Reviews.Title: “Without the name, this is an unextraordinary, overpriced, old hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhantomTraveler79
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Waldorf Astoria for a couple of nights and was severely disappointed, especially considering the rack rate of over $700 USD. There is nothing special about this hotel and the lobby, restaurants, common areas and especially the rooms are underwhelming. Staff was helpful and courteous, but this was nowhere near the special experience I was hoping it would be. If you take away the beautiful clock in the lobby and the Ferragamo toiletries,all that's left is the Waldorf Astoria name. Would definitely not stay here again, as there are half a dozen cheaper (and possibly better) options within a couple of blocks for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for history. Don't expect more.”
Reviews.Author: Cyberhwk
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed. I am an adult male traveling with my mother making two beds a necessity. We are meticulous about making sure to book rooms with two beds or we don't book at all. So I'm sure you can see where this is going. We showed the check-in staff our exact paper that specified our room was to have two separate beds. We were told there were none available. The staff, however, was very accommodating and told us they could get us a roll-away and then upgrade us to a Suite. Fine, I'll rough it for one night. So we head up to the room after being told the roll-away is on it's way. 30 minutes pass, nothing. We call back. Another 30 minutes pass, nothing. Only upon the third call (1:30AM) do we finally get a roll away. We sleep. So the next night we go to the front desk to get keys to our suite. "OK, now this suite is going to have two beds?" "Oh well, it has a couch that turns into a bed. Yeah, but I didn't pay $300 a night to sleep on the COUCH! "This is a four level upgrade, I'm sure you will find it satisfactory." Ummmmmm...no, actually. I appreciate your effort and generosity on such a large upgrade, but if our problem is that our room has only a single bed, upgrading us to a nicer room with one bed doesn't solve the problem that needs to be solved! So that was that. We paid $300 a night for one of us to sleep on a hide-away bed for a week. Lame. The AC units in the rooms are useless and you're discouraged from opening the windows. It takes the strength of the Incredible Hulk to get them open anyway, at which point you're met with the loud buzzing of generators. The bathroom is the (only) highlight. Our suite had a fantastic tile walk-in shower. Shower head was high and heated up plenty fast. Sink was granite with plenty of space to put your stuff. The usual fare was provided. To cap off the trip, for some reason the very last night they decided to remake the sofa instead of just leaving the bed down. Around we went again. Called at 5:00, come back from dinner, no bed. Called at 7, nothing. Called again at 8...finally someone came to make the bed down. Common areas are beautiful (you have to sneak your way into some of the ballroooms) and I did feel for them, that has to be expensive to maintain, but that shouldn't fall on us. Con your way in to take pictures of the common areas, but stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: slimmorrell
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the historical displays and information as well as the splendor of the carpet, chandeliers and art deco interior. Yes I agree it is living on its past reputation, but it was one of the cheapest hotel options on our package deal! Our room wasn't made up but we wanted a twin not a double as they thought. They gave us a free cockctail each to enjoy in Harry's as it was a birthday, and that was the nicest drink I have ever had! There is a great Dehli to eat breakfast just 2 blocks away when leving the Waldorf entrance by their steak restaurant. Turn right, go past the tour bus company touts, and its on your right.

Reviews.Title: “Landmark Disappoints”
Reviews.Author: Martin B
Reviews.Content: Our New Years experience was runnied by indifferent unhelpful staff. we rounded off a skiing trip with 3 nights in this iconic new york hotel. While this hotel oozes charm and represents the best of New York the treatment of the hotel staff all but ruined our stay. We transfer in at 11pm from our flight- with 3 children our rooms were on opposite ends of the floor, and neither acceptable nor in line with our booking- some 4 hours latter- at 3 am in the morning and one bed short we were finally able to sleep. the service did not improve the next morning with half promises and a dishonest approach to the problem another 4 hours were wasted until the issue was resolved and adequate accommodation provided- oh yes, a 50% refund of one room for one night was offered as compensation! not what one would expect from a hotel of this standing.

Reviews.Title: “A real disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Charlmagne
Reviews.Content: This is a national landmark and a flagship hotel but it is a real disappointment . The lobby and entrance maybe grand but the rooms are very dated and don't feel clean. The location is good and the restaurants are reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Historic? No, dated”
Reviews.Author: tint7003
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a night to sightsee and shop. This is a grand old building with a great location. Aside from the bellmen and the extremely miserable people who work in the Starbucks outlet in the lobby, the welcome was consistently warm and friendly. We were allocated a very small room on the 15th floor. This was reasonably well-fitted in a very old-fashioned style but was also quite worn in parts. While we could cope with the small bedroom, the boxlike size of the bathroom was much more of a challenge. There really was no room in there at all and, for this standard of property,and given our gold Hilton Hhonors status, we'd have hoped for much better. This hotel trades on its name and its history but for the most part the place just felt dated and in need of a refresh. We moved on to the Conrad at Battery Park which, for the same price, provided a far better experience and a real taste of luxury. Waldorf Astoria next time? No thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Just Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: susanne_laird
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 3 friends for 4 nights in early april 2012, we had booked the hotel along with flights with an internet travel complany and got a great deal, we booked a room with 2 double beds to minimise the cost. when we arrived the lovely Wayne on reception did us proud and we were given a room with 2 double beds as expected but it also had a "boudoir" dressing room, beautiful bathroom and a vestibule area, so for 4 girls was ideal lots of space to get dressed and store all our stuff it was on teh 7th floor. Wayne also sorted some special vouchers for us as the trip was to celebrate my birthday so we had free cocktails on the night of our arrival and a free breakfast for all four of us the following morning which costs $41 each! and was a wonderful buffet breakfast. We loved the hotel its elegance and history and location and the price, the staff were all friendly exceptionally helpful and couteous. Lots of little complimentary details that just helped make the trip easy, like left luggage facility on our last day, free internet for check- in and printing for boarding passes etc. will recommend time and time again thank you Waldorf form 4 UK ladies who had the time of our lives in NYC!!

Reviews.Title: “Old hotels have theircharm”
Reviews.Author: lotsotripsneedsleep
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Waldorf Astoria for a conference was not the best way to enjoy this old hotel, but it made the conference elegant and fun. The hotel retains much of its character and does go the extra mile to give guests a great experience. The building's age does show through with inconveniences like no water for a morning due to a plumbing mishap, uneven heat and cooling, or difficulty with wireless internet. The situations were resolved fairly quickly and to my satisfaction. The meeting rooms were elegant and the conference food was very good. I do suggest the hotel work with both the coffee shop and Oscars to expand capacity in the coffee shop and hours at Oscars.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, relies on it's name a bit”
Reviews.Author: neilmcd84
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for four nights in march. The room was nice, bed was incredibly comfy and the hotel location was great. However the decoration was a bit out of date and overall the place relies a bit on it's name. We paid approx 1200 dollars for 4 nights room only.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Much Met Expectations”
Reviews.Author: mercurial1985
Reviews.Content: We were at the Waldorf Astoria over Christmas, it was our first visit to NYC (from the UK) and we were only there for four days so we had a lot to take in over a very short space of time. We booked the Wadorf Astoria because, well, it's The Waldord Astoria! I prefer modern hotels, of which this is far from, but we knew this before we booked so no complaints. The hotel is in a fantastic location as you would expect and I have nothing negative to report - I equally don't have anything to shout from the roof tops from as we had no call to speak with staff and spent most of the time dragging our feet around the City. The lobby is unquestionably spectacular (if you like that sort of thing) but the Hotel itself is what you would expect, old. Next time I think we will stay elsewhere but it's nice to say we've stayed at this hotel. We enjoyed it and had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service/Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: Italy1982
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights as part of a conference. The decor was ornate and felt outdated. The woman that checked me in was actually quite nice and helpful. The rest of the stay from the housekeeping to the bellhop to everyone else I encountered could not be bothered and were quite unwelcoming. Not to mention that each morning I was woken up by the sound of carts (or something like that) barreling down the hallway repeatedly. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Walk in the footsteps of presidents and celebrities”
Reviews.Author: Jerseymick
Reviews.Content: The minute you work into the Waldorf’s opulent lobby, you feel you are walking in the footsteps of U.S. presidents, heads of state, socialites, and celebrities. The hall ways and lobbies could tell a million stories; photos of some of its famous guests hang on walls and in display cabinets. The location is perfect, it is just a short walk to the Rockefeller Centre, Radio City Music Hall, and you can also explore the city's landmark buildings such as Chrysler, Empire State and Rockafella, which are in easy walking distance. Grand Central Station is also a short walk away. We had a few problems with our original room allocation but this was ratified quickly and professionally, and we were upgraded to the next level of room. Check in was very smooth, with plenty of check in staff on duty. The room on the 9th floor was a good size, king size bed, walk in wardrobe, marble bathroom and a nice size flat screen TV. Nice view of the Chrysler Building. We loved the main lobby and bar to just sit and admirer the hotels art deco and people watch. We used the bars a few times but not the restaurants, we did use starbucks for a grab and go a few times. My only complaint would be being charged $21 for two very small cups of coffee one night in the main bar, so be aware this is the Waldorf and this is New York, so expect to pay big prices for the hotel food and service, especially room service and the Sunday brunch. Overhaul a memorable stay at The Waldorf Astoria, and it is nice to have a change from an ultra modern hotel and step back into time, and admire architecture and furnishings you just don’t get any more.

Reviews.Title: “Old and musty”
Reviews.Author: Kristine S
Reviews.Content: The good bits first: extremely friendly staff, beautiful public spaces, super comfortable beds and a great location. Now for the disappointing bits: the safe in our suite didn't work when we checked in, you have to pre-order a coffee maker if you don't want to spend mornings in the queue for Starbucks in the lobby (or pay an extortionate amount for room service), the bathrooms look like they haven't been updated since the early 1960s and our ceiling showed clear signs of water damage. Nowhere near as nice as The Peninsula.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, close to many sights”
Reviews.Author: ruthy01545
Reviews.Content: This hotel is stunning. It’s really close to the public library, which is next to Bryant Park (a great place to sit and relax, or have something to eat). It’s perfect for a couples weekend getaway <3, as it has the feel of old New York romanticism.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SandBAtlanta
Reviews.Content: It's the Waldorf and an iconic NYC landmark. Yes, it's a bit outdated, but the rooms are a little larger than most of the other hotel rooms that I've stayed in. Bed was very comfortable, lots of big fluffy pillows. Our bathroom was fine. The bathroom cabinets are outdated, but no issues whatsoever. The only downside for us was that it was hard to regulate the temperature and we felt a little stuffy. I thought the hotel staff was very friendly. There was a NYC buzz about it with tons of people milling about. We also had a drink at The Bull and Bear, which was really nice. And finally, extremely convenient to all of the major stuff you want to see.

Reviews.Title: “A landmark!”
Reviews.Author: ColumbusDB
Reviews.Content: I've stayed a the Waldorf many times over the past few years - all for business travel. The rooms aren't all that modern and sometimes you don't get a steaming hot shower, but there is just something about this place and all of its history and opulence! The lobby and shops and all public areas are just beautiful. The location is great, too. I'm a walker so love being able to walk to just about anywhere I want to go from here. I will say that during this stay I barely got hot water and my heater wasn't working. Not much of an issue at the time so I didn't report it. My co worker was also not getting heat and did report it. They tried hard to fix the issue but she ended up with a space heater.

Reviews.Title: “Great location: Convenient to mid-town landmarks.”
Reviews.Author: cyclopseye
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference based at the property so received a discounted rate. Don't think I would stay here without the discounted rate. Regardless, a historic property with great service, restaurants, and an impressive lobby. As a HiltonHonors member, we were supposed to receive 2 complimentary water bottles daily in our honor bar, but this only happened once during our 4 night stay. So we had to call for the bottles 3 times. Room size was pretty standard for Manhattan. Comfy bed. No charge to use the workout facilities despite what was advertised. Be sure to check out Steve Cohen's Chamber Magic shows in the Towers. Truly amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Old in a good way, and in a not so good way....”
Reviews.Author: bagoda1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last week on business in a regular room. The exterior is undergoing renovation, but I did not notice renovations on-going on the interior. The entrance and interior common areas are old school New York elegance, from the decor to the uniforms of the staff, to the bars and restaurants. The service is excellent, and very professional. The rooms, on the other hand, are simply old in appearance. The wall paper is pealing, there is paint on the marble in the bathroom, the shower is old and without sufficient pressure, and the toilet looks like it has not been changed since the 1970s, and works that way as well. The door to the bathroom is a pocket door which is badly in need of replacement. The pocket door concept is a bit tacky, but it is needed because the bathroom is so small. But the bed was new and very comfortable, and there is a nice large flat screen television with all of the amenities. If the price is really right, I might stay again. But this is not lavish, opulent, old-school luxury New York as far as the room that I had was concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and old”
Reviews.Author: bhandarisonal
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf is meant to be an iconic property in NY but now it just seems old. I stayed 3 days on a business trip and the room I had was just about functional. The cabinet in the bathroom did not close. Everyone expects a tip for doing the bare minimum. Only thing nice was the check in experience at the front desk, which was quite welcoming. The location of the hotel of course is also great. All in all not worth it for the rate they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: Bisphambob1967
Reviews.Content: The two of us stayed at the Waldorf Astoria during a short break to New York in March this year. We paid a little extra for a superior room and had a view right down Park Avenue from the corner of the hotel on the 13th floor (through the gauze netting! - yes there is scaffolding up also as the hotel exterior is being refurbished, the view only being partly obstructed). The room itself was fabulous, in a classic art deco style, with a bedroom, small storage room, separate dressing room and separate bathroom, all of which were very grand and a little dated, but that just added to the experience. We spent some time wandering around the rest of the building, marvelling at what it must have been like in it's heyday, because it's by no means shabby now, despite all the negative reviews that caused us concern before we went. In summary, if you are expecting a modern, minimalist, clinical experience then this is not the place for you, however, if you are visiting New York and want to stay in somewhere iconic that you will always remember, then it may be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Brand Does Not Live Up To Reputation”
Reviews.Author: SpaGirl007
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Waldorf Astoria, for a work event, and it did not live up to the brand's reputation. Let me start with the good points. The hotel is in a great location...walking distance to just about everything (MOMA, Madison and 5th Avenue shopping, Central Park). The architecture and grandeur of the hotel is amazing--it is like stepping into history. The stepping into history is also the downside. The hotel is in need of a major overhaul, as it has not been properly maintained. They are in the process of renovations. Unfortunately, the first room I received was situated on the 4th floor roof, which was being worked on. It was bad enough to hear the drilling but the workers were able to peer directly into my room. That was enough for me to request a new room. The second room was much better, and as other reviewers have stated, the newer tower is much better. The room was nothing special and the chipping paint on the door and leaking faucet were all indicators of wear and tear. The service was good--definitely not becoming of a 5-star hotel. After being on hold for 20 minutes to get my room changed--I ended up gathering my suitcase and going directly to the front desk. The agent who assisted was very nice and helpful. Overall, I would not recommend. It's nice to tour and get a piece of history and then move on to more modern times.

Reviews.Title: “New York”
Reviews.Author: davegirling
Reviews.Content: Massive place but staff are great Well located for bars and grand central

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Bradgl
Reviews.Content: If you are staying in new York this is the place to stay. Top notch staff and right in mid town, nothing is far away. Even if you don't have any activities planned, they can help you out

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Asher J
Reviews.Content: I went to the Waldorf on MLK weekend. We booked 3 rooms, including 1 suite. The suite was very large, with an impressive master bathroom. The kitchen was from the 50's. There were 2 other rooms, each the double beds deluxe rooms. These were small, but cozy. They have an excellent lobby, with true elegance. I will be booking this hotel next year.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, amazing room, amazing service”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoJillo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I used points and stayed at the Waldorf for one night prior to taking a cruise from the Manhattan cruise port. Since we are diamond members we usually get an upgraded room. This time was no exception. We were given a King suite room which had a living room with a fire place, a huge entry way a bedroom, a make-up/parlor room and a huge bathroom. The hotel was decorated beautifully and service was amazing. We had a cocktail in one of the hotel bars and the service there was outstanding as well.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was great but service less than desirable; great location”
Reviews.Author: GATravelGuy
Reviews.Content: This is an icon in the hotel world and I wish I could stay here more. I'm a HHonors diamond member and it seems that this property that doesn't really matter. Hilton is very inconsistent lately on how each property treats the HHonors benefits. I never got water and certificates for breakfast, etc. They weren't available at check in for some reason so they were supposed to be brought up. When I left early the next day they never showed up. The room was well appointed but the sink had a slow drain and the shower head was loose. It was a bit challenging taking a shower the next morning. Other than the small things that make a big difference, this is a classic NYC hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: calvinpoway
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this past week and had a good time. Our room was nice, somewhat quiet on the seventh floor and a nice view. Service for the most part overall was very good. We were checked in upon arrival around 5 pm without delay- went to Bull and Bear for a quick drink prior to going out on the town- the bartender here was not real friendly or quick to serve but maybe a bad day for him. We did later have drinks in Peacock Alley and very friendly and good drinks- Some of the elevators do have problems and some areas are a little worn- but for the most part pretty good. The Starbucks in the lobby of this hotel does have a "B" rating which is a little strange...We did order room service twice - it was fast and the food was good- You will pay the WA prices however...if you are looking for OUTSTANDING service you may want to try The Carlyle- from the moment you step in that hotel you are well served- I will return to Waldorf Astoria if I can find prices under $300 per night- It is currently being renovated and the outside is hidden behind mesh-

Reviews.Title: “Pure perfection”
Reviews.Author: m2k
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf earlier this month with my mom and sister and it was incredible. Before I even arrived I was in contact with the concierge, Celso, who did an amazing job putting together and itenerary for us. We stayed in the Towers and our suite was quite spacious for 3 ladies who don't travel light. The check-in for the Towers is not in the main lobby and it was peaceful, easy and the staff was wonderful. Breakfast in the lounge each morning was the perfect way to start our day. I cannot say enough wondeful things about The Waldorf and the professional, friendly and efficient staff they have. I highly recommend this hotel for any occassion ~ it is pure perfection!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Experience! The only place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Danraydan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently celebrated our anniversary at the Waldorf spending six nights at the hotel. Our experience can only be described as remarkable. A tremendously friendly and helpful staff. The room was fabulous. The individual bars and restaurants were all special and wonderful. The hotel delivers on the iconic experience you dream to have at The Waldorf. Very impressive in every respect. Would go back anytime and we feel this has to be the best place to stay in New York. Perfect location for walking to the best of New York.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Astoria”
Reviews.Author: Nockster31
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Waldorf in NYC for five nights I have to say it was worth every penny. The hotel lived up to all expectations, the staff were really kind and helpful. The beds were so comfortable, the pillows and sheets were out of this world, I have never had better nights sleep. If you get chance to stay at the Waldorf do it, it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Classic NY elegance but not true luxury any longer”
Reviews.Author: Sheherazade70
Reviews.Content: This was my 10th time at The Waldorf Astoria and while one will still be seduced by its grand lobby and lovely shops I am truly convinced that the hotel needs some serious updating/refurbishment. My room was upgraded one level slightly larger (for which I was appreciative) as I had been the one who booked 15 other rooms for a group function. While the check-in process was very pleasant and my room size spacious, the rooms for our entire group were run down looking---carpets in need of cleaning and worst of all-- almost none of our heaters/air conditioners worked causing us to not sleep well due to the high temperature in our rooms. When I called for assistance the only option was to go from a very hot room to having the windows open and being very cold---to their credit they responded immediately to my request. On the plus side: Room service was delicious, courteous, prompt, in large servings and actually worth the typical hotel price for it. The housekeeping was friendly and efficient. The toiletries were plentiful (Ferragamo) and rooms were furnished with excellent linens and lots of towels. If you can get a very good price on the hotel it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time”
Reviews.Author: horizon t
Reviews.Content: I was getting worried after i had booked because some of the reviews referred to tired rooms and poor service - We spent 4 nights here, the service was amazing, the place is full of history and charm, the room was great... We did make use of the e-mail sent to us before we arrived and opted for a very cheap upgrade to a king at 25 dollars per night - well worth it... Its the waldorf, its famous and it exceeded our expectations... 1 thing to watch for, there are a number of additional charges for room service which for example changes the cost of a pot of coffee from 15 dollars to about 24 dollars so do watch that one... The staff were very kind and very helpful in recommending great local places to eat that were reasonable priced, we had some great thai food at a place down in Hells Kitchen on recommendation from staff, so it is well worth asking them.. Well done Waldorf

Reviews.Title: “A family tradition - well appointed luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: brice2
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at the Waldorf Astoria in NYC several times over the last 7 years. We always have a good stay both in the Towers and the main hotel. Rooms are usually larger than most NYC hotel rooms and are always well appointed with a traditional decor. The staff is professional and helpful. It is not inexpensive and neither is parking ($60/night) but it is a treat. There is a Starbucks on the Park Ave side of the building - slow but conveinant.

Reviews.Title: “Seen it in the movies? Experience it!!!”
Reviews.Author: VIAboytes
Reviews.Content: The hotel lives up to it's reputation. As a Diamond member with Hilton (at the time), I was upgraded and they sure don't disappoint! I took my daughters and my wife and they were impressed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Trip of a Lifetime ?”
Reviews.Author: AliVIII
Reviews.Content: This hotel is without doubt an icon from a glamorous age and will not disappoint in terms of beauty and elegance. However having booked a twin double suite for myself and two teenage daughters and promised the bed sizes would be large doubles as with all American hotels, and big enough to accommodate us, we were surprised to find a large suite yes, but containing 2 large singles not doubles, this did make our stay a trifle squashed. when I complained they offered me a camp bed for an extra 50 bucks each night!!!! Sorry not good enough when I had just paid £3,000 for this trip before buying anything else!!!! I found the staff both rude and somewhat condescending, in other words I wasn't rich or important enough to be polite to. Many of the guests are also of this ilk. The hotel is open for any Tom dick and Harry to wander through and they do, taking photos as they go which somewhat undermines the exclusivity!!! New York is fantastic, but save your dollars and go for a Hilton instead.. Shame on you at the Waldorf......work harder at treating all of your guests in the same manner, whether they are VIP's or not.

Reviews.Title: “A Great New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulo747
Reviews.Content: On arrival our check-in was warm, friendly and efficient. Our room was extremely comfortable, well-appointed and spotlessly clean. Breakfast was excellent. The building itself and furnishing exude a wonderful ambiance of nostalgia which along with an outstanding level of service from all the staff we encountered made for an immensely enjoyable stay. Its location is great for exploring the best that New York has to offer as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service!! I have never been lied to so politely”
Reviews.Author: Teacherspencil
Reviews.Content: I had 2 rooms for 5 days and 4 nights. The rooms were suppose to be close together. They were not They were suppose to be superior rooms. One was one was not. The non superior room was small. We asked 4 times for a coffee pot before we finally got one. We left the Peacock bar after waiting 20 minutes on a waiter. I have stayed at the Waldorf 2 times before this stay and enjoyed fine service but this time was very disappointing I have stayed there for the last time. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Public Areas, Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: TheBristolJohns
Reviews.Content: The hotel's public areas are a wonderful combination of grandeur and elegance, the rooms less so. They have everything you need, but all a bit faded - worn carpet, scuffed and chipped paintwork and wallpaper. The bed though was hugely comfortable and the sheets were high quality, though the towels and bath robes were not, the former in particular being small and rough. All-in-all, in need of a makeover in order to maintain parity with the competition. The hotel is in a good location for the main tourist sites in Manhattan and for accessing public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Medsta
Reviews.Content: This grand hotel has great history in New York City and had hosted many past and present high profile figures. The location was great and the staff were very friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Tired, chaotic and no longer at its best”
Reviews.Author: CatandDogBrussels
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughter, who was in NYC for the summer, under the impression that this was one of New York's best hotels. Perhaps it once was but that is no longer the case. The rooms are tired and in dire need of renovation. A flat screen does not make a room 5 star if the bathroom was installed in the 70s! The bar is fine but the dining area, which is part of the lobby, leaves much to be desired. The staff try their best but managing so many guests is not easy and the place gives of an air of disorganised chaos. Breakfast, however, was copious and of good quality. Overall my impression was that too many cut price deals and cheap room rates brings down the reputation of this hotel. By choosing good hotels I rarely have the need to write bad reviews so this is a rare exception. I will not be visiting it again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Nexthol
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week last year and loved every minute of it, what a iconic hotel. The public areas are beautiful, very grand.As others have mentioned the rooms are a bit dated but this is a historic hotel so we didn't expect it to be much else.If we'd wanted modern we would've stayed elsewhere.Our room was clean and elegantly furnished.We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ellegance from an Earlier Time”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler967
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf with my wife and two kids in December 2011. We upgraded to a suite using points. This is our fouth time at the hotel. It is not inexpensive, but if you want to experience the elegance of a time gone by, this is it. The suits are large and furnished with museum quality furniture. Marble bath was large and clean. Service was outstanding, as always. If you like steak, and are willing to pay for it, the Bull and Bear restaurant offers unparalleled food and sophistication. The concierge suggested an Italian restaurant for the family that is frequented by the locals. WOW. The place was crowded and frenetic. The staff obviously all originally from Italy, and the food was fantastic (also expensive but this is NYC). All the little extras that the Waldorf provides makes the experience memorable. This is by no means a budget hotel. It is expensive, but worth experiencing. If you want to save money, stay in January or February when rates drop to a fraction of those in December. There is always someone famous at the hotel because it caters to royalty and the elite.

Reviews.Title: “Unfaded Grandeur”
Reviews.Author: VMAW
Reviews.Content: I jumped on a special offer to stay here for business - all NY hotels are expensive anyway and the WA was not so much more so we thought why not? This hotel is so large that it spans a whole block. There are very smart shops in the lobby area and several restaurants to choose from. We had breakfast in Oscars which was about as good as it gets but cost us $100 for 2 owch, we thought it was worth it it was that delicious and meant lunch could be skipped anyway. When we arrived at the hotel we were given an upgrade so we had a suite as big as a NY flat which was fabulous. Everything about it was so luxurious from the incredibly comfortable beds to the well appointed bathroom. I would love to go back to this marvelous bit of NY history.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, but the Grand Old Lady is Showing Her Age”
Reviews.Author: FlaCrab
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most noted hotels in New York City, for good reason. A landmark location and architecture, a one-of-a-kind setting for meetings or a wedding, a name that everyone recognizes. All in all, a nice mid-town hotel, but the grand old lady is showing her age. Lower floor rooms are noisy, every room I have stayed in needs an overhaul. If you are a Hilton Diamond-level rewards member, you'll probably get a room upgrade. I can often find weekend discounts that make this hotel cheaper than some mid-level hotels in the city. However, it no longer measures up to some of the competition for luxury in the rooms. Too bad, because the grand old lady could still be a real stunner with a renovation. Do try the restaurants here. Usually, hotel restaurants are a disappointment. Here, they take center stage with food and service that is outstanding. You pay a price for it, but it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Emily H
Reviews.Content: I'm glad I stayed here so I can say that I've done it. The lobby is beautiful and I love the history of the place. And I loved the feeling of getting in a cab and saying "take me to the Waldorf." That said, a legendary luxury hotel should provide a spectacular experience, and this was not that. I was there two weeks. First, the good: - Gorgeous Art Deco style lobby - Beautiful marble bathroom with a medicine cabinet and under the sink cabinet, so there's plenty of toiletry space - Possibly the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in - Hotel staff was very friendly on check-in, upgrading me to a better room - Bellman was extremely helpful after I checked in, testing all the amenities of my room and showing me how they worked - iPod dock on nightstand - Helpful concierge - Plenty of hangers in the closet - Shades for the window so the room was nice and dark at night - Waiters in the Peacock Alley Bar were very friendly, if a little slow. (The bar itself is quite overpriced, but that's to be expected here. I paid $44 for a cheesecake slice and a Manhattan.) - Beautiful fitness center with great treadmills and free water and snacks, although I would have appreciated a squat machine as part of the weightlifting equipment - Good location with lots around The bad: - When I arrived, there was no doorman to help me with my luggage so I struggled with it up the marble stairs into the lobby. - I had someone stay with me for the weekend. I asked at the front desk to leave her a key to my room so she could come in before I was off work. I've had no problems doing this at other hotels. The front desk said they had to add her name to my reservation, which is fine but I've never seen another hotel do that. They took down the name, supposedly put it in their system, and then the next day they had no record of her. She had to call me and give the phone to the front desk to ask me questions and verify what was going on. - The rooms are shabby - paint chipping, water damage on ceiling that's been painted over, black scuff marks on wallpaper. - The towels and robes need an upgrade, or at least some fabric softener. Not horrible, but rough and on the thin side. - The minibar has no prices posted, but you'll be automatically charged for moving things. There's no space to put your own snacks or leftovers from dinner in it - there's a space where you could wedge things in, but it isn't cooled, as I discovered the hard way. - I had a bottle of wine that I left corked and half-full on the dresser. The next day, the cork was missing and half of what was left was gone. So apparently the housekeeping staff stole my wine and left it out to spoil. Nice. - The hotel guide says there's a charge for the fitness center, but nowhere is it posted how much. I luckily didn't get charged, but I don't know if this was a mistake, or if they've changed the policy, or if I got it free for some other reason. Regardless, they should clarify. - Wifi is $15 or so per device in-room. - Terrible channel selection - no Comedy Central to watch Jon Stewart, and I missed a March Madness game I really wanted to watch because the hotel didn't have the channel. - The Starbucks in the lobby charges a good $1.50 more than other locations for the same drink - save your money and go across the street to the one on Lex and 51st. I didn't have a bad experience at all, apart from the housekeeping staff stealing and spoiling my wine, but I wouldn't stay here again, especially on my own dime. I get better service and amenities for less in the Marriotts and regular Hiltons I've stayed at lately, so I'll be going back to them. Maybe worth it if you get a huge discount and you're just staying a night or two for the bucket list.

Reviews.Title: “slightly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jkruger
Reviews.Content: So who haven't dreamt of staying at the Waldorf, well I have, and when I got the opportunity I just went for it. Location, lobby very good, but the rooms are at best just average. Samll, worn out and feels like stepping into a room from the 70' ties with a really old airconditionsystem. Seems like parts of the hotel could be in need for a major upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Weary at Waldorf Towers- Concierge Level a Sham”
Reviews.Author: wearyinwaban
Reviews.Content: Booked a Weekend GetAway at the Waldorf Towers and horrified by the conditions. Checked into an upgraded room that was offered for an additional 99.00 a night. The room was in significant disrepair!! Holes in the walls by the bed, cracked chipped ceiling in the bathroom, stained curtains with sharpie marker on them, dust over a centimeter thick on the vents, used dental floss on the floor in the bathroom,and the best of it...... a hole in the floor. Called concierge and the lovely woman came up to the room and once I showed her all of the above she reported she was in shock and moved us within 2 minutes to a GIANT 2 Bed/2 Bath Suite with a ballroom sized living room. I was pleased once moved but found myself disappointed with the concierge level breakfast that is nothing more than stale breads, poor quality smoked salmon, fruit salad- out of a jar, poor quality coffee- burnt tasting. Sorry I like Matt's Coffee from Maine. It was just a really bad breakfast bonanza. All in all I was happy to have been moved.... but I ask myself this: What happens to the poor slob who gets that 1st room with the holes in the walls and doesn't speak up??? It just seems terrible to me that the hotel even uses that room at all... ROOM 2714 to be exact. Shame on you Waldorf and god help the poor person who doesnt like to complain. You will get what you get and Paris Hilton will say thanks as she builds her dog another 350,000 dog house. UGH.... Never again. I liked the Ritz Battery Park Much Better.

Reviews.Title: “New York for the first time!”
Reviews.Author: Winesurgeon
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful trip to New York, though in 2009 october my birthday. We stayed for a week visiting some friends and all those great restaurants.We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: Eva R
Reviews.Content: its seems they are getting old as a building but still good and perfect service i love the view ow south manhattan that i can see new world trade center

Reviews.Title: “Not as expected”
Reviews.Author: LondonSpartacus
Reviews.Content: Communal areas were as grand as expected however our room was tired. The shower just spurted water at you which was either hot or cold alternately (very annoying). Although the room was clean at the beginning of the week, by the end of the week it was really dusty despite tipping the maid $3 each day. Be aware that there are no tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms, there is room service at $8 for a coffee when you wake up. The well know Peacock Alley Bar staff were very aloof, bordering on rudeness with their inability to hold any small talk. Very expensive and like anywhere in New York children are not allowed anywhere that alcohol is served without eating and even then only between the hours of 12 noon and 6pm. This was very annoying and I was eager to sample the craft beer pubs that are quite famous. Be mindful that if you do like a decent cup of tea, the expensive breakfast does not serve a good cuppa (ask for two teabags). No WiFi in the rooms unless you pay for it and although a large TV the channels were very restricted to American news channels. Thinking that the land of America was one of hospitality where people will do anything for you was not the case. Generally we found that New Yorkers were rude and ignorant. Give me England anyday where people apologise for bumping into you in the street and open doors for you.

Reviews.Title: “5 day break in new york”
Reviews.Author: henriktreble
Reviews.Content: the hotel was outstanding and yes it was being refurbished but this did not deter from an amazing experience .the staff made you feel like royalty and were extremely helpful and curtious .the location was excellent 10 mins walk to time square and 3 mins walk to grand central station.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room”
Reviews.Author: landsick
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, if the rooms were a bit worn. We stayed for one night. The location was excellent and the beds very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Worth It”
Reviews.Author: George16
Reviews.Content: Yes it's pricey and yes it's old but in a good way. I spent a couple nights there just to mark it off my bucket list. It is worth the price. Friendly service with a smile. The hotel has so much history and I would recommend the hotel tour that ends with lunch at Oscar's. It was fun to see the ballrooms and a suite. I can't exactly describe it but you feel special there, well cared for. Go, enjoy it, sit in the lobby and observe, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Typical ridiculously priced, average NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: maxie3328
Reviews.Content: Lives off of its glorious past. Rooms are fine but nothing special; food is at best average; and the prices are typical NYC absurd. My wife and I had lunch in their lobby restaurant for $140, which constituted two Caesar salads with average quality seared tuna (not cooked according to request), two iced teas, some fruit for dessert and two cappuccinos. If not for my business expense account, I would never walk in this hotel. Ultimately, it's nothing more today than an overpriced NYC Hilton with a glorious past.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than the first time”
Reviews.Author: Steve_jersey_jambo
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here and it was even more unforgettable. We had a massive suite this time round with great view of manhatten and chryslyer building. I proposed to my girlfriend on the Saturday evening at the Empire State Building and I arranged for some roses and champagne to be in the room for when we got back and the concierge was extremely helpful with this. We got to experience the fantastic brunch at peacock alley-highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Ruined Christmas - Terrible food, terrible service and terrible room. The worst I've experienced in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Firminger
Reviews.Content: I choose the waldorf because as it was the first visit to NYC for my partner, I wanted our christmas to be magical. With the history and reputation of the waldorf i thought it would be perfect. Although the public areas are undoubtably beautiful, this is a place to visit not stay! Our room was small, dark and very tired (more money should have been spent on fixing holes in the bathroom than large flat screen tvs). The breakfast admittedly (although expensive) was impressive. However Christmas lunch was a disaster. After repeatedly trying to contact the Waldorf for weeks before I eventually had to make an international phone call. The brasserie was the only place left. The Christmas lunch (at over $100 per person) was awful. By the time we arrived the food was cold or gone, the service was terrible, and the wine selection woeful. My works canteen (at£2:30) was of better quality!!!! I made the hotel aware of my concerns, even filling out a comment card. To date (3 months later) I have not received any response to either the comments made during our stay or the several emails sent before our stay. I have stayed all over manhattan, and this is trully the worst. Terrible food, terrible service and terrible room.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: MrsDippy
Reviews.Content: I booked a trip to new York for my husbands 30th birthday and chose to stay at the Waldorf. Upon check in they noted it was a special occasion (with a little help from an email prior to our stay!) and we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite overlooking park avenue. Fab!! Rooms are dated but clean. The hotel itself is amazing. We ate in the bull and bear on our last night which was expensive but hey, when are you going to eat in the Waldorf again?!! Amazing service an the food was outstanding. The stop for the hop on hop off bus tours is right outside and lots of main sights and attractions are within walking distance. If you are looking for a hotel to remember when visiting NYC always stay at the Waldorf!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service at a great historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: FisherDiver
Reviews.Content: My granddaughter and I stayed here to enjoy a week in Manhattan. We had a terrific time with its perfect location, polite and helpful staff, and very comfortable room. From check-in to concierge to room service staff - all were more than courteous and took an extra step to make our stay just that much better. We purchased excellent theater tickets for Wicked from the onsite ticket agent and had several fine meals in the restaurants and room. We would visit again in a New York minute!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Time at the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: Becky33
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel by car around 1pm and had our car valeted..Very quick and efficient. When we got up to Diamond check in there was no one in front of us so we were able to get checked in very quickly. Our room wasn't ready yet so we left our bags with the bell and took off to explore. The double decker tour bus has a stop right outside the hotel. We find this is the best way to see a city and hit all the main spots.... Very convenient. The hotel itself is wonderful. It was our first time there. When we made it back our suite was ready and we were very happy with the room. It was large, clean and very well appointed. We ate dinner at the Bull and Bear on the premises.. We went to the bar first to have a before dinner drink. The service was terrible. It looked like they had 2 people serving the entire bar and serving food. Our dinner was outstanding. The food quality was beyond good and service for dinner was one of the best we have encountered. We actually went back there the following night for an early dinner before starting off for a Broadway show. We loved that there was a starbucks in the hotel and we were given coupons for a free coffee and pastry for our morning breakfast. I have nothing but great things to say about this hotel. They even posted my poscards for free. We will say there again on our next trip to NYC. If you are planning to stay here you will not be disappointed..

Reviews.Title: “'I wish service was as great as this in the uk'”
Reviews.Author: 186338Family002
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to New York with my husband. The staff in the Waldorf are very knowledgable, efficient and helpful. In particular I would like to mention John and Jackie on the reception desk who went that extra mile and provided exceptionally great service. The breakfast in the lounge was really nice and the breakfast downstairs in Oscars was fantastic with freshly squeezed orange juice, smoothies, smoked salmon etc. Our room was lovely, quiet and comfortable with everything we needed. The art deco and history in the hotel is facinating. When we return to New York we will book the Waldorf. Thanks for making our stay a great one!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfull hotel”
Reviews.Author: PMIreland
Reviews.Content: Great location, the rooms were superb. They actually gave us a free upgrade without asking. The cost of breakfast was crazy so we went down the road and had a similar quality breakfast for one third of the cost We would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Really Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: BlueJ110
Reviews.Content: The hotel certainly has an certain art deco charm, and I have to say the rooms, although small (it is New York after all), are probably slightly larger than the average New York postage stamp size I have seen elsewhere. However, the service we received there was embarrassingly bad. After the first night of sleeping on pillows so soft that your face falls right through them, I called the next morning to see if it would be possible to get any other pillows for our room. Yes, they would bring us some foam pillows - thank you very much. Later that day (3pm) when we returned to the room there were no new pillows so I asked again, and again they politely told me - no problem, we will deliver them to your room. When we returned to the room after dinner and they still weren't there I called again, and they apologized and said they would deliver them now (11pm). They didn't. They were very polite each time I called (5 times total), but never once did they actually do what they said they would. One of the people I spoke to said she would inform the manager of the poor service I received, and again apologized. I never heard back from the manager. The pillows weren't really that important and if they had told me that they didn't have any other pillows I don't think I would have cared. But they kept telling me that they would provide the service, and constantly failed to do so. I was embarrassed to mention it again frankly - and didn't say anything at check out. They don't seem to care enough about their guests, so I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “It has to be done - even if it is expensive!!”
Reviews.Author: TricksBerkshire
Reviews.Content: Husband and I have just got back from our NY trip. Staying at the Waldorf Astoria has to be done if you want to enjoy the grandness, heritage and tradition of this well-known hotel. It is very expensive though (but then hotels generally are when you start getting into this price bracket). Checking in was carried out quite quickly, but we did time it right as there were long queues on some occasions. We were upgraded to a larger room on the 17th floor which included a fireplace which was a nice feature. In general, the room and bathroom was well equipped, clean and tidy. You could pick it to bits if you really wanted to but I doubt if anything is that perfect. Unless you are out to completely blow your budget, I would suggest you don't get anything out of the mini-bar ($17.50 for a minature whisky), don't pay for a movie ($18.50) and avoid room service (service was good, but again boy do you pay for it!!). I do think for the amount of money that the rooms cost, complimentary bottles of water should be offered. They cost nearly $9 from the mini-bar. We only ate a small meal in Peacock Alley, which was okay but again very expensive. We chose to eat out for the rest of our meals as especially with breakfast you can wander not too far from the hotel and take your pick of eating places which will cost you far less. All in all we had a wonderful time in The WA and NY, even if our bank balance has taken a beating!! We would recommend the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, old-world style hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsGladiator
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf while on business at the end of October 2011 for 3 nights. They offered a special rate, otherwise we couldn't have afforded to stay there. My room was a corner room with a huge bathroom, tall windows, exquisite furniture & drapes and a comfy bed with high quality linens. It also had double-paned windows so the room was quiet. The Waldorf really pays attention to detail and I loved the old-style charm. I'm used to small shabby rooms when I come to NYC so this was a treat. I felt so pampered. I will look for that special again and come for fun next time!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend at the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: vacationmom103
Reviews.Content: Weekend stay in September with friend and our daughters. Corner suite with two bedrooms, two bathrooms, oversized walk-in closet (perfect for extended stay), foyer and DOORBELL...lol. The girls got a real kick out of the doorbell. Front desk at check-in and Bellman were standouts. We took in the whole experience, appreciating every nook and cranny of this fine hotel. Brunch at Peacock Alley, so memorable, tea in the morning and the most beautiful cappuccino for room service. Wine in the lobby, next to Cole Porter's piano, hmm. SWIZZ for an early dinner, fully appropriate with teens. Serendipity, Chelsea Market, SoHo, and Central Park. Broadway show, Mama Mia (2nd time for this show), just a fabulous weekend, and the Waldorf, WOW, you must experience this NYC gem.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Emily H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Waldorf in March 2012 and had a very nice time. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. The room was just as we expected - small but very nice and clean with quite a touch of charm and history. The location of WA was perfect for our trip. I know NYC is expensive but $95/person for Sunday brunch was just out of the question. If you're looking to stay and really get an old fashioned feel of NYC, WA is the perfect choice. Just beware that you will be walking for every meal because the restaurants are all $$$ and up.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: DPH69Mahopac
Reviews.Content: This hotel is unbeatable - service is great - rooms are always nice - plus it is quiet

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Anais1989
Reviews.Content: Not only the hotel is absolutely amazing because of its history and its beauty, but also the staff is wonderfully kind. We feel like being privileged everytime we talk to waiters, managers. Rooms are beautiful, and as we were at 40th floor, our view was incredible. This is THE hotel to choose.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: steve p
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights in mid-February and this hotel is everything that you'd expect. The atmosphere throughout the hotel is luxurious while at the same time very comfortable and without pretense, From the time that we checked in, the staff was extremely responsive, solicitous and courteous. Everyone that we encountered during our stay was extremely helpful and welcoming. The accomodations are old school luxury while being modern and convenient. Housekeeping service is outstanding and was serviced twice daily. They must have known when we were going to be out because the room was always cleaned when we returned. Room service was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Girls New York Trip”
Reviews.Author: haleygmann
Reviews.Content: This was THE PERFECT hotel for our girls trip! Centrally located, close to the museums, 5th avenue, and our Broadway shows we were going to. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was large for New York standards and everything was clean. We had 2 double beds which was perfect for all of us girls. I'm so glad we picked this place. We barely had to catch a cab or ride the subway the whole time we were there! So convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping Ninjas”
Reviews.Author: dbb4216
Reviews.Content: not sure how these Housekeeping ladies do it, but it is amazing. I took out my dont disturb sign, went out for a run at central park and back in 1hr. my room was clean spotless. everyday!!!! amazing service. big hotel but they treat you as a person. I didnt feel anyone was rude or anything as some reviews say. I was wearing casuals and am not the elite types but the reception staff was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Small dirty room in good location”
Reviews.Author: Globall
Reviews.Content: I had heard great things about the Waldorf when booking our trip from Australia so for $650 a night even though it was expensive, I thought it would be worth it. When we checked in we waited ages in a queue and when we finally got the keys we went to our room which was down the back in an ugly little nook. The room was even worse! The room was tiny and didn't even have a queen or king sized bed, it was a tiny double. The ensuite was itty bitty and had a mouldy shower curtain and ingrained mould around the sink. Despite the terrible room I must say the location was great, and the Bull and Bear restaurant was fantastic. I am not sure if I got bed bugs, but every night I would wake up itchy with a rash all over my back. I loved NYC and will go back in a heart beat, but I will never stay at the Waldorf again.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Dame of New York”
Reviews.Author: maggie55186534
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. Room was a little old fashioned but this added to the charm. Public areas were elegant . Staff were polite and effecient. The staff at the Concierge desk were very knowledgeable about all aspects of the city. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “a m a z i n g”
Reviews.Author: meddlingmike
Reviews.Content: stayed at this lovely venue on a trip here, i little off the beaten track but we had no problems walking to all of the relevant attractions

Reviews.Title: “Can't Get Enough of the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: ljerpi
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just stayed at the Waldorf this past weekend, which was our second time staying at the hotel. Everything was amazing, as always! The staff was super friendly to us, and even upgraded us to my boyfriend's HHonors Gold Status, even though the room was in my name, and I'm only a Silver member. The hotel lobby is gorgeous, and the rooms are elegant. You kind of feel like you've gone back in time to the 1930's New York! We would absolutely stay here again, as this is probably my favorite hotel ever!

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay for this one!”
Reviews.Author: PYT13
Reviews.Content: This is poor value for money. OK it's iconic art deco but it's really living off its reputation now, not its present offering. You will be one of literally thousands of people milling about in the public areas. There were some massive groups there which makes it feel like a school trip! Over priced, dingy rooms. Unless you are truly an art deco fan and can't resist, then save your money and go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “I stayed here in the 80s, and nothing has changed.”
Reviews.Author: pritchke
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely stay, but I was amazed at how everything was exactly as I remembered it from 20 years ago. The lobby can't be beat and I loved gazing up at the chandelier, but the rooms felt so dated. It was clean, but "worn." The bathroom still had the exact same phone on the wall. As a kid in the 80s, I thought that was amazing to have a phone right by the toilet, but now it just seems silly. Location was great - grab a bagel at Ess A Bagel around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “A tired rip off with”
Reviews.Author: Susan6062
Reviews.Content: I have just spent a night at the Waldorf and would not stay again. The motor lobby looked like an evacuation centre when I arrived, the bell hop suggested leaving my luggage on an open shelf. The rooms are tired and dated and tatty. The public areas are only saved by the inherent architecture but has a distinctly '80s' corporate feel which is depressing. Two martinis $45, orange juice $9, eggs Benedict which was decidedly average $28. And to add I insult to injury, there is a Starbucks in the hotel where a tea that had cost $2.99 at another Starbucks yesterday was $4.25 'because we are owned by Starbucks. I don't mind paying for quality but this isn't it. Avoid, there are plenty of other better hotels in New York

Reviews.Title: “One ot the most amazing T-Bone i ever had here!!”
Reviews.Author: RiadDarNajat
Reviews.Content: First..i didn't stay here as didn't have enough cash to be sincere ! i just came there as invited by a family member from Canada and did enjoy! I had one of the most amazing meet in my all life (I’m foodie and also working in this industry..so supposed to know what food means a part of my French’s origins..) The meat was simply one of the purest thing in my all life as said and i cannot forget the excellence of the place. the hotel has an excellent location for sure and is a little old fashion style but god value as far as I’m concerned. enjoy at least a great lunch there! Cheers! Oliver from Marrakech

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Iconic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: misssupermonty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in Feb 2012 as our first trip to NYC. We found the hotel staff very welcoming and accomodating even before arriving and answering any questions we had by email prior to our arrival. We arrived on the Saturday afternoon after a long flight and our room was ready straight away. The hotel lobby is huge! And very classic and luxurious. It was a bustling hotel so it was never quiet in the lobby or bars but there were plenty of areas to explore. Upon check in we were informed we'd been given a complimentary upgrade to an Executive Suite which was amazing. When we arrived at our room, we were amazed. It was huge with 2 TV's, a lounge, separate bedroom and 2 bathrooms. Absolutely fantastic and couldn't have asked for a better room on the 11th floor. The only downside was that we didn't have a view - it looked out into other rooms at the hotel but this wasn't a problem for us at all. The bed was very comfy and we both slept very well all nights. We drank each evening in the Peacock Alley Bar as the other bar was always full. The cocktails are amazing but pricey - but then so was everywhere else we drank in NYC so it's not any more expensive than any other places. The staff were always friendly and helpful and the lobby with the lovely chandelier was nice to just sit and watch people go by. We visited the Starlight Roof floor and this would have been a lovely setting for a function. Central station & 5th Ave is only a 5 min walk and Times Square was a little over 10 mins walk away which was really good and suite us well. Overall I would definately stay at this hotel again and it's just such an iconic hotel it has to be done. The only downside was the outside was covered in scaffolding due to the renovation so you couldn't really take in the grandeur of the hotel but once done I'm sure it'll be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Well let's just say location location location.... History Yes.... Rooms uh well average....”
Reviews.Author: KF1967
Reviews.Content: Want to say I stayed at Salford Astoria well I did... Very nice lobby, exceptional welcoming staff between valet the cincierge and front desk I got very excited that I would be pampered They definitely did their job well. Prices for coffee , breakfast, brunch were astronmical! Really ? $95 plus tax n tip PP! It was a beautiful array and display but WAY overpriced! The rooms are old in tradition the superior room was suppose to be larger to fit 4 But really?? Omg.... Very tight i enjoyed our time in NYC but unless I got a discounted room price again I would NOT stay there again! Again good location great lobby but way overpriced so if money is no object and you want history and location waldorf is your place! Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service in beautiful, historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: outtoexplore10
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Waldorf Astoria were wonderful and had several suggestions to offer for first time visitors to NY. The location was great for walking to several of the popular sites, (if you don't mind walking several blocks and you bring good shoes). We had a great time visiting the Empire State Building, Statue of Liberty, Times Square, etc. The Waldorf was hosting a posh event with a lot of celebrities when we were there and they have photos of many diplomats and stars who have visited their hotel over the decades. It is a beautiful hotel and was a great way to spend time in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “We can say we did it!”
Reviews.Author: EllaMocera
Reviews.Content: We loved the Waldorf. This was a girls getaway to NYC for some shows, dinner and just relaxation. We enjoyed ourselves so much. The location was good but not the best but the atmosphere is wonderful, the service outstanding, the beds divine. Would we stay there again?? Maybe not. Although we enjoyed it very much we went with a budget and it's difficult to enjoy all of the Waldorf on a budget, but we didn't expect anything different, we were at the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “It's a nice building to visit but a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: Kermie9
Reviews.Content: Like the title says, maybe worth a visit or the Sunday brunch, but to stay its not high value. We were unimpressed with the room and the fact that we didn't have hot water and that there was central heating that we couldn't alter in-suite. I've stayed in much better boutique hotels at better prices in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Astoria NYC - A lovely Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: masterkik
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family, it was made memorable by the staff hospitality. I would like to especially thank Ana Tijan, who was instrumental in making this special occasion such a delightful one. The buffet breakfast service at the Oscars restaurant was excellent and lots of choice for everyone, and would like to thank the restaurant manager Jeff in meeting our special request. We had a lovely 2 double bed suite, with a lovely lounge with classic styling. Also liked the exclusive check-in for Diamond and Gold members when they arrive, which made it more personal and was a nice touch. The choice of restaurants and bars within the hotel is pretty good, and should be able to cater for all ages and groups. The location is also ideal, and within easy walking distance from most tourist attractions. The yellow cabs (taxis) are quite reasonably priced, so we did make use of this when the kids got tiered walking.

Reviews.Title: “Great property and wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: Lovethefoodandwine
Reviews.Content: Everything you would expect to find when you stay at a Waldorf! Personalized service and friendly people! The rooms might be a little outdated but they have a certain level of old world charm and immaculate cleaning service so it doesn't matter at all. We stayed here with a very large group and the staff wen t above and beyond to make sure every last request was fullfilled and then some. Kudos to all employees here, because it is you that makes the people come back :)

Reviews.Title: “Service not so good”
Reviews.Author: Brian R
Reviews.Content: The Lobby is amazing, such a beautiful place. Check in was wonderful, the young lady was so helpful and kind. The only issue I had was I get there early and they took my luggage until my room was ready. They did text me in a prompt manner that my room was all set, I had to head to a business meeting so I went over to the Bell man and asked if they could just put the bags in my room, I had to leave. The bellman told he he could not put the bags in my room, I needed to do it. I did and was a couple of minutes late to my meeting. World Class service would have probably taken care of that for me. I know I have recieved better service from many of the Hiltons I have stayed at. I am a Gold Memeber of their Honors plan and an Owner at HGVC so I should have gotten free internet as "they" brought up on check in, nope had to call them to tell them to take it off my bill. Small thing, maybe, but if you sell yourself as the best you should be the best.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Bad Bad”
Reviews.Author: luxuryreviewer1
Reviews.Content: Been to the best hotels in the world. This doesn't compare with the worst. Must trade on reputation of days gone by. Not a place for families. Pay for everything incl cartoons on TV. Wrong side of town. Unapproachable front dest staff with attitude. Gave me apology and free upgrade for next time but wouldnt take it if you paid me. Really disappointing dusty, musty and lousy Very very expensive for every little item. Hairdresser in hotel was so hopeless and so expensive that I could have paid for 10 hairdos elsewhere . Nonethess hotel offers nothing and just feel as tough youve been ripped off. Stay away if you have a family with you

Reviews.Title: “There is nowhere like the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: Pollyanna89
Reviews.Content: We ( my daughter and I) are looking forward to our 6th visit to this fabulous and totally unique hotel. We visited as a family in 2007 and I always said if I ever went to NYC I would stay at the Waldorf. I honestly could not imagine staying anywhere else, As soon as we get out of the taxi it is like being transported to another, gentler,more charming age. I have stayed in many 4 and 5 star hotels and while unable to fault them, once inside you could be in any big hotel anywhere in the world. Not so the Waldorf, you could not possibly be anywhere else!!.The lobby is magnificent and the rooms are so comfy and elegant none of your minimalist boutique-e chic here. We have upgraded to a suite on the last three visits and we feel like royalty.The service is faultless and the doormen and bell boys so smart in their uniforms. Oscars does a fab breakfast, yes it is pricey but you dont need to do it every morning. Ellens stardust diner and the Brooklyn diner both in Times square are cheap and full of atmosphere Normas ar the Parker Meridien is fantastic as well. A bit further afield is the Lexington candy s hop,a great place for a cheap brekkie. The bull and bear steakhouse at the Waldorf does the best steaks we have had but we really like Johnny Utah nr the Rockerfeller centre too and it is more reasonable. We always come home exhausted there is so much to do it would take too long to tell about eveything that makes what seems to be an annual event now for us, so fantastic but there is no doubt that each visit to the big apple makes us love it more and staying at the Waldorf is the icing on a huge,decadent cake. Our last visit was Jan 2011 and we had to stay an extre day due to the snow we were gutted NOT .Cant wait until 25th March 2012..

Reviews.Title: “Hype or reality”
Reviews.Author: SandyA_10
Reviews.Content: The name suggests old world charm and glamour, which are there in abundance, but a visit to the lobby would achieve the same result. The best thing about this hotel is the location - great for walking to a number of areas at the top of the tourist 'to do' list. However, the service is impersonal and the number of passers by in the lobby can make getting to the elevators a real challenge. I'm glad I went, but wouldn't rush back.

Reviews.Title: “Been there, done that”
Reviews.Author: LentonFamily
Reviews.Content: I'm a bit late writing this as we stayed at the Waldorf in December 2010 but I doubt much has changed ;) This is undoubtedly an iconic location and at Christmas when we were there the public areas were beautiful and made for a fantastically atmospheric entrance. The room we had however was really very basic, pretty small and the bathroom very outdated. We were travelling with children (8,11) who found the hotel stuffy and old fashioned and we left with the feeling that we've had in other high end hotels that the constant stream of 'extras ' such as wifi and tv channels are designed for those that don't have to think about running up a big bill. I felt that the Waldorf was a bit too complacent, relying on it's fantastic heritage. When poor weather cancelled flights and extended our stay we were unable to extend our room and moved to the Pearl which was without doubt a much better option for our family. Glad we did it as it feels great to jump in a cab and say 'Take me to the Waldorf' but we've done it now and wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Elegant but aging”
Reviews.Author: IsadoreG
Reviews.Content: Service was first rate and the room was large and comfortable. The bed and linen perhaps the best I have slept in a hotel (or I was very tired) The room was somewhat dated and you could see the age of the woodwork, moldings etc. at the edges cracking paint and so on. Still it is obvious that for a old hotel they work hard to maintain it. The lobby is wonderful and grand Basically if you want something different with old time class and charm, this is the place to be. The location is also great, though parking quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “nice place with a few concerns”
Reviews.Author: Yanni_Pannimayoo
Reviews.Content: no doubt this is a classy place. we had one of the "superior rooms" and it was comfortable and attractively furnished. I would say, however that it made very inefficient use of space. The dressing area, which was separated by a door from the main living area was as large as a small bedroom. I can't understand why they put a second desk in there rather than a couch or daybed. There also was an unusually large foyer which could have been put to better use. My one other peeve is that a $90 toilet is not consistent with a $300 hotel room and when the bathroom has no exhaust fan ( or even window) they could at least supply some sort of scented spray or incense.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not contemporary so expect a timeless classic”
Reviews.Author: ARCHIE0410
Reviews.Content: My first impression of the outside of the hotel was of slight disappointment as the hotel is currently under renovation and is covered in mesh. I was delighted however with my allocated room and the swift check-in procedure. They certainly know how to deliver good old fashioned service and the only let down is the expectation of a tip for anything. The beds are really comfy and the rooms have all mod cons. My biggest bug bear is the charge for WIFI. The cost is $15.95 for 24 hours per device. Coming from a family of 4 iPads, the cost was just too much for us all to enjoy. I travel a lot and I just don't get why hotels charge for providing a service which I imagine costs them very little.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and elegant”
Reviews.Author: Bloomers28
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 nights in a superior room on the 25th floor, it was wonderful! The lobby is beautiful, check-in was quick and very welcoming, our room was fabulous with extremely comfortable beds and quality toiletries. Every member of staff we encountered was friendly and courteous. It was just how I had imagined the Waldorf=Astoria would be.

Reviews.Title: “Always amazing”
Reviews.Author: Ken M
Reviews.Content: Wife and I have stayed there many times when they have a discount period. Always a treat. Everything is special and the location is incredible for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Put Her out of her misery.”
Reviews.Author: John J
Reviews.Content: Although the Towers rooms are still beautiful, the rest of the hotel is tired and worn. Unhappy staff who speak ill of their managers in voices loud enough to hear are probably telling the truth. The place has seen it's glory days and those days are gone.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent”
Reviews.Author: ilovetravelling204
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to New York and it was amazing as usual! I went with my mum and grandma and between them they had visit new york around 15 times and this was the first time any of us had stayed in the Waldorf Astoria and we will 100% be going back! It was such a classic, elegant hotel which is full of history! The rooms where outstanding and also full of history in its decor which we loved. The beds were so comfy and no doubt you will have a great nights sleep there! The staff were just amazing and helpfull, we had no problems whats so ever! We did not experience the spa so i cant comment on that but after what i have heard, that is also very good! It was also great to find out that there was free Wifi access in the lobby which was great for me to catch up on college work!

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in New York.”
Reviews.Content: Four days of excitement and wonder on our first visit to what is the best city in the world. Myself and three of my children stayed at the Waldorf and were given a lovely room with two large beds. The service was always excellent - attentive yet relaxed. There is a Starbucks in the foyer for a morning coffee that was pricey but very convenient. The great benefit from a stay here is the location. Walking distance to anywhere that matters. Do look into Grand Central Station, use the subway and skate at the Rockefeller. What a place. Any one that grumbles about it being tired doesn't deserve to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Dublin_IrelandDavid
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in a junior suite and it is such a beautiful hotel. The room was lovely and spacious and the bed was very comfortable. We did not eat in the hotel but did have a few drinks in the ground floor bar which is a lovely way to finish off the night. Staff were very friendly and courteous

Reviews.Title: “Iconic, beautiful but noticeably lacking in the small things”
Reviews.Author: YRLENGLAND
