Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf last week for 3 nights. It was our first time in New York and my husband booked this hotel and trip as a nice surprise for our short break. Having stayed at a few older but iconic hotels around the world, our expectations were not overly high for the room as we have found the rooms tend to be smaller and more worn than the new hotels. When we checked in we were surprised to see the room was of a decent size and well decorated and very clean. The bathroom was basic with plastic shower curtain holders and a toilet that kept blocking up - but nice smelling shampoo and soaps. Overall the room was ok. The size was good, it was clean and the bed was comfy but the small things were missing - no slippers, a threadbare robe that was ripped, no coffee maker (Starbucks was in the lobby but had very limited hours and room service was available but had a $5.25 charge on top of room service prices which would make a coffee around $13!!!!!) if you had the foresight of knowing that the hotel didn't supply coffee makers (which I didn't) you could have ordered one. I strongly recommend this if you are early risers or else it's either a long wait or an ouch in your wallet - either option is not really what you expect from this hotel. Also be aware that for the whole 3 days there was no Internet available in our room either. We saw a lot of people using the free Internet in the lobby which my husband ended up doing for business. There was no explanation for the lack of Internet - it just didn't work. The lobby and reception areas are beautiful to say the least and make this hotel. We ate breakfast at Oscar's once which was a buffet style and we had a bill of $90.25 inc tip - would not recommend this but one evening we had drinks, plates of cheeses and meats and a slice of cheesecake in The Peacock Alley - which was lovely and relaxed, excellent service and only around $130. For us we would not have stayed anywhere else as this hotel is the epitome of luxurious New York from bygone days and if only Hilton paid attention to the small items we would rush back there as the location is perfect, however we will probably look elsewhere for our next trip or maybe pay the extra and try The Towers.

Reviews.Title: “4 Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: jamesavfc
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Waldorf Astoria. Wow what an experience. This is a very old hotel, and indeed does show its age, however do not be fooled it oozes elegance and once inside the reception area/lobby you cant help but feel the ambiance of the hotel. The staff are all immaculate in their dress, and are so polite and helpful it almost irritates (if that is possible). Everyone appears to be wearing white linen gloves and if they are not busy seem to be polishing any item that stands. The hotel is in midtown manhatton in a perfect location. Approx 10 minute walk to the lively Times Square and the Empire State Building. A few minutes walk to the Rockefella Centre and only a short walk to Bloomingdales and loads of designer shops. We only had 4 days there and decided to try and visit as many tourist attractions as we could, but wished we had more time to explore the shopping areas as prices were certainly better than in the Uk. We also chose to use the tourist hop on hop off bus which we thought was perfect. All in all if you plan to visit New York if you dont stay here please make an effort just to visit and see for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Grand old lady”
Reviews.Author: JGC
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf exudes the sort of glamour that new hotels just can't manage. The lobby is spendid, the staff is extremely attentive and friendly, and staying there feels like an "old New York" experience. I first stayed there 15 years ago, and it still has the same grand feeling. The rooms have been updated, but in a classic style. I stayed there with my husband and teen daughter and our room fairly large, by New York standards. The towels were fluffy and replaced daily and the beds were comfortable. The toiletries were really nice--the kind I would actually use. The only dismaying feature was the ceiling in our bathroom was leaking the first morning, and I could tell it had been patched before. The location is wonderful and of course there are restaurants everywhere if you don't want to eat at the hotel ($$$). Also, wi-fi is $15 for 24 hours in the room, but free in the lobby. And there are Starbucks almost literally on every corner in NY, so you can use the wi-fi there, too. The price was not bad at all for a NY hotel room of this calibre--under $250/night. Also, and this is important in NY, the windows were excellent and the traffic noise wasn't bad.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel & adequate room”
Reviews.Author: ocInvestor2
Reviews.Content: Checked in to the W=A for a 2 night business stay. The elegant entry and sumptous lobby was even better then my sky high expectations for such a storied hotel. The staff was crisp but not particularly warm. My room left me with mixed feeleings. I think I was upgraded due to my HHonors status. I recieved a surprising large room with 2 Double or Queen Beds. I was shocked on how large he room was particularly for NYC. The bath was also large and even had an antechamber going into it. Bu here's where the mixed emotions came in. The room itself - the walls, rug, tile, etc. all seemed, well, old and somewhat worn. The bath reminded of something designed in the mid -80's Leona Helmsley/ Trump era. It did'nt seem particularly clean or dirty, just old. The bed linens and the towels were all top notch, but the bones of the room was just old. The climate control seemed to go from nothing to pizza oven. In fact I woke up my first night in a dead sweat and the room was a sauna. And this was after the bellmen had set the tempature for me. I'm glad I had chance to visit this Grand Dame, but at the rates they charge I would'nt come back until the rennovation is complete.

Reviews.Title: “A true classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: nezza28
Reviews.Content: I stayed here many years ago on my first trip to New York in 2004 and was suitably impressed with the hotel back then. I returned there last year in March and I am delighted to say that the hotel is still as impressive as it seemed to me on my first trip. The room we had, by New York standards, can only be described as huge. No exaggeration. The sleep quality is also second to none in this hotel. The room was clean and tidy and well appointed. The only issue that we had throughout the trip was with the in-room WiFi but as a result of the problem we were not charged upon checkout without any question from staff. Yes the hotel in some ways looks a little dated but this only adds to the charm of it. I would certainly return for a 3rd stay without hesitation. Its also in a fantastic location and within walking distance of most of the main attractions and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Legendary hotel but kind of old-ish”
Reviews.Author: LazNYC
Reviews.Content: It's THE location to be in Manhattan. I've been here many times to parties, weddings, during the Fashion week... My work is just blocks away so I often stop by for a drink at the bar. But I went upstairs to the room only once. My boyfriend got me a suit and Guerlain spa package for my birthday. The spa was nice of course... Pampering at it's best! But the room was disappointing... I expected more from the suit at the Waldorf Astoria, NYC... The furniture was old, the rooms small, and the bed was not that comfortable, the towels dry...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: howdeppisyourlove
Reviews.Content: Located conveniently to just about everywhere in Manhattan with easy access to taxis and subways, this lovely hotel was a highlight of our trip to the USA. We walked or took the subway everywhere and found it very easy to do so from the Waldorf. The hotel is gorgeously decorated, attentive and helpful staff, friendly service, quality amenities and lovely rooms. Clean, fresh and well maintained in every way. We only had one sour note during our stay and that was on arriving, we were left standing with our luggage on the sidewalk for about 15 minutes before the doorman assisted us. We did expect better service from a Waldorf Hotel! Room service was excellent but very, very expensive. I cannot honestly fault this beautiful hotel and would happily stay here again when back in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Service Auld Lang Syne in Deco Dreamland”
Reviews.Author: kdonnh
Reviews.Content: One reason why the Waldorf Astoria only rates 2 stars when you have a cold & need hot tea 7pm on a Sunday nite. A reading from the in-room info book: Coffee makers are available in your room strickly (sic) per advance request to Room Service. Guests are invited to order coffee with Room Service or to enjoy coffee at Peacock Alley Restaurant in the main lobby, at Oscar's Restaurant or at the Starbucks located down the steps from the Park Avenue Lobby. Problem? Starbucks closes @4 weekends/6 weekdays. Oscars's & Peacock Alley won't provide take out. Concierge sends you 2 blocks away to another Starbucks...also closed.Room service? $8.00 + $5.25 in room charge +15% gratuity+ City taxes. Other reasons < 5 stars...uninformed staff, no doorman @ Park Av entrance to help with luggage, lacking in general amenities,maintenance & cleanliness of room. BUT... The public rooms are glittering & fabulous..&the food served @ at a huge gala in the ballroom was excellent..almost on par w/Bull &Bear...no rubber chicken here.  And, yes, I could imagine a Guy Lombardo New Years Eve while in the ballroom & cocktails on the Starlight Roof.   My room was spacious & quiet & since it faced the interior courtyard, barely a whisper of city noise.

Reviews.Title: “Average service, extra-ordinary prices”
Reviews.Author: CKB66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf in February 2011 for one week. At check-in we were given a free upgrade - great! When we got to the room it was hard to imagine it was an upgrade. The furniture is tired and they seem to think that old means charming. It meant old. The windows were drafty and the heating system not great. The room was smaller than you would expect for an upgrade. But nothing prepared us for the prices at the bar. Everything was SO expensive. Be prepared to shell out $50 for two drinks - and I mean a glass of wine and a Manhattan (which was cheaper than the wine!). Don't touch the mini-bar - it seems to think you have taken things you haven't. That said we did have one of the mini-bar small bottles of white wine - $36! The location seems great on Park with Madison, Lexington and all the famous names so close. Just means everything is expensive. We went to the Rockerfella Centre for breakfast and that was ok. If you have heaps of money to literally throw away - go. If you want good value perhaps select another hotel - we wish we did.

Reviews.Title: “Would Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: jtribe
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 day break in New York, our first visit, staying at the Waldorf. Having read some of the reviews about the hotel being a little tired we were a little apprehensive but have to say that we do not agree with this at all. The service is first class, to the door men, reception, bar staff and waiters. Always polite, helpful and smiling, they made us feel very welcome and nothing was too much trouble. When we arrived we were on the 8th floor of the Astoria, the room was nice and perfectly acceptable. Unfortunately our neighbours decided to have a party and were playing very loud music until 1am. We phoned down to reception and within 10 minutes we heard the knock on their door and it all stopped. The following morning we went to reception and were informed that we had been upgraded to the 39th floor of the Towers! All our belongings were transferred whilst we were out and upon our return we were thrilled to bits. The room was amazing! We had breakfast at the hotel which again was great, everything you could possible want, albeit think was very expensive at $40 each! The drinks are all expensive in the bars but the champagne cocktails were just too tempting. If we are lucking enough to visit New York again I would certainly stay at the Waldorf again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Older Rooms”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteBuckeye
Reviews.Content: I have wanted to stay at this hotel for a long time. When I saw the great deals in January, I could not pass it up. I have stayed in a lot of NY hotels and the service here is outstanding. I think that I was greated by 6 different people before I ever reached the front desk. The lobby area is quite grand and beautiful. The rooms were much more bland than I had imagined. I have stayed at much cheaper hotels that have much better rooms (ie The W). Despite having old and dated rooms, the beds were quite comfortable. I had a good nights rest, no issues with noise. There is a nice lobby bar as well as another attached on the east side of the building (Bull and Bear I think). My husband and I enjoyed 5 cocktails and our bill was more than $100. Steep even for NYC. All in all, would I stay here again? No. But I did check a box off of my Bucket List - so it was worth it in that regard.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Astoria New York City”
Reviews.Author: csg
Reviews.Content: I visited with my son in March of 2011. Room was very nice, a bit dated, but very spacious. Hotel location is a tad too remote for my taste - no "fast-food" restaurants (or any restaurants acutally) or neighborhood food stores very near. There is a Starbucks location in the lobby of the hotel, which helped in the mornings since there is no coffee machine in the guest rooms. The hotel is quite beautiful and rich in history and I enjoyed my stay there very much. Sitting in the lobby and watching the "parade" of tourists was very entertaining. Restaurants were good but very pricey - after all it is the Waldorf!

Reviews.Title: “Old style charm, with new modern comforts”
Reviews.Author: dannythedog2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Waldorf on two occasions, first in the towers and second in the main part of the hotel. Even through the towers were had not been renovated in awhile, the experience was wonderful. Hugh room, with all of the modern conveniences (large screen tv, Jacuzzi, wireless in the room). As others noted, the lobby is wonderful, but do check out the spa (it is included in the price). I was there to watch the Thanksgiving parade, close to the route. The hotel is so large, it takes up a full city block.

Reviews.Title: “Great 40th birthday trip to remember”
Reviews.Author: Laura40_12
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a five day trip to New York staying at the Waldorf Astoria. The hotel was kind enough to upgrade us to a suite as it was my 40th birthday. From the minute we walked in to check in until the end of our stay the service was amazing and we were treated to complimentary drinks vouchers for my birthday. The suite was beautifully decorated, very clean and had excellent facilities. The view from our room was the Crysler Building. The room was very quiet, the bed and pillows were very comfortable and I found the whole hotel very clean and luxurious. Our busy schedule meant that we didn't spend as much time in the room as we would have liked. The location suited us well and I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel or staying in it again. The hotel made my birthday trip more special and it was our first adults only trip away without our children. It is well worth asking for an upgrade as they couldn't do enough for me. Some comments on this site had previously put me off and I was going to pay the extra to go to the Plaza. So glad I didn't waste my money now!!

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for sleek and contemporary this is not for you”
Reviews.Author: ScottishLady38
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a Saturday evening for four nights. There was only a short wait to check in. It would have been a shorter wait if people had not ignored the queue and gone directly to receptionists. We received a very warm welcome from Carolin who upgraded us to a suite in the Towers. The suite was beautiful with a huge living room and bedroom. Yes it looks dated in places but that is the charm. It was spotlessly clean and was kept that way by housekeeping every day. The bathroom was gorgeous and was huge too. We had room service a couple of times and could not fault either the quality or presentation of the food. We ate in the Bull and Bear one evening. The food was wonderful. The restaurants, bar and room service in this hotel were not cheap but for quality like this we did not mind paying. I can't write this review without commenting on the staff. Without exception they were professional, accommodating, and friendly. We will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “A grand old hotel -- with a wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: RevL05
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Waldorf the Sunday before Valentine's Day, since I had a meeting the next day a few blocks away. We took in a play and then had a marvelous dinner at a well-known restaurant before our stay there. And then the Waldorf. Our accommodations were actually two adjoining rooms -- with two bathrooms (a very nice touch so that we could get ready simultaneously). One room had couches and the other the bed, but both had TVs. There certainly was some wear, but not bad and the rooms were well-maintained. I'll grant you that for this up-graded suite the price was not cheap (approximately $450 including taxes), but it was an experience to savor -- including a very comfortable bed. My biggest complaint was the price of drinks in the bar downstairs: if I remember correctly, $19 a drink for simple fare, not complicated cocktails. Still, it was sort of fun to be able to say that we'd stayed in the same hotel as kings and queens and presidents.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: mlsimp2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights for a conference. I didn't get to enjoy the outstanding location very much since the conference agenda was packed but found the property to be top notch. Rooms have small bathrooms you would expect with an older property. The HVAC was also dated since it was unseasonably warm but there was no A/C. Fortunately I opened the window and it was very comfortable. Internet was free if you have AT&T service at home!!! The property is dated but charming and service made up for any shortcomings in the physical plant.

Reviews.Title: “The Waldorf - Service still counts”
Reviews.Author: elmarko123
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I had thought the place would be an outdated stuffy old relic but I was wrong. It is not a Hyatt or Sheraton but that isnt the clientelle they are going for. I think if you want a good location and a piece of New York History and really good service - this is the hotel. it was especially nice the staff were so well trained and sincerely friendly. As for price I think like all hotels you can get a spectacular deal but on the surface it is very expensive - maybe to keep the riff-raff like me away! lol But I did get a good deal anyway. Other than that Beds were comfortable, no bedbugs, clean sheets. modernized bathrooms and old style well kept decor throughout. Lobby is gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Let down”
Reviews.Author: sonilapokharia
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to stay at the Waldorf ever since I read an article about it in Reader's Digest more than 20 years ago. To say that I was disappointed would be putting it very very mildly. The room that we were in had such a run down feel to. The bathroom fixtures had rust on them. The first day that we were there, one of the blinds got have stuck and cam down partially. The room service must have seen that every day for the next 3 days but didnt fix it. There was no coffee maker in the room. While one was brought up very promptly, the staff didnt replenish the coffee any day!!! One day wen we came back to the hotel in the middle of day, the house keeping staff had seemed to have just finished cleaning our room and the smell of bleach was strong enough to make you gag! Having said that, I wouldnt have sat down to write my very first reveiw of any hotel because of the reasons mentioned above. I have stayed in better hotels and in much worse hotels. What prompted this review was - this was Waldorf and one of the to-do things on my bucket list. And thats why the expereince was even more disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and romantic”
Reviews.Author: kathryn_robertson
Reviews.Content: If you prefer minimalist, ultra-modern décor then this is probably not the place for you. The Waldorf is all about old world charm – big sweeping chandeliers, lovely art deco/1920s style rooms. The bathrooms aren’t super modern, but bright and airy with high-quality fittings and scrupulously clean. A huge bath tub, if like me you like a good soak. We stayed in a suite which was really luxurious - roomy with lots of period furniture, and helpful staff on hand whenever required. Really tranquil and relaxing, I found the Waldorf the ideal place to catch my breath after the bustle of the city. I’d go back there in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rachel F
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it's one of the most famous hotels in New York. The hotel had an impressive foyer with chandeliers and old fashioned elegance. The rooms were large with a super comfy bed. The rooms were not modern and minimalist but classic and chintzy and what you would expect. The Noel has plenty of history and many famous people have stayed there. The staff were really friendly and helpful. The concierge recommended a good restaurant for a steak and even booked a table for us. The location of the hotel is good for Grand Central Station and we walked everywhere from the hotel. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel full of charm, character and elegance”
Reviews.Author: andy182
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Waldorf Astoria following a 4 night stay and we could not fault this hotel. I’ve read some previous reviews about the standard of rooms being tired and musty. All I can say is that our room (2516) was fantastic. It was large, spotlessly clean and had an extremely comfortable king size bed with a ‘boudoir’ that leads to an impressive bathroom. The best compliment I can give this hotel is the standard of service delivered by the staff. On checking in we were dealt with by Justin, who was extremely professional and gave us a superb standard of service as we’d had some issues with BA losing our luggage. The service from house keeping to the bell captain was equally good The Waldorf is situated in an excellent location, only a few blocks away from the main tourist attractions. Overall it was full of charm, character and elegance and I would not hesitate in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Guerlain Spa = Divine Room Service = needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: JenY_Travels
Reviews.Content: My husband gave me a Winter Spa package at the Waldorf Astoria as a gift for my recent trip to New York. The Waldorf is a classic and there is no modern minimalism here. My room was large and spacious and very comfortable. Room service was a bit of a let down on my first night - I arrived and got all comfy in their big white robes and went to order but alas, no menu in the room. Called Room Service and requested a menu to be sent to the room AND to cut a long story short - after 3 phone calls and a wait of over an hour and still no menu I decided to get dressed and go out and get my own food. Not quite what one expects from a luxurious hotel of this standard - I put a call into Guest Services to let them know and to their credit they got a menu to my room while I was out foraging for food on Lexington Ave and my experience the next night was much better. However - the highlight of my stay was the amazing Guerlain spa treatment - I had a "As You Wish" 80 minute massage, champagne on arrival and use of the spa room after my massage. It was just divine and I will visit the spa again on my next NYC visit even if I am not staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: princessmena
Reviews.Content: from start to finish this hotel great staff couldnt do enough for us got room upgrade when they found out it was my birthday and a lovely present and card special mention to marlene caroline and agnes

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Waldorf Astoria”
Reviews.Author: palikeras
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Waldorf for my daughter's 16th birthday. The room was musty, spacious but with a tiny bathroom and very dated. We live in the UK and are used to the faded country style hotel but the Waldorf is not in that class it is just a bit grubby round the edges. I asked to pay for an upgrade to the towers and the lady at the Hilton check in was very helpful. She showed me the options before I confirmed and negotiated a discount for me. I moved to a suite in the Towers and this was much more suitable with rich fabrics large bedroom and bathroom. However staff performance was patchy. Paul our bell person was top notch and David the concierge recommended a fantastic restaurant where we had one of the best meals in a long while. The staff at the towers desk were not so helpful and during our stay we didn't have any input from customer relations. The Tower lounge is very basic not really worth visiting. Having spent some days at the New York Palace Towers where the lounge presentation is amazing the Towers at the Waldorf was lacking. The general feel in the hotel was not welcoming it was busy and transient. The public rooms do reflect the past prominence of the hotel but it doesn't have an up market ambiance now. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “History abounds - Rooms could be better”
Reviews.Author: Alleyns
Reviews.Content: If you are thinking of staying at the Waldorf Astoria you will not fail to be impressed by its lineage and history since its opening in 1931. It is a New York landmark building which exudes art neuveau decoration throughout its public areas. You may however be surprised, as we were, to read so many negative trip advisor reviews about rooms in a hotel which has hosted events for every US President since its opening, and has had numerous famous celebrities live there. The truth is that there are two parts to the hotel, the lower part of the building houses the Waldorf Astoria Hotel, whilst the 28th to 42nd floors house the suites of the Waldorf Towers. The suites in The Towers which we saw on a hotel tour reflect the higher price demanded, whilst rooms in the Hotel may be small and tend to reflect the age of the building. Having read many reviews we requested and paid for an upgrade to our room when we checked in. Ours was a corner room with a king size bed on the 12th floor which was of a reasonable size. We did not experience any problems mentioned about noise on lower floors from the exterior refurbishment works, which I understand are nearly finished now. In our room however the window mounted ventilators were old and their controls tended to be difficult to manage, the old window blinds were frayed, and the shower took several attempts to keep the water hot. This projected an aged and poorly maintained image. That said we found the room clean, comfortable and well furnished and we enjoyed our stay in it. For us a good aspect of the hotel was the staff who were always pleasant and polite, and assisted with any queries we had. Would we would stay there again? Yes we would as the positive aspects outnumbered the negative ones, and the staff made our stay very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Central Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: AJWW4764
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night at the end of January. The room was large and comfortable with a great view over the Avenue. Only downside was the small bathroom Saff were efficient and capable. Will stay again next time in Manhattan

Reviews.Title: “holiday of a life time”
Reviews.Author: ross45
Reviews.Content: My two daughters and i travelled to New york city for a five day break and we stayed at the Waldorf Astoria, It definitely has to be the best i have ever experienced, the staff were amazing the rooms were outstanding, the bathrooms were spotless. Nothing was too much trouble for staff in this wonderful hotel i would recommend this hotel to anybody and if you decide to stay here i hope that you enjoy your stay as much as we did

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: TonynKaren
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 days at the WA over Christmas. They helped us move to a much larger room because of a problem with the mini safe at no additional cost, and all in all we have no regrets at all about staying there. This is a grand old NY hotel, so dont expect swish state of the art decor and electronics. The reception area is a huge concourse running the whole block. Breakfast in the lobby is expensive but there is a Starbucks by the entrance door, and if you want to avoid the queues (sorry- lines) go to the one immediately opposite on 5th Avenue and meet some newyorkers. I took bagels and coffee back to the room each morning, same as most clients staying there. There are plenty of good restaurants in the area for eating out. Service was impeccable and all the staff very helpful and friendly, and always ready to give advice. This is a huge hotel, so enjoy the bustle and people watching, but its heyday was in the Sinatra/Kennedy era.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and beautiful public spaces, but the rooms are in need of an update.”
Reviews.Author: Stuart K
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Waldorf-Astoria on business, and the service, facilities and overall cleanliness of the hotel and guest rooms is excellent. The location is great and allows for easy travel (as easy as it can get) within Manhattan. The rooms, on the other hand, while clean and well-appointed, are clearly dated and in need of an update. The bedroom was small with somewhat threadbare carpet in places. The bathroom, (again, very clean) was also quite small and did not have room for any of the typical traveler's vanity items. There was some peeling paint throughout thr room, ceiling and in the hallways. Finally, the room offered only a rudimentary temperature control, and in this case the only choice was heat or fan speed. Granted, it was winter while I was there, but there was no way to get the room unstuffy, which led to a fairly frustrating need to have the heat on and the window open at the same time. A call to the front desk informed me that the guests have a chooice of heat or cool only from April to May, and in September and October, when there is otherwise only seasonally-available hot or cold air. Overall, great location, professional staff in a very historic hotel. Would be much better if the living history didn't extend to the guest room, however.

Reviews.Title: “a garanty !”
Reviews.Author: filofilo
Reviews.Content: the classic hotel whit a service excellent, sailence ,quite. location excellent near museums and shopping

Reviews.Title: “My most expensive disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Glamazon1123
Reviews.Content: I surprised my kids a lavish trip to NYC for Christmas. We booked Broadway tickets with a backstage tour, reservations at amazing restaurants, limo service, shopping excursions, a carriage ride in Central Park, tickets to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island and the icing on the cake: I booked a suite at the Waldorf Astoria, a hotel I have always wanted to stay at given its rich history and its reputation for beautiful decor and luxurious accomodations. I was so happy with every aspect of our trip with the glaring exception of the Waldorf Astoria. They are in need of a deep clean- not only in their rooms, hallways, public areas and entrances, but in their customer service departments. We were treated like a nuisance by the house keeping phone center when we dared to ask for linens for the pull out couch, or to be able to have the clock set to the right time (it's locked down tight for some ridiculous reason). When the linens finally did arrive (an hour later- and it was already 10:00 at night) there was no blanket included. And the housekeeping rep was so annoyed by having to come to our room to give us linens ("I have to get back to work"....?) that she actually asked if we "really needed a blanket"...No. It's January in NYC. We'll be warm and cozy in the 20 degree weather. The maintenance man who came to set the clock insisted on getting into some political arguement with me about the mayor of Chicago, which he initiated. Why? The worst thing that happened was that there was a function in the lobby on the Sunday of the weekend we were there. NO ONE alerted us to this. No phone message, no paper under the door, no sign in the lobby- NOTHING. When we returned to the hotel after a very long day of sight seeing we were blocked from going to the elevators of our room. Instead we were shuffled to some elevators in the bowels of the building (of which there were several but only one was actually working) along with 100 other guests. All to wait to get onto one elevator to get to our rooms. it took forever and would be infuriating at a budget road side hotel much less the WALDORF ASTORIA. When we complained to the front desk manager about the situation we got NO apology, NO remedy and NO compensation. Instead he handed us a coupon for a small coffee from Starbucks. Gee, thanks. He actually said "Well, we told the people who checked in on Saturday." When we said "What about those who checked in on Friday?", he replied "Oh, I guess we forgot." The beds were horrible, the carpet was dirty, the decor was trying desperately to reflect the history of the building but failed miserably. I would never stay here again nor would I ever recommend it. I paid an insane amount of money for this horrible hotel- it would have been much better spent at a more modern hotel in a better location with a MUCH better staff. Such a shame.

Reviews.Title: “An old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lamonci L
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights during last January 12. The location is good, being on the Park Avenue near to all the most important attractions and shopping in NYC. But the hotel is quite old (under renovation). We booked a superior double room for about 400 usd per night + taxes but when we arrived in the room we realized it was not a superior... I called the reception and after some "sorry" they change the room. The superior room was at the 12th floor, quite big and nice with a partial view on the Chrysler building. The bathroom was quite old but at the end we were happy. We went twice to the bar and the glasses/ cups were not well clean (do you think is normal to pay 60 usd to have breakfast having this service?) Moreover every morning we had a terrible wake up around 8 am by the housekeepers, they did loads of noise every morning in the corridor. We asked the concierge to book a really nice japanese restaurant and they booked a table for us in a Japanere around the corner telling it was the best one...we were really disappointed about that. Finally they blocked the mini fridge the last evening without advising us and we spent 30 minutes by phone during the night to get the fridge open. We think it was a great hotel maybe 30 years ago. You can find better hotel in NYC at the same prime (Essex House)

Reviews.Title: “Towers rooms”
Reviews.Author: NDR64
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last January for 8 nights. You need to love the early 20th century style to love the hotel. I also think that rooms in the tower wing are better than the others and you can also enjoy the complimentary continental breakfast. I had breakfast (wonderful) also in one of the restaurats of the hotel but it cost me 50 USD. The staff is nice and helpful and if you stay in the tower you have a dedicated concierge and reception that is nice because the other reception is always very busy. I think it's too expensive for what it is but service and location are good. Rooms need some love and tender and they are now doing some sort of renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, good location”
Reviews.Author: bleue-marine
Reviews.Content: we spent 3 days at the Waldorf Astoria in NY and enjoyed the location (10mn walk to Rockfeller Center, 5 mn for Grand Central) Even if pricey, decoration is so gorgious that we forget about money:) we had the experience of the room breakfast which was a dream ! at the 17th floor view on surrounding buildings was terrific, staff was very helpful and nice. Definitely I would go back when I return to NY

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Old Lady Still Delivers”
Reviews.Author: Lonners
Reviews.Content: Want a modern, minimalist, efficient hotel experience? Try somewhere else. The Walforf is a charming, iconic and generally lovely hotel, but it won't be for eveyone. The foyer looks as much like a Hotel Museum as a 21st Century hip, wireless accommodation experience, and we love that about it. The hotel is huge, so there is often a queue just to talk to someone at reception, even to collect a message. We were shocked and delighted at the rate we got for our 7 night stay at The Walforf. Our suite was beautiful.....then next morning we saw the workers immediately outside our window - and I do mean "immediately." The Park Avenue facade is being upgraded, and suddenly the low rate was put into context. But it mattered not - there was no noise and no inconvenience. It was a delightful, warm and comfortable place to be. Bobby delivered our luggage and gave us the rundown - stop him talking if you can, the man is a human word machine - but listen to him, for his NY wisdom is invaluable. Internet is expensive by today's standards, but of course we signed on anyway. Just after we arrived, a pipe broke somewhere and the water system was shut down for the entire hotel - a reminder that the Waldorf wasn't built in the last 10 years. It came back on a couple of hours later. We had a drink at Sir Harry's (wonderful when it is quiet), buffet breakfast at Oscar's (extensive choices) and a nightcap at the Bull & Bear (the Cheescake and Red Velvet are to die for), Midtown location means that attracions like Grand Central Station, MoMA, even Central Park are within walking distance, and downtown life is (for us, not gerat subway users) a $12 cab ride away. As a genuine NY experience, staying at the Waldorf is right up there, and was a highlight of our time in this great city. I could on, as may have become obvious...we would and will stay at the Walforf again, if rates permit. Oh, one last thing - the $5 overnight shoeshine service is a brilliant service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, helpful staff, generous rooms”
Reviews.Author: Nicolas_Kar
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for eleven nights over new year's 2011. As a Hilton Honors Member, we got upgraded to a junior suite, which was a very nice treat. The staff were very friendly and polite and always eager to help. One needs to keep in mind, when staying at the Waldorf, the sheer magnitude of the hotel. Close to 1,500 rooms make this a challenging operation to manage; this means that there will be a few hiccups, but nothing that cannot be resolved throught mutual good faith. On the 1st of January, heading out of the hotel, we noticed the brunch was up and running. Although we had not booked in advance, the staff were very polite and gave us a table. It was a great two and half hour indulgence. A very nice experience, to be repeated.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel, but rooms are in dire need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: TwoWire
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Waldorf~Astoria many, many times over the years, and truly love it. The lobby areas, Grand Ballroom, other meeting rooms, and various other common areas are terrific, and the staff was uniformly outstanding on this last visit. However, there is no question that the rooms and overall mechanical systems are in dire need of updating and renovation. While the appointments in the room are pretty and comfortable, they are very dated and getting close to looking very tired. One afternoon, after working out in the fitness center, I returned to my room, only to find that we had no water at all. Once the water came back on, it was brown until the rust was flushed out. While my TVs (I was in a suite) were HD-ready, the picture was so fuzzy that I hardly every turned the TV on. I realize the enormous cost associated with renovating a hotel like this in NYC, but if they are going to charge the rates they do, they have to re-invest it in the facility. One final thing: there was no room service after breakfast. That's completely unacceptable for a hotel of this stature.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine - just fine.”
Reviews.Author: ChiTown907
Reviews.Content: Several of my colleagues and I stayed here for business since our administrative assistant found an unusually low rate for them through Travelocity. So this review is mostly my impressions, but a few from them as well. The bellhop promptly brought my bag up to my room, he was very kind and courteous. The room was small but clean, and the bed was nice with comfortable pillows and new linens. If you want to use more than outlet at a time, good luck! There was one outlet free in my room, then two more in the bathroom (I charged my laptop in the bathroom in desperation at one point). The closet was relatively small - enough for me but it might have been too small for two people, but there were plenty of hangers, a safe, and an iron and ironing board provided. The draft coming in from under the window was so strong that it blew the curtain and I had to set my thermostat at 80 degrees just to keep the room comfortable because it was FREEZING in there. Another colleague of mine of a different floor had the same problem. And we live in Chicago, we're used to cold weather but we prefer to keep it outdoors. Now, I like old buildings and I appreciate the history of them. But I feel like there is a difference between "old building" and "poor maintenance." I think the hotel is somewhat coasting on their name at this point. They haven't complately let the place go, but they're not exactly holding it to the highest possible standard either. One important thing to note: the walls are paper thin. My room was near a supply closet for the hosuekeeping staff and I could hear everything they did in there, as well as their conversations. One colleague could hear a couple of his floor having very loud, athletic... couple time. He could hear it all the way down the hall coming from the elevator. So if you're a light sleeper, this may not be the place for you. Some male colleagues alerted me to the fact that late at night the lobby was, and I quote, "crawling with professionals." Apparently they were propsitioned multiple times just trying to get to the elevator. The lobby was pretty busy at all times, day and night, probably because it had free WiFi. You have to pay for WiFi in your room unless you're a gold or platinum level HHonors member. $16 per day and it is painfully slow. If you have AT&T for your cell phone note that the 3G signal in the hotel is terrible (not the hotel's fault, obviously, but good to know). My lowly blue level HHonors membership did get me free bottled water out of the minibar, which was nice since as other have noted there was no room service and no vending machines. So definitely let the front desk know if you're a member, and if you're not you should join before you stay there. All in all I'd say the hotel was fine. Not excellent but not bad, and none of us came home with bed bugs. The location is amazing but I don't know that I would spend my own money to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service !”
Reviews.Author: mlpn
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in with Gina at Diamond Reception, we felt pampered throughout our stay. From reception to housekeeping , any small request was cheerfully accommodated. There is a reason we return over and over to this hotel....not only is the location perfect, but we always feel like special guests.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel a bit disappointing - and a theft”
Reviews.Author: NoneNixNada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf Astoria for 5 nights in January 2012 and I have to say that while there were some positives, I was a disappointed with the hotel. First the positives, to be fair. The hotel is centrally located and it is easy to get anywhere in Manhattan. When checking in the staff was extremely helpful and welcoming and the concierge was very helpful on several occasions when we had questions. As a Hilton HHonors gold member we were also placed in a large corner room far away from the elevators and had free internet (membership certainly has it's privileges). The bed was extremely comfortable and there was plenty of closet space, with a standard closet for me and a walk-in closet for my girlfriend (perhaps this was due to it being a corner room). The bathroom was large and everything worked. Now for the negatives. While the Waldorf Astoria certainly has an old world charm, it is also a bit tired and in need of some updating. The elevators had some issues while we were there and it was difficult to get to our room on several occasions. The carpets in the hallways had certainly seen better days. Wallpaper was pealing in the hallways and it was rather shabby. Also, while the room and bathroom had individual temperature control, they were the type of radiators seen in the 1960s (either too hot or too cold and a bit loud). Again, as a Hilton HHonors gold member I qualify for free breakfast at other Hilton properties, but the "breakfast" at the Waldorf was supplied by the Starbucks downstairs and consisted of a coffee, a pastry, and a juice box. Now I realize I'm complaining about something that is given to me for free (poor me), but when other Hilton properties supply a relaxed breakfast in a restaurant setting, standing in line with 30 other people in a tiny Starbucks seems a bit chintzy. Also, there are no coffee or tea making facilities in the rooms, so you have to either order room service or go to Starbucks for this. I think that the Waldorf Astoria is coasting on its name and reputation, and I was definitely a bit disappointed. Why does it seem that the (supposedly) highest end hotels are the most stingy on the amenities? And finally for the theft. After I had checked out and was on a train to Washington DC I noticed that a beautiful Mont Blanc pen I had in my bag was mysteriously gone. The bag had never left my side during the trip, except when it was in my room. I certainly can not prove that it was stolen while at the Waldorf, but the facts are, 1) the pen was in my bag when I checked in, 2) the bag was only left unattended in my room, and 3) my pen is now gone. Apart from the alleged theft, however, my overall impression of the Waldorf Astoria in New York is that while it is in a great location and has a certain old world charm, the hotel, which is supposed to be one of the best in the Hilton chain, does not live up to this reputation. I think there are definitely better hotels for the money in New York and I would probably not stay at the Waldorf Astoria again unless some major changes are made.

Reviews.Title: “Bill Overcharge”
Reviews.Author: BAC922
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old so when the water went out for a day, you work around it. But they added an $85 room service charge that was not my charge and is totally unauthorized. I called and was told it would be sent to accounting, but didn't hear anything for 2 days. I called back and was put on hold supposedly to find a manager, then was disconnected after 10 minutes. I spoke with customer care at Hilton, the parent company, who appears to be trying to take care of it, but given the lack of response at the hotel, it remains to be seen if they will actually correct the overcharge. I'm probably going to have to complain to AMEX because that will force them to admit they don't have my signature on this charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location and exceptional service.”
Reviews.Author: Frankambler
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay here with my girlfriend. The service was excellent, and the room's were comfortable & clean. Some parts of the hotel do look a bit tired, but there is no escaping the fact that walking through the doors of The Waldorf is a special moment. I proposed to my girlfriend on this visit in Central Park and celebrated with some Waldorf Astoria bubbly in the bar. My girlfriend wanted to keep the bottle as a souvenier which we did, but it was cleared away by the room cleaner. Mentioned it to the desk, as it wasn't put in the bin but in a bag and they replaced it and offered us a free night on our next visit! Only downside to this hotel is seeing a Branded coffee-shop under the lobby, even if it is handy on a winter's morning. It's looks a little out of place alongside all the grandeur of the historic entrance. Overall, this hotel has a great location for all the sights and there is always someone on the door to greet you with a smile when you return. Definately 1st choice hotel for our next stay. Anyone visiting NYC on more than one occasion should make one of their stays' here, if only to say 'I've stayed at The Waldorf'.

Reviews.Title: “Back in Time..”
Reviews.Author: Nova_girlLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel was undergoing external renovations and the front was shrouded in canvas but, what a beautiful surprise when we stepped through the revolving doors. Low season meant the hotel reception was quite quick. We were given some vouchers to the Spa and a couple for cocktails. This was a pleasant surprise. The room was a Superior one with a walk-in closet (which was a very useful feature to tuck away suitcases) and the size of the bathroom was generous. The place was warm with controllable heating which was good for us who like warm but not hot rooms to sleep in. The feeling was one of being enveloped in secure, calm, gentility. We were there for three days only and started relaxing immediately which I think was because of the lovely, homely, antique furniture and lamps that cast a warm glow. The only thing was that no slippers were provided. We did not bother to ask at reception whether this was an oversight but we were concerned about walking barefoot on a carpet where grubby shoes may have been. We also did not have anywhere to put our robe in the bathroom (the hook on the back of the door was broken) and it would have been nice to be able to have a chair in there. However, the showers were strong and the water hot. On a couple of nights we were awoken by people arguing in the corridor - a bit annoying. The staff were wonderful and very helpful and courteous. All in all, it was a wonderful experience and definitely to be repeated....

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a stay”
Reviews.Author: eastcoastbb
Reviews.Content: My first time back to the Waldorf in nearly thirty years and it lived up to all I remembered. It is a gem of architecture, worth walking around to notice all of the beautiful touches - light fixtures, railings, carved elevator doors - everywhere you look there is a detail of beautiful history. Modernizing and maintaining such a historic place must be a challenge, but they seem to do it very well. Yes, there may be a few compromises, but the old world beauty is far worth it. In addition, the staff was very kind and caring. I became ill my last day there and they arranged for late checkout and other amenities that helped me feel better. It was a gem of a stay indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Living in the lap of luxury”
Reviews.Author: b0bbestultz
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf in NYC is such a beautiful old hotel. But completely renovated and updated. It is a real treat to stay there -- you really feel like you are in the lap of luxury. Plus it is wonderful to view the history of the hotel from photos on the walls and historical displays in the lobby. The bars are fun at night and the location is great for restaurants, theatres and museums.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm with every convenience”
Reviews.Author: Geronimojo
Reviews.Content: Dont go expecting ultra modern, but do expect quality. I have now tried too many NYC hotels to recall on both business and pleasure and now wouldn't stay anywhere else when spending my own money. Four Seasons, Essex and Mandarin Oriental have it for flash but the Waldorf has it for price, bags of charm, warm personality and beautiful public rooms. Cole Porters piano is in the lobby, the rooms are bigger than your standard NY fare and if you like climbing up on to your bed, brocade chintz and a proper sized bathroom, this is the place. The concierge is often busy and justifyably so, they do get you tickets at the right price and the advise comes for free. Trendy its not, but this is as clean, classy and sassy as old school gets! Right in the heart of Manhattan, handy for shopping, theatre and the Bull & Bear downstairs IS the best steak in town.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Adventure T
Reviews.Content: Spent a Friday night in the city. Booked a room using hotel points. The check-in process took a long time (about 15 minutes), but we were given drink and breakfast vouchers, which was nice. The lobby was beautiful, the rooms were just average (small, as could be expected of an older hotel). The staff was very friendly and abundant. There was just nothing exceptional about this hotel outside of the ornate lobby. I guess I had high expectations. An enjoyable stay none-the-less.

Reviews.Title: “shame”
Reviews.Author: nuthurralt
Reviews.Content: we had a truly unpleasant stay. Nine days in a small noised room without a view for 300 $/day! and with room'wifi only after my strong request after the 4° day! for this price during 9 days it's possible to have a pleasant suite with jacuzzi and kitchinette in all midtown 5 star hotels. Never more!

Reviews.Title: “A fab place, brilliant location and good staff”
Reviews.Author: Thomas T
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located and has brilliant staff. I stayed there for 4 days and they did everything possible to make our stay plesant and well. I highly recommend this to anyone travelling to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “"Don't let the Name fool you"”
Reviews.Author: trustworthy2011
Reviews.Content: I was too excited after reviewing the pictures online and thinking, Wow, this is where they filmed several movies, the Presidents stayed here. First of all let me say if your a Modern Day person, this is totally not the place for you. I arrived thinking that I would be blown away with look of the lobby just from the pictures, boy was I disappointed. The lobby is average and in fact I've seen better especially for $319 a night. I arrived to my room, thinking ok I know the rooms will blow me away, but instead when I arrived at the room, I wanted to run a way and ask for a refund. The bathroom was super small and OLD. I figured I'd make the best of it, that is until I went to take a shower and shut the door and for some reason it got jammed, I'm thinking what the heck, after me jingling it a few times it opened, but I didn't close again (lol). The doors had cracks in it and it looked as if someone had painted over it with some cheap stale looking paint.... After touring the hotel, I found they had some nice cute little shops, but expensive. On Sundays they serve brunch for $95 per person, but who in they right mind would set brunch up in the main lobby where people are continously walking in and out of the hotel and the food is totally exposed and not covered. I couldn't not believe this, but this goes to show you because of the name you can't assume the its Greatness. The Hiltons need some serious upgrades in this hotel, the corridor leader leading toward the room smelled OLD.... Good luck to those who want to stay here, because next time I'm going to try modern day hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Boring - New York has much nicer hotels as the same or less price!”
Reviews.Author: Jonnie27
Reviews.Content: I stayed just one night in this hotel on my first night ever in NYC back in August 2010 This was my first trip to the States so I wanted to spend a night at the historical Waldorf, as it is in all the old movies etc. Upon arrival, I got out of the limo (yes, I got a limo transfer from the airport, I wanted to add to the feel of it!) and was told to get straight back in because there was something wrong with the main door, so we had to enter via some dingy back street entrance. Not quite the grand entrance I was hoping for. Then, had to lug my own bags through to the main check in area which took me a while to find from this dodgy second class citizen side entrance. Checked in... went up to the room. I have to say.. the room... was a bit of a disappointment. Although it was not bad and in a way, was kind of up to 4 star standards, if you took a closer look, it was very dated and in desperate need of an update! The room was also quite small too. Now - to give it a fair chance, I am a bit fussy, and the room wasn't dreadful... but from the pictures ... I had high hopes that were soon crushed!! In my mind I was thinking "thank god I am spending the other 5 nights of my stay here at the New York Palace" (which I might add, was cheaper and MUCH nicer!). The lobby area etc was immaculate of course but I was just more concerned about the room - which is where you spend most of your time anyway. I'm glad I stayed though, so I can say I've been here, but that is all. I won't rush back next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: SeasonsedTraveller
Reviews.Content: Love NYC, love this hotel. We were one floor below the Presidential Suite and had the most fantastic views over Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Luxury”
Reviews.Author: luv2trvlwb
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf was on my "bucket list"... it was everything & more, I had anticipated.... The room was Huge, bed sooo comfy & Ferragamo products in the bath. I always travel with my mini poodle, & from the minute we checked in, until we departed, we were treated like royalty. It was fabulous! Thank you WA! I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Impressions of a 1st time guest”
Reviews.Author: jrleonardfl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at only a handful of 5-Star hotels in my travels; two Fairmont properties and a Ritz Carlton as examples. Admittedly, I am primarily a Hilton / Marriott business traveler. On a recent business trip to NYC however, I found that the hotels I was familiar with were all fully booked. Had Expedia not offered a "head-turning" rate on the Waldorf Astoria, I sincerely doubt I would have ever stayed at this property whether for "business or pleasure." I fully enjoyed this property and the relentless pursuit of service demonstrated by their entire staff. My room was both elegant and comfortable. While an older landmark hotel, the bathroom was still spacious with wonderful lighting and I had no trouble establishing a Wi-Fi connection at my stylish desk. Many hotels lay claim to "dream beds" but the standard Waldorf Astoria pillows, sheets and mattress that I experienced were perfect in every way. While the check-in was quick and efficient and bell captain storage of my luggage for several hours was appreciated, it is the assistance of Graham at the Concierge desk that I will detail. I've always stayed in the Broadway area and had no knowledge of Park Ave area restaurants for a business dinner that would not wreak havoc on the per diem. After some thought, Graham reccommended the Benjamin Steak house and it was frankly terrific. A short stroll away that I can heartily endorse. (I haven't verified this but apparently an individual from the famous Peter Luger establishment is involved in the Benjamin Steakhouse and it shows) I am glad that I was able to experience the Waldorf Astoria on a first-hand basis as a guest. I'm also pleased to report that somehow this hotel managed to over-exceed even my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Hark back to years gone by and be treated like a silver screen star.”
Reviews.Author: Jill M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly a historical New York landmark with its opulent and grand decor, its famously ornate chiming clock where many a rendez-vous takes place and most significantly it's attentive and capable staff. They are numerous due to the vast size of the hotel but work harmoniously within their fields to ensure an efficient and dedicated level of service is acheived. The Diamond desk ladies are wonderful and Mary Macias in particular always ensures we have a warm and genuine smile to greet us and provides more than we need for our stay. F & B Manager, Jeff Krauthamer is a stellar part of the team and goes above and beyond for us and other guests using his extensive knowledge of the Hotelier industry and his can-do attitude to always deliver more than expected. Thank you to all at the Waldorf, we are regular guests for a reason and consider this our home from home.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Treatment of HHonour Guests/Shabby Rooms”
Reviews.Author: gingerCanada
Reviews.Content: How did this Astoria come to be so far below the standards of other Astoria's and Hilton's? The lobby is fine but beyond that the rooms are shabby with worn carpeting, fixtures and dated bathrooms. Service for HHonours is insulting and the expected standard amenities of a lounge does not exist for it's members. Check in was dismal. There was only one person checking in HHonour members and as they were occupied we went to the front desk. The attendant took 20 minutes to complete check in, slowly writing out vouchers, staring at the computer screen for long periods of time, all for a confirmed booking and simple check in. At this point we were told there was no executive lounge, even for Diamond members for breakfast and drinks. We were given vouchers for two drinks at the bar and another voucher for a coffee and muffin at the lobby Starbucks for breakfast. Are you kidding? I don't have a problem with Starbucks, and a voucher for a complementary coffee would have been a nice touch and would have made HHonour members feel like valued guests. However, this is no replacement for an executive lounge or a free breakfast at the restaurant which is offered at other Hilton's and Astoria's. The next morning we went to Starbucks and found a line up of 15 people, this line occurred each morning throughout our stay. I asked the HHonours desk if they really expected their members to stand in line for 20 minutes or more for a coffee. She replied yes. Excellent way to make you welcome. I spoke with the duty manager and he advised that all the people in line were also HHonour members. Now was this supposed to make me feel better? And how did he know this? And if this was the case, does it make it anymore acceptable? Obviously not. In any case where did the Astoria expect it's members to have their free Starbucks coffee and muffin? Apparently in the lobby, which was full of guests occupying chairs, munching away on muffins and sipping Starbucks coffee. Is this really what a five star hotel is about? Having it's guests eat take away from Starbucks in the hotel lobby? I've also attached a photo of the line up at Starbucks one morning, with several people behind me also waiting to place their order. Other staff at the hotel were pleasant, courteous and friendly. All would say hello and smile. Perhaps management, HHonour check in staff and the front desk could take some pointers from the chamber maids and bell hops on how to welcome it's guest properly and provide it's HHonour members with the respect and amenities that is expected throughout the Hilton/Astoria chain. As

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Molez1978
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend stayed for five days, a 30th Birthday present for her! The Hotel is amazing, you really feel as if you are in the movies walking through the reception area, staff are very friendly and welcoming. We were on the 17th floor, room was large if a little dated but I suppose that's what you expect from this fine hotel. One negative would be there are no tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms and not even a bottle of water to be had!! Apart from that we had an amazing stay and would recommend this hotel to all looking for a memorable time in New York. If you're on a bit of a budget, DON'T eat in the hotel, Sunday brunch is 95 dollars per adult and 65 for a child, madness if you ask me, but as is the nature of New York you can make it as cheap or as expensive as you want.

Reviews.Title: “Art Deco splendour”
Reviews.Author: Tourist1054
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a trip to New York (3 nights) to celebrate my Sisters 50th birthday. We travelled specially from Ireland and met my sister who lives in Canada there. The main thing is the actual building and the history and sense of past that it evokes. The reception area is truly beautiful and we felt like we were part of a movie set - pure 1939's splendour. The breakfasts in bed were gorgeous (but pricy!). The rooms are all different - well the three I saw anyway - which was lovely and really different - antique furniture etc.. If you are looking for the modern room formula you won't get it here - it actually feels like you are a house guest. The only real disappointment was the dining facilities. The main dining room is really just an annex off the reception area and not that great. We went out instead to the St. Regis for my sisters birthday dinner. We got a great deal as we booked so early and it was truly a memorable occasion,

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: rafaul
Reviews.Content: Always wanted to stay at The Waldorf. Everytime in NYC I wandered its lobby and looked upon its clock, its guests, its personnel. We booked Park Av room, a large and very comfortable room. Classic and technologic. We really enjoyded it!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, historic, grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: brunello44
Reviews.Content: Staying here is always more than just a night of lodging; it's an *experience*. Now, it may or may not be the experience that you, in particular, are seeking, but it's certainly an experience. I've stayed here once a year or so for the last 15 years. Some folks say the place has gone downhill. I feel quite the opposite. To my eyes the Waldor=Astoria has gotten consistently better and better at giving us the best of the old, along with the best of the new. This was the first trip for my wife, and she absolutely loved the place. Of course, the common spaces are grand, formal, lovely and inspirational. The dining options are numerous and uniformly excellent. (Please have at least one drink while reclining in Sir Harry's.) And we were given a spacious, corner, two-window room with a king bed and excellent views on the 25th floor. The room was spotless, impeccably appointed and contained every possible modern amenity, including an enormous LCD TV, a well-lighted closet, a comfortable desk, and two large, comfortable, upholstered chairs. OK, so there's only space for one person's toiletries on the pedestal-style sink in the bathroom. It's a minor issue (and our only nit to pick). The shower wonderful -- hot, hot, hot, with a strong, strong spray. And the towels were the best you'll find anywhere - super thick and soft. So go and enjoy it! If you shop around and are flexible, you can get a night here for no more than a cookie-cutter hotel. So why not have an *experience*?!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel spoily by staff taking backhanders.”
Reviews.Author: giftedmidfielder
Reviews.Content: I nearly had the perfect stay at this amazing hotel. Everything about this place is impressive from the public areas, the bars, the food and the room. It's a real shame that our stay was spoilt by greedy staff members prioritising who gets served first by accepting backhanders. I doubt I'll go back because of this despite the otherwise enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to expectations.”
Reviews.Author: FFFins
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Waldorf last weekend. It was fine but I was hoping for so much than that from such an iconic hotel. We stayed at the Plaza a few years ago and loved it. I guess we were hoping for that type of experience. Instead we we let down over and over again. We arrived and walked through the revolving door where a bellman asked if we wanted help with our bags (there are stairs immediately upon entry and no sign telling you how to get to the hard to find elevator) but before we could answer he said he would be right back. After a couple of minutes I just toted them up the staircase myself. We entered the beautiful lobby (really classic) and onto the registration desk where we waited in line like we were in the Post Office. Even though we were early our room was ready and we headed up to a small and unimpressive room that looked like it was due for a makeover. It did have a nice large bathroom but the shower had a slight smell of mildew and almost no water pressure. It was cool so we turned on the heat and discovered we had two options with the ancient looking heater, we could freeze or sweat. On top of these conditions the hotel was hosting a wedding in the lobby that night! We could not even enjoy the lobby and were rerouted into a very crowded and uncomfortable area to try and get one of the slow elevators. We had to wait for twenty minutes. I was amazed that they would inconvience thier guests this way. The dissapointments continued the next morning when we asked the concierge where we could eat breakfast nearby and were sent to a very average cafe. The next mornign we found that we were very near one of the best bagel places in the city and had a much better experience at ess a bagel. Also, would it kill them to put a coffee maker in the room? I will say that we asked for late check out and were given it without hesitation which was very nice and the location of the hotel is fantatstic. In all it wasn't a bad stay just not nearly what we had hoped for.

Reviews.Title: “What a rip off”
Reviews.Author: Rhodyate
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the hotel many times before I am sure this will be my last! they claim to be a four/five star hotelBUT do not deliver the service. No room service apart from breakfast , I could not even get a coffee on a Sunday morning in the lobby! I arrive on Sat evening after a long flight and delayed arrival at Newark having unpacked I just felt like relaxing with a glass of Wine and a light snack in my room I was told that during Jan& Feb they had withdrawn their room service to save money! So I end up going out of the hotel to get a a light meal. On my return I asked for some cold milk to have with my coffee which I could make in the room but dislike cream which was supplied. "I am sorry sir I was told at reception we do not have any staff available to bring that to you! and suggested I should ask the concierge for directions to the nearest 7-11 store!! Remember this is a five star hotel!!! Fortunately a very helpful you lady who had overheard my conversation appeared with a cup of milk ! Incidentally during my conversation with the front desk staff I did ask to see the manager - he refused to see me and I was asked to place a complaint on the system which he would look at later. New York has many excellent hotels and clients should not have to put up with this agorance from what was one of New York 's finest. I agree with past comments it has had it's day - what a shame!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably bad for a renowned hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gemckee
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler who often works evenings, it is important to me to have room service. I sit in my room, watch the news, work, and have dinner. This is also important when I arrive late, as often happens. Imagine my surprise to learn ... With no advance notice to my travel arranger ... That the Waldorf has no lunch or dinner room service in Jan or Feb due to low occupancy. "you can eat in one of our restaurants..." Not if I am working. And not if I arrive after they are closed. In 25 years of traveling this has happened to me once, in Ohio at a cheesy hotel. I would never, never have imagined the Waldorf would care so little about the convenience of business travelers. Who are probably key visitors in Jan and Feb.

Reviews.Title: “Classic and pampering.”
Reviews.Author: Gene M
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night but it was very pleasant...great touches, such as refrigerated water from the tap, just a really nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Depends what you are looking for”
Reviews.Author: homebody12
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here mayber 10-15 times over the years. It has become kind of my default NYC hotel. Love the old NYC hotels. Not many left. If you like that and want a reasonable price, The Waldorf is great. The food is VERY expensive but room rates are pretty good (at least for NYC) It is old and many thing are tired. Don't expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “Pre QM2 treat.”
Reviews.Author: Guerndonkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights as part of a Cunard package for New Years eve in New York and then a QM2 trans-atlantic sailing back to UK. Our airport transfer from JFK to the Waldorf was also part of the package and we duly arrived at NYC on New Years eve. The main entrance and reception area is magnificent. The corridors to the bedroom are large but bare and a bit dated. The bedroom was large and comfortable. The toiletries in the bathroom were a treat amd replaced daily. The Grand Sunday Brunch Buffet was superb with so much choice from breakfast or roast dinner to Lobster, oysters and loads of tempting desserts, all washed down with a glass of chilled Champagne! At a cost of $125 per person with the strong pound against the dollar it was worth every penny. All the staff were so very helpful, nothing was too much trouble. We would definately like to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, classic elegance”
Reviews.Author: ckccan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on and off for some 20+ years. I had a bad experience a few months ago, and the management responded quickly to address my concerns and asked me to let them know when I was returning. Upon arrival, they made sure to personally take me to my upgraded room on the Towers side and there was a small welcome gift from management, and a personally signed card. The room was very formal with furniture reminiscent of my grandparents - but this is the Waldorf Astoria, so it's what I was expecting. IT was very "gilded" and yet still comfortable, and quiet. There was a sizable bathroom, though fairly dated, and the remains of cigarette burns on the side table took a small amount of the elegance away. As a Diamond member, you receive breakfast vouchers for Starbucks, and also two drink vouchers (which are valued up to $20), along with Free internet. The staff (as they always have been) was excellent throughout the stay. This hotel has location going for it, a grand lobby, a crazy Sunday brunch (alas, had to be working), but it's really about the history. For me, I generally prefer more modern but I will always have a soft spot for this property, and I appreciate the management responded to my issue, and ensured I had a much better experience on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: SignCliente
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt that this hotel had much better times in the 60’s, probably during those years it was the most luxurious hotel in town. Whit a noticeably exception of the main lobby, which still inspires sense of an high level hotel ,all the rest is a real disappointment. The whole façade is covered by dirty and dusty construction scaffold, with the result that is not possible to see outside and it is even very difficult to judge the weather conditions due to the dark curtains covering the scaffolds. Service is at the lowest levels I have never experienced in hotels of such category: I was confirmed (even at the check in) in my room was a coffee/tea machine available and when I arrived there wasn’t any, after my remarks, when I was back from dinner I found a machine which was not working. During the days I had to ask repeatedly to bring the used cups and replace with the new one, with no success (despite my 5.0$ daily tip to the maid) and only after daily complaints to the front office cups were removed. Also I asked several times to speak with the ‘manager on duty’,but always had to speak with the same man who was serving customers at the check in. Probably there is no manager at all taking care of customers. Too boring to face responsibilities? Room, despite been large compared to other hotels in NYC, simply need a total renewal: scraped wall paper, rusted taps, old furniture. Also room cleanliness was poor (I checked personally that dust was not removed from the bottom of the TV screen for 4 days). Concierge information was directly proportional to the tip received, most of the time the responsible person answered to questions with a snobbish and arrogant attitude. I believe that at the same price you can find better alternative around. As last note to travellers in NYC (but this is not Hotel’s fault): -Prices normally do not include taxes (which are 4 different types) a real nightmare. -Many restaurant INCLUDE now the item “suggested gratuity” in their bill, so avoid to double tipping . -Remember that taxi have flat fare to airports, when called by hotels tend to ‘round’ this fare.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant classic”
Reviews.Author: Silvernight
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June 2009. I managed to get quite a good deal for my stay here, 199 USD per night before taxes, so I didn't have very high expectations in regard to what type of room I would get (in the basement behind the boiler, was my expectation :)) but on arrival we got a really nice room on the 27th floor with awesome views - lovely! Room was clean and fairly standard as far as space went. Excellent location and a really lovely hotel, it's a classic! Free wifi in the public areas, which we used a lot. Didn't try out the breakfast in the hotel since it was ridiculously expensive. Was scared half to death one night when some sort of alarm (fire alarm perhaps) started howling but shortly after the staff called out that we could disregard that alarm so it must have been some sort of error. But all in all the stay at the Waldorf was really good! :)

Reviews.Title: “If you can do it”
Reviews.Author: Hotabbots
Reviews.Content: This grand Art Deco hotel is a must for anyone coming to New York. The lobby and bars are truly amazing, the details on every surface are astounding and it would be very easy to spend an entire day just discovering this wonderul old lady. The rooms vary greatly, I have now stayed twice and both times were a pleasure but the last time I must admit that once in the room it was a bit like a motel only spotlessly clean. The first time I stayed at the Park Ave side of the building and the room was wonderful. Large living area and a huge bathroom, fantastic. This last time I booked a "pay in advance" special and ended up in a small room which looked onto other rooms in the centre of the back building. The room was quite small but Waldorf clean. The staff everywhere are the best I have encountered in my 35 years of travel. Position, position, position it's hard to get better.
