We love her and hope to return again but will be a bit more selective about where the room is. My only compliant is that Wi Fi is not free to the room. Most hotels have now got over that charging rip off, but Hilton appears to still be slugging it to the customers. At all times of the day and night you will find all the seats in the lobby taken up by people trying to get online as that is the only place in the hotel that has free wi fi.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance personified”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo1119
Reviews.Content: Great stay, lots of history. If you can do it once, then you should. Concierge and staff are wonderful. A bit of a waste for our first trip as we did not stay in the hotel other than sleeping. Get a breakfast deal if you can.

Reviews.Title: “1st Time in NY and Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: Kaley S
Reviews.Content: My partner surprised me for my 40th a trip to NY staying at the world famous Waldorf. My first impressions of the hotel was very good and i was very excited, this didnt last long.The staff in the Peacock bar seemed to look down their noses at us, and were quite short and sharp when seating us, not making us feel welcome. I awoke early on our first morning ( time difference i supposed) and when i read that the hotel had 24hr room service i thought i would treat myslef to a pot of tea. Who would think that a top Hotel in one of the worlds best cities, could not / would not even provided a pot of tea for it's guest.Our room was comfortable, but old fashioned with wall paper coming of in the bathroom. However we did not let this spoil our stay and NY and my whole surprise was great, just wouldnt visit the Waldorf again, it seemed that if the staff didnt think you were loaded then they didnt have much time for you.

Reviews.Title: “A tick in the box, but not worthy of superlatives”
Reviews.Author: PiersSurrey
Reviews.Content: Forgive me for being disparaging about something which I know is an American institution, but the historical importance of the WA aside, it really is capable of being described as shockingly overrated. I think most people have articulated similar thoughts far better than I can, so I'll say the following... Dates: 10/01/12 & 11/01/12 Rate Type: ADVANCE PURCHASE / Rate per night: 229.00 USD / Total for Stay per Room: Rate 458.00 USD / Taxes 74.56 USD / Total 532.56 USD / Total for Stay: 532.56 USD The staff courtesy levels varied from poor to ok, but never quite reaching what I'd call 'good' much less 'excellent', considering it's a 4-5* (depending on where you look). If you're hoping to get treated individually, reset your expectations in advance and you'll be ok. You're one (or a group) amongst thousands and you'll be treated as such. We were fortunate enough to be Hilton H Gold VIP or whatever the term is, so we received: - complimentary room upgrade (can't compare to the level below, but I saw no evidence of anything warranting an 'upgraded room' tag) - 4 complimentary drinks vouchers worth $20 each, and - a 30% off voucher for the onsite Guerlain Spa for treatments over 50 mins (massages, basically). By the way - these are also available in the Guerlain shop simply by asking for one, if you plan on using the spa. Since I had pre-advised by e-mail that were also celebrating our engagement, we received 2 additional cocktail vouchers and frankly, that was a generous gift on the basis that the hotel has no obligation to offer anyone anything for free...so for that we were grateful. But here are the reasons I take issue with Waldorf=Astoria [sic]. 1) The check-in really is shoddy for a 5* hotel. It's chaotic and understaffed for an hotel of this size 2) The room temperatures are set at 23c/73f throughout the entire hotel and cannot be adjusted from your in-room controls (why install a redundant temperature control gauge in there then, you ask?). After the first night sweltering in our room I went to reception the next day and was advised that the hotel 'climate' is controlled centrally. I asked how to reduce it and was advised that I could "open the window". Hmmm...first 5* query goes off in my head. So there's your choice: 23c/73f (our house is usually set at 20c/68f), or whatever melange you get by opening the window and combining 23c with outside air temp at the time. On this point I'd also mention that as a consequence during the night, we were both gasping for water and in the absence of anything else, I threw caution to the wind and cracked open 2 bottles of water from the MiniBar (schoolboy error, I know). When they subsequently applied a $20+tax per 300ml bottle charge to my bill, I took exception and brought it back to the reception desk. I'd have paid a 'reasonable' charge, but under the circumstances I felt aggrieved. What really made me laugh out loud was when the guy at the front desk looked indignant and explained to me that I had chosen their "Premier" water. I nodded knowingly (in that condescending way that apparently only Brits can do), as if I'd suddenly understood his explanation, and that $76/litre of water ($347/gallon) was remarkably good value! Then I told him to remove it and stop wasting both our time. He did, but looked very hurt. 3) Without the vouchers we were fortunate to have received, you're looking at $18-24 + tax + tip per drink, which explains why the majority of people in the bars are corporate suits on an expense budget. Again I am conscious that being the W=A [sic], they feel justified in sifting out undesirables at the bar by having high bar prices, but it's as well to be forewarned. It's an ok hotel, it really is. And if you've never seen art deco hotels like The Savoy, or you live out of the city/state/country and have always loved the images of Marilyn Munroe and JFK staying here in the 60s, then it's probably worth the tick in the box. But if you've got a budget, want real value for money and are happy to just drop in and have a cocktail to take your photos, I'd suggest that NYC has far better places in which to stay for similar or less money. It's a tourist destination, not one in which I suspect many East Coast Americans would ether stay or would get excited about. Oh - and I didn't mention it to my fiancee when we were there, but there were plenty of telltale signs that the maid had not cleaned the bathroom properly after the previous occupants had left. I leave that to your imagination, but I hate it when that happens and it immediately turns my stomach.. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel could not bear responsibility for there personals”
Reviews.Author: MarinaRevenko
Reviews.Content: We were travelled to New York on January 2012.For our accomodation we've chosen this hotel. The day befor departure we bought in Apple store three iphones.They were new in boxes, when we returned to the hotel we put them to the suitcase,but unfortunatly didn't close it. It was our mistake! When we came back to home we and opened the luggage(it was locked during all flight) we saw that one box is opened and the most expensive iphone is stolen. This small incident spoiled the impression of grate city! Choose for your accomodation more reliable hotel. Marina Revenko

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nittie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf Astoria for a long weekend. It was a wonderful experience! We arrived mid-day on a Sunday and upon check-in were given an upgrade to a suite. Check-in was smooth and efficient, with a helpful staff. There were always several staff members present in the lobby, by the desk, the concierge desk, on the doors, by the elevators, etc. All were professional, helpful and friendly. Our room looked out over the side street, and sadly, the entire facade was encased in sheeting, so our view was somewhat muted; however, in January the sky was drab anyway. Our sutie was quite large, with a king bed, fake fireplace, easy chair and desk. The bathroom was spacious, with marble flooring. A large tv and a fridge gave us all the "comforts" of home. The bed was very comfortable, with fresh linens every day and a nightly turn-down service. Maid service was efficient and un-obtrusive. We did not partake of the Sunday brunch (arrived too late), nor did we take afternoon tea. We did enjoy a delicious breakfast each of the three mornings of our stay. It was pricey, but delicious; honestly, all our meals in NYC were pricey. When one stays in a historic hotel, with an iconic name, a certain amount of ambience is to be expected. We loved seeing the placques and pictures placed through the lobby and hall walls noting former well-known guests and events. But all this would be for nothing if the beds were uncomfortable, the place was dirty or dated. The Waldorf Astoria is a grand old hotel that has managed to retain its historical integrity and integrate it with an up-to-date understanding of modern-day hotel requirements for a discriminating traveler.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok...”
Reviews.Author: Channell55
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on 12/31/11-1/1/12(NYE). I had a room with 2 double beds. The room was very spacious. There was even another room that was kind of like a sitting/dressing room. The hotel, of course is old. So, there were a few things that were ancient. Like the TV in the bathroom. Also, you can't control your heat in your room. The hotel's heating system is based on the weather outside. If the temp drops below a certain degree, the heat kicks on. With that being said they provided us with a space heater. The beds are very comfortable. I would only stay here again if I was with a large group of people. The rate for that night was $542. I would never pay this for this hotel. It was NYE, and this rate was the cheapest in NYC. The location is good. You're in walking distance of everything. Nice lobby. Never got to the rooftop because of a private party. Overall, the hotel is a little too outdated for me.

Reviews.Title: “A must !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lolly028
Reviews.Content: I have just returned after a week at the Waldorf with a friend. I read all the reviews before I went and was a little worried. I have never been so happy in a hotel anywhere. The staff are all first class from front desk to bell boys. We were lucky enough to meet a gentleman called Jimmi who had worked at the Waldorf for over 40 years, He made our holiday, nothing was to much trouble for him, he rang us on our last day to say goodbye. even though it was his day off. You dont get service like that in many places. If you get the chance please stay at the Waldorf Astoria,

Reviews.Title: “A Touch of old fashioned elegance”
Reviews.Author: springergirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 2011 as an anniversary present to ourselves. The booking in process was swift, efficient and friendly. Although when we came down later a queue had formed so it could depend on the time you get there. Our room was nice, not lavish or large but for a city hotel it was a good size. The decor was oldie elegant, which we expected. The room was very clean and the bed very comfortable. We strolled around the hotel and loved the decor especially the lobby with the stunning chandelier. It reminded me of the savoy before its makeover. It is expensive to have a drink in there which didnt really bother us as we like to go out and find some good old New York bars. Staff were friendly in all parts of the hotel and we would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “True elegance, the perfect place for a traditionally special stay”
Reviews.Author: k993257
Reviews.Content: Firstly I will say if you want a swimming pool, 5* facilities and spotless decor and furnishings you are better off with a newer style hotel. However if you are looking for somewhere special, with oodles of charcter and grandeur, art deco class and sophistication then this is the right place for you. Our room which was a king, was much bigger than I expected knowing most NY rooms are tight on space, the bed was ultra luxurious, the furniture was stylish and the marble bathroom was classy. The lobby and other reception areas were grand and it was just what I was looking for for my trip of a lifetime to NYC. Everything was very clean and left luggage service was excellent too. The location is good too, walking - 5 mins from Central park and 10 mins from time square. Charges for internet were a bit steep, especially as wi-fi is free in most hotels these days. There was also some road noise. I would definately stay here again, I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, historical & great location!”
Reviews.Author: Tina G
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria is full of elegance, charm and class. It is located in the heart of New York City. Shops, eateries, restaurants, etc...are easily accessible either by taxi, on foot or the subway trains. On a nice day, you can stroll through the city to Times Square or St. Patrick's Cathedral, which isn't far from the hotel. This stay was during New Year's Eve. Luckily, the weather was wonderful, making it possible to have a comfortable walk to Times Square for the ball drop. There is a Starbucks located within the establishment, which made it convenient for a quick breakfast or snack. There are a couple or so restaurants as well. The breakfast brunch buffet is magnificent, fit for royalty! You can array of exquisitely prepared options. The bar/lounge is lovely for a cozy break before dinner or just to relax. Their chocolate martinis are yummy! The staff at the reception were friendly and helpful, although the bar/lounge staff was a bit indifferent. The room was small (considering it's much older), but was quaint and clean. The bathroom didn't have counter or sink space, except for a little enclave in the wall. You might not be able to put all of your toiletries in there (somewhat frustrating). Although, your provided mini shampoo/conditioner/lotion do include a designer brand (Salvatore Ferragamo). That's luxury for you! The noise from the traffic below can be a problem. The view from this particular room was limited partial city and another building. Not too exciting. If you need to stow away your luggage for a certain period before you check in or after you check out, there is a place in the hotel for it. I believe they normally charge a fee. It was complimentary this time for whatever reason. Check with the hotel first. Do take the time to explore the hotel. It is huge and grand! You will discover plenty of history on the establishment, founder, all the bygone celebrities, dignitaries and royalties.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with geat food spoilt by greedy staff member”
Reviews.Author: terrytTerry
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for a weekend break in Manhattan. The hotel is impressive, by no means the best in NY but a great hotel all the same. Our room was spotless with an extremely comfortable bed, a little on the small side but that's NY for you. We drank in the hotels bars a couple of times and had okay service but the bars had a cosy atmosphere. The Sunday brunch is unmissable. It's worth starving yourself for as I've never seen a buffet like it before or since. Expensive but what a meal. Our experience at teh hotel was marred a little by the man who organises the taxi queue. Were had queued for a good ten minutes when just as we were next in line to get a taxi the hotel employee who was looking after the queue kept bumping people to the front for slipping him a tenner.. Sort of made us leave with a bad taste in our mouths after a very enjoyanle stay.

Reviews.Title: “Been Spoilt”
Reviews.Author: leedslady083
Reviews.Content: By far the nicest hotel we've ever stayed in - its Waldorf Astoria NY, nothing further needs to be said !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: FosWashington Posted by a Virgin Holidays traveler
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. The service we received from staff was excellent on all levels. You have to remember that this is an old hotel and some features are dated, however this only adds to the character. We had a one bedroom suite, very spacious and all beds were very comfortable. Location is great too, within walking distance of Central Park and Times Sq.

Reviews.Title: “Famous Does Not Equal Greatness”
Reviews.Author: Patrick97401
Reviews.Content: I’ll admit it, as a jaded traveler I was actually excited about my 1st stay at the world famous Waldorf-Astoria in NYC. But famous does not equal greatness. At $263 per night (Jan. 2012), it was “reasonably priced” for NYC. The services at the front desk as fantastic (thanks Caroline) and the place has character. As a Diamond VIP I was upgraded to a Jr. Suite and it is the size of an average NY apartment. So what does it lack? Ironically enough, THE hotel that invented room service DOES NOT OFFER room service! I assumed a flagship Hilton in downtown NYC would feature 24-hour room service. No! They do offer some form of limited service during the breakfast hour, but if you think you are getting a pizza & beer to watch the game – think again. And no coffee pot? Really? No room service and no coffee pot? They expect guest to bring their own pot from home of waddle down to Starbucks in their PJ’? I’m stuck here for a week so tomorrow I am going to guy a coffee pot for my room. Maybe I’ll ask the manager to take if off my $1,500 bill when I check out? Also on the downside, the room is cold and drafty and the bed does not live up to the current Hilton standard. I will not stay here again and in fact I am going to look at other Hilton options ASAP. I might move out tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “The Waldorf is the Best”
Reviews.Author: SRTS44
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf is New York City. The best location, the best service, and a real historic NY atmosphere...hard to beat this wonderful place...

Reviews.Title: “Lived upto it's reputation”
Reviews.Author: andrewb113
Reviews.Content: Had a great 5 night stay.booked a basic room and it was comfortable and very well appointed. Made a very special base to explore this great city. Well worth the extra dollars

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Zizza55
Reviews.Content: We spent a night in a suite of the Waldorf Astoria, the famous NY Hotel. The staff was extremely kind and the location amazing, but these are well known facts. After the check in we have been brought to our suite, the door opened and I felt like in a movie, a dream was becoming true! We had a small living room, classically furnished, a very comfortable couch and a plate of snacks waiting for us. At the end of the living room, on the left, there was a white double door. We opened it, and there was the bed: a huge, white, shiny bed! It was so comfortable, that words wouldn't be enough to describe it. From the room, we had access to the bathroom, it looked like the bathroom of Queen Elizabeth (not the I have ever been invited by the Queen, but that's how I imagine her bathroom to be)! There was a shower, an amazing bath tap, soap, towels....everything signed Waldorf Astoria! The point is, in such a famous hotel, this is what you expect to get, but looking into details, I saw the wall paper falling apart (in the bathroom), the shower was quite small and old. Our room had a terrasse, so right after a tour in the suite I jumped out and that's where I have been disappointed the most! The terrasse was huge, at the end of it there were table and chars. They were so old and falling apart, that the idea of taking a sit, couldn't even cross my mind. On the terrasse there were 2 windows which didn't belong to our room. Since curtains were falling apart, we were able to see inside the rooms and we saw all kinds of old, dusty objects which (I assume) used to belong to e hotel and they were just stored there. My point is: this is definitely an impressive hotel, but looking into details. Is not as perfect as I expected it to be. Last, but not least: breakfast was nice, but very simple, I had a much better breakfast in the Sheraton Hotel of Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Iconic”
Reviews.Author: Suemercer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were visiting NYC for the first time as a new year treat to celebrate the completion of my cancer treatment. We wanted somewhere comfortable and central. Our cab from the airport meandered through the traffic and skyscrapers of Manhattan to drop us off at the main entrance to the WA. Unfortunately the hotel is having some exterior works done and our initial view of this iconic building was blurred by the protective coverings. Once through the 5th Avenue revolving doors and up a seemingly small staircase the iconic lobby appeared and we found ourselves surrounded by the opulence and grandeur for which the hotel is known. Checking in was easy as there were no queues and we took our own bags up to our room although we could have opted for a uniformed bell boy. We stayed in a standard (deluxe) Queen room. It was an adequate size for a downtown hotel room with an extremely comfortable bed with excellent pillows and high cotton content bedlinen. There was a huge TV screen facing the bed. Our room faced onto the street (didn't work out which one) and we had a view of the opposite hotel rooms - so kept the blinds down when we had the lights on! The bathroom was a decent size with a bath and shower. The shower took a while to get hot and I had to get my husband to work the handle. This was a bit frustrating as my first impulse on arriving was to jump into the shower but I had to wait for the water to catch up! Once I had it sussed though it was fine. Free wi-fi is available in the lobby and there is a Starbucks on the premises - at the 5th Avenue entrance. This is a premium Starbucks and charges premium prices - even though they had run out of cinnamon. There are several places to eat in the hotel but we didn't check them out as we wanted to get out as much as possible. We didn't use room service - after checking out the prices. I wanted a massage in the Guerlain on site spa but at 180 dollars for 50 minutes I decided against it. We enjoyed our stay in this historic landmark. We stayed there for the ambience but if we visit NY again will probably stay somewhere a little smaller and less iconic. The hotel was quiet when we arrived but became very packed as there was a convention of psychoanalysts on during our stay and this made the lobby a little uncomfortable! On checking out we were charged for an item in the mini bar that we hadn't had but this was soon sorted out. (I had made the mistake of using the mini bar as a fridge to cool my own juice and it had automatically recorded this as a sale). On our second night at the hotel we were woken by loud voices in a nearby room which was disconcerting. My husband mentioned it to the staff the next day and was told that he should have reported it the night before when it was actually occurring.... Staff we encountered were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfl Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: ChristineGrisel
Reviews.Content: Arrived on 30th December (flew from Paris with Open Skies, business class airline, but nothing great to say about them). As the hotel had never answered my email concerning a car to pick us up from the airport, we decided to be adventurous and took the bus from the airport to the centre. Never again! Too much hassle, too much pushing, too many people and much too long. At the hotel, which is so very conveniently located, close to everything, there were no porters or bell boys to help us with our luggage, nobody offered either, so we lugged our suitcases up the many stairs ourselves. Same thing for check out. No offer of help, which I found truly shocking. The lobby was stunning (Christmas time) as was the whole hotel . Okay, a bit dated but that is part of its charm I think as well as the historical links to it. The receptionist was very pleasant and helpful, as they all were everytime I needed to see them. The concierges gave the information needed but it was never ever done in such a nice way as at reception. I felt I was disturbing them. Upon our arrival the lobby seemed like a railway station: So many people, a guide with noisy tourists showing them around the lobby, just noise and people, people and noise. I must have got used to this because it didn’t bother me anymore, I stayed for 5 nights. Anyone and everyone can come into the hotel, which they obviously do. The fact that a public Starbuck’s is actually in the hotel (when you go through the front door on the left) doesn’t make things easier. The buffet breakfast at Oscar’s was just out of this world. Lovely staff and exquisite food. Oscar’s was closed on Monday & Tuesday and we went to the Peacock Alley. No buffet and of course a lot less choice with the a la carte menu. The waiters were not very friendly at the beginning but after the second morning they were nicer . The Sir Harry’s bar was always full in the evening and it was a pain to have to wait for someone to leave. I sent an email to the concierge asking to print out my boarding cards and he said he had never received it because the department involved had never sent in on to him. Anyway, on checking out, we waited for about 40 mins before it could be printed out, due to the internet connection being so slow. There was no practical information given concerning what to do and where to go on 31st December, which was a real shame. We just followed the crowd on the streets in the end. Our final bill had drinks taken from the fridge that we had never touched and other oddities but that was sorted out just fine. All in all a lovely experience, really worth doing, even though our first and last newspaper was delivered to us on the last day!! I do think that a small something special should have been given to each staying guest on 1st January to mark the beginning of the New Year, to keep as a souvenir.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: beentheredonethat97
Reviews.Content: Family of 6, 3 rooms. My family has taken a holiday trip to NYC every year for the last 20 years and we always enjoy the Waldorf. Rooms are recently refurbished with comfortable beds and elegant appointments. If you stay overnight Saturday, you must experience the Brunch at Peacock Alley on Sundays. Exquisite dining awaits at a reasonable $75 per person.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it....”
Reviews.Author: SanAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: I liked the Waldorf....a lot...! My room was excellent and nicely updated. No complaints there. Staff was very polite and courteous. But best of all is the location...you can pretty much walk to an nearby shopping area or Central Park. And of course the fact that one stays in one of New York's historic landmarks. I stayed there a week or so before Christmas and the complete lobby was decorated nicely, showing three large decorated trees. Very nicely done. No overkill, just beautiful. See my picture. Check-in and check-out could be better, as it seemed there was not enough personnel to handle the in- and out-flow of guests.

Reviews.Title: “Timeless Classic”
Reviews.Author: PrefersWindowSeat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose to kick off our honeymoon and spend New Year's Eve and the begining of the New Year at the beautiful Waldorf-Astoria in New York. The first word that comes to mind is classy. The lobby is gorgeous and decorated with red and gold towering Christmas trees. When we arrived, we were given a free upgrade from our standard queen bedroom to a Waldorf Towers room. We had a gorgeous view of the city and could see the fireworks at midnight, albeit over the tops of some buildings. We ordered room service, which was delicious, and thoroughly enjoyed the traditional Sunday brunch on New Year's Day. From the caviar blinis to the smoked salmon, from the french toast and chicken sausage to the waldorf salad, and topped off with a wide variety of pastries and desserts, it was a scrumptious New Year's feast washed down with a mimosa and sparkling water. The service was great, the room was decorated in lovely, rich colors and perfectly clean. It did not feel outdated at all, as some reviews seemed to suggest. It was expensive. That's just a fact. We probably won't be heading back except for another special occasion-- it would have to be pretty special too. But if you can spring for it, it's a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mythical !”
Reviews.Author: Murielle P
Reviews.Content: Such an amazing place! Funny enough, every time we go to NYC, we stay at the Waldorf. Even when we go with our daughters aged 5 and 7. Usually, we like modern luxury hotel, but it is so special to stay at the Waldorf in New York! As soon as you enter the hotel, you feel you are going back in time. The atmosphere is unique. The rooms are very comfortable and spacious, and also very quiet and peaceful. Great location. We love it. Do walk around the lobby to see all the old photos. Only negative point : check-in can take a while as queues can sometimes be long.

Reviews.Title: “Special Trip - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Virginia20170
Reviews.Content: My husuband booked this hotel for my 50th b'day weekend. It is a nice hotel. I agree with a previous review, I think I expected more, the hotel itself was a bit dated. The outside is under renovation with most covered in scaffolding (no noise problems the 2 nights we were there). The lobbies are all very grand, historic and beautiful. The staff was top notch and customer service was very good both check-in and departure. It was conveniently located and we walked everywhere. When visiting NYC again, we most likely would not stay at the Waldorf; I think for the price there are other options we would explore. For wonderful NY bagels, walk down to Ess-a-Bagel ... so good (ask at the front desk, they gave us directions).

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from such a famous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nora S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Waldorf Astoria in order to have the “glamorous New York” experience. But it turned out to be “dated” rather than “glamorous”. The Waldorf has an undeniable historical presence in NYC but for £300 per night I have expected more. The building can be easily recognised from various movies, photographs and TV series. At the time of our stay the front exterior of the building was under renovation which is unfortunate but promising at the same time. Location couldn’t be better: 10 minutes’ walk from Central Park, shops at the doorstep, Grand Central next door and Broadway 10 minutes’ cab ride away. On arrival the bell boys were very helpful and they seemed to be in control but the entrance was full of unattended bags. Given the sheer size of the hotel, 100s of guests are checking in and out on a daily basis and the hotel does not seem to have enough storage space on the ground floor. Once we were seen at the check-in desk we quickly got our keys and the bell boy took our luggage. I had real concerns about this hotel reading the reviews but deep down I really hoped that Waldorf Astoria could prove them all wrong. I was wrong. Our Superior King Room was clean with designer toiletries - as you would expect, Salvatore Ferregamo - but the bathroom was dated and the room was very dark. (It is never a good sign when hotels don’t want you to see the room in bright light!?). On the other hand the size of the room was much bigger than I expected for NYC. As a conclusion, like in every hotel with close to 1,500 rooms you need to be prepared for the service to be impersonal. The location is great, but the guestrooms need some serious re-decoration. Now that I have been once, I will stay next time in a modern boutique hotel, where I could get a much better room for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic”
Reviews.Author: missH2525
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel was very welcoming and helpful. Yes, the hotel is old, but it is beautiful. We had a nice, clean room with a view of the Chrysler building. The location is also great. We would stay here again. It was great for a romantic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pay75
Reviews.Content: As a surprise for our Xmas break, I booked this hotel for the family. My husband has always wanted to go since watching Coming to America and we were not disappointed. The people, the hotel and the food was just want we expected. Also the location meant it was easier to get everywhere. Even the kids loved running up and down the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “What you see is NOT what you get!”
Reviews.Author: HolidayApril
Reviews.Content: All the grandeur is simply a front! We arrived with our 2 children after a long trip from LA, and asked to be accommodated in the new wing of the hotel. Our travel agent had requested this on booking our accomodation, as we had been warned about the old section been outdated and bleak. The very helpful young gentleman at the reception told us there was nothing available until the following day. We also got told there were no interleading rooms, which we had also requested when our booking was made. We decided to be taken up to look at the room, and then make a decision. Well, I was shocked to see what the room actually looked like, let alone the fact tat my 10 and 12 year old were offered the same standard room FOUR doors down the passage. We requested to see a manager, who was on the phone!! After a good 20 minute wait at the reception desk, I insisted that they upgrade us to a suite until the morning. Finally we were told we had a suite in the towers but the children had to sleep on roll out beds! We decided we didn't have too much choice so late in the evening, so accepted their offer. Upon entering the so called suite, we were almost knocked out by billowing cigar smoke that was coming from the room next door! To say our room stank was an understatement! We accepted what it was and made a plan with towels to try and block the worst of the smell from coming through the connecting door in our passage. By this stage it was almost 11pm so we decided to order room service, which set us back $350! The service charges were ridiculous. We had come from the Sofitel in L A which is rated around the same as this hotel. It comes nowhere near it! Not even a free bottle of water in your room, let alone the usual gesture of a chocolate on your pillow! The amount of laundry that could be reduced with the simple 'green' steps of re-using towels, would easily allow for free water and a measly chocolate. We had up to 8 fresh towels daily, even though our towels were hung up! The concierge was extremely unhelpful, and managed to send us to a so called good restaurant, which left one of us with food poisoning! The Sunday brunch was the only good thing, the spread of food was outstanding! Oh but I forgot to say it set us back $400! The icing on the cake for us in this over rated, pompous hotel! You pay for what you get in life, this was simply a rip off! I will definitely not come back, and look forward to experiencing the Sofitel in NY next time, as it is consistent worldwide!

Reviews.Title: “My experience at the Waldorf Astoria”
Reviews.Author: Doneganboys
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in early December 2011. This was a special trip for my 40th Birthday and I had waited ages to go! I was really concerned as I had not read many positive reviews! I have stayed in New York on many occasions but I wanted to do it in style for my 40th so that is why I booked this hotel. So here is my view! If you are concerned, e-mail them ahead of time. I did exactly that to avoid having any issues. We had 3 people sharing a room and I was concerned about room size. We were allocated two spacious rooms to make us more comfortable. when we arrived we did have a problem as one of the rooms had been released to somebody else and I complained. We were then upgraded to a suite in the Waldorf towers which was lovely. this had a sofa bed, very comfortable, which just gave you your own bed and we had two bathrooms. They had also placed champagne in the room too. Now there are not many rooms in many hotels in New York that are really large, unless you pay a lot of money for it. So if you have more than 2 people per room and want to stay at the Waldorf, pay for a suite. The double beds are not like ours at home and you could find it a tight squeeze! Don't rely on getting an upgrade, it doesn't always happen! With regards to the hotel staff, I have to say that apart from one or two I found them to be so very polite and very helpful. You have to remember that this is a huge hotel with hundreds of staff, it's constantly busy and it's human nature to have an off day! We wanted to visit the 911 memorial and did not realise we had to book advance tickets, they did this for us and we didn't miss out. The decor in this hotel does need updating as do many in New York, but I will say this about the Waldorf, it is filled with history, you can feel it just walking around and this trip was my 8th visit, I've never felt that about any other hotel. There are photos on the walls and if you get the chance, just take an hour to look around the hotel itself. I don't think it's the best location but it was worthwhile staying there, even if it was just for the experience! So New York is a great place, to get the best plan ahead. The Park central is a lovely hotel as is the Intercontinetal Barclay. Have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: nolalady60
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our long weekend stay in this NY hotel. Service and accommodation were really good and the entrance foyer decorated for Christmas was spectacular. All staff were very friendly and we found this everywhere we went in New York which surprised us for a city experience. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a good location and a friendly atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Construction on entire Park Avenue view”
Reviews.Author: Philip W
Reviews.Content: Visited New York for the first time in June/July 2011 and enjoyed our stay at the Waldorf so much that we booked at the Waldorf for December 2011/January 2012 in July. Requested Park Ave view again. Arriving at the hotel, we found the entire Park ave side had scaffolding and shade cloth. The construction sounded like a hammer drill all day long. None of this was communicated to me prior to our arrival! We again had two rooms, one for my 16 and 22 year old sons and one for my wife and myself, so double the heart ache due to the Waldorf Astoria spoiling our vocation, Christmas and New Year break!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, grand hotel, staying here helped make our special day perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Linzimc2001
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 28/11/11 until 3/12/11 and got married 1/12/11(on the World yacht). We were allocated a large room on the 9th floor which was perfect! I had my very own dressing room and walk in wardrobe..wot more can a girl want! The champagne in our room on arrival went down very well also. The commonal areas of the hotel are stunning and you can't help but feel special in some way amongst the surroundings. I had some wedding photos taken in the lobby which I'm sure will look very elegant:-) We didn't eat in the restaurants as they were very pricey although we did enjoy some drinks in the bar. The location of the hotel was great! Within walking distance of the Rockefeller centre, Times Square, Grand Central Station and the Empire and many more. There is a subway station adjacent to the Lexington Ave entrance also. Went to Kenneth's salon within in the hotel for my bridal hair and makeup...expensive but well worth it!! All in all this hotel is a special place to visit and helped contribute to an amazing wedding day!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: IainAF
Reviews.Content: We rounded off our whistle-stop tour of New England in New York city. Having stayed in many city centre 4/5 star hotels round the world, I am unable to rate the Waldorf Astoria better than average. The entrance and reception areas are spectacular (see photos); the lifts are very 'olde worlde'; the rooms are very comfortable but nothing special; the sevice is very courteous as one should expect. It certainly was not as tired as some overpriced London, UK, hotels can be. Overall, we had no complaints and have now had "the Waldorf experience".

Reviews.Title: “Glamorous”
Reviews.Author: Perdido
Reviews.Content: It's glamorous and an icon. It's conveniently located. It's old though so don't expect new doors ,new fixtures , etc. It's grand and classy. The mattress was fantastic and I'm picking about mattresses. I have a bad knee and was worried about walking. The only location that would be better would be near the Rockefeller Plaza. But this was do-able.

Reviews.Title: “Lap of Luxury”
Reviews.Author: DebFex7
Reviews.Content: I have never had the privilege of staying at the Waldorf Astoria, as usually it is far out of my price range. However, I lucked into a last minute rate through AAA for a one-night stay on 12/30. I knew to expect opulence and class from suc a storied locale, however I expected I would encounter stuffiness, and was pleasantly surprised that I did not. Everyone was amazingly nice, and I was treated like a valued guest by all I encountered. I was given a complimentary upgrade (I'm assuming) because I was willing to give up the double-double room I reserved, and ended up with a quite large mini suite, the largest hotel room I have seen in NYC so far... had to be 500 SF, and had a small kitchenette area (fridge, sink and cabinets), a full sitting area (full size sofa & 2 overstuffed chairs w/ tables), and a full wrting desk . I had 4 large windows with a nice view of St. Barts and Park Ave. My only "problem" with the hotel would be the cost of food... I'm sure the brunch buffet is wonderful, but $95/person? And $14 (plus service fee, plus tax, plus a $5.25 cover charge)... for HALF a grapefruit delivered via room service? Really?? Ah, well... Starbucks is right off the lobby (and WHAT a lobby-- worth the visit alone!)-- I got a latte, oatmeal w/ fruit & nuts, plus a water & snack for later for a mere $13. I felt $82 richer after that!! Overall, a very positive experience, and I would do it again in a heartbeat if (as Bob Barker would say) the price is right!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but disappointed”
Reviews.Author: roseford1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Waldorf for New Year(I personally love the Art Deco Era) A lovely grand hotel with LOTS of history.Our room was on the 17th floor with no views of the outside(in a way it was good as we could still slightly hear the police/fire/ambulances go by).Check in was pain free,as im a Hilton honors member I mentioned this and was allowed 2 bottles of water from the mini bar and newspapers free. We didnt have the water and got the newspaper on the LAST day.The room was a good size with 2 double beds in(I requested that) the bathroom was an ok size.The only downside was there was no tea/coffee facilities you had to order it or go to the local coffee shop to get your own(not so good 1st thing in the morning).Breakfast was expensive, so were the drinks(pimms/lemonade & southern comfort/lemonade £16 EACH)hence we only had the one.We wanted room service on our last day only to find out that as from the 1st of Jan it stopped and they were only doing BREAKFAST in the room.So I went to reception and was given the room service menu(phew) After we had finished we called reception to get someone to collect the table...It was still in our room the next morning so we pushed it outside only for it to be collected within 5mins. As for New york itself been there seen it did'nt get the t-shirt but wont be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Grand lady, great location but with signs of age”
Reviews.Author: Wereldreiziger987
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf over Christmas for 3 nights. Second time for us at the Waldorf. We love the history of the hotel, the architecture - even as it comes with signs of age. Location is great, not too busy and at the same time not too far away from major points. As Diamond member we got free breakfast at Starbucks as there is no excutive lounge. Not much more, no welcome letter, no Christmas gift, pretty sec. We did get some welcome drink coupons but our 10-ager was not allowd in the bar. We used it during dinner at the Bear & Bull hrestaurant which is a great steak restaurant. As said, you have to like staying at an old, grand hotel with its charm. If you look for consistent quality, state of the art rooms, you better find something else (more boring).

Reviews.Title: “What a Place”
Reviews.Author: Soprano1NewJersey
Reviews.Content: We stayed with the kids and booked connecting rooms. At check in we were up graded to a corner suite. This was the nicest room we ever had. And we've had some fine rooms. This was like an apartment. The service was stellar. The place is the finest hotel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “A piece of elegance”
Reviews.Author: kegan5
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel after our 7 hour flight from London through garage entrance located on the lower ground where we were kindly greeted by the hotel porters. Our bags were immediately given tags and placed on a trolley to be brought up by the porter. We made our way upstairs to reception (without the inconvenience of heavy luggage). We were greeted by a friendly receptionist who pulled up our details within seconds, a quick swipe of my card and we had our room keys in hand. The lobby area is full of beautiful decor, if you make your way around the the gift shop there are wonderful artefacts dating way back, including a large hand written bill for a party that happened at The Waldorf back in 1935 (don't hold me to that date I had to rack my brain but you'll see it in the cabinet if your ever near The Waldorf you should go check these things out). We were staying on the 23rd floor, the lifts require a key to operate between the hours of 6pm and 6am, despite being near the top floor the lifts are fast often causing our (family of 4) ears to pop. Our room was a twin double room, with as stated two double beds in my opinion the beds were quite small, we ( 4 adults) were fine in the room but the beds could have done with a little more width. The room had a desk, wired and wireless internet, a large tv with a selection of 25 channels, you can also select a movie (for a fee) from the list through the tv menu, a lot of the films were still in the cinema too. The room also had a mini bar, stocked up with plenty of drinks and snacks...although it's rarely needed given the amount of deli's and various other food stores near the hotel. The bathroom was very clean with a lovely beige tone and beige granite worktops, the shower was inside the bath making it perfect for both those who prefer a wake up shower or those who enjoy a long soak in the bath. The rooms are serviced once a day and were always lovely and clean when we came back from a day out in NYC... this is probably more of a compliment to the house keeping staff than I could ever write in words, our room was full to the brim with bags of shopping, bags of empty boxes, empty drinks... 4 females in a room meant copious amounts of hair brushes, straighteners, make up, perfume... so to come back to a room that looked fresh and clean without the house keeping staff actually really touching our stuff was wonderful and perhaps would require a magic wand for someone like me to achieve the same :p. The Park Avenue entrance is beautifully decorated (we went for the New Year) with Christmas decor, large Christmas tree's placed around the famous piano Cole Porter would play and wonderful garlands place above each archway leading to various areas of the hotel. As for local amenities, the hotel is fabulous, it's situated between 49th and 50th on Park Avenue and Lexington Avenue. It's a short walk to Times Square perhaps 10 minutes, and there are plenty of other shops on the way like Saks, Radio City is also a short walk too. We didn't dine in the Waldorf this time round but on previous visits we have dined in the Bull and Bear, Oscars and have also been privileged enough to enjoy the buffet offered at the hotel which was absolutely beautiful (we ate in the hotel back in 2009/2010 over New Year). Overall the hotel is a perfect piece of luxury, and whilst NYC may be full of people rushing everywhere to get to where they need, you can rest assure you will always come back to a clean, friendly and welcoming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “VERY Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MeresMom3
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at The Waldorf between Christmas and New Year's Eve. We had two rooms - a suite and a room with two double beds next door. There were three of us in the suite and four teenage girls in the double room. The rooms were very pretty (our suite was huge), but it was all downhill from there. We had to wait an hour past check-in time for our suite (the hotel gave us free coffee/drink coupons and brunch the next morning). our sink clogged during the first night and the toilet became clogged on the second. When we called the front desk at 9 AM, it took 45 minutes for maintenance to arrive. I will say that the domestic and maintenance staff were fantastic - friendly, helpful. The problem was the management. When my husband complained about the toilet, the manager said "We already gave you breakfast yesterday, so we can only give you four this morning." When I complained about the toilet (and the discomfort it caused my 8-year-old), the manager was spectacularly unhelpful and, when I demanded my money back for the night, offered me a free night in the future. Why would I ever stay there again? Eventually he (very grudgingly) did refund that night's charge, but only after informing me that they had already given us the price of the room in meals and that I obviously didn't understand how hotels worked in NYC. Really? Save yourself the aggravation - stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Short of expectations”
Reviews.Author: AgileScottie
Reviews.Content: Spectacular lobby and foyer but downhill from there. Went there with the family between Christmas and New Year a busy time but I was surprised that an elite hotel could not cope with demand. Waited 20 mins in line or the check-in desk and then another 15 to check-in. The room was just average. Service at Peacock Alley was a big disappointment. Waiter was very in-attentive, also overheard wait staff cussing about a customer. Also, amazingly they didn't have root beer for my young son. Went for meal at Bull and Bear, food was great but service very slow, the waiter was pretty much absent although he only seemed to have 3-4 tables, we waited 15 mins before being asked for our drink order. Fortunately Lam the under-waiter who seemed to be carrying the weight of 3 waiters saved the day by taking care of us. The breakfast venue was very ordinary looking however food and service was very good. Finally when we left it took an hour to get our car.

Reviews.Title: “Eloise may have stayed at the Plaza, but Christmas Eve at the Waldorf was a FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: Pharmacyfrau
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Waldorf as part of a pre cruise stay and I was able to use my Hiltons Honors points and get 3, count 'em 3 superior level rooms all together on the same floor no less. The lobby was as beautiful as everyone says it is and the Christmas decorations really put us in the Christmas spirit. The rooms are on the small side but this is an older property. The beds were very comfy and the bathrooms very nicely appointed. The staff was extremely nice and as HH members, we got drink coupons (worth $20 each) and vouchers for Starbucks. I could never afford 3 rooms like this but one at the usual rate would be a nice splurge given the excellent location (walking distance to Radio City, St Pat's etc.) The folks who worked that evening were so nice and stayed past closing just to chat and welcome in Christmas. It was definitely a special visit for us and we will stay there again if we go to NYC for a show. It's a classy old dame of a hotel and the fact that Cole Porter's piano is in the lobby just makes it even more special.Can't say enough good things about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: teaspoon96
Reviews.Content: I've never stayed anywhere that has had as many problems as this. The lobby is beautiful with its gold trimming but waiter in lobby restaurant got one of our orders wrong. They tried to keep as many old features in the room, such as original (painted) wood doors but we had electrical and plumbing issues; a fuse blew out, the shower drain was clogged, the safe broke. And my six-year old's shoe lace got stuck in the escalator (scary!). Checking in took a long time too but it was three days before Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “10 days at the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: neilmac1971
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from 10 days at the Waldorf Astoria. I had a Queen Deluxe room on the 14th floor which was adequate for just me as a solo traveller. The room was cosy, very comfortable bed, decadent marble bathroom but the other furnishings in the room and decor were rather dated and tired. Although on the 14th floor, the noise from the street below rarely bothered me, but even that far up you can still be easily woken by police and fire vehicles sounding their horns! The lobby and reception areas of the hotel are second to none, exquisite and beautiful. They are exceptionally well maintained throughout the day too. There is a Starbucks conveniently located on the ground level on the Park Avenue entrance side of the hotel too which I regularly used. Although due to the excellent location of the hotel there are many other places within easy reach to go and eat. The room was cleaned daily and the maid staff were all very friendly. I had room service one night (the last night) just a sandwich and some cheesecake, this came to $57 which was ridiculously expensive but there had been both a 15% service charge applied plus delivery charge as well. It is difficult to fault the hotel and would happily stay there again but perhaps in a different style room.

Reviews.Title: “A bitter taste in my mouth”
Reviews.Author: travelingnurse07
Reviews.Content: I was excited to be staying at the Waldorf over the Christmas holidays, however, the stay did not meet my expectations. Let me say that the hotel lobby was beautiful, the meal at the Bull and Bear was amazing, but that's the end of my accolades. I realize that this is an old hotel and therefore keep that in mind. But, they also charge upwards of $500 per night and they need more than just the name to continue to do so. The heating unit in my room (we stayed in the Towers) sounded like a train. We were awaken in the morning at 7am by a very odd and persistent maintenance man who wanted to change a light bulb. He became upset when I told him to return later. And, just an hour later he returned to again persistently try to change this light bulb and did not like the fact that I told him to just change it that afternoon after our check out. Very bizarre. We also were treated poorly by the lobby bartenders who made it seem as if they were doing us a favor when we ordered Irish Coffees. We later had to listen to them argue with the wait-staff and then make fun of and curse at patrons at the other end of the bar. I called the day after my return home and was told by the manager they would investigate our concerns and get back to us, many days later, sadly they have not complied. I'm disappointed that a hotel of this caliber would not at least send an apology letter. I certainly would not recommend this hotel. It seems to me that they obtain their guests based on name alone and do not provide the service in order to keep them.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: DRJPH1
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf was obviously a premier hotel in its time but it is now looking quite tired and is undergoing renovations. The renovations are a major disincentive to staying here at present but hopefully will be worth it once done. The rooms are small for the price, the carpet is old and dirty and the fittings are very old (probably original) and often broken. The water was turned off for repairs from 11pm to 6am on the first night we stayed. On the positive side the lobby is breathtakingly beautifully and the Sunday morning hotel restaraunt brunch is outstandingly decandent (but you'll pay for it).

Reviews.Title: “Still an excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PTD
Reviews.Content: 4th visit to this Hotel over the years, and still a pleasure to stop here. Good location and facilities. Will return!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: aSheikh1
Reviews.Content: Despite it's status as being one of the most beautiful and luxurious hotels in New York, the time I experienced in this hotel was quite the opposite. I was on a family holiday and had a standard room with two large beds. The room was filthy, with the vast majority of amenities needing badly replaced. The staff at the hotel was quite nice, as far as most staff in New York go. The lobby is nice with free wifi which is one of the main positive attributes the hotel has. Overall, it was a very disappointing stay at the hotel especially with the price you pay to stay here. Would not recommend this hotel for a New York trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good comfort, Great Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ericoa1
Reviews.Content: The rooms are decent, but the quality of service is excellent. Located close to shopping and restaurants. A 10 minute walk to Times Square or Rockefeller Center.

Reviews.Title: “Art deco elegance with great service.”
Reviews.Author: travelight125
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in November with my daughter and it was amazing. It's worth it just to sit in the lobby and people-watch. Nobody rushes you. The staff are extremely professional and seem to know instinctively when you need them. The doorman who got a line of people cabs on our day of departure sure knew how to handle the N.Y. cab drivers, most of whom were very reluctant to go near J.F.K. The food was very pricey though,especially in The Bull and Bear restaurant, although it was perfect. We had breakfast in the hotel on our last morning and it cost 100$ for two people. There is a Starbucks in situ though and plenty of places nearby for a cheaper meal. Our room was comfy and clean My daughter thought it rather old-fashioned but I found it charming. We had two double beds and very comfortable they were too. We had a slight problem with one of the windows and rang reception. Within minutes two men appeared and the problem was sorted. The location is great too. All in all it was a haven to return to each evening after a busy day's sightseeeing and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrMrsHill
Reviews.Content: We went to New York for the first time over Easter 2011 and stayed at the Waldorf Hotel. What an amazing hotel. From the moment we arrived until the moment we left the service was impeccable and we were treated like royalty. Our room was on the floor below the tower and we had spectacular views of the city. Room service was excellent and we also had a two meals at the Bull and Bear Restaurant which was very good. We are already planning our next trip to New York and the Waldorf!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable way to start our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: roxcochrane
Reviews.Content: After travelling for 30 hours, we were extremely happy to check into the Waldorf. I booked a 2 night stay as a surprise for my new husband. Check-in went smoothly and within no time we were unpacking in our suite. Within a couple of hours a complimentary bottle of sparkling was delivered with a custom made letter from the shift manager. Lovely and unforgetable touch. The old world charm of this hotel makes it an iconic gem. However, having seen this hotel in countless films we were both disappointing to find the entire front of the hotel under cover due to renovations. I am also disappointed I wasn't able to get our photograph infront of this gem. Although this wasn't our first time to NYC, this was our first time in the Waldorf. I recommend staying at this hotel as it transport you back to a time when hotels were grand and service was classy.

Reviews.Title: “My Christmas engagement at the Waldorf=Astoria”
Reviews.Author: tracey1983uk
Reviews.Content: My partner and I decided to spend Christmas in New York so we treated ourselves to the Waldorf=Astoria as it’s a famous and iconic hotel. I booked a 4night stay through our Travel Agent (Thomas Cook) and booked a King Deluxe room. I emailed the Waldorf a couple of weeks before our visit to confirm our booking details and the Waldorf responded very quickly to advise that we had a Queen room booked, I queried this with them because I booked a king room with the Travel Agent and the Waldorf responded to my email very quickly again and confirmed they had changed the room to a king deluxe. We were on the 16th Floor. Room 1642 The room is how we expected it as we have read previous reviews on trip advisor. Yes it’s a tad dated but it is an old/iconic hotel. The bed was SOOOOOOOO comfortable and the bathrobes and bath towels were very fluffy and soft. We had a nice view from our room The staff are VERY friendly. My partner proposed to me on Christmas eve (YaY) and he had contacted the concierge to arrange champagne and rose petals to be in the room that evening. My partner said they were very helpful with contacting the florists etc. The following night (Christmas day) we returned to the room to find a complimentary bottle of champagne with strawberries and chocolates courtesy of the Waldorf as a congratulations. There is a starbucks in the hotel, the queue for a coffee in the mornings were very long. Apparently we were the 1st couple to say ‘Happy Christmas’ to the starbucks staff on Christmas day. That’s quite sad isn’t it. The location is awesome!!!! We were able to comfortably walk to the big attractions such as Times Square, the Rockefeller, Grand Central Station and Broadway Again I must express how helpful the staff were and made this a very pleasant stay. Photos attached

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SKSAL
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here for our anniversary trip to NYC. The hotel is an old building with what some might describe as dated decor, however, this just adds to the charm. We upgraded to a suite (500R) and we were really pleased with the accommodation. High ceilings, loads of space, yet modern plasma TV in both the bedroom and sitting room, although we hardly watched TV as there is so much to do in NYC. What sets the hotel apart though is the service, especially the breakfast team, who can't do enough for you and are always around to top up water, orange, coffee etc. The location is brilliant as well, only a couple of blocks from 5th Avenue and there are copious restaurants and bars within easy walking distance. Would definitely return to NYC and will probably book the Waldorf again as we really enjoyed the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a visit for the history”
Reviews.Author: Brett044
Reviews.Content: My second visit to the Waldorf Astoria in several years confirmed by initial impression; which is that the hotel is ultimately lacking. The building itself is a wonderful historical landmark and the foyer is a fascinating place to feel the history and just watch the ebb and flow of New York society. However as a place to stay the Waldorf falls short. The rooms have the same historical ambience and are acceptable. It must be hard to deal with the sheer volume of guests however the service, while courteous, lacks any sincerity. On both occasions I have felt that the staff are just too busy to provide the kind of service that most will expect from a hotel of the Waldorf's stature and reputation. Having stayed twice I feel no need to return.

Reviews.Title: “do it once”
Reviews.Author: Ozmumwith12yrold
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf for two nights at the end of our trip after a longer stay in another New York hotel. There is no doubt that it is a beautiful property that is worth a visit, however, there is a constant feeling that the staff are only happy to serve you whilst they wait for someone more "important" to catch their attention. This was not the case in the other (more expensive) New York hotel that we stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Rough start, good finish”
Reviews.Author: tinybabyrobot
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel on points. The day we checked in to the hotel, there was a 'city-mandated' water shut-off from 11 pm to 6 am. We were aware of this, so we came back to the hotel early that evening at 10 pm. I tried to take a shower then but both water faucets ran steaming hot water. I phoned the front desk and they told me someone would come up to check on it. They assured me someone would be there before 11 pm to get it fixed. No one came, so I phoned down around 10:45 and they said they'd phone me back. No one did. 11:30 came around and of course now the water was shut off, so I phoned to tell them to complain and tell them not to bother phone me any more (not that they were going to anyway). They did give me $50 credit on the room account, which we used at their restaurant for lunch the next day. I spoke to a manager that day and just told him to comp the meal (which was a tad more than $50). He was very apologetic and of course I understand that they had no control over the water shut off. The point was - if you're going to tell me you're going to do something - do it. So... after that rant, I'd still like to say that the hotel itself is amazingly grand. The lobby, rooms, and well... everything about the place gives a sense of old-fashioned charm. It does, of course, still have the creature comforts that people demand nowadays, while retaining that old-world feel. Very very nice. If it weren't for the phone-tag fiasco, I would have rated this hotel higher, but because of it, I can't justify giving it more than 3/5.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: CaptGreeny
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Waldorf is one of those things many people do to "tick the box" . The hotel however is not just a tourist attraction, it does function very well as a top quality hotel, despite it's high reputation. The rooms are well, presented , appointed and more importantly well serviced. The service is what sets hotels apart, and the Waldorf doesn't disappoint in this regard. Our needs were all well catered for , and nothing was left wanting. Obviously the higher the room grade the better the furnishings and outlook, but all rooms are fine. Special mention to the Concierge service who were able to provide us with the desired show tickets and give us some good tips on around town. Overall, a nice experience, and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “High Expectations Fell a Bit Short”
Reviews.Author: JetsForFunJourneys
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to finally be able to stay at the famous Waldorf. With reservation made, It was noce to receive a pre-arrival email message. However once there, I did not feel that I received a level of service that I would expect at a 5* hotel. Within my first 10 seconds of arrival, I was yelled at by a bellman who told me that we had to drive around the corner to check-in. I exclaimed that I did not have any luggage (I knew that I could enter via Park Ave w/o luggage). After walking in, all of the HHonors checkins were closed so I went to the front desk. The gentleman there was nice. I went up to my upgraded superior room. While the room was spacious, there was a lot of "floor area". The view was of some noisy exhaust fans from the roof below. The TV has burned out pixels. In the bathroom, there was only warm water the first morning. I never received a newspaper as promised the first morning and the wrong one the second morning (they ask your preference at check-in). Upon checkout I advised the private reception of my concerns for which they asked me to look them up on my return visit so that they could properly prepare for my visit. One word to the wise... there is a dress code at this hotel. No shorts, t-shirts or faded jeans daily until after 6pm. There are a lot of tourists that visit, so expect crowds in the lobby. HHonors Diamond offer: Two of three MyWay items, daily newspaper choice, room upgrade to superior if avail, two free frinks up to $20 and cont breakfast for 2 at Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Great history with decent rooms.”
Reviews.Author: roadabug
Reviews.Content: Waldorf has a beautiful lobby, foyer and restaurant areas. The hotel was very busy and the service was average. The rooms are little dated...I had a broken bed that never got fixed. I called four times, yet none of the staff could fix the issue. I could clearly see that the frame was either damaged or off-track but apparently the staff was unwilling to fix it. The temperature in our room was unbearable, so we had to crack the window in December! We booked this room at a relatively good price but our expectations were not met at such an icon in the hotel industry.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place”
Reviews.Author: Freelanderx
Reviews.Content: We were booked to stay here 9-13 November 2011 and it was amazing. Rooms were very comfortable and clean - as we would expect. The beds have to be the most comfortable we have ever experienced in a hotel. Our room was by the lifts on the 15th floor (not that we heard them) and although we didn't have a view this did not spoil our stay. The service was superb and the food choice for breakfast was unbeliveable. Prices were as expected for a hotel of this calibre although we didn't touch the mini bar as felt this was quite pricey!! Well placed to explore this fabulous city and we were very lucky with the weather. Would we stay here again? - you bet we would!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moochiebpaul
Reviews.Content: My travel agent got me a deal, so I stayed here on a business trip in November. The room was very comfortable, quite, spacious (small suite), great bed, and nice amenities. The service was also outstanding! The only drawback is that the room appeared a little aged and tired . . . but this same drawback can also be viewed as a positive and part of the "yesteryear charm" this hotel exudes. If my travel agent got me a good deal on this hotel again, I would be more than happy to make this my next stay in NYC! Oh yes, the hotel has a great bar!

Reviews.Title: “Like a second home”
Reviews.Author: RuieC54321
Reviews.Content: Had not been as a family for several years to nyc but were lucky to go just before Christmas and stay in our favourite hotel the Waldorf. From the car service at the airport to being reluctantly dropped back again all the staff we encountered over the four days were excellent and our every need provided for. Thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone who loves art-deco style hotels and wants a fantastic lcoation in the centre of nyc. Room service is also great if you want a cosy evening in or a relaxed family one.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel but not wowed by it”
Reviews.Author: earthangel_376
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the WA NYC for 3 nights the weekend prior to Christmas 2011. Of course we've heard legendary things about this hotel and expected to be wowed. I couldn't say that we were. There was nothing wrong with the service we received or the room provided but I didn't feel the staff going an extra mile that I would expect at a 4 diamond hotel. Maybe my expectations are too high or I'm just niave since staying at a hotel like the WA is a rare thing for me. Our room was a standard queen on the 16th floor. Size of the room was adequate for 2 people sharing a bed, not a huge room but I wouldn't say it was tiny either. There was a 42" flatscreen tv in the room with HBO. Bathroom was adequate as well, with Salvatore Ferragamo toiletries. Water pressure was excellent with plently of hot water. I liked the fact that they provided complementary robes. The view from our room wasn't anything to look at though. We also noticed that since our room was located somewhat behind one of the elevator towers, that the sound of the elevators going up & down was definately noticeable. It kind of sounded like a far away subway station, but it didn't keep us awake at night. Since we took advantage of a relative's Hilton points to stay here, and he was a diamond member, we were given vouchers for complementary continental breakfast (med drink, juice & pastry) each day, and 2 vouchers for drinks at the bar of any one of their restaurants. As a diamond member, you also get free internet access in your room, which would normally cost about $15/night. Oh, and we were allowed to take 2 Waldorf brand bottled waters each day from the minibar in the room. So all these perks were nice, but you have to be a diamond member.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at The Waldorf Astoria”
Reviews.Author: Sandy D
Reviews.Content: What better place to spend a Christmas excursion or any time, than at the Waldorf Astoria! My husband and I spent two amazing days at this elegantly historic hotel. We had the opportunity to stay in the Towers and our stay was simply elegant. The staff couldn't do enough to make our stay a most enjoyable event. Our room was beautifully decorated and emaculately groomed. Everyone from Bell Captain to Waitstaff was courteous and always willing to help. Everyone should experience a Waldorf stay! Simply fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Historic, fancy, central, but $$$$”
Reviews.Author: herzog00
Reviews.Content: The hotel overall is ornate and fancy, but if I was paying cash I would never stay here (I stayed on points). I would sooner go for a W Hotel or Westin - I prefer the more modern hotels. And for the price of the hotel, I would expect the rooms to be a bit better maintained. I subtracted one star for the hotel missing these details. Its my first time staying here and when I entered the room, I thought "that's it?" Of course I had high expectations -- its the Waldorf right? This is where rooms can cost $600+ per night. I was there on Saturday and the Sunday brunch looked amazing, though at $99/person, skipped it. Pro's -The location is very central to midtown -Very ornate and beautiful -Salvatore Ferragamo shampoo/conditioner -When I requested more shampoo/conditioner, they were brought right up to the room and someone called immediately after to see if I got everything I asked for. -The bed was *very* comfortable Con's -The rooms are just average, considering which hotel this is -The flat screen TV is a cheap Phillips model (not a big deal, I wasnt there to watch tv) -There were a few spots where the paint was peeling on the ceiling, a rusty patch about half the size of a dollar bill, on the window (I've posted a photo) -The curtain seam was falling apart -2 Bottles of water were supposed to be complimentary but there was only 1 of the "Waldorf" branded bottles in the fridge. A phone call and asking twice still resulted in no water being brought up. I left the hotel for a few hours, came back, and had to call again to finally receive the water.

Reviews.Title: “A Dream of Mine”
Reviews.Author: BelfastAussie
Reviews.Content: My Dream has always been to stay at the Waldorf, only because as a teenager I heard so much about it. The Hotel when we booked it was not that much more than The Milford Plaza were I have stayed on previous occasions if you check all the Hotel search engines and compare the rates You can usually find a great deal. While the Waldorf was lavish in its Piano bar etc , it was too expensive to drink and eat there as a Beer was $20 in the Piano Bar.The rooms were comfortable and pretty big comparing against other New York Hotels were space is at a Premium .We ate away from Times Square and 5th Avenue and Breakfast cost us $3.40 for Bacon egg Roll and Coffee a Hot Dog varied in price depending on the Time of Day and area were You were. Dont take the first price given as until You know they will take You for a fool. also Only eat at Restaurants and Cafes with an "A" or at the worst "B" category as a Tour guide told us any that said pending or waiting classification stay well clear of.also Friends of Ours have just come back from the Big Apple in the last week and People near the Empire State Building are offering Front of Line Pass's for $50 Dollars when if You join the cue it was only a wait of approx 20 Minutes

Reviews.Title: “A must stay at least once in your life”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer R
Reviews.Content: I love the Waldorf! It became a tradition in my family to spend a weekend after New Years when the holiday craziness died down. It was our time to gather as an extended family. Every year we stay at the Waldorf and I am never disappointed. There is so much history to the hotel! The rooms are beautiful and the bathrooms (at least in the rooms I have stayed in) are huge and have a large dressing/vanity area off them. I never hear any noise. I could stay all day relaxing in the hotel but its New York and there's so much to do and people to see. Even if you have the attitude "I'm only sleeping in it" please stay at least once at the Waldorf so you can feel what a true hotel experience should feel like: staff that calls you by name, not having to carry or unpack your bags, bag delivery if you've had a particularly successful shopping day, all the amenities you could ask for and more. And as an added bonus it's right next to Saks and in the heart of everything. I cant wait to be back in Jan!

Reviews.Title: “old fashioned but still very good!”
Reviews.Author: 13hawaii
Reviews.Content: we stayed 4 nights at the waldorf in a minisuite (about 300 euro per night exl, breakfast) the suite was very clean, new furniture, ecxellent kingsize bed, 1 living room extra, 2 marble bathrooms . big flat screen tv's in bedroom & living room. the service was very good and the roomservice 24h was very quick even at midnight when we ordered spagetti bolognese - excellent al dente, very good merlot, and some flowers on the table. well, the waldorf still has the excellent location: you can do a lot on your own feet - the 5th avenue with the famous shops, the central park, the guggenheim museum, the rockefeller center etc etc are pretty close

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Towers lived up to my expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: amandabgraves
Reviews.Content: I read many of the reviews out here after booking the hotel and was not sure what to expect...traveled with a group of 30 women for a business/pleasure trip. I stayed in the Towers room 2621 and loved the decor, double bathrooms, comfy beds - not much of a view but we were not in our room that much. Room service was excellent and very quick even though it is the Holiday Season. The first day we arrived it was unseasonably warm so we opened the windows and enjoyed the breeze and sound of NYC. Even once it got colder we still left the window cracked for fresh air and it helped keep our drinks cold in front of the window! Housekeeping did an excellent job and loved the proximity to The Today Show. Checked out the street vendors at St. Barts - lovely lace scarves along the street. The only complaint was the elevators being very slow - especially the ones located in the private Towers Entrance. Great Gift Shop, too!

Reviews.Title: “It's not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: BruinGirl21478
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria is a glamorous icon from a by-gone era but unfortunately, the renovations haven't been kept up with modern times and the hotel is not what it once was.
