While we were here, we waited in line for 45 minutes to be checked in because there were so many people coming and so few staff members available to help with the process. The lobby is almost devoid of furniture which was very strange and made it feel like it was a waiting room rather than a place to relax and people watch. It also appeared that the WA is making most of its money off of conventions and office parties and that the majority of its guests are HHonors members cashing in points. On our first night we were given a room that screamed 1987 with floral spread and rose chintz curtains, peeling wall paper and stained ceiling tiles in the bathroom and a shower that looked like it had gotten into a fight with a caulking gun. We complained and were moved to a much nicer room for the remainder of the stay. The second room was still a bit outdated but it was spacious and had a separate bathroom and changing room with little art deco mirrored dressing tables. The hotel staff was average but with such a large property I understand the difficulty in providing personalized service. You can tell when you're staying here that this hotel was once grand but partial renovations and cost saving measures have really allowed its grandeur to fade.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly 5 but not quite !”
Reviews.Author: philip l
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a true icon in the city of New York, but the one thing that stopped me giving it top marks was the dreary bathroom.This had definitely seen better days, but ask yourself this How long do you spend in the bathroom when in New York ,precisely not long. Anyway now to the positive side the staff cannot do enough for you they are great the hotel lobby and reception are just magical this time of the year, very very busy but the hotel is just well worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Manhattan at its best”
Reviews.Author: FrostyinNJ
Reviews.Content: After decades of missing NYC at Christmas, we stayed at the Waldorf this past week. We had a king deluxe suite, and was so happy we took the plunge! A bit pricey, but the service, the cleanliness of the suite, friendliness of the staff (housekeepers, bell boys, front desk staff, room service attendants) was by far, outstanding. The Lobby decor really put you in a festive mood! From the cheese, crackers and *waldorf* champagne, to the eggs benedict the next day delivered promptly to our room, was extremely enjoyable. I would definately recommend the Waldorf Astoria to anyone visiting the city, especially during the Holidays. Once again this is Manhattan at its best!

Reviews.Title: “This was an amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: SleepWhenWeRDead
Reviews.Content: I feel very blessed to have been able to stay at this amazing hotel! The staff was so wonderful...make sure you stop into the lobby bar! ALL of the bartenders were top notch! We're keeping it in mind when we're in the city but don't want to fight the crowds at a another club/bar! We're going to the Waldorf!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for the name - left slightly let down”
Reviews.Author: Pinbal
Reviews.Content: Being somewhat "in the industry" it was a childhood dream to stay at this Iconic establishment; entering into the lobby initially truly lived up to everything..... but then hit with the smell of bacon and carvery was a strange touch. To have the sunday brunch, however signature, in the main lobby area when people are checking in after long overnight flights, strikes me as a very strange idea. As someone who does not eat bacon at all, the smell is not an appealling one and even though its been 2 weeks since staying there this is still my first impression as I walked in. Charming check in (DAN on front desk - GORGEOUS!) somewhat made up for it, room not ready (fair enough) so the free wifi in the lobby was appreciated - astronomical fees in the room definitely not! Aahh the room - what an utter let down! Huge space but such a musty, old, haggered feeling, almost depressing. Such a shame that waited two nights to ask to move as the next room...... well isn't it amazing what new carpest and a lick of paint can do!!! SO MUCH BETTER!! and I have to say, incredibly comfortable beds (a comment that was made by other guests whilst talking to them too) Overall, I am happy I have had the experience of staying at the Waldorf Astoria but honestly, and very unfortunately, don't feel like I'll be running back in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “Service 1st Rate!”
Reviews.Author: alwaysgreen1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I drove into New York from Maryland for an overnight stay with plans for a broadway show and dinner. We found check in to the Waldorf to be easy and hassle free. From the valet parking to the front desk...the entire staff greeted us and offered assistance. During check in, my husband mentioned that we were celebrating by birthday and the front desk immediately offered us complimentary cocktails in the lobby bar - what a great way to kick off our stay. We found our junior suite to be perfect for us...clean and well done. IF I inspect the room with a magnifying glass, yes...You can see the age of the property...however the historic and classic feel the Waldorf offers is top notch. The hotel even delivered a complimentary bottle of Champaign to further commemorate my birthday - Service, Service, Service...we felt very special...Would return / stay here again in a New York minute (LOL).

Reviews.Title: “Old School Elegance”
Reviews.Author: Penuski
Reviews.Content: It's hard to top the grand hotels of old New York for elegance and style. From the grand lobby and art deco architectural details, the Waldorf is gorgeous... in the lobby. The rooms are a little on the worn side. Not necessarily bad, but not up to the grandeur of the public spaces in the hotel. The service is impreccable. Each person we talked to was polite, friendly, helpful and gracious. Also, I was tempted to steal the pillows because I slept like a log.

Reviews.Title: “Classic accomodations with a sea of navy suits”
Reviews.Author: Msk6261
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf is considered the epitome of classic, old style NY hotels, The rooms are an OK size for the city and the staff is extremely professional but I guess it is just not our style. Room appointments are dated and worn and the atmosphere is on the "stuffy" side. The location is convenient if you have reason to be in midtown. The subway and Grand Central is nearby as well as many corporate headquarters. It was holiday time and the lobby was swarming with dark blue suited patrons. We have stayed here before and probably would not turn it down when hosted for a business conference but when it comes to our dime, we would probably stay in younger, more hip hotel downtown for the $$.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby but tired rooms”
Reviews.Author: BOTBPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf for 3 nights during December 2011. Lobby is beautiful and was lavishly decorated for Christmas. However, our room was in major need of repairs. Very small (which is ok), old bathroom with peeling paint on the ceiling. Old tub with strange shower set-up. Tiles missing behind the sink and covered with vinyl. Only the heat worked and the room was very hot (thankfully the windows open). It seems like there are updated rooms, but for $500 per night, I expected better. Bellman took over an hour to deliver our bags to our room so that was time wasted for us. Probably the biggest issue for me was getting our bill at the end of our stay to find that we were charged about $9 per 12 oz bottle of water that we drank in the room. I accept that hotels mark up these products, but $9 for a 12 oz bottle is insane. Much, much better choices in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Classic, Pricey; Showing Wear”
Reviews.Author: BradBrian
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful and grand hotel with lots of history that deserves its place among the best. Christmas decorations were going up already in the main entrance and very lovely (see photo)Service from maids to bartenders was top-notch(we really liked Tony, the older gentleman who took our bags); the quality of food and beverages (Have Noah the Bartender in the main bar by the lobby make you one of his cocktails. He knows his profession well) was exquisite. However, my one complaint is that for a hotel that was, at least for me, around $800 a night, one would think that wallpaper starting to peel at the seams, and other structural issues : the overhead beam joints on the ceiling were cracking open in several places, the bathroom also had old, ugly, dirty looking phone jack in the wall by the window, a 70's era, dingy looking push button ventilation fan that was duct taped around the seams that was on the wall near the floor by the toilet, and-- I found some weird,ugly, unused base plate for some long-time-ago mystery apparatus was on the wall in the shower. I am sure these all are resulting from years of wear and tear that should have been(and easily could have been) adressed and taken care of---especially with the reputation of this place. I stayed in Room 10A--on 10/23/11 to 10/26/11 in a nice suite with a living room type set-up and a separate bedroom and bathroom adjoining it. The beds were extremely comfortable--quality feather down covers and pillows were a nice touch. The large flat screen TVs in both rooms, decent chairs, and comfy sofa were nice touches . However, due to several little problems like those mentioned above are the reason I am not giving a perfect score. I wanted to get away in comfort to NYC for the Holiday Weekend. I did enjoy my stay and it was indeed comfortable, but, as stated already, I do feel that for the price and reputation of this place, they really should be more attentive to the conditions of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: spence150
Reviews.Content: Love love love this hotel! From the moment we arrived to check in until we left we were made to feel special. Beautifully decorated for Christmas. The rooms are huge...it is in a perfect location...close to Grand Central Terminal, close to shopping, Rockefeller Center and close to the theaters. We were able to walk almost everywhere from there. Only took the subway to go to ground zero and Chinatown. Will stay here again. My only complaint is the bathroom has no counter space and our room looked out over concrete. But the bed is wonderful with great pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: Mageemaria
Reviews.Content: It was such a nice hotel for our first trip to New York. Nice location for shopping, Broadway, sightseeing etc. Room was clean, with a huge tv! A bit disappointed that there wasnt coffee making facility but just a small point. Given vouchers to use starbucks downstairs at breakfast which was good but wow what a queue! It was just at the begining of the holidays and the foyer looked beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “New York is the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: EpicureanFunTraveler
Reviews.Content: There are numerous hotels in Manhatan that speak NYC, but over the years no hotel consistently whispers the decadence of living and travel like the Waldorf. This year we stayed at the Waldorf prior to the Thanksgiving Day parade and enjoyed brunch immediately following the popular holiday festivities. The Waldorf has wonderful suites that capture old world charm with modern conveniences. The moment you're limo or cab pulls up to this property you are spoiled rotten. The lobby is more disjointed with shorter ceilings the newer hotels, but this isn't a negative. The hotel is charming and welcoming with sophistication and class. I know this hotel doesn't do everything right, but I find happiness here on every visit including this one.

Reviews.Title: “super guest service”
Reviews.Author: kim g
Reviews.Content: i am a frequent guest at the waldorf and a diamond level hilton honors member. jackie always tends to every need i have and always with a smile. it is jackie who exeeds my expectations with her knowledge and information. she is a fine, the best example of a superb work ethic and it is one of my main reasons for returning to the new york waldorf. people like her are hard to find....

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre rooms, Great Common areas”
Reviews.Author: dacarrr
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the hotel with a lot of luggage we had to move it ourselves (we did not mind but in hotels of this level you normally have a doorman). The room was not ready so we had to leave the luggage at the concierge. They sent me an SMS when the room became available. The lobby was spectacular and the rest of the common areas were also very nice. My rate did not have breakfast included (which was fine by me) but at +500 USD a night it may be a nice thing to include that kind of service for guests but well... what was really a bad surprise was that we had to pay +15 USD a day for wifi access in the room, Come on! this does not represent an extra cost for the hotel and it is a very important extra for guests. Very disappointing. The room was mediocre, with very BAD and sad decoration, and I am not saying it was classical, I am saying it was bad. The room was large but at least on 1079 when you opened the door you almost had to fight your way in with the pillar against the wall. The amenities in the room were Ferragamo and they were ok (just ok), no slippers, very large TV with VERY grainy image. We checked out and left the luggage at the hotel where they told us that the service was complimentary (if they had made me pay I would have said something nasty). Once we left the room we noticed that we had forgotten a silver bracelet on the floor next to one bed (my partner remembered seeing it there and thought I would see it, which I didn't) and when we cam back for the luggage we asked the concierge only to be told that nothing had been turned in and that housekeeping had already cleaned the room. To sum things up: Good lobby (that I do not use to sleep) Mediocre room No services included in the +500 USD a night Disappearing items (I did not really care, but it was surprising at this hotel level) I would never recommend it, there is much better, much cheaper and much more central

Reviews.Title: “Lovely lobby, need to sharpen up a bit.....”
Reviews.Author: thevonster
Reviews.Content: Hi, I'm a Hilton Honors member and on arrival after a horrendous 1.5 hr immigration queue at JFK we get to the Waldorf - straight to the Hhonors checkin-in - well we would have if it was open. So, after 20 mins we get to the front. We were told there was a problem with our one bed suite (for 4 adults) so we were given 4 drinks vouchers. The problem was apparently a lack of a plug for the bath. No problem. So, we go up in the lifts, and low and behold our cards dont work the lift - so we get out at 8 and walk 2 floors up to 10. Get to the room - 2 bathrobes and 3 towels for the 4 of us. 2 glasses etc. Thought we would order some food, and we would have if they had bothered to bring a menu - we requested this 3 times. As for the room itself - tired is an understatement. Black gaffer tape holding the air con unit into the wall in the bathroom. This is a Waldorf??????? I've stayed in the bottom end Hilton properties and they are much better. Positives - Justin who checked us in was lovely - he sent a bottle of sparkling wine and chocolates to the room as my friend and I were both celebrating our 40ths. That's the Waldorf touches I loved, and the wonderful lobby. Would I stay there again - mmm, probably not, I think for the money I could have stayed somewhere slightly better. ($1000 or £666 per night room only)

Reviews.Title: “November Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Jvmac
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three nights in early November. This was our first time staying outside of Times Square. I absolutely love this hotel. It is so beautiful and majestic. It made me feel like we were taking part in the glamour of the past. The hotel staff were fabulous. They were kind, courteous, helpful and there to meet every need. We attended the Sunday Brunch and all I can say is that whenever I am in NY, I wil make sure to attend the brunch. If you are a "foodie", you must do the Sunday Brunch. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants a beautiful hotel away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square, but close enough to be in Times Square in a matter of minutes.

Reviews.Title: “It's The Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: happyjackman
Reviews.Content: What can I say....it's The Waldorf Astoria! Of course it is amazing! It truly does live up to the hype of its name. I've stayed at The Waldorf several times over the last decade and I've never had a bad experience. The service is wonderful and the hotel is luxurious in every way. And, for New York, the rooms are very spacious. You can't beat the location if you want to be near Grand Central and 5th Avenue. The first time I went to New York, I stayed somewhere else. But, every trip since then, I've been a Waldorf girl (and I always will be)!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tembo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in November. I'd seen a few negative reports so didn't know what to expect but I was very happy with the hotel. Very beautiful and historic - I was disappointed that we weren't going to be there on one of the days that they provide a guided tour combined with lunch. No complaints whatsoever about the room, the cleanliness, the service. We had room service one evening and yes, it was expensive but it was also delicious. We had an extremely comfortable and pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Elegent”
Reviews.Author: abadilife
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf Astoria dozens of times over the last year and always had a pleasent experience. The food is good, the staff is very helpful and the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Living on past glory”
Reviews.Author: sunshinenow66
Reviews.Content: Wonderful building and location but that is all. Rooms dated, tired and dirty. Crying out for a refurb. So much better to be found in NY. Heating was on, and on and on. Impossible to turn off. Maybe some rooms are better than others, no coffee in room either, as some reviewers seem to praise rooms maybe there are different standards. Personally would never stay again until significant upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, grand hotel, staying here helped make our special day perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Linzimc2001
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 28/11/11 until 3/12/11 and got married 1/11/11(on the World yacht). We were allocated a large room on the 9th floor which was perfect! I had my very own dressing room and walk in wardrobe..wot more can a girl want! The champagne in our room on arrival went down very well also. The commonal areas of the hotel are stunning and you can't help but feel special in some way amongst the surroundings. I had some wedding photos taken in the lobby which I'm sure will look very elegant:-) We didn't eat in the restaurants as they were very pricey although we did enjoy some drinks in the bar. The location of the hotel was great! Within walking distance of the Rockefeller centre, Times Square, Grand Central Station and the Empire and many more. There is a subway station adjacent to the Lexington Ave entrance also. Went to Kenneth's salon within in the hotel for my bridal hair and makeup...expensive but well worth it!! All in all this hotel is a special place to visit and helped contribute to an amazing wedding day!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in a truly iconic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AnneH38
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in a superior room with two friends. Service was fantastic from the moment we checked in to leaving the hotel 5 days later, We ordered a rollaway and it was delivered to our room within minutes. It was as a comfy as the beds. The receptionist recommended the tour of the hotel which also included a 3 course meal in Peackock Alley. This was outstanding and the food truly divine. Every moment of our stay was a true pleasure. This was made so special by the friendly and helpful staff. Loved the fact that the hotel did not have a modern make over as you could really enjoy the original surroundings which makes this hotel so special. The location was great and easy to get taxis outside - as hotel staff flagged them down for you. Another wonderful touch.

Reviews.Title: “8 Dollars for a cup of take- out coffee from the Peacock Room”
Reviews.Author: Janet H
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Lovely decor! Friendly and helpful staff. Room was large and very clean. Would highly recommend this hotel. Loved being able to walk to The Plaza, Bergdolfs, Saks, and Rockerfeller Center. HOWEVER, do not order take-out coffee from the Peacock Room. Outrageously expansive!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel......for not so average prices!”
Reviews.Author: big11burd
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with this hotel. Stayed their on our honeymoon, no special treatmeant from the hotel, room was very small and average. The hotel itself is lovely but perhaps in need of a make over! One positive is the location. All in all I wouldn't recommend this hotel and won't be back. Much better value to be found in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Tyler D
Reviews.Content: The rooms are dated and unimpressive and the service is poor. There are many great hotels in NYC. This is no longer one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: 5sun
Reviews.Content: Reserved two "Superior" rooms for 5 nights. Rooms were decorated with historic antique furniture, were very clean/quiet, in excellent condition, and bathrooms were marble. Because the hotel is historic, the rooms are smaller than many of todays more recently built hotels, yet still easily fit our belongings. The bath was VERY small, but in good working condition. The beds were "double", not USA Queen sized, which we knew when we made the reservation. The beds and pillows were some of the most comfortable we have ever experienced. Simply wonderful! Bathroom linens were large sized and luxurious. Maid service was superior. The hotel was lovely and within walking distance to Broadway shows, Times Square, and Rockefeller Center. We would stay at this hotel again. Our only negative experiences were that one luggage man was very rude, and one morning there was not any hot water. However, both situations were quickly corrected. We enjoyed this hotel very much and would certainly stay at it again.

Reviews.Title: “Not so grand - massive let down”
Reviews.Author: kimberley z
Reviews.Content: I have been to New York a number of times and stayed in various hotels however as this was my mother's first trip there she said she would like to experience staying in the Waldorf Astoria as it is meant to be a grand, historic, iconic hotel. Check in took a while but we will forgive them that as it was Thanksgiving weekend. I booked a large superior quad room as it was a girls trip and I wanted us to stay in one room. When we got to our room there was barely enough room to swing a cat let alone have four women stay there. When I asked if this was a superior room they said superior actually meant standard. In the end they moved us to a slightly larger room at a cost of $50 a night. The room was slightly bigger but not much. Both rooms we saw had no luxury qualities about them at all. Very dated and bland decor and very small! We also had to call up housekeeping every day for extra towels as they only gave us one bathrobe and 2 towels a day for 4 people. One night we asked for room service - only 2 coffees and two waters and this took over half an hour. We also couldn't access our mini bar - it was locked. One positive note about this hotel is that the restaurants and bars were good - offering good food and drink. The Bull and Bear was lovely the Peacock Alley good for cocktails and Harry's Bar also good. Unfortunately our last night was spoilt by a very rude barman in Harry's bar. We were standing at the bar having a drink and ordered another round. A table freed up behind us and my mum suggested we sit down. The barman shouted over at me - You ain't going anywhere without paying your cheque'. I explained a) I was staying in the hotel and cashing this to my room b) I hadn't finished my evening yet and wan't ready for my bill. In the end I said I would sign it to my room and he then had the cheek to ask me if I was leaving gratuity! I love NYC but definitely would not spend the money to stay at the Waldorf again.

Reviews.Title: “5 days at the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: j c
Reviews.Content: Day 1- On arrival upgraded by Reception when booking in, with slight prompt. (stayed on 12th floor, corner room) Day 1,2 - no heating. Reception said system too old to cope. Provided a heater. Day 2 - road works all night. Day 3 - erecting scaffolding around hotel until 3.45am Day 4 - had enough. Reception upgraded us to a suite (27th floor). Room adjacent to six goods lifts and one guest lift. too tired to complain. noise not too bad. Day 5 - booking out day; allowed to stay in room until evening (complimentary because of all the issues - normally there is a charge) General - hotel has grand dated features. Scaffolded completely at the front and some to the side of the building. Nicely located for Times Square, Grand Central Station, Rockafeller Centre, Bloomingdales, Central Park and shops. Rooms a bit dated. Shower over the bath (even in suite) with shower curtain. Beds very comfortable, however, would suggest you find a more modern updated hotel. Arriving/departing - Limo has to use side entrance because of luggage (too busy with axis at the front main entrance). Side entrance more like a tradesmans entrance. Not so nice. New York City - fabulous. Flew with Delta - not good. Dial 7 cars good value $51 JFK to hotel. $5 more the other way. (all inclusive except tips) Mad drivers.

Reviews.Title: “Old lady but still with some class”
Reviews.Author: ScotReid
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a 40th birthday gift. Yes there are far better hotels listed on trip advisor but we wanted to see it for ourselves. Although our room was not ready for a 3pm check in when we arrived at our suite we were delighted. Granted its dated and I was surprised some areas were definitely past it's best but I think that's why it's unique. Everyone must stay at this hotel at least once in their life!!! Tips - unless breakfast is included in the rate then I wouldn't pay the extra costs. Starbucks in the lobby is very expensive and remember the front of the hotel is undergoing renovations so scaffolding is up.

Reviews.Title: “"Historic gem in the middle of Manhattan"”
Reviews.Author: Sally L
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Waldorf many times and it is always a wonderful experience. The rooms are spacious with comfortable beds and bedding that you can sink in to after a long day of meetings or shopping. The beautiful marble bathrooms and seperate changing rooms recall bygone days of elegant parties and fancy dresses. The lobby is impeccably maintained. It is a wonder to take in and admire the detailed handiwork. The staff is professional and very accomodating. Given the choice I would not stay anywhere else in New York. It really is an American treasure.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect but very charming”
Reviews.Author: marsabez
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 (two adults and 9 and 12 years old kids) stayed for three nights over Thanksgiving break. We arrived very early (before 11 a.m.) and were given very big room 976 on the corner of Lexington Ave. Check in took less than five minutes, no wait. Hotel shows its age in some parts (closet doors, scuffs in wallpaper, not very strong heat) but very clean throughout. The bathroom was very big and beautiful; all marble. Lobby and elevators have a luxurious feeling. Personnel was polite but not over the top; door men very effective in getting you a cab. But the room service was not without its flaws. We forgot the "don't disturb" sign all day once and even though we requested service in the room at 6:30 p.m. nobody had come once we returned to the room at 10 p.m. But the location cannot be improved. And the hotel has retained its charm throughout the decades. It is not the Four Seasons, but its rates are very reasonable for its location and charm. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “faded old lady”
Reviews.Author: hotdigity
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the waldorf recently,good location ,check-in took awhile ,our rooms not ready for hours. had to walk out to use up time , not recommended after a 7 hour flight and 1 in traffic. Rooms were ok although tired,no tea or coffee making facilities we asked for a kettle but received no milk just sugar ,no coffee & some Tea bags. The foyer bars need a complete refurb ,must have been fantastic in its time but like alot of old girls need a little cut and tuck

Reviews.Title: “The Greatest Hotel In The World- New York”
Reviews.Author: Casablanca_11
Reviews.Content: For Thanksgiving2011 booked a room for $246.My wife,Zemfira, has a friend working in the executive office who after being told of our plans upgraded us to the Waldorf Towers, $1000 a night..It is the bygone era of gracious elegance.The Who's Who in this World have stayed at the Waldorf.Sinatra, Bing Crosby,Princess Grace and Prince RainierDuke and Duchess of Windsor and the list goes on and on. .Peacock Alley Restaurant was situated in the main lobby with a Thanksgiving buffet that would would tempt the King himself. The price was $125.00 per person and worth every penny.Many influential people take up residence in the Waldorf Towers.Our Suite was big enough that you could get lost. The service was impeccable.It doesn't seem like Thanksgiving and Christmas without a trip to New York. We saw the beautiful sights of New York. We plan to make this a tradition each year.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel with incredible history”
Reviews.Author: roxieontheroad
Reviews.Content: The deco architecture and history of this hotel are enough to keep me coming back. Yes, a few of the rooms and suites, even in the private Towers, could use a refresh. And, yes, the cost of a simple breakfast for two can set you back well over $100. Yet the experience is always a bit magical. Who doesn't appreciate a stay in the same hotel that housed many of the top historical and political figures of the 20th and 21st century? And who doesn't appreciate staying in a hotel with lovely paintings and beautiful furniture in many of the suites? Service at the property is exceptional. The management has made it clear to everyone on the staff that customer service does matter. Everyone from the doormen to the housekeeping staff is quick to offer up a warm greeting. The hotel has made some cutbacks that probably help keep the room costs from zooming up. There haven't been coffee makers in the room for a few years now. Honors members who've earned free breakfasts now just get vouchers for Starbucks instead of service at Oscar's. If you're staying in the Towers, service at lounge has also been cut back a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Epoque Grandiose Historic hotel has past its best...”
Reviews.Author: JamieLansdell
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Astoria over the thanksgiving weekend, £650 for 3 nights in a Junior Suite (no breakfast) We were celebrating my girlfriends birthday with a trip to NY, The Junior Suite we stayed in was huge by New York standards, a small kitchenette, large sofa, reasonable bathroom and good size hilton bed. My description of the room decor would be "sparse" and "dated", yes it was a good size, but not the sort of room that you would want to spend prolonged periods. to celebrate my girlfriends birthday i'd emailed ahead to organise champagne and chocolates in the room, i received an emailed response stating the hotel would do this for me on a complimentary basis (fantastic!) but when i got to the hotel the items were not in the room, reception had no record of the request, and it took 3 further calls and an hour of faffing to get a glass of celebratory fizz. hardly the "romantic" start to the weekend i had in mind!!! So, in summary, a good hotel, steeped in history and 1950's glamour, somewhat dilapidated and outdated by today's standards, service levels are 4 star, rooms are 4 star also....the foyer is the only 5 star part of this hotel. I will be staying in a cheaper boutique hotel on my next trip to NYC and will not be back to the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Jane R
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf is a truly beautiful, iconic hotel in a fantastic location. Some of the public rooms were very impressive and worth a look. However our room was very small and lacked any similar signs of elegance or luxury. The staff were very formal and not very welcoming and check in lasted forever and didn't even get offered a complimentary cup of coffee while we waited. Location wise it was great but we didn't feel welcomed and didn't like our very basic room as we had paid a lot of money to stay here for four nights. Didn't like how quick the staff were (doormen who greeted taxis etc) to expect a tip with hands outstretched as soon as we arrived. We always tip and generously but not when staff expect it and then sulk when they do not get it.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, fab city”
Reviews.Author: Laura2910
Reviews.Content: I returned yesterday from a week at the Waldorf and had a great time. I travelled with my sister for a girlie week in the city and couldn't have chosen a better hotel. The previous reviews on this site were making me a little apprehensive about what to expect but everything was perfect. We arrived at the hotel at about 5pm and were checked in immediately with no wait. We didn't upgrade our room and therefore stuck with the standard which was more than what we expected. The room was very spacious with a queen size bed, desk and a bit of a view on to Park Avenue although I can't imagine you get many rooms with a view due to the high rise buildings everywhere. We assumed that the door off the bedroom led to the bathroom but upon entering we found that it was a separate dressing room complete with dresser and large wardrobes and a couple of chairs. This then led to the bathroom which was a decent size and had a nice powerful shower. The bed was very comfy and we slept soundly through the night and was surprised about the little noise you could hear - expected to hear sirens all through the night as you were in a big city but didn't get any of this. The rooms were very clean and the location of the hotel was brilliant. Walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, 5th Avenue (shopping), all the department stores, Empire State Building, Rockerfeller Centre and Grand Central. The only negative was that we could have done with longer in New York - we miss it already and won't hesitate to book into this hotel if we visit again!

Reviews.Title: “A really superb experience”
Reviews.Author: dennis m
Reviews.Content: I used my Hilton Honors points for a visit to NY for Thanksgiving. The building is at 50th and Park. The hotel's interior is stunning. Elegant and totally over the top with decor. Somehow it works very well together. The key take memories are the fantastic service from the front desk to the maids to the doormen. All very polite, charming and knowledgeable. The room was fantastic, the bed was beyond comfortable. I know some people who have reviewed the hotel have complained about noise but we found the room very quiet. Again, if you wanted a perfect hotel room in a perfect mid-town location, I'd recommend the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wendy N
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf for the NY marathon in November. It is a beautiful hotel and the lobby area is amazing. We were given a room near the lifts and it really was the most noisy room we have been in. But after a few sharp words we were very kindly moved to a suite which really was lovely. The next morning there was a letter of apology and a basket of fruit for us, which was a very nice touch. We ate in the restaurant and had one of the best steaks ever, the service was very good too. The bar near the restaurant was brilliant and made us not want to venture very far at all. We met friends for dinner there who did the marathon, and we had the best night, thanks to the very courteous and helpful staff. Would definately recommend, and would stay there ourselves again. It would be lovely to get the suite again.!!

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite - perfect birthday treat”
Reviews.Author: walker1971
Reviews.Content: Arrived for a 3 night surprise birthday stay in this beautiful hotel on Park Avenue, central to all NY attractions required on a short break. Walking distance to Times Square, 5th Avenue, Grand Central etc. Husband had booked a suite overlooking the avenue - extremely spacious with the comfiest bed and pillows ever. Large marble bathroom and separate lounge area - another area held a fridge and minibar. Iron, hairdryer and all other amenities. Opulent reception with helpful, courteous staff. Frequented Harrys Bar on number of occasions for late night drinks - lovely staff and very relaxed atmosphere. Good mix of residents meant that never felt uncomfortable or intimidated staying in such an opulent hotel which we would not usually attend. Did not have breakfast as wanted to experience different eateries/delis but smelt delicious! Only minor downside (being english!) is that there was no tea/coffee facilities - but there was a starbucks on site!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: luv t
Reviews.Content: Amazing history. If you have a chance to take a tour of the Waldorf it is absolutely worth every penny. Rooms have so much character...marble..high ceilings...feel like royalty when you stay there. The only drawback is NO coffee makers!! Probably because of the Starbucks in the hotel...try the pastries baked by the chefs at the Waldorf. Not your typical offerings that other Starbucks offer. I'm hooked on the danish. The location is quieter in the evenings; however, the walk up to Times Square and the theatre district is short. The hotel is close to Grand Central Terminal which is amazing to see if you haven't been there. All in all the Waldorf Astoria is full of history, lots of activities going on...the concierge are extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Astoria: Great Fun and Service Next To Great Shopping”
Reviews.Author: Lorrence
Reviews.Content: If you like a cosmopolitan international atmosphere combine with great service and comfort next to the high points of shopping and sight seeing in NYC, there are none better than than world famous Waldorf Astoria. Brush shoulders with high ranked officials and business leaders from all over the world attending important conferences in NYC. It's fun, it's exciting, it's a very satisfying experience. The food at the Bull & Bear is not bad, either!

Reviews.Title: “Well looked after by all the staff - & the hotel's not bad either!”
Reviews.Author: Wizzies
Reviews.Content: WOW!! This was our first impression on entering the lobby from the garage and it continued from there on. From the receptionist to the bell boy, nothing was too much trouble and we only had to ask and it was done. Our room was on the 13th floor (no we're not superstitious) and we had a fantastic view of the Chrysler building from our hotel window. Everywhere was beautifully clean and our overall view of the hotel was one of opulence and a step back into a bygone age in the decor but with modern service. The Waldorf Astoria is NOT a modern, minimalist hotel and if that's what you are looking for then it's best that you don't stay here. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom was not in working condition”
Reviews.Author: Thomas C
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. Upon arrival the checkin time was roughly 35 minutes. The lady didn't even say she would be right back just left and came back later with the room keys. As soon as we opened the door to our One bedroom suite, we could smell a very musty smell and the room was very dark, the windows had a dark film over them. There was a whole cut out of our wall with a patched, the wall paper was falling off where they had cut the whole. The so called view was a roof of part of the hotel full of garbage and piles of shingles. The toilet in our room didn't flush the last night we were there. We called house keeping and they said they'd be right up, that never happened. So we had to go all the way across the hotel to our friends room to use the bathroom. Also the bed in our room was broke, and the bed leaned to one side. This is just some of the downfalls to this so called Five star hotel. We will not be staying at the Waldorf ever again. I would strongly suggest staying somewhere else in the city such as the Omni Berkshire or the NY Palace hotel, these hotels have much better service and updated rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay - not bad value- needs a refurb”
Reviews.Author: ross7979
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 days in October, rooms are big for NY, but all a bit tired and could do with a refurb. Nice common parts, room service and mini bar are stupidly expensive, $9 for a small bottle of water, or breakfast was $80 for 2 omelettes and coffee! Bar is ok downstairs, price isn't too bad for the rooms if you avoid all extras. Staff at front desk were friendly but bar staff were poor, didn't understand English very well.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy”
Reviews.Author: cmollys
Reviews.Content: The room was a good size. Over all very clean the tv remote was a little funky. Other then that we had a great stay. The lobby is very grand and over the top. We had our two year old with us and that made things interesting. The Waldorf is not the best place for a toddler but i am not sure they see many. Over all we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but a little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TravelingUSA
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria is a beautiful, historic hotel. As a Hilton Honors Gold member, we received a nice corner room with a view of Park Avenue. The room was very clean with a large, flat screen TV. The bathroom was rather small but with nice amenities. Upon early check-in, our room was not ready but the desk clerk was very helpful, reviewing our extra perks received as Honors Gold members. He offered to call us when our room was ready. Upon our return, however, we were checked in by a different desk clerk, who was rude and condescending. We have traveled all over the world and have never encountered such rudeness by a hotel staff person. However, other than this one unpleasant man, our stay in New York was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better than We Expected - Will definetly stay here again”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler486
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our mother in law to the big city for a non stop weekend. We originally were going to stay out of downtown and commute, but thought the location at the Waldorf would be great for us. I really liked the area.. Away from the craziness of times square but close to high end shopping, central park (about 5 blocks) and the Radio City Music Hall about a 10 minute walk. I always wanted to stay at the Waldorf having visited NYC about 25 times... but was really never on the radar. We used to stay at the Stanhope right on central park but that closed. Used to stay at the Essex house when it was part of the Starwood brand but it was sold and the new ownership ruined the hotel Anyway, I am so glad we finally were able to stay at the hotel. It is very similar to an art deco hotel built around the same time in Cincinnati. It you are looking for new, spotless and the modern look this hotel is not for you. If you love history, going back in time and enjoying a true american landmark this is your place. The room was great, the suite was needed due to the 3 of us. The furnishings in our room were very traditional and yet very near new. The staff was also very good. The is the first time I ever stayed in a hotel room that had a medicine cabinet in it... thought is was so cool and about 80 years old. The lobby in the hotel was cool to walk through. Very old... but majestic. Thought I might run into Winston Churchill around the corner or Ronald Reagon but realized they have been gone now for awhile. We all three liked the propertly alot. Thought we were fortunate to stay there and would definetly stay there again. Lastly the breakfast at Ocsars in the morning was excellent. The OJ freshly squeezed.... so good and the pastries... thought we were in Europe. I guess my advice would be don't expect this hotel to be modern and new... expect to go back in time where they spent an ungodly amount of money on a hotel that was (and still is) one of the top properties in the world.... with the clasic touches of marble, granite, mahoggany and painted ceilings. Where the curtains are larger than life and the furnishing look like they were bought in the 1920's.

Reviews.Title: “Shouldn't happen at a first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: pegandbern
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Waldorf Astoria. My room was clean but the bathroom was tiny and needed a face lift and some Lysol! Check in was a breeze and the bellman and concierge were most helpful. The hotel lobby is gorgeous and there is a free work-out facility that is very adequate. My phone charger was taken by a housekeeper and returned, after many phone inquiries, the next day. Why she took it in the first place then waited until the next day to return it (after I made a big stink!) raised questions in my mind as to her intent in the first place. When I checked out, there was a bar tab that wasn't mine, charged to the room. It was the hotel's mistake, but customer service put me into a position where i had to spend time and make several phone inquiries before the charge was reversed! No apology was given.

Reviews.Title: “Summer in the City”
Reviews.Author: EandK1
Reviews.Content: Very proffesional staff. Hotel rooms need modernizing. Beautiful, classic lobby

Reviews.Title: “great base”
Reviews.Author: mrswicker
Reviews.Content: short walk to all places to visit on a site seeing holiday. Very near subway to all over New York. Hotel staff (except Maitre d)were brilliant. Receptionist was second to none. Bar staff very helpful. Door staff also helpful. Hotel very clean and room also clean. Towels changed every day and room cleaned daily. we paid for an upgrade but really wished we hadnt. the only difference was a king size bed.

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired”
Reviews.Author: Terri879
Reviews.Content: While we enjoyed our stay at the Waldorf Astoria, we found our room to be a bit shabby and tired. On the plus side, the location is within walking distance of high end shopping as well as the theatre district. The lobby is impressive. A tour of the ballroom and other areas proved very interesting, as the hotel oozes history and grandeur. The staff was nice enough, and we enjoyed the lobby bar. Our room was located in the older part of the hotel. The bed was comfortable, but the furnishings were tired and the upholstry quite worn. The bathroom was tiny with a tub/shower combo and one sink. We could hear lots of noise from our neighbors across the hall coming and going. I suppose it would be very expensive to redecorate and update such a large hotel, and that is sad. This hotel remains a landmark and was surely very elegant in it's day.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel In the Middle of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: colony
Reviews.Content: First of all you will love your welcome. Although elegant and rather imposing at first, the staff make you feel very special and that you are at your "home" away from home. I loved being in the middle of the city. I was at the hotel on business, not a pleasure trip this time. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and I loved the elegant bathroom. The only thing missing was a bathrobe. The hotel was busy and I saw a number of people that you have read about in the news or even People Magazine. I used the restaurants and loved the fact that after only one visit those in the Peacock Alley Restaurant remembered me right away. You will truly enjoy this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, ageing, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Paul S
Reviews.Content: I am a business traveller. I got in late at night. Found the valet staff polite. The from desk staff was nonchalant and preoccupied, and appeared more interested in making sure the credit card was effectively charged rather than showing a polite welcoming attitude. I later spoke to the front desk staff about telephone handset cables that were missing! Rather than apologize, they seemed puzzled, and then said they would send someone up. This was never done! I had to call twice and speak to a front desk supervisor the next day. Her attitude was confrontational and dismissive. My room decor was not traditional or historic- its just old and worn. The bathroom was mildewy. The building facade appears to be undergoing repairs. The view outside the windows is contraction bars, and you hear Park avenue taxis honking their horns thru the night. Windows are not well insulated. An old heating system without a thermostat and a noisy fan- Not unlike two star and three star hotels (which are considerably cheaper. The lobby is impressive- worth a visit if you are a tourist with an interest in "history". But this hotel's best years are well behind it. The decor is mediocre, and the staff, especially at the front desk, is dismissive and rude, surprisingly, this includes managerial staff! Many better boutique hotels available in New York. Way overpriced. Really, don't stay at the hotel if you can avoid it. Paul, Washington DC

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel0914
Reviews.Content: LOVE being pampered...had a two room suite, sophiticated, elegant, wonderful dining..concierge got us fantastic tickets for the Phantom of the Opera..took care of our every whim Did I mention I loved this place?

Reviews.Title: “over priced and disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: johnk317
Reviews.Content: This hotel is showing its age. It has lost the glamor of yesteryear. Rooms (and bathrooms) need a major renovation. Furniture is old and the drapes outdated. The price of the room is expensive and the room service overpriced. Other than its great location in NYC and historic lobby this hotel is totally over-rated.

Reviews.Title: “Ok to try once but never again”
Reviews.Author: MichellefrmOC
Reviews.Content: Condition of the hotel was not so good. very outdated. Feels like you are staying inside a museum. Neat that it is all original. But we stayed in a 2 bedroom suite for $1000/night and for the price of these rooms, you would expect a little better condition or tile floors that arent cracked. Great free breakfast if you are staying in the towers. Staff was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Domer130
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here at least a couple of times in the past but things seem to have gotten worse now. Firstly, prior to our night out we had to take cold showers since the hot water seemed to be out of order. We called and apparently a valve was broken in the tub. They fixed this later in the evening when we were out. We were supposed to get a couple of bottles of water but there were none. Upon check out I voiced my feedback to the young lady in reception I dealt with but all she could say was they fixed the showers didn't they and she offered two bottles of water! Considering this was a King Superior room, this level of service to a Diamond member was disappointing to me. I have come to expect better from Hilton and that too a premium hotel such as this.

Reviews.Title: “Old New York”
Reviews.Author: jodelicious
Reviews.Content: A wonderful stay in New Yorks history. Far better than a chain.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Clare H
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and it has been fantastic... this time however they took nearly an hour to check us in at 11:00 pm and did not have the room we booked, they upgraded us although the reception staff and particualry the reception manager were rude and made no attempt at customer service, the manager did not even manage eye contact! The room we were eventually put in was fabulous, except for it was a smoking room and the smell was over whelming in the bedding and towels....awful... The door men were superb as were the house keeping staff what a shame :(

Reviews.Title: “The Waldorf.....OMG. !”
Reviews.Author: George2351
Reviews.Content: It was always a dream for us to stay at the legendary Waldorf Astoria New York hotel which we read stands as a beacon of old-world elegance and service...we were not disappointed. From check-in to departure our four nights/ five days was absolutley fabulous. The hotel on fabled Park Avenue in Midtown Manhattan was an ideal base for a very memorable stay....truely wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Average room, beatiful lobby!”
Reviews.Author: BrigetteB
Reviews.Content: My friend booked this room for a girl's night out in NYC. We arrived and they did not have the type of room she had requested so we had to take what they had. The lobby is just beautiful. You can just picture how many famous and important people have stayed and or lived at this hotel in the past. Our room was very small. There was a nice sized TV. I had to play with the wires to get a good picture. We went to call room service and for some reason the phones weren't working. We had to call the lobby via our cell phones to order. We ordered an appetizer to get us through our Broadway show so we could go to dinner after. It was really nothing special. I was disappointed in the quality of the food. We ordered the dim sum platter and it was really awful. The bathroom was very worn. The ceiling in the bathroom was peeling. It defintely needed an upgrade. The toilet did not flush properly. You had to flush it three times before the toilet would flush clean. All in all it was a lot of fun to go to the Waldorf Astoria. It has a lot of history. It is a beatiful hotel. My friend paid for the room, but I would not pay for a room at this hotel. I will choose another hotel when it is my turn to book in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good- but a few minor problems.”
Reviews.Author: ABAHL
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard double room, and when we checked in, we were upgraded to a suite! The room was lovely, the air con system was a bit arcade, but nice room. We went to bed, and found that the aircon on the 7th floor was faulty, the whole floor shook, and there was a very loud whining noise throughout the night. We rang reception at 4am. Straight away we are delt with. We got complimentary breakfast, and an upgrade to a junior suite on the 21st floor! The service is great at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Overall good stay”
Reviews.Author: FiChisholm
Reviews.Content: First off, the history and name of the Waldorf is the most exciting part for sure, and the primary reason I stayed there. The room was clean and had nice period touches eg the fireplace and some of the furniture. I had a room facing the side of the hotel, so it was very quiet in terms of street noise. Check in was smooth. Location is great and easy for tours, shopping, restaurants etc. Food in the hotel was very good, although very expensive. A couple of niggles that prevent this from being a 5 star rating. First off, for a few of the nights the main entrance of the hotel was closed because of private functions - this seems to be commonplace particularly on Friday and weekend nights. This meant either walking around the block to the back entrance, or using another set of internal lifts that were slow and had a lot of people waiting for them. This is pretty inconvenient upon arrival with bags, or when coming back later in the evening. Second was check-out. There were several small inaccuracies on my account (eg being charged for mini-bar items that had not been used, being charged additional tips for room service delivery etc). This is standard stuff and is normally sorted out immediately with a quick apology. In this case, I had to wait while the front desk "investigated" by calling room service, maid service etc to get an answer. Ultimately the 'investigation' went nowhere and they eventually told me that "if I wanted" they could remove the items from the bill. I was left with the distinct feeling of being dressed down for questioning such small items. I experienced similar feeling when interracting with other staff at the hotel in terms of expectations on tipping and extras, which was disappointing. Overall the stay was good and if you have never stayed at the Waldorf and want to have the experience by all means do so. If you are looking for exceptional service and facilities though, you can find these in other 4 and 5 star hotels in the city and probably more updated.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf salad”
Reviews.Author: peter h
Reviews.Content: Landmark hotel in the centre of down town new york. Great service,good size rooms for an old hotel.best steak in new York at the bull and bear downstairs.don't miss the peacock alley bar

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: HobokenGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: In August of this year, I posted a not-so-glowing review of the Waldorf Astoria. Well here we were back again. We arrived at 11:30 pm on a Wednesday and check in was rather slow as two lone agents tried to accommodate a number of late arriving guests. They couldn’t find a king room so they put us in a double. The room was a joke: old, small, dark and a little creepy; the bathroom was equally dismal. We resigned ourselves to the cramped quarters and started to unpack only to discover that there was, essentially, no closet. There were two sliding doors where a closet should have been but most of the closet space was taken up by a large duct. Since we were there for four nights and had suits, a tuxedo and gowns to hang, this was unacceptable. My husband called the desk; they were apologetic and told us that if we could hold out for one night, they would have a lovely room for us the following day. The next day we were moved into a bright king room on the 23rd floor with all the necessary modern amenities, a large walk-in closet, windows with views of the Chrysler building and a pair of comfortable reading chairs. Even the bathroom, which was well sized and functional, had a large window with rooftop views. The bottom line is the Waldorf does have nicer rooms but you never know what you are going to get. If you are stuck with one of their many sub-par rooms speak up and you might get lucky…I’m just not sure it is worth the risk.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old School Luxury...Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: IslandGirlCa
Reviews.Content: We thought about staying at a hip new loft-like hotel but thought better of it and went for the New York old school grandeur. We were not sorry! Upon checking in, they found out it was our anniversary and gave us an upgrade to a wonderful suite, complete with sitting room, changing room and a bathroom the size of most New York apartments! Loved everything about this hotel...the view, the grand lobby, the people watching and the Starbucks in the lobby. And the location couldn't be better. A quick walk to Central Park, Times Square and Grand Central Station, and a quick cab ride or subway most anywhere. Our favorite part was the service. From the concierge to the desk attendants, everyone was overly friendly and greeted us by name. They even sent us a bottle of champagne for our anniversary. Yes, there can be some rude and pushy people in New York, but they are not among the staff at the Waldorf Astoria! I can't comment on what the "regular" rooms are like since we were lucky enough to upgrade, but I will say the pricing was good for these. Sure, it's an older hotel, but it still looks and feels quite luxurious. Stay here for an authentic New York feeling, anything-but-surly service and a location central to everything.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT let the name fool you!”
Reviews.Author: nylike2travel
Reviews.Content: Oh yes the hotel sounds so luxurious The Waldorf ( the key word is sounds). Since my girlfriend and I usually stay in two or three times during the year and we stay uptown we decided to give The Waldorf a go. Check in was very pleasant room not ready so we came back hours later. Our room was on the 11th floor a one bedroom suite. First of all you could not see out of the windows they were all filthy all of them. There was toothpaste left on the faucet from the previous guest, the sheer curtains had stains on them and looked rather worn. The best part was the constant noise all night, but it does get better since we had terrible sleep that night we tried to get a bit of rest the next day THEY were jackhammering outside and it was vibrating the room, I called downstairs and was told sorry that it would be going on until 5 P.M. I realize this hotel needs refurbrishing since the room is a bit worn ( not much luxury) but they should Warn guests before they book so they can make other plans. I do feel cheated on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Lauree1183
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed here in August and had a fantastic time. The Waldorf's location is great for lots of sightseeing. We booked our hotel room 6 months in advance (paid in full), and because of this got a FANTASTIC rate! Cheaper than many of the other 3 star hotels in midtown. Our room was a bit small, but the size was perfect for just us too. Everything was clean and well maintained. We loved staying in this New York landmark!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Hotel, Great Location and Very comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: JMTravels24
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old and in some places looking dated but it is still grand and has tons of history. Our party of 4 stayed in 2 Deluxe doubles for a week including the New York Marathon weekend - Deluxe is the basic room at the Waldorf. The hotel would benefit from a make over but the rooms are spacious and have very comfortable beds. As you would expect at a property of this rating and location the bars and restaurants are quite expensive but worth trying at least once. The Bull and Bear proved to be a superb choice for us to celebrate with our marathon runner. Location is great and the lobby area really is spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Cross one off our to-do list”
Reviews.Author: lovetowineanddine
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf being the hotel that all others strive to be, it was a must during our recent trip to NYC. Let's face it, it's a legendary icon of service and I had to experience it for myself. My wife calls me a snob. Maybe I am. I like things a certain way. I get annoyed when there's no valet service. I expect fast check ins, spotless rooms, a bathrobe and impeccable service...and for God's sake don't serve crappy wine or make me pay for my internet. The Waldorf almost made it. The service was, in fact, impeccable. To start, they had valet service. Yes, it's $50, but this is NYC. Apart from parking your car on top of someone else, what can you expect? Check in was quick, very professional and courteous staff. The bags were delivered to our room minutes after we arrived. The bellman happily demonstrated all the features of the room. I look around the room. Paint is bubbling on the walls and there's a stain on the bed skirt. Seriously? There's me getting annoyed. I go into the closet. Ah. Two bath robes. The bathroom is all marble and nicely kept. The shower is nice and hot. They use actual toilet paper instead of sand paper. I can almost forgive the stains. I sit down at the desk and start up my computer. Going to get on the internet I discover that I have to pay for internet access. What the hell? Paying over $300 for a room and I have to PAY for internet? They give it away for free in the lobby, in a far more impeccable environment! I'm not impressed. We call up the concierge. Within minutes she was able to get me a reservation at the Artisanal Fromagerie (another check off our list). She was smooth and efficient. Big plus there...although the hold times on the phone are absolutely unacceptable to get to them to begin with. One nice thing about the Waldorf. It's location is fantastic. There's a myriad of taxis outside the front door almost constantly. When there isn't, a doorman's whistle takes quick care of it. You can walk to several restaurants nearby. It takes minutes by cab to get to an end of the island (it took us maybe 10 minutes to get to the WTC Memorial by taxi). After dinner I sit back and relax in a rather old, uncomfortable chair and have a cigar. It's not hard to get lost in the history of the place and imagining what type of grandeur the hotel must have experienced in it's prime. Looking out the window I could enjoy the skyline and an army of yellow motorized horns. Finally I go to bed. Sleep came effortlessly. The bed was firm and comfortable. Ample and comfortable bedding. The sleep was excellent.....until 8 AM. At 8AM I'm abruptly woken to jackhammers and grinders outside my window. The banging was obnoxious, giving me a headache. Ok, now I'm really annoyed. A call down to the desk (and another lengthy hold) tells me they can't stop the work, but they can move me to another room for a couple of hours. If they could do that, they should have done it the previous night. Why would I pack everything up, move to another room only to check out a couple of hours later? I thanked her for the offer, but declined. It was pointless. "I tell you what. Treat us to breakfast and we'll be happy with that." She readily agreed. The customized invitation showed up at our door within minutes. Breakfast at Oscar's was good. Very good actually. An omelette made for me, right in front of me. Good start. A great buffet with a great selection of food that was actually warm. Bacon that was thick and not overcooked (there is a difference between bacon and jerky, for the record). Excellent. Attentive and friendly staff, ensuring my coffee was topped off (without asking). Check. They have rapid check out so there was zero fuss at departure. I drop my mail in the mail slot at the front desk and go to the parking to get my car. It's already there, the bags are ready and they load them into the car for us. A solid finish. Am I a snob? You can be the judge. But to me, the Waldorf Astoria is an almost.

Reviews.Title: “Not as it used to be”
Reviews.Author: Mitch2nd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here several times, and my latest was for my 50th birthday this August gone. Now I love this Hotel, but since my last stay something has happened and standards have dropped. Its an old Hotel and some rooms can be battered around the edges, but I can forgive that because of the history and normally very helpful staff. One thing that is annoying with this standard of hotel is that there are no tea coffee making facilities in the rooms, you can request a coffee maker, but I don’t see why, even a Travel lodge gives you this basic item. The first thing we did on arrival was straight to the Bull & bear in the bottom of the hotel, lovely old bar with normally friendly staff. Within 5 minutes of sitting at the bar one of the barmen (a Newyorker I would say) was offering out his fellow barman outside for a fight, horrible man. We didn’t stay or return to the bar during the week stay. Now this may sound petty, but this hotel normally prides itself on customer service, which on past visits has always been excellent. However, on returning to the room after a days shopping you want a nice cup of coffee or tea. To arrive back and find the cups and coffee machine still dirty and no coffee is just disgusting. On ringing reception, they were apologetic and sent up more coffee, but we had to clean the cups and machine ourselves. The following day I left a very polite note on the coffee machine asking for more coffee. On returning that afternoon, we were confronted by a note left by the room attendant, it said. ‘I do not serve coffee please call 4767 and they will send you’ and yet again dirty cups and machines, she had taken the spoons away so just don’t understand the thinking. Ok some will say what’s the problem with that just call them, well the problem is what happened to customer service?? Well what is wrong with the room attendant doing it for the customer ? this is not a cheap hotel and its basics that the hotel should do, why should I have to call ever day to ask for more coffee and every day have to clean out the cups and machine. It was a small thing but from a 5 star hotel not acceptable, and was annoying. The last thing I have to say is checkout. Now in most hotels when checking in or out you just stand in a queue until someone is available. Here they have a person stood at the queue who then directs you to the next available person, nice but overboard and not needed. When checking out I was stood there and a customer had just checked in and left the counter, the staff member obviously was not ready to receive the next person but we were directed to go over to the counter, we were greeted by him holding up his hand in a stop motion, not even looking at us and shouting out ‘wait’ Not even a please. I think you could see the steam coming out of my ears, I walked off and just went to the next counter that had just become available, never should I have been spoken too in that way and I was to say the least p’’’d off. I love this hotel and I love New York, but will I stay there again, I really not sure, most of the staff were good, but it only takes two or three to drive customers away. This is not the same 5 star hotel that I love and know.

Reviews.Title: “A night at the Waldorf is worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Hey2011
Reviews.Content: Classy, a living legend. We had the possibilty to stay there at at a reasonable price despite the fact the hotel is world famous: excellent location, amazing lobby, great decoration, outstanding service. However, we were a bit disappointed by the rather small rooms and poor condition of the bathroom. It all is very old and needs to be redone some day. On the other hand, staying at the Waldorf is a dream and we haven't regretted it for a second.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and old world charm”
Reviews.Author: Jwbjrb1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in a 2 bedroom suite and had a wonderful experience. The rooms were very spacious and elegant. The staff was great as well. Upon our arrival our tv wasn't working and they had someone there to fix it within 20 minutes. The hotel is within walking distance to so many attractions. The lobby was extremely busy during check in time but we were able to arrive earlier in the morning when the lines were very short - our rooms weren't ready but they held our luggage and sent us a text when they were ready so we were able to bypass the lines. All in all it was a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “The legendary Waldorf Astoria”
Reviews.Author: Jola L
Reviews.Content: Living up to a legend might be difficult at times, and at least my feelings are a bit mixed after spending 4 nights in one of the most famous hotels in the world. The hotel is located in a perfect spot, close to a subway station. Central Park and Times Square are just a few blocks away. There are lots of restaurants and bars nearby, regardless of the direction You take. Inside the hotel (by the main entrance) there's a Starbucks cafe if a small hunger suprises You. The main entrance with an impressive Wheel of Life and a huge lobby indeed make an impression. The lobby is usually quite crowded because of the free wifi connection and it might be difficult to find an empty chair. The staff seems to be indifferent to the customers waiting for a place to sit... The room we were staying at (located on the 10th floor) was quite small and in a pretty poor condition. You could not use the bathroom at night without waking everybody else. Taking a hot bath was not possible, either, but fortunately the shower was working fine. There was a minibar in the room, but the pricelist was missing... Still, it was a dream to stay in the Astoria once and the dream is fulfilled now :-)

Reviews.Title: “A large midtown hotel with old New York charm, you can’t beat the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: SBAdvisor
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful four night stay at the Waldorf Astoria in early November 2011. At check in we were told that it would be about 15-20 minutes until our room was ready. She gave us a coupon for 2 free drinks and directed us to the bar across the lobby. She told us to relax with a drink and she would come over and get us when our room was ready. At 8 pm in the evening after a long day of travel a free cocktail was a wonderful surprise. Just as promised, our room was ready in 20 minutes. This level of service was above and beyond what you normally experience at a large hotel property. We had a nice sized room with a king bed on the 16 floor. By NY standards, our room was very spacious with high ceilings, a work desk, sitting chair, large closet, and large bathroom with shower tub. The room also had two large windows that opened about 4 inches each - I love a room with operable windows that allow you to get some fresh air. The room was extremely quiet – I never once heard any sound from neighboring rooms which were all occupied during our entire stay. The bed was very comfortable with soft sheets and lots of pillows. Several of the posts here talk of warn fabrics and old furniture. Our room did not have any of these deficiencies - everything was in good condition. The Waldorf is an old historic hotel with loads of old world charm. If you want a modern, sleek décor this is not the hotel for you. The lobby, halls, elevators, and common area are magnificent. In addition, the location is fantastic and provides easy access to most of New York’s major attractions. There is a Starbucks inside the hotel and as a Hilton Honors Gold member; we received a coupon for coffee, juice and a pastry for both my wife and me each morning of our stay. We also received free Wi-Fi. We did not eat at any of the restaurants at the property so I can’t speak to that. If you are looking for a large midtown hotel with old world New York charm, you can’t beat the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: brian796
Reviews.Content: I'm usually a pretty easy grader on hotels. If they are clean, quiet and comfortable, it's difficult to disappoint me. Unfortunately, my three night stay here found a way to disappoint me repeatedly. For a premium hotel that is bold enough to "suggest" a dress code on their website, my expectations were not met. 1. The staff deliberately overlooked an obvious issue with my room. When I checked in. The thermostat was on 65 and a window was cracked, letting in considerable street noise as well as plenty of 45 degree air. Of course, I closed the window and changed the thermostat to 72 before hearing out for a few hours. Upon returning to the room, I discovered why the window was open and the thermostat had been on its 65 degree minimum, the room was burning up at well over 80 degrees. I soon discovered that the thermostat was inaccurate by about 10-12 degrees. Why the staff decided to bandaid the problem rather than fix it is beyond me. 2. The bathroom sink stopper was not working. It would not close. How was the maid cleaning? So I used a wash rag to stop it temporarily, only to discover that the stopper was then stuck in the closed positin with a sink full of dirty water. Again, an obvious problem that should have been fixed before I ever walked into the room. 3. The tv had no picture. I'm not much of a tv watcher and I only tried it on the very last night of the stay, but still disappointing to discover at bedtime that the tv doesn't work. 4. The bill slipped under my door at the end of my stay had overcharged me by more than $200. The room rate was incorrect for the last two evenings. Luckily, I had my confirmation email with me and was able to sort it out with the front desk after showing them the email. I hate to think what would have happened had I not had my email with me. What is so hard about charging the same rate that is included in the registration confirmation? Upon educating the front desk of the issues above, I got an apology. Final notes... I was placed on a floor with both smoking and non-smoking rooms. On two mornings, a strong cigarette smell invaded my room very early in the morning (prior to 6am), waking me up. Obviously, there is a physical issue where smoke is leaking between rooms. If you want a smoke-free stay, insist on a floor that's completely non-smoking. Room size was fine for New York. Typical for New York and Europe, small for most American cities. Room was very clean. Bed was comfortable. Lobby was beautiful (as depicted in web photos). The rooms themselves could stand some refurbishment on some cases... Missing tile grout, slight mold I soap tray, peeling paint on havoc unit, tired desktop lamp shade, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Its all about the history”
Reviews.Author: Ravella29
Reviews.Content: It was the first time we have stayed at the W-A and have to say I felt very privilaged. I would have loved to have stayed there in its heyday. I do agree with others that this hotel is resting on its history but hey they can get away with it because the place is like Grand Central Station.The atmosphere is buzzing. The entrance, the lobby, the reception area is beautiful, so elegant. Yes it is expensive but one expects that. 5 star hotels in any city are expensive. We booked a room with two queen beds but were given a king in a small room with a view of the scaffolding (no problem with the scaffolding, maintenance work has to be done at some time) Following day I mentioned it to the receptionist and she immediately changed us to a bigger room with two beds. Got lost in the pillows and have never slept in more comfortable beds in any other 5 star hotels anywhere in the world, it took a lot of effort to get up. Of course the rooms are dated, its what makes it the Waldorf but I do think that Wifi should be available complimentary in the room as it is in many hotels these days. Nothing in this hotel is free except the toiletries. You pay for the room, breakfast is not included, there is not even cofee/tea making facilities. Most of the staff are friendly and helpful. The only issue I have is with regard to security. My husband brought an antiquated Nokia cell phone which he managed to lose between the cocktail terrace and our room around lunchtime on our second day. We retraced our steps 15 mins later feeling sure we would find the phone or at least be told it had been handed in as we felt that the type of clientele who visit or stay at this hotel wouldn't be seen dead with this old relic. It never did turn up. They have enough security agents there, maybe they should be looking a little closer at their staff after all this is NY not Dubai. Next, on checking out, we asked reception if they could arrange to have our bags brought down. They told us they could but someone would have to be in the room at the time. Kind of tells you something as this is a first for us. Never in all our years of travelling have we been expected to stay in our room and wait for the bags to be talen down. I would love to stay at the Waldorf again but the security aspect makes me feel uncomfortable. I do feel everyone should have the experience of staying there at least once in their life.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: hollyhouse_7
