Reviews.Content: Me and my son had a lovley time at the Waldorf Astoria,we stayed for three nights,the room was nice and clean and the beds were very comfy,it is very central for getting around New York and i would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Like taking a step back in time”
Reviews.Author: ad1215
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the 'long weekend' shopping trip recently and had a great time. I think it's a difficult hotel to review as it's really in a category of it's own having so much history attatched to it. The check in process was efficient and very friendly and we were quickly allocated a room. When we got to the room and started to unpack we suddenly realised there was a noise like a freight train passing every few seconds, it was we realised the lift shaft the on other side of the bathroom wall. No matter, after a brief conversation with reception we were relocated without fuss to a new room. In reality the rooms are 'oldy worldy' even down to the old fashioned light switches, so if you are after chique boutique with the minimal look then it's not for you. Bathroom, again more than adequate - marble, etc although an overall 'tired' feel to it. Free wi-fi in the room that was good although so it should be at nearly $400 per night. The hotel has a very busy air about itself being the host of functions most evenings so it's not uncommon to see people around in either black tie or (as we were there halloween) in fancy dress. One disappointment was they do charge for a tour of the hotel. Location is great for sight seeing being central to lots of attractions, taxi's at the front door at all times. Lobby, fantastic and the focus / highlight of the hotel, gift shop on the ground floor fantastic for those stocking fillers. Bars in the lobby, great for people watching but pricey, e.g 2 Gin & tonics $60.00 (only did that the once!). Used the shoe shine, that was great - shoes are still clean! In conclusion, glad I've been there / done that, but will go back to somewhere like the Westin again next time as in reality a NY hotel is just a base so I'd much prefer one with a more modern room - but that's just my preference - you need to go to make your own mind up.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf did not disappoint me, this trip.”
Reviews.Author: DMeek
Reviews.Content: This was my fifth stay at the Waldorf Astoria in NYC. Ive had mroblems here in the past, not this time. I was greeted by a smile and my interactions with the hotel staff were great for the most part. Staff. Very friendly and outgoing, they will use your name if they know it. One gentleman tried to be helpful to me when I was looking for ice on my floor, he told me to go to 17 or call room service, another person interjected and said to go around the corner on the floor I was on, turns out the first gentleman was correct! Ice machines are hard to find! When I arrived, earlier than check-in time, they kept my luggage for me and texted me when my room was ready, this was great as I had a meeting to be at. Food. Granted I was with a conference eating the conference food, it was great. Top notch tast and awesome presentation. If you eat on site be prepared to pay top dollar. Value. In my opinion the Waldorf Astoria is a great place to stay on occasion, the money spent here is worth the luxury, every now and then. Obviously ou can stay for less in NYC but treat yourself every so often,you should not be disappointed. Very clean, great beds, rooms are very nice. Ask for a coffee maker in your room at check-in, otherwise you will have to go outside to get it! Location is great, right on Park and also on Lexington, right near the train station. Close enough to walk to lots of great things. CONSTRUCTION NOTE. This hotel will be doing renovations the next 3-4 years. You may, stres may, see or hear construction, but hey it is NYC.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: ericsplastercast
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights to celebrate daughter's 18th birthday. From the moment we arrived to the last goodbye from the concierge, nothing was too much trouble. The whole atmosphere of the place was brilliant. We were dropped at the motor entrance below reception and directed up the stairs through the magnificent lobby which manages to capture the granduer of old New York yet remain intimate with little alcoves dotted all over the place Check in was very efficient and we arrived at our room just a minute before our bags. We were shown where everything was and loved the elegance of the bedroom, the large dressing room and the well appointed bathroom. The beds were as luxurious as any I have ever slept in and street noise from Park Avenue was minimal. Free wi fi in the lobby was a godsend but would have appreciated it in our room for the price we paid. Due to money constraints we didn't eat at the hotel but were assured by other guests that the meals were excellent if expensive. For the peasants like me there is a Starbucks in the hotel building which is very convenient and good value. The Hotel is central for everything and one of the tour buses even drops off and picks up outside. Taxis line up outside and the door staff will get one for you if you are feeling shy. Overall a great experience which I would highly recommend everyone who visits New York should do at least once. ! We will return if I win the lottery

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Rob2175
Reviews.Content: A Super Luxurious hotel. Not quite what I expected though. The room was very nice and big, but a small window overlooked a rooftop. Sucked!! Overall, the staff were Great and I enjoyed my time in the hotel. I had dinner at The Bull and Bear inside the hotel and absolutely loved it. Great place. I would stay again, only when the price is right. Not worth over $400.00 a night. I only paid $190.00 per night. Got a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel copied poorly by so many others”
Reviews.Author: clams5
Reviews.Content: You can feel the history of this hotel from the main entrance to the pictures on the walls of the hallways upstairs. The walk from the outside doors builds excitement as you approach the main lobby, which is beautiful, but perfectly sized, and with little alcoves that make it feel intimate. Other hotels in emerging markets try to copy this but get the scale and intimacy wrong. The staff is efficient and available, but with a New York brusqueness that is part of the culture of this city...they are NOT rude...but don't expect midwestern charm. But you feel you are in New York just as you feel the local flavor in the great hotels of Paris and London. The rooms are nothing special. Internet is not free, but at least they spent some money on a generous number of power plugs mounted on the side of the desk, and each room has its own wireless hub so the speed is pretty good. Those planning confererences will be pleased with the quality of the food. Meeting rooms on the main floor are perfect for black tie affairs, but not great for business meetings as they are lined with mirrors which can create glare from reflected spotlights, and in general, can take focus away from the main speakers. Seating is pretty uncomfortable after a couple of hours, but not unusual for hotels. Overall...a memorable stay in a historic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing honeymoon experience!”
Reviews.Author: Holidaymaker1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf last week for our honeymoon and loved it! The staff were helpful, especially the concierge. The rooms were serviced twice daily and standards were extremely high. We loved the decor throughout the whole hotel, including our room, it was the old fashioned image we were expecting. They made a fuss of us with a complimentary bottle of fizz, strawberries and a card. The little extra's you would hope for from such a grand hotel on your honeymoon. We ate in Oscars which was definitely expensive but well worth the experience. The Bull and Bear was fabulous, my fillet mignon was heavenly! All and all a wonderful experience and would stay there again in a second (money permitting!)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way”
Reviews.Author: Alex-Bex
Reviews.Content: Featured in so many films, The Waldorf Astoria is one of the iconic hotels in New York City. It lives up to its reputation in every way; the grand entrance, opulent lobby, fantastic restaurants, charming rooms, excellent customer service etc. As others have noted, some of the rooms do seem a little dated. In part one could argue that this adds to the charm of the hotel, others may think differently. Either way, the room features and fittings are all in good condition, good quality and well presented. There are other hotels which are more modern, have bigger rooms (for an equivalent rate) and are perhaps offer a little more for the modern traveller. This said, nothing can take away from the great experience of staying at The Waldorf. We have stayed there twice now and would always go back. It just has that 'something special' about it which we love.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Carol D
Reviews.Content: After a 4 night stay I can say we were very happy with our stay in this great hotel. Our room was very clean and in full working order. The staff were all extremly helpfull and very polite. Had a fantastic (if rather expensive) meal in the Bull and Bear.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy place, but some things a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: Snickersmama
Reviews.Content: We just got back on Saturday from my first stay in New York City. We stayed at the Waldorf Astoria because my husband had a conference for the first night, so we just elected to pay for two additional nights. I know this is a very old, historic hotel, which was pretty cool! Lobby area was very impressive. The room was decent with a great bed to sleep in, but I felt the bathroom could be updated a little bit. The only meal we had at this hotel was through the conference itself, but it was located in the Starlight room on the 18th floor, and the food was fabulous. Mostly we walked around NYC to eat and drink, but we did stop at the lounge one evening to have a cocktail before heading up to bed. One crown and 7up cost $17!! I guess that's probably normal in NYC, but it was definitely the most expensive drink I've ever ordered for a simple cocktail. One of the best things about this hotel was the location. Very close to 5th street with all of the shopping, Rockefeller Center, NBC Studios, etc. For never having been to NYC before, it was a great place to stay location-wise because it was within walking distance of so much. I would recommend this place to someone staying in NYC, as long as they are not looking for a "bargain". Also, saw a few celebrities in the hotel too, which is not something we are used to seeing in Texas, so that was great!

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Astoria - a recent stay”
Reviews.Author: Blossomcat41
Reviews.Content: Trip of a lifetime so was really looking forward to staying at this iconic hotel. But... Very impressed with the entrance and foyer area and it is certainly very grand. The doorstaff and concierge were very helpful and afternoon tea was great. Our room had a huge TV and a champagne bucket, but no kettle to make a hot drink when you return from a hectic day sightseeing. Cleanliness was also a bit of an issue as we found sweets on the floor from the previous occupant. Behind the scenes, the hotel is a bit faded and is trading on its previous glory. Would not stay again sadly.

Reviews.Title: “Classic old charm atmosphere right up to date”
Reviews.Author: izzykk
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf is as it ever was I am sure - holding onto that air of a time long gone when ladies wore white gloves and gentlemen tipped their hats! And nothing whatsoever wrong with that in my book - added to every modern day trapping that is necessary for the average traveller, this really is a lovely place to stay. The room (a twin bed suite) was pleasant - although I think one might have to pay a slightly heftier room rate to get any sort of New York City view. The service was efficient and what one would expect from a hotel in this range. I have to report that on the day of our departure after a four night stay, and whilst passing the time until driving to JFK afternoon tea on the mezzanine floor took on a surprising turn! Whilst admiring Gershwin's piano and the newly erected Christmas trees and decorations - upon returning to our table we found that it had been occupied by a native New York cockroach! Yes - only a small one, but still uninvited! The waiter was obviously mortified and acted swiftly to remove the intruder (and I imagine to quiet myself and my sister who may have been guilty of an involuntary squeal at the sight of the reddish brown creature!). I don't think that even The Waldorf is immune to the odd cockroach or - God forbid - bed bug, and of the two - I can just about put up with the cockroach nibbling on my scones! The Waldorf is an oasis in the midst of the magnificent New York madness and is my tip for a stress less stay in The Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Halloween Weekend”
Reviews.Author: ladycarolyn1
Reviews.Content: In from LaGuardia Airport on a sunny, crisp fall day to the Waldorf=Astoria. Popped into StarBuck's before heading out to Ricky's Costume Shop on 40th. Checked into our rooms which were just lovely. We walked to Times Square and noticed Charley O's had become Caffe Bene before we went to Sephora's, Swatch, Forever 21, and a small bead shop. Had a quick lunch at Pax. We watched the skaters at Rockefeller Center for a while. A very authentic Thai dinner was served at Topaz, and we followed that with the World Series final game at McGee's in Hell's Kitchen. So much snow on Saturday, we stayed in the comfort and warmth of our rooms and had a beautifully presented breakfast from room service. Everything was just perfect. The food and service was excellent. We were so relaxed in the suite we stayed in all day. Mama Pia's was the choice for dinner with wonderful homemade pastas. We followed with 'frozen hot chocolate' at Serendipity before going to the Kaufman Center for a documentary premier from Matchstick Productions. We decided on the Tower Lounge for buffet breakfast before departing for LaGuardia Airport. It's was a well planned buffet with great choices. We so enjoy our trips to New York City staying at the Waldorf=Astoria. The Best of the Best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nostalgic , beautiful hotel .”
Reviews.Author: taloolaa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this fabulous hotel in a king suite . It was well worth the money . The service was fantastic from the bell hop to the check in . You don't stay there if you want all mod cons and rooms . If you want to stay in a gracious hotel then this is the place. The only negative is the cost of room service , very over priced . These days also Internet access should be free in a 4 star hotel . Breakfast is great value opposite the hotel , the New York Luncheonette . Service and food great , only around 7 dollars !! If you are going to visit Empire State building pre book your tickets in advance as we skipped all the queues and even had an elevator to the top on our own! Absolute must !! Also if you are going to go on Statue cruises to Ellis Island or Statue of Liberty Pre book your tickets again or you will be waiting forever !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good experience.”
Reviews.Author: TonyCardiff_Wales
Reviews.Content: As usual there are always negatives, so let's get them out of the way. Firstly, our room was a bit musty, when we arrived a de-humidifier was going full blast but housekeeping soon arrived and removed it. WIFI is free in the lobby, but you have to pay to have it in your room. I was surprised not to have an in-room safe at a hotel of this standard, but other than those niggles, I was impressed with the overall comfort of the room. That said, I think one pays for the name and the location as I have stayed in better rooms elsewhere in the world at far cheaper prices. The lobby is as I imagined it would be, olde worlde art deco at its best. But for me, the key here is the location, particularly for first time visitors to New York (like myself). Time Square, Grand Central, Central Park, Rockerfeller centre and shops are all within walking distance. Across from Park Avenue, you will find SAKS only a few minutes walk away on fifth avenue, with the beautiful St.Patrick's cathedral on the opposite corner. There is a metro station near the Lexington Avenue side of the hotel and taxi's readily available which make the Waldorf an ideal base to explore New York. Reception, bell services and concierge were all good. We dined in the Bull and Bear, (which I will review seperately) which was extremely good with top class service. The hotel is steeped with history, I only wish I'd had the opportunity to take the tour of the hotel, I would certainly reccomend that visitors take a few minutes to wander around the lobby area, and read up on some of the history. If you have small children, this is probably not the best hotel, but ideal for famillies with teenagers and business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Stinky room, stained carpet; only OK with discount price”
Reviews.Author: localSanFranciscan
Reviews.Content: A beautiful lobby and great location. Only a tiny bit of "you're lucky to be here" at the check-in desk. Entering the room, strong smell of scented spray--desk offered to change me to a room that had not yet been "cleaned" that day, but I was never in the hotel at the time a room became available. I think if they cleaned, or god forbid, replaced the carpet, they wouldn't have to spray the strong-smelling air spray. The carpet was worn, nappy, linty and stained. It was a comfortable room, but nothing special. One drawback, the period bathroom had a pedestal sink and no place to put toiletries except the back of the toilet. I got a price that was equivalent with area hotels through Expedia; even so, once was enough. Oh, incorrect charges on bill at check-out-mysterious dinner bill on one room and mini-bar bill on another.

Reviews.Title: “Oldie but Goodie”
Reviews.Author: fmoussavi
Reviews.Content: I used to live this hotel for 14 years. Now that I don't live in NYC anymore, this is my favorite hotel. I know the area and it is close to everything whenever I need my NYC fix :)

Reviews.Title: “A little less than perfect”
Reviews.Author: SCinRB
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, historic hotel.... but at this price and reputation you have to expect perfection. Ordered a king bed, when we got there we were told by a very nice young lady that she just couldn't give us that room. It was too close to the elevator. Would we mind accepting a Queen bed? Well, ok... Got into the room. It was fine, the bed was a little small but hey ok, no big deal. We get a call "We'd like to send you a bottle of wine as a special gift for your inconvenience." Hey nice touch! Can you send it up now? No?? When can you send it up? Tomorrow? But wait we won't be in tomorrow... The bottle finally did show up, too late at night to drink and we were leaving the next day. It wasn't a special bottle really, so we just left it behind... Oh and another thing, that pesky WI Fi just never worked on my iPad. They were going to send someone up each day, but gosh, just never got around to it. In a hotel that entertains kings and corporate titans, those two punk rock people from LA that got a great deal on Expedia never quite got the level of service they expected.

Reviews.Title: “An old charm that amazes”
Reviews.Author: weihao07
Reviews.Content: Decided to spend our last night in New York extravagantly when we decided to book the Waldorf as our final stop. This hotel did not seem to appear as grand as it is from the outside (probably due to the upgrading works going on right now) that covered the original structure but nevertheless, walking through the doors, up the historical elevators and into the lobby was a 'wow' experience. Living up to its name as one of the world's grand old dame hotel and a place where founder Conrad Hilton decided to buy this place, it is definitely the place to be. We are a young group of friends enjoying the hustle and bustle of the city yet, staying at the Waldorf just kind of brought us to a completely different era. The interiors, decors, dim lighting, crystals, classic structure and more. This old dame is really magnificent and exudes a class of its own. The lobby is absolutely stunning with the signature clock and the Park Avenue entrance. We saw a number of them dressed up beautifully walking around the hotel - guessing there should be a high-end event happening at the Waldorf. We arrived pretty late and it was bad traffic so the cab took us to another entrance which is located at the side of the hotel. We were given a little upgrade to a larger room, though not much view, but it was big enough to accommodate all of us. The bed was really comfortable, the room had its own entrance corridor and an extremely large bathroom. What we really love most was the Salvatore Ferragamo amenities in the bath - when I return from the trip, I found out that they just launched it officially! The hotel is huge so the corridor may be quite eerie if you are not used to staying in old hotels. The doorbell is really really special! Service was good but could be better. A little miscommunication occurred during the stay but took quite a bit of time to resolve as we had to wait for half an hour, go down to the front desk and spoke to the executive on duty at the lobby. It was full house that very day so perhaps, they were really tied up but no excuses for being the top-tier in the Hilton family. Our receptionist was really friendly and helpful but the room service server who sent up our water was rude. I asked him some questions about the order mix-up and he could not be bothered - acted as though he has finished his duty for the day, hurried me to sign the bill and did not listen to my explanation. He also insisted me to contact the room service through phone rather than to speak to him! Breakfast was complimentary, lucky enough to be awarded one, as the hotel ran out of the room we reserved. It was at the Oscars and I feel it could have been better but the spread was quite a variety. The other restaurant was closed for renovation works so we did not manage to try out. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who plans to stay in New York, and hopefully get a good deal from them! We got an advance rate from their website and it was really worth it. The location is pretty convenient, lying on Park Avenue and just a few blocks away from Grand Central and Fifth Avenue. For a taste of historical hotels with grand old charm that amazes and class, consider the Waldorf Astoria. Hilton HHonors members don't really get recognised when you stay with them though.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: michyuk
Reviews.Content: An absolutely amazing hotel the staff and service were fantastic. We loved the hotel and the history that is part of this wonderful landmark. We will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “It couldn't be better!!!”
Reviews.Author: Arielfurmanski
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights, everything perfect! When checking in, ask for an updated room!

Reviews.Title: “Not what used to be, but ok”
Reviews.Author: MXvoyager1
Reviews.Content: My fourth visit to this Hotel when in NY, but little surprised, and not for good, check in was ok, crowded but ok, this time my room was the smallest I ever, but for me, now looks antique but nut updated, lines a mess, and I was wake up early by room clean service (7:30am), they suppose to know the door!. Next time i will ask only for a room by the Waldorf Towers...

Reviews.Title: “Incredible historical hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tinsco1
Reviews.Content: We had made a reservation for this hotel 2 mos. in advance for our anniversary and the person making the reservation stated that we would have an instant upgrade due to our anniversary. Upon arriving we found out that it ws never put into the computer system that way and they had no more upgrades for us. It turned out good because they brought us a refrig to our room. Disregrding all that we had a very nice stay. Very helpful and accomodating!! We really enjoyed our stay although we didn't eat at the restaurant due to other previous plans they look gorgious and beautiful. They sent us a letter apologizing about the mistake and that we would have a free upgrade to use within a year. We will be going bak and staying there. This hotel is centrally located and we could walk to anywhere we wanted. Gray line picked up in front of hotel so we could take all the tours!! Lots of ammenities and YES we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Still a remarkable place”
Reviews.Author: daveb84
Reviews.Content: On a recent two-night stay in New York, I cashed in some Hilton HHonors points that I had been squirrelling away ("slumming it" in Hampton Inns for years) just so we could stay at the Waldorf=Astoria. This is our third stay here, and second "free" one. The last time we stayed for free, they put us in a glorified broom closet (albeit one with a window overlooking the air conditioning plant). I was a bit curious as to what we would end up with this time! Check-in was quick and easy, and our room was available even at noon. Agreeing to check in at noon is often just asking for a broom closet, and I mentioned to the front desk clerk that we would be willing to stow our luggage and come back later if that would give us a better shot at a "Park Avenue view." After some ticking on the keyboard, he said that the room we could have right then was "very nice", and as it turns out, we got a generously sized room (especially by NY standards) with a Lexington Avenue view. We even got one free bottle of water out of the minibar per person per day (not a huge whoop but not $8.00 a pop, either). But the bottom line is that I felt that we were treated like frequent, full-paying customers. The room itself was very well appointed, with a couple tiny examples of the hotel's age showing through (hardly worth mentioning). The bed was very comfortable (but not Westin comfortable, though) and we drowned in the pillows provided. Toiletries were of good quality (Salvatore Ferragamo...who knew?) and good quantity. The full-sized built in medicine chest is a very convenient touch. The only complaint I had was a coffee maker is available only upon request, and the one I requested during the afternoon (in plenty of time for the next morning) was never brought up (I did not call back down a second time). And I HATE those flourescent bulbs everyone puts in hotel lamps any more, but what are you going to do? We did not hit the bars or restaurants here as we had done so during previous visits and there are millions of others in town. Tip: out the Lex Ave entrance and north a half-block is an outpost of the ubiquitous Cafe' Metro. Excellent place to begin the morning without spending a fortune. Also the 4-5-6 line subway is right at this corner, as well. I have read in many posts about poor or indifferent service in this hotel. Could it happen? Sure, especially in a hotel this size with the myriad things that go on here. But in three stays here, I have not once seen any indication of it. I simply love this hotel. It's classy and elegant and in beautiful condition. While I really enjoy the vibe of a W or a Kimpton, but there's nothing like feeling really special by staying in a "grande dame" like this.

Reviews.Title: “I expected more.”
Reviews.Author: K B
Reviews.Content: We were travelling to NYC for a romantic break and wanted to do it in style, so we chose the Waldorf. Our first impressions were very good as the foyer is just beautiful and looks as if it has been preserved in its Art Deco style. The queues to check in were long, but the staff were friendly and allowed us to check in an hour early. Our room was fine, the bathroom and fittings were a bit outdated and the shower wasn't fantastic, but it was adequate.The bed was comfy and the room was clean. We were disappointed that you had to pay through the nose in order to use Wi-Fi in our room and again if we wanted to use the gym facilities We had hoped that these would be included in a five star hotel. We went for drinks in the bar which was very pleasant but we chose to eat out of the hotel at other times. The Starbucks in the hotel is ludicrously overpriced and there are coutless others 2 or 3 minutes walk from the hotel. However, it is fantastically placed for exploring New York on foot as it is so near to many locations. It just doesn't provide the luxury experience you would hope for from such a famous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby shadow of a once grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: DAAFY
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel. I had a group deal as my conference was held here, of "only" $330 per night (plus taxes, etc.). First thing you need to know, this is a gigantic hotel, with a couple of towers, with over 1400 rooms. It's like walking into a gigantic cave, never to see daylight again. The lines to check in at the lobby were enormous, and every time I walked by it, they were the same. People, hundreds of people, everywhere. Crowded and impersonal. The décor is frozen in the 1930s, and some furniture might have been here since then. The endless hallways still stink of cigarette smoke. The rooms are... barely ok for a "semi luxury" hotel. My room had an AC installation where you could still see bare wood through the holes in the paneling. To boot, I had to call downstairs because some kind of fan next door was making such an ungodly noise that I found it difficult to sleep. The view from my window... that was a direct view of the other side of my tower and was decidedly depressing; I kept my shades down all the time. I called the operator to find out if I had to go to another tower to access the 18th ("Starlight") floor for my event, to be told I had to. Turns out I didn't have to - I could have just gone straight up using my elevator. Why didn't they know this? The staff seems either composed of super senior citizens well past retirement age, or super junior people completely wet behind the ears. In a word: "Meh". I guess for a reimbursed business trip this is ok - if you are looking for a special experience, there are better, way better, hotels in NYC in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby rooms and some quirky service”
Reviews.Author: larrybud
Reviews.Content: I'm a displaced New Yorker, so after not having lived in the city for over 20 years, I thought for my first NYC hotel stay ever, it would be great to stay at the Waldorf. I knew it had been under renovation for some time, but I had seen the reviews start to improve, and expected that the refurbishment was starting to show benefits to guests. I did contact the hotel in advance to express my concerns about getting a shabby room, and was assured they would get me a good room. First impression of the hotel was not good. Our car from the airport pulls up to the main entrance, and the doorman comes to the trunk of the car was it opens and takes out my carry-on bag, leaving me and my wife to handle our two large suitcases. Then he just leaves us there with the three suitcases. I figured, what the hell, lets just go check-in. But there is no way for a guest to get into the front door with suitcases, as there is a staircase immediately inside. Finally the aloof doorman asked if we would like him to take care of the bags for us. I held back any sarcastic replies and confirmed. At check-in I again asked about the room, and was advised we'd been upgraded to a Superior room. I also asked about further upgrades, as I had opted in advance to pay up for these if they were available. The check-in guy didn't seem to take any notice of what I was saying. Well, I will admit the room was large. Probably last decorated in the 1980's and last maintained not any time in the recent past. I cant fault a room for decor, as that it a matter of taste, but this was just lacking in any way. It's the Waldorf ! It should at least have some opulence and air of luxury, rather than old tenement. It just felt dirty. Carpeting left much to be desired. No hotel slippers in the room, but the next day I managed to get 2 pair by going down to the lobby. In the bathroom was rust around the bathroom fixtures, peeling paint and just a plain old smell. I will give them kudos for bringing us a second fridge. The fridges in the room do not allow you to take anything out, without immediately being charged. Whether you use the product or not. We had medication with us that needed to be kept refrigerated. So they did at least bring us one of the older fridges. I just wonder why they upgrade the fridges and not the rest of the room. The best thing about the room was the bed. It's that nice Hilton bed, very comfy. Rest of the room was the pits. The lobby is great, and it liked a NYC thoroughfare. Crowded, noisy and full of atmosphere. Don't stay here if you are looking for the personal touch. We only had drinks once at Peacock Alley. Otherwise we didn't frequent any of the other bars or restaurants in the hotel. We purposely did not take breakfast in the hotel, as this is NYC, and I wanted to get out on the streets. By day 2 we found Burger Heaven a short walk away, and had nice diner style breakfasts at the counter. Nice clean, reasonable and cheerful place with many regulars and friendly staff. As for the W=A, will give it a miss on my next trip back to the city.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT TIME”
Reviews.Author: fruitbat100
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a stay at the Waldorf,it was pure class. The room was great,staff helpful throughout the whole stay,the tour was great as was the fantastic guide. The bed was awsome,so comfortable. Thank you so much

Reviews.Title: “The way a hotel should be.”
Reviews.Author: chostetler
Reviews.Content: It's not often that you can stay at a hotel and feel like royalty. The Waldorf truly is a one of kind experience. The staff goes above and beyond out of their way to make your stay memorable. It's an older hotel, but the nostalgia and history you experience makes up for that. Also, the hotel is an excellent location. Everybody should stay at the Waldorf at least once!

Reviews.Title: “Reception area is an unorganized mess.”
Reviews.Author: multitrips
Reviews.Content: It took longer to check in than it took to get from Newark in a cab. The staff attitude was totally wrong and the staff on duty to manage the reception area were clueless. Rooms are tiny but clean and the cleaning staff very pleasant and helpful. Definitely not going back - there are much better hotels in the area at less cost.

Reviews.Title: “1 stay, 20 nights”
Reviews.Author: cokosmomma
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd stay at the Waldorf=Astoria and each visit has provided a different experience. On my first visit my room was large but VERY dated. The furnishings improved with the 2nd and final stay, or maybe my expectations were lowered. This visit was for 20 consecutive nights so it quickly became home away from home. The staff at the Waldorf does a great job considering the number of guests they must service each day and I think I had the friendliest & most accommodating housekeeper ever. I'm not a big fan of the front desk as it seems to always have a line, so I tend to take care of my business during off peak times (early AM or late PM). With so many wonderful properties in NYC this isn't my absolute favorite, but if you're into nostalgia and antique furnishings it will be the place for you. Compared to other NYC hotel rooms it's by far the most spacious; however, I think the hotel could be refreshed. That being said f I can secure (and afford) room 1108 on every visit I would chose the W=A every time. It comes with double beds along with a separate changing room and a lovely marble bathroom. My second choice is any standard corner room. Not to complain about money but the drinks in the lobby bar are pricey so be ready. I couldn't even justify it on an expense account so I found Snafu Bar a few blocks away where the drinks are strong and cheap. I'd recommend the Waldorf to others to try at least once. It's a NYC landmark.

Reviews.Title: “Nice - Good Location, Helpful Staff and Stylish Room”
Reviews.Author: PerantauDunia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on week 2 of a business trip after staying at the club Quarters and Intercontinental for the first week. GOOD: 1. Very helpful, dedicated staff - Although my business travel agency messed up and booked me a room in Waldorf London instead of NYC, and I arrived very late on Sunday night, the person at the reception did absolutely everything to make sure I can get a room and was even willing to get me the corporate rate I was initially promised by the travel agent. She even went away to get 2 levels of approval to put me up in a tower suite for 1 night as they were fully booked. 2. Value - this is a luxury hotel in mid-town and for the price I paid (around the $250 mark) it's really good value. It is close to attractions in mid-town. 3. Wifi in the lobby (Big hotels obviously don't usually give wifi) 4. Rooms are stylish, comfortable and of a decent size. Note however, this is decent size for NYC - those making comparisons with Luxury hotels in other cities will be thoroughly disappointed. 5. Big Reception area for check in and check-out, saving you time. 6. Beautiful Lobby. SO-SO/BAD: 1. Fitness room is small and basic considering this is a luxury hotel. I would have expected a bigger room, although it's usually not busy when I was there. 2. Had one instance where when I asked a staff member at the reception for direction to the elevator to the tower floors, he was polite enough, but you can see the 'what is it now!' look on him, but lets give him the benefit of the doubt as he may have had a bad day. SUMMARY: 5 stars definitely for the service and the value. The rooms are also very stylish for a luxury mid-town hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: JimeSoto
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with many reviewers when they say this hotel is living only on the history it has. I was at the Lymphoma Myeloma Congress October 19-23 and found terrible service for the group I went with (over 10 people). Individual credit cards were charged with room rates and taxes when everything had already been paid for over a month ago, mail and paperwork was impossible to find at the Business Center and the Front Desk when it was actually there!!! In a nutshell very overpriced for such a bad customer service!!!!

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL IN THE BEST CITY IN THE WORLD”
Reviews.Author: ilovecurtis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf=Astoria with my husband and son for 6 nights on a 'once in a lifetime' trip to New York to celebrate my 40th birthday. What a dream come true! from the moment we entered the fantastic building we were treated special. We had a room overlooking Park Avenue and as it was my 40th, management sent cheese and wine to our room, which surprised us, as we are just an ordinary family, but they made us feel like the only people there. My tips for this hotel are to treat the hotel as part of your holiday (not just as somewhere to sleep) as the hotel is absolutely fascinating and I tried to spend as much time as possible looking around the hotel (they have glass cabinets with items relating to its history and its famous residents) and people watching in the lobby. If i had to be critical (and i really don't want to be) it would be that as its such a beautiful hotel and is very busy sometimes i found it quite difficult to find a seat in either the Park Ave lobby or the main lobby, but its worth waiting for! On another note, we upgraded before travelling from a deluxe room to a Superior Room, which although i don't know what a deluxe room is like, our room was via a small hallway (how posh)!rather than straight off a corridor and i'm guessing slightly bigger, with a better view. The room was equipped with all the necessary items you would expect including mini bar and ipod dock, and the bathroom/dressing area was immense and decked out in marble. Housekeeping did a great job and it seemed everytime we left the room, someone would come in and sort it out for us, including 'turn down' i.e getting the room ready for sleep with dimming the lights, shutting the curtains and turning down the bed......heaven. In a nutshell, THE BEST HOTEL IN THE BEST CITY IN THE WORLD.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: BizTravelerDeluxe
Reviews.Content: My wife and three kids stayed in the Waldorf Astoria on a holiday around Christmas. We chose the Waldorf Astoria because of its world renowned name and as it is an older hotel we believed the rooms would be a much better size. We booked a suit and the room was large for NY so that was good, but unfortunately this is where it all ended. The ground floor is quite beautiful as the picture on the web-site suggests, but this did not flow through the rest of the hotel. The room was quite dated, as was the entire hallway from the elevator to the room. Now I understand an old hotel will by its nature be “dated”, but it seemed a lot worse than it needed to be. Perhaps worst of all was the service. For example, we got a call to ask how things were going – nice touch. I told them that the bar fridge had the temperature of a pyretic camel on a sand dune in Saudi Arabia and they claimed it was the most important thing they could ever do to have it fixed and…. The next day they called again and I told them the same story… then the next day. I even went to the front desk and let them know…. Then they called the next day to see how things were going… this went on for a week! Then to top it off, we probably had the worst breakfast ever in Oscar’s Brassiere. It was dreadful and even had a bug in one of the buffet dishes. We needed going to another restaurant a few blocks away and went from a meal we couldn’t eat to a decent one for far less than half of the price. The hotel has a lot of history and this is a nice touch. I get the feeling they rest on this “heritage” as they can’t be relying on return visits if my experience is anything to go by.

Reviews.Title: “A True Landmark”
Reviews.Author: JamesII
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a truly enjoyable and memorable visit to NYC. WHile in New York my wife and I were fortunate enough to stay at the Waldorf Astoria. This is a wonderful hotel with attentive staff and the building itself is a destination. The dining in the Bull and Bear was excellent. Peacock Alley and Sir Harry's are great spots to have a cocktail (we received two complimentary ones when we checked in). The Sunday brunch at Peacock Alley is massive (and a bit expensive but impressive nonetheless). My wife and I booked the two hour hotel tour the Saturday we were there and I highly recommend it. The tour of the huge kitchen(s) was a highlight as were the many ballrooms and meeting rooms we saw. The suite we visited near the end reminded me of the Royal York in Toronto. The tour ended at Oscar's for a buffet lunch that was included in the tour. As Gold members we had breakfast coupons good for a "continental breakfast" at the on site Starbucks. It actually worked out very well. You can substitute their oatmeal for the pastry. It was all we needed to start the day. The location of the Waldorf Astoria is excellent. You can walk to many of the main attractions in the city and you are only three blocks from a subway line that will get you wherever you want to go. It also connects you to Penn Station where you can pick up the AirTrain in the NJ Transit system that quickly and reasonably gets you directly into the Newark Airport. Our stay at the Waldorf Astoria is something we will long remember and fondly.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Our Expectations...”
Reviews.Author: Anne S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I attended the Opening Gala of the Metropolitan Opera September 26th in celebraton of our 40th anniverary and we chose The Waldorf Astoria to complete our fairytale evening! Everything about your hotel surpassed our expectations during the three days we stayed there. The staff person who checked us in was so personable, professional and helpful. There was a slight issue with our room and we were graciously upgraded at no extra charge. The room was perfect and the bedding incredibly comfortable. The hotel itself is so elegant in everyway and filled with wonderful history! It has a great location and it's an easy walk to Times Square. In our opinion, everything from the moment we walked through your door until we left...was PERFECT!! During our next stay in NYC, you would be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey J
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels we have stayed, and customer service was an absolute priority for the staff. We were treated very well and we have no complaints. The hotel has a rich history, and it was fun to see all of the past VIPs who have stayed here. Despite the hotel's age, it was clean and adequately updated. The staff was very friendly and helpful with any and all concerns we had. It is also close to everything -- Times Sq, Central Park, and a subway station are all well within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Never meet your childhood heroes”
Reviews.Author: Pomtiddly
Reviews.Content: As I was checking in, the rest of the United Nations were checking out, probably why I got such a good rate for the room. Admittedly I was a tad early for check in but I expected a bit more in the way of customer service and pampering from such an iconic hotel. Instead my bag was whisked away to the store and I was dismissed to amuse myself for a couple of hours until the agreed 3:00pm check in time. Not much fun when you have been travelling for 12 hours. So I was less than impressed when I re-presented myself at the agreed hour only to be told that as the ‘system’ was down they could not process any check-ins and to ‘check back’ in an hour! After a bit of protesting I was grudgingly given a voucher for a free drink in the bar, and at $20 for a small glass of wine I sure as hell was not going to pay for one, and after further protest they added 24 hours free Wi-fi access (normally $15.95 a day). The reception staff were professionally sympathetic, albeit the rather effeminate male receptionist a bit over the top. ( He reminded me of Serge from Beverly Hills Cop, I think his name was Ramone, but of course it would be), but it did seem all very rehearsed and training manual derived as opposed to spontaneous and genuine. In short, it was all very hiltonised. I had requested, and got, a room as high up as possible, on the 51st floor with sort of views of sort of the Queensborough bridge sort of between the buildings. The room was a ‘Queen’ room, quite consistently appropriate given my check in experience. As one would expect from such a place everything was in impeccable condition if a little bit dated from a design point of view, very 80’s country house hotel type décor. Other than that it was a very, very average 5 star hotel room. In fact, if you forgot about the fact that it was such an iconic hotel it was all a bit disappointing and poor value, even on the special rate paid. I’ve had a lot better for less (as the politician said to the…..) As for the food. I had room service on the first night. I mean you can’t stay at the Waldorf Hotel and not have a Waldorf Salad can you? So I was a bit miffed when all I got was a rather small ordinary almost waldorf free salad, (I’m sorry, we’re right out of Waldorfs at the moment, there has to be a sitcom in that somewhere) an un-chilled plastic bottle of still water with a glass of ice and a wedge of what looked like bought in cheesecake delivered on a trolley. Again all very basic and $65 to boot! After that I decided to avoid the $30 breakfast, instead I ended up having a veritable feast each morning for $3.99 in the Madison Avenue deli just around the corner. I had dinner in the Bull and Bear cocktail bar on the last night but again it turned out to be very, very expensive for what it was. Again, poor value. Would I stay here again. Definitely not. They say that you should never actually meet your childhood heroes as it inevitably leads to disappointment. In that respect, having always had a fascination with iconic hotels, the Waldorf proved how very true that is.

Reviews.Title: “waldorf manhattan”
Reviews.Author: cody4512
Reviews.Content: we stayed at waldorf on the 7th oct to 9th oct 2011 and i will have to say it was one of the worst hotels we ever stayed at, we booked a junior suite and it was dirty dull boring and totally overpriced, was looking at some of your reviews and i think we might have stayed at different hotel but no we stayed at waldorf, we also felt the staff were average and food was very average we stayed for brunch on sunday at a cost of 220 for two and to be honest we would have been better going to local diner for something to eat. we also have travelled around the world from s,a to new zeland to london. cheers cody

Reviews.Title: “GREAT BIRTHDAY TRIP- thanks to the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: A.MACCA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my partners birthday and loved it. The reception area is beautiful and we went for Thanksgiving Nov and loved it. Been to NYC a few times and stayed here and the Sofitel. Both hotels are excellent. Loved the opulence of the Waldorf and the history, but also loved the Sofitel French chic The Waldorf, was excellent, room is large enough for NYC standards and all the staff we had dealings with were professional and great. It was lovely to see NYC ready for thanksgiving, then after 27 November the Christmas decorations went up in the hotel and it looked beautiful. Also the Shops have all the Christmas decorations out. Well worth going around this time, but be aware the prices are little bit dearer due to the "Thanksgiving" HOLIDAYS and you can pay a premium. I would suggest, book a few days after thanksgiving and prices goes a bit cheaper, but to be honest my partners birthday is in the middle of thanksgiving and i would still pay the extra to go to NYC at this time for flight/hotels Rooms facilities are excellent, bed was huge and very comfy. I would stay again in this hotel and love NYC so much to do just not shopping. Been to NYC 4 times and still find new things to do there Waldorf is not far from Grand central station but a slight walk from Park Ave to the main shopping areas and Broadway but enjoyable walking...in NYC you got to walk to see the place, Central park, we have been and seen parts of this great park and we still have not seen all of it...it is big and you need a few days to fully explore it, what we do is each visit search another area of the park... dont forget the central park zoo and the polar bears, John Lennon memorial "Imagine!" Is there as well, you can also get a horse and cart ride around the park Enjoy the Waldorf and NYC.. we will be back again and again and i would stay again at the Waldorf or Waldorf Towers or the Sofitel again..just love it!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience”
Reviews.Author: Michelle M
Reviews.Content: Would recommend the Waldorf=Astoria in New York, New York for anyone who wants to experience not only the old world charm, elegance, and beauty of this one block historic hotel between Lexington and Park Avenues, 49th and 50th streets, but the wonderful food, decor, and excellent service of the staff. We had the opportunity to celebrate my parents' 50th wedding anniversary there and enjoyed the expertise and professional service of the various departments from Sales, Events, Guest Services, Housekeeping, and Room Service. It was a wonderful experience for everyone in our family and the courteous and friendly nature of the staff, hotel wide, made the time we spent there even more wonderful than just the hotel itself. If you have not had the opportunity to stay at the Waldorf=Astoria in New York City I would highly recommend it, even if you are a New Yorker.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cander60
Reviews.Content: We took two rooms, a quick phone call before we set off ensured we had connecting rooms, top marks Waldorf. Rooms possibly would be a little tired but charming nonetheless. Bar- after a few lessons they turned out some pretty acceptable Bandy Alexanders. Bull and Bear - best steak I've ever eaten, better than I cook myself. Concierge - efficient with good advice for shows. Breakfast - donno we never had it in the hotel - why bother. We will come back

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room, loved the details in the decor”
Reviews.Author: cjg2901
Reviews.Content: This historic hotel still has all the attention to detail in the decor that most hotels don't have. The elevators, hotel lobby, and hallways still have the most beautiful touches. Like most NYC hotels, the room and bathroom were small, but they were decorated beautifully and clean. We did visit the Bull and Bear bar two nights and enjoyed desserts there. I would return to this hotel. We have been to NYC many times and lived there for a few months, I think this place has alot of charm for the price

Reviews.Title: “A tired old lady”
Reviews.Author: RuthT00TH
Reviews.Content: (or expensive old hag as my husband called it!) Such a disappointment - this was to be a highlight of our North American tour, but our 4 night stay in this gracious icon was far from what we expected. The hotel is operating on it's previous reputation. The building is still splendid and at first glance so are the furnishings, but the decay is obvious once you check in. We had to switch rooms twice due to malfunctioning plumbing. The suite we finally settled in had functioning plumbing but it had faulty light switches, scuffed and worn wallpaper and paintwork, a large gap under the door to the hallway which allowed in noise from the hallway & lifts. Many of the usual services came at an extra cost such as internet access & hot tub. There was no pool or gym. Meals and drinks were way too expensive. My recommendation - go for a look, but don't stay there. There are many other hotels in the same price range or less.

Reviews.Title: “Faded splendor but splendor non the less...”
Reviews.Author: Kazzy76
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Waldorf twice. First in 2006 and again in 2008 and a return to New York next year is in the pipeline and i wouldn't hesitate to book the Waldorf! It's arguably one of the most famous hotels in New York, if not the world, and has long epitomised the upper class choice. However, it may look and feel upper class, but if you shop around then the prices aren't as bad as you might think. The second you walk into the main entrance off Park Avenue your breath is taken away by the sheer opulence and the inviting scent of fresh flowers which are in a massive display almost dominating the marble floored entrance. Walking through to reception you pass Harry's Bar (more on this later) and your immediately transported back to the 1930's with all the wood panelling and Art Deco glamour. Check in is always swift and efficient. The receptionists don't generally exude the same relentless niceties that you find in the big department stores but then this is the Waldorf Astoria and not Macy's so a little decorum is expected. From receptions it's straight into one of the bank of elevators that seem to arrive surprisingly swiftly to take you to your floor. We didn't pay extra for a delux room or suite preferring to save our money for the shops and you do notice this reflected in the decor of the room. It's clean and tidy and functional but, in my honest opinion, it's not particularly glamourous. Having said that, how much time do you expect to spend in your room when you're in New York!!! Robes and slippers are provided and the maids clean the room and change the towels daily. Newspapers can also be delivered daily if requested. We were surprised to note that there were no tea or coffee making facilities but room service was only a phone call away! When it comes to drinking and eating, as with most decent NYC hotels, there's a wide selection of both. As i mentioned earlier, you can't go to the Waldorf without visiting Harry's Bar. It's a delightfully charming bar situated just off the main reception area. It's pretty low key - a small screen in the background keeps you abreast of the news around the world but people go there simply to meet and chat. As with most NYC hotels, the drinks aren't cheap but then what price is an ambiance like the one on offer at Harrys? Then there's the iconic Bull and Bear situated on the other side of the hotel with an external door leading out onto the hustle and bustle of Lexington Avenue. This bar is where you'll see high-flying business men striking deals and watching the latest stock prices filter through on the ticker tape. Opt for a seat at the bar to watch the bar tenders mixing an endless array of cocktails - if you're not sure what to have then tell them what you like and let them do the rest. Or, you can bag a discrete table in the corner for a more intimate evening. Food is available in the Bull and Bar or you can book a table at the restaurant adjoining. We chose to stay in the bar to eat and just had a couple of starters between us as the portions are pretty generous. In the main reception lies Peacock Alley open from breakfast through to dinner. We've not eaten here, preferring instead the hustle and bustle of the Bull and Bear. For breakfast though, it's got to be Oscars for some AMAZING American waffles and pancakes or for lunch to taste the eponymous waldorf salad. Location wise, the Waldorf is ideally located close to mid-town and just a short walk from Grand Central Station and the Empire State building. In summary, if sleek and chic is your bag then the Waldorf probably isn't for you but if you want to experience some real old fashioned New York glamour then look no further, i promise you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel on a grand scale”
Reviews.Author: gmorris194
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business back in July 2011, this was the first time i had stayed here and i must say was really impressed with the granduer and style of the hotel. The lobby is amazing and very stylish. The room i had was great, i do know that some rooms are dated and are being refurbished but mine was perfect - minor thing is the air con is a little noisey so if your a light sleeper then it might disturb you but was no problem for me. The food at the hotel is pricey but hey its your choice if you pay it or not. Overall great stay and great base to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive but worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: Pari072808
Reviews.Content: My husband had a seminar to attend at this hotel. So i decided to join him. We had our own car and paid $66/- for parking it overnight at the hotel. Food at the hotel is great but we only ate here once as we wanted to try other types of food.

Reviews.Title: “Our weekend at the Waldorf-Astoria in New York City”
Reviews.Author: Andrew T
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Waldorf in New York City for two nights, celebrating her birthday. The accommodations were wonderful. The room was spacious and very quiet, the bed was extremely comfortable, and the amenities were first class. Additionally, the treatment by the staff, from the manager to the bellman, was very thoughtful, courteous and professional. They made us feel like we were the only guests in the hotel with their attention, which was definitely not the case. Everyone went out of their way to make us feel welcome and comfortable. The concierge gave us great suggestions, and cabs would pull up almost immediately with the help of the doorman. I travel all throughout the country, and I have stayed in hundreds of hotels in New York City. The Waldorf, by far, is the best. All in all, the exquisite treatment of the staff and the beautiful accommodations made this a memorable birthday for my wife, for which we are both most grateful.

Reviews.Title: “A grand lady the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: Travels4love
Reviews.Content: Have travelled extensively but this was our first visit to the big apple. The Waldorf Astoria did not disappoint with the feeling of history and tradition apparent in the service through to the decor and architecture. I appreciate good service and we found it here from when we first checked in, with the friendly bellhop, the eager to please concierge and the efficient doorman. The room was spacious and well appointed with nice linens. My only complaint of our room was a slight odor which I could likely have been rid of if our window opened. I find that complimentary wifi is to be expected more and more these days, but unfortunately not so here. The location for us was good as this was our first visit to this city we wanted to see most of the tourist sites. The walking distance proximity to Times square, 5th ave, many restaurants and central park was perfect. Transportation was convenient by subway, right outside the hotel or taxi if needed. We had a great time and plan to be back!

Reviews.Title: “What a treat!”
Reviews.Author: kitkat65
Reviews.Content: The end of a perfect 2 week cruise from Europe - the Waldorf was truly wonderful and full of so much history and character - so glad we did not book a sterile modern hotel. The Lobby is magnificent, a tour in itself. Service is wonderful, we felt so welcome and pampered. We arrived quite early at 10.30 from our Ship and our pre-paid Superior Room was not ready - we treated ourselves to an already- available Suite 1760 for additional $100, just had to be done! Room extremely comfortable, but must need 24/7 TLC as very old. Bed amazingly comfy, huge flatscreen TV, sofa & 2 chairs in lounge area, + small kitchenette + marble bathroom. Huge wardrobe with safe and usual bits and pieces. Great view of Park Avenue. Great base to explore, sightseeing bus stops right outside (that costs $50 pp 48 hours, fab value) for tours to take you all around Manhatten Island hop on & off. Sat in 'Bull & Bear' that evening for cocktails and watched New Yorkers in action (!) - service slick but friendly. Had lunch in Peacock Alley before transfer to JFK and had the Waldorf Salad (of course) - experience not to be missed. If you want history as we brits do, as well as a comfy night's sleep and great location, couldn't do better than WA. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: DingoBeast
Reviews.Content: Great central location for business travel. The rooms could use a little updating but are generally as outdated as the other hotels in this price range in the area. The staff and service is very excellent...my cable was out for an hour which didn't inconvenience me in the least but they provided me with free breakfast for every day of my stay because of the "inconvenience." The staff goes above and beyond here...pleasurable stay!

Reviews.Title: “The best ONE”
Reviews.Author: Dario S
Reviews.Content: I will recommend to everyone who it's going to visit NY. Amazing place, amazing hotel, I had an excellent stay at the Waldorf Towers last month, I felt like being home, first class service!! Thank you very much. I hope to come back as soon as possible to New York and of course my first thought will be to sleep by The Waldorf Astoria once again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: hbrWoking
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as it's such a historic hotel to be in when visiting New York. The staff were wonderful, and the hotel lovely. It was not outrageously priced and our room was beautiful with 3 huge windows to gaze out of.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Jacquie V
Reviews.Content: My kids and I stayed at the Waldorf for 4 nights, and were treated like Royalty. The room, although dated in furnishings and decoration was clean and comfortable. The kids especially enjoyed the separate dressing room in the junior suite. We were in and out all day long and were greeted with smiles and courtesy by the staff at every turn. Please try the Eggs Benedict at the lobby restaurant....they created it, and they own it. It was amazing! We walked at Central Park, shopping on 5th Avenue, Grand Central, Roosevelt Centre and a million other locations quickly and easily from here, but loved the fact that a taxi was always at the ready at the front door to take you anywhere for next to nothing. It was a joy to stay somewhere with so much history...every president since FDR has stayed there, and Joe Bidon arrived while we were there. An incredible experience!

Reviews.Title: “worth the price for the glamor and tradition”
Reviews.Author: redscarfox
Reviews.Content: we got what we expected. The so called deluxe rooms are really just standard hotel rooms which are somewhat dated and quite small. What you pay for though is the glamor and elegance and history of the building itself and in that we weren't disappointed. the staff were brilliant throughout the hotel and the service was second to none. Like a previous reviewer the lobby was closed when we arrived due to a wedding but that just added to the experience, we were able to enjoy the lobby on the following days

Reviews.Title: “Still a great classic”
Reviews.Author: HappySwan
Reviews.Content: I've always had a soft spot for Waldorf Astoria and it has that touch of old world glamour. To be fair, it has been over 10 years since I last stayed there. I like the conservative classic decor though it may not be to everyone's taste. I didn't realise that the hotel is so massive with literally thousands of rooms. Didn't use much of the hotel facilities this time but still have fond memories of past events there, especially ones at the ballroom.

Reviews.Title: “Felt very pampered”
Reviews.Author: lurdes8
Reviews.Content: Went their because my husband and I were being honored in NYC. The hotel was beautiful. It is a bit pricey but the service is great. It was close to many attractions. I did not give it 5 stars because they closed the lobby one day for a wedding. We felt a little shortchanged not being able to enjoy the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Classic glamour, fabulous location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: kate3346
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf is known for its classic, old style elegance and it didn't disappoint. We had a wonderful time when we stayed there in September. The lobby is beautiful, with a very opulent and classy atmosphere. Yes, like other reviewers have said, rooms are a bit dated, but the classic elegance, great service and fabulous location keeps the hotel up to a very high standard. Room service wise, we had a continental breakfast with coffee in our room every morning which was delicious (fabulous coffee). We also had an evening meal in our suite and it was wonderful; delicious food and lots of little finishing touches which made the experience even more special. All of the room service and house keeping staff were lovely, very helpful and attentive. We also had a really fantastic meal at Bull and Bear, definitely have a dinner there during your stay- I highly recommend the Surf and Turf (steak and lobster, divine! Lobster was so fresh and tasty!) Staff there also absolutely excellent. A five star stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and location.”
Reviews.Author: philshadwell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf Astoria for our Honeymoon. From the moment we checked in to the moment we left we found it a very pleasant place to stay. When we checked in we were upgraded and given a bottle of champagne on the house. The room on the 15th floor was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The view wasn't the greatest but we were only in the room to sleep and get changed as we were out for most of the time we were there. The staff were friendly and helpful. We certainly had no complaints about the hotel. The hotel is located on Park Avenue and Lexington, Its close to the subway which gives access to the whole of New York and it's easily accessible to Times Square and the other sites in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!!”
Reviews.Author: heelsfan603
Reviews.Content: This hotel is overrated, outdated and most importantly.. has bed bugs! I handed the desk attendant a glass with a bed bug in it as I checked out this morning. He was sincere in his apology and as grossed out as me - but in the end, NEVER staying here again. Lobby is great... no need to go any furtherl

Reviews.Title: “A classic beauty, always a pleasure...”
Reviews.Author: DenverDoctorMom
Reviews.Content: The New York Waldorf Astoria oozes the very rich and stunning history that gave it its reputation and keeps the "OOH" factor high. Always elegant, stunningly rich and soaking in charm, it is a sure bet when in Gotham. The staff and personnel were outstanding and again remembered the definition of "service" in an industry that sometimes forgets....even giving a credit when the TV was broken without our request. On a busy Labor Day weekend, complete with the US Open in town and seemingly half the players staying there, the Concierge managed to find tickets to "Book of Mormon" which was otherwise sold out until February. The lobby is always gorgeous, the Front Desk staff always accommodating. Drinks at Sir Harry's, though overpriced, even for New York, were lovely. A couple small complaints kept this from being a perfect stay, although it was lovely and would never keep me from returning: 1. the room was small overall--don't look for tons of space: this is New York ! 2. the noise in the hall was too much, and consistent. On a high floor that was mostly suites, kids running around and frequent "beeps" from the elevator was not exactly what we hoped for... 3. the speed of the wireless connection in the room was abysmal. That said, I would and will go back. Again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel but the rooms let it down..”
Reviews.Author: Frenchbantam
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 3 nights in the Waldorf. Arrived tired and hot after a BA flight from London. The check-in staff were very pleasant, befitting a really impressive lobby. However,as most other reviewers have said, the rooms are old and tired. I struggled to use the TV, couldn't turn a bedside light off so eventually had to unscrew the lightbulb. The good points; the valet was good and he had my laundry back when he promised. The room service breakfast was excellent but a little pricey. The bad points; the wi-fi was so incredibly slow that I gave up. The air conditioning was too noisy and the walls are so thin that I heard the constant ringing of the phone in the room next door. Would I stay again? No, I much prefer the St. Regis.

Reviews.Title: “Living off its reputation and impressive lobby”
Reviews.Author: Ken_and_Nyetta
Reviews.Content: While the lobby remains impressive, everything else about the Waldorf Astoria screams "faded glory" -- both the service and the physical amenities. We waited about 20 minutes to check-in and through the many times I walked through the lobby during our stay I always saw the line waiting at check-in. Our room had a strong smell of something chemical -- maybe formaldehyde? The 1960's vintage A/C unit did little to dehumidify the room, leaving it sticky feeling. The heavy sliding doors on the closets had been painted over so many times that paint clogged their tracks, making opening and closing the closet a real chore. The furniture had once been very nice but was now chipped and worn. I've stayed in much more comfortable 3-star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Living something of a dream! Coming to America style!”
Reviews.Author: coz2006ster
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March of 2009 and was awed by how beautiful the setup inside was. The service was beyond expectations, as they went out of there way to hook a girl up for a birthday. Originally I booked a single double bed and they gave me a king size. They called me by name and made me feel very welcomed. The room was clean except for a few lint balls in the bathroom. The view was of the street, not extremely impressive but okay. The bar was definitely overpriced but the drinks were good. Upon check out which was like 3 in the morning, the wake up call was very prompt. And when I had to come back from the airport cancelling my flight, they put me back in the room at no charge and allowed me free late check out. I felt blessed being able to walk the halls of famous people before me. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, great location, but the rest not that impressive”
Reviews.Author: bilgong2
Reviews.Content: At $600+, even with NYC prices and its location (hey, there's a Marriott and the Intercontinental across the streets that share the same location), I had mixed feelings about it. I think you're mostly paying for their lobby decor and their history. Pros: Location. Beautiful lobby floor. Cons: Shows sign of age. Small rooms (but oh well it's midtown). - The bathroom toilet didn't flush well. Out of the say 10 times I flushed the toilet during my 3 day stay, I had to reflush 7 times. The bathroom ceiling looked like it had water damage (those bubbles looking things). Their air vent was FILTHY. I can understand they don't want to do major repairs, but cleaning air vents is easy to do. Dust was caked on so thick in some places it was starting to fall down in chunks. It's right above your showerhead, so you can't miss noticing it taking a shower. Ick. It was like that the entire stay. - Metal detectors. Yes, the first thing I encountered was those airport security type metal detectors. I had to stand in line and put my handbag in the detectors. Not very welcoming. Plus I went out for coffee and came back in 15 min. I still had to stand in line again and do the same thing. I was there during UNGA. Swarms of delegates everywhere. Hotel must have been at full capacity. - Overzealous hotel maids checking on security? Getting out of the room in the morning, a hotel maid stopped me and said "Excuse me, what room are you coming from?" I said 12XX. She said she was used to seeing a tall girl there, not me, and waited expectantly, as if I needed to explain further. So I said "Yes, that's my friend." Are the hotel maids here doubling up as hotel security?? I was dressed in khakis and a white shirt with wet hair from having just showered, no makeup. Did I look like I wasn't supposed to be staying there? The maid was courteous but it was odd to be asked what room I had come out of. We had put out the "do not disturb" sign so it couldn't have been that the maid was figuring out whether to clean the room or not. Front desk: My friend got a message that a package had been delivered. They told her they couldn't bring it up to her. So we went to pick it up after dinner. The front desk person after midnight could not find any notation of a package. He checked several times and said it simply wasn't there. He asked to describe what we were expecting. Friend said "Black dress, from St. John's" and that we were down there because another person earlier had told us the dress could not be delivered to the room (at the Waldorf?! Don't they have staff to do this sort of thing?). He finally found a reference to the package and told us it was in their Business Center, that he had to first contact some other person to get the key to the center, etc. We got tired of waiting and asked him whether he could send the dress to the room. Thank goodness he said yes. I was beginning to think we were at Holiday Inn Express or something.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Experience - Fantastic Upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: Claire H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Waldorf in August as part of a trip to The US and Canada before returning to the UK on the QM2. We stayed for four nights. Our party consisted of my husband and I and our 2 boys aged 12 and 9. On checking in we waited a few minutes and another desk was opened and we were served by the Night Manager "Yon". He went to check us in and commented that he thought the room that we had booked would not be comfortable for as my husband is 6ft 10" tall and we had booked a double-double. We assured him that we were used to it but he offered us a suite albeit on the smoking floor. We gratefully accepted and excited went up to "17H". The suite of rooms was absolutely beautiful. We had a marble lobby area with butler area, a massive sitting room with windows over Park Avenue and a view of the Empire State Building from 49th Street window. There was a massive master bedroom with huge flat screen TV, DVD player and Bose radio. There was a large dressing room and a huge marble bathroom with separate toilet and shower and bath with 2 vanity areas. The rooms were spotlessly clean and richly furnished. There was bottled water and bowls of fruit that arrived at intervals. The suite smelt beautiful - not of smoke that you might have expected. The hotel delivered 2 rollaway beds for the boys and they set up camp in the sitting room. We are delighted to have a few nights in our own room after many days travelling altogether! The Concierge were very helpful in recommeding restaurants that the children would also like and all staff that we encountered were friendly and efficient. The hotel itself was like walking back in time. The displays and photos all around I found very interesting and we looked around the hotel and the various function rooms and you can begin to imagine what life for the guilded few was like 80 odd years ago. The hotel trades on it's past and why not - I really enjoyed it - and the people watching! It tied in nicely with the final part of our holiday - travelling home on the last ocean liner. For that our cabin was smaller than the walk in wardrobe in the Waldorf! We had a fantastic time in New York and the Waldorf is ideally placed for a trip to NYC and to to stay in the style we were given made it all the more special - Thank you so much. I very much doubt we would ever get an opportunity like that again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room in a historic building.”
Reviews.Author: LewM
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room, well decorated, in the tower. I wish i had the time to take the guided tour. This is a historic building and if the wall could talk the stories they could tell. The furnishings may look dated to someone expecting contemporary chic. My room had a large flat screen tv set on an elegant 1920's style sideboard. Beautiful marble floors at the entrance to the suite. The gold fixtures in the bathroom do look dated to modern eyes but they also look very good in the period furnishings of the suite. Loved staying there and would return anytime. Service was excellent; very accommodating and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: julaHolland
Reviews.Content: The central lobby is beautiful art-deco style. But the room was a bit disappointing: small, with 2 queensize beds close together. And it needed painting and redecorating very much. But also the curtains were very dirty. A bit of dry cleaning is not too expensive for the Waldorf, is it? Not chic: use of wifi will cost you 20 dollar a day! But the staff was very friendly and helpful. We felt very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTING BIRTHDAY GIFT”
Reviews.Author: Philjulie
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, we were disappointed in the decor and service. We were driven in a back door where our luggage was placed with bundles of other luggage that looked like they had been tossed there.
