At the check in counter, there was a line of about 20 people and took around 40 minutes to be served. We had arrived an hour early and mistakenly thought we may have our room ready. We were told to come back at the correct time and again, lined up for over half hour to be given our key. The room was old and furniture scratched. The power point situation was a workplace health and safety nightmare. One power point with a double adaptor with 2 separate powerboards attached containing the TV, clock radio, and internet connections etc etc. Our internet connection never worked and we were told that is usual in New York. You would think that a Hotel like the Waldorf would have state of the art technology in the rooms. Our room was on the 6th floor and overlooked the street. It was very noisy and you could hear the street cleaners and people all night. On the last night, my husband cut his foot badly on glass that was in the carpet. We had not broken anything so shows that the vacuuming isn't up to scratch and how long had the glass been there. We were offered a free night to be used in the next 12 months for this misfortune but advised them that it's not like we are in New York every year!!!! The staff are not as friendly and welcoming as many other USA hotels we stayed in during out holiday. As it was my husband's 50th birthday celebration holiday, I had specifically booked the 3 nights at this hotel as a present and surprise and to fulfil my "bucket list" wish. The only redeeming feature of the hotel was the location - easy walking distance to the city centre, Rockafeller Square and bus lines. I was so disappointed in the Hotel seeing it was a gift/surprise. Would never stay in the Waldorf again and do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Updating!”
Reviews.Author: JeanieTG
Reviews.Content: We were given a room with what seemed to be two large twin sized beds. I would be shocked to learn that they were actually full size beds. They couldn't get us in a room with just one queen or king bed so we had to either sleep cramped together or in separate beds. Not what we had in mind for a romantice getaway. Next the carpet, chairs, and bedding cried late 80's decor. Extremely outdated. I can't understand why the furnishings would be so old with the kind of prices that they command per night. If I had looked at pictures of the room without knowing that it was the Waldorf, I would swear it was some old Ramada Inn. I would never stay at this hotel again. The location was great but that didn't really make up for the lousy room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: FalconFly190
Reviews.Content: I have not stayed at the Waldorf for a few years but the Service was outstanding! Unlike most of our customer service industry, the Waldorf has managed to get better. The room was great, and the Sunday brunch, although pricey is over the top!

Reviews.Title: “A perspective from a younger guest”
Reviews.Author: drizzy5oh
Reviews.Content: First of all, great location - very close to transport hubs and Manhattan, literally seconds walking distance from Grand Central Terminal, Tiffanys, Times Square etc. Staff are exceptional as are the rooms and service (what I'd expect from a well known, reputable hotel such as this). We travelled during thanksgiving. As we entered the lobby there was a large spread of almost Michelin-star quality food laid out on tables including the biggest cooked turkey with all the trimmings. Our stay including thanksgiving dinner however we were disappointed to find that the glorious food on display on the lobby was the 'premium' dinner and was not included - instead we were escorted down a small corridor to a buffet style dinner - most of which was cold including the Turkey! The rooms/service/cleanliness of the place brings the rating up however. The rooms are very old fashioned, as is the decor however it is in line with the image of the hotel. Very high ceilings. The bathrooms are excellent as were the toiletries. Overall, I would stay here again but eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Old charm new love.”
Reviews.Author: mer1969
Reviews.Content: This building houses old secrets. If you enjoy charm and turn of the 20th century interior this is your place. If you look really close, and you have a penchant for pointing out what is askew you will find it. This place should only be used as a background for two people who can appreciate it and use it as a catalyst for a beautiful time together. It draws you back to the old interior of a Great Grandmother; paint chip and overused carpet. You should bring a new love.

Reviews.Title: “walmartia”
Reviews.Author: jimmhk
Reviews.Content: this is a shockingly under imoroved property..everything is frayed, shabby, underlit, and frankly unhygenic.dont stay here unless yuo have to - its not cheap.my laundry was delivered four hours late, the duvet had bloodstains on it, and the bathroom was too revolting to write about here.its a conference hotel, with lots of meeting rooms, but it the residential rooms need closing and completely rebuilding.i had to change rooms - the first still had traces of the previous occupant.to be fair, Rebecca at recerption was incredibly firendly and changed the room; Oscars is excwellent for breakfast, and the staff were uniformly nice.But the owners need to dig deep to restore this grande dame to some semblance of her historical pomp/

Reviews.Title: “Grand!!”
Reviews.Author: roger486
Reviews.Content: Traveled to New York City for our anniversary and decided to splurge. The Waldorf was grand on a large scale. The hotel is full of history from the time you walk into the lobby to your room. The staff is what you would expect in an upscale hotel, very courteous and helpful. The room was decorated very elegantly and comfortable. The price was high but what do you expect. Next time you want to live like royalty, this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Not prepared to help business travelers.”
Reviews.Author: taylorharris50
Reviews.Content: My day started 2 hours earlier than expected thanks to the maids walking the halls and talking loud enough to wake a heavy sleeper behind a thick door. No coffee in the room - had to get dressed to walk to buy a cup. In the lobby I stopped to pick up the phone that was charged by the night staff. It was not charged and the only option is to leave it with the business center. This is not a workable solution. No apology offered. On service it took two calls to have a toothbrush brought up. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Tired old lady”
Reviews.Author: amberlower
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf promises much but it is getting very worn and very shabby - the bathrooms are the worst of any hotel I have experienced...probably a 1-star if that. The whole place needs an overhaul and wouldn't be acceptable anywhere else, but I guess it survives on its history, reputation and curiosity appeal. Not the place for someone wanting rooms with great finishes and everything in working order but has lots of old-world atmosphere if that's what you're after. The staff are mostly typical NYC - short on service and friendliness, but on the positive side, there are lots of them. The rooms vary hugely in size, so it is a good idea to check first. ''Breakfast'' is a Starbucks voucher which only offers sweet pastries, but can be redeemed up till 6pm. Great beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great, quirky old gal.”
Reviews.Author: Bookshelfish
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf in NYC is truly a great, old, traditional hotel with all the trimmings. We have stayed there at least 8 times and have few complaints. The smaller suites are lovely, with LARGE dressing rooms and enormous baths. The location is excellent. Short walk to Theatre District, Grand Central station, shopping and Central Park (10 min. walk). All restaurants are good but the Starbucks, for which you get breakfast coupons, is a disaster. Expect a 45 minute wait in line for a cup of coffee - not accaptable at such a location. No such thing as grabbing a cup of coffee. If breakfast were not such a hassle, I would give the Waldorf an "excellent" rating.

Reviews.Title: “I just had such high hopes....then they were all dashed.”
Reviews.Author: Goingplaces1953
Reviews.Content: I really had high expectations of good service and a nice room. But the 2.5 hour wait when I was told the room would be ready in 15-20 minutes was just the beginning of a long night of rude staff ( probably tired due to tennis star watching ) and plumbing that knocked all night long like a "B" horror film. If you are in the area, it is a nice lobby to hang out in. But the room was so small I mistook it for the closet initially. We would have been better off sleeping in the nice wide hallway, it was wider than our room. This was just not up to snuff. There are better places in NYC with service & rooms that match price with value.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the Starbucks but generally a grande dame.”
Reviews.Content: Still a great hotel with magnificent public areas. Our room was very comfortable and we enjoyed a couple of fine cocktails at the bar (though on that point, shame the bar isn't open later for a nightcap). We had difficulty working the lifts but we were given a new key which seemed to do the trick. Also Hilton Gold Card holders please note, your breakfast is a Starbucks pastry. Aside from the grottiness of the grub, it's disappointing a hotel of this renown accommodates a Starbucks concession. Overall though, we very much enjoyed our stay and can recommend.

Reviews.Title: “There is No place like the Waldorf!!!”
Reviews.Author: BustersDad014
Reviews.Content: Excellent!! Clean comfortable rooms. Excellent location, excellent service. You can't find a closer feeling of comfort and calm!!!the beds are the best. Stay here, you won't be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Stay - Three words to describe: great great great”
Reviews.Author: LikeABigPizzaPie
Reviews.Content: Spent a week vacationing in Manhattan and we stayed at the Waldorf=Astoria on Park Avenue. The lobby was spacious and beautiful. We enjoyed busy late nights in it and quiet early morning in it. The doormen were the best in flagging cabs for us. The elevators during the busy period were slow but on the average, not a concern. The room was very spacious, great view, clean and very quiet. We had great sleeps. The drinks and food of top quality. The location of the hotel within walking distance to Time Square, Broadway, restaurant row, 5th avenue, Central Park, even Greenwich Village. The low cost taxis were super convenient and fast to get us everywhere else, and most time, we would take the relaxingly romantic walk back. The only problem with the hotel were so of the guests who thoughts they were better then others -- always have that anywhere one stays as some people don't go out much. This is not the first time at the hotel and every stay, the room gets better... so you have to be patient sometimes. The staff and cleaning staff always acknowledge us with their morning and late night greetings. Excellent people skills. Lastly, special kudos to the concierge. Excellent for ideas and reservations. Thank you and I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quaint hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NurseTerry6
Reviews.Content: Lovely quaint hotel located on 5th Avenue in NYC. Close (a few blocks) to Time Square, Grand Central Station and Broadway. Rooms a decent size, clean, and nicely furnished. Lobby is beautiful! Breakfast buffet was fantastic which was included in the stay. Only downside was that free wifi only available in the lobby...not in the rooms...thought this was a bit petty considering the price of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing old hotel”
Reviews.Author: katertonks
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel that still believes in service. It's so pretty I could have just sat around all day and not left. The Sunday brunch they do is amazing, just be sure to come hungry as it is vast.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again..but only after checking room first!”
Reviews.Author: mary92651
Reviews.Content: I chose the Waldorf having stayed there previously in a spacious, quiet room. This time, traveling solo, not the same. The first night the air conditioner was so loud I couldn't sleep. I reported the problem and the mechanic was sent. He was to come back while I was out to replace the unit. Returned late after the theatre to find it had not been done. Night two with a tremendously loud racket, but it was too hot to turn it off. Just bad luck, but it definitely spoiled what would of been a much nicer stay. Once replaced, all was well. I recommend eating breakfast in one of the great spots in grand central right down the street rather than in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: Janie79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf Astoria in NYC on September 7th-10th. It was my second time staying there and they get better and better. Their customer service is impeccable. Love, love them!

Reviews.Title: “much inmproved but for consierge service”
Reviews.Author: neptune30
Reviews.Content: No more cockroaches in the good ole'Waldorf! I was almost nostalgic for those room-mates but easily got over that. Excellent cleaning, amenities, superb breakfast, everything. Quite reasonably priced... compared to the cockroach-filled past. One bug is there, though, and a big one: the consierge service. I stayed from 25th through to the 29th – through the entire Irene, which, incidentally, had never come to anything in the middle of Manhattan. Since almost everything in the city has been shut, one went to consierge a lot, perforce. All three consierges that I talked to at the counter were off-hand, "superior", indignant and plain rude. To my, admittedly silly question asked almost in jest (but on the 28 August, mind you!) whether one can order Cinese to the hotel, the answer was "It's not gonna happen!" (Sir? I'm sorry?). "Use room service!" (I suggest? Sir?). Trying to humiliate a paying client – or any client, for that matter – is not a suitable trade mark for a historic hotel. Next time I'll try Mariott near by.

Reviews.Title: “An experience”
Reviews.Author: Catherine G
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, a truly memorable experience, from the time we checked in to the time when we had to reluctantly leave. Rooms excellent, staff friendly and attentive, will definitively return to stay at the Waldorf Astoria NY.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved the Waldorf!!”
Reviews.Author: ljerpi
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Waldorf for three nights, over Labor Day Weekend, at it was amazing! We are Hilton HHonors members, so we actually got the room for free which was incredible. We also got vouchers for a free breakfast at Starbucks each morning, and for each of us to have a free drink at one of the bars! There are just not enough good words to say about this hotel. The service is wonderful, the hotel is beautiful, and everything was immaculate. Our room was very large, for a New York City hotel room, and was very clean. The furniture was in great condition, the bed was comfortable, and we would recommend the Waldorf to anyone staying in the city! http://thejerp.wordpress.com/2011/09/08/experience-timeless-glamour-at-the-waldorf-astoria-new-york/

Reviews.Title: “We had a Grand time!”
Reviews.Author: WhitneyV40024
Reviews.Content: Our family of four traveled to NYC for our children's first trip to the city. We warned them NYC hotel rooms are notoriously small compared to other cities. We only decided to take this trip 10 days before departure and booked through Travelocity which saved us at least $1,500. Imagine our wonderful surprise when we arrived at the Waldorf and were asked if we'd like to upgrade to a suite for only $50 a day! When we got to our room it was marvelous! We had a foyer, big living room with a pull-out couch, flat screen TV, fireplace, 3 large windows, and seating enough for the entire family. The bedroom was huge, too. We had two double size beds, great bedding, a large walk-in closet, and windows that surrounded two entire walls. The bathroom was roomy, granite, had a tub and a shower. It was total luxury. I was shocked that the Waldorf offered us an upgrade even though we booked online with Travelocity. The staff couldn't have been nicer, friendlier, more accommodating, or more attentive. We had a problem with our toilet in the middle of the trip. They were there in 5 minutes to fix the problem and called an hour later to make sure everything was still okay. We loved the lobby, its free wifi, and the Starbucks in the hotel. The location for perfect for walking to Times Square without the noise of Times Square. It was also a perfect launching off location for everything else we wanted to do. The Waldorf Astoria will now be our first choice for our next NYC trip.

Reviews.Title: “next time I'll get a suite”
Reviews.Author: newyork268
Reviews.Content: Stay somewhere else, unless you can afford a suite.. was very fustruated while satying at the Waldorf.. food horrible. This hotel should be considred 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and posh! AND we got a great deal on expedia!!”
Reviews.Author: cnavarr0
Reviews.Content: Live it up in the city that never sleeps! The height of luxury and hospitality was on super sale on expedia during the month of August! We got a lovely king bed room for $289 / night including 2 breakfasts daily (valued at $32 each) AND $25 a day in credit to use for room service or at the spa, etc. Other hotels in Manhattan wanted $300 or more. Why not stay at one of the most famous hotels in the world? Unbelievably wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for Honors members”
Reviews.Author: seattlefamilyoffive
Reviews.Content: We were a party of three, two adults and a nine year old. We booked two nights at $329 per night and two nights with Honors points. Consecutive of course but the hotel could not combine the reservation for some reason and as a result on the third day we were asked to pay cash for our room service coffee and hot chocolate ($32 plus $5 tip and the coffee was terrible). Twice. Once by the waiter and once by the manager who called us. I called down to Guest Services to ask them to use the credit card we used at check in (check in by the HHGold desk was smooth and pleasant) and got lots of attitude and argument until the staff member finally looked in her computer and pulled up the information. Unnecessary rudeness. Our room, a King Superior was nice with high ceilings, crown molding,beautiful furnishings and extremely quiet, but since we had to have a rollaway bed it was too small and felt cramped. We should have been given two beds and I'm not sure why we weren't as we booked months in advance. At check in we were told that as Honors members we would receive free wireless internet (wifi), two free bottles of water per day and certificates for two free drinks at any one of their bars. My husband had a little trouble connecting to the internet but the front desk sent someone up immediately and all was well with the internet for our stay. They had to be constantly reminded to replace the waters. Every day sometimes 2 x. The drink certificates were great my husband and I had a Cognac and a Cosmopolitan respectively and they threw in a lemonade for our daughter and a tray of nibbles. Very nice. The maid service was good and the concierge desk was unfailingly polite and helpful. This being New York we tipped well and often for the service we received because this is how these people make their money. It was appreciated. Overall, if you use points for this hotel it is a fantastic deal. The midtown location makes getting around the city extremely easy and inexpensive since a lot of what you want to see and do is close by or a cheap cab or subway ride away. I'm not sure how the $329 rate compares to other hotels in the area, it was low season supposedly so perhaps that is a good rate. With taxes and fees it was around $400. It's a mixed bag but we had a great time and bottom line it's a beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BEST EVER”
Reviews.Author: jaynesimpson
Reviews.Content: This was one of if not the best ever hotels i have ever stayed in all the staaf were welcoming and friendly as we found it a bit daunting stoppong at The Waldorf,but it was fantastic we had been travelling for nearly 22 hours we were hungry and tired and even though the reataurant have a booking policy the manager found us a table it was wonderful.the food brilliant i cannot say enough great things about this hotel only that we nearly missed seeing new york due to the fact we could have just stayed in the hotel and enjoyed it, cannot wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and over rated”
Reviews.Author: sarahk72
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I booked to stay here for 2 evenings whilst in New York...We thought we would stay due to the history and the prestige. Thank heavens we did not stay their for the other 7 days we stayed in New York. The foyer is beautiful and there is a real buzz as you walk through however Check in took over an hour, ( maybe this explains the Buzz ?) as Very busy, but only 2 staff behind reception. We then were shown to the room, which needed some maintenance work, peeling paper and dirty grouting. There was half used toiletry products ( so room obviously not been prepared properly) also rubbish still in the bin. I then went to mim bar for some water, but this again was nearly empty so telephoned reception for some water for mini bar.... 4 bottles of water ( small one's) brought to room at a charge of $8 a bottle + $30 room delivery charge - despite fact they should have already been in mini bar... Obviously we refused to pay this crazy charge...The guy who delivered water was very apologetic and explained that due to new owners the standard's at Waldorf had dropped, and was no longer about Customer care and the "Waldorf experience" but about the bottom line and the $.... We were going to eat in the restaurant and really enjoy the luxury of The Waldorf but decided after our experience with the room etc we decided to eat out... As I said thank fully we only booked 2 evenings at The Waldorf and spent our next 7 nights at The Muse which was a completely different experience. It's a real shame that an historical institution such as The Waldorf Astoria has been spoilt by investors who appear to have no connection or responsibility to maintaining what was once a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Brendan W
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Waldorf Astoria several times. The location is excellent, about 15 min walk min from Times Square, 2 min to Central Station, 15 min to Central Park and 10 min to 5th Ave shopping. Upon arrival the first impression is that the foyer area is grand and impressive although for first timers it might be a little confusing of making your way from the underground garage to the lobby. Being a Diamond member with Hilton Honors you do not even have to line up in the lobby for check in, instead you are ushered into a office for an efficient check in and for this stay I was kindly offered a complimentary upgrade to a suite and Starbucks breakfast by the General Manager. Once check in was complete I went up to the 27th floor with glimpses of Park Ave. The lounge room was large for and included a fireplace and there was complimentary wifi. One concern was that the room next door to the suite was occupied and I could hear the neighbours from within the lounge areas as the two rooms shared a common entryway. It would have been nice if the door would be made more sound proof. Although the lounge room was large in size the soft furnishings and furniture were a little tired to be honest. However the bed as usual was extremely comfortable and the room was completed with a walk in wardrobe. The bathroom, although functional and clean it was a little small in comparison to the size of the suite and was similar in size to that of a standard room. From reading the guest informant there appears to be a big difference between the type of bathrooms in the Waldorf Astoria Towers as opposed to the Hotel. Further, in prior stays the amenities were Penhaligons but this time around was the standard Waldorf Astoria Verbena amenities which were a little disappointing. Other room amenities that made the stay more comfortable were bedroom slippers and robes. Now for the rest of the hotel, the concierge staff are efficient ( although sometimes there is a bit of line) as the hotel is so large and during holiday season there are plenty of first timers to New York. Some of the concierge staff are more helpful than others but then again it is New York and providing tips does help. Regarding line ups, there is one thing that all guest have to line up is for a coffee in the morning at Starbucks. Overall, excellent location but this hotel needs a freshen up, however service levels are high but there are always room for improvement. I would recommend the Waldorf Astoria if you like a hotel with old world charm, Hilton level of service and at the end of the day location, location location.

Reviews.Title: “Interupted in the middle of a personal moment...”
Reviews.Author: rpb2654
Reviews.Content: Short story long - In February of this year while traveling on business, I was upgraded to a Suite most likely due to Hilton Diamond HHonors, and though the hotel was beautiful and there is history here, I have to agree with another reviewer that the property is tired. Mostly, what I remember is being in the middle of morning care and prep, and having a hotel employee walk all the way through the entry room, into the bedroom, and look at me in the bathroom while I looked back in shock. More shocking was the hotel's response when I complained, which was "we're sorry, let us know when you come again" No thanks, the Kimpton properties in NYC are much more my speed!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Buckeye1_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and historic, but the rooms need updating. The front desk staff was very nice and helpful. Restaurants closed earlier than I expected they would. Good location, within walking distance of Times Square, Grand Central Station, and Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: scott f
Reviews.Content: Initial impressions are good. The location is excellent, about 15 walk mins from Times Square, 2 mins to Central Station, 15 to the SE corner of Central Park. The reception area is lovely, grand and a pleasant environment. However, that's where the good impressions finish. We stayed on the 13th floor with a view into the internal courtyard. The room size was adequate, the patterned carperts belonged to the the 70's. The wi fi worked only occasionally which was desperately frustrating. The furniture was mahogany and dated but the bed was very comfortable; if a little small. Now, the problem...the bathroom was an utter disgrace. Mixer taps where you couldn't get the right temperature and you had to run the taps for about 2 mins to get the temperature up. The water pressure in the sink was pathetic. The toilet seat was broken and at a jaunty angle. No seperate shower (shower in the bath). Loads of mildew. Horrible. Later on, we had a few dealings with the concierge who was nothing short of rude when we asked about a transportation to the Newark airport. He basically laughed at us and told us that we should have booked it the day before and told us that a taxi would be over $100. Well, we got one in the street for the fixed fee of $75. What a $%&* that concierge was. Overall, excellent location but this is a tired old building with an old fashioned attitude to what's expected from customer satisfaction. I read before we stayed that we should spend our money elsewhere as this was a hotel relying on a reputation built up in the 50's and 60's, well, I wished I had listened to that advice because thats exactly what this hotel is. Old, tired and not of a 2011 standard, Save your money, the Waldorf's reputation is over and if you tell people that you stayed at the Waldorf in NYC then those in the know will know that you've wasted your money. Its a crying shame.

Reviews.Title: “that's for sure!!! we love it!!! it looks like HOME, the TOWERS are very a luxury one.”
Reviews.Author: louisenicole_11
Reviews.Content: We want to tell everyone that was a SUPER time,we spend there 23 days of a very pleasant and luxury stay..We want to thanks at first to Nathalie,she is THE PERSON,she solve everything,at anytime,with a so delicate way to do it!!! there is also Michael,and Celso,great people too. The luxury suite is a very fantastic suite,with bar,the closet great with a lot of mirrors..everything,very satisfactory..the bed is divine..the vue...awesome..I really recomend people this suite at the Towers. You feel like HOME ,and the room service s GREAT and very effective too. The Oscar's restaurant for breakfast was Super too.Is a delicious way to began the day...Catarina,is teh best in there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Art deco at its finest!”
Reviews.Author: nordicbare
Reviews.Content: Amazing work of art as far as the interior public space is concerned.The main entrance, lobby,shoping area,are all a wonderful passage back to the "gay"days of the early 1900's. The rooms though,at least the standard and so called deluxe categories are a rip off since there is no destinct difference between them(we ended up in a "deluxe"and our associates in a standard.Price difference then,apx.$30-40).The rooms themselves need to be renovated and the bathrooms are a mess!The noise from the streets at night is unbareable at times since the windows have not been changed to keep the noise out. If you are an insomniac,don't even think about it!! My suggestion is to just walk in,absorb the beauty of the place and stay at one of the many much more comfortable and cheaper hotels in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Weren't treated as equals by staff”
Reviews.Author: Nick2903
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with 3 other groups of people and 1st impressions were good. Nice clean old fashioned style as you walk into the lobby. The receptionist was friendly and treated us with respect. Sadly, that's where it ended. Our room was nice at first glance, but when it came down to it, it was very average. Literally 10 minutes waiting for hot water in the shower, flimsy light switches, had to get out of bed to turn the tv off because the remote was broken, no fridge and no safe which should be standard in a hotel of this stature. The best way I can describe it is a 3 star hotel with fancy carpet. Talking to our friends in the morning, they too had problems such as cracked light switches, 1 toilet seat broke when lifted up, and the wardrobe door falling down when it was opened. And besides the receptionists, we all thought the staff were judgmental and rude. My friend went to the bar and asked for a drink and was told rudely to go elsewhere. Just because we weren't wearing suits like the rest of the guests, doesn't mean they can look down at us and treat us like we didn't belong there. The other guests did the same thing to us. The only good thing that came out of this experience was that I can say I have stayed in this world famous hotel. But I can safely say I will not be staying here again because of the obnoxious staff and poor room fittings.

Reviews.Title: “service sorely lacking - highly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Cams32
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite which was lovely and roomy. The bed was very small given the enormity of the suite rooms! Furniture was quite worn. Reception staff were not very helpful. When we arrived to find the minibar had items used in it , we notified reception immediately who promised to get someone to come up. 3 further phone calls to reception in the duration of the stay still resulted in no one restocking the minibar, and sadly we were charged for the items we had not used. I would definitely stay elsewhere in New York for other hotels offer better service & quality accommodation for a smaller price ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Your paying for the name!”
Reviews.Author: Djlloyd
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here as part of our honeymoon. Rooms arevtotally over rated, old and the tap was dripping all the time and also the shower was very poor pressure. It cost us $21 for water to be brought to be brought to our room! Breakfast in bed was ¢107. Our view wasnlooking at a dirty roof top of the reception!! Did not float our boat. Location is the only thing going for this hotel sorry.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay, but it needs to come a little more into the 21st century.”
Reviews.Author: lyndsWales
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here as part of our honeymoon (20th-23rd august). Upon arrival we were met with an extremely warm welcome. Cases taken straight off us, whisked up to our room to meet us there. We were checked in by such a friendly gentleman (but I can't remember his name :-/) who chatted to us about our wedding etc. He gave us spa vouchers (which we didn't have time to use) and asked us if we'd like a bottle of champagne or drinks vouchers for the bar. We chose the drinks vouchers, however, the next day we returned from shopping to find a bottle of champagne chilling in our room, and a card in our married name, even though I had booked in my maiden name - a very nice touch! The lobby and bar areas are outstanding, oozing the class and glamour that you would expect from the waldorf. It's also interesting to see the history of the hotel in the lobby, seeing pictures of it's famous guests! The only fault I have is the rooms. I was very worried after having read reviews, but I was pleasantly surprised. It was clean and well presented. However, it does still look stuck in the 1930s. It definitely needs to modernise it's furnishings now, it is looking a little tired :(

Reviews.Title: “Deserving of it's reputation - fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_DW
Reviews.Content: Loved it. Very old world charm and lots of nooks and crannies to explore. We stayed in a king deluxe room which was not only incredibly spacious but it had a real "homely" feel. There was a comfy chair to rest in and great size everything - bed, cupboard, bathroom etc. Front desk reception was the only disappointment. I'm not sure this person spoke English as everything had to be repeated three times. It would also be good if they extended the free Internet in the lobby to the rooms. Without that, the lobby is full of people on iPads that would otherwise use their rooms. This would make the lobby quieter and more relaxing. You also pay extra for the gym even as a guest. A gorgeous place to stay, very central for shopping and a real institution to enjoy. We had a lovely time here and would definitely recommend it for a romantic place to stay especially if, like us, you enjoy the more quaint, character-filled hotels than the mega chains.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Elegant and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: thatsenough29
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the weekend of August 6th, 2011 for my bacholerette party. We had a two room suite, with a dressing room and tremendous bathroom. The sitting room of the suite was very elegant, of course it was, it's the Waldorf! Fireplace, two couches, huge TV and desk, reading chair....etc. The bedroom was very big, walk in closet, another huge TV, king size bed, two reading chairs with a table and lamp between. The bed was very soft, and the pillows firm, so for me, not very comfortable, but not awful either. The bathroom was amazing, we had seven girls trying to get ready, and we all had plenty of room. The staff was so friendly, and so welcoming, I cannot say enough good things about them. We needed a few safety pins before we left, called down and they were delivered to our suite within 10 minutes. Overall, a terrific stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: Startrekers
Reviews.Content: We were booked in for one night prior to flying home but hurricane Irene caused us to extend, now at this point I would wish to be staying elsewhere due to the cost but I have to give credit to the Waldorf for not ripping us off, as every other tourist in New York needed to extend. The thing with the Waldorf is, it is exactly what you expect you would get for the price, then you have to double it. and as my wife says.sometimes in life you have to pay up and shutup. !! Having said that I cannot fault this hotel the service levels are fantastic, for a tip, and sometimes its in your face, like, "where's my tip?", but its a great iconic hotel which is becoming my favourite in New York and I dont tip everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pinksteven
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf for a week towards the end of August and I would highly recommened to anyone, fantastic location with 5th Avenue being minutes away which leads to central parc and times square within five minutes. The staff were very helpful and the hotel was beautifully decorated throughout, the room was very big and clean. I wouldn't hesitate in staying at the Waldorf or again or recommending it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Solomon64
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location especially for women with expensive taste! The staff was friendly and I did not face any problems whatsoever. The hotel needs a major refurbishment after which it will look like a palace again. I was there with my father back in 1983 when I was 19 years old and it was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing to see this historic hotel in person!”
Reviews.Author: DG7Meath
Reviews.Content: Home Alone... well i wasn't quite! But it's so nice to walk into a hotel and be "WOW'd". The hotel is having a bit of a make-over at present, but this does not at all distract from the beauty of it. We were treated to a night here as a wedding present - so it was lovely to spend a night in our favourite city in such a fabulous hotel. I cannot comment on value for money... so maybe if we were paying ourselves i wouldn't feel quite the same. However, upon early check in, our king room was ready for us to occupy. The bed was lovely and everything was perfect in the room. There were "old" features like the door knobs, light switches that all add to the charm of the place. We didn't eat in the hotel as we were only staying the one night. But just the accommodation alone would make me want to return!

Reviews.Title: “The Big Apple's Best, a gem in NYC is TWA”
Reviews.Author: Tundo07
Reviews.Content: As soon as you walk in, one can feel the history and charm of this Art Deco Style hotel. The lobby is classic! We loved hanging out there and listening to the sounds of fellow travellers. The jazz tunes being played on the baby grand is a nice enjoyable touch. We stayed for 4 comfortable nights. Most of NY sights and shoppng are just steps away. Cab service is best for those lower Matt trips. Rooms are super clean and Top notch service from beginning to end. After a long day out, room service is perfect choice. May i suggest the apple pie alla mode, The Big Apples Best!

Reviews.Title: “Marvel in Manhattan !”
Reviews.Author: ANUJ_MITHANI
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf is a part of the Hilton chain of luxury hotels, and sits in the heart of Manhattan at 300 Park Avenue. I found the location remarkably convenient for business and work - and is at best a short stroll away from anything you might find yourself doing in NY - shopping (5th ave), walking (Central Park) or eating (Union Park/anywhere in NY!). The hotel exudes a distinctly old-world charm (currently under refurbishment, externally it appears), with large high-ceiling lobbies and dazzling chandeliers. The rooms are spacious, with comfortable beds and a large flat-screen TV - always helpful for real time updates on Hurricane Irene! Some of the good experiences included : - The staff is attentive and courteous, sending me an adaptor for my phone charger within a few minutes of placing a call - The business centre was also very efficient, and I was directed there promptly after check-in to pickup a package that had arrived for me - They offer a Zip check-out i.e. if the bill slipped under your door in the morning is Ok, you just punch a key in the phone, leave a message and leave without bothering to go to the desk or returning your keys - which is an idea I'd hope all hotels should adopt to save time A few suggestions for improvement that come to mind : - I wish they had told me about the complimentary bottles of water as a Hilton Honors member upon check-in, unless this practice stands withdrawn - My secretary had conveyed my airline frequent flyer # but for some reason it hadn't been captured on my reservation - The doors arent able to filter the hallway noise, and I was woken up somewhat early in the morning by some noisy neighbours So overall, I'd say this made for a very comfortable stay and I'd certainly consider coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: winonat63
Reviews.Content: My finance' and I recently stayed at the Waldorf and we had a wonderful time. The young lady at the front desk was very accommodating in our reservations. She found the exact type of room we wanted. There was no coffee pot in the room and they brought one up very quickly. If you are a Hilton's Honor's member you get 2 bottle of water from the mini-bar a day, I thought that was awesome. Someone checked on us every evening to make sure if we needed anything. I highly advise anyone to stay at this hotel at once in your lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and classic, with great service and clean rooms!”
Reviews.Author: MountainMel
Reviews.Content: We stay here every year for a convention that we attend, and we love it. It is expensive but beautiful. The rooms are clean, the food is good, the staff are helpful, and it is in a great location. I would say it is overpriced, but everything in NYC is overpriced. Tip: Don't spend the extra cash on the Towers. It isn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The Waldorf-Astoria NYC”
Reviews.Author: Caper1947
Reviews.Content: We placed the high bid on a trip package for the Waldorf. Liked: Beautiful lobby and Art Deco decor, history, and wonderful brunch, polite and helpful staff. Disliked: $16/ day for wireless, balky shower handle, limited TV channels

Reviews.Title: “Great location but need an internet deal”
Reviews.Author: Slip460
Reviews.Content: Beautiful public spaces and great mid-town location. It's expensive so you need to find a deal on the internet. Don't buy anything at the hotel as it's way over-priced.

Reviews.Title: “Never again - stay at The Plaza instead!”
Reviews.Author: CarlaDeluca
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after visiting the wonderful Waldorf Astoria Website which promised the Ultimate in glamour and Service. Unfortunately our "superior" room at over $400 per night was so bad that we were moved to a suite in the Waldorf Towers. Our original room had holes In the wall, peeling paintwork, broken lighting and was dirty and dusty. After calling reception to explain this, we were told to wait around an hour to "see what they could do". I asked for someone to come up and see the room as I was astonished it could be so bad but was then just given a suite in the more expensive part of t he hotel. I got the feeling that the reception staff though I was trying to gain a free upgrade and that they weren't really interested in the disappointment we felt. Unfortunately, whilst the suite was very large, it absolutely reeked of stale cigarettes (we'd asked for a non smoking room) and was also shabby. Not once were we contacted by any member of staff to see if the room was acceptable and the service was exceptionally poor. Out of the 40ish Hilton Hotels I've stayed in, this was truly the worst. I have NEVER complained at any of the others and was expecting the best here. As our trip was only short, we put up with it and didn't want to spoil the rest of our time in NY. What should have been a memorable birthday trip was quite forgettable at this hotel. If you want to experience old style glamour and charm then choose The Plaza hotel - similar priced and with far superior service with staff that genuinely care about your experience! Or the Mandarin Oriental. Truly exceptional with an experience you won't forget. The Waldorf's website is misleading and they are trading on reputation alone. They can not live up to it and it just does not deliver!

Reviews.Title: “Sons Birthday”
Reviews.Author: shelann34
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and full of history. A must stay, the staff was very nice and helpful throughtout our stay. The rooms a little dated but very well kept and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby & Low Market”
Reviews.Author: T B
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to staying at the Waldorf Astoria, after all, it has such history. However, I was so disappointed. The room at over $300 per night was shabby, dated and ordinary. I like classical old but this was not charming or antiques, just dated full stop. The carpet hasn't been changed since circa 1950 and the furniture has scuffs and dents. The phone is ugly and again old - 1980's. The bathroom again needs updating. There were no stoppers in the bath or sink. Shabby & grubby. I decided to pay a visit to one of the cocktail bars - Sir Harry's. Whilst sat reading, I could clearly overhear the barman talking with his friend - eveyr other word was the f-word. His friend motioned him to let him know guests could hear him and he just dismissed it as who cares. At cocktails of $18 and up, this is not the behaviour you expect from the bar staff. Is this the standard of a 5 star hotel? I dont think so. I stay in a lot of them and this has to be the absolute worst hotel I have ever been in. Do yourself a favour, have a look around the lobby, avoid the bars and dont stay there, you can still say you've been to the Waldorf Astoria without any of the pain. Hilton owners please take a look at The Savoy in London for pointers as to how its done. Will not be back or stay in any Hilton ever again.

Reviews.Title: “You feel well”
Reviews.Author: jmfalmeida
Reviews.Content: Good in all aspects. Luxury, confort and correct relation quality/price

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: Abbasec
Reviews.Content: I don't understand who the people were who gave bad reviews of the Waldorf. We were there for 2 nights at the start of a tour of USA and Canada to celebrate our 39th wedding anniversary. We were immediately given an upgrade to a deluxe room which was immaculate and beautifully decorated. I cannot criticise the queue - immediate reception on a busy Sunday afternoon. All the staff we met were very friendly, talkative and helpful. We came back one evening and there was a bottle of Cava in an ice bucket with a note wishing us congratulations on our special occasion. Dress code non existent, everyone we saw was casually dressed. I can understand how people say that it's passed its glory days, maybe it has but it still has that touch of elegance. Loved it, thank you so much Waldorf!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic ambience, but dated.”
Reviews.Author: jimboinbmth
Reviews.Content: We went to America on our 3 part Honeymoon (Las Vegas, Los Angeles and New York). During our stay over 2.5 weeks we stayed in some fantastic hotels, unfortunately the Waldorf was not the best of the 3. The ambience was great and it appeared very grandure, however this was only in the reception and more public areas. The rooms were spacious but extremely dated. It just wasn't how we expected the most expensive hotel on our trip to be. The Wi-fi is an additional charge but doesn't work in the room if you have an IPad 1, we were unaware of this when we booked. Apparently IPad 2's will work just not IPad1's, very annoying! However the Wi-fi in the lobby is free and appears to work whatever the system you're using! Location wise the hotel is in midtown on the east side which makes it extremely accessible to Times Square and Broadway. The main shopping district is also only a short walk. On the whole the hotel staff were excellent and very helpful, unfortunately the room let the hotel down for us which is where we spent the most of our time. We stated in a one bedroomed suite on the 13th floor between August 12th and August 17th.

Reviews.Title: “Nice - only”
Reviews.Author: Shadelle128
Reviews.Content: Got a good price online for this but wouldn't wanted to have paid more. I went with my husband and 2 children, the room was slightly bigger than other hotels I used in the city, but beds the same size. No tea/coffee making facilities in the room, as we found elsewhere. Bathroom was a little tired, the doorstop came off as soon as we opened to door, but was always hot water and nice soap shampoo etc. The lobby area was very impressive and worth a visit anyway, it also had free wi-fi which was useful. We got a room rate with breakfast, and both kis eat free which was very worhwhile, although breakfast was very busy and the tables were very packed in, but the food was good. Used the garage to get us a taxi to JFK worked very quickly and smoothly. Overall I found the staff helpful, but got the impression they were a bit 'snooty'. I wouldn't feel the need to go back, but it was cerainly nice to say I'd been.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and will recomend to friends”
Reviews.Author: morris c
Reviews.Content: everyone can tell that the location is great you can imagine the rooms and the lobby from the photos-but are they the real thing well guys we came with two families with kids and we got the VIP treatment. Vickram was at the front desk of the tower and never rested throughout the stay (5 nights) to make sure that we were completely satisfied. The rooms were clean the towels were soft even the beds were comfortable (something I can't say about many of the other 4-5 * hotels in the states) so - what can I say - go for it

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time at the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: ClareLouise19
Reviews.Content: I knew the Waldorf would be spectacular but my stay exceeded all expectations!!This is the best place to stay on a visit to New York and provides a wonderful escape at the end of a busy day spent in the "Big Apple". The staff do everything they can to make your stay comfortable - great recommendation to visit "Bobby Vans" steak house for a memorable evening.This hotel feels something special,you can feel the history and splendour as soon as you walk through the door! Make sure you time having cocktails under the stars!! The rooms are great - comfy beds and facilities and a great turn down service for when you return from your evening out.I will not hesitate to return on my next visit to this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Old Charm”
Reviews.Author: Jfb381
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated a few blocks from just about every attraction in Manhattan. Charming and impressive but a little tired. Plumbing struggles to keep up and some furnishings have seen better days. Pricey but worth it overall. Don't plan on eating too often at the hotel resturants unless you enjoy being gouged. Plenty of great places to dine in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: paulo2111
Reviews.Content: Grand entrance From limo pickup at JFK through welcome,check in and room-everything was special Historic hotel just like the movies Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “True Service Excellence.”
Reviews.Author: theheadland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite for the last nights of a 3 week holiday in the States. Everything about the hotel is grand and luxurious - stunning lobby, beautiful restaurants and bars. The suite was huge, well appointed and very comfortable. The staff are what really sets the Waldorf above other hotels. There are lots of staff - they all smile, look you directly and work out how they can help. Every request was quickly and cheerfully met. We used a few services - business centre, room service, conceirge, laundry - all were flawless. I cant wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...small beds!”
Reviews.Author: IngZel
Reviews.Content: Loved the location of the Waldorf on Park Avenue. Our family of 4 stayed in one room booked by Hotels.com. The room smelled like cigarette smoke and the (2) beds, which I thought were going to be queens, were more like full beds. Very small for 2 people!! We called the front desk and they said they would change our room the next day (they were booked), came to spray air freshener and added an air filtration machine within a 1/2 hour. Great customer service! But the beds....wish they were really queen size!

Reviews.Title: “It exceeded all expectations!”
Reviews.Author: beckere
Reviews.Content: We just finished a four day, three night stay in the original Waldorf Astoria (not the Towers). We were in a Junior Suite with a king bed. It was simply a great place to stay. Old world elegance mixed with modern touches (such as a very large flat screen TV).The bed was very comfortable and the soaps and shampoos were of high quality. It was so big, we felt like we were in an apartment (the suite even comes with a doorbell). At one point we had 7 family members visiting us, with all seated comfortably in our "parlor" area with plenty of room to spare. Space is not easily found in hotels in NYC, so this was just wonderful. The hotel personnel were friendly and extremely customer oriented. Everyone we encountered working in the hotel was that way. During one day with heavy rains, they were giving out large umbrellas to one and all to use. No fuss about signing them in or out...just helping out with umbrellas to ensure their guests were comfortable. This was indicative of their approach overall--good solid customer service with the goal to make it a great stay for their guests. I know the Waldorf's reputation is for high cost and found this aspect mixed. For a suite, we paid less than what we have at times paid for single rooms in other Times Square hotels. So, we felt the price for the suite was quite good. However, prices for some of the extras were quite high. Massages in their newly renovated spa were priced out of reach and the items in their lobby Starbucks was twice what it would have been at their other locations. On the other hand, we had room service one morning and found the delicious breakfast portions were so large that one meal was easily shared by two, thus making the price for one comparable to going out to a restaurant for both. So, the cost aspect was easily handled with some planning. In summation, we found elegance, great service, and the extra size of the suite very appealing. We do plan to stay here again, and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: olesoleil
Reviews.Content: Having wanted to stay in the Waldorf from being a little girl walking in was nothing short of breathtaking. The lobby is amazing and you instantly feel like you are featuring in your own movie! The hotel is within walking distance to all the attractions of NYC and a perfect base. The room was lovely although could have done with a little more attention to detail where the cleaning was concerned. The curtains were very dusty and we found a condom wrapper in the closet! Loved the ice dispenser in the corridor, came in useful on a twisted ankle thanks to the snow and ice! The staff were all very professional and accommodating. We asked for an extra bathrobe in the room and within 5 mins it had arrived. Overall this is an amazing hotel. Yes it's not "new or modern" but that's why you go. The amazing old world charm is worth every penny. I wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Outstanding.. An Amazing Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Triptravler
Reviews.Content: Honestly the best hotel I ever stayed in. The entire staff was friendly, professional, and extremely attentive to any of my needs. The hotel is a masterpiece & my room was upgraded @ no extra charge. Clean, very well appointed, and full of rich charm & history. It's expensive to stay there but if you really want to be treated like a star and live in luxury then definitely stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Living On It's Reputation”
Reviews.Author: Belmores
Reviews.Content: One to say you've been and done but there are better hotels in NY for the price. You can't fail to be impressed by the history but rooms are small, facilities dated and feeling a bit tired Great location but you know that before you book

Reviews.Title: “Grand old hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Pablo
Reviews.Content: Great service from the moment we arrived by car, free parking for 30 mins so we had time to checkin and put luggage in our room. Really comfortable room - no view to speak of but guess that was just unlucky. Reception staff really really helpful. Rooms are grand and old style but have all mod cons, but come on paying for wifi in room is not very 21st century. The location on 50th and Park was excellent and there plenty of delis to get breakfast - Oxford cafe just round corner. Really interesting to look at all the pictures of guests in times gone by and all interesting artefacts. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “We stay at the Waldorf Astoria every summer and love it!”
Reviews.Author: Megs0668
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old sister, Grandparents and myself (22), stay at the lovely Waldorf Astoria Towers every summer since I was 7. My grandparents have been going to NYC and the Waldorf since 1961 and will be celebrating their 50th wedding anniversary this December and are coming back for about 4 days this winter. We enjoy the Waldorf so much because every person who works there is always willing to help us and accommodate us; we feel as if we are home! But a certain individual jumps out at us. Sara Ashenafi has watched my sister and I grow up over the years of coming to NYC. She always does a great job of remaining professional and helping people any way possible, but at the same time, she ALWAYS has a smile on her face and finds time to ask us how we are doing and what we did the past day. She definitely brings happiness to the Waldorf Astoria and my sister and I are always excited to see her the following summer!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay for our Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: nativecubuff
Reviews.Content: My family (myself, wife & 2 daughters) spent 5 nights at the Waldrof Astoria in July and loved every minute of our experience. From check in to departure, The Waldorf provided the NYC experience we hoped for. We loved exploring different spaces and seeing the Grand Ballroom and other places where so many in history have been - Churchill, every President, Queens and Kings, etc was great fun. We requested a renovated room and received a corner room on the 26th floor that was well appointed. While there were some scratches here and there, the room exceeded our expectations in size and condition. Every staffer we encountered was truly first rate. From the front desk staff and concierge, to the waiters, housekeepers and bartenders, everyone lived up to the status and history of the hotel. Dinner recommendations from the Concierge were spot on and every request for assistance was happily met. One evening my wife and I were having a drink and our conversation with another couple including cookies. Next thing we know, our bartender delivered a plate of chocolate chip cookies for us to take back to our daughters. That kind of thoughtful service is what we experienced. Thanks to all at the WA for a wonderful trip.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need update. Hotel living from nice lobby and glorious past.”
Reviews.Author: travelpro_d
Reviews.Content: Most rooms/floors in need of urgent update. Rooms on 13th floor updated. Even high floor suites are not up to date. Cleanliness is also an issue. Small bathrooms even in 1 bedroom suites. Textiles of sofas etc old and worn. High floor rooms to Park Ave side can be hearing ventilators of airconditioning cooling towers.TVs are up to date as flat panel. Front desk mostly friendly / helpful, however can be manipulative. Good 4*, however mostly overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Time to join the 21st century? Or is that part of the charm?”
Reviews.Author: Seniomsed
Reviews.Content: OK, you know what you are getting when you book here. It's fantastic for what it is, but it's a little bit old-fashioned in ways that could be fixed so easily. Like charging $10 per day for wifi, when every crappy roadside hotel in the country offers it for free. Still, it's a great experience, and the bar makes one of the finest Manhattans I've ever had. Made with bourbon, like most Manhattans in Manhattan, but still wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and charming - will go back!”
Reviews.Author: Harvard_Mum
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 had the most wonderful stay at the Waldorf Astoria. We stayed 6 nights and received the most outstanding service from all members of the staff. We could not believe the service level of the Waldorf Astoria and this is all around from Bellman, Reception, Room Service etc. And the breakfast restaurant is amazing and you are spoilt for choise and here you also receive an outstanding service. A bit pricey, but well worth it compared to other places in New York. Loved it and will stay again, given the chance

Reviews.Title: “Best Birthday EVER”
Reviews.Author: DCAtravler
Reviews.Content: My sons took me to NYC for my birthday and we stayed at the Waldorf. Everything about it was first rate! A wonderful extra was the Sunday morning brunch, I have never seen better. The only hotel room I have ever stayed in, that had it's own doorbell.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel - a real piece of luxury”
Reviews.Author: den1971
Reviews.Content: Celebrating a 40th birthday and a 15th wedding anniversary, we booked the Waldorf to add something special to our trip, and it certainly lived up to our expectations. It was so glamorous and exactly as you'd imagine it to be, from all the films you've ever seen it featured in. Our bedroom was large with two double beds and on the corner of the building so had plenty of windows letting in plenty of NY light. Aircon was terrific, as was the room service who were on hand 24/7 to answer your every call. Definitely worth paying a little extra for a little bit of NY luxury - would LOVE to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Our Second Stay Was Better Than Our First”
Reviews.Author: fluffnfold
Reviews.Content: This is my second review of the Waldorf-Astoria in NYC. (My spouse and I stayed there in mid-November 2010; see my December 2010 review titled “New York City: The Waldorf Astoria: Prestigious Name, But Service Level Is Lacking”.) We found ourselves back at the Waldorf in January of 2011, despite saying in my last review that there were other choices in town. So let me explain ... Shortly after my review was posted (I also completed an online survey from an independent company reviewing the hotel), we received a letter apologizing for the mistakes we experienced during our November 2010 stay, and offering us a complimentary night in an Astor Junior Suite to make amends. If you can splurge on an upgraded room, this category is quite spacious, with a large sitting area with desk, sofa, two wing chairs, side and coffee tables, large TV, and a wet bar with a sink but no refrigerator; the wet bar area also a lack of appropriate glasses and utensils should we actually want to use the area to prepare a drink. (There was a minibar, but that was in the bedroom, not in the living room area.) French doors (mirrored, not transparent) separated the living room from the bedroom, where there was a king-size bed, two night stands, a small closet (which I think was the only closet for the large room), a dresser (containing the minibar) and a second large TV. The bathroom was large by any bathroom standards (so for a NYC hotel room, it was huge) with a separate shower and soaking tub and double-sinked vanity. Each room had its own window or windows, and each had its own thermostat. We took advantage of using this room to the fullest, visiting the city on an incredibly cold January weekend. (Living 1.5 hours away, we visit NYC often, so we were able to just relax and watch some movies rather then brave the cold city streets for sightseeing.) As Hilton Hhonors Diamond members, we were offered two free drinks in any of the hotel bars (we chose Sir Harry's; the coupon was good for any type of drink) and two free bottles of water. Unlike at other high-end Hilton properties, there is no executive floor at this property, and no free breakfast is offered other than a coupon to Starbucks for a beverage and pastry, but as with our last stay at the WA, the lines at Starbucks were ridiculously long, and we did not redeem our coupons. The hotel provides free wi-fi to its Gold and Diamond members; however, we did not get free movie promised as part of Waldorf perk (the hotel claims not to participate in that part of the program). We used the Diamond check-in area with minimal problems - another guest arrived just after our check-in began, and it was clear that he received preferential treatment over us because he was a repeat customer. I don't mind if that sort of thing occurs, but don't “rub it in my face”. There was a private event happening on Saturday evening in the Park Avenue Cocktail Terrace/lobby area; therefore, hotel guests could not exit on the Park Avenue side of the hotel. During the event, guests were directed to the Lexington Avenue entrance, which wasn’t a big deal, but it would have been nice if a card or memo was left in the room instructing guests of this detour. As it was, I had arranged to meet my spouse at the Park Avenue entrance to depart for dinner, which caused a bit of running around when the private event ended after I had left for our meeting point (and was directed to Lexington) but then opened again in time for my spouse to be waiting at Park. To summarize, we had a good (second) stay, particularly with our Astor Junior Suite accommodations, but I maintain my “bottom line” from my last review - there are other great hotels in town that I’ll probably try next time.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional hotel - amazing location”
Reviews.Author: beenthereHampshireUK
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Waldorf was my husbands idea. We had seen it in the film Serendipity and he had wanted to do the whole NYC experience. The location is amazing but it is very confusing depending on which part of the hotel you are in, as lifts go to certain sections and other lifts dont reach certain floors so beware. Room service is excellent - nothing is too much trouble. If you want a central location for sight seeing - Central Park etc then this is the hotel for you. Not the cheapest, not on same level as the Plaza either, but very traditional, luxurious rooms. I would definitely stay again . The concierge service is excellent too - tickets available for most Broadway shows, at a premium obviously but for a special occasion its a must !

Reviews.Title: “The Old Dame is clean, but age has taken its toll”
Reviews.Author: FlyinBee
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in a Junior Suite while celebrating our anniversary. We were happy with the space, although the view was somewhat disappointing. However, the two bottles of champagne sent to our room took some of that disappointment away. The hotel is beautiful, at large, but there are some refurbishment/work taking place, so be aware of construction noise. We were not bothered by this, since we were roaming the streets of NY from dusk till dawn. Yes, there are some paint peeling off here and there, and the finish is somewhat pale, but it is clean and the people working there were so service-minded and helpul that I could not fault anything. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “So beautiful and enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: sparky0803
Reviews.Content: Our room was beautiful, though they were doing renovation on certain parts of our floor. The service was wonderful, as everyone encoutered was more than helpful. Kudos to the concierge (a gentleman) that helped us "first time to New York" people. I found it very hard to believe that their free internet in the business center was down the whole week, which I would have liked to use. Expect the best, and seems like the Waldorf will go out of their way to give it!

Reviews.Title: “I guess it just depends . . .”
Reviews.Author: akoser
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf=Astoria in August 2011 while attending a business conference. I get to New York quite often on business, however this was my first stay at this property. Given the large conference at the hotel as well as the many tourists, the hotel was quite busy. Check in went smoothly and the agent was quite helpful, giving me an upgrade to a large corner room as I am a Hilton Honors member. He did notifiy me that there would be men working on my floor replacing carpet in rooms and that mine would be replaced immediately after my stay concluded. I guess that explains the strange, almost urine smell in my room. It was very noticeable each time I entered the room but I became acclimated to it each time within a few minutes and I chose not to ask for another room as my stay was only for two nights. The room was a large, virtually square room located in the corner of the building on the 8th floor which offered two large exterior windows. I enjoy corner rooms as the extra window allows for lots of natural light, ufortunately the windows were covered with what looked to be decades of grime such that you really didn't want to look through them. The bed was extremely comfortable with lots of extra pillows. I slept wonderfully and heard no noise from the hallway or other rooms during my entire stay. The room also featured a bottom-of-the-barrel Phillips television that afforded only passable video quality and abysmal audio. Woodwork in the room had multiple coats of paint built up over the decades as well. The most recent coat looked as if it had been applied by a child using a mop. There comes a time when you just can't put any more paint on woodwork and my room was long past that point. The bathroom was smallish, even by NYC standards. Although it really didn't make a difference or cause any inconvenience, I found it odd that the shower and water controls were located at the front of the shower and the shower head was located at the rear of the shower. The bathroom vanity still had some chrome effects that looked like they might be original and I don't realy mean that in a good way. I'm aware of the hotel's historical significance but when I pay for a hotel room, I'm paying for the here and now. There is a difference between "historic" and just plain old and this hotel crosses that line at times. I was in elevators on numerous occasions where guests would press a botton for their particular floor and it failed to light or stop at their floor. On on occasion, the light was lit for a the floor of a guest in the elevator but failed to stop at his floor, In many ways, this hotel reminded me of the Intercontinental Barclay just around the corner and why I no longer stay there. That being said, I spent some time in a room on the 9th floor that was temporarily converted from a quest room to a meeting room for my conference by removing the bed and replacing it with a conference table. This room was much fresher than my guest room and featured a much larger bathroom with a large, glass shower stall and modern bathroom appointments. This room was very nice in comparison to my guest room. The woodwork in the room was crisp and did not feature multiple layers of poorly applied paint. I did not use room service or the fitness center nor did I eat in any of the restaurants. Food at my large group lunch was a salad that I would describe only as marginally edible. I would have been very dissatistified to have received this salad in a restaurant. This was my first stay at the Waldorf=Astoria and I really don't see myself returning. There are just too many really good alternatives in this part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay for business”
Reviews.Author: Dguest
Reviews.Content: First Impressions:Someone needs to give this hotel a good dusting - its like visiting Grandma. What you must know: No tea & coffee making facilities, or complimentary water - which comes as a standard with all other Hilton properties - and this is one. No in room safe - what a hassel going up and down to the lobbly for a safety deposit box - honestly who needs that kind of old world experience No full length mirror - but there was one in the room I was orginally assigned; except it was an interconnecting room (an interconnecting room with no security - I could walk straight into the other room, which had a couple of noisey guests) There is plenty of dust in the curtains, smothering ligh fittings Noisey housekeeping staff who at the crack of dawn start their conversations for all to hear Front office staff - who make promises and don't deliver (we complained about the interconnecting room drama - we were asked to wait in the room and told 'we will check'! Well no one arrived - 1 hour 15 minutes later we were assigned another room. Poor internet connectivity No gym Hovering bell staff - who could do well to keep their hand in their pocket and be discrete in theior hunt for tips! REally this hotel has to look at aligning itself with Hilton standards. Because everything at the Astoria is an EXTRA. How boring! This hotel needs to be brought out of the industrial age - an overhaul is well overdue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience we will definately return”
Reviews.Author: meme4641000
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at The Waldorf Astoria. I would recommend this hotel to any one coming to NY for business or pleasure. It is a little pricey, but it is worth the money !!! HAVE FUN !!!! I DID !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great historical hotel, probably past its prime.”
Reviews.Author: Californianative123
Reviews.Content: I used to live in New York city, and every time the King of Saudi Arabia or major international leaders had meetings, it was always at the Waldorf Astoria. I remember walking by it, thinking of how grand the hotel was and how out of reach it was for me with my budget. It had so much history, so much allure. Now that I live in California, I went to New York on business. My company paid for me to stay at the Waldorf, and I was beyond excited. Finally, I would be able to stay in the same hotel that the King of Saudi Arabia and movie stars stay in! Upon check in, you realize the hotel has been taken over by the Hilton chain. It's basically a Hilton. The lobby is still grand and very nice. The rooms are incredibly small, very much like many Manhattan hotels are. The room is quite old, as is the entire hotel. The amenities in the bathroom are not luxurious at all. There is one bar of soap that you have to use for both the sink to wash your hands and to shower. The shower is not luxurious at all. It's very ordinary. The sink is also quite ordinary, as is the toilet. This place does not compare to any of the modern luxury hotels such as the Wynn in Vegas or Hotel Rey Juan Carlos in Barcelona. It is an old hotel with a famous past. I dont know how much the room cost, but if it was very expensive, this hotel would not have been worth it.

Reviews.Title: “SHUT IT DOWN”
Reviews.Author: Spencertraveller
Reviews.Content: Total over rated hotel that has seen its date and time and needs to be shut down to preserve its brand. Follow the example of great iconic hotels - The Plaza, The Savoy who spent millions $$ to renovate and come back out with a splash. Unless your company is paying for the room , dont stay here. You can do so much better. Creeky bed,Ac unit that makes too much noise, boring bed,doors that slam, restriction about after 6pm proper attire in the lobby (Who is payingm,here?) water temp that is way too hot,small room,awful decor, bath tub turned backways - should i really go on. You can truly know an awful hotel when you check out and the receptionist does not ask HOW WAS YOUR STAY?! Use that as to confirm your thinking. Way too many staff milling around doing nothing, looking over people. This has got to be the most overhyped hotel I have ever visited. No offence, maybe its for the over 60yr old crowd but you can so much better with so much better hotels in NYC. The amount of people at reception waiting to change rooms for many faults is deplorable.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience!”
Reviews.Author: danlyons3043
Reviews.Content: We were moving our daughter, 25, into her New York apartment as she began a new career journey in New York. Our 4 night stay at the Waldorf was outstanding. Such a beautiful hotel. The lobby, the restaurant, the bar....all exceptional. The staff was so courteous and personable. We will be back frequently to visit our daughter in the Big Apple!

Reviews.Title: “Mind the bed bugs don't bite !!”
Reviews.Author: dewi21
Reviews.Content: I recently visited the Waldorf for 3 nights as part of a package. Whilst the hotel is steeped in history, Presidents, celebrities and many others have stayed there over many years. It's public areas are a visual delight, great big chandeliers, the clock in the reception/check in area with it's carved portraits and quarterly chime give the building an historic virtue. On the negative, rooms are dated, the plumbing is somewhat still in the dark ages with the sound of the hot water tank refilling in the wall cavity behind the bed's headboard whenever the bath/shower or tap was running. Added to this was the price of room and other services. $14 plus tax for half a grapefruit !!!. Worst of all were the bites to my legs which I can only put down to as bed bugs !!! It is a shame that a hotel of such calibre is sadly let down by a lack of room hygiene and dated plumbing !!!

Reviews.Title: “nice to say you stayed - but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: PtboCan
Reviews.Content: Lovely atmosphere and nice to have had the "experience" - but I would rather spend the extra cash shopping. We were not in our room much except to sleep. The beds were comfortable and the linens A+ which is important to me. The location is great with the tour buses stopping at the door(since this was our first visit to the city with our kids we did the tour bus thing), but I think our next trip will will try someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “what a grand old hotel”
Reviews.Content: Charming , opulent edifice....great service.......only complaint...poor communcation between booking company and hotel...............but back to the compliments: quiet room, very friendly clerks...the main restaurant was excellent with the steaks (aged beef) AAA

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from this luxerious hotel”
Reviews.Author: monana66
Reviews.Content: I am hilton diamond vip member, and we only get room upgrade and breakfast in starbucks. I was surprised that there is no executive lounge like the other Hilton hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Bad encounter at Waldorf Astoria NY”
Reviews.Author: nayanaya
Reviews.Content: I would like to report my experience in this hotel as an alone business European woman. I accomodated 3 nights at 37th floor of the Wardorf Astoria tower. The tower and lift entrance is allowed only through the room key. During my last evening I was following a couple (an old man and a middle age blond woman staying al 29th floor) to enter in the elevators area benefiting from their key.
