The woman assaulted me in a bad way asking for my key and my right to stay there. On the lift she required me to select the floor for her as her servant and continued to stess me on this subject. I preferred to stay silent in front to her awful show. At my leaving she addressed me a prostitute appellation. It was first time in my life and wherever. But it is unacceptable this situation happened in a hotel like Wardolf Astoria where a guest is looking for the best also in term of safety. So my advice to everybody is to prefer a boutique hotel instead of this big and impersonal hotel where, in spite of the appearance, all can happen as in a metro.

Reviews.Title: “Still Love It”
Reviews.Author: susie2jeeps
Reviews.Content: The first time I visited NY I stayed in this hotel and feel in love with New York so I do have a soft spot for the Waldorf Astoria. Stayed in some fabulous hotels here but they have been a bit pricey and although I wanted a five star hotel I didn't want to pay the exorbitant price of the St Regis or Peninsular Hotel (great hotels by the way). I loved this Hotel then and I love it now. It has atmosphere and presence and that old New York feel about it. Yes the wall paper is slightly peeling off in the bathroom and the room keys don't always work but that is part of its charm. We upgraded to the Towers with a complimentary breakfast. The breakfast is lovely for two woman, orange juice, granola and strawberries hit the spot for me but if I was with a guy I wouldn't have bothered. We did have a couple of hic ups during our stay but they were dealt with efficiently and certainly wouldn't deter me from staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Past Her Prime”
Reviews.Author: HobokenGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: This was a grand old hotel in a great location. The lobby and reception areas are lovely and the Empire and Vanderbilt ballrooms rooms have been beautifully redone. The rooms are another story. We had a small king room on the 11th floor that faced other rooms so it was rather dark and musty. The room had most modern amenities, a safe, flat screen TV with dubious reception, internet access and minibar but overall it was in desperate need of renovation. The furnishings and carpeting were tired and stained, the wallpaper was peeling, the doors were old, cracked and had been painted over one too many times. The bathroom was outdated, small and needed refurbishing; on a positive note, the water pressure in the shower was great and the bed was comfortable! We were there with a group and learned that the room sizes and quality ran the gamut and that not all rooms had safes. Service was good, check in/out efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Jackie in Diamond Reception Made all the difference in the world!!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoHotelCritic
Reviews.Content: I love the Waldorf, and it is the only place I stay in NYC for business or pleasure. It is perfectly located, grand, clean, comfortable, luxurious, and iconic. As a frequent guest and Hilton Diamond Member, I especially appreciate their Diamond Reception area. The staff is fantastic. Jackie in paticular always goes above and beyond to make sure tha I am happy and have everything I need to maximize my time in NYC. What an outstanding asset for an outstand hotel!

Reviews.Title: “"Wow"”
Reviews.Author: Mike2006
Reviews.Content: Our third time visiting this hotel. The name says it all. Definitely worth the splurge and you can opt for discounted upgrades which may become available for the date you require. This offers serious discount on accommodation upgrades and luckily we got upgraded to Towers suite for and extra $50 per night, so well worth the saving of over $600. Ate in the Bull & Bear restaurant and the food and wines was outstanding - exactly what you expect from a hotel of this nature. Looking forward to getting back again in near future!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, EXCELLENT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: KimPreston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Walford with our two children. The hotel was great. The staff were pleasant and very helpful. Room service was seriously expensive - although that is only to be expected in New York. The hotel has a great atmosphere and history. We would recommend going to the Starbucks around the corner from the hotel for coffee, which is cheaper than the Starbucks within the foyer of the hotel itself. the hotel is a great landmark - and taxis are available outside of the hotel. We would stay here again and have recommended the hotel to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Comparable to an aging Celebrity that has peaked in their career.”
Reviews.Author: chia6000
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay this weekend. The Waldorf-Astoria has a reputation for its history of having been THE place to stay in its heyday. This is made known through its photographs of golden-era celebrities that line they halls, the stories of Presidents and dignitaries that have stayed there, etc. It IS fascinating and impressive to learn all the tales within its rich history , and I respect that this hotel is an "icon" of the Hospitality Industry, but overall, I felt that if you compared this hotel to a person, it'd be the "aging Elvis" : still famous, and talented, but losing the luster he once had. The facilities are VERY clean overall: guilded furniture, shining floors, polished mirrors. But the rugs are a bit worn , room (we stayed in the TOWERS) are a bit dated, amenities not exactly as expected. GOOD POINTS: (aside from reputation and richness of history) The best part was the STAFF! Concierge SO FRIENDLY and PATIENT, especially to a "countrified" out of towner like me. Bell hops treated everyone so courteously, even though we certainly were NOT the celebrities or government dignitaries I am certain they have helped before. (my luggage , a Nike Duffle Bag, was not exactly Louis Vuitton!) Room service efficient, polite, helpful: extra towels brought up promptly, unexpected chocolate covered strawberries left for us plus Champagne! Hotel bar staff SUPER nice! Rooms were very quiet, climate control just fine, beds were comfortable as well. LOVED THE FITNESS CENTER: I was not staying in N.Y.C to work out, but this fitness center was probably the NICEST environment I have seen in one in a loooong time! Impeccable, modern and GENUINELY top notch equipment!!! Spa looked good too, but it was closed until "August 12th" according to the sign. The BAD points: the Hotel's age is a plus and a minus. As stated earlier, there are signs of worn-out areas. Rooms would benefit from renovations: bathroom was pretty small considering this is a "luxury" hotel. Tub was dangerously slippery.. The WORST part is that in this day and age, HOTELS LIKE THIS CALIBER should have FREE COMPLIMENTARY WIFI in the rooms. I understand about security, but it was ridiculous they cannot provide free internet , especially after paying this much for a room. There is a Starbucks acorss the street and wifi in the lobby area (many people hung out here because of that), but it is MUCH nicer to go back to your OWN room and zone out after a long day battling N.Y.C crowds. Overall, if you are jazzed about the romantic history the Waldorf carries and do not mind a little out-dated aspects of an aging hotel, you'll enjoy your stay. Kind of like Elvis: you might not have cared for his tacky white jumpsuits at the end of his career, but he still sounded pretty good, and will always have a place in our history.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, once in a lifetime experience!”
Reviews.Author: hanknlori
Reviews.Content: Our first time in New York City and we wanted it to be memorable. Our suite was elegant and everything we expected. Just walking into the hotel was a treat and we were thrilled when we were shown our room. The hotel lives up to its past glory and is a gem. We found the location to be within walking distance to may of our planned sightseeing spots and Grand Central Station if we needed the subway. Taxis were also always in que as well. We did not dine at the hotel as prices were said to be quite high. We were very happy we chose to stay at the Waldorf, well worth the price for the experience of a bygone era of elegance.

Reviews.Title: “Cole porter would cry”
Reviews.Author: jimbo067
Reviews.Content: This is probably our 20th stay at the Waldorf in New York. When we first started staying there, it was wonderful (about 10 years ago ). Several years ago it started to go down. I think after this last stay we have taken it off our list!!!! It is sad because it was so great in its day. Rooms small, not clean. Staff not helpful. The only positive is the location but certainly not worth the money!!!! So long Waldorf!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaRae
Reviews.Content: We were two couples traveling to NYC to see some Jazz and Broadway shows. We decided that if you are going to stay in NYC, why not stay somewhere fun, historic, well located and safe. The Waldorf was the place. The rooms were huge and had a historic sort of elegance. Though we didn't spend that much time in our rooms, the time we did spend was fabulous. The beds were extremely comfortable (and we have "back issues"), the rooms clean, service was great. The hotel itself is an historic site and features Cole Porter's piano in the lobby! Though one might think the Waldorf is too expensive, it really isn't that much more than most quality hotels in New York. We will definitely stay here again. The only expense we didn't enjoy was for parking....but we got what we payed for....our cars were safe, no worries, returned to us promptly etc.....NYC parking is always a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Melivard
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Waldorf since 1996 and I have to come to the realization that it just is not what it used to be. The rooms quite frankly are dirty. I understand NYC rooms are not large and that there is a level of charm in the city's hotels. Another issue was the hotel lobby. I was in the lobby (where Cole Porter's piano sits) and I overheard two ladies soliciting two men. It was very disturbing. I went to the hotel security and the answer he gave me led me to beleive this is an ongoing problem....I am not naive but....get the street walkers out of the lobby please!!!! The service is really bad too.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Tallulah4
Reviews.Content: My husband and two daughters aged 13 and 16, spent a fabulous week at this famous hotel. It was an unforgettable experience and made our holiday very special - we were very happy to return there after each busy day. The whole place is beautiful, in a very convenient location. Stay there if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Upper class”
Reviews.Author: D0nTravel
Reviews.Content: The name itself tells you that you are visiting a piece of history. Elegant, sophisticated and one of the best locations in Manhattan. You are right in the center of things, both for business and pleasure. Old world charm, mixed with modern facilities. We rented a suite and had a fantastic living room with fire place and a separate bedroom and bathroom. Ample, comfortable and elegant. Service is 5 stars and the facilities are excellent. The only thing that bothers me a little is the amount of people in the lobby as it is full o visitors and onlookers, but this is the price you pay for being a New York visitors attraction on its own right. This is one of the 5 hotels I would recommend to stay in New York if price is not a real consideration :)

Reviews.Title: “Classy and beautiful hotel in a Big City”
Reviews.Author: traveler_pr_usa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as part of my NYC trip in July. I used the Hilton Rewards Points to book the hotel and honestly it worth every point. The hotel is very classy and beautiful. I got a suite room and was excellent. Check-In - We got there very early and though they tried to get a room for us. As there was no rooms available at that time they got my cell phone and advise to text me when the room was available. Two hours later and while walking in Central Park I received the text that my room was available. And that was 2 hours before the check-in time. Excellent Room - What can I say??? Two bathrooms, King bed, amazing curtains, very very comfy and classy. After 10 minutes in the room they called my room to advise they will have my luggage in another 2 minutes and that they were sorry about the delay. What??? Facilities - Beautiful, A lot of restaurants and bars to choose from. Business Center - This I did not like, I forgot to print some tickets and went to concierge to see if they could do the favor, I was told to go to the business center which I did. They charge you a minimum of $5.00 to print or use the computers. They charge $0.50 for a black and white page plus $0.60 per minute. Please make sure you dont have to use this expensive service. Checkout - For checkout you just call ext. 69 and advise you will be checking out. You dont have to go to the front desk. What I did not like about this hotel is that in NYC you dont spend a lot of time in your hotels. It is a classy but pricey hotel and you should book it if you will spend some time in it.

Reviews.Title: “Simply da best”
Reviews.Author: ODEE2
Reviews.Content: Best 4-5 star lobby, It's luxurious, cosmopolitan and most importantly it's alive! Other Updtown/Midtown lobbies look like you lost a bet. This is a place to hang! Even heard a German choir singing in it. Best location - 51 st Metro station , 53 st Metro station, East 2nd avenue eateries, 24 hr pharmacies, best breakfast (the Brasserie on 53), Grand Central Terminal, Rockefeller Center, Radio City etc. Even the Halal wagon on 50st is good. Room -we had a Superior room 13th floor (view of Park Avenue/50 st) . Speakman AnyStream shower head, great toiletries . Would be better if there was free bottled water and a coffee maker. Expect New York Times not USToday. Least - No pool. 2nd Least - No quick tier deli food shopping with red velvet cake, Waldorf bagette, Waldorf salad, eggs benedict , Waldorf poster etc.

Reviews.Title: “Girls weekend for a Classic NYC trip!!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaPeapod
Reviews.Content: We travel to NYC regularly for family, fun, and business. One of the places we enjoy visiting is the Waldorf. It is a classic NYC landmark and to stay there is a treat. Some of the rooms are updated, and some others need a little work. The lounge, lobby, and all public areas are classy and beautiful. A meal at the bull and the bear is something to be savored (get the apple pie for dessert!!) as well as evening drinks in the lounge. Are there more updated places to stay? Yes. Can the Waldorf be a bit crowded and underwhelming if you get placed in an older room? Yes. But go for the history, the elegance, and the legacy. Keep in mind as well that you can get some great rates or not so great rates. So book carefully. I personally would not pay over 250 per night for a standard room there but that is just me.

Reviews.Title: “Still top shelf!”
Reviews.Author: Veniceneighbor
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying at this landmark iconic hotel in July of 2011. I expected the best and was not disappointed. Lovely, lovely old hotel with an efficient, friendly staff. The bed was wonderfully comfortable with lots of down pillows and comforter. The marble bathroom was exquisite. Don't miss staying here!

Reviews.Title: “We're back for our annual visit”
Reviews.Author: seabrite
Reviews.Content: This was our third year at the Waldorf=Astoria on the occasion of our niece's birthday.Although the hotel is over the top pricey...you get what you pay for. The staff in the hotel continues to be both professional and helpful and are always there to serve their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zooland
Reviews.Content: We were not looking for a modern hotel but a hotel with Class. We found it in The Waldorf-Astoria. This hotel has good service and a lot of history. I will say the restaurants are rather pricey but there are plenty of other restaurants in the area. Indulge yourself and try the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “A Waldorf Happily Ever After”
Reviews.Author: lakemilover
Reviews.Content: I was in New York City for a job interview and had checked out of my prior not-so-Waldorf hotel when my flight home was cancelled. The next flight I could get was the following morning. The not-so-Waldorf was booked full, and the woman at the desk said the best she could do was give me a list of other hotels to try. Have I mentioned it was raining? It was. Buckets. And I was wet and tired and had luggage and my computer to deal with. Figuring I might as well make the very best of the situation, I called the Waldorf Astoria (which was not on the not-so-Waldorf's list). They had four rooms available, and they would hold one for me. From the moment I arrived, every Waldorf Astoria employee I met was charming and polite, and not in that "I'm being nice because corporate tells me I have to" way. Jordan Howell, who checked me in, was especially professional and caring. My room turned out to be a charming bedroom suite with its own sitting room, complete with marble fireplace. After what had been a long and hectic day, I felt as though I had stepped into an earlier, more peaceable era. Room service was timely, and the food was perfectly prepared. The bed was heaven. Will I stay at the Waldorf again? Yes. Whenever I can.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could live in the lobby instead of the room....”
Reviews.Author: Corvette8
Reviews.Content: Title says it all. I've stayed at the Waldorf several times over the last 25 years and the lobby stays as glamorous as ever while the rooms get more and more outdated and tired.... Good location of course. Staff? Rude, unhelpful but this is New York so what can one expect? Tried to bill me for someone elses roomservice and not admitting fault even when I told them "No, I've only stayed one night and No, I have not changed rooms during that night...." That set me back an additional ten minutes to clear up, stupid mistake and bad handling of it.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: crazesu
Reviews.Content: I visited NYC for part business and part pleasure. I must say that the bed was incredibly comfortable. The room itself was nice but the bathroom was small and definitely not built for women in mind as there is no real space for toiletries. Also, be careful not to move things around in the mini bar or you will find numerous charges on your folio. Overall it was a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Failed to meet my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: marvic140908
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night in December after moving from our first hotel in which we spent three great nights. I got the room on a 50% off deal. We would never had afforded this room without the offer. If I had paid the full amount I would have been dissapointed. The room was very big and the bed was massive and comfortable. However we thought the the decor of the room was very dated and in need of modernising. This was also the case for the bathroom. The decor of the ground floor and restaraunts is fantastic/stunning. The prices of food and drinks in the hotel are expensive which you woulp expect from a hotel of this calibre. On the whole we found the hotel a bit overated.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kmp89
Reviews.Content: Myself and my friend stayed here in February 2010 as part of my birthday celebrations. Its a hotel we have both admired and always wanted to stay in. We booked a fantastic rate on a mini suite room. The room had 2 double beds, a lounge and 2 bathrooms. A little disappointed that we didn't get a marble bathtub but it was certainly an experience staying there. We also ended up staying an extra night due to our delay during the first part of our holiday. We downgraded to a Double Double room and the porters transferred our luggage whilst we were out sight seeing, so all we needed to do was check out of one room and into the other. The double double room was just as impressive as the mini suite! A huge bathroom and a good sized space for getting dressed as well as 2 double beds. The hotel is very close to Magnolias Bakery, which is famous for being in Sex and the City. They sell some amazing cakes. The location again is excellent and near a really good diner that is perfect for breakfast, not too expensive and very friendly. Overall this was a wonderful stay and I would honestly go and stay there again if the price was right. It ticked all of the boxes and many more. The staff were friendly and very helpful. John, on the Concierge desk informed us of the airport shuttle which was so much cheaper than getting a taxi. It was $17 each I think from the Waldorf Astoria to Newark Liberty International. Highly recommend this hotel, even if it is just for 1 night to say you have stayed here and experienced a night at the Waldorf Astoria, New York!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: trifocal3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a classic. Most everyone has heard of it and seen it in a movie or two. We were super excited to be staying here. Unfortunately it probably would a lot better if we stayed in 1975 instead of 2010. This hotel looks like it is stuck in the 1970's. We had a decent size room for NYC. Something I noticed that was unique was each room has a doorbell. Probably really cool 30 years ago, but I got bored with it after ringing it a few times. The bathrooms are eclectic but be careful of the sloped shower/bathtubs. When the water hits the tub floor it makes a pseudo slip and slide. The lobby is vast and dripping in gold and elaborate decorations. Each Sunday they turn the lobby into a giant brunch buffet. My mouth was watering looking at all the fresh shrimp and the smell of the omelets, but at $90 a person ($60 for a child) we passed. Overall it was nice to be able to say I've stayed here, but probably will look to stay somewhere a bit more modern next time.

Reviews.Title: “Paying for the name”
Reviews.Author: andy_b_lad
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is overly impressive, so much so that they may have forgotten about the rest of the hotel. The rooms are nice, but staying here you expect more than just nice. I certainly don't have anything bad to say but again, you expect more. They are clean, nicely furnished with a big tv and elegant feel. Each room has its own wifi, but it costs $15.99 a day. The rooms seem safe enough but there is no safe inside. Everything that is positive seems to have a 'but'. Its hard to pin point anything wrong with the hotel but you leave with a small sense of disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Waldorf Astoria”
Reviews.Author: Nudge12
Reviews.Content: It is just an amazing experience ariving at the Waldorf. It is so steeped in history and we had a very warm welcome from the doorman to the reception area where we were checked in. Mary took us to the diamond reception for check in and Mary and her colleague Jackie were full of chat and entertainment and it was obvious there were happy to greet us and made us very welcome indeed. Mary took our passports for checkin and I informed her that it was my wifes 40th birthday (although she doesnt look a day over 30 if you are reading this hon !). She promptly gave us a fantastic upgrade which was the perfect start to our break just after the long flight from Ireland. We regularly used the concierge and they were always happy to provide us with all the information we needed and recommended a super restaurant for our second night there. The only part that was less than superb for me was the bar. We were told in books and by the hotel itself of the history and classic bull and bear bar that people came to visit from all around - found it very average myself - nothing to do with staff or drinks just found the bar to be average. Location is fantastic with proximity to Central Park, Rockafeller Center, Times Square, shopping in 5th and Madison - list goes on. Overall fantastic trip to New York and wonderful experience at the Waldorf. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “The latest stay over the last 10 years”
Reviews.Author: LynneDGV
Reviews.Content: Since the Waldorf Astoria welcomed survivors of 9/11 who were displaced from ground zero, we have experienced only the most excellent service during our subsequent monthly stays at the Waldorf. It is because of such outstanding service, especially at Diamond Reception, that the Waldorf Astoria is now our, "home away from home." We wish to single out Jacqueline Grant at Diamond Reception, Front Office Operations, whose caring, friendly, professional attributes, and consistent attention to our special needs, has made every stay easy and a pleasure. When my husband was recuperating from surgery, she ensured that every device we needed was waiting for us, that a refrigerator and microwave were placed in our room making our lengthy stay so much more comfortable. We had only the best attention from everyone at the Waldorf, from Diamond Reception to the bellmen to restaurant personnel and excellent maid service. We could not recommend this hotel more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, incredible stay”
Reviews.Author: Jenn1125
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf in NYC does not disappoint. Even though it was a holiday weekend, we were able to check into our room upon arrival at approximately 10 a.m. This was our third Waldorf stay - and there are many more in the future. The location is great - close to everything, but away from the noise of Times Square. The concierge was really helpful with our Fourth of July plans. Just an overall great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Were treated like a king & queen”
Reviews.Author: Jason_and_Tania
Reviews.Content: We were treated fantastic from the beginning when we met Katelin (sp?) at the reception who was very professional, courteous, polite, friendly & respectful. Every morning at breakfast, we requested Daria who served us quickly, efficiently, kindly & with a smile. We look forward to returning!!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Stay at Waldorf=Astoria”
Reviews.Author: LornaMoore2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf Astoria for 1 night on the 9th of July as part of our honeymoon trip around the United States. We'd stayed the previous 5 nightst at the New Yorker. I've always wanted to stay at the Waldorf since I was a little girl but due to cost we stayed for one night only. We arrived at the hotel at the Towers Entrance as that is where the taxi left us, the bell man took our luggage to reception and then shouted at us as we didn't tell him we weren't staying at the Towers! The receptionist was lovely though and arranged for our luggage to be stored and transported to the main part of the hotel when we checked in. The main reception was stunning and really made you understand why the hotel is such an historical landmark in New York. The toilets themselves in the lobby are worth a particular mention - absolutely incredible!! We went up to our room which was very large by NYC standards but was a little dated with some peeling wallpaper etc. It didn't really detract from what was a stunning room though. About 5 minutes after we arrived a butler rang our doorbell (the rooms have doorbells!! I loved this!) and brought in a tray of champagne with glasses and a printed letter which said on the envelope "Mr & Mrs Moore - In Residence" which was an amazing touch. The letter wished us congratulations on our honeymoon and asked us to let us know if there was anything they could do to improve our stay. A lovely touch! We decided to have a night in and make the most of the room so we ordered chinese food which the concierge helpfully gave us some menu's for. We also ordered room service for breakfast which was brought in with a set table and every dish had cloches over which was absolutely brilliant. The food was delicious and made you feel very special! Unfortunately of about 10 of the staff that we encountered about 8 were very rude and obnoxious. As I've mentioned we'd previously stayed at the New Yorker which is a much less expensive hotel and their service far exceeded that of the Waldorf. It really did make a difference to our enjoyment of the stay there and could have been improved greatly. All in all a historic hotel and worth a stay but I'd recommend visiting the reception/lobby and having lunch in one of the restaurants rather than forking out for a room which are better elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “WOW...Australians impressed”
Reviews.Author: AmizB
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived back home to Australia and I wanted to write to you to tell you about our most recent stay. This was our first time to NYC and chose to stay at the Waldorf Astoria due the name and reputation it has worldwide and I can say that the Waldorf definitely didn't let us down. We arrived at the hotel and felt instantly welcomed, from the doorman, porter and even the room attendants; all of your staff went out of their way to look after us and make sure we were comfortable. During our time at the Waldorf we crossed paths with many of your staff but there was one girl, who in particular, really was exceptional. We approached the desk to get some keys for our room and we were greeted not only by a friendly face but by an Australian, its not very often you find an Australian working in a hotel in NYC. Laura provided friendly and individual service and really went above and beyond our expectations. She was happy to discuss our trip with us, provided recommendations of great restaurants and places of interest to visit and even sent a lovely amenity to us. These are the little things that really made our stay a memorable one, such a great Australian ambassador for your hotel. We had a wonderful time staying at your hotel and will be recommending it to all of our friends back home.

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: coocoomaroo
Reviews.Content: This is a hard review to write because I love the waldorf astoria! We had two rooms, my room was a mini suite, one bedroom, two bath with a living room. Just loved it. the beds were comfortable, great pillows too. the room was a little worn, but the propertry is old. The maids did a fantastic job everyday and were friendly. The staff was also friendly. At the conceier desk, Mauel was very helpful, and a speical thanks to Gram who was excellent! No complaints on my room... however my daughter had delux room, non smoking... and the people next to her smoked everyday, and night and the smoke came under her door through the connecting door. after three compaints to the management who said they would send someone to talk to them, and didn't. the smoking contuined. Finally my daughter spoke with the people who were smoking and it stopped. The management should have taken care of this. In their defense the did offer to move my daughter, So, I am very dissiapointed in the waldorf astoria for allowing this to happen, this is not a cheap hotel. If you do stay here, you have to eat at the Bull and Bear, it is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious New York”
Reviews.Author: LadyMysteriis
Reviews.Content: We went there with my parents for their wedding anniversary. It was very perfect. It's very luxurious and beautiful. All the decoration is old style, but the room are very comfortable. My parents were very happy to be in New York in this kind of hotel. I know the room are expensive, but in New York, Time Square, every kind of nice hotel are expensive. I'm happy to tried Waldorf one time in my life. Park Avenue is more relax then Broadway, so if you want some tranquility and you can pay for Waldorf, go for it!

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL!”
Reviews.Author: CAR09
Reviews.Content: Fantastic property and we were VERY pleasantly surprised at the size of the room...especially since it was in NYC. The room was very large with a sitting area, huge closet, and very nice bathroom. We especially loved the fact that there was ZERO street noise. Beautiful hotel and can't wait to stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely accommodations in a really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Opinioned_traveler
Reviews.Content: We found the Waldorf Astoria to be a very nice hotel - our room was large and well appointed, the bathroom too was quite large and nicely appointed. The lobby was elegant, the concierge helpful and the location is terrific. The only bad thing about our visit was that the television in the room was broken.

Reviews.Title: “Old but Chaming”
Reviews.Author: simplythebest_2511
Reviews.Content: A little chaotic upon arrival.Check in slow.Surroundings enjoyable, trying to take in just where we were.The room was comfortable and clean just old ,could do with a referb.No view but didn't really expect.Tried for an upgrade as led to believe it possible, it wasn't.There was a problem entering and leaving our bathroom with a slope and slippy carpet no warning very dangerous, ended up putting the bath mat on it to remind us to go slow so as not to land again on the bed or sink.Visitors from the UK need to be prepared for the excessive tipping where to start and where to finish.Very expensive.Breakfast fantastic.The Bar was very good again expensive but for the experience worth it.You do get a starter voucher of approx $20 each.Overall Worth the visit just for the experience of being there where so many famous people have been before us.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Lusitanian
Reviews.Content: I was there at the coldest time in NYC for 6 years and I had never experienced anything like that here in the UK. However the staff were warm and friendly and there was nothing too much for them to try! I was greeted at reception by this lovely girl called Sarah, who was outstanding! My room was good, the food was great and the lovely jazz pianist in the lounge made the evenings superb. Would I go back... most certainly!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & Historic”
Reviews.Author: DryProp
Reviews.Content: I was initially worried because some of the negative reviews. We stayed here for two nights on a recent getaway to NYC and couldn't have been happier. 1. Atmosphere - this hotel is beautiful. From the carved wood in the elevators to the marble fireplace in my room (which I thought about trying to sneak out in my suitcase) to the mosaics in the lobby entryway, I loved it. The history here is incredible too. Herbert Hoover, Douglas MacArthur, etc. lived in this hotel. To those who say it is "dated," I say go stay at a cookie cutter hotel that looks the same wherever you go! 2. Staff - I checked in early and my bags were stowed by the bellhop so I could wander about the city. I explained to the check-in girl (named Mai) that it was my wife's 30th birthday. She comped us a bottle of champagne and upgraded us to a room with a better view than the one into which we were originally booked. The bartenders (Nowicki and the young Albanian) were really friendly as well. We had no complaints with the staff. 3. Room Service - pricey, but hey this is NYC. 4. Location - couldn't be better. We walked everywhere (Chinatown, Empire State Building, etc.). 5. WiFi - we need to stay in touch with our jobs. I wish that the wi-wfi (in a hotel of that caliber) was free. As I was buying bottles of champagne at $100 a pop, one would think that internet access would be provided! We are thinking of returning in November and bringing our daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect One Day, Outstanding the Next”
Reviews.Author: MandyandTim
Reviews.Content: As frequent travellers, we enjoy trying out all the luxurious hotels around the world. The Waldorf Astoria was our pick in New York because it is renowned for being the top destination in New York for over a century. We had high expectations and I am happy to report that the service, food, room and hotel exceeded our expectations. I would never stay anywhere else in new York. We came from Australia for 8 nights and from the moment we arrived after a long tiring flight until the time we left we felt welcomed and well cared for. The staff were so friendly and always helpful. Jackie in the Hilton HHonors lounge was exceptional, providing friendly, individual service, catering for all our needs and requests happily. The food and service at the Bull and Bear, Oscars' Buffet Breakfast and at Peacock Alley was terrific. We even enjoyed the room service, because the menu sounded great, and we were very pleased we did. The cleanliness of the rooms was fantastic. Our rooms were serviced twice a day and the lovely ladies servicing our rooms were terrific, it felt like a fresh new room every day! The staff encouraged us to wander around the beautiful Hotel, which was great because we felt comfortable to visit the Grand Ballroom etc. The position of the hotel is excellent. An easy walk to Times Square, Central Park, Theatre District, Grand Central, United Nations, Rockefeller, St Patricks, Saks and the great shops of 5th and Madison, and more. Taxis and the Hotels Town Cars are always at the front door to take you anywhere as well. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in NY. And, in future when travelling around the world, I will be trying to stay at all the other Waldorf Astoria Hotels too. Very happy to be able to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: DMK81
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, my wife and I were greeted by Jackie of the Diamond Reception desk. Jackie greeted us warmly and asked the purpose of our visit to New York City. When I told her my wife and I were celebrating our anniversary, she was quite happy for us and told me I should have noted that on my Hilton Reward Stay Certificate. Apparently, the Waldorf likes to recognize such occasions and for Jackie, she would see to it that we were properly accommodated. After several phone calls and some side conversations with her colleagues, Jackie managed to upgrade us from the Waldorf Astoria to the Waldorf Towers and provided several amenities including a bottle of iced champagne. I certainly was not expecting any of this and was excited just to be staying at the Waldorf with my wife on a Reward Stay. Jackie turned an already incredible start to our weekend into an absolutely unforgettable experience. This woman is "best in class" and a true star in the Hilton/Waldorf family. As far as the hotel, absolutely breathtaking. Art Deco, four distinctive restaurants, three lounges, and of course, 24-hour room service. Superior hotel amenities, services and walking distance to many popular NYC destinations. A bit pricey but I was staying on a Hilton Reward Stay and was Treated like Royalty. We will definitely return for another anniversary celebration.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf New York”
Reviews.Author: notam787
Reviews.Content: Pre booked a suite on a corner allowing better view of NYC The suite on the 23rd floor was OK showing signs of age around the edges, dressing room sliding door mirror broken and would not open Blind in the louge room broken. At six pm jackets must be worn in the hotel Had dinner in the Bear Restaurant only average food and presentation

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at Waldorf-Astoria”
Reviews.Author: katiebc
Reviews.Content: Luxury like I had always dreamed of at this hotel. Great service and extremely comfortabke bed. The E train subway station is across the street and very convenient if coming from JFK. Great location in proxmity to lots of sites. This place did not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “A classic, pricey hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: bsimosd
Reviews.Content: This was our 40th wedding anniversary celebration, with the accommodations and midtown location very good. Room service seemed quite expensive, and we had to utilize the lobby for free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: ls87
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed in the overall condition of the hotel and the service. I would definitely not stay there again if traveling to New York. The hotel isn't clean and the staff is arrogant.

Reviews.Title: “old old style hotel”
Reviews.Author: bicocchinaonesta
Reviews.Content: I've been at the famous Waldorf Astoria for some work reasons and I've been really disappointed. The building interiors are really really old and sometimes decadent. The lobby is great, with that majestic chandelier but the rooms have an urgent need to be renewed. For the reputation of this hotel, the management should do something to renew the rooms, at the moment it's really disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Prestigious, Great Location and Breathtaking Lobby”
Reviews.Author: wow69
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is amazing and I think anyone that wants to visit NYC should stay atleast one night at this historical hotel. I was skeptical with the reviews I read online. But my room was of good quality (not old and in need of restoration) and I only paid $239/night through priceline. The amount I prepaid on priceline should have been the final amount no extra taxes if not noted at the front desk upon checkin. The checkin 1 hr early was originally allowed and then they told me they would let me know when my room is ready which was 3:00pm. When I checked out is when I found an extra charge for my prepaid room for $75 additional taxes. Other than that small inconvenience the hotel being historical with an amazing lobby with Swarovoski Crystal chandelliers and custom marble foyer, the location is worth the extra $'s (walking distance to Times Square, 5th Avenue, Central Park, ETC.). The King Deluxe Room was average size but was perfect for 2 (especially considering you don't stay in your room in NYC you are going to as many places as possible). Pack a few bottles of wine or champagne in your checked baggage and put them in the ice buckets they provide and you can save alot of money on alcohol. The breakfast is like $70 per person but their is a starbucks in the hotel downstairs and the wifi is only free in the lobby. Make sure to take the circle line 2hr cruise around most of the main landmarks of NYC in the morning on your first day and sit on the left side (coupons in airport magazine $8 off per person at the time), bike through central park (prices are significantly cheaper 2 blocks away and negotiable), and eat at Tao or Aureole in Times Square!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: utaxid
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Waldorf for over ten years and will never stay anyplace else in the city. It is truly a classic hotel unlike any other. Jackie in diamond registration and Sonny in Sir Harrys are great! I am already looking forward to my next stay at the Waldorf and I just left!

Reviews.Title: “Not a real good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: chicodkid
Reviews.Content: When we first got there I asked the doorman to have our luggage brought up to our room. He acted surprise "you want someone to bring your luggage up to your room ??" Like he had never heard that before. Got to room, TV remote didn't work. Took a while to get a new one. One morning I was leaving the room & was almost to the elevator, a maid who saw me come out of the room asked me to take this notice back to my room. I said my wife is there, she handed it to me anyway. The notice said that we would be without hot water for 6 hours. Also the hot water in the shower never worked like it should. Took about 5 - 10 minutes for hot water to get to shower. Had to be real careful, couldn't get in shower before you got the water just right. Almost got scalded the first time. Good location, rooms were clean, lobby etc.

Reviews.Title: “What are you critical people talking about??”
Reviews.Author: LovetogoCalabasas
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Waldorf Astoria at least once a year (if not more) for many years now . I have never had any negative issues like I have been reading here. On the contrary, I have always been treated like a VIP with nothing other than the utmost respect. The entire staff has always been more than friendly and accomodating to me. I am not one to hesitate to speak up if there is an issue and it is never a problem here. My last trip Jordan at the reception desk was amazing and could not have been more helpful and accomodating. He went out of his way to make my stay perfect. What I like most about this hotel is that everyone here has always been very gracious to me. It is fabulous, the rooms are very grand and stately, the location is perfect, the lobby is just jaw dropping magnificent. This is the place to come for the New York of years past. Don't miss it. I think you will never stay anywhere else in the city again. You walk thru the revolving doors into the lobby and are transported to magnificence. No matter what season I have returned this hotel remains the same. Simply fabulous! I am staying at another Waldorf Astoria collection hotel soon and I fear it will be a disappointment after my many stays at the New York Waldorf Astoria.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel -- special treat!”
Reviews.Author: b0bbestultz
Reviews.Content: We went for a couples weekend. The hotel is luxurious, comfortable, and beautiful! The service was excellent. I would go back in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “Consistently excellent”
Reviews.Author: RolfZ11
Reviews.Content: I travel to NY for business every two weeks. The Waldorf is my favorite hotel because the service, the cleanliness, the rooms are consistently excellent. Also, the elevators are fast! You don't have to wait to get one. Also, appreciate Jackie at the front desk who always makes me feel at home there.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible stay, horrible staff, don't go there”
Reviews.Author: littleswisstravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a couple of days beginning of june with family and everything was wrong from top to bottom. First the rooms are extremely old-fashioned, and dirty. On the second night the toilet flush could not stop flushing resulting in a complete flooding of the room....when we called the front desk they just said "yes we will come"...and we waited for 30 minutes!!!!!!!! We were late for dinner so we had to leave but they say it will be fixed...did not bother offering a new room since ours was flooded...when we return the room had been cleaned - somehow - but the smell was still there! Next night the same problem occured and the same experience! no one coming before half and hour! incredible for a hotel that pretends to be a 5 star!! Definitely not worth the price! will never come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: vale_sartori
Reviews.Content: Its location is the only pro - 5 minutes walk from the 5th avenue and 10 from Broadway. The rest was a big disappointment: very tiny room, not particularly clean, bathroom requiring renovation. I would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Great. People Extremely Helpful”
Reviews.Author: Thankfultohilton
Reviews.Content: In June of 2010 my wife and I stayed two nights at the Waldorf in an excellent room. The noise level was very low and the bed extremely comfortable. We had a great birthday dinner at the Bull and Bear and great in-room service. An entire year later I was helped by several people on the Hilton (now owner of Waldorf) staff to discover the source of a charge on my credit card bill that was to the Waldorf, but seemed a bit odd to me. It turned out fine and it was a charge for which I had lost the receipt. I would like to thank Dan, Laura, Sarah , Sara , Jordan and Spencer for all doing their jobs and solving the puzzle. They went the extra mile and then some in good spirit. We will be coming back to this and other Hilton hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but def paying over the top for the name”
Reviews.Author: workandtravelmix
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend. The hotel itself is lovely and well situated for shopping / site seeing / eating & drinking but well overpriced. Cost £200 a night and there are hotels a lot cheaper and with far better rooms (The room didn't have anything wrong it was just nothing special for the price and our view was onto a nearby sky scraper). The food was also very expensive though delicious. New york is amazing though if I went back it would be a cheaper hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel, exceptional service"”
Reviews.Author: GlennMiller_11
Reviews.Content: Great service from room to resturant to bar. Jackie, is the provider of excellence without question. You must experience the breakfast, Sir Harry's Bar, and room serice is efficient, rooms very spacious and maid service superior. Location of the hotel is perfect, in walking distance to sites of interest, Madison three blocks, broadway a fun walk or $5 taxi, near bus and subway, abundance taxis. Most impressive lobby. Compliments to management most employees have been employeed over 15 years, they remember and greet you like family.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with lots of history!”
Reviews.Author: Stacywalden
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel! We had a great experience and plan on returning next time we are in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Still an American classic!”
Reviews.Author: SerengetiSam
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton HHonors Diamond member, I have had the pleasure of staying in many properties all over the world, in all of the HHonors brands. The original Waldorf Astoria remains one of my favorites. The building itself is an Art Deco classic, and the experience of staying there exemplifies traditional elegance in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Anniversary Stay!”
Reviews.Author: streake
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Waldorf to celebrate our anniversary. I informed reservations of the celebration when I booked the room and I was not disappointed. A bottle of champagne greeted us when we returned to our room on Friday evening. Also, as diamonds members we received two drink coupons, two bottles of water (each day) from the mini-bar and a starbucks breakfast (each day). They were able to upgrade us to a suite, which was GORGEOUS! We didn't have a view but we didn't care much as we were out and about all over the city during our weekend stay. All in all, I don't think I will stay anywhere else in NYC from this point on...

Reviews.Title: “Trading on past glory..”
Reviews.Author: helen2412
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf Astoria for five days with my partner. While the lobby is amazing, and the history of the place palpable and pretty glorious, there is much that could be improved in the hotel overall. The rooms are not big. Ours was a suite but was little more than an average sized bedroom in most hotels. The bathroom was averagely sized though the fittings outdated and generally tthe same is true of the bedroom. The style is outdated - which to some extent is fair enough, it is not trying to be a modern hotel - and threadbare at the edges. The bedroom window overlooked a roof with bits of rubble on it and the result was that the room got very little sunshine and was dark even in the day time! Despite costing about 400 dollars a night, there was a charge for internet access. There was a radio, though nothing as modern as an iPod docking station. It appeared (unbelievably) according to the room guide that there was a charge for using the hotel gym, though when we called to query this they said no, it was free. So they need to update their room guides.. The bar was beautiful, though when we first went to sit at a table we were told there was a queue - despite there being no-one queuing that we could see, and several tables free. we opted to sit at the bar - and unsurprisingly about 5 minutes later someone came and told us there was a table free. We chose to stay at the bar. The bar staff are friendly, the drinks are not cheap but it is worth having at least one drink here. I'd advise steering clear of the breakfast, it looks amazing but it is incredibly expensive - i think around 70 dollars per person - and there are no shortage of wonderful places in Manhattan to have breakfast or brunch - the Rockefeller centre outside restaurant is just one that is great for brunch. Late in the evening there are very obviously prostitutes hanging around in the lobby and/or chatting to men/potential clients. It seems strange that such a supposedly grand hotel turns a blind eye to this, but they seem to. The positives are that the staff, especially the domestic and maintenance guys, are really friendly, and that the location is very central. The downsides are the cost, the general shabbiness in much of the hotel, the lack of value for money. Overall I would definitely pick somewhere else with more individuality, quirkiness and style, especially if spending that kind of money!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrsjessicawilliams
Reviews.Content: We went to New York for my birthday and the hotel really made the holiday for us. It was fantastic. They knew it was my birthday and so upgraded us to a better room - although the view was not great. Check in was a breeze and the location was perfect! We could walk everywhere or there were always taxis outside. We didn't eat or drink in the hotel but everywhere look so luxurious and grand. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a new york stay. It's well worth paying that little bit extra.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Birthday”
Reviews.Author: greenidlady
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the weekend for my birthday. This hotel is beautiful. Others have said the hotel needs updating but this is a historic site. I like the antique furniture and old fixtures. If you want a modern hotel go try one of the boutique hotels. Our room was on the 10th floor, very spacious with a nice comfy bed. We upgraded to a superior room. I am not sure what the deluxe room would have been like. Concierge was great, very helpful getting reservations, directions, holding our bags after check out. You couldn't ask for anyone more friendly. Bellman were also very helpful handling bags and getting a cab for us. They are pretty curt with the cabbies though. We wanted to try the famous Sunday brunch, big mistake to do on a holiday. It was quite the shocker when our bill came and it was 155 dollars per person. Sort of wished someone would have informed of the price beforehand. We could have just stayed another night in the hotel. The buffet was very elegant and tasty but I don't know if it's worth that price unless you sit around and have caviar and bloody mary's till 2pm. Don't drive here, parking is 60 per day without in and out priviledges, I flew in and boyfriend took the train from CT. WiFi is 16 dollars a day and with Verizon there has little to no phone service in the lobby area. The gym is very nice but 15 dollars a day unless you are a Hilton Diamond member or tower guest. They do provide headsets and towels. Location was excellent, within walking distance to Grand Central, Times Sqaure, Central Park and Madison Avenue. I couldn't have asked for a better birthday

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but pretentious restaurant staff”
Reviews.Author: walkabout101
Reviews.Content: Beautiful large main lobby, a bit busy with all the conferences going on. Room was nice enough, but bathroom in need of a little nip tuck. Ate at the Bull and Boar, pretty good food, but waiter was quite snobby. Also paid $82 for breakfast in the lobby restaurant, for coffee and bacon and eggs. Coffee $8/cup, TOAST is only $7. Again, got the snob treatment. And it wasn't anything to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “The famous landmark lived up to its reputation”
Reviews.Author: Cath44105
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Waldorf while we were in NYC for my cousin's wedding, and we were impressed. The price was only slightly more than other hotels in the neighborhood, and the little things made it worth it - cabbies always knew where to drop us off, and a uniformed employee out front always found us a cab when we needed it. The customer service throughout was great, the business center with computers for flight check-ins was very convenient. We had a little trouble with loud neighbors, and security responded quickly and effectively - it gave us a great story to tell when we got home. The room was decently sized, but quite large for a NYC room; walk-in closet, and very large bathroom. Our view was of an airshaft, but it buffered the street noise, so we didn't mind. We used a sheet of hotel stationery to write a note for my cousin and her new husband - they loved it! We'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it & disagree with the negative reviews on here”
Reviews.Author: jhk85
Reviews.Content: we stayed last night in room 1554 and it was fine. Granted we got a good deal...250 a night and I would probably feel differently if I had pad 350 but there are a couple of things to keep in mind. we were on a cheapie deal and and I'm sure that were were not in one of their best rooms. the room was fine size wise. for a NY hotel it was about average if not a little big. (much bigger than rooms at the W across the street) The room was a little noisy, but again, not much different than other hotels in NY. the bed was fine, there was an ipod docking station & a minibar. the room overlooked the dome of St Barts next door...not an awsome view but pretty good. there was a chair and ottoman in the room that was a little worn but the other furnishings were fine. The bathroom was really nice. the air conditioning was not great--I have often had this problem in NY hotels. I think the negative reviews on there have unrealistic expectations of reasonably priced NY hotels. You want a big room & great air conditioning at a reasonable price? Go to Phoenix in August.

Reviews.Title: “Below expectations”
Reviews.Author: cat_n_harrell
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations of this hotel. After all, this is the historic Waldorf in NYC, right? After a cross-country trip, I waited over 20 minutes in a long line in the lobby to actually check in and get a room. Hair in the bathtub, nasty crud caked on multiple buttons on the remote control and really, really loud drunk neighbors across the hall in the middle of the night really made the stay challenging. Despite paying $16/day for internet... it was painfully slow the entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed!”
Reviews.Author: Johngreek
Reviews.Content: Very shortly ,great brand but need's full renovation ! rooms are less than 3* quality ,service is very slow ,would not recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & historic, but I would choose another place”
Reviews.Author: tjcheerio
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and historical, of course...but once you get up to the room it's sort of disappointing. I absolutely adore The Four Seasons on E 57th Street and I think it's comparable to The Waldorf. The rooms are much more comfortable, in my opinion and I were going to spend this kind of money on a hotel room.....I'd definitely choose the Four Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “Five star.... classic quality... classic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Marty1962
Reviews.Content: What a place... We got a great bargain from Virgin Holidays and stayed for a week. This hotel has pure class written all over it and oozes quality. Once checked in we went to our 24th floor "delux room" (the bottom price tier) which was enormous. The bed was massive and there was room for a writing table and 2 armchairs ,,, even a 48" TV! Everything was fine and they even offered us a fridge to keep water (beer) in for free! I can't comment on food, spa etc as these were out of our price range but one evening in the bar was fun if expensive (our celebration). There are plenty of places close by to eat in (esp San Martin on E 49th St). There is free wifi in the lobby or the paid for type in the room. There IS a dress code but nobody seemed to fuss over that. I wore my shorts in the lobby in the same way many corporate types wore their name badges in the lobby... both things not desirable but they didn't bother. If you can get a deal, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Living off its name only”
Reviews.Author: markoc96
Reviews.Content: This was without a doubt the biggest dissapointment I have received from the Hilton group so far. I am a Hilton Diamond member and have stayed at a great many of their group hotels over the years, finally stayed here last week. The good things are, the lobby and the Diamond Desk staff, both excellent! The "meh" things are the rooms are quite small and uninspiring (I had a 2 category upgrade (Superior King) so can say this unreservedly) with a view of aircon units, and its not "that" close to where you want to be. The bad things...... Room was ready only after check in time and I found long hairs behind the toilet seat. The staff came to check the room 3 times in the 20mins after i arrived before I even had a chance to check..different people. The doormen did not help people, i can carry my bags fine but I saw elderly people dragging their bags up the front 10 steps inside the door. this while there were 3 doormen outside the front standing. There was "fluff" hanging from the aircon in the bathroom. The TV was buzzing a lot (this I have seen in a few other posts and seemingly explained by staff as overcapacity on the system). You have to order tea/coffee facilities from reception, these are not provided automatically. My diamond "breakfast entitlement" was a pastry and a juice from starbucks....not even a bagel...just a apple pie or muffin or whatever. In short a HUGE dissapointment, I have stayed at the W=A Cavelieri in Rome and I can tell you that is a hilton that knows how to treat its guests well. I would not stay there again or recommend it to others, it was just very very dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “An institution....”
Reviews.Author: Uncorked4u
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf is an institution, in both good and bad ways. The check in process can be tedious...if you are a diamond member insure that you use the diamond services office to check in...it really expedites things. Rooms vary from small and slightly outdated to extravagant suites. Room service is great, a bit pricey, but great none-the-less. Restaurants are ok, many other better options nearby. The staff, other than the diamond desk, goes about their tasks diligently, no t really noticing that you are there...unlike most other properties of this caliber. The overall lack of quality service is what really keeps this hotel from becoming something great again. The hotel is very much worth experiencing, its beautiful, well situated and, if you get a suite of some kind, spacious.

Reviews.Title: “We felt like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: peacockranch
Reviews.Content: I would first like to thank all of the front desk staff at the hotel for their utmost professional attitudes upon checking in. It is to be expected of a hotel of this calibur to receive the best hospitality in the nation and they did not fail. I was always under the impression that the hotel rooms in NYNY were "the size of shoe boxes" however we were given a room that had 2 queen beds fit for Royalty. We received an early checkin on a Sunday mid morning and when arriving in the hotel lobby we got to look at the wonderful Sunday Bruch that the hotel provided (at a cost). This was an enchanting sight! Crab Legs, Oysters on the half shell, and on and on. What a wonderful stay we had and I would stay here again whenever visiting NYNY again. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Best service we have ever had at a hotel in 40 years of travel!”
Reviews.Author: brbnurse2
Reviews.Content: The staff made us feel warm, welcome and pampered. After 40 plus years of travel we have never experienced this level of exceptional service. It started upon arrival with Jim, the bellman, and held throughout our five night stay. History tour on Saturday was both interesting and delightful. Already planning a return stay!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it-fantastic”
Reviews.Author: RIUCapeVerde
Reviews.Content: Loved the Waldorf Astoria-such an iconic building. Fantastic location. Great service. Hotel may be a little tired but still has it's grandure.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: BrianE315
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently on business and always endeavor to stay at the Waldorf. Their service is simply unmatched. Jackie at the Diamond Desk goes is just outstanding. Staying there is a memorable event

Reviews.Title: “A landmark that needs an update”
Reviews.Author: 3fortheride
Reviews.Content: A convienent landmark mid-town location. The rooms are old and could use updating.

Reviews.Title: “considering the name i was soooo dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: roadlesstraveledNj
Reviews.Content: I'm going to keep this short but i still can't believe this hotel would have a room like this and treat a hilton member this way. The lobby was really nice, a bit dated but its all marble and nice, the parking was expensive, the service was pretty good, the location was great. Now the room, i used hilton points to stay here so i didn't expect much except that considering the name i was looking for a nice experience. Our room faced an airconditioner unit on top of an asphalt roof, the TV was as old as the marble in the lobby, and the bed was so old i think George Washington may have slept on it. Enough said, i could not believe this hotel has a room like this....amazingly bad room.

Reviews.Title: “It was beautiful and close to alot of attractions”
Reviews.Author: shopper319
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf is a beautiful hotel. The lobby is very exquisite and a little overwhelming. I stayed on the 17th floor and the beds were fine and cleanliness was great. We had a fireplace which was an added bonus! The bathroom was all marble, definately spared no expense there. I recommend asking for a room on a higher floor because the view of the city is worth it. I would definately stay again considering the location is within walking distance of the majority of tourists locations. Literally Rockefeller Center, Times Square and Radio City Music Hall is 2 blocks away ( you can walk it for sure). I did not attend the Sunday buffet, because it was close to $40 per person, but I wish I had, It looked scrumptious! If you want to get Starbucks in the hotel plan you can plan on spending double the time and double the money than if you just walk a block down the street to another Starbucks in times square...starbucks are on almost every corner there. The one downfall I had is that if you want internet access in your hotel room you have to pay a daily fee, but to offset that you can get free wireless access in the hotel lobby, it's just a little difficult to find a free seat there.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is lovely.”
Reviews.Author: mmontecalvo
Reviews.Content: We had a particularly wonderful time at the Waldorf Astoria Hotel, NYC, this weekend. We want to give high marks to some individuals in particular: Mia, Jordan & Jerome. There were some problems with our reservation; however, these three people (along with their co-workers) really helped solve the problems. In the end, everything worked out beautifully. We also found the hotel to be lovely and we will be highly recommending it. Pat Sullivan, Providence, RI

Reviews.Title: “grand old elegant hotel full of history-was a priviledge to stay there”
Reviews.Author: J0anne123
Reviews.Content: got a great deal on a summer weekend cheaper that all other hotels i researched rooms were spacious and clean-no bed bugs in our room

Reviews.Title: “What can I say... it's the Waldorf Astoria”
Reviews.Author: sciencetraveler
Reviews.Content: What can I say... It's the Waldorf Astoria. Very beautiful hotel. Much attention to detail. Everything was stunning and tasteful. I'm sorry that I didn't get to try the restaurant. The room had internet and the bed was very comfortable. There were nice amenities in the bath. The mini bar was a bit pricey and there was no price list. I think I paid about $15 for some really nice mixed nuts. The only complaint was that there was a long line at the reception upon checking in and out. There also was a line at the concierge. It would not have been so bad, but I had a meeting to get to and was checking in on my lunch hour.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic New York experience”
Reviews.Author: avid_traveller_0703
Reviews.Content: We are still dreaming about waking up at the Waldorf and walking down Park Avenue and admiring the views. The stay was incredible. We got upgraded to a suite, as our regular room was not ready due to a barrage of summer tourists in NY. The suite was plush, and comfortable, and pretty spacious by New York standards. Our beds were excellent and we didn't hear any noise from adjacent rooms, which was sweet! The bathroom was small, but we didn't feel cramped. The hotel definitely has a lot of history and old school charm, with b/w pics of Presidents in the men's bathroom to the grand clock in the main lobby. We loved the accessibility and being able to walk to the Park. We hardly waited for a cab to ride to other parts of town. I have actually had the horrendous experience of having to wait for a cab for a half hr at another hotel, only to get stuck in traffic and be late for my meeting. Overall the stay was fantastic. It was our first time staying at the Waldorf, and we were already making plans for our next trip. Best way to experience the Big Apple!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding suite exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: AshleySanderson
Reviews.Content: My mom and I picked out the bridal suite (13H) a year before my wedding. The 4 days we were there I felt like royalty. Everything was designed with an old world flair and attention to detail. Nothing was a problem for the hotel. Every request was met if a warm smile and fast service. We will always stay here!

Reviews.Title: “For New York, can be a good choice”
Reviews.Author: SF94597
Reviews.Content: Of the 5 hotels I've stayed at in the last year & a half in New York, this has been the best experience. My experience in New York is that hotels are small, expensive and mediocre or poor service. At the Waldorf Astoria, my room was definitely small & non-descript - although fine by New York standards. Service was very good & rate was within our corporate guidelines. As expected the historic lobby is lovely. As the property is a Hilton property & I am a gold level member, was disappointed that, although informed me at check in that I would not be charged for 2 bottles of water, I was charged for the one I had. When I brought it to the front desk attention it was promptly removed, however, annoyed that I had to stop at front desk to fix.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty and Wonder End After the Lobby”
Reviews.Author: Kevman123
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Waldorf in Rome we were so excited to visit THE Waldorf in New York. I’ve seen it in movies and on TV and thought it would be a wonderful experience. We had built this hotel up so much to two of our travel companions and they were beaming with excitement when our taxi pulled up at the front. When you walk in the lobby it definitely takes you back to a time of grand travel experiences almost impossible to recreate with newer properties. The lobby is beautiful and inviting; great detail everywhere you look. Unfortunately, this is where the wonder will end. We were checked in by Mary in Diamond reception; she was super friendly and you could tell she loved her job. She quickly checked us into our rooms and gave a brief tour of the lobby. We were off to our “deluxe” rooms. We first stopped in our travel companion’s room because we wanted to see their faces when they walked in. Well, we did see their face and you could tell they tried to look excited, but were really disappointed; as were we. The rooms were tired at best. Sparsely appointed and quite frankly, worn out. We then went to our room, and it only got worse. The carpets were threadbare and there was rotten fruit in the minibar. At first I thought it was a peach, but realized it was an apple that had been there so long it was almost petrified. When we called the front desk, they sent someone up to remove it. He informed us that this happens all the time because they can go weeks, or even months without opening the fridges. Really? Wow. As our stay continued, we realized Mary was a very pleasant exception at the Waldorf. The service was next to terrible. Bellmen were rude, making comment on the number of bags we had and huffed when we asked them to store them since out flight was leaving late that evening. Front desk attendants were dismissive and took forever to help guests. Very disappointing. A note on Diamond on property benefits for those who care. Don’t expect much! You will receive a free coffee coupon for the Starbucks on property. The line will wrap around the building in the mornings, so it’s completely unusable. There is NO executive lounge, no concierge floor, and no breakfast for Diamond/Gold members. Also – no free movie. They do not “participate”.

Reviews.Title: “Great service... yet again...”
Reviews.Author: texasrig26
Reviews.Content: Time after time I tell folks that I appreciate what they do for me, but rarely do I take the extra step and comment publicly about it. I travel to NY on business on a regular basis, and the vast majority of the time, I stay at the Waldorf. As we all know, the Waldorf is a top quality hotel, and it is a well known landmark in NY. The atmosphere is special; the rooms are very nice and much larger than most NY hotels; but it is the service that really sets it apart. Jackie and Mary in the HHonors Diamond area in particular go way out of their way to help make the trips there smooth, uneventful, and very enjoyable. On my last trip, my daughter and wife joined me on a business trip on which we also celebrated my daughter's birthday. Mary and Jackie set us up in a great room with personalized birthday wishes and a little gift as well. Jackie took care of us three years ago when I took my oldest daughter to NY for her birthday as well. Needless to say that when my last daughter reaches the same milestone, I'll be back in NY and at the Waldorf celebrating yet again! Many thanks to everyone there; see you next month!

Reviews.Title: “Losing It”
Reviews.Author: FPodesta
Reviews.Content: Few would argue with the assertion that at one time the Waldorf Astoria was among the best hotels in the US, if not the world. Walking into the lobby, one might still believe in the legend, but a stay in the rooms will quickly dissolve any such impressions. The halls have tacky carpeting which may have been in style in the mid-80's. The wallpapering is equally poor. Inside the rooms, decorations and design are no better. The beds are old. The furniture is outdated and outright ugly. The bathrooms clearly used to be chic, again in the 80's. That being said, I have stayed at the Waldorf a number of times and will be doing so again this weekend. The location is exceptional and the prices have been very reasonable, possibly due to their failure to renovate. The front desk staff is polite but incompetent. If you are a Hilton Honors Diamond member, be sure to speak to the Diamond Desk staff. Also as a note to HHonors Gold and Diamond members, the complimentary breakfast, that you are accustomed to, is a a coupon for a pastry and coffee at the Starbucks in the hotel. The hotel has a real breakfast that is excellent, but is not free. Parking is ridiculously expensive ($80/night for an SUV).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Maurycek
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our 5 day NYC trip in May. Location couldn't be better. Everything close by. 1 min to subway but most of what you want to see in in easy walking distance. Local area felt safe any time of day or night. Hotel is incredible. Amazing foyer/reception. We stayed in the deluxe queen room which was large and very comfortable, perfect after a long day traipsing around NY. As reported by other reviewers the rooms could do with a little updating eg the bathroom looked a little chipped and dented, but certainly nothing to worry about and everything was immaculately clean. Didn't try the restaurants in the hotel, and didn't think that the $90 breakfast could really be worth it, but there is a Starbucks in the foyer and lots of bagel/breakfast places nearby that are excellent. All in all a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “It was amazing! We'll be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mayra78
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the hotel accommodations. The room was great and so was the service. The restaurants were superb. It was amazing. We spoke with Jackie, a representative who works at the Diamond Guest Office, and she helped us with all of our concerns. She managed herself very professional & courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and decent price”
Reviews.Author: Mdbyny
Reviews.Content: Although when we first arrive the doorman was too busy hamming it up with the town car drivers to get our bags (but then I saved a few bucks taking it in myself.) once I got to reception things went smoothly. I booked online and advise we may be coming early...they had a room available for us at 12:15 (check in is at 3); then when we came back to Getty ready for dinner they had left us a bottle champagne (had also wrote we were celebrating our anniversary.) I called to concierge for a place to have dinner and the made a reservation and the place was nice. Other than the doorman and the fact they charge $15 a day for wifi when it's free in the lobby; I would come back and recommend it to everyone. My husband said it was one of the best beds he has slept in...thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely grand with a wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: IdealReviewer001
Reviews.Content: The moment we walked into the hotel we were amazed! The entrance couldn't get any better, it was absolutely beautiful! We walked to the hotel's main lobby and we told the lady at reception we were checking in. She told us that our rooms weren't ready because we checked in at about noon and their check-in time is around three o'clock, so she told us that we could have lunch and she would text us telling us our room was ready. We were very hungry and wanted some New York style pizza, so we went to concierge and they recommended a marvelous pizza restaurant called AperiTIVO Pizza Bar--definitely recommend it to you--which is in walking distance of the hotel. When we got our table at the restaurant we received a text message from the hotel saying that our room was ready, so we just had lunch and walked back to the Waldorf Astoria. Our suite was spectacular and we were not expecting the largeness of our room. We booked a two double one-bedroom suite for my family of four. My wife and I slept on one double bed, while teenager slept on the other bed. My other younger son slept on the sofabed, which he found surprisingly comfy, although the beds were obviously more comfortable, so comfortable that I slept like a baby. The suite was huge for a Manhattan hotel, so get you definitely get what you pay for ($500-600 per night)! It also includes a luxurious large marble bathroom. This hotel is also very nicely located--one block away from Madison Avenue, two blocks to 5th Avenue, and about a 10 minute walk to Central Park. I think that this hotel is flawless, but I have to say that their food is mediocre and very overpriced. Also be aware that WiFi is NOT free and costs $15 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I'd hoped for!”
Reviews.Author: pauie
Reviews.Content: Had always dreamed of staying at this hotel and talked my friend into staying here on our trip of a lifetime. We put in a request for 2 beds in the room but really had to push to get two beds when we arrived.
