The interior of the hotel (public sections) is absolutely beautiful and we had high hopes for our room but alas it was small, dated and had none of the lavishness, beauty and light expected after looking at the photos on the website. The staff were friendly and the room was clean but I really was expecting a whole lot more from "The Waldorf".

Reviews.Title: “Great room upgrade, but too busy to really look after you”
Reviews.Author: Fryzy
Reviews.Content: When we arrived our taxi couldn't get anywhere near the front door too many cars and cabs double parked. We were upgraded to a mini-suite because we were staying for 12 nights - that was fantastic! Room was clean and remarkably quiet. We did have the toilet back up - no real apology They just said it was due to "old pipes". We couldn't adjust the room temperature so we turn the heating off. The lobby was constantly crowded with a major conference on for 4 or 5 days, and the doormen were inattentive throughout our entire stay. The housekeeping staff however were delightful and did a good job. The concierge staff weren't eager to help and were a bit surly.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: karenlottes
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the best service we have every received. Every staff member had a "Can and Will Do Attitude" Definitely willing to go above and beyond. Jackie, in the Diamond Desk check in, was OUTSTANDING!! We have had many great vacations with Hilton, but Jackie is hands down the BEST!! We had a beautiful room with a fabulous view. We will definitlely return.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mort55
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many fine hotels around the world but have never stayed at this legendary hotel. We were wowed by the graciousness of the staff and the old world feel of our accommodations. We always wondered why so many famous people have stayed and lived at the Waldorf. Now we know why.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: vickilynn2001
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf was a very nice hotel. I agree the rooms are a bit dated but, it is an old hotel. My only complaint is that while sitting in Sir Harry's bar the first evening we got there I was appalled at the amount of prostitutes that were so obvious in their solicitation of patrons. One guy was blind sided by it and told us about it. I would expect that type of activity in a shady hotel but right here at the Waldorf? Shame on you Waldorf for letting that go on.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: casablanca101
Reviews.Content: It was in the middle of scorching heat that My husband and I decided our vacation to New York. Our only condition was a great palacial stay which we found in the very awesome and unique WALDORF ASTORIA. A very beautiful Hotel . Very well laid out in the heart of New York City. Ideal for a leisure as well as a business trip. A great get away. Has been in the heart of the city of New York since 1900s. Looks very palacial and has been a great host to may famous personalities since a very long time. Web special can give good rates else it is a bit expensive for a hotel stay but that is only because it is an extraordinary experience staying there. Awesome lay out of breakfast buffet. Yummy desserts. Worth trying hotel . A beautiful view of the downtown/ timesquare New York. Close to Empire state building and in the centre of the shopping hub in New York. It is a treat to see the starbucks coffee counter in this hotel. So if you are thirsty for aquick cold coffee you do not have to shell out alot of dollars ujust because you are sitting in Waldorf Astoria. I stayed there with my husband and the best part is that even though we did not have a conveyance or a private transport available, the hotel took vare of this without charging even an extra dime from us. The staff of the hotel is very courteous.Public conveyence very much available from outside the hotel . All in all a great stay.Cheers!!!! I would highly recommend this hotel to all my friends and family on their visit to New York

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old world charm but rooms could be updated”
Reviews.Author: vpmuscat
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf is a lovely hotel, very steeped in tradition with excellent service and security but the rooms could do with some updating, we stayed in a double double ie. a room with 2 double beds which were reasonably comfortable but a bit cramped for taller people there wasn't enough storage space for 3 adults, the overall impression was good but not great for the money we spent also we found it a bit far from the action & next time we would probably stay somewhere closer to Times Square

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel....simple rooms.”
Reviews.Author: travelwithkidlets
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because the rates were comparable to others...and who wouldn't want to stay at the Waldorf Astoria!! It's a beautiful hotel and very fancy. Our kids (age 5, 3 and 7months are pretty quiet and not "run aways" so we didn't get TOO many looks. The staff were very friendly and made us feel welcome, even offering a Waldorf Astoria coloring book to the kids at check in. Sadly, it was the other guests in suits who looked at us like we didn't really belong. But who cares to them because we did have a great stay! Location was good for us. Walking distance to where we needed to go. We were able to find a few restaurants close to the hotel for breakfast and dinner. Small note on the website suggested dress code after 6pm..we didn't follow it but we also were not dressed in tshirt and shorts. Would we stay again? Probably not. The hotel is beautiful but the rooms were standard.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular service in a historic masterpiece.”
Reviews.Author: Skycrew
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in we were greeted by Jackie. She made us feel right at home with her smile and willingness to ensure a satisfactory stay. She did not disappoint. The room and stay were fantastic. Anyone who is looking to experience an awe inspiring, historic and luxurious environment with service to match, this is your chance. Thank you.....

Reviews.Title: “First Choice on Bucket List”
Reviews.Author: lupton3473
Reviews.Content: This was first on my "Bucket List". I have Ovarian cancer and "Living while I'm alive", as Bon Jovi would say. Everyone was extremely nice, helpful, friendly and made you feel special. We had great accomidations and service. The food and service at the hotel was the best. Our room was always in order and ready for us. If you want to be treated as royality and have a once in a lifetime experience this is the place for you. I hope to be able to celebrate a victory there someday.

Reviews.Title: “overated and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: choochooJerseyCIUK
Reviews.Content: I decided on this hotel for our 6 day break on reputation of the hotel and location. The room we were allocated was of reasonable size for a city hotel. However, it was so tired I think it had fallen asleep! Damp and peeling wallpaper in the 2 windows, bath and shower did'nt work properly and was a struggle to use, toilet was dirty, and a silly thing no brush to clean it! We stuck it out for 3 nights, on the 3rd night I had to shower and shave in freezing cold water, on the way out I complained and was upgraded to a junior suite for the last 3 nights of our trip. The new room was much better, lounge, 2 bathrooms etc, however there were things I did notice that was'nt up to the standard of this star of hotel. I can honestly say I have stayed in many hotels worldwide, usually 4 & 5 star, Dubai, Sydney, Bejing, Capetown etc, the Waldorf being the worst one by far. Finally, the conciege and reception staff were the most arrogant, rude, aloof, and unhelpful staff I've ever come across, and I think the Management should consider retraining them in good old fashioned manners and customer service. I realise they have many clients using the hotel every day as it was always busy, however they should give ALL customers 5* treatment like their 5* prices, and stop living in the past and relying on it's reputation, as it will be overtaken by new hotels. I realise there is a huge refurbishment taking place, however I believe they should'nt use their very tired rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I was expecting, Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyD81
Reviews.Content: I had read some negative reviews on TripAdvisor and seen some pretty bad pictures too, so when I arrived at the Waldorf I was prepared for the room to be a bit old and in need of a refresh....but I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised to see none of this at all! The room was bright, clean and elegantly decorated with tasteful furntiure and a marble bathroom which looked like it had some original features (not sure if they were!) The bed and seats in the room were very comfortable and there was plenty of storage space for clothes etc. The hotel is ideally located to get to any of the major sights as it is walking distance to Rockefeller Center and Times Square and there is also a Subway stop just by the Lexington Entrance of the hotel. The hotel bar was reasonbly priced and the staff were very attentive, in fact all the staff we met in the hotel were pleasant and helpful. The two things I've taken away from my experience is the feeling that you are staying in a part of New York history and that I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay in an iconic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tigerman67
Reviews.Content: We returned from 6 days in NY, and we splurged and used a bunch of points to stay in the Waldorf Astoria. While we had a lovely stay, I must mention that it was free to us since we were on points, and since my wife is a diamond status in Hilton we may have gotten a nicer room than normal and we also mentioned it was a special occasion for us. We were up on the 13th floor (which is odd since most hotels don't have a 13th floor), with a corner room that overlooked Park Ave and the church next door. They sent up a bottle of wine and cheese to help celebrate our special occasion. Our King sized room consisted of the bedroom area that included a small desk and another small table, kind of a dressing room with a makeup like desk area, and a gorgeous bathroom. Having read some of the other reviews, maybe our room was nicer than most, since the bathroom was all marble and granite and had a huge tube that my tall wife was able to full stretch out in which is a nice plus you don't see in most hotels or homes anymore. Everything in our room worked, and we had plenty of room for our clothes both in the closets and drawer space. They provided some nice robes for our use as well, and the closet had a safe that was larger than most I have seen in hotels and we could have easily have put our laptop into it if we were worried about it. The hotel was rather centrally located, and we had no problem walking to Times Square or a few more blocks over to Hells Kitchen. Within easy walking distance of Grand Central and catching a subway where ever you want to go. We found it a nice place to start our adventures on Manhatten. We flew into LaGuardia, and it was less than $40 with tip for a taxi to the hotel. We probably could have used the subway to get back and forth between the airports, but if you have large luggage this can be a bit of a pain. The only downsides I would say is that this hotel was expensive even on points, but when you realise you can stay at the Waldorf for only slightly more than the other hotels on Manhatten, I think it was worth it. The maid did come early in the morning, so put out your do not disturb if you want to sleep in. Even on the 13th floor, you could hear some street construction in the room if you were sleeping late. The internet was a extremely high per day rate, but if you are a diamond member this is comped. Maybe I am just a sucker for the classic hotels, but I am glad we stayed at the Waldorf Astoria.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for business or leisure ... Hilton needs to renovate though!”
Reviews.Author: gambit76
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a beautiful hotel and in a great location. I can't complain too much about this hotel other than they need to spend some money updating the rooms and touching up the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “FIRST CLASS IN EVERY RESPECT !”
Reviews.Author: DIMITRIOS5061
Reviews.Content: service,service,service.location,location,location.if this at the top of your priorority list,look no further.im from adelaide australia and stayed 4 nights in a smoking room ,my only regret is that it was only 4 nights.the hotels reputation speaks for its self.the staff are friendly and helpfull,the room service food is good and timely,sir harry's bar was a revelation,the bull and bear steaks are the best in town and the overal ambience of the hotel made me feel like i was part of history.President Obama had a function there the night i checked in,what can i say,its the Waldorf on Park Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Paid extra for a treat, wish we never bothered”
Reviews.Author: TravellingBritDuck
Reviews.Content: Good points are the hotel itself, beautiful to look at, amazing lobby, iconic in every way...until you get to your room... I arrived super early and they were lovely enough to let me check in at 9am, so it all started really well, but then went downhill... The room (number 1111) was average, I have had better amenities in a travel lodge. The paint work was chipped and the bathroom needed an overhaul. I had a bath and the next thing we knew the porter was knocking on our door because it was flooding the room below, believe me it was not overflowing, just had no sealant left!! Our bathroom door did not shut properly, despite them 'fixing' it 3 times. The remote on the TV did not work. And to top it all we were cold! So what turned up in our room? One of those tiny portable electric fan heaters...this was the Waldorf??!! It was comical. The people on reception were hit and miss between vague, helpful and dismissive. The concierge, well aloof and condescending does not even begin to cover it. It was like he was doing us the hugest favour in helping us out with directions and restaurant recommendations. All in all the hotel is all style and no substance. What a shame for such a grand old lady.

Reviews.Title: “six standard amenities not provided in room”
Reviews.Author: Sateasy
Reviews.Content: Two of us stayed in room 1554 (deluxe two queen beds)for six nights. Used to luxury travel, we were amazed that this room did NOT have: (a) a safe (there is an antiquated drawer & key system near the lobby) (b) a heated towel rail (we had hooks on the back of the door!) (c) more than four small drawers under the TV for clothes (for two of us for a week's stay!) (d) a quiet air-con unit. (e) more than two lamps to light the entire room, one with broken switch despite our notifications. (f) free wi-fi

Reviews.Title: “What a dissapointment - don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: minicooper321
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria was once a great hotel and on the surface they try to keep up the facade that they still deserve that title. But stay there and be prepared to be sorely disappointed. The staff at reception and the porters are very friendly and the carpets feel very thick under your feet but that's sadly where the air of luxury comes to an abrupt end. My family and I booked 3 rooms over a long weekend. One room was situated directly next to the air conditioning unit outside. This brings the phrase "The City that Never Sleeps" to a whole new level as you wont be sleeping either. Like us you'll be up at 2 in the morning trying to stop the constant humming that consumes the room. After a long journey the last thing you want to be doing is requesting a change of rooms which in the end is what we had to resort to. All of the rooms were very averagely sized and it's hard to place exactly what it is but much like the corridors leading up to them, there's just a feeling of not so much antique, but dated and in need of renovation. In one of our rooms the plug for the sink was broken leading it to remain full of dirty water and beard trimmings. All three rooms had problems with the televisions set. Despite being large flat screens the pictures were fuzzy and sometimes crackling. At one time the TV simply refused to show a picture. We were informed by a technician who came to fix it that it's due to the whole system running at maximum and so they've all got problems. The room service prices are laughable with a mark up bases in pure fiction for only the most idiotic person to order from. $8 for a glass of milk, plus tax, plus $15 for the pleasure of bringing it to your door, plus the expected tip. The rooms also lack any tea or coffee facilities which you'd expect in the loneliest 3 star hotel. They can be specially requested to your room but i can't help but think that this lack of amenities has something to do with the Starbucks located in the lobby. Why provide your guests paying hundreds of dollars a night with the option of making their own coffee when you can make them go downstairs in their bath rode and pay an extra $5 for the privilege? The porters outside the hotel seem to be nothing but ornamental with multiple times leaving and pulling up outside the front door in cars with no assistance from them. The cocktail bar in the lobby is very pleasant for a quick drink before heading out on the town but I'd check your bill very carefully. After only ordering 4 drinks the server made a mistake and charged us $50 for a simple martini. With their aforementioned rooms service i could almost believe it but I'm glad i questioned and had it changed. Overall a very disappointing stay and it will be a very long time before i return. Maybe they will realise they're surviving only on their past reputation and will have to improve but i doubt it and i believe their standards will continue to slip. If you're looking for a trip to remember or the standards you'd expect for the price payed then i strongly recommend staying at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The people make the difference”
Reviews.Author: guatamama_11
Reviews.Content: Rebecca at the check-in desk was kind, helpful and went out of her way to make me feel like they appreciated my business. She upgraded me to her favorite room - that was not only a kind gesture - but a personal one. i will ask for her the next time i stay there

Reviews.Title: “Charming & from a bygone age”
Reviews.Author: Suewho50
Reviews.Content: What a lovely Hotel . I was a trifle concerned by some of the reviews , but my experience of the Waldorf showed that you can't always go by what you read. Everyone has different standards , I like to think mine are high & the Waldorf certainly lived up to my expectations. The staff were polite & helpful, the room was lovely , & kept immaculate every day. The downside to this hotel is that it seems to attract people who want everything for nothing. All I can say is that if you want cheap room service - pick a cheap hotel. If you want free wi-fi - pick somewhere that advertises it as standard , and if you must eat/drink your Starbucks in the grandly elegant reception area, then at least have the courtesy to take your rubbish with you when you go. The Hotel has elegance & class , its a shame that the same can't be said for some of the guests. I would not hesitate to recommend this Hotel & would say that you get exactly what you pay for & for those who found things to complain about then try a Holiday Inn - you also get what you pay for there!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: AH1268
Reviews.Content: My wife and I honeymooned in New York, very recently and my wife really wanted to stay at The Waldorf Astoria becuase of its great history etc she got her way...)....I was not so keen I have to say. However, the 4 day break was indeed excellent. Being upgraded helped, a complimentary bottle of wine was a nice touch. We found the staff all informative, friendly and helpful. The food from Room Service ( an expensive treat), was excellent. Location perfect for all the usual supects, 5th Ave, Central Park etc....we even had an overlowing toilet, which was fixed in a jiffy....this hotel has 1500 odd roms, so there are bound to be the odd issuse, but its 'Grand Status' is still maintaines, and we would certainly return one day. AH

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, pleasant stay! Was very pleased.”
Reviews.Author: JRDTexas18
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Has a very traditional, classic feel. Tastefully decorated, clean rooms, and nice amenities in the bathroom. Yes, if you look very closely, you can spot things that look outdated or should maybe be replaced because they are from a different time. But this place still looks fantastic and is super clean for its age, and just because something is old, doesn't mean it should be replaced. We were upgraded to a suite, which was a nice surprise, so we had a room with Queen bed, a separate living room, and 2 bathrooms. We were also given breakfast vouchers for each morning to the starbucks in the lobby. Only negatives during our stay was how long it took to check-in, how long the line at Starbucks was to redeem our vouchers, and how quickly the Starbucks ran out of good pastries in the middle of the morning rush each day. Overall, the hotel is elegant and timeless and I"m glad we stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Way past it's time!”
Reviews.Author: Thomas9000Boston
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few days and found the" superior room" shabby with a bath tub with a large chip (5 inches radius). Well past it's prime!!

Reviews.Title: “Full of history, but tired”
Reviews.Author: chashk
Reviews.Content: We decided to try one of the grand old hotels of NY for our first visit albeit recognising that the hotel would be dated. This pretty much summed up our experience. Our room was dated but functional. It was on the 14F and overlooked Park Ave. We experienced a lot of noise from trucks/workmen in the street in the early hours of the morning which made sleep difficult. There were a number of large groups/functions at the hotel. This meant the lobby and main street entrance were often crowded and put pressure on the lifts and other facilities. We did enjoy the Bull and Bear both as a restaurant and bar.

Reviews.Title: “I had a similar experience - pretty spot on with review May 1”
Reviews.Author: AJ5383
Reviews.Content: The revew on May 1 that shared photos of the room in such a sorry state was very similar to my experience - spot on! I too felt that the Waldorf had seen better days and was living on a past repution. I spent 1 night here before moving to the Hilton for 2 nights and was shocked that the Hilton seemed to be an "upgrade" when I thought that it would be just the opposite. In fairness to Waldorf they sent me a survey post-stay and asked about my experience and I shared with them my comparisions of the Waldorf vs. the Hilton given they are both in the same parent company. I was shocked to find a nice letter from the general manager in my mailbox a few weeks later with a certifiicate for a complimentary stay at the Waldorf asking for another chance when in NYC. At least they are reading comments and hopefully addressing the concerns. It would be a shame to see such a legendary hotel suffer. I hope my next stay results in a good review. I would give them another chance based on this so that is why I would recommend them to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Iconic”
Reviews.Author: SilkCut_10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights using HHonors points (Low Season Reward). I was a little nervous given the mixed reviews on this hotel but thankfully my stay was fantastic from start to finish. My bags were efficiently taken at the door and arrived two minutes after arriving to my room. Check-in was efficient and as I have Hilton Gold status, was given two $20 drinks vouchers for any of the hotel bars, Starbucks vouchers for each morning, free bottles of water in the room and free Wi-fi. We also received an upgrade to a Superior Corner room, which contained a bottle of WA sparkling wine on ice - nice touch! We only ate once in the hotel - room service on the first night. Whilst service was polite and efficient, the food was average at best and expensive. The room was beautifully presented and well serviced during our stay. There were one or two areas in the room that were a little worn / needed fixing but this was no issue. The beds are very comfortable. Service in Peacock Alley Bar was excellent; in fact, I could not fault any of the staff I encountered during my stay, Starbucks staff included. My major annoyance was down to people having their Starbucks breakfasts around the beautiful lobby and leaving their rubbish at their feet. The lobby/reception area is breathtaking and very well maintained. When I return to New York, I will have no hesitation in returning to the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: fluoro
Reviews.Content: Took my mom for her birthday. Was given an upgrade to a suite. View of Park Avenue. All staff polite, incredible to deal with. A must stay hotel. Location is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: MNSpark
Reviews.Content: We obtained an absolutely marvelous rate for a corner king-sized suite. The living was larger than many hotel room I have stayed in. We usually stay at boutique hotels, but it was great staying at a grand hotel like the Waldorf. I had never stayed east of fifth avenue, and I was surprised how convenient the hotel was to everything I wanted to do - musuems, broadway, subway and shopping. I would highly recommend this hotel, especially with such a wonderful rate

Reviews.Title: “Unsurpassed Service & Cleanliness! Very Satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: Mychelle71
Reviews.Content: I can't imagine a bad review being written about this hotel and I'm sorry for anyone who has an unpleasant time while staying at The Waldorf Astoria. What a shame! We found it to be WONDERFUL! I visited NYC with 5 other childhood friends as we were all celebrating our 40th birthdays! We chose The Waldorf because we wanted to do it in style, and we made a great choice. The service cannot be surpassed. From the time we drove up (thank you Pedro!) until the time we left, we were treated like celebrities. Our room was clean at all times and in the evening a maid would go in and straighten up while we were out. Whatever we needed, they were more than willing to supply us with. Everyone was friendly, courteous and accommodating. A stay here is pricey, but you get what you pay for. It was worth it! If I go back to NYC, I want to be at beautifully historic Waldorf Astoria. Thank you Waldorf!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, hotel as expected”
Reviews.Author: kepLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Check in speedy and upgraded as new customers. Room good size, very comfy king size bed, air con, mini bar, Location close to central park and shops, short walk to grand central. Bear and Bull bar recommended. Hotel is a little dated but i wouldn't have visited the waldorf if i wanted boutique style. Staff helpful, room maid great. Definatly would recommend. New york great a week wasn't long enough.

Reviews.Title: “An icon of NYC, a bucket-list hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Laconicsurf
Reviews.Content: It just has to be done. I have dreamt of staying here for years and finally did it, so glad i did. The history of the place seems to literally ooze from the walls. The wonderful reception was a great place to start and receive a welcoming and warm check-in. Even the elevators exude charm and class. The rooms are a little on the small side, but are clean and very comfy. We took a walk around to soak up the atmosphere and went up to the starlight rooms which were empty except for a maintenance guy who let us go in and out on to the balcony overlooking the night city. You could almost hear the voices of people dancing here in the 20's and 30's, eerie and wonderful. Ok, its expensive but it's a one in a lifetime visit, a bucket list hotel ( do it before you die). The memories will live always stay with me.

Reviews.Title: “Girls' Trip to New York”
Reviews.Author: Babs5801
Reviews.Content: The hotel's main area and rooms are exquisite. It made us forget about our hectic, sometimes stressful every day lives. The employees are very friendly and accomodating; we got very spoiled in a short period of time. The boutiques and restaurants on offered great selections, so that you really don't have to leave the hotel. However for those that want to venture out -- and we did often-- it's very easy to either step outside where someone will flag a taxi or car for you OR the subway is just across the street. We used both of means of transportation. Also many of popular stores to shop were within walking distance so we did that as well. To get back and forth to LaGuardia airport the easist way is just to split the cost of a taxi (about $28 total). Our stay at the Waldorf was one of the best experiences we had , even as frequent travelers. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not as impressive as it sounds...”
Reviews.Author: scarletbgn3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 days on a combination business/leisure trip with my infant son, sister, and niece. Booked a great rate through the WA website ($279/night) and chose an upgrade to a deluxe room for an additional $21/night. Had a great check in experience - bell staff took my luggage from the taxi and directed me to the lobby where I was approached by WA staff and directed to the proper area for check in. I had arrived early, directly after my flight arrived in NYC, shortly after 12pm. In spite of my early arrival, staff checked me in and thought to ask if I'd need a crib, extra toiletries/towels in the room, etc. The room itself was a bit of a let down. The size was fine, which was surprising for a NYC hotel room. The room just looked like it had seen much better days, and that those days were quite far in the past. Torn wallpaper, chipped and broken floor tiles in the bathroom, layers of dust, and a rusty bathroom heater made the room feel depressing and not at all what I expected from a hotel with the reputation of the WA. Our stay was unimpressive, other than being able to tell cab drivers to "take us to the waldorf". Once we arrived back at the hotel we had to use the motorcoach entrance in the basement as it was the only way in and out with a stroller - we didn't get to take in the splendor of the main entrances. The food and beverage prices were outrageous. My chopped salad and bottle of water through room service were $54, my omelet and coffee in Oscar's were $51. There was no coffeemaker in the room, but we made do with morning trips to the Starbucks tucked under a staircase in the main lobby (again, no easy way to get there with a stroller). Service beyond check in didn't really exist, although there were large numbers of staff milling about the lobby area regularly. Prior to our visit we received an email about the WA dress code (no jeans, business casual, etc.), but it didn't seem to be enforced in any way onsite. The President had an event at the hotel during our stay, but except for the throngs of people around and in the hotel, we weren't really impacted. Unfortunately, the empty room next to us had some sort of incredibly loud alarm that went off regularly during our last two days. The loud screech would continue until hotel staff entered the room and shut it off - but they couldn't seem to find a way to keep it off during our stay which was quite a nuisance. While preparing to leave the hotel I called down to bell service to request help with my luggage and was told by the bell captain "Well, we could send someone to come help you, but it will be at least 15-20 minutes so you'd probably be better off bringing it down yourself." When a hotel prides itself on being able to 'do the difficult in minutes and the impossible in slightly more time", I would think that having someone help a mother traveling with an infant and 5 pieces of luggage wouldn't be too much to ask. I managed to get to the lobby for checkout where I waited in the incorrect line for several minutes before realizing I was in the wrong line thanks to another traveler. The check out experience was typical of a chain hotel checkout - asked how the stay was, but unconcerned with my response and definitely uninterested in correcting any of the hotel mistakes such as the alarm or the bell captain experience. In general, I think I would have had a better trip by staying at a different, more updated hotel. The WA is a hotel that is living off its reputation of grandeur and fine service, but sadly no longer lives up to those standards.

Reviews.Title: “Management could care less about your issues with their hotel.”
Reviews.Author: stateside12
Reviews.Content: Service is slowand staffcould care less. I contacted the assistant manager and informed that i would recieve an upgrade upon my next reservation at the Waldord Astoria of wish i recently secured .However when i contact guest services i was informed that management woul get back to me within 24 hourswell that was 72 hours ago if management trreat it's diamond members poorly I wonder how do the ohther guest get treated by the Waldord Astoria staff. So long Waldord Astoria i am Ritz Carlton bound .Remember service to your client base is key.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: tdick68
Reviews.Content: The service is top notch. Guests are treated extremely well. The hotel is regal and classy without being stuffy but retains the timeless feel. Cocktails in the bar were overpriced ($18 for rum and coke), so we headed to a known restaurant around the block for happy hour. We will definitely stay at the Waldorf again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel, not worth the money, what a waste of time”
Reviews.Author: veg_travels1982
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business conference from 10 April - 15 April and at the end of it I wish I had stayed up the street or elsewhere despite the conference being located at the Waldorf. I arrived after a long flight in the evening around 10pm. The check in process was straightforward and I was relieved to get my key. However, when I got to my very small room I could hear a very loud high pitched whirring from outside my window. There were some large units making the noise. As I was staying 6 nights I knew I would not be able to cope with the noise for that length of time so I called Guest Services to see if they could change my room. The lady advised she would send someone up to see what I was talking about. 10 minutes passed... nothing.... 20 minutes... and still no one had come up. By now it was close to 11pm, after a long flight I just wanted to go to sleep. I called Guest Services again and they said the security guard had "already been up and did not hear anything"... The guard had not been told to come to my room. Even though I had clearly told them the noise was heard inside my room. How very odd. Another 10 minutes and the guard arrived, he confirmed the noise and tried to phone downstairs from my room but was put on hold. I had to go downstairs to the front desk to see what was going on. The manager barely even apologised for the incompetence of his staff, not communicating, he did however upgrade me to a slightly larger room on the other side of the building which was appreciated. However when I got to the new room, it was very hot, so I decided to use the thermostat to cool it down. I also wanted some water but the mini bar was locked for some reason. I called downstairs to ask why, the lady I spoke to did not know but said she would send up some complimentary water, which was nice of her. However, it never arrived, after waiting 20 minutes I fell asleep. I woke at 4am to find the room extremely hot. I called downstairs about the water and they finally sent some up. And when I asked about the heat in the room I was told that even when the thermostat was on a low temperature it would be blowing out hot air!! What on earth?? I was told that the hotel had NO AIR CONDITIONING. Not only that, but I could not open the windows. She said they had to send an engineer up to open the windows for me. Crazy. 10 minutes later he arrived to open the windows.... The lobby of this hotel is very very dark. Even on a nice day you have no idea what is going on. Having spent close to a week at this hotel based on my experiences with the service, and basic idiotic processes to just open a window I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The Waldorf Astoria has lost it's shine and is only surviving on its name. It is now run by the Hilton chain and worthless. The rooms are very very out of date and clearly need some TLC. Also, having to pay $15 for 24 hours of wifi use is extortion. Good points: Very clean Great power shower Close to Grand Central Terminal

Reviews.Title: “A very grand experience - if that is what you are looking for.”
Reviews.Author: pennydog24
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights with Virgin. We had looked at some pictures before we went of a one bedroomed suite which we had booked and expected something much larger than we got- with a walk in wardrobe, grand bathroom, kitchenette etc. We actually got a corner suite which had two outlooks - perhaps you pay more for this as the rest of the areas we expected were absent. Still - it was a lovely huge lounge and bedroom, bathroom a little small. The furnishings were very grand, but as many say - it is rather worn in places. The carpet in our room and landing (14) had seen much better days and the pile was so worn I kept slipping where it was smooth. I am a stickler for cleanliness and hate funny smells - but the room was spotless and fresh. Some parts of the hotel are better repaired than others - but the decor is beautiful all over and it is all very clean. A word of warning is the price of the meals and drinks. If you are an average family looking for a bit of luxry then you will NOT be able to afford the prices on a regular basis. A white wine and a beer cost over $20. However - if you want a bar atmosphere with good food then there is Bills bar near the rockerfeller centre, Conolleys bar off Lexington and Aperitivos. All walkable and reasonable. We bought a bottle of wine and drank that in front of the TV - they provide ice bucket and bottle opener in the room - but no coffee making facilities. There is a Starbucks downstairs and a reasonable diner serving breakfast really close. The staff were helpful and friendly. The room has an ironing board and iron, hair drier etc. Bed is lovely and comfortable - nice crisp linen.There are some REALLY rich families staying here. The area is lovely and in easy access of Times square and shopping. You can get internet for free by taking your laptop to the lobby or else it is $15 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute of our stay here”
Reviews.Author: 7carlton
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a wonderful 5 nights in the Waldorf. Can't understand the previous reviews as we had a wonderful time and found the hotel to be very luxurious and comfortable. Check in was a breeze, concierge very helpful, lady who managed safety deposit boxes was very nice as were the guys who looked after our luggage on check out. Our room was very roomy with 2 double beds, was spotlessly clean and had a lovely bathroom. I was with a group of friends celebrating our birthday and on arrival there was a complementary bottle of champagne in each of our rooms. The hotel is ideally located for shopping on 5th Ave and seeing the sights. All in all the 6 of us loved the Waldorf from start to finish and I would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent mid town location, first class service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself, my husband and our 9 year old have just returned from a wonderful weekend to NY to celebrate my 40th birthday. When we booked the trip with expedia, we were asked if it was a special occasion and we confirmed it was. On arrival, a bottle of chilled champagne and 2 glasses was waiting in our room with a note wishing me a happy birthday! The service, cleanliness and room comfort was first class. Every day we were given fresh towels and a lovely turn-down service in the evening. The location is fabulous too, short walk to 5th avenue, central park, rockerfeller plaza, times square etc. The concierge was very helpful and suggested a few good restaurants nearby that were very good. The lobby is absolutely beautiful, so grand and reminiscent of a bygone era. All in all, the Waldorf is 5 star all the way, from the reception staff to the surroundings. I especially liked the excellent zip check out, just dial a number and just leave your door key in your room and leave, no hanging around at the front desk. I would not hesitate to recommend this to a friend and might even ask if I could join them!

Reviews.Title: “Sadly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: thjcay
Reviews.Content: We decided to get married in City Hall in New York and thought as we were saving money on a big wedding we would spoil ourselves by booking into the Waldorf Astoria. I emailed the hotel over 2 weeks before we were due to inquire on whether I could make an appointment for my hair and make up done for the big day....not even a response. On arrival, we had to queue to check in, despite this we were still excited about how our luxorious room would be! alas, the room was very basic, a very small double bed and a very large tv, no tea and coffee making facilities or mini bar. The bathroom was very outdated and didnt look particularly clean. We used the computer in the business centre for a total of 4 minutes and were charged the princely sum of $7 which just seemed out of proportion. All in all the experience was a disappointment and we will not be rushing back next time we are in New York or recommending to anyone we know. Sadly I think you are paying for the "name" and nothing else of any substance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Giulianini
Reviews.Content: Close to everything you want to see in NYC. Great service in general. Lovely decoration at rooms, well equiped and totally renewed. Noise heard from other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not worth the 300USD standard room price tag!”
Reviews.Author: tiBooker
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Waldorf early April. When I got there, I got so depressed by the look of my room (avoid 1544) -not to mention the awful synthetic vanilla smell from the ozone machine lying on the ground, that I ended up sipping Bailey's at the lobby bar... The air conditionning was old and noisy, the numerous layers of paint had dripped on the weak bathroom lights and the overall feeling was creepy (bed was so so) [see pictures]. I must however recognize the techological effort made by the hotel: the flat HD tv was 38"-40" and the wi-fi bandwith pretty solid. I have spent overall four months at various Hilton hotels since 2007, this one was the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Will take my custom elsewhere...”
Reviews.Author: clairerk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as my cousin had recently stayed there. We decided that we would not dine there as I have two fussy children also we did not plan to be in the Hotel much. At check in we found the queue too long, the attitude off the member of staff was quite rude as the booking was room only, he seemed to look down his nose at us. We arrived at the deluxe room we found it small, the beds also seemed small we phoned reception they did not seem interested & stated that all the rooms are that size. The solution to the small beds was for them to bring a camp bed up god knows where they were going to put it. Starbucks Coffee shop in the hotel don't bother with go out less than five mins walk is a Starbucks at the fraction of the cost. I called room service... they said it would be 20mins it never arrived. Our last night we decided to got the bar for a drink, four glasses of Bud $39.20 what a rip off. Every morning we went out for breakfast to Europa Cafe on Madison Ave corner of 53rd St all I can say is I highly recommend this place as they cater for every taste it's clean with polite friendly staff and resonable prices. Europa Cafe have a few outlets in the city.

Reviews.Title: “A weekend to remember”
Reviews.Author: Tdr623
Reviews.Content: This past weekend (4/8-4/10) I had a chance to stay at the Waldorf, it was quite an experience. Everyone was genuinely pleasant, and eagered to make sure you were comfortable. The architectural culture had a historic appeal. We were there for a Bridal Extraveganza we really did enjoy ourselves!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at this iconic property”
Reviews.Author: VancouverSeatoSky
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before my trip and was a little put off by some of the reviews. Speaking with some locals I decided I'd check it out. How often do you get to stay at the Waldorf Astoria! I had an amazing time. I opted for the $21 check-in upgrade that was sent to me via e-mail on my online booking and ended up getting a fantastic upgrade to a room with two bathrooms and a sitting room. It made the whole stay that much more comfortable and for only $21 a night! The restaurants and conference areas were fantastic as well and service staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms and common areas were clean and comfortable. We even took advantage of the Sunday Buffet! All in all a good trip and I’d stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Problems problems problems.....”
Reviews.Author: ahegarty
Reviews.Content: We like old fashioned hotels like the Waldorf. There is something in the shabbiness that's attractive in a comfortable sort of way. The last time we came we found ourselves in an horrific room. But, after a rough night, we complained and in fairness we were moved - and to a better room to boot. And of course there is that wonderful Guerlain Spa.....As my grandmother used to say, its not whether one runs into problems, its what one does to solve them that counts! So we came back. We decided to stay in a suite this time. We booked a King suite but got a Queen. The room was nice enough. We did not complain. We were too tired to face the check in desk again! There had been a long wait for check in because there were only three or four unfortunate staff trying to check in a long long line of people when we arrived. Then we discovered that even though we had sprung for a nice suite - not cheap - they were going to charge us extra for wi-fi access! When my husband called the main hotel line he was told it was "corporate policy" and apparently corporate policy is inviolate. We were reminded that if we wanted to use free wi-fi we should go down to the lobby! (Did I mention we were too tired to go to the lobby? But of course one there is always the spa....Opps! I forgot to mention there is no Guerlain spa here at the moment - nobody seems to know whether it will re open..... My husband complained to corporate headquarters about this - there is something unpleasant about being "nickle and dimed"..... Guess what? corporate headquarters referred us back to reception "downstairs" once again. We called again - this time mentioning about not getting the king suite - prominent in our reservation - and I suppose we had met the "hassle threshold" and so the wi-fi access was now free. It did not end there! During the night we noticed the room was cold. We tried to sleep - early appointment the next morning....When we got up to take a shower we discovered the water would not get hot - after 15 minutes.....At least the wake up call came on time - and came, and came and came: the thing would not stop ringing. The lady told us we had to actually listen to the recorded message or else it would keep ringing. I told her this was ridiculous and asked her to make it stop. She did. Apparently also they had known about the problem with the water: during the night something had happened and the steam that heated the water in the building had not yet heated all the water. I was advised to wait for my shower - out of luck, I had to leave.....finally, we mentioned the cold room - the first question was whether we had called the staff during the night. I explained we had been trying to get some sleep...... The hotel made a reasonable adjustment to the room rate at checkout. We stayed here to reduce the stress of a long commute and instead of starting the day refreshed and relaxed....well, at this point: 'nuff said! Why do I continue to recommend this hotel? It huge, but its comfortable - overall. I like rooms - this is indeed an historic hotel. When there is a problem, staff do their best to resolve it. The staff make a big difference here. This matters. Its just a pity there are so many problems they have to deal with! I'm not sure if you will be seeing us again though.....

Reviews.Title: “The Best of The Best”
Reviews.Author: NjDevilsguy
Reviews.Content: I was extremely pleased with my stay. This hotel has got to be the best of NYC. The staff are all polite and well mannered. Everyone from the front desk to the cleaning staff are exceptional. The room was very clean and decorated very well. The lavishness of this hotel, combined with its history and staff make it what it is. You definitely need to stay here at least once. I also would recommend having brunch at Oscars (one of the hotels restaurants) The food was delicious, and the price reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent except one small thing ...”
Reviews.Author: CdnMtnGal
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this legendary hotel for a business function. The group I had booked through was hosting a large event there, so I decided to stay at the Waldorf for the convenience, but was a bit concerned after reading some negative reviews. I called Hilton Honors and specifically requested a recently renovated room, and also did an e-upgrade where for $20 more, I was guaranteed the next level of room up if available. Upon check-in, I was served promptly and courteously by Justin, who took pains to ensure that a room matching my specifications (i.e. newly-renovated bathroom) was available. My room was wonderful, with a king bed and, true to their word, a newly-renovated bathroom. The oversized shower was AMAZING!!! I could have stayed in the shower all day. I was in room 767, which faced away from Park Avenue, and there was hardly any traffic noise at all in the room. The hotel's location is very convenient. During my short stay, I was able to walk to the Rockefeller Center and Times Square, and Central Park was also close by. I was a stone's throw from shopping on Fifth Avenue (Saks, etc.). (Another tip - a sales lady at the Clarins counter at Saks did an amazing job with a free makeup application for my evening event!) So what is the "small thing" referred to in the title of this review? After receiving my room keys, I went to the concierge to obtain a map of the city, as I was meeting a friend at a nearby office tower for lunch. Not being too familiar with my surroundings, I asked the concierge how to get to the address of my friend's office. The concierge was engrossed in his phone (either texting or surfing the net), and gave me very quick verbal directions to turn one way, then the other, then the other. Of course, it was all lost on me. I asked for a map, and the concierge (still engrossed in his phone) handed one to me, still folded up, without further offer of help. I had to unfold the map, then specifically ask him to point out on it the location of the hotel, and show me how to get to my friend's office. He did oblige, but I was left with the feeling that I was somehow imposing on him. I must be quick to say that I described the above experience in an on-line survey after my stay, and to my great and pleasant surprise, received a call the very next day from hotel staff apologizing for this, and seeking further details from me. It was, overall, a small incident, but one that marred the stay nonetheless. Management's willingness to address so promptly gives me great optimism that this is not a typical experience for guests. I paid $420 for the room, including the $20 upgrade fee. This seems like a lot of money compared to most other places, but for a classy experience in an excellent location (in the middle of Manhattan), it was worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful hotel with historic charm”
Reviews.Author: bailey1106
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the most beautiful rooms, freindly and helpful staff and just a high class feel and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I stayed here once but probably won't return”
Reviews.Author: Maryandfamily
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent the weekend at the Waldorf Astoria (NYC) for her 18th bday. A lovely, historic hotel an easy walk (or very short cab ride) away from Times Square, Public Library, Grand Central Station, FAO, Central Park, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Serendipity 3, Dylan's Candy Bar, Rockefeller Center, broadway theatres. A cab is needed to access the Status of Liberty and Ellis Island. A bit of a line at check-in and a delay in room availability but hotel text messaged me when room was available. Our bags were stored while we wait. Room was at a discount rate I found on-line. Comfortable, small (but with two beds), zero view, a bit dated with an old sort of odor/maybe mildew? Felt safe and appreciated the after 10pm need for your room card to access guest floors via elevator. Piano Cole Porter used to compose on is on display in lobby atrim, as well as historic clock and historical overview display cases with memorabiliia in main lobby. Hotel definitely seems to appeal to many international guest. Hotel shop has an adequate selection of items that aren't as pricey as I would have expected. Dining and room service prices, however, are absolutely ridiculous. $30 for a Caeser salad? I'm talking absolutely ridiculous pricing. Glitch at check out with bottled water from the in-room refrig erroneously charged to my account. I believe the price was around $7 a bottle. Hotel removed charges but with a slight bit of hesitation. No safe in the room but there is a blow dryer, ironing board and iron. There is not any late night 'grab a snack' dining in the immediate vicinity of the hotel which was a negative for us returning from shows after 11pm. Staff is aloof but friendly. There is a business center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service meets the Landmark!”
Reviews.Author: MarcusLima
Reviews.Content: The best at the Waldorf Astoria is the service: it meets the fame of this New York landmark. All my contacts with staff were great: they're always gentle and fast and made me recall why the place is famous. The prices are high (NYC average for this Hotel Class), but pay attention to promos and catch a good deal. The best room I've been in NYC was offered me as a complimentary upgrade... great!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous...”
Reviews.Author: rhubarb_owl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf=Astoria as a 40th birthday treat whilst celebrating in New York and it was gorgeous, filled with old-world charm. The staff were wonderful, very friendly & really couldn't do enough for you. I felt spoilt. The concierge was extremely helpful and as well as recommending trips to take also pre-booked the trips & sights which was invaluable & saved us an eternity of queuing both at the Empire State Bldg and the museums! The recommended escorted bus tour with Concierge Tours was really excellent. The bathroom could've done with a makeover, the suite was looking tired but the room was spotless and serviced twice a day with tonnes of fresh towels. And the safety deposit boxes were free to use - bonus! On departure the staff couldnt have been more helpful directing us to the Business Suite to pre-book our seats for the flight home. They even stored our bags all day & arranged transport back to the airport. If there's one fault it's that there are no tea & coffee making facilities in the room but there's always room service and there's a Starbucks conveniently situated in the hotel. Overall, it was a fabulous experience and a lovely 40th present. It was lovely to be waited on hand and foot, in very opulent surroundings...gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “The Waldorf Should be on EVERYONE's bucket list”
Reviews.Author: ARKSugarLand
Reviews.Content: I always try to stay somewhere different each year when I travel to NYC for an annual conference. This year was a bit more stressful after dealing with some health issues...I really needed someplace where I could rest after working all day. Noodling around on the web I came up with a great deal at the Waldorf. I was so excited as to me growing up, the Waldorf was New York City. I have to mention that the aforementioned health problem was possibly severe enough to cause me to cancel my travel plans and the rate was non refundable through Hilton. I wrote the GM and explained and wonderously he replied and said they would work with me. Happily I recovered enough to travel...imgaine my shock when checking in and finding out I was upgraded to an executive luxury one bedroom suite! I about fainted. It was MAGNIFICENT in the old school classic way. It reminded me of my very wealthy aunt's home...so much space, so much comfy furniture. From the reception desk to the concierge to virtually everyone I came into contact with throughout my stay I was impressed by the wonderful attitude and friendliness. There was no faux snobbery, everyone just did their jobs very well. I loved wandering through the lobby and reading the hotel's great history. Sure there may be slicker hotels (go to Vegas for that or spring for a room in the newer Towers) but none that make you feel like you have stepped back in time to a more gracious era. I almost felt like Marilyn Monroe would come rushing through the lobby or perhaps to catch a glance of President Kennedy. So much history, you can literally feel it...in a good way, not creepy. For me, it was perfect to luxuriate in all of that space and relax after a hard day. I felt special. No small thing in this world today. My only regret is I did not have a Waldorf salad! I will be back and I will recommend to all who appreciate a taste of old New York....

Reviews.Title: “The real thing.”
Reviews.Author: Brad993
Reviews.Content: Recent business trip to Manhattan for meetings. This hotel is still "fabulous". So much history and modern day comforts. Great fitness center and prompt service. Sir Harry's can top it off for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Check the Bathroom in 1176”
Reviews.Author: lottiemillie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf Astoria New York for 4 nights, we arrived and they had checked us into a smaller room than we had booked. There was no hot water in the bath tap, we called maintainanace they advised that we needed to run the water for 30 minutes before hot water arrived, we did this and tepid water arrived. We managed to change the room the guests service at least was gracious about this. i beleive every night that room gets handed out to some poor folk and therefore they manage to get $300 every night for that room. Great side of the trip Marvellous Manhattan trip with Stephen really informative tour. Jersey boys at the theatre, Ellens starlight diner with singing waitress. But felt mugged with the cost of 20% on top with every one expecting this as a tip Always get a yellow cab with the meter! they also expect 20% tip Great gallery Frick Museum on Park and dont forget John Lennon on Strawberry fields near the Dakota building. All in all New York is fun, but take loads of dosh, you'll need it to Mug

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious location”
Reviews.Author: SRCH72
Reviews.Content: Through Kuoni we got 4 nights in room 2539, corner room on the 25th floor, for £400. Fantastic location, all what you would want within minutes. Great service from the Concierge all three times we asked for recommendations, table booked at a fantastic Italian restaurant in literally one minute, directions printed without ask. Very busy lobby but not a problem and still not noisy due to size. Room was lovely if not a little tired, four out of five scored. Would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money - an oasis in the concrete jungle”
Reviews.Author: tthomson53
Reviews.Content: We have learned, after trying many boutique hotels and finding that they usually come up short in some form or fashion, that the Waldorf is worth every extra penny you may (but not always) have to pay. Unbelievable service from the entire staff, gorgeous, architecturally beautiful surroundings, spacious rooms, phenomenal towels, sheets and mattresses - it goes on and on. Just don't plan to eat there, as the meal prices are extravagant, and, of course, NY has many, many options. We had a wonderful king suite this stay that was only $360 per night, a true bargain by NY standards.

Reviews.Title: “The location is good”
Reviews.Author: 2dman
Reviews.Content: I was visiting New York from Seattle to attend the Buildings New York Show at Javits. I got a decent deal (for New York) at the Waldorf, so I took it instead of one of the show hotels. the show hotels were southwest of times square, so I opted for a better location and it was a correct choice. I like staying somewhere in the vicinity of Rockefeller Center. First, I was very impressed with the staff at the Waldorf. they had a number of staff just standing in the lobby who would offer to help without asking if you had the slightest concerned look on your face. The concierge was great and was spot on with the choices. The business center was nice, but fumbled the ball on a package delivery that was guaranteed by 8 AM, but not delivered to me. The Bull and Bear restaurant was closed for renovation, so I could not comment on it and there weren't a lot of other choices in the hotel. The room itself was on the small side, typical of New York, I guess. But it had a nice work desk, an arm chair, and a largish flat panel TV. If you want to watch TV, however, it pretty much has to be from bed. luckily the beds was extremely comfortable with many pillows. The bathroom was a little dated, but everything worked. An oddity was that the shower head was at the back opf the tub, on the opposite end from the valve, so adjusting the temperature was time intensive, as the flow restricter made you wait for a while for the temperature to change. Flow was pretty anemic. the room seemed to be very quiet, other than a thin door hardly blocking hall noise. The fitness center was OK, but pretty standard. Not what I would expect for the price. In some packages you have to pay for it and it is definitely not worth paying for. All in all, not a bad stay. I have stayed at the Palace and think that the Palace is a little better, but is probably more expensive. I wish the hotel had a tower lounge.

Reviews.Title: “I can not think of any other hotel to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: zun1ga
Reviews.Content: I wish all other large luxurious hotels could give you the same "at home" feeling the Waldorf gives you. I have been traveling to NYC for about 10 years and while booking my trips, I don't even think of any place else to stay. I have stayed at the St Regis, Pierre and others but none of them has given me the experience, service, location, history and friendly smiles I consistently get at the Waldorf - ultimately giving you the best place to stay in NYC. I consistently travel about 3 weeks per month...and I almost feel like coming home when walking into the Waldorf. Moreover, I have been a Diamond HHonors member for about 12 yrs and have not found a better Diamond desk than the one at the Waldorf. Jackie, Mary and the rest of the staff make every effort to make your stay the best possible, Thank you so much for all you do. And the history....just walk around the lobby, and while walking to your room pay attention to the photos of royalty, celebrities, elected officials, diplomats and you will then realize that you are staying in a very special place.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond words”
Reviews.Author: LBerg10
Reviews.Content: Whenever you think of luxury and elegance in New York City, The Waldorf Astoria certainly will come to mind. Whether or not you have ever been to NYC or not, you have heard about this hotel. Whether it's from a tv show, movie, or in the news, the Waldorf has made itself known. I remember watching a lot of movies and TV shows and seeing the characters staying at this hotel. I also have read about royalty and very prominent figures staying here as well. So I decided to look online and could very well see just from the website alone how this hotel has such great notoriety. Knowing that my father and I were planning a trip to NYC in the near future, I looked on the website again to see if I could book a room and if it would be affordable. I will be honest, the prices can be a little shocking at times if you're not used to paying a couple hundred dollars a night for the room, but I have paid that before for other hotels in other cities that were nowhere near the caliber of the Waldorf. The prices for the weekend we were looking to go were actually modest and we decided to save up a bit and give it a shot. Upon arriving the cab drops you off out front and you are immediately greeted by doorman who are more than willing to assist you in/out of car and with your luggage. My dad and I travel light so we did not need assistance but it is always good to know that it was there. I will say whenever you first walk in the place is breathtaking. The lobby looks like (and I'm sure is) something right out of a magazine. The chandelier alone will be your first photo op. Right from the start you can feel the power of the this hotel. The staff (who are all dressed to the nines) and the guests walking around, sheerly are some of New Yorks elite. My dad and I dressed for the roadtrip were not in this category...haha...but we managed to blend in enough to make it to check it then up to our room. The room is hands down the nicest I have ever stayed in. The decor is undescribable and the ambience as well. We almost felt out of place because thats how nice it is. I felt bad putting a soda down on the desk and jumping onto the bed. I immediately realized I had forgot a toothbrush(as usual) and few other personal items. I was immediately able to speak to customer service and a very friendly Krystyna was able to assist me. She actually gave me more than needed. Customer Service at this level I would think would have to be above and beyond, and to be truthful, it really is. Dan Briks and Matt Lane are the directors of rooms and front desk. We spoke to them both over the span of the weekend and they were more than able to assist us in the requests that we had. Another employee, Melissa K, found out that it was a pretty important trip for me and my dad and was able to come across two free drink tickets for one of their hotel bars. The drinks can be a bit out of the regular price range but I ordered an Old Fashioned and its exactly the way it should be made. Missy was very personable and is definetely someone who should be walking about and accessible to the guests. We then went out for the night and returned to the room and slept on beds that I wish I never had to leave. They too are out of this world. We also found out that a few celebrities were in the hotel and there is always a good chance you can have a run in! For what it's worth, and I'd be lying if I said different, the hotel for the extra money is completely worth it. If you are just looking to lay your head down then this might not be the stay for you. But if its a special trip and you plan on spending some time in the room as well as the hotel to eat/drink and people watch, this is hands down the #1 hotel in NYC. I will definetely be coming back and would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Elegance”
Reviews.Author: dodi22
Reviews.Content: Three nite stay for a girls weekend. Beautiful, charming, elegant! Staff were incredible , courteous, helpful from bellhops, front desk, concierge, housekeeping! Was treated like a diplomat even though I am blue-collar. Very clean. Restaurants are very pricey, but hey, this is NYC.....step out the front door and there are hundreds of other dining choices. If you want a weekend of pampering...this is the place to go!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury & old world charm at it's best”
Reviews.Author: thewidds
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 25 March 2011 and had booked a 1 bedroom suite along with a standard double room. What we ended up with was a two bedroomed suite as the second double was actually interconnecting with the suite. The sitting room was enormous to say the least and the bedrooms were of a very good size. Yes people can say that some parts of the hotel are a little dated but lets face it any grand old lady with such a history will have a few wrinkles and laughter lines!! But do not let this put you off staying. The public areas are stunning and the staff cannot do enough for you. We never got tired of sitting just watching the world go by in the lovely lobby areas. This was our third trip to NY and having stayed at the Waldorf can say without fear of contradiction we will be back again. It was totally amazing and the staff make you feel so special. Well done to the Management on keeping this beautiful hotel as it should be and not giving in to "contemporary" pressures!! Thank you for a wonderful few days.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience , wonderfull hotel, exceptional staff, Diamond reception phenominal.”
Reviews.Author: thomas48230
Reviews.Content: Was at the Waldorf and have stayed there many times. The personnel there are experienced, exceptional, make you feel welcome and try very hard to make your stay perfect. Especially enjoy the staff, Jackie, Mary etc at Diamond Reception, who work very hard to please the guests and make them feel wanted and pampered. Makes this large hotel feel very welcoming

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets!!”
Reviews.Author: chag45
Reviews.Content: For the business traveler, the staff at the Waldorf do everything they can to make your stay a unique, away from home experience. For those who travel enough to be at the Diamond level with Hilton, it all starts with Jacque at the Diamond reception desk. Quite simply there is no warmer, more welcoming person in the industry! Now it is not uncommon for a hotel to have a staff person or two who truly understand the meaning of Service but this unique brand of service is repeated over and over again by the bartenders, the waiters and the service staff. While the hotel itself is unique, it's the People who make this hotel what it is, one of a kind!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, rooms in need of some attention”
Reviews.Author: YYZtotheworld
Reviews.Content: Stayed over a 4 day period on a business trip. Beautiful common areas, especially the lobby. Staff go out of their way to make you feel at home (very pleasant, positive attitude). Location is ideal, just down the street from 51st Street subway (or just up the street from Grand Central station). My room itself felt cozy, but was a little surprised to find wallpaper peeling back (hanging off the wall just above the TV) and mould in the ceiling of the shower area. I would have thought housekeeping would have noted the issue with the wallpaper before allowing the room back into guest inventory. For a hotel with such a great reputation, this was a disappointment. Bed was incredibly comfortable (best sleep I've had in a hotel in years), amenities in the bathroom were also of high quality. The hotel is also very safe, with card access required past 6 pm and police regularly outside the front door (my guess would be to protect VIPs that are staying at the hotel). Others have noted no in-room safes. This was a surprise to me as well, but given the hotel offers a full vault area in the main lobby, it wasn't a big concern. Charges for wi-fi are expensive. Surely with more basic (much cheaper?) hotels including it at no additional charge, you would think Hilton would make the move as well (perhaps Hilton Hhonors members should get free wifi?). Used free wi-fi in the lobby for the occasional time I needed to catch up on work. There was also a rather damp smell in the room, but after all this is an older hotel with a lot of history (including a time where all rooms were smoking rooms). Aside from the wallpaper issue, I'd gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Living on past glories!”
Reviews.Author: JPD11
Reviews.Content: We visited NYC for our honeymoon and were looking for a special hotel for our 3 night visit. This was not it! After a lot of searching and enquiries we chose the Waldorf as it seemed a quintessential piece of NYC plus well located for transport and sight seeing. We specifically wanted a room with a view and at the time of booking (by telephone) a room with a view of the Chrysler building was requested for us. We even upgraded to a king bed mini suite to try and ensure we would have a nice room and view. This request was backed up via an email reply to one sent by the hotel reservation team. On arrival by taxi, no-one offered to deal with our bags or direct us to reception. Even when we asked where the reception was, the reply was curt and still no offer to take our bags. There was a big conference on at the hotel and the lobby was exceptionally busy. We had to queue for some time to check in which was not ideal after a long flight. Whilst the lobby, reception areas and bars were very opulent the corridors leading to the rooms were rather drab and dated. Our room was nice and big (mini suite) and the bed was very comfortable but that's where the positives end. The room was very dark without all the lights on which was in no small part due to the fact that it looked out onto the inner courtyard of the hotel. So much for our nice view - just 3 walls of hotel windows!! There was a cupboard that purported to be some sort of kitchenette with an ancient fridge and horrible stainless steel sink and drainage board. Then the piece de la resistance was the bathroom. This was a poky little room (even the washbasin had to be located outside of it) that the bath just about fit into. A bath that looked at least 30 years old from the 1970's. Shower was poor. The toilet didn't work properly with water continually flowing after flushing. We rang to explain that we weren't happy with the room, especially the lack of requested view and bathroom, only to be told unsympathetically that there were no other rooms available that night. The hotel did offer to move us to a higher floor the next day but couldn't tell us what the room would be like and wanted to charge an extra $50 a night. We didn't take them up on the offer and instead checked out at 7.00am the next morning, moving to the Mandarin Oriental (see review) which was fantastic. At check out they tried to charge for 2 bottles of water from the mini bar which we had been told on arrival were complimentary. I don't think we could have been more disappointed with the Waldorf which did not live up to it's past reputation or our expectations. The rooms are badly in need of being brought up to date (especially bathrooms). The opulence of the past could still be retained with a sympathetic refurbishment. The lobby might be grand but that's not where you're going to sleep. They could also take some lessons in customer relations from other hotels. It seemed they were more concerned with their large conference and the business from that than their other individual guests and their concerns. Perhaps everyone should experience the NY Waldorf once in their life but for us one night was more than enough.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute dream....heavenly.......start to finish!”
Reviews.Author: capekate
Reviews.Content: I have been to NYC many many times and always used trip advisor to find to check the hotel that I was considering. I generally like to stay in (the lowest) star and above, generally 4 star. It is so easy these days to get a smart deal on good digs! I never thought to try the Waldorf. I always figured it was too stuffy and I would get lost among the fur coats and diamond! Ha! I want to tell you that they probably couldn't have treated a member of the royal family any better than we were treated. From the moment we drove up all I saw were smiles and and all I heard was,"Can we help you?", "can we get you anything else?", "Is everything okay?" The room was so lovely... Just what you would think a Waldorf room would look like... Brocade curtains, plush pillows, an amazingly comfortable bed.... Best I have ever slept in, in a hotel, and the room was so spacious compared to the accepted cozy size of a NYC hotel room. It was very easy to walk to rockefeller plaza, times square, etc. And getting a cab is pretty easy too, so the location is quite convenient. I was concerned about finding someplace to grab a snack outside of the hotel. They were only to happy to point out an array of options within a block. There is a place that is right outside the back door that sells sandwiches salads fruit on and on....and some great restaurant very close also.... I think everyone should stay at the waldorf at least once in your life.... You may find that it may become the only place you ever stay in NYC! One more thing... The parking was 50. A day and that is actually less that it is at some of the other NYC hotels... And they are fast and courteous...

Reviews.Title: “Home from home”
Reviews.Author: CWQ41
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been staying here twice a year for quite a while. I commute to the financial district, which is easy as Grand Central is just up the road. We find the welcome and service to be excellent and although the rooms may not be as modern as some they do have a charm of their own. If you are lucky enough to fall into the clutches of Jackie and Mary at Diamond reception, then there is no problem that cannot be overcome. I have tried other hotels but keep coming back to this one for the service, location and ambience.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has elegance, history, romance and staff that makes you feel right at home!!”
Reviews.Author: mgsgtravelbugs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to New York for our 34th wedding Anniversary!! My husband is a Hilton Diamond member, so the staff moved mountains to up grade us to a beautiful corner suite with a view of Park avenue!! It was so beautiful that we canceled our dinner reservations and ordered room service, before heading out to see a play!! The meal arrived promptly and was great. You cannot find a better location for seeing the sites in Mid town. We were close to great restaurants, Broadway plays, time square, and wonderful shopping!! We walked to most of our destinations, because the weather was so nice!! The staff was so personable and friendly,even though they were so busy!! We are already planning a trip back and we will be staying at the Waldorf Astoria!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Special Place that made us feel Special”
Reviews.Author: dogmombarrington
Reviews.Content: We were in New York for a long weekend associated with a business trip. We found the Waldorf to be beautiful, accommodating and real joy. The locale can't be beat and the beds were very comfortable. This is a special hotel in the old classy hotel tradition, without being stuffy. Truly a 'great lady' of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “elegant”
Reviews.Author: donnacarder
