Reviews.Content: stayed four nights for my 50th birthday with ny sister the waldorf astoria was the highlight of my stay in nyc ,only downside was we didnt have much of a view ,but hey your not in your room during the day .ps dont bother with woodbury common unless your into prada ect soooo expensive xxxx

Reviews.Title: “Love the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: shaunster
Reviews.Content: Stayed three times at the Waldorf in the last few years and finally got round to posting a review. Rooms can be small (much better to be on the outside, my last room had a great view of the empire state) but are always well equipped and the overall experience at the hotel makes up for any shortcomings on space. Great location, very central and close to key shopping areas and many excellent restaurants a short walk away. Was original going to stay elsewhere during my last visit at the Waldorf rates were expensive, but these dropped considerably in the weeks before our trip so was able to ditch the other hotel. If you do book early, watch you don't pay over the odds. Love the bull and bear restaurant and the coffee shop in the front foyer, which is great for a grab and go breakfast. Above all else, the Waldorf gives you that 'old' new york feel - will definitely be back at some point in the not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Waldorf!”
Reviews.Author: Tyronegirl1971
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights last year with my boyfriend on our first trip to NY from Europe. I have been in NY since and have stayed at other hotels, but nothing can compare to the Waldorf. The standard rooms here are nearly twice the size of what one normally gets in NY, the service, the staff are second to none. And the decor...and Art Deco lover's dream! It really is a piece of NY history and the atmosphere is buzzing. I'm going back again this Fall for a week, can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: MartinGilmore
Reviews.Content: Great service when checking in staff very friendly and effecient. Room was very clean and maids tidied the room twice a day. Concierge was very helpful and phoned our helicopter company to confirm our booking for us. Would strongly recommend this hotel as it is close to 5th Ave and local metro stations. Only negative point about this hotel is that the bar is more expensive than other NYC bars but we expected this

Reviews.Title: “why stay anywhere else?"”
Reviews.Author: gsiem19
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC once or twice a month. Let's face it, NY is filled with great, if pricey, hotels. But I always seem to return to the Waldorf after trying many of the others. It's roomy and always immaculate. On my most recent stay (March, 2011) I took the time to take in the effortless charm of this great old hotel. It is close to everything midtown, the service is the most consistent I've experienced in NYC. Thye food is well above average, the bars are varied and great ,and an interesting place to meet fellow travellers. If you happen to be a frequent Hilton traveller, Jackie, in Diamond reception, will apply a personal touch to solve any personal needs or requests.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: Travel154_10
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria : "On celebrated Park Avenue in Midtown Manhattan, the Waldorf=Astoria New York hotel continues to define the concepts of peerless service and indulgent comfort. This legendary New York luxury hotel combines art deco splendor with the latest technologies and modern amenities." Right from their website, I couldn't say it any better. It is a legend, it is history and the service is impeccable. I am a weekly traveller and I would add home to my description. It is how the staff receive you, as if you are a family member, the service is 10 stars. Especially from the Diamond Desk, Jackie is simply THE BEST EVER - REALLY in customer service. She never ceases to amaze me at the level of service she provides. Mary, is so nice and attentive to details. George, Dan, Jeff and so many others are incredible. How lucky am I that I have discovered the best, warmest team place that is almost my second home.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic....!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BAJB
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 nights at the fantastic Waldorf Astoria, this hotel is not just in New York......This Hotel is everything i love about New York, from the moment i arrived i was blown away by the exceptional customer service this hotel provides, the elegant lobby greets you right away and we were met with a group of smiles from the bellman to the receptionist to all of the cleaners, we were given an Astor suite, clean, well sized and immaculately clean...(no Bed Bugs here)....The hotel is decorated the way hotels used to be, traditional and homely.If you want modern souless hotels that are light airy, contemporary and basically a copy of Ikea, d'ont stay here. Overall a superb Hotel, very Art Deco, very Historic and very New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, traditional quality”
Reviews.Author: PacerJim
Reviews.Content: We went for a quick NYC trip for a night and stayed at the Waldorf. It has a great location. Flying to JFK and taking the Airtrain, then the E subway, drops you a block away. From there you can get uptown or downtown on the 6 line. Our room was very nice, not very big, but the bath was nicely done. We had free internet due to HHonors status, along with free continental breakfast at Starbucks. When Starbucks ran out of juice, the Waldorf dining manager quickly corrected that with some from their kitchen. Good customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Chic”
Reviews.Author: curban17
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria, NYC is a must see for any hotel or travel enthusiasts! From the Bellhop to the Housekeepers, everyone is the most professional, yet friendly people find in NYC! Definitely worth the money to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “luxury, perfect location and superb service”
Reviews.Author: loz089
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my husbands birthday and both thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience. From the moment we entered the hotel we couldn't fault a single thing. The staff were very helpful and pleasant at all times, our room was perfect for us, and we were delighted when we were given a bottle of Champagne and chocolate coated strawberries to celebrate my husbands birthday. Would certainly recommend this hotel and we will be back again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing NY hotel and customer service at its best”
Reviews.Author: jruez
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Waldorf for two nights for our anniversary trip. We were both very pleased. Room: The size of the room surprised us for a NY hotel. It was very spacious. We were given a corner room, so we had two nice views .. its new york so you are going to have some obstruction, but it was still nice. Bed was comfortable. Location: We had planned to go to the top of 30 Rock, and that was a few blocks away. Carnegie Deli was a 10-15 minute walk. Le Bernardin was close, which we choose for our anniversary meal. It was a great location for the things we wanted to do. Customer Service: Very friendly staff that accommodated us in any and every way. They go above an beyond what is expected. It really made the stay an experience to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and consistency”
Reviews.Author: KrisC_13
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf is an outstanding hotel. The rooms are clean and comforatble and the service is terrific. Jackie at the Diamond Desk goes to extraordinary lengths to make guests welcome and comfortable. The waldorf is my favorite hotel in NYC, my home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service and Rooms”
Reviews.Author: DrToney
Reviews.Content: I visited the Waldorf Astoria in December of 2010 for a holiday weekend in the city. The stay was fabulous and memorable. It started with the "incredible" Jackie at the Diamond Reception Desk. Jackie was simply marvelous. She greated me and my family as if she had known us for years. She and her associates made us feel right at home. She was able to secure two fantastic rooms for us and even called us after check in to make sure that we were pleased. All of the employees at the hotel are professional and kind. We felt as if we were the center of attention when it came to service. We have already made our plans to return next year. I also plan to make the Waldorf the hub of all of my business ventures to the city. Thank you Jackie and all of the staff of the world's best hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel- the jewel in the crown of our holiday”
Reviews.Author: tas12
Reviews.Content: I had a 5 day stay at the Waldorf recently and was a little apprehensive having read other negative review. However, from our initial arrival at the front door to the doorman hailing our return taxi to the airport, we had a wonderful experience. The staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. Check in was prompt and friendly. Our room was on the 11th floor and surpassed all our expectations. It was at least 20'x20', two double beds, large flat screen tv and a great view of the Crylser Building. The room was really quiet too. The hotel's location is superb. There is a great little diner for breakfast just a block away- 'Lunchette'. The hotel is walking distance of 5th Avenue, Times Square, Central Station and Central Park. I have been raving about the hotel sinto all my friends and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelx4
Reviews.Content: Super location and great service.Beautiful Frette bedlinen and really nice china in the rooms.Gorgeous bath amenities ! Beds are really comfortable and even though it is a large hotel ,service is very efficient.Location is good and 5th Avenue is just a short stroll.Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel staff and surroundings in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Gibbsy3195
Reviews.Content: The staff are so professional and courteous. Nothing was too much trouble including our complimentary upgrade. The rooms are not tired as some say but are "period" as you would expect. The hotel is as grand as you would imagine, we thought just like the titanic. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone who visits NY and wants a bit of luxury. Bar drinks are a bit steep but still cheaper than London.

Reviews.Title: “Old New York”
Reviews.Author: madiandcindy
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria is a beautiful property. Very old money type of hotel. It's always crowded with business travelers and groups. The hotel is showing it's age and should be refurbished. That being said it is a great property to visit. I would not repeat my stay because there are so many better options in NYC but it's a must do in NYC at least once in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: country_girl_usa
Reviews.Content: The historic hotel is outdated and overrated, though nostalgic. It is the service that lacks. Most of the staff avoids eye contact. The housekeeping department on the 23rd floor just didn't care, they were so loud that there was no sleeping in possible... Internet access not included. No coffee maker. Use of fitness center only at additional fee...

Reviews.Title: “we would recommed this hotel to all family and friends, staff are very helpful and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: lees90
Reviews.Content: we stayed on the 7th floor at the front of the hotel in a king size room (we where upgraded when we arrived as it was my birthday), the room was very clean with a walk in wardrobe and a bed we could have shared with our whole family plus a large flat screen tv (this won my husband over straight away). I have been to NY before but stayed midtown on the west side I came home feeling like I hadn't slept at all due to outside noises and I was higher up, but this hotel is situated in a much nicer area. we met a regular business man in the hotel who infromed us the rooms above the 20th floor where cheaper to stay in as they had not been renovated. we did have breakfast in bed on my birthday which was fab but expensive, there are no tea or coffee making facilities in the rooms but there is a starbucks in the entrance to the hotel. we also had an evening meal in the bull and bear restaurant, the food was fantastic,we had real trouble booking a table as people book at least 3 weeks in advance but after giving the conciege a large tip they manage to fit us in. would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Valentines Day at your beautiful, historic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Tina F
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights on the 17th floor and everything was perfect. While the room was a bit small it was very clean and comfortable. Used the concierge service at least 3 times for directions, restaurant recommendations and they were always very helpful and accurate. We had a wonderful and memorable wknd and I highly recommend your hotel. Thank you for everything, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: ANURAGKEJRIWAL
Reviews.Content: Staff is amazing, friendly and all out to make the stay most memorable and comfortable. Hotel is average as rooms are old and not very comfortable. Any bookings or tickets are booked by the staff instantly and they go that extra step to make your day enjoyable. Food in the restaurants is good and there also staff is very friendly. Staff warmth made the stay worth otherwise a big let down

Reviews.Title: “Mismanaged and Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TheFlock1
Reviews.Content: I stay in NY frequently on business. I have stayed at the Waldorf many times in the past, and I think it is getting worse, not better. The location, lobby and restaurants are great. The rooms are very run down. The health club is small and poor. When I checked in on this visit, despite being a Hilton Gold member and a frequnt guest (12 stays in the last year), the check-in person had no idea that I had ever stayed there before. I was assigned a bad room, even for the Waldorf. My heater did not work (which happens often there) and my bathroom looked like it was from the 1970s. When I asked a manager why I was given a bad room, she told me their computer systems are very old so it is hard to tell who are the return guests/Gold members. She did not care in any way that I was disappointed. With so many other hotels in the area, I am surprised the hotel staff cares so little about the customers.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas stay- hotel needs improvement.”
Reviews.Author: Hillar33
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed over Christmas last year and want to review now as i still feel strongly about this hotel , our stay was largely ok however there where things that the hotel really had should improve. As a family of six my parents had booked a suite and two additional rooms , we asked originally to be close together and have the two additional twin rooms to be interconnecting however no such luck and when we checked in the receptionist looked at us as if this was a completely outrageous request ! after letting this slide she informed us that in one of the DOUBLE rooms we could use a rolla bed as there where three girls staying in one room and a 20 year old boy in the other , the receptionist then told my father that and they did not cater for this and she suggested that we just, should share the double bed ! as we were staying for 10 nights i thought this was very unreasonable. As well as this being inconvenient when we actually got to our rooms they where small, hot and uncomfortable ! The hotel really needs some modernizing and it would be nice to see a staff member smile once in a while ! The Christmas dinner was an absolute Joke and really ruined our Christmas after pre booking our time we were left waiting over an HOUR for our table on xmas day and were told we were not allowed to wait in the bar as 2 of our party where under 21 ( 20 and 18) even though we were only ordering Soft drinks ! i understand this is an american law but does seem highly unreasonable givven the situation and so where left standing in the lobby . We had a fantastic time in New York city and loved our holiday but we certainly will not be returning to the Waldorf Astoria ! p.s. you should think about adding a English breakfast to your room service menu

Reviews.Title: “What a swellegant,elegant party this is....”
Reviews.Author: Canadianknowitall
Reviews.Content: LOVED this hotel. It is a grand palace of plush and style and busy with people revelling in being in New York.The room was grand with a fireplace with a faux fire (colored glass with a light behind it) windows that opened (on the 15th floor!) a spotless bathroom and beds so comfortable you could die in them and not know it. The lobby you could spend a day in just watching the comings and goings. The Peacock bar is a fantastic spot to have a drink. At first glance it seems ridiculously expensive until you taste the quality of what is served and you sample the fair sized serving platter of peanut ,olives and wasabi peas that accompanies your drinks and is complimentary. Also the lobby is is a free wifi zone and you can catch up on emails and surf the internet on your laptop or ipad for free. The hotel internet is very fast and unless you want to pay to have it in your room ($14.95) the lobby is far more fun. Don't miss checking the beautiful ornate piano that once belonged to Cole Porter as he lived at the Waldorf for many years. It sits above the main entrance to the hotel. The location is handy to everything. I did get a very good rate and felt I really lucked in. The service was impeccable whenever one inter-related with staff and the amenities were all first class. For a true one of a kind experience this is the place to stay now that the Plaza has re-invented itself and morphed into something unrecognisable to what used to make it so special. Not the Waldorf=Astoria. It feels like it must have been back in the thirties,forties,fifties and so on without feeling for an instant a whiff of decrepitude or running down because of age. It really is a living monument in every positive way. Elegant without being pretentious, classy without being intimidating. Beautiful and alive with a great patina to savour and enjoy. A timeless classic. I can't wait to go back. Cole Porter knew a good thing when he saw it.

Reviews.Title: “awesome!”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisBeau
Reviews.Content: I travel alot and stay at 4-5 start hotels, so after reading several reviews, I wasn't happy we had reservations here..but from start to finish, our stay was wonderful...no issues at check in...staff thru-out our stay were extremely friendly from doormen to housekeeping and waitstaff. our room was clean and being a mini suite..large..and the beds were super comfy

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing- not living up to its heritage.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for two days Valentine's weekend. I am a HHonors Diamond and we stayed on points- I spend approximately 225 days a year on the road, about 100 w/Hilton properties. We both love historic hotels- given the choice, we'll frequently stay at an Embassy Suites vs. a Hilton or Waldorf because of the ameneties for our style, but we have enjoyed wonderful experiences at properties like the Waldorf Grand Waileia and found the flagship wanting. When one arrives at the main entrance of the Waldorf on Park Avenue, there is a 18-20 step staircase up to the lobby level. There was one doorman and no bellmen working (the main bell desk is next to the front desk in the main lobby, 200 feet up the stairs away), but to his credit the harried doorman helped my wife with our third bag to the top of the stairs and apologized there was no one to help to the desk- functionally this was fine, as we are used to handling oour own, but the doorman at the WALDORF is having to apologize for being unable to help on a Sunday afternoon? Check-in reminded me of a Vegas casino hotel, with the line and line-minder, but they were very friendly and when our room wasn't ready offered to call me on my cell when it was and directed me to the 'Diamond Reception' when we returned to pick up our keys. When we returned, we went to the 'Diamond Reception,' which was a two-desk room, only one manned, next to the bell desk at the end of the lobby. While waiting for the couple in front of us to be waited on, I got the pleasure of listening to the bell captain talk loudly into his cell phone in walkie-talkie mode as if he was yelling at his kids at home. That said, we were given nice coupons for drinks and continental breakfast at the Starbucks at the base of the stairs (where a bellman desk would be great), upgraded to a junior suite, and the bellman who delivered our luggage (we'd left it with walkie-talkie boy when we first checked in and the rooms weren't ready) was outstanding in both service ethic and personality. Sunday night- we went to the Met for a concert, stopped at the lobby bar for a drink, great service. Two hours later, after we haad changed clothes to go for a brisk walk (from dress to casual), went back to the same bar, sat down, I ordered an upscale drink and a glasss of water for my teetotaler wife, and received a very snippy 'there's a two drink minimum at the bar' from the lady bartender. Responding 'Oh, would it help if I am paying with this?' and pulling out the Waldorf coupon with my name on it as a Diamond, she just turned around and made the drinks, no other response. When leaving, at 5 am Tuesday morningn to catch an early flight, I had to stop at the front desk to fix our receipt- I'd been charged fro Internet acceess. Very friendly staff and no problem, but why? I have this problem 1 out of 20 stays- didn't expect it here. So we head out, down the stairs, and come to find out that the flagship of the Waldorf brand, a hotel located oon Park Avenue in NY City, doesn't have a 24 hour door presence. The taxi drivers were nice- the one who took us to the airport helped my wife through the door when her bag was stuck- but REALLY? You're the Waldorf and you don't have a doorman? Please understand- this is not overblown expectations. We spent the previous two night at the Intercontinental Barclay (also on points), and the service blew the Waldorf away. All things being equal, I had better service at the Hilton Atlanta airport I bought off of Hotwire last month during a snowstorm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service. Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Porthos77
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a king 1 bedroom suite on the concierge level. The room was slightly worn but very spacious and had beautiful views of Park Avenue. The breakfast on the concierge level was excellent. Staff was friendly and helpful. Guests on the concierge level have access to the Waldorf Towers entrance and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “I lucked out, big time!!!”
Reviews.Author: jayemge
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Waldorf early on December 31st so we could get settled before the ball dropped at Times Square, but because we were early, our room wasn't ready yet. WELL....instead of making us wait...they gave a a HUGE SUITE (701 or 711, I cant remember, but it was on the corner) for the same price of the original room which I booked. It had a huge living room, huge bedroom and the biggest bathroom I've ever seen! A separate shower from the bathtub and the commode was in its own room...with a telephone inside! LOL!!!! There was even a huge dressing room off the bathroom. The bed felt like it was made of down. If you haven't already guessed...I was impressed. So impressed, we stayed in and watched the ball drop on the tube...and had one of the best nights sleep in a long time. Room service was prompt and the complimentary food brought to the room (included champagne) was the icing on the cake. I dont travel much (if ever), but I am glad I had this pleasant of an experience.

Reviews.Title: “Living on its reputation”
Reviews.Author: travelling1935
Reviews.Content: This is a legendary hotel and a prestigious name, and that will be sufficient for many visitors. Yet, one's actual experience as a guest can be variable. I attempted to check in around noon on a weekday, having arrived by an early flight, and the clerk was polite but firm. Check-in time was 3 p.m. and I would have to come back later. In my experience, a responsible hotel will nevertheless check the system in such situations to see to see whether a room is available. She was unwilling to do so. I said I would return later and in the interim leave my bags in the hospitality suite in the Waldorf Towers section of the hotel. I was staying there for business meetings, and the suite was already open. The Towers section is normally accessible from the lobby, but when I approached it, I discovered I needed a pass key, so I had to stand in line again at the reception desk to get one. This time, I ended up with a male clerk who immediately said: "You can certainly have a key to the Towers but first let me check if a room is available." It turned out that a room was, in fact, available, so I checked in. I felt that the luck of the draw was at work here. The first time I arrived at the check-in counter, I received less than acceptable attention. The second time I received the kind of attentive treatment one would expect from a hotel of this reputation. The gorgeously designed lobby has been a familiar New York landmark for generations, and it is always a pleasure to be greeted by its warmth and atmosphere, but the rooms don't necessarily live up to your initial ground-floor impressions. Again they are of variable quality, although always clean and well-maintained. But I once had accommodation so small that there wasn't even room for a small desk. This time, there was space for a desk. but the appointments were pretty basic: Very comfortable queen bed, bedside tables, dresser, TV. The only chair was the desk chair: there was no easy lounge chair for enjoying TV, reading the paper, or comfortably partaking of a room service meal — because there was no room for one. In brief, many a well-run motor hotel does better. The bathroom, although offering only a shower, was well equipped with good lighting and ample hot water. The thermostat was eccentric and difficult to regulate. Meals were a problem on this particular visit. Because I didn't think I would enjoy room service food in my room, I opted for the public areas. The hotel has stopped opening its popular coffee shop in the evening (an unfortunate decision deplored by many regulars), so that leaves either its Bull And Bear Restaurant or a limited menu in its Peacock Alley lounge. Peacock Alley was closed (because of kitchen problems, I was told) so that left the Bull And Bear, a steak and seafood place where the food is excellent, the choice limited and the prices stratospheric (the most modest steak costs $48; vegetables are $12 each extra). I ate well there, but I resented the limited food options on this particular visit.

Reviews.Title: “The Waldorf Astoria is classic elegance in a good location”
Reviews.Author: phillyvoyagers
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at the Waldorf and were generally pleased with the overall experience. The staff is polite and helpful, and as HiltonHonors Diamond members we were upgraded to a suite, which also included a free drink at any of the bars, as well as a continental breakfast from the Starbucks which is located off the lobby. The furnishings were elegant with wall paper, drapes and carpets in good condition, and with large flat screen TV's in both the living room and the bedroom. The only objection was that the room was very warm, and despite our attempts to lower the temperature by using the controls, it was hard to get a good night's sleep because the room was so hot (the windows have signs on them not to open them). It is a 25 minute walk from the theatre district. There are many nice restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: patggoole
Reviews.Content: My daughter (26) and I stayed here for 3 nights from 10th - 13th February. Check in was efficient and staff welcoming. The entrance and all the ground floor was lovely and obviously full of history. Having read mixed reviews about the rooms, we wondered what to expect. No problem - we had a room with 2 comfortable double beds and had plenty of space to move around. The bathroom was a bit dated but clean with fluffy towels and bathrobes. However, no shower gel, only soap, so take your own. We had a large flat screen TV. I asked for a fridge and this was brought straight away. Location good: 10 mins to Times Square, 5 mins from Rockerfeller and MOMA. Subway stations just round the corner or 3 mins walk at Grand central station. Very convenient. We would have liked cofee/tea facilities in the room but there is a Starbucks in foyer but then had to get dressed for our early morning cuppa! Be prepared for queues. Lovely Sushi bar, called Haru ,2 mins away - go out of main entrance, turn right and first left. Doesn't look much from the outside but good food, japanese beer and cocktails - Happy hour 3-7 weekdays and 5-7 weekend so very good value. Other recommendations- Blue Fin in Times Square and L'ecole On Broadway in SOHO.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service in a Grand Hotel of Another Era”
Reviews.Author: MichelleDekker
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf=Astoria is a grand hotel, a historic gem out of another era, and I have to say that I like it just the way it is. Perhaps some of the rooms are small, perhaps the carpet in some of the rooms is worn and dated, perhaps the style of the shower fittings doesn’t match that of the sink fittings. No matter. This is a place that makes one feel alive and connected to those who have come before. The beautiful, bustling lobby with its antique chiming clock in the center and the little restaurant Peacock Alley off to the side is the very essence of civility. And civility is what we encountered throughout our stay. The staff gave the most professional and kind service imaginable. My one disappointment, and this is important, is that instead of complimentary coffee in the lobby in the morning (or even an in-room coffee maker), the only option for morning coffee (besides room service) is to head down to a Starbucks, which is just below lobby level. What’s next? Replacing Oscar’s with McDonalds? This was a huge letdown and the one discordant feature of an otherwise lovely experience.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to its hype”
Reviews.Author: outoftownIAD
Reviews.Content: We reserved two rooms and arrived to find that neither was ready, even though it was well after check-in time. The front desk clerk was nice enough but not particularly apologetic, and after waiting for nearly an hour, we were told our rooms were ready. However, when we got there, the maid was still cleaning one of them, and she was not pleased to see us. Yes, that's right - the maid cleaning our room well past check-in time seemed annoyed that we were there. The rooms themselves were very small and dated, although we didn't spend much time in them, so it wasn't a big deal. Overall, the Waldorf was a disappointing experience, and I can say that there are much better hotels in NYC in terms of customer service, comfort and value.

Reviews.Title: “upgraded to the elevator shaft”
Reviews.Author: smargach
Reviews.Content: in NYC for business, was "upgraded to a junior suite" but it was next to the tower elevator. it was the loudest room i have ever slept in. the elevator stopped whirling up and down around 1:30 and started up again at 5:30am. the front desk sent ear plugs, all for only $450 a nite. unrelated to the noise, you only have to pay $15 per visit to the health club, bit of a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Nostalgic”
Reviews.Author: jpj028
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Waldorf Astoria in NYC this past week on business. I upgraded to one of the older luxury suites which doubles the size of a typical room. This is one of many nostalgic hotels in Manhattan that should be experienced once in your lifetime. I've read a number of not-so-happy reviews and all I could say that you need to have an appreciation to elegance and history. Remember this is NYC, rooms tend to be on the small side and in some cases hotels are dated. The location is excellent and staff tends to be more helpful and professional than a majority of the hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “One word ... Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: WnaTrvelMor
Reviews.Content: I have always heard of the grand dame of New York hotels, the Waldorf Astoria, and I was very excited to spend Christmas with my family there. First of all, they must have been short-staffed as no one even bothered to take our bags .  We had to carry it, along with 3 children, to the front desk. Yes, the lobby was fabulous and brought you back to another time when the word "luxury" meant something and I also loved the pictures of both famous and infamous dignitaries and celebrities who have stayed in this establishment.  However when we got to our rooms it was very disappointing. Although it was clean (no bedbugs), it was old and musty.  There is quaint and charming, and this wasn't  it. This was just dated.  If it wasn't for the Name and location of this hotel,  I could have just been staying in any run-of-the-mill motel on the side of the road. Having said all this, the location was just perfect but I think one stay in this hotel is enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but don't expect much. Worn is the best adjective to describe the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Aggienhouston
Reviews.Content: Glad I only stayed one night and that it was on business. The hotel, furniture and rooms are very worn and in great need to replacing. I stayed on the 8th floor which needed new carpet, new paint, etc. - you get the picture. Room was very hot - only way to adjust was to turn it off. No in room safe - I've never stayed in a hotel that did not have an in-room safe. Too many nice hotels in NYC to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant comfort in the grand old style of Art Deco NYC”
Reviews.Author: BBBTTTNYC
Reviews.Content: Our 2nd family Christmas ('09 and '10) with grown children at the Astoria. Perfect! Our stay extended by 3 days because of the big blizzard, but the Astoria made room for us. We had 2 suites this time, each with non-working fireplace, but thoroughy charming. We ate dinner elsewhere (the Warwick hotel) because Peacock Alley was booked. Don't miss the amazing brunch downstairs though. The location made everything from Macy's to Times Square to Central Park walkable --important since the blizzard took cabs and buses off the road! But the magnificent Christmas decorations at the Waldorf will encourage you to just lounge the lobby at every opportunity. Staff is superb as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Welshvisitors
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for four nights in December. Prior to arriving we requested a room with a view and a bottle of wine for check in. Unfortunately the check out was not as efficient as it could have been. Although we arrived at midday (and the hotel states that they cannot guarantee check in until 3 pm) we had to wait until at least 4 pm as we were told our requested room was being cleaned. We were happy to accept this delay as we had been quite specific about wanting a room with a view, but was disappointed to find that the view was pretty limited, overlooking the air con units. However we could see the main street and this may have been as good as it gets for a standard room in NYC. The room itself was spacious and clean. The heating was straightforward to use, and this had to be put on 'high' as soon as we got into the room. Obviously, the mini bar and the bar//restaurants are a little pricey but we expected this and as we were in NYC for such a short time we wanted to eat and drink out as much as possible, so we didn't use any of the hotel facilities. The rooms were quiet and communal areas were clean which was impressive given the amount of guests they had at this time of year. Would I book this hotel agin? Definitely. Was there a hotel we passed that seemed better value for money, better location, with the wow factor of the Waldorf? Not that we saw. We debated for ages before booking due to some of the reviews on trip advisor, but we were not disappointed. We went there with the view that we would only be in the room to sleep, but we could have comfortably spent more time in the hotel if we had the time. The location was ideal. A short walk from 5th Avenue and about 20 minutes walk from time square. We felt safe walking back to the hotel in the night as the main streets were well lit and busy. We even walked to central park from the hotel (about 30 minutes) and grand central terminal was just around the corner. Sightseeing: If this is your first time to NYC, plan ahead. This was our first trip and we were told to be prepared that we wouldn't see everything that we wanted. We did. With a bit of planning it is possible to hit all the main sights. To give you an idea our itinerary was: Day 1: Subway to Battery Park. Go to Grand central terminal help desk and get a subway map and all day travel pass (cost about £10). The subway is colour coordinated so pretty straight forward to use. From battery park (we bought breakfast from a street vendor: very nice) we went to trinity church, and then back to the park to board the sightseeing statue cruise to Statue of Liberty Island and Ellis Island. I would recommend both. Book these tickets online before you go to beat the cruise. Leave half a day to tour both islands (Ellis took us the longest about 90mins). Back on land, head for financial district (wall street etc) and then to WTC. Make sure you go into St Pauls Chapel directly opposite the site as it is filled with memorabilia of the rescue efforts. There is a tribute centre nearby, and a developmental centre opposite the church to end on a more uplifting note. We then got subway to china town for dinner, and then back to hotel by about 7pm. Day 2: We walked to Central Park and had breakfast in a small diner nearby. We then walked to strawberry fields and some other sights nearby, but we didn't go further up. Too cold and not enough interests further north. We then headed back towards 5th Avenue and walked the length of this down to Times Square. Fantastic Pizzeria's around here. Keep walking to reach Flat Iron (that was for my husband I wasn't too interested). We broke up the walking with shopping, and it took us the best part of the day. After a couple of hours rest in the hotel we went to the Top of the Rock at about 7pm. Again pre booked online saved the queues. Fantastic views of manhattan. Day 3: We got on the subway to Brooklyn and walked the Brooklyn Promenade to take beautiful photos of Manhattan skyline. You can walk Brooklyn Bridge, but at this point we had enough walking! We walked a few streets in Brooklyn to look at the beautiful houses. Again we felt perfectly safe. We got on the subway and headed back towards times square and we went to the Empire State building to have a view of Manhatten by day. Again fantastic views but cold. We also did a lot of shopping this day :$ Other recommendations would be to visit Juniors Cheesecakes in Central Terminal (I thought the cheesecake here beat the Magnolia Bakery cupcakes that are often raved about), Central Library, The Oyster Bar (a pint and 6 oysters for $12- unusual but nice), Famous Dave's BBQ (the ribs and shrimp were fantastic - and cheap. Don't have starters...trust me, you won't fit it all in. We went twice it was that good), Radio City Music Hall, and a Karoake Bar in Times Square (not sure of the name, but entertaining. Don't expect the standard to be similar to UK Karaoke, it was full of Beyonce type singers). We managed to squeeze all that in within our trip, and still have time for cat nap before going out in the night. Obviously we didn't visit everything (museums etc) but we managed to visit all the main sights that have been recommended on trip advisor and fitted our interests). So if you organised and wearing good walking shoes it can be done. We just need to book another holiday to rest now!

Reviews.Title: “Faded grandeur - in need of sprucing up”
Reviews.Author: TravellingBen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the history and ambiance on our 1st trip to NYC. We were kind of disappointed - there was amazing art deco look and feel in the public areas, but in the room it was more traditional and old-fashioned without the art deco touches we hoped for. I had booked a mini suite and the room was large, but under-utilised with empty space and a 40s style kitchenette with a 70s fridge that we had to get turned off as it was too noisy. The room is more chinz than class, with clashing carpets, curtains and furniture. It did have a great bed, ipod dock and massive plasma tv. The room grew on us, but the bathroom had oddly matching tub and toilet/bidet and no real power shower. No tea/coffee facilities though. Overall I don't think it was really worth the money but had good breakfast and location. Would try another hotel in future. COncierge was mixed, and they mucked up a welcome gift for my wife so was a day late and then they sent twice! Overall, wished tried a W hotel or maybe suite at Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I expected/dreamed about.”
Reviews.Author: lmcm61
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to visit NY and in particular this hotel, which I thought reflected glamour, sophistication and the treat to end all treats! Shortly after booking, I read reviews on here, got told some stories about it being not all that it is cracked up to be etc etc and went to the travel agent to cancel and rebook another hotel...I am so, so pleased I was put off from doing so. The hotel is beautiful, rooms are very clean, and the ambience of the place alone makes you feel special. The food was superb - you must eat at the Bull & Bear steak house, it is mind blowing even though very expensive. Not a bad bottle of wine in the house if what we had was anything to go by, so you can be confident in making a choice.The service was very on the ball, and the consierge very informative. The location is bang on for walking up or down town, and walking we found is the best way to discover some fab deli's and restaurants. The other hotels we were offered in place of the Waldorf could not compare - you can stay in a marriot or hilton in this country. Only 2 things could improve the overall experience, and that is the price of eating or even drinking in the hotel; we were prepared for expensive but it is really expensive for an ordinary couple like us, ($86 for a bottle of water, class of wine, a slider (2 mini burgers with fries) and a mediterranian salad at Peackock Alley, $232 for 2 waldorf salads, 2 steaks with 2 side orders, 1 desert and 1 glass of wine at the Bull & Bear ) and we did find some of the staff a little snooty....most were fantastic, but one or 2 acted in a very superior manner. However, if you are well prepared financially, and can overlook small minded people who think they are better than you, then there is no problem. I would absolutely go back there, as overall it really was a wonderful experience, and one which I shall never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Great old hotel but, could use some updates”
Reviews.Author: smb1007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf on business this past week with a group of colleagues. The hotel is in an excellent location and the staff is fantastic. The major complaint I have and heard the same from most everyone else relates to the rooms. As you might expect with an older hotel the size of the rooms are inconsistent. The one consistent problem was that no one could get the heat below 74! It was freezing outside but, many of us could not sleep because we were all roasting. I actually opened the window and turned off the heat completely. The conference room we were in the next day did not have very good acoustics and we had to have the temperature adjusted several times during the day. Its really a shame because the hotel itself is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Not The Best Bang For Your Buck”
Reviews.Author: VanessaW2
Reviews.Content: I have traveled quite extensively and stayed at many wonderful hotels (luxury, middle of the road, low end). I found that, like many Hilton properties, The Waldorf left something to be desired. The reason for our stay was that I was to be operated on and my parents and I wanted a little bit of luxury and a classic NYC experience to make things better. I live in Manhattan, but wanted to enjoy myself by staying in an iconic hotel. From the very start I was a bit put off. Prior to checking in both my mother and I spoke with booking agents and informed them I was a government employee (city) -the hotel states online that they offer a discounted rate to government personnel. The agents responded by saying that all I must do is show them my ID at time of check-in and they would apply the rate. Upon checking in we were told that this was not the case and arrangements had to be made when booking the room. The woman at the desk went to talk to her supervisor, however the individual refused to accommodate us. I wasn't upset because we were not able to receive a lesser rate, but was upset that we were misinformed. We found our room to be comfortable (bedding especially), however, a bit dingy and lacking good temperature control. A knob on our dresser popped off and the screw appeared to be stripped, The mirrored doors to our closet had mismatched and cheapie looking handles. Small details, I know...but ones we noticed! The restaurants were overpriced...even by New York standards. I had a $9 pot of tea at Peacock Alley (which is quite lovely I must admit). In terms of service the doormen and garage attendants were very attentive, and most restaurant staff were very pleasant. I am happy I had a one-time stay here, but know I have no need to come back with all of the other great choices in the city. I'm sure that the rooms in the tower portion of the hotel are quite amazing, but if you are going for the more moderate priced rooms you may be disappointed. If I ever had to host an event I feel this would be a fantastic venue, however for a vacation I feel you can find better .

Reviews.Title: “Nice but pricey”
Reviews.Author: BelieverMI
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf is a beautiful hotel in a great location. However, the rooms are small and are in need of an update.

Reviews.Title: “Long lost Allure”
Reviews.Author: KunalAjinkya
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel on a recent trip since had always heard of it, seen it in movies and even passed by but never really stayed in it. I just wanted to know wots the fuss was all about. I got a standard double, very old fashioned room. Yes the hotel may had its golden past but I realised its long lost allure. It has a very classic feel but would not suit most modern business travellers. Overall, satisfied with the service and cleanliness. The room was well done, well equipped and clean. I would not not stay again unless updated to the 2010's.

Reviews.Title: “A NYC Classic”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl027
Reviews.Content: LOVE this hotel. Perfect location, great service. Worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Feel like a star!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoLondon
Reviews.Content: Finally, after reading all the reviews, I stayed at the hotel. I was very apprehensive on receiving a dumpy old room with no escape since i booked a non-refundable rate. We arrived at the hotel with a doorman opening the cab door. Walked inside and the lobby was kickin' as it was Friday night around 7:30 PM. I was lucky not have to wait in line for longer than a couple minutes to check in. Nice lady greeted me and welcomed me back (last stay Oct. 2001). I had called the day before asking if they could upgrade me to a 1 bedroom suite from my king mini suite and they told me they were fully booked but would try their best. They had assigned me the king mini suite but I pressed for a larger room and she told me nothing was available that would top my room and that they sometimes put Towers guests on the 27th floor. She gave me 2 coupons for full American breakfast for two at Oscar's and 2 coupons for Starbucks drink and pastry for 2. Had to use room key to access rooms after 6 PM. Arrived in room and yes, indeed, it was very nice with two rooms and two bathrooms, but it felt small. The room was very clean and lights were lit up making the room feel very welcoming, however, I could not get over how it felt small. I picked up the phone and called guest services and asked if there was anything else. After about 5 minutes of nothing else, all of a sudden, the lady asked if she could put me on hold while she talked to housekeeping. She came back on the line and said there was a large 1 bedroom luxury suite with boudoir, large sitting room and large bedroom. She said to meet her at the room. We immediately went down there and she came down the hall with 2 new room keys and a smile. We walked in and I was stunned at the size. Large marble foyer, very large sitting room with a fireplace!!, spacious bedroom, large boudior with endless storage space, large bathroom with two separate sinks and lots of counter space, separate tub and shower and commode room and kitchen (dated from the 80s but had fridge, stove, sink, dishwasher, cutting board and lots of counter space). Room was so big that my young kid would not go walking around unless I was with or would follow me around if I went to a different area. I could not believe this. I promptly called guest relations and thanked them. We ordered room service the first night. Food came within 30 minutes. To be honest, it was too expensive for what you got. Portions were a very good size but food was tasteless. Service was excellent. All the staff I encountered during the trip gave top notch service. We received a voicemail on each day of our stay wishing us a great stay and to call if we needed anything. We were in town for a wedding and needed suggestions to kill time during the day for our kid. Concierge gave great recommendations. Now, critiquing the room - furniture style was upper east side NYC. Sofa and matching chair in the room were very old. You could really see the age on those 2 pieces. Other chairs throughout looked more recent. Bed was comfortable. Lots of pillows. Flat screen tvs in bedroom and sitting room. While scrolling channels, I ran into 4 or 5 Arabic channels which I assume they had programmed in when the King of Saudi Arabia and his entourage were at the hotel in November. Breakfast at Oscar's was top notch. Had everything you could imagine. We ran into the housekeeper after breakfast and were able to hang out in the sitting room without feeling like we were in her way while she worked in the bathroom. She even vacuumed and I had not noticed anything highly visible so that was a big plus. The room, overall, felt very clean. Overall, my expectations were exceeded. I didn't have much cash on me but did leave the lady who upgraded us a tip. I found her at the check-in desk when I was leaving and was lucky enough to hand it to her personally. She seemed very appreciative. So basically, I think the lesson to learn here is if you feel your room does not meet your needs, call guest relations and they will do their best to accommodate you if they can and they do so with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Classic”
Reviews.Author: NoVaWahoo
Reviews.Content: Classic hotel. Difficult to navigate, hard to figure out where you are. My room was small and noisy, located immediately adjacent to the elevator shaft...could hear the elevators whizzing up and down all night. Staff was very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: heymattyg
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 1/18-1/19. It's just like walking into a movie. Everything is immaculately clean and the staff is professional without being pretentious. We had several meals catered by the hotel as our meetings took place on the 18th floor. The food was delicious. Even the sandwiches were excellent. How is that possible? The layout of the floors is a bit labyrinthine, but there are signs everywhere. The only gripe I have is that my TV remote was running low on batteries or something. Very difficult to change channels or anything, but it didn't really matter since I was either in meetings or out the entire time. I must also say the bedding is terrific. Slept like a baby. I wish I could rate it higher.

Reviews.Title: “A Dream Come True”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkBellita
Reviews.Content: Ever since I was a little girl, I dreamed about staying at The Waldorf Astoria. All of my expectations were met! Our room was lovely and quiet. I specifically asked for a room off the street so it would be quiet. We even overslept (we never do that!) one day. The only disappointment we had was that the famous Sunday brunch restaurant was not open during the summer. Beyond that...4 stars!

Reviews.Title: “We're glad we stayed at this famous hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulaScot
Reviews.Content: The hotel foyer was beautiful, well worth going to see. We felt safe and very comfortable in the hotel and our room. The room was great, but the corridor to it was bland and faded, as if they had removed everything, including the pictures, and forgot to put them back (or didn't care). Would definitely recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1168
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant one week stay at a two double bed one bedroom suite which accommodate 5 of us ( 2 adults & 3 teenagers). The room is luxurious and comfortable. The service is definitely 5 star. The lobby is glorious and grand. The gym is first class, it provides water, energy drinks and towel. The only down side is the breakfast queue is 15 minutes at the Starbuck almost every day. And there is nowhere to sit. You have to take it back to the room. The continental breakfast is only a muffin and a coffee(hot drink). Not quite worth the queue. A few blocks from subway which connects to all part of city. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GA.Familyof5
Reviews.Content: Went for a girls weekend. We completely enjoyed our 4 night stay. The hotel is absolutely beautiful. We stayed in a suite that was large and accommodating for the four of us. The rooms, like most in NYC hotels, are a bit dated, but were elegant and clean. The master bath and dressing are were large and covered in marble. The hotel is convenient to everything and we were able to walk most places. We enjoyed the shops, restaurant and lounge (bull and bear on Friday night was such fun!). One of the nicer hotels that I have visited.

Reviews.Title: “marvellous”
Reviews.Author: montob
Reviews.Content: All the staff were extremely helpful and it was an absolute pleasure to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Grotty”
Reviews.Author: Dottygirl2010
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a girly holiday in NYC after saving up to stay in a really nice hotel we were expecting to be wowed-it's the Waldorf after all?? Wrong the nicest part of this hotel is the lobby, which is impressive I'll give it that. The staff are rude and desperate not to talk to or help you. The corridors stunk of cigarette smoke which for a hotel with no smoking signs everywhere you'd think management would address. Our room wasn't cheap but it looked like it belonged in one of the lesser ranked hotels we have stayed in NYC in the past which were far nicer. Dated and tired decor, in dire need of new carpets and the bathroom stunk of sewage, no lights worked in the room which after I investigated with the light of my phone I discovered the lights had no bulbs in - why I don't know. After this we tried to ring reception but both the phones in the room didn't work so I went downstairs and was giving a filthy look by the bored receptionist who said someone may come that evening, they didn't so we gave up and went out. On our return the problem still hadnt been fixed I asked to be moved rooms which I was told I couldnt as they had no rooms equal to what we paid!? So using the tv for light we went to sleep and tried again in the morning. Pointless as nothing had happened until a passing maid had said she had lightbulbs and gave us them. The blinds in the room didn't open they just got longer. Honestly coming back the hotel every night was a chore, we couldn't wait to leave. On checkout the receptionist tried to charge $300 for the lights, phone and blinds. I think not so that caused and arguement. On trying to get a taxi back to JFK the bellman snatched my suitcase from my hand then had the cheek to ask for a tip for putting it in the cab!! Would I stay there again- no!! I'll be staying in the koreatown hotel next to Macy's again!

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: MarbleJac
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful, and the location couldn't be better. Service is outstanding as well. The rooms are small, as is the case with most historic hotels. However, the heating system is either on or off, so there is no adjustments to the room temperature, making it either too hot or too cold. According to staff, it is the same in the summer. At the price they charge, I think there are better hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “$8.00 tea”
Reviews.Author: JAR31
Reviews.Content: the hotel was nice and comfortable, clean and the staff was friendly BUT lunch in the Peacock Alley restaurant was $78.00 for two sandwiches and a hot tea, hot coffee and one coke. Ridiculous???????????

Reviews.Title: “First Class if you have the right room”
Reviews.Author: ronneedham
Reviews.Content: Good news is: Had a great suite this time (have stayed here probably a dozen times over the years) at a great rate. Got a Diamond Membership free upgrade so it was solid and first class and the people in the Diamond Room when you check in are first class. Hotel has "wow" factor when you enter, if you haven't been. Location is rock solid: easy walking distance to Rockefeller Center and mid-town attractions/restaurants (you can be in Times Square in around 10 minutes walking). Down side: charged for a few things in the mini bar after I left but the punchline is my Suite didn't have a mini-bar. So be aware. Either somebody is incented to say you did or they are padding their profits and assuming 90% of customer won't get around to pursuing to get it taken off the bill. Had a great stay but was pretty ticked off about the mini-bar thing. And it takes a lot to tick me off. Just an FYI. Otherwise, a great stay. (Parking is rich at $60 a night).

Reviews.Title: “Classy but outdated”
Reviews.Author: Daisy05
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in December 2010 with my mum for 5 days for a pre Christmas treat. After reading some of the reviews on here I was a bit worried. However on arrival we had no problems with check in and were in our room about 10 mins after arrival. The public areas of the hotel are very grand but I was disappointed in the size of our room and decor. We had upgraded but it was still very small and the the decor in general needs to be refurbished. Looked very dated and old. We were on 8th floor and found the traffic noisy at night so I recommend you ask for one of the higher floors. The staff were all polite and couldn't do enough to help. Breakfast in the hotel is very expensive so find somewhere cheaper outside. A great location for visiting the main tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelmaven1
Reviews.Content: This is a memorial, outstanding hotel. Its lobby is beautiful. The hotel strikes a perfect balance mixing the current liveliness of New York City with historical elegance.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf has extremely poor customer care”
Reviews.Author: MariaDelMedico
Reviews.Content: As you have not given me the courtesy of replying to my original email I have to now go elsewhere for my trip and will go out of my way to have no dealings with the Waldorf organisation again. Both personally and in my working career I shall actively outline my reasons to people to not use you and encourage them to go elsewhere. I am a student who saved up her money for 2 years in order to have a trip of a lifetime and you stole all of that from me. Being ignored by you has left an extremely bad taste that I have to move on from. I shall forget about how you treated me and stole my money. Promise that you will enjoy it! I worked very hard for that cash and knowing it has gone to a corpate bandit will give my indigestion, so I give it to you freely. Clearly, The Waldorf needs it so much more than me. The above email was sent to The Waldorf 8 Jan 2011. I was trapped in snow in Dec 2010 and managed to secure a refund from the airline and asked the Waldorf to change my booking to another day. They ignored my email requests and did not retunr my calls. Based upon this experience in dealing with The Waldorf I would not recommend them. I am planning a cheaper trip to New York for later in 2011 and will be staying in a much better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location good value”
Reviews.Author: abbyalt
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were upgraded to a small suite for an additional $89 a night. Our room ended up being $411 a night and that is a good deal in NYC. The location is great. An easy walk to shops and theatre. We had room service which was great but expensive. The hotel was beautiful and we felt like the service was good. The room was on the corner and looked out over Park Ave. The view was fabulous but there was a little bit of noise. I have stayed at many hotels over the years and although this may not be as luxurious as The Four Seasons- it sure beats it price wise. I'd rather pay less for the hotel and have more to shop with. The Waldorf was certainly nice enough!

Reviews.Title: “Is this really the famous Waldorf?”
Reviews.Author: thesuperstar
Reviews.Content: Overpriced, small room, holes in bathroom ceilings. Now, we booked our room via airline miles, so we estimated that it was the hotel's cut rate room. There are other rooms called the Towers, but my salary didn't get me in those doors. The bed was full size, which was cool when you were 13. Each room had its own Cisco wireless router in the room, but for $15/day charge, free WiFi in the lobby only. We didn't order room service, but a bottle of Tanqueray you can get for $20 at your local liquor store was $115. In the lobby bar, it was $15 for Captain & Coke, I'm used to $7. The staff was very friendly and attentive. If we do the math, the room was $411/night, we had a bigger room with a king bed at the Marriott airport for $199/night standard rate. I can only guess the high rate was for the location, which was Fabulous, center of Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping in a museum, comfortable but disconcerting...”
Reviews.Author: MitchLions
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria has a grand reputation among hotels; the name evokes images of classic luxury and old fashioned service. The hotel could be something truly spectacular by living up to this, but instead it seems to be trading on past glories. The Waldorf Astoria is a New York landmark, and iconic hotel, and there are elements here which are really special. The foyer, lobby and lifts are stunning examples of art deco design, so grand they warrant a visit themselves. The Bull & Bear bar is also a real gem; sitting at the bar sipping cocktails you really feel like you're touching a piece of New York History. There is also nothing wrong with the quality of rooms; beds are comfortable, showers powerful and thick walls provide peace and quiet. However this whole experience is just not what you would expect from a top end hotel like the Waldorf Astoria. First and foremost the decor beyond the lobby is horrendous. I'm not sure when (if ever?) clashing florals were fashionable, but they make the rooms and hallways look tired and shabby. Service is brusque and procedural and not set up to deal with modern issues, such as wifi not working. Plus there is the bizarre decision to put a Starbucks just inside the entrance, to add an extra breakfast outlet. Truly incongruous. I strongly recommend a visit to the Waldorf Astoria, it's an iconic piece of New York history, but this does not mean you have to stay there! Anyone is free to stroll through the foyer, soak up the art deco designs and drop down to the Bull & Bear bar for a drink, before heading back to one of NYC's more stylish, comfortable and friendly hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service Does not Match Reputation”
Reviews.Content: We expected to experience a world-class service in this hotel, but were disappointed. The rooms were small and carpet looks very dirty. The bathroom shower faucet handle was very hard to figure out. It's very easy to get into scorching hot water with just one small turn. There was a sloping threshold between the bathroom and the room, and we all slipped on it, and felt it was very dangerous. In the morning, when the maids cleaned the room, they did not replace half used shampoo, or cotton balls, or bathroom items. I had better service in a Wingate hotel in Iowa than this. When we ordered some drinks at the bar in the lobby, we were told that we could not site there, because they needed the tables for dinner guests. So we had to walk around the lobby with wine glasses. Very strange!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION BUT NEEDS TO BE UPDATED QUICKLY”
Reviews.Author: jmr74
Reviews.Content: The location is outstanding and the entrance from Park ave. is very nice as is the lobby but it needs to be updated. The standard rooms aren't very big and some have updated bathrooms which is nice. Ask for a room with an updated bathroom. You will hear sirens and horns all day and all night but you'll hear that anywhere in NYC. By the way, we were on the 9th floor so maybe you don't hear that on higher floors??? The suites are nice in the towers but the towers are more expensive and a little more private. The Sunday brunch will run you 95 bucks a person, it looked good but that is a little pricey I think and it's displayed in their lobby. Drinks at the bar will run 21.00 a pop and a bottle of beer was 9.00, I guess if you can afford to stay here you can afford to drink here. I suggest you find a pub or bar nearby. I would stay here for a night or two to say that I have stayed there and that is it.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: daut_travler
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Woldorf. Everyone there dressed amazing and was a great place to stay around Christmas / New Years. We were upgrade from a mini suite to a full suite (for free) and very happy with the room. We were not happy that we requested a role away be at 4:00 PM, and we didn't get it until 12:30 AM after I called downstairs probably 7 times. I eventually told the women I was not going to get off the phone with her until my bed arrived at the door. I look past this incident because of the overall ambience of this hotel and dare I say... value. As long as you don't spend much money in the hotel bar or restaurants the overall stay is affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Why is it so hard to get rooms ready?”
Reviews.Author: JJWLW
Reviews.Content: Have been waiting at and around front desk for more than an hour, as the hotel keeps predicting (wrongly) when my room will be ready. What's so hard about being honest with guests, so they don't waste their afternoon sitting around the hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated reputation and poor service”
Reviews.Author: HannLyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the Christmas period and while the lobbies were very pretty, the room was average and the service was totally lacking: - when we arrived, from the street till check -in at the reception there was not a single offer of help with our luggage and we actually lugged them to our room - even though we arrived in the evening and there weren't many people checking in or out, we had to wait. - in the room we found that there were no slippers so we had to ring housekeeping 3 times (and put on hold for 10 mins twice) before someone actually spoke to us. then we had to wait another 30mins before someone brought them up. The cleanliness of the bathroom was not great-there were stains in the toilet bowl. Also the contrast between the interior of the hotel and the storage rooms (for towels etc) was stark. This may be the case for all hotels but a couple of storage rooms were left open on our way to the room and it made me feel that the towels might not be that clean if they were kept in such conditions. Overall I felt that this hotel is relying on its reputation from different days and it would be better to choose a more modern hotel with better service..

Reviews.Title: “The Waldorf is not what it once was”
Reviews.Author: Tainc
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria has turned into a typical Hilton Hotel and not a very good one at that. I travel extensively for business and pleasure and have stayed in hotels all over the country from the Ritl Carltons to Best Wesferns. The mark of a good hotel is not just doing the big things well but also the little things. A hotel with the revered name of Waldorf=Astoria should do everything well. They shouldn't miss items on your room service menu not once but twice. They shouldn't forget to vacuum the floor, leaving visible crumbs on the floor. The business center shouldn't be unusable for a full day. You shouldn't have to wait 30 minutes for your car and get the wrong one! This hotel is trading on it's past glory. I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Service and accomodation outstanding in every way!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dorothy459
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Aster Suite for Christmas and were a little worried by some previous reviews of this hotel. Don't worry, everything about this hotel is top notch, from the courteous checkin, the charming housekeeper who couldn't do enough for us. We ordered room service twice, once on Christmas morning. The first time our food arrived in 15 minutes, we thought it was luck. However Christmas morning our breakfast arrived again quickly, this time it took only 14 minutes. I timed the waiter. The location is so central and the icing on the cake....we got delayed three extra days due to big snow storm, and found wine and cheese in our room from the hotel. THANK YOU FOR A WONDERFUL HOLIDAY

Reviews.Title: “big corporate hotel with cheap sales approaches”
Reviews.Author: Sam7506
Reviews.Content: Having spent 4 nights in a small hotel uptown in Manhattan, the 2 night "luxury treat" at the Waldorf should have been the highlight of our x-mas trip. But it was more of a let-down. There is nothing romantic, friendly, warm, or exciting about it, but the name. So the location is great. no doubt about it. The staff (except for one lady whose role was hard to define - but she seemed like an "angel in the lobby - mrs fix-it-all" - she was brilliant) was very! ordinary. That started with a very rigid and partially even rude process of getting our reservation done. the check-in was more like standing in line at the post office - is this really 5 stars?? the level of friendliness is minimal and the doorman rudely ask for tip. Now, we travel between 8-10 times on leisure per year, and tipping in different countries is no stranger to us. Yet, asking for is so bluntly, whilst he didn't even hail down the cab for us (we had to do that ourselves) is just not what you'd expect of "The Waldorf" - in the end, I have to say, it's just another very ordinary Hilton hotel - not worth the money they take of you. The A/C in the room is hard to manage and totally outdated, the rooms are big & spacious - that was nice. Breakfast in the Lobby Restaurant was very ordinary and service was slow. The hostess seems to float on a cloud of Ego....not sure she understands service quality and that the guest actually pays her salary. The 2nd breakfast option was literally laughable....it's a cheap-charly buffet version that you'd expect in a 3-star hotel; Compared to other 5-star hotel breakfasts, this was a disappointment and we opted to not eat in the hotel at all for the rest of our stay. The bar is fairly nice & barmen seem to know what they are doing. The best part however was the super-cheap approach by "Ms sales woman" as my husband was waiting for me. Her smile didn't stop as she tried to sell!!! right after our arrival, some Hilton Card. - You'd expect that on a bazar in Morroco, but certainly not in the lobby of a 5-star hotel. Very cheap approach. The washrooms in the public areas are guarded by staff which is super unfriendly and rude. Obviously the hotel is used 50% as a tourist attraction and there is no security or anyone that would allow the guest a bit of privacy. It's an "all walk in, walk around, hang around in the lobby" feeling. - A smaller hotel gives you more the feeling of a welcome guest, than this corporate institution. Hindsight - it'd been worthwhile paying a bit more on the anyways exorbitant price and stay at the Plaza. Or just remain at our lovely "On The Ave" Hotel in Uptown, which was beating the meant-to-be special treat by far in all aspects. - Hilton....if that's one of your flagships, you might want to check your staff training & kick it up a notch!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful public areas, but the rooms are lacking.”
Reviews.Author: caddoboy
Reviews.Content: First, both my wife and I are Hilton Honors Diamond level and we used points to book the room and paid a nominal amount ($50 per night) for the upgrade. Our first room was horrible - small Jr Suite, very disjointed, view of a brick wall, and single sink in the bath. Went back downstairs and they moved us to a suite which was better, but have to admit I was expecting a higher level of quality from this hotel. That said, the staff was very attentive and polite. We visited to of the louge/bars during the stay and the service was good as were the drinks. The hotel provided vouchers for the Starbucks on the lower level. Went there one day and did not go back as the attitude of the staff was typical of NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Lobby, Snobby Staff, Needs Rennovation!”
Reviews.Author: Echar
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Honors Diamond member, we have spent years staying loyal to the brand, spending tens of thousands of dollars on stays. We are used to upgrades, and being treated really well as loyal guests of the Hilton chain. This came to a halting stop at the Waldorf Astoria. Yes, the lobby is grand, beautiful, festive, historic...etc. The staff, however, is incredibly rude, nonchalant, and cannot be bothered by the lowly like of those who would have the audacity to pay a *gasp* advanced purchase rate. You'd think a hotel would appreciate the fact that a guest would pay 100% up front, ensuring they will have that room sold, but instead, at check-in we were met with this exact phrase, "I see you are a diamond member, but since you paid the advanced purchase rate, you will have to use Starbucks coupons for breakfast." Now, I know that a Starbucks coupon is appealing to 99% of the population, but when you are used to full hot breakfast, and they are parading people past the most extravagant buffet you've ever seen, it is a slap in the face to offer someone a cup of coffee and a doughnut that I couldn't even use because of food allergies. The line alone at Starbucks (sometimes 45 minute wait) makes this more of a punishment that a perk. We inquired about an upgrade, but were also informed that "Europeans are willing to pay for the suites around Christmas, so they wouldn't be available." Why even say that? Just state that they are unavailable. Why say you are "upgrading us to a nice superior room," when that is exactly what we paid for? The whole check-in process was condescending, rude, and was set up to make the guests feel defeated...guess I should have packed the fur coat. Once we finished the check in, we went up to our room, which was nice enough. There was the weirdest plug-in fireplace thing from I would guess the 1960's. The wall paper is pealing everywhere, the room was musty, and there was dust...a lot of dust. The beds were great. The soaps and lotions smelled great. Housekeeping was fabulous. The honking and sirens 24/7 kept some of us awake at night. We were on the 15th floor, and it was very loud! Our room was cold...very cold, even when the heat was turned up to 75, the heater just blew cold air and the windows are not insulated. The room service charges are insane (a cheese pizza would cost $55 after all of the fees, service charges, and taxes), so we passed it up. We were here during the blizzard, everything was closed, and we were starving, and Peacock Alley wouldn't even let us order Creme Brulee and take it up to our room. All in all, this hotel is a Hilton hotel in need up serious TLC. The historic feel is great, but I have been in many historic venues that weren't run down, and there is a huge difference between the two. The name is not worth the $350 a night, and we will more than likely stay elsewhere for the following Christmas'.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect New York feeling”
Reviews.Author: Sari-Saurus
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a week and loved it. Beds were fantastic - and great pillows. Room was spacious with a big flat screen TV. I see many compaining about old bathrooms.... why? They were beautiful - graciously old - but everhthing functioned - clean and lovely soaps. I really dont mind some old cracks on the wall - come to Europe and you will find lots of them.. :-))) We could see the morning sun rising from our window witch was really nice as we drank great Starbucks coffee in bed. ( Starbucks in the lobby ). Safes were guarded by this fabolously nice lady and there was a possibility to checkin your flights and print boarding tickets next to the safes. The ball rooms were something .... straight out of the movies! It was one of the nicest hotel stays Ive had. Will go again - I hope!

Reviews.Title: “Seriously under staffed and inconsistent service for what they proclaim to be and one would expect given their rates...”
Reviews.Author: Jason334
Reviews.Content: I do not write this review to compalin but rather express my experience as a Hilton Gold guest at this hotel. The hotel itself is quite beautiful, you cannot dispute that. The lobby is festive and quite a place to take a picture. You almost might feel as though you are on the Titanic it is that nice. The entire check-in process is a production but when I say this I am one would think it is like a bad broadway play. It took over 20 minutes to get situated valeting the car and giving the bell captain our bags. It was chaos and disorganized. After that, it took over 25 minutes to check in at the front desk. There is not really a section alerting guests where to form a line, the process is slow and reception is understaffed. Once checked in, it took an additional 40 minutes to get our bags, a far cry from the 15 minutes promised. Don't over promise and under deliver especially when on a schedule... Our initial room was small (as can be expected) and had a nice bathroom. They do not use a/c in the winter but will open the window. Nobody ever came to open the window. When we called back, someone then brought us a fan. Our fan did not work. Our desk sparked electrical outlets sparked, shutting down power to that entire portion of the room which included the internet, lamp. This over plugged outlet was on top of a fancy drapery.
