Given the above all building up within the first 2 hours of our stay, aggrevation began to sit in and this resulted in a room change and upgrade. We started to bring our bags up to the room ourselve rather then wait an additional 30 minutes for someone to come help. The upgraded room was much larger with a private changing room and larger bathroom with barrel ceiling on the corner. I could not complain about the room as it was beautiful and in line with expectations one would have for the Waldorf. We did not utilize some of the hotel's features given we were sightseeing in NYC often. The housekeeping staff refused to come into the room and was discourteous to us and just laughed in another language to our co-worker. The hotel bar service was quite good and packed with interesting characters. The drinks were good. My advice, do not use Hilton Honor points in conjunction with a paying stay. They cannot seem to link reservations properly, our cards did not work after the first night and we never received an itemized bill. On our check out date we actually received a blank bill which did not even provide charges from previous night or an overview of the charged incurred for items such as room service. I am dreading going back to reception to finalize my bill as a broadway show is amazing, just not at the Waldorf. At this level and based on their boutique pricing, whether or not you get a deal or not, if your goal is to have a seamless hassle-free experience in a historic well known hotel, I'd recommend staying at the Plaza Hotel and or trying one of the many other boutique hotels in NYC. Would I give the hotel a second chance? Perhaps but only if it were not on my dime or some amazing deal came around... But in NY, time is money and wasted time with extra headaches costs money. I would rather stay at a standard Hilton, take my chances and save money and at least get consistent service and less headaches. Overall, I have found service to be more delightful at Hilton's Anatole in Dallas, Hilton's Research Triangle "Mansion on the Hill" or even a random Hampton Inn on the side of an interstate. You can always take your picture in the beautiful lobby. Some of the staff we encountered gave 110%, others however, you would think they hated their jobs and were giving 50% at best. Nonetheless, the average of the two and our experience is not worthy of 5 stars, perhaps something more in the neighborhood of 3.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Glamorous and fabulous. Loved every bit of it”
Reviews.Author: Lizziecanada
Reviews.Content: If you love glamour and all things fabulous this is the hotel for you. I went here with a group of girlfriends and we had a lovely time. There is something so magical about the hotel, you feel like your in a movie in the evening you see parties people for dinne all dresses up just like something out of a hollywood movie. During our stay we witnesses the most incredible wedding which was taking place in the hotel it was breathtaking. The location was perfect walking distance to most places, great room service and friendly conceirge staff who booked us into all the nice restaurants, bars etc. Comfy rooms, theres even a starbucks in the hotel for your morning latte just at your leaving. Cant wait to visit New York again will be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect New York Holiday Experience”
Reviews.Author: soberesident
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Waldorf = Astoria for a long weekend in mid-December. It was wonderful! The hotel is beautiful and the service is world class. Although our room was one of the "small" ones, it was still a decent size for a city hotel. Big windows, comfy bed, and very quiet. It did not have a room safe, which is something I now expect everywhere. The temperature control for the shower was either hot or cold, no in between. The hotel bars were very nice and, for NYC, the drinks were moderately priced. Room service is expensive, but there is a Starbucks on property and plenty of restaurants nearby. If you are looking for an elegant experience, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Fun time at historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomcatxiv
Reviews.Content: Took a quick trip to NYC and decided that since we were going to be spending quite a bit for a hotel, we might as well splurge and stay at the Waldorf=Astoria. Flew into LGA and took the M60 bus to the N and finally the 6 trains that dropped us one block from the front door. Amazing lobby and it was fun imagining all of the upper echelon of society walking through those very doors in previous times. Check-in time was minimal and were able to upgrade from a deluxe room to a superior. Room was average for $300/night, but had a renovated bathroom that made things nicer. The only drawback was the heating/air was too warm the first night, so their fix was to just open the window a crack (during a 20*F night), rather than actually fix the problem. Of course, I don't know if it was fixable in such a short time, so it was certainly tolerable, but we would have preferred them to spend a little more time looking at options. Great location on Park Avenue. We opted to eat outside of the hotel so I can't comment on the in-house restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else where your reservation won't get canceled”
Reviews.Author: jjfad
Reviews.Content: Traveled from San Francisco to visit my grandmother who was in the hospital after having a heart attack. When I arrived at Waldorf, I was told by an extremely rude and unsympathetic manager that my room was no longer available. Instead, I was sent over to another hotel. Thanks for the second-class hotel, but no thanks for the rude service. I made a reservation at the Waldorf and I expected that it would be honored. Nope, too bad. Actually, there was a New York Times story about why I (and many, many others) got bumped: Turns out the Saudi Arabian King Abdullah was in town and the Waldorf bumped us all to make room. http://www.nytimes.com/2010/12/14/business/14road.html Well, I guess if you are a manager making a cost-benefit calculation, you may as well bump the riff raff to get on King Abdullah's good side. It'll only cost you 20 negative reviews (out of thousands) on TripAdvisor. Even though this negative review will strike only a weak blow for justice in this world, I feel compelled to post it anyway. Take that, Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel but bathrooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: Sheadz
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, the lobby is breath taking!!! The room was very spacious for a New York City hotel. Very clean. The bathrooms were the only let down... They are in desperate need of a referb!!!!! The location is fab... A ten minute walk from Times Square and away from the big crowds. The staff were great! Especially the maid service!!!! Would I stay here again? Probably not but only because I would want to experience a different hotel, not because there was anything wrong with this one. Overpriced....??? I would say yes BUT there is something very special about saying you stayed at 'The Waldorf' :)

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here and pay this much it is not worthed.”
Reviews.Author: birdeyes68
Reviews.Content: Long line to check in, we wasted most of our day to check in and get our room because they did not have it ready, or has given it to another person. Our luggage was damaged , elevator was not stopping at our floor all day till we complained. I had to walk down the steps with a very bad hip. Internet connection cost you and then it dose not work. Tub was not draining and the maintenance man said this is all we can do, wasted most of the second day till we could take a shower and get out. Robs smelled disgusting. We were in the room when our room was only vacumed and not dusted, that was their cleaning. Blanket seemed like it was bought from goodwill, we ordered room service and the table cloths was bought from goodwill and starched, lots of holes in it.. The only 2 places you can eat is extremely expensive. Martini was $20 and a cup of soup for $18. Looby is atractive but when you look closer the furniture are in bad shape. we are Hilton club member, and this hotel bring shame to the name of Hilton. There are much nicer places to stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend at the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: PlainGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband & I enjoyed a weekend stay at the Waldorf Astoria during the holidays. I'm so grateful that we'll always share this wonderful memory. The service was impeccable and very friendly. Our room was spotless and touched up throughout the day. The food at Oscar's and the martini's at Peacock Alley were delicious! We took the tour on Saturday morning and the history of this grand hotel transported me to another, more elegant era. To paraphrase Jack Nicholson, it made me want to be a better-dressed person ;-)

Reviews.Title: “could not be better”
Reviews.Author: DanDob
Reviews.Content: try the brunch there, that's so amazing! the rooms are a bit old but perfect for a romantic weekend in NYC everything is nearby staff very professional we will come back

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: bonitasue
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to stay at the Waldorf. Although I had reservations at another hotel, I went into the WA lobby to inquire about a room. It was as if I was invisible. No one and I mean no one gave me any attention. The desk clerk was so snooty. I was wearing a casual, dressy outfit, so I wondered if that was it? Black capri pants with a long top and flats. She treated me as if I crawl out from under a rock. I explained that I had always wanted to stay at the hotel and that I would like a room for the night but I wanted to see it first. Well, that didn't happen. I was told to step aside so she could wait on a customer that had a reservation. I left feeling very abused and embarrassed. So much for customer service. What a huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Attn Hilton: Either upgrade or sell”
Reviews.Author: travelbh
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel have rickety furniture, heater/ac fans that don't work, and TV Clickers that are from the last century. No bargains on rates either. We had a one bedroom suite. There is probably someone in the world who would love to own this hotel and spend the money to really upgrade the rooms to the 4 star hotel this should be.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water, poor in house dining”
Reviews.Author: steakman55
Reviews.Content: Okay. I know some hotel shower faucets are confusing, but I am not stupid. First day could get no hot water in shower, no matter how I turned the knob. Thought it a little unusual but washed off in the sink. Next day no hot water in shower. Called to complain. Said there were no other complaints. They asked how long I let it run. I let it run 30 minutes while waiting for someone to come up and check it out. Finally had to wash off again in sink and head to airport. So, no shower in NYC for two days. Staff downstairs promised to look into it; have not heard back in a week. $6 diet Coke from mini bar resulted in a room charge of $508. Yes, five hundred eight dollars and still trying to get this resolved. Breakfast on a Saturday morning limited to an expensive buffet. PS, the Sunday buffet is $95. Is this the definition of a luxury hotel? Or perhaps the result of a private equity owner milking it for all its worth.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Grande Dame”
Reviews.Author: MichaelT3412
Reviews.Content: Good location convenient to Roc Center, 5th Ave but not Times Sq. Beautiful architecture but very tired furnishings. Lobby was a sight but some armchairs were threadbare - not what one would expect. Public area size didn't seem large enough. Service was befitting the standard of the hotel; bar was expensive - $31 for domestic beer and (dirty) martini; before tip. Food was exceptional. King upgraded room was good size; bathroom was small. 3x3 shower with good ventilation, small and shallow vanity. Reception touted the bath as renovated but that was years ago. Outdated furnishings darkened room with no view and included heavy draperies, old carpet and chair. Bed/pillows on the king were exceptional. Overall, she's an old, charming hotel beyond overdue for an update. Diamond upgrade was room, 2 drinks in bar and coffee/juice and pastry at hotel Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a gut renovation, but historic!”
Reviews.Author: ReliableReviews7
Reviews.Content: Overall, a quality place to stay if you get a deal. If you are payign there exorbant rpices, then there are much better options like the Standard Hotel, the Gramercy Park Hotel, or the Soho Grand, all of which are much mroe Modern and do not desperatly need a remodle.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf - AVOID”
Reviews.Author: zooid
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Waldorf was very poor indeed and I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Nothing was done about any of my complaints during my stay, apart from being inconveniently moved to another room, to no purpose. The manager assured me that he would write to me. He never did. I therefore decided to forward my list of complaints to the Hilton Group - three times. They also have ignored the complaints, despite initial assuring me of their attention. I could enumerate the staggering list of incompetence, poor service and, well, danger, but it's much better that simply tell you that turned down their offer of a free luxury suite for a return visit - I'd rather pay to be somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected....The only classy thing about this hotel is the lobby”
Reviews.Author: nrw34260
Reviews.Content: We booked and paid for this hotel in August. We even had a confirmation from Eric. E Long the General Manager on the 9th November. When we arrived in the evening of 23rd November at 7:30 after a long trip we were told that we did not have a room as a corporate client had decided to extend his stay and took over 90% of the rooms. I went ballistic and told them that I had a CONFIRMED booking. They offered to transfer us to the Marriot Marquise and reinburse us 1 night. I said it was not good enough, eventually after a long argument my wife said we should take the deal, but I said I also want a free meal out of them, which I got. We were then asked to follow someone to a waiting "Limo" to take us to the Marquise, and I was expected to carry my own bags, whoa, all stop, I am not going to carry my bags, get someone to it. Eventually there was a porter. We were then driven to the Marquise and the driver told us it was the King of Saudi Arabia who had taken our rooms. We did not realise that the Marquise was located in Times Square. Hold on, this is not the type of area we want to stay in, so we got the driver to take us back to the Waldorf. I then told them on the desk that we wanted a room, we had paid for one and we had a confirmation and we were not going anywhere else. The clerk then went into a back room and after a few minutes she came back and said they had one. Why did we go through this charade if they had a room after all? The room was very average and in need of a refurb, not what I expect in a 5star hotel, the toilet in the bathroom looked like it needed a good clean. There was no way of turning the heating off and it got too hot and had to sleep with the window open. The bed was comfortable and the room was adequate, but not 5star. We were woken the next morning at 9am by the sounds of hammer drills in the hotel. We took advantage of the free meal in the Bull and Bear which was very nice, the Maitre D was very good but the waiters were VERY average, my wife had her plate removed before she had finished. The meal was overpriced but we were not paying for it. We were waiting by the entrance to leave one day any 2 doormen were having a shouting match in which one was moaning he had been "shafted". NOT what I expect to hear in a suposedly top class hotel. On checking out we were hit with over $100 in taxes on top of what we paid for 3 nights stay. All in all, not a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “NO LONGER A LUXURY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: juandia23
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a 4 night stay at The Waldorf Astoria. It was probably the most disappointed i have ever been in a hotel ever! The lobby really is the only grand thing about this hotel. The rooms have seen better days, the staff are very poor lacking basic information and curtesy. Our first room had no heating and when it is minus 5 outside this is a problem - shame the reception did not see it that way -they eventually gave us a really poor heater that did not work most of the time - then the window fell down in the bathroom and being on the 16th floor in freezing conditions this was awful - after one night of that we were moved to a smaller room! The restaurants were very overpriced even by new york prices and the staff really do need a lesson on service. All in all i would really like to warn anyone thinking of staying there not to. It is expensive and trading on being a luxury hotel and it most certainly is not!

Reviews.Title: “nightmare in new york”
Reviews.Author: cstorment
Reviews.Content: My husband and daughter traveled from Oregon to New York to visit our son, who is in school on the east coast for Thanksgiving. When we got to the Waldorf Astoria we were informed that our room was not available due to a large party that extended their stay. We were not informed of this prior to arriving. They offered to set us up in a similar hotel for one night only. The manager was very rude, and was not sympathetic toward our situation. Many other guests were also effected. They offered to help us find a cab to our new hotel; not even offering to drive us there. The new hotel was not as "nice", however, the staff was fabulous. We will never stay in a Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “WORST ROOM I ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: jjwaskitty
Reviews.Content: It was bad and the staff doesn't get it or care. I went to NYC to get a way with my husband with a group of other couples. We had a tough day traveling and arrived to long check in lines. The room on a low floor was supposed to be Superior. We asked for a new room as ours was too small- we are talking really really small. The closet measured 18-20 across and our mini bar was not working-- they knew this as it was also empty, The furnishings fabrics and carpet were completly worn out. It took several phone calls and 1 1/2 hours to get to the supervisor who said she could do nothing for us... she said we were staying in the biggest room they had which we knew to be untrue. She suggested that something may open up and that we should get a call in the morning and be packed and ready to move rooms at 2pm. I didn't relish the thought of coming back to the hotel to make the room switch as we wanted to see NYC. The bell hop arived at 6pm to move us but we were already showering to be on ime for our dinner plans.We realize after the fact that the WA has given up entirely. Our concerns are probably the same ones they hear daily so why bother with us? If you want to get out into the crazy hustle and bustle of NYC and then return to a room to be comfortable and a little pampered they this is NOT the place for you. I found it depressing!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice but no longer the Grande Dame”
Reviews.Author: MysticKid
Reviews.Content: Stayed here w/ my wife on a business incentive trip and while we really had a great time in NYC the Waldorf is very good but certainly off it's greatness. Public areas are still beautiful and they carry the luxury brand very well. Restaurants (and we ate at all of them w/ vouchers) were OK at best and incredibly pricey even for NYC. Peacock Alley had a shockingly slim lunch menu and when they charged us $8 for a cup of coffee and$8 tea and a water surcharge of $3, it was too much. Go elsewhere. Bull and Bear was good but way overpriced. Bar included lots of older men wearing black tie and it was a very boring crowd. We thought the staff including the front desk people were great, well-trained and helpful at all times.We relaxed in various lounges @ the main public areas and it was as comfortable a hangout as I have seen in many years of hotels. The room was not large but very well appointed w/ great luxury touches on the sundries. TV was a big flat screen and was terrific. Room heat was amazingly dry but we turned off the heat and on a very cold weekend in NYC, we were warm the whole time. A really good time at the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, tacky room”
Reviews.Author: Maize75
Reviews.Content: I was shocked, I am a Hilton Diamond member and travel consistantly with Hilton. This was may first stay at the Waldorf and somehow I expected it to be nice. The check in staff was short, the lobby is beautiful, bar is nice but very pricey. When we walked to our room we were disappointed at the chipping paint and worn carpet in the hallways. The room itself was VERY SMALL, I would hate to see their average room. The bed was good, the usual Hilton quality. I did check for beg bugs and found none but when I moved the nightstand there was significant debris such as sunflower seeds and other food bits left by previous tenants. Flat screen TV but the bathroom had NO VANITY, just a wash bowl and it was SMALL and did not drain. My husband and I struggled to spend 2 nights there and were really glad to say goodbye to the Waldorf. Next time we will try another place.

Reviews.Title: “Suprise Stay - Beautiful old hotel - expensive but worth it!”
Reviews.Author: murzd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf from last Thursday until yesterday! I had thought that i was staying at another hotel but had been suprised when my boyfriend booked this hotel as a suprise!! On arrival at the hotel i was amazed at the luxury of the hotel foyer! Gave a brilliant impression! We were given a corner room suite. I was a bit nervous due to stories of bedbugs but i searched through the room but thankfully did not see anything or have any bites. The bed was complete luxury and so comfortable. A big TV , lovely lockers and tables and plenty of hanging space...had a mini walk in wardrobe too. The downside was that there was an adjoining door to the next room even though locked made noise travel a bit further especially if you have an annoying woman screaming over her shopping experiences!! the bathroom was lovely.. I did find that the bath was not cleaned down properly on arrival but it was cleaned twice a day and towels were changed twice a day for our entire stay. My boyfriend proposed in NY and the hotel helped him so much...they had a love heart from rose petals on the bed...put rose petals on the floor and a huge bouquet of roses. they also put all my clothes for the night out on the bed waiting for me...champagne and chocolate covered roses and champagne also!! Brilliant! The bar in the room is quite expensive! $6 for a Coke and $9 for a bottle of water.... to order water to the room was $21. The bar downstairs was also quite expensive $45 for 3 cocktails!! However all in all loved the hotel and service if you don't mind the expense!! It is a dated hotel from an electrical and furniture point of view but it is a hotel steeped in celebrity history!!

Reviews.Title: “The Waldorf uninvited us”
Reviews.Author: Grammylindy
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Waldorf Astoria in New York every November for about 30 years, we planned a special Thanksgiving trip with our children and grandchildren. We reserved several Waldorf suites and a few additional rooms last July. On the day we were departing for New York, we called the hotel to cancel one of the rooms, after my mother decided not to go on the trip. My husband was put "on hold" for a long time; then a Waldorf manager came on to tell him we no longer had rooms at the hotel. A large party, he said, had extended their stay. We would not be accommodated; for us, there were No Rooms At The Inn. We were effectively kicked out, after planning and looking forward to this week at the Waldorf for months. No amount of reasoning with them helped. We asked them to re-check our history with the hotel - we had actually just been there a week-and-a-half earlier. We are seasoned travelers and had never, ever, been treated like this anywhere in the world. So we wondered: Were they being up-front with us? Did a group really extend? Or were the bedbugs we'd been hearing about taking over a hotel wing? Was Obama visiting? Prince Charles? Had they read my new parenting book (I'm an author) and not liked it? We were mystified. They made arrangements for us to stay at their sister hotel: the New York Hilton. They offered to pay for a night (we negotiated a few more) but it was just not the same. The Hilton - adequate though it is, is more than a few steps down in quality from the Waldorf. What's more, the hotel gave us virtually no notice. Remember - we'd phoned them. They clearly were not planning to spring this news upon us until we checked in, very late at night, with young children in tow. Where was their ethics? Their loyalty? Their revered style and service? And why have we not heard from them since? Somewhere, the Hilton family is weeping (Paris excluded). Maybe one day, we will find out the true reason for this egregious exile. Until then, we'll be searching for a new, more welcoming hotel in the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Money talks - especially when foreign dignitaries are involved”
Reviews.Author: ValnHouston
Reviews.Content: I had a reservation for over 6 weeks - my dream to stay at the Waldorf and see the Thanksgiving Day parade in person. Apparently a Saudi prince paying a lot more money than I was paying persuaded management to choose to keep him in their hotel over me. There was not an apology or any type of sorrow when we tried to check in. The lady behind the counter said," A delegation has stayed longer than expected originally and we're putting you up at the Hilton." No apology, no compassion, no nothing....just "Did you check in luggage and where is the tag so we can have it pulled and we're sending you by limo over to the Hilton." The limo is actually an Escalade, so that wasn't true either. The delegation was a prince with 200 armed men with him, or so we heard (from a reliable source). I was VERY disappointed that our reservation didn't mean anything when big money comes to the big apple. After all, we were only two people who didn't pay 30 million to stay there like the "delegation" did. Bah Humbug!!!!! My father had stayed there on business years ago and said even then it was "past its prime", so maybe we didn't miss out after all. Stayed at the New york Palace years ago and absolutely loved it - will be returning there from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated, over-priced, poor room qualities and facilities compared to a UK 5 star”
Reviews.Author: jeremymangu
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this from the hotel where we've spent 3 nights, one night in a suite earlier in the week, two nights in a luxury king. Lovely lobby, great location, iconic and all that. But the rooms are past their best (torn upholstery in both rooms, cables dangling from wall by TV, very dated rooms, bathrooms look like a 3 star. We're glad we came, but wouldn't come back as if you compare it to a Malmaison in the UK in terms of room amenities - well, there's no comparison. Watch them on the prices too - I mean, we chose to book here and knew if would be expensive, but there's an element of gouging going on. Order a pot of coffee from room service - $13 - not too bad. But they will add $5.25 cover charge per person per room, so the coffee jumps to $23.50. Then they will add a 15% service charge - so that cup of coffee each is now $27 or so. This must by why the Starbucks in the hotel lobby is so expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel screaming refurb”
Reviews.Author: SohanTanna
Reviews.Content: The hotel enterance and lobby is VERY grand, but once you actually get to the rooms it is VERY dated and parts of the rooms fittings are broken / moldy / dirty. The check in desk towards the evening is undermanned and overcrowded with guests. I noticed staff standing around behind the counter, just looking - but not serving which was VERY annoying. The hotel is screaming for a refurb, however the rooms are VERY big and spacy. They are pretty dark too, with a lack of lighting. The hotel's fitness center is very nice, with friendly staff. Luckily I had some hilton status, and got it for free otherwise it's $15/pp/day which is too much for the offerings imo. They offer free water (bottle and dispenser) / towels and all the machines have TVs. The rooms minibar is priced crazily, and doesn't have much variety. Both the fridges in the room were badly damaged, with the front covers ripped off and never fixed. The bathroom was big, but 2/3 shower heads were broke and the entire bathroom smelt of mold/damp and was very dark. The aircon was pretty weak and the windows were very tough to open and heavy. Despite all this, the value of the hotel is INSANE for New York. The staff are great, the bar / resteraunt in the hotel was good and the amount of space in the rooms was great. I would probably return, but probably to the Towers next time if available until the W=A does some sort of refurb.

Reviews.Title: “Still good but could be great”
Reviews.Author: LearnedFriend
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay at this hotel. I had previously stayed there with my mum in Feb 06 and was keen to see if the place had changed at all. First, the location of this hotel cannot be beaten if you are looking to be within walking distance of shops, good restaurants and many of the sights. The subway on Lex and 51st will get you to places further afield. Second, all of the staff that we interacted with were very helpful, courteous and friendly - particularly the lady who manned the safety deposit boxes. Third, this is a lovely traditional grand hotel with a jaw-dropping lobby and reception to die for (even the ladies toilets are grand!). Plus, the rooms are large! We would return to the Waldorf and may well do so on our next trip to NY. It's a good hotel, but a few tweaks would make it a great hotel. Some minor grumbles below. When we arrived, it was very busy (rush hour too, it took about 2 hours to get from JFK in the cab). Owing to the traffic, the cab driver dropped us at the front entrance rather than entering through the designated entrance for cars and cabs. Fortunately as we only had 1 case between us, this wasn't a problem, but if we had been travelling with more luggage, we would have struggled to get it through the revolving doors and then up the stairs and into the lobby. Of course, this wasn't the fault of the hotel, but I fail to see why they cannot have somebody on hand to alert the bellhops if guests do enter via the main doors...surely they might require assistance with luggage too?! Check-in was very speedy, which we appreciated, since we just wanted to get to our room, freshen up and get out and about. There certainly seemed to be a more hurried feel to the entire experience this time around as compared to 2006, although to give the hotel the benefit of the doubt, this could be because we stayed there in the very busy period running up to Thanksgiving. On top of that, there were all manner of private events being hosted there, in addition to a wedding in the lobby area of the hotel on the Saturday. This didn't cause us any problem at all, although the letter posted under our door would have been better received the night before rather than at some point during the late morning on the day of the event! We had already left the hotel before the letter was placed under our door and knew that a wedding was probably going to take place in the lobby as there was a team of florists setting up an enormous archway made entirely of pink and white roses, right over the steps to the lobby! The location of the wedding meant that hotel guests could not access the main lobby from the Park Ave entrance, but rather had to walk through the hotel, take a lift or the stairs to lobby level from the Lex Ave side, then through reception back towards the Park Ave lifts. Again, a minor inconvenience, but if you are planning to stay at this hotel, be aware that these private functions are quite regular. Which is why I would have thought that the letters or notices could have been posted a lot earlier. On both occasions I have stayed here, the rooms have been of a very good size. The sheets are nice and clean and the feather mattress toppers make you feel nice and cosy. The bathroom sizes vary; on the latest occasion, I would say that the bathroom was about double the size of that of the previous room. This time around we also had a separate secluded entrance to our room, which was rather nice. The rooms are cleaned to a good standard every day. I would rate cleanliness at 4 and a half stars only because on this occasion, I noticed quite a bit of dust built up on the bedside table during our stay. That said, the rest of the room was spotless and there was no dust there when we arrived. The Waldorf claims to provide all guests with a nightly turndown service, but this seemed a little sporadic. Each night I stayed in 2006, upon return to my room at approximately 8pm, the bed had been turned down, music was playing (!) and the bedside light was on. On this occasion, on some nights the bed was not turned down at all (although the room had been cleaned and the bed made etc), while on one of the 5 nights we stayed, we indeed experienced the full turndown service. No criticism of the staff - the maids seemed to be there morning, noon and night. However, I feel that the service should either be provided fully or not at all. Personally, I don't require a turndown service but others might be disappointed if the service is sporadic. As other reviewers have noted, not all rooms at the Waldorf have a safe, so do ask upon check-in. Again, this was a minor inconvenience and in fact the lady who generally manned the safety deposit boxes was lovely and friendly, always greeting us with a smile first thing in the morning. Dining in the hotel can be pricey, so be prepared. We didn't eat in the hotel on this occasion (too busy sampling the meatballs at The Meatball Shop (84 Stanton Street - GO THERE!!) for that. However, I have previously eaten here and the food was good, though expensive. As other reviewers have said, there is a Starbucks in the entrance of the hotel (would have thought not the image that the Waldorf would want to portray, but no matter). Don't bother buying from there unless you are desperate, do yourself a favour and if it must be Starbucks, visit the one on the corner of 51st and Lex. It's about half the price and right around the corner from the hotel. We have both stayed in other hotels in New York but we like the Waldorf for the size of its rooms, the staff and the location. This is not a hip and trendy hotel by any means, but it doesn't need to be. Frankly, if those minor niggles could be resolved, it would be a great hotel and we wouldn't even consider looking at other places to stay when we visit NY. Fingers crossed that they work it out!

Reviews.Title: “This is my room? Really?”
Reviews.Author: jpzeller
Reviews.Content: I traveled to NYC in November 2010 to attend the Notre Dame-Army game, and booked my room at the Waldorf months in advance. (My wife and I had been there before and enjoyed our stays.) Upon booking online, I was offered space-available-upon-arrival upgrades, at discounted rates. Nice. Upon registering, I was greeted as a returning guest. The desk clerk then began an extremely lengthy review of available rooms. Naturally, I thought she was looking for a nice available upgrade. Wrong again. Room 632. A low floor, but just high enough to overlook the cooling towers and miscellaneous machinery on an adjacent roof. (See accompanying photo.) Naturally, the roof machinery works all night, but this noise was a nice accompaniment to the traffic entering and exiting the service elevator directly across the hall from my door. Why not complain and ask to be moved? My flight to NYC was delayed, and I was extremely short of time to meet friends for a long-scheduled dinner. After unpacking, it just didn't seem worth the effort. I did enjoy my $7.29 latte at the Starbucks downstairs the next morning, though. BTW, what is the purpose of providing a flat-screen TV without HD? I suppose one could just use his computer, at a low, low rate of only $15/day. Here's a useful tip: if booking transportation to/from an airport through the hotel, balk at the price (shouldn't be an effort) - this should result in an immediate offer for a sizable discount (bringing the price down to merely "outrageous," from "exorbitant"). OK, end of rant. The bed was delightful, and the car service (Capricorn) couldn't have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay...well worth the splurge”
Reviews.Author: bremar67
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful 4 night stay at The Waldorf. So glad we decided to treat my parents to what will certainly be their last time to visit the "big city'. The service was impeccable. The only downside would be the size of our deluxe rooms - but when "adjusted" for the cost of NYC real estate, they were more than adequate. Overall, an unforgettable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Be aware - Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: VicktoriaSweden
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby, quick check-in, poor standard of the room, worst of all the bed bugs. I got a huge bite on my foot second night...really ugly and itchy.

Reviews.Title: “An all time favorite!!”
Reviews.Author: rush2hush
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled to The Waldorf Astoria and it was phenomenal! I was in complete awe as soon as I stepped into the hotel. It's is stunning! We had little difficulty using the lifts - during the hours of 6pm - 6pm you are required to insert your key to be able to use the lift. As well as the security/concierge at the hotel this is an additional security check - brilliant idea! We arrived at our room to find the bellboy patiently waiting with our bags, he followed us in and promptly set about turning on lights and explained how the air conditioning worked. He ensured we were completely satisfied before leaving. As we had arrived late and were very tired we had a look at the menu and thought about ordering room service for breakfast. The prices are obscene but we decided to go ahead just for the experience. Breakfast for two was extortionate but i'd do it all over again! The service from the porter, the way the table had been laid, the huge selection of food...Wow! There was so much food and it kept us going all day. The housekeeping staff were equally attentive; like magical fairies who come but are never seen. Not once did I see a maid or even a trolley whilst staying at the hotel yet everyday our suite was spotless! The decor is the room was a little tired but considering the capacity of the hotel they are doing a pretty good job keeping it to the standard they have. Communal areas and breathtaking! Everybody should visit once in a lifetime. SUPERB!!! Area recommendations We had our entire weekend planned with walking routes and itinerarys. We ended up getting bus tour tickets and it was the best thing we could have done. We saw so much of New York that we wouldn't have seen otherwise and to hear local knowledge is facinating. I would also recommend a visitt o Grand Central Terminal and St Patricks Cathedral especially if you like architecture. Central Park is also FULL of history and if you go to the Empire State Building then i'd definately recommend getting the audio tour...

Reviews.Title: “A great "splurge" hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Brisvegas_Boy
Reviews.Content: My fiance & I spent the last night of our month long USA holiday at the Waldorf. At $477 for the night it was certainly the most expensive hotel room of our visit but we wanted to go out "with a bang" so to speak and splurge on a world famous hotel (to impress the friends & family back home :)) I must say we were not disappointed. The hotel is everything you would expect of a world famous brand. The room was bright and reasonably roomy with quality fittings and the most comfy bed I have ever had in a hotel. Part of the Waldorfs appeal is its art deco finishings & our bathroom was finished in beautiful marble. The lobby area itself is something to see itself with its soaring ceilings & ornate chandileers. Of course as you would expect the customer service was exceptional. The only draw back if there is one is the tarriff which would be beyond the mere mortal for an extended stay however as a one off experience like we had its perfect. Would love to come back again one day!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Liz-9999
Reviews.Content: Great location but it badly needs a remodel and the bathrooms are small. I guess we expected more from the 5 star Waldorf. The prices are not very different to Essex House but definitely not as luxurious. I do not understand why they do not give up the Hilton name since they have such a problem being associated with Hilton. They do have a great Sunday Brunch. Most Hiltons treat Diamond members very well but after our 3rd visit to this hotel we have decided to avoid returning. No upgrades or complimentary breakfast unlike the Hilton New York where they have created a special area for diamond members. It is a shame that our America Hiltons are doing so badly. When we go to Europe, we are upgraded to the Executive Level where drinks are free (nobody abuses it) and they have a great afternoon tea if you happen to be around and not enjoying playing tourist. One has to wonder how the Europeans and British feel when they visit our country and the executive rooms are non-existent or provide the minimum service and hours. Certainly no upgrade to the executive level at the Waldorf. Again we love the location but really did not feel welcome, rather felt like our Diamond status counted against us. I guess they receive too many diamond members so we are a bother - one would think that would make them realize how much business diamond members bring in. I do not want to sound like somebody who just wants freebies but being a Diamond member and feeling like you are not welcome at a hotel, was a first.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous NYC HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: LuvinMomx3
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here in 2001(option n/a on drop down of dates) LOVED it and have only heard good things from other's who have stayed there since! VERY clean, excellent staff and amenities. The comfort level and quality of linens and beds was outstanding! We have since visited NYC, stayed elsewhere and were soooo disapointed that we chose lower pricing in place of the quality of the Waldorf...will not make that mistake again! Will only stay at the Waldorf when in the city!!

Reviews.Title: “Minor Setback, but a terrific time”
Reviews.Author: uncmac92
Reviews.Content: My family traveled to New York from Tuesday, November 9 to Saturday, November13. We were so excited to get to stay at the Waldorf=Astoria; that is until we woke up on Wednesday morning to discover that there was no hot water. The hotel had left letters at the registration desk noting that Con Edison, the utilities provider in NYC had informed them that due to a steam leak, the steam supply to the hotel would be shutdown between 11:55PM Tuesday and 6:00AM Wednesday. I woke up at 7:00AM Wednesday and tried to get in the shower. After calling the front desk, I remembered the letter. I was informed that the hot water should be back on by 8:00AM. I waited until then. I tried again to get into the shower around 8:20AM, and when there was no hot water, I went ahead and dressed without showering. Shortly thereafter, my husband noted that the hot water was on, so I went ahead and showered. I spoke to the Director of Group Services, Ana Tijan, about what happened. She infomed me that this was not something that the hotel had any control over; however, she kindly offered me a credit to the hotel to compensate my family for the trouble. She went on to offer my children each a Waldorf chef and bellman bear. This made my children very happy. We were very thankful and appreciative that they took our complaint seriously, and addressed the matter in a manner which was acceptable to both parties. After this, the remainder of our stay was very enjoyable. Everyone on the staff, from Sara with the safety deposit boxes to Mina and Jonathan at the Concierge's desk, was very friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend, and if I am ever blessed to return to NYC, I would be glad to stay again at this historic hotel. Hopefully, next time we will be able to get a reservation for the historic walking tour of the hotel. (This is $50 and would include lunch. It was completely booked during our stay.)

Reviews.Title: “Care and Feeding of a Grand Dame not There”
Reviews.Author: 3cats99
Reviews.Content: Well, the property, although labyrinthine and vast is stunning in it's art deco detail and rich history. However, that's where it comes to a screeching halt. For a hotel that is of the W=A stature, we were stunned that the restaurant in the main lobby was left not only fallow for lunch on a bustling Saturday, but in fact was left with all the tables unset and the chairs strewn about, in a packed full hotel. On Sunday mornings, the main lobby is virtually a construction site all morning setting up for the Sunday brunch. Can't find anywhere else to do that? The hotel's apparent answer to midday eating is Oscar's, which really has absolutely no appeal and not only has the bar been closed (for whatever reason), it looks abandoned in place with empty shelves (save cleaning items and random junk). On a Sunday morning (as in this morning), there apparently is exactly one place to get a cup of coffee in the entire hotel, and that is the Starbucks take out kiosk in the lower level off the lobby. At any given time, Starbucks was 20 or more people deep, and as I said is take-out only. Part of the reason for this is that those with Hilton Honors status are given vouchers for "continental breakfast" in lieu of concierge lounge service (2200 rooms and W=F can't find space for a lounge?) Therefore, the lines. There are so many great hotels in NYC located in this area that offer all of the splendor of the W=A without the size and scale and inattention such a large property lacks. I really don't see why I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Even better once you have actually experienced it!!”
Reviews.Author: ModernEdge
Reviews.Content: I would like to just say our check-in was done in an efficient and professional manner by 'MEI' and her professionalism didn't stop there. We had few problems but she was able to help solve them before it was even noticed. Had a couple other glitches with service but overall it was on point. You have to know to apprecite places as the Waldorf in order to really enjoy your experience there. It was centrally located to mostly everything! Time square, rockerfeller center, subway and shopping on saks fifth. Also, I have to give a HUGE thank you to Ms. Ana who works in groups dept. and made the whole trip worthwhile!

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy and got no sleep”
Reviews.Author: MrsFitzy
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the 22nd of October and were upgraded to a Delux Room. The room was very large by New York hotel standards. It was very clean and you could tell the staff took pride in what they did. However, the noise from Park Avenue was deafening, there was work men drilling from 4am every morning. None of the family could sleep. The thing we did not do was complain I know we should have but I did not want to sound like a winging pom - I was so exausted as were my family. The hotel was shabby chic and the staff really had that oldy worldy attitude. We stayed in this hotel 2 years previous and it was a more positive experience. PS; please remember not to move any of the contents of the mini bar, as you will incure a charge on your account. It took us a while to rectify this. Some good breakfast cafes in Lexington.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: writeway00
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to head to The Big Apple for a Broadway show and booked a night in the Waldorf Towers to make it more relaxing. The hotel was fabulous; the luxury suite comfy and roomy; the service outstanding! Had Sunday brunch in the lobby the next day--expensive but worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “What a Delight”
Reviews.Author: blondebratz
Reviews.Content: After reading some worrying reviews on Trip Advisor our fears were forgotten when we entered our room. My Mum and I were staying for three nights and arrived from the UK around 8pm with no queue at check in and were welcomed by a lovely lady at reception. As this was our first time in NYC I asked her if we could have a quiet room on a high floor and what she allocated us was superb on the 13th floor. We had a corner room and the view was stunning of the Chrysler Building - we were well impressed with two queen beds which were so comfy, walk in wardrobe, great marble bathroom and large TV. The service throughout the hotel was first class and the breakfast in Oscars was great even though it was very expensive. We had a delightful time and everybody was so friendly and helpful both at WA and New York......what a fabulous place this is........can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Nicky06_10
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here the hotel is very well kept, the room was larger than we thought and all the staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “An old lady, lost in her dreams of grandeur...”
Reviews.Author: François_Bogacz
Reviews.Content: We had 2 queens in our bed room which were definitely not queen size but at least they were quite comfortable. Of course the location is perfect and the decoration of the whole place is nice, or even very nice if you think about the halls, but what about the desk in our first room which had a big hole on its side, where the electric plugs should have been? What about the faded paint on the walls? What about the room service, which is horribly expensive? What about the long check-in/check-out time ? And, icing on the cake, what about this stupid TV system that does not even include kids channels, just in the case where we will be stupid enough to purchase kids movies to satisfy our little ones? "This is New York", as they all say in other reviews, which means I should be happy and shut my mouth, but I don't agree at all. If we rate such a place with 4 stars or more, it means we are encouraging the status quo. We, as reviewers, have a simple mission: stimulate the whole market to improve. For what she gives you at the price she asks, this old lady does not deserve more than 3 stars. Modern luxury places, were money is spent in maintenance and were the whole experience is great for what you pay, really deserve 4 stars or more. There is absolutely no reason why NY should stay on another planet in terms of quality, except if we don't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice! Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_McGee
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried after making reservations and seeing some negatives reviews here, but the hotel was great. We arrived 10/29 at around 1:30 and our room was ready. We had a mini-suite which means one big room of which one end was a living area and one end was the bedroom. It was very spacious and had a separate room with a refrigerator and sink. The bathroom was very spacious also. No fixtures fell off, no wallpaper was peeling, everything was clean. The reasons I didn't give all 5 stars is 1. No safe in the room, 2. No coffeemaker in the room, and 3. They charge $5.25 per person for room service (service charge), in addition to 15% gratuity. We ordered a basket of muffins and coffee for breakfast and it was $45. Location cannot be beat. A short walk to Rockefeller Plaza, NBC Studios, Radio City, 5th Avenue, Central Park, etc. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wow - old school American classicism at its best.”
Reviews.Author: craiglegrice
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to celebrate a birthday and it was fantastic. We were on a high club floor and the views uptown were spectacular. Exploring NYC, we didn't eat in the hotel every day but if you get a chance to visit Bull & Bear, I highly recommend it (as a hotel guest or not).

Reviews.Title: “Good standard, but expect queues”
Reviews.Author: everplainjane
Reviews.Content: When this hotel is busy, be prepared to wait a lifetime to check in and out. The rooms were great. Room service was great. The hotel bar staff were rude and closed the bar earlier than their stated closing time and didn't want to serve any drinks which I thought wasn't great. Regarding location, if you like tourist trappings, it is great but if you are looking for cooler things to do, this is the wrong side of town but a great retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Suggest a few improvements!!”
Reviews.Author: Susie91
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Waldorf around 4 in the afternoon, check-in took quite a while. We were tired after flying in from Bristol, UK and just wanted to relax with a cup of tea. There were no tea or coffee making facilities in the room!!! Couldn't believe it - even in the most modest B&B in England you are provided with a kettle and tea and coffee in the room. We were told to ring Room Service, which we did, and were told it would cost $20 for a pot of tea for 2!! I was astounded that such an up-market hotel would try and rip us off like that. We discovered a Starbucks in the hotel lower foyer and had to get our tea there - not what you want after a long flight. I can't believe they don't get more complaints about this. Apart from that, the hotel was fine, grand in a traditional way but I wish the Americans could source some real English Breakfast tea.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Old”
Reviews.Author: Carltonowen
Reviews.Content: Rooms smell of old age, bathroom fixtures came off in my hand and the shower stall leaked a running stream in the bathroom. And the slick floor is an accident just waiting to happen. Staff is friendly but I felt they were all waiting for a tip when they spoke to you. This is my second stay and the first wasn'y much better. I was hoping for a better stay this time. Had to pay for internet ?

Reviews.Title: “We weren't disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SpineyNorman
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on a whim to impress my wife and then read the Tripadvisor reviews (I know this is not the best way to do it) - so was relieved that the Waldorf did not disappoint. As soon as we saw that grand lobby then we knew it was all going to be good. In fact we enjoyed the whole ambiance of the hotel. Our room was large, well furnished and beautifully clean. I had booked the cheapest room ('deluxe' I think). Don't come to this hotel expecting the food and drink to be cheap but then why would you. However it would be a shame not to sample some of the restaurants and bars but be prepared to pay for it - this is a hotel on Park Avenue and you must expect to pay for it. I'm not so sure of the location - sure it is right in the centre of midtown and surrounded by sophisticated shops and prestigious offices but is this really the best place to be? Perhaps next time I come i'll choose hotel in Greenwich Village, Soho or Tribeca which might be more interesting and exciting. We ate one night at P J Clarke's on Third Avenue, a couple of blocks away - a great New York experience.

Reviews.Title: “Relying on past reputation”
Reviews.Author: bungke
Reviews.Content: We travelled with my 79 year old mother in law. Her wish was to stay at the Waldorf, which we happily agreed to despite the high prices. Sadly the expectations were not met as from check in. The queue at reception was 15 persons long, this was at 3 PM. When we finally made it to check in we were told that our rooms would not be ready until 5pm despite check in time being 3pm. We were told to return at that time to receive our keys having finished the registration formalities. We returned at 5 to be told to join the end of the queue again !! During our 4 day stay the queue for check in seemed to be a constant feature. Having got to our rooms two and a half hours after check in the initial reaction was of surprise, the rooms were tiny even by European standards. The bed was supremely comfortable which is a good thing as there was no form of easy chair in the room, if you wanted to read or watch the ridiculously large TV there was no alternative but to sit or lie on the bed. There was a free standing reading light but nowhere to plug it into. This applied to both rooms we had. The paint was flaking off the bathroom door, the bathroom fittings were ancient and the furniture was scruffy, there was a general air of gloom about the place. The windows were so dirty we had to have the lights on during the day. We found most of the staff were rude and surly, as if they were doing you a favour by speaking to you. The lobby is spectacular, the art deco ceilings and fittings are fantastic. The Waldorf is supposed to be the "Grande Dame " of New York hotels, this may have been true 50 years ago, sadly, scratch the surface today and all you find is a Hilton, and not a very good one at that.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaGril83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Waldorf=Astoria by cashing in rewards points, therefore we were expecting to get the worst room in the house. However, when we checked in we were upgraded to a suite! The suite consisted of a very large bedroom with an average size bathroom and a large living room with a fireplace. The bed was large and luxurious and incredibly comfortable for sleeping. The staff was very friendly. In fact, when we first arrived it was pouring down rain and our cab driver tried to drop us off in front of the hotel. However, the doorman would not allow it, he made the cab driver go around the building to take us into the covered entrance where we were quickly helped with our bags. The lobby is very beautiful, yes it is old, but it feels more historic than dated. Overall, it's a beautifully preserved historic hotel and did not come off as dated in anyway. We were very comfortable during our stay and would absolutely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room with Musty Scent”
Reviews.Author: diamondsnowball
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here via Priceline. The room was the smallest room I've ever had in NYC and it had a musty, moldy smell. I would not stay here again!! Having said that, I may have been given one of the worst rooms since I booked on Priceline. The lobby is grand and you feel sort of special being part of the history that comes along with this hotel, but do yourself a favour and stay somewhere newer and nicer and just stop by this hotel for a drink or two.

Reviews.Title: “cant wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: potter40
Reviews.Content: We chose to stary at the Waldorf Astoria on our trip to New York to get married. We were seen straight away at check in, no long wait however at other times during our stay the check in was very busy. We were allocated 2 great rooms on the 19th floor which were spaciouse and very clean, we had a great view of the Chrysler Building and were not disturbed by any noise. We also received a complementary bottle of Champagen in our room. The beds were really comfortable and the bathrooms large and clean, but we could have done with more wardrobe space. The maid service was excellent as was the concierge, especially Johnathan who was very helpfull. All calls down to the desk were answered very quickly and all staff that we dealt with were efficient and very polite. The location is great just a short walk to TOTR, Grand Central Station, Times Square, Central Park most places you would want to visit. We cant wait to go back, hopefully for our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special!”
Reviews.Author: brazilian_tourist
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at Waldorf Astoria, as a final stop of a leisure trip to Japan. We had requested an early check-in when we made our reservation and the room was available upon arrival (around noon). Front staff was professional and efficient, but could be more friendly. Lobby is very elegant, but many events take place in the hotel convention rooms, so it can be quite confusing and noising. Room was big and its décor was quite dated, and so was the bathroom. There is not a free internet access in the room nor a safe, which is unacceptable for the price you pay for staying there. The hotel has a “dress code” for public areas after 6pm, which could be nice in past decades, but nowadays it seems outdated and presumptuous. I confess I got a little disappointed with my experience in this hotel and, for the price they charge, I am sure it can be possible to stay in much better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch !”
Reviews.Author: beinhappy
Reviews.Content: From beginning to end our stay at The Waldorf was fabulous ! Our Superior room was spacious, clean and the bed very comfortable. This is an old hotel and the historical atmosphere is worth a walk through even if you don't want to stay. If you love Art Deco you will love this place! The doormen were very helpful and friendly in getting us taxi's. As far as location, it can't be beat! I will be back the next time I come to NY. Reserve The Sunday Brunch, you will not be disappointed! :)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Speges
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Waldorf for three night on a special trip to New York from the UK. First impression wasn't good when the bellboy told us there was a 20 minute wait for the luggage to be moved from the cab to the lobby. We struggled with our cases and eventually signed in. At first glance the room looked quite good. It was large with two double beds. We wanted to have a bath but there was black 'gunge' coming out of the plug hole and it smelt mouldy. I rang housekeeping and was told someone would be there immediately. After 45 minutes I phoned again and was told someone had been up. When I informed her that nobody had been to the room she said she would send someone again. It turned out the doorbell wasn't working!!! It took another visit the next day to get rid of the 'gunge' The beds were very comfortable and clean and we slept well. Next morning we had breakfast in 'Oscars' which was very good. After lunch we arrived back at the hotel to find our room was very cold. I again phoned housekeeping to be told the boiler had broken down and they would send up a blow fire!!! This duly arrived but after an hour all the power went off and my daughter and I sat under the duvets to keep warm - ridiculous !! The wardrobe wouldn't shut because it was warped and the carpet and some of the furniture had seen better days. This was not the basic room - we had paid for a superior room! Beware of the mini bar - on checking my credit card on my return there was an item for $17+ added. We hadn't even opened the mini bar during our stay. I noticed someone else on these reviews had the same problem but for more $!! The hotel has since refunded this amount. The public rooms in the hotel are fantastic and the Sunday Brunch in Peacock Alley was very good.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved New York”
Reviews.Author: KimberleeJ4
Reviews.Content: I loved the Waldorf Astoria it was very beautiful the people were nice people they greeted us with the up most respect anything we needed they were right there to make sure we had it i would definitely be going back i am taking my kids to see the tree at rockefellar center

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Weekend Celebration”
Reviews.Author: kroywen1
Reviews.Content: Celebrated both our birthdays by booking into the Waldorf Astoria. We noted this on our reservation & they couldn't have been more accomodating. Sent us a fruit platter and bottled water complimentary. Our room was just renovated and beautiful. Marble bathroom, bed linens, etc. We had gotten tickets for the exclusive "Chamber Magic" show that is presented in a suite at the hotel & it was fun. After the show had drinks and late night supper at Peacock Alley. Very sophisticated!! On Sunday we opted for brunch next door at the Church Courtyard. Defintely recommend it!!! Overall, a 5 star experience. Only negative -- Parking is every expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: DirtyCupcake
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed at the Waldorf Astoria for 5 nights recently. We were lucky enough to stay in one of their finest suites and felt completely spoiled by our surroundings. The sitting room was lovely and was a nice place to unwind at the end of a long day. We loved the huge marble bathroom and the dressing area was awesome. The staff was more than helpful and courteous. I would love to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Safe, Secure, luxurious - made our trip a joy.”
Reviews.Author: Auntzann
Reviews.Content: My grown daughter and I wnet to NY to visit places where I grew up. We stayed at the Waldorf Astoria as our base. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the restaurant was fantastic and the rooms were quiet ( I can't remember ever having such a quiet sleep) clean and decorated well. I highly recommend staying here for your visit to NYC. You can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel & Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: tanyamary627
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf Astoria for a week during a business trip. The concierge John was extremely helpful, recommending unique restaurants within our price range. Rooms were extremely clean and decent size for NYC. Lobby, business area, and shops are spacious and gorgeous. My room was located extremely close to the elevator and I woke up a few minutes before my alarm every morning due to the beeping of the elevator. Not a big problem since I needed to get up, but if you are on vacation and plan to sleep past 6 I would recommend a room farther from the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Great luxaury experiance”
Reviews.Author: ishahin
Reviews.Content: The most iconic hotel in the Big Apple, It has had an illustrious history, hosting the famous and fabulous from its Fifth Avenue home. The lobby is gorgeous and the rooms are top notch for NYC.There is a dress code (no cut off jeans, t-shirts, baggy clothes, hats ... pretty much anything that wouldn't get you into a club). However, the dress code is not heavily enforced. The Starbucks in the hotel also asks that you follow the dress code as well.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected!”
Reviews.Author: lucuma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf and frackly it wasn't what we expected. :( The service was just okay. I think the hotel is not what it used to be...sad!

Reviews.Title: “I'm glad we got a chance to stay here, but ...”
Reviews.Author: Nannarpite
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were planning on being in NY for one night, so we wanted to do it with a little bit of style, and since he's a HiltonHonors Gold member we thought the Waldorf would fit the bill. Overall, I'm glad we stayed here. We got a good rate (at least, for the Waldorf), so we booked a superior room. We arrived early (around 1pm), but our room was not ready. We left our luggage and went out for lunch, but our room was still not available when we returned at 2:30pm. Since check-in is not actually until 3pm, this wasn't a big deal, but I can't imagine that there wasn't a single room available for us 30 minutes early. However, by 3pm our room still wasn't ready. We were becoming impatient by this point. How could this be? The hotel has around 27 floors and there wasn't a single room available at check-in time? The lady at the front desk was very nice and gave us each a voucher for a free drink at the bar, then called us 10 minutes later to tell us our room was finally ready. We were given room 913, which was an upgraded room with a corner view and a dressing room. Very nice! Our luggage was brought up just a few minutes after we arrived, so no complaints there. However, the heating did not work and there was a very strange odor in the dressing room that grew worse throughout our stay. On our way out to dinner, we mentioned the heating to the staff at the front desk and was also going to mention the smell, but when I told them that I had forgotten to take the 'Privacy' notice off the door they said they wouldn't enter the room. Oh, well. We were in a rush to leave and since we were only going to be there one night there wasn't much point in forcing the issue. I'm sure if we had mentioned it there wouldn't have been a lot that could have been done, given their apparent shortage of rooms. Still, it was a great room, with an over-sized bathroom, in a nice, quiet corner of the hotel. I liked the photographs that lined the corridors of people who have stayed or visited the hotel in the past and the lobby truly is quite spectacular. I expect we shall return to the Waldorf-Astoria, as it really is a great location, but I think it'll be a while before we do.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the hype and your expectations- Enough with Hilton/ W=A”
Reviews.Author: Justtravels988
Reviews.Content: I have multiple posts on TA. I travel frequently for business and pleasure and am a Hilton Diamond Member. I decided to use some points for a one-night stay at the famed W=A. The additional nights, I spent at The Plaza. The W=A and Hilton certainly make this hotel out to be on par with other luxury hotels and are even using this property to spur a brand. However, if you have any desire for service, well appointed accommodations or expect any better treatment due to your brand loyalty....look elsewhere! The lobby is nice...historic...the rooms...are seriously bad. Our room reeked like dampness and mold and was masked with some potpourri/flowery scent. I can appreciate historic details but the shower, tub, casing about the shower was full of dust and hair and just disgusting. Trying to connect to the internet is almost impossible (wired, of course) and everything is just very...."preserved." As a diamond member, it went totally unrecognized during my stay. No upgrade...the "free breakfast" i'm supposed to receive was instead rewarded with a gift certificate to Starbucks in the lobby. Seriously? The W=A sends you to Starbucks for a coffee and muffin to it's most loyal customers? It's just so tacky. I also was given 2 free water bottles from the mini-bar as a diamond member. I checked my HH accout today and was charged $73 and then another for $17 for mini-bar charges. I called the hotel, was put on hold, then transferred to accounting, put on hold again....then told that I probably moved "everything around" in the mini bar and that's why i got charged. It's laughable that they call this luxury. I didn't move anything and even if I did- they shouldn't be so quick to put $90 on someone's credit card after checkout without even asking. The accountign girl said..."this happens all the time...' So...I wonder how many people out there are getting robbed by the W-A NYC. She reversed the charge, but it was a 15 minute ordeal...and not my fault. This stay was supposed to be special- and as one of the top properties in the Hilton brand- somewhere you want to go to use the points you earn. But because thsi place is such a let down...i'm seriously thinking of switching to being loyal to Starwood next year. Just think...I could have used Starwood points and been at The St. Regis vs. The Waldorf....and the St. Regis is on par with other luxury properties in the city.....(and the Plaza is spectacular). Nutshell- it's old, smells, bad service, trickery in accounting.....living of former days of grandeur. Don't go.

Reviews.Title: “Legendary Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EasternCanada
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria is a legendary hotel. I have been there before but my short stay to see New York City again and the Yankees (September 25) was very nice. As I walked in, I asked for a room with the nicest view possible. Even though my reservation was for a standard deluxe king size room at a reduced price, they gave me a Park Avenue room with a fireplace in it. Check-in was very friendly and really helpful. The room was beautiful with a traditional decor and a marble bathroom. It was very clean and comfortable. After a long day visiting the city, it's great to be able to relax in an enjoyable room. The location of the hotel is a real plus with Grand Central Terminal and Rockefeller Center two blocks away. It is also impressive to look at the hotel and its history with many pictures of well-know guests displayed everywhere in the hotel. Despite this great history, the hotel staff is down to earth and very efficient. I have only praise for this hotel after my stay. I strongly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: Ati58
Reviews.Content: I agonized over where to stay for our first visit to New York and I constantly consulted Trip Advisor for people's recent comments. The Waldorf often had mixed reviews but I am so glad that we stayed there and would definitely return. The receptionist went to great lengths to find us a quiet room but with a view (not easy in NY) and we had 5 nights of peaceful sleep.. We didn't eat in the hotel but enjoyed cocktails in the bar before going out and the atmosphere was superb. Probably slightly disappointed that although there was an evening dress code many guest were quite scruffy which was a shame because the Waldorf is such an iconic grand hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Waldorf is an icon for a reason!”
Reviews.Author: FairyPrincessHolly
Reviews.Content: We booked at the last minute after another hotel botched our reservation. We arrived literally 10 minutes after the reservation was made. They couldn't have been kinder to us at the front desk. We ended up with their "superior boudoir room" and it was lovely. By New York standards, our room was enormous. Honestly, by any standards, it was a large room. We had a huge bedroom with 2 double beds, a large LCD tv, a huge dressing area with two large closets, floor to ceiling mirrors, 2 writing/computer desks, a huge step up marble/granite bathroom with double doors, a separate small toilet room that had a cute crystal chandelier over the toilet. It couldn't have been lovelier, or had better service. We got an excellent deal, and I'd go back in a heartbeat. It was a treat to stay at this iconic New York hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: mapleleaves8
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in Mid-September at the Waldorf with my mother. We were given exactly the same room that we had when we were there last year - a very large, clean, well-maintained room with a foyer, a walk-in closet, and a large bathroom with a separate shower and tub. We called each night to schedule room service for the next morning; six times they were prompt or a bit early, one time they were fifteen minutes late. Everything else ran beautifully. The location is perfect. There's a subway stop (6 train) just north of the hotel, and it's walking distance to all of Midtown - we saw two Broadway shows and ate at some wonderful restaurants and never had to take a taxi once. Everyone on the staff treated us well. The bellmen, the doormen, the front desk, housekeeping, everyone we came in contact with was friendly and polite. The dress code for the lobby and having to use one's key to get to one's floor after 6pm are minor inconveniences. They don't expect tuxedos and evening gowns, just collared shirts and long pants. If you're going to stay at a high-end hotel in Midtown Manhattan (and not in the Times Square area), don't dress like you're at Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Fab times great hotel piece of history”
Reviews.Author: jinty58
Reviews.Content: My daughter and i visited on the 3rd of sep for a five day trip. I am 52year old and my daughter is 23years what a wondrefull time we had a packed so much in plenty to do for all ages whatever you want to do must say I really enjoyed the speedboat trip got so wet but a really funtime. The hotel was fab all the staff we found to be freindly and helfull. It has a really nice astmosphere nice and calm in the middle of the hustle and bustle. It really feels like a bit of history. the rooms are big and spacious the bathroom was small but all you need is there nice toiletries. The bed were super comfy not that we were in them that much to my daughter horror she just could not slow me down. Ihave been to new york three times I would recommend this hotel nice bars and resturants in the hotel a bit pricey weate outside most of the time.The delis are so good choise is great and you are never that far from one. LOVED IT SO MUCH cant wait to go back the weather was really warm and sunny in the 80s .

Reviews.Title: “Old and Tired”
Reviews.Author: lovedagrape
Reviews.Content: We were there for 3 nights/4 days and based on the reputation of this hotel, we were disappointed. The grandeur we experienced in the lobby did not continue everywhere else, especially our room - the holes in the ceiling tiles in the bathroom were taped over, the ethernet wire was broken at both ends, the bolt on the door lock did not work and they could clean the rooms more thoroughly. We came back from a play at 10:45 PM on the Saturday night and not one restaurant/bar was open for any type of food (snack or otherwise). If you wanted a snack you had to call room service. Room service delivered 4 appetizers to our room - 2 were good 2 were terrible (dry, overcooked and tasteless), oh and it cost $130.00. NYC, 10:45PM on a Saturday night and they don't want to serve you in their restauarants or bars??? Doesn't make sense to us. Asked the tour desk for tickets to ellis island and they said they don't do that - go to the dock and get them there, we were told. The line-ups can be quite long so I told them they were available on the internet if they could print them off for us but they were not interested (in our opinion) on helping because they can't make a profit on it. Wasn't impressed with this staff member. There were other little things that didn't go right, especially for the prices they still charge for this place. We will definitley not return to Old - Tired - Waldorf Astoria.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: brownei
Reviews.Content: Before travelling to New York for our honeymoon i read the reviews about The Waldorf Astoria and was really disappointed as they werent very good, i got abit depressed and worried that it wasnt going to be as special as i wanted it to be. PLEASE dont take any notice of the negative reviews, our experience of this hotel was fantastic. We stayed in a one bedroom suite, which was out of this world in beauty. We had a lounge with a massive television and a seperate bedroom with the biggest, most comfy bed. The check in process was swift and easy, there were no massive ques as i have read and i never saw ny the whole time we were there. On finding out that we were on honeymoon we were given complimentry vouchers for free continental breakfasts for our stay (3 days) and two free drinks in the bar. The breakfast was lovely and plentiful. The drinks n the bar were fantastic, the barmen were lovely! The location of the hotel is wonderful and within walking distance from alot of the tourist attratctions. The prices of the drinks in the hotel was expensive, but this is New York and everything is expensive and hotel prices are always more expenisve anyway.
