I have read reviews from people saying that they were not happy that they didnt have a flat screen in their room, or that the carpets were dirty - please ignore these, it wasnt true on our stay. The lobby and chandalers will take your breath away. I would love to come back to this hotel and will try and persuade my husband that we might have to do it every wedding anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: RSLambert
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in April with my husband and parents. There was some confusion when booking in as they had us down for one room not two but it was quickly sorted out even though our two rooms werent anywhere near each other. The room was lovely large and very clean. Yes some of the fittings are a bit worn but we chose this hotel because of its character and the room had classic charm. The only issue we had was they tell you to check the internal door locks as some rooms connect to each other we forgot and next door managed to open the door one night! to all our amusement. The hotel is beautiful but also very expensive the drinks in the bar are very expensive as is breakfast but there is a handy Starbucks on the ground floor even though this got very busy. Loved our stay here just wished we had more money to eat here!.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Magic”
Reviews.Author: MrsCorningstone
Reviews.Content: After dropping our bags off with the Bell Boy we were directed to Reception. As it was late there was no queue and check-in was extremely quick. We were told that we had received a complementary upgrade as we were on Honeymoon. My husband and I travelled to The Waldorf Astoria and it was phenomenal! I was in complete awe as soon as I stepped into the hotel. It's is stunning! We had little difficulty using the lifts - during the hours of 6pm - 6pm you are required to insert your key to be able to use the lift. As well as the security/concierge at the hotel this is an additional security check - brilliant idea! We arrived at our room to find the bellboy patiently waiting with our bags, he followed us in and promptly set about turning on lights and explained how the air conditioning worked. He ensured we were completely satisfied before leaving. As we had arrived late and were very tired we had a look at the menu and thought about ordering room service for breakfast. The prices are obscene but we decided to go ahead just for the experience. Breakfast for two was extortionate but I’d do it all over again! The service from the porter, the way the table had been laid, the huge selection of food...Wow! There was so much food and it kept us going all day. The housekeeping staff were equally attentive; like magical fairies who come but are never seen. Not once did I see a maid or even a trolley whilst staying at the hotel yet everyday our suite was spotless! The decor is the room was a little tired but considering the capacity of the hotel they are doing a pretty good job keeping it to the standard they have. Communal areas and breathtaking! Everybody should visit once in a lifetime. SUPERB!!! We had our entire weekend planned with walking routes and itineraries. We ended up getting bus tour tickets and it was the best thing we could have done. We saw so much of New York that we wouldn't have seen otherwise and to hear local knowledge is fascinating. I would also recommend a visit to Grand Central Terminal and St Patricks Cathedral especially if you like architecture. Central Park is also FULL of history and if you go to the Empire State Building then I’d definitely recommend getting the audio tour.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: TAL-PE
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Waldorf for 5 nights in Dec 09 / Jan 10 for New Years eve and we loved the hotel. Our room was huge and although the heating system in our room was a bit noisy, it didnt keep us awake. Other reviews have commented that the hotel is dated and needs refurbishing. We would totally disagree, the hotel is old fashioned and full of character and charm. The hotel is so grand and everything was extremely clean. The food from room service was beautiful and the hotel bars are so cosy, it was lovely to go back to the Waldorf after a hard days sightseeing in the freezing cold. We would recommend Oscars for breakfast, its expensive but its bloody lovely! The beds are extremely comfortable, its in a great location and its got so much history its just lovely to wander around the hotel and sneak a peek in the ballrooms! Definately a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: norajay
Reviews.Content: I have never been a fan of those old fashioned hotels but my stay at the Waldorf was amazing. We arrived late at night after a 12 hour flight, when we checked in the receptionist invited us to have some wine at the bar (delicious pino noir). The room was lovely with nice view over Park Ave. I was most pleased with the Ipod-docking station. The location was great. I wish the free WIFI area wasn't just limited to the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavyGGG
Reviews.Content: Stayed on Sept 11 & 12. It was our 40th Wedding Anniversary. When I called to re-confirm I mentioned it. We arrived and checked in and went to our room (1414). It was very large, great view of Park Ave. It had a large marble bath. In the closet there were two Bathrobes (very plush) and bath towels that were as large as beach towels ,also very thick. We were very impressed. The room was immaculate with thick wool carpeting,rich furniture and a marble fireplace. After resting the doorbell rang (It is so much nicer than knocking) and it was a waiter with a bottle of champagne on ice with two glasses and a card from the manager wishing ua a Happy 40th Anniversary. This was our first time at the Waldorf. Imagine how they treat their Regulars??? We will also be writing the Manager. For the Price. If you want to be treated like ROYALTY chose the Waldorf. We will be back for our 45th.

Reviews.Title: “Loved New York, loved the waldorf even more...”
Reviews.Author: loves2travel2011
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel completely by accident, and when I found out how much I paid on booking.com (ALL NON REFUNDABLE!>>) Had a small heartattack (it ended up being almost $400 a night for me and my mom) but after the initial shock, and since it was non refundable, I just decided to sit back and enjoy it. What choice did I have?... Then I read the reviews here, and my heart really sank, so I went there ready for a fight and ready for a huge disappointment but had a blast! First of all, a quick tip - order the Super Shuttle online before you leave, order a round trip to and from the airport and add the tip. Believe me, you will thank me! Saves time and money. Then, I got to the hotel at midnight, my mom got here before me, and it was all great. We stayed in room 883 (not in the towers), and it was fantastic. Don't expect a nice view (our window overlooked the W hotel) because this is New York City - all you see around you are sky scrapers. The room was gorgeous, the bathroom was great, flat screen tv (for the little we had time to watch). Room service was fantastic, the Concierges (there were several) were always helpful. Gave us a map of the subway, a map of the area, AND a map of the buses. They also printed our boarding passes before we left (so don't pay for the business center, it's too much), AND changed our seats for us on the plane... I thought I read somewhere that the ice machine was money-operated - Not true. It's free. The only annoying thing was that after 6pm you need to use your room key to operate the elevator, but three out of the five elevators wouldn't accept our room cards, so we had to call the concierge and they fixed it. The other thing was that the hotel is expensive, period, so we couldn't eat breakfast or dinner there, and even the strabucks at the hotel was at least a dollar more per cup than any other starbucks,but since there are two around the corner from the hotel, we didn't mind. My mom had to put her diabetic shots in the mini bar, so we told them ahead of time so they won't charge us, and they offered to bring a fridge up for us. The other thing was that I was always confused about where we were, because the waldorf has exits on all four sides of the hotel and I had to get my bearings each time I left... Everything was great, wish I could have stayed longer, hope i can return some days. The location is the best, really, you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special Here”
Reviews.Author: durkinm
Reviews.Content: This was supposed to be a “once in a lifetime” stay at one of the most renowned hotels in Manhattan. I made the reservation for three nights using my Hilton Honors points (50,000 per night) that took 8 years to collect. As a current Gold Honors level, I was anticipating some consideration towards an upgrade – it didn’t happen. We ended up in a tiny room with no view of anything except another part of the hotel just a few yards away. The mattress was lumpy and uncomfortable; the bathroom was very small and cramped. There was also an odor of pet residue in the room. I can tell you that there are probably better rooms, but you’d better be prepared to pay through the nose and do not expect any consideration for an upgrade unless you are a Diamond level. Since we had an early flight the last morning we also reserved a room at the Hampton Inn at LaGuardia Airport and was much more please with the room and service.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Reservation Service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hermit02
Reviews.Content: I recently scheduled a trip to New York for vacation. I'm pregnant and wanted to get away one last time before I become a first-time mom. I became extremely ill with a vitrus before my scheduled trip and had to cancel late notice. My $2,000 reservation was charged to my card and was not refunded in the form of a reimbursement or credit to stay another time. Even with a note from my doctor stating that I was under doctor care at that time, the Waldorf refused to work with me. I understand hotels have policies in place, but under the circumstances I feel there should have been some leniency. I was incredibly disappointed that not only did I not get to take my vacation, but I'm out $2,000 for a stay I never took. This is incredibly bad customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: t-spillers
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great, very clean, great customer service. The only downfall was they have a dress code for the lobby after 6:00pm (thats difficult for tourists walking around all day sweating) and no free internet in your room. With the price they charge I believe the internet should be free for guests not for anyone that just walks in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Visit again”
Reviews.Author: faizh
Reviews.Content: Great location with a great service . Highlights of all great locations around new york.. Food spcially fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay at this Legendary Hotel; Elegant and Classic”
Reviews.Author: HelloNewJersey
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband, mother and teenager daughter at this elegant, legendary hotel on Hilton Honors points. The hotel upgraded us to a one-bedroom suite in the Towers Section which was really nice. The suite had a feel of an earlier time but the decor and furniture were lovely. We had a breakfast the next morning which was okay; nothing spectacular. The lobby is simply elegant with the clock in the middle. We always wanted to experience the Waldorf-Astoria and was not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “a very special anniversary at The Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: Memphisbelle70
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, my husband and I only stayed one night in the city before flying oversee's on holiday to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. As a Hilton Diamond member, we used points for our stay that also included breakfast. Hilton really takes care of their honor members, and we were very pleasantly surprised with a large, updated suite. We found the room to be gorgeous, spacious and not at all "run-down" as I have read in other reviews. The bed was very comfortable, bathroom was huge and plenty of storage. Shortly after check in, we received a lovely bottle of sparkling wine and chocolate covered strawberries and a note from the hotel wishing us a Happy anniversary. This was greatly appreciated! We loved all the common area's and of course, the lobby was very grand with a mostly business clientele and there was also a few black tie events taking place that was fun to sit and watch from a seat in the lobby. I also loved the location, Saks and many cafe's, shops all a short walking difference. I recently stayed in times square, but prefer this Midtown location. I also want to add that all the staff we encountered were helpful and professional. Hopefully, we will find a time to go back to NYC and stay at the Waldorf more than one night!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel...Arf!”
Reviews.Author: Beancake
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf during one of the coldest spells of winter weather. we had a lovely suite...but the reason I did not rate this hotel with 5 stars is because there was a dog in a neighboring room. This dog would bark whenever it heard a noise, and woke us up in the middle of the night every night we were there!! The Westminster Dog Show was that very weekend.....need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “The hotel that time forgot”
Reviews.Author: phillyvisitor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible. Its really sad, because this hotel was really a grand place at one time. The problem is it hasn't been updated since then. The lobby is reminiscent of the 1940's but with no modern upgrades. II would venture to say that the carpet hasn't been upgraded in 20 years. The corridors are not lit well and kind of scary. You have to use your key card to access the elevator (I thought this was a 5-star hotel?). The room was a complete let down. I had a reservation for 5 nights and left after one. Here's why: 1. The internet in the room didn't work. They actually have a personal Cisco wireless router in each room. Is this a dorm room? Really? You have to find your room # in the list of 30+ wireless networks. Mine did not work. They also have the old school wired connection as well. That didn't work either. It wasn't just me; one of my colleagues stayed here and couldn't get internet access either. 2. The room itself hasn't been upgraded in some time. That would be fine if it was in good shape but it wasn't. The paint was chipping in the bathroom, the desk had several nicks on it and the room is very dark. The bathroom is really small and has a weird medicine cabinet. Maybe this was the trend in the 40's? 3. HBO kept going in and out on the TV. Not a huge deal but it was a Sunday night and I love True Blood! 4. No coffee maker in the room. I have come to expect this in most hotels at this point. Even the Ritz and Four Seasons has them. 5. This wasn't anything that negatively affected me, but they actually have a dress code posted when you walk into the hotel. Who do they think they're kidding? The hotel is in terrible shape. It was a joke. If it was super posh and deluxe, fine, but it wasn't. Don't stay here. They have a respected name and they're banking on it. There are much better hotels with modern conveniences in this City.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, not worh the money”
Reviews.Author: gt6210
Reviews.Content: Dreamed my whole life off sleeping in the Plaza however couldnt afford that so i choose the Waldorf. The waldorf has a good location for visiting manhattan at night and for visiting shops and museums. The waldorf itself is great the lobby and surroundings are amazing, fresh flowers everywhere and beautifully decorated. The service for check in is great no waiting, the woman had a decent UK accent and was very friendly. The room itself was ok nice bed and great philips TV, nice decoration. However the bathroom was a disapointment dirty and a litle dated. The breakfast i choose to take on the room was a whopping 47 dollar so i ate very slow and enjoyed it. ;-) For that price you get a lot different breads, pancakes,eggs,bacon, sausages,hash browns, coffee,orange juice, water and a rose. Overall Good hotel but i would go to the W times Square for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “This grand old New York hotel is as luxurious and wonderful as ever!”
Reviews.Author: Murfee
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about what a great experience we had at The Waldorf. We were celebrating our 39th anniversary and the hotel and its staff could not have been more wonderful. The lobby is a grand step back in time and our room was simply fabulous. The staff from Agnes at check-in to Graham at the concierge desk were amazingly helpful and gracious. Whoever said New Yorkers were brusque and rude has never stayed at the Waldorf Astoria. And the location was an added benefit - easy to walk to the theater but out of the hub-bub of Broadway and Times Square. Wonderful restaurants in the neighborhood and the breakfast buffet at the Waldorf was simply magnificent.

Reviews.Title: “Still a Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tyreman01
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights with my Wife and 2 teenage daughters. It's a nice Hotel with really nice staff. Just a couple of observations, watch out for the people selling "Studio 57" Hilton timeshare in the lobby, they are all very polite but it is timeshare. Also we had no safe in the room but there are saftey deposit boxes behind reception where you can lock valuables, the lady who runs this was delightful and very helpful. Avoid Oscars for breakfast unless you want to pay €160 plus tip for 4 of you. It is an impressive place with a justifiably impressive reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steph2727
Reviews.Content: The hotel was booked through the Javits Center hotel listings. I got a great rate and I was pleasantly surprised by the service at the hotel. It is a huge place and swarming with people. Lots of security too. The lobby is gorgeous. The room was large and we had a view and could see the sky, which sometimes does not happen at NY hotels. The only downsides were the wifi does not work in the rooms. You had to go to the lobby which luckily is quite large. The other downside is the food. It was $80 for dinner for one person for a basic meal, nothing too extravagant. However, the location is excellent and it was an easy walk or taxi ride to other restaurants. The bus for the Javits Center picks up and drops off right in front of the hotel. We left our luggage with the luggage storage downstairs the day we checked out and went to dinner. Picked up the bags and headed to our airport hotel for the night and very early flight the next day. All in all a great experience! Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: teanutSouthWales
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Waldorf in December for my birthday and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The christmas decorations were out of this world and the reception area took our breath away every time we entered the lobby. Check in was fairly slow, but no problems. The room was nicely decorated, but fairly small and no tea making facilities (but there is a starbucks by the main entrance). The bathroom was very tired. The shower was useless - the spray went everywhere and made the floor slippery. On our first night we absolutley froze and couldnt get the heater to work. We rang reception but noone came until the following afternoon. He couldnt fix it then so they gave us a small heater for the following night, didnt help much but took the chill off and the following day the main one was fixed. We were room only and decided to try a typical american diner for breakfast and it was so good we used the same one every day (down the back escalator, out the door and its down the opposite road). The location of this hotel was excellent - nothing is too far away. We used the subway once but preferred to walk or use taxis. In all this is a fantastic hotel and you can feel the history of it the minute you walk through the main door.

Reviews.Title: “Still great, still a legend”
Reviews.Author: cityhotelsightseeing
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed a week in New York City, but only two nights at The Waldorf=Astoria- due to bad reviews. I shouldnt have worried, as it's still first class in everyway. My only complaint was that I had requested a new bathroom (and been told by email it would be granted), however I still got an old one. It was ok and I quite liked the room, so I decided not to request a room change. I did however receive an upgrade (on check in) for an extra $19, which gave me access to the Astoria Lounge and its delicious buffet continental breakfast. The service in all areas of the hotel was extremely good. I did a tour of the hotel- this was truly one of the highlights of my holiday. I got to see the kitchens, Ballroom, Starlight Room and Royal Suite. You dont get much of a meal in NYC for $50, but not only did I get the tour but also a fabulous three course lunch in Peacock Alley. Tours depend on whats available at the time and I struck it lucky. Im glad I stayed and ignored some of those reviews, yes it's a little worn but it's still great!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service; Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: pakalana
Reviews.Content: Great location on Park Avenue; absolutely beautiful hotel. Booked stay through Expedia and got a great rate; unfortunately upon arrival we were told our reservations were cancelled; pulled up a confirmation email and all was made right and we were upgraded to a very spacious and well appointed room. Ambience, decor, piano and vocals in the lobby, just wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “THAT was legendary service?!?”
Reviews.Author: balld80
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria in NYC is a beautiful hotel with amazing finishes and architecture. I found many pleasant surprises during my four day stay there and I'm very glad I experienced it for myself...but I was somewhat disappointed by the lackluster service that is highly advertised on their website and reservation emails. When I walked in through the main entry, none of the doorman stopped their conversations long enough to offer to help me with my bags. The man who checked me in was very nice and professional, and the room was lovely. We had a king size bed on a corner of the hotel, so the room was nice and bright. We had a large closet, a very large dressing room with 2 more closets, a built in dressing table, and a large bathroom. But, around the hotel, I found the staff to not be very friendly, except the housekeeping women were very welcoming. It was most interesting that moments after my sister checked in, she had a visitor at her door with a silver platter with wine, cheese and fruit. We had paid the same rate, but I stayed there for 3 days while she was only there for one. We couldn't figure out how or why she scored the special treatment...and it continued. We found stationery in her room that was personalized with her name, they had a wall street journal in front of their door in the morning, and they were also offered free continental breakfast! We didn't have any of those things, and I have no idea. So, I'm not super impressed. The hotel is amazing, but I expect to have interaction and lots of it for the price of that place. Next time I'll stay at the plaza.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: TampaJack
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for four nights to celebrate our 30th anniversary. The accommodations and staff were absolutely wonderful. EVERYTHING exceed our expectations. And we were staying with award certificates rather than being paying customers! The hotel did not have to be so nice to us. True, I'm a Hilton Diamond member, but I've rarely been treated so well anywhere, ever. The location is great. Less than a block to the subway, plenty of dining options around the hotel, and centrally located. We did a lot of walking, but that's just part of being in NYC. I'll fondly remember our stay forever, or as long as my memory holds out. LOL!

Reviews.Title: “Old and tiered”
Reviews.Author: Tracy13_7
Reviews.Content: Looks good from the outside,dated inside, lives in the past. Breakfast service could be better. Not a bad stay. Enjoyed the Peninsular more.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but there are better locations”
Reviews.Author: Shoppin7
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Honors member, we stayed for free at the Waldorf. Nice hotel, 1 block from the financial district, two blocks from Saks FIfth Avenue so very conveniently located. Best part is the City SIghts tour bus picks up directly in front of the Waldorf which makes it easy to see the city when you don't have a car. The next trip to New York we will stay at the Hilton in Times Square. Don't expect to visit the executive lounge though unless you stay in the Towers at the Waldorf. Expect to hear a fair amount of noise from the street level (we were on the 14th floor). Also, the room smelled terrible. I think it was just from the age of the hotel. Once you were in the room, it only took a few minutes to adjust but the inital smell when you walked in the room was fairly unpleasant. Also, the A/C unit was fairly noisy and kept me awake the first night but hey the first night is always tough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Stephen w
Reviews.Content: I had my Daughter coming to visit me in the US from England(i live in California now) and i decided to take her to New York for a long weekend . I have always wanted to stay in the famous Waldorf so i thought this was the ideal opportunity . Excellent service from the minute we got there , i was worried that it may be a bit pretentious but it was far from that . Nice room with an obstructed view of the Chrysler building from our 16th floor window , for first time visitors to New York the Hotel is in an excellent location for all the must see attractions .

Reviews.Title: “Historic Luxury in New York City”
Reviews.Author: MichelleMMiller
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service in this 100+ year old hotel. Many amenities and services in this centrally located location. The staff is very attentive and professional. We traveled with our 7 year old daughter and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Historical Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PedroAthens
Reviews.Content: Ok, I will start by saying that we stayed in this hotel using my Hilton Points. It was our second trip to NY, and we got a PointStretcher promotion and could stay here instead of the Garden Inn for a few more points, so we said why not? It is an impressive hotel. The lobby, reception, and public areas are very nice, well taken care of, luxurious. There is a separate entrance for cars, as well. This was a great first contact with the hotel. As we went up to the room, the age of the hotel started to be more clear. The furniture and other room equipment is old (except the huge LCD TV), and while it may contribute to the "historical" feeling, I believe this could have been achieved even if you renovate some things! The bath tub was cracked at several points, there was visible rust, and the overall looks of the room were not at a par with what one would have expected. Keep in mind we probably had one of the cheapest rooms :) The hotel is central, but if you do not intend to be traveling by taxi everywhere, it is not so accessible as other hotels closer to Times Square. It's about 5 blocks to TS, taking at least 15mn to get there walking. Last time we stayed at 9th Ave Garden Inn, and the location was much more convenient. Anyway, it's an interesting experience and we are glad we did it, but next time we won't be staying there, even if we have points to spend.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Buns4vs
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a steamy Saturday afternoon and no offer to deal with luggage, which we had to drag up to the lobby by ourselves. Distainful Check In Clerk seemed to take pleasure in telling me that it was prior to official check in time (it was 2:45pm) and to come back 30 minutes later. Room spacious, but as others have said, looking tired. No turndown service offered and I would have expected more of a property that trades on its status. No acknowledgement of HH Status and I have stayed at far better properties in the Hilton Chain and other chains for that matter. Been once - never again

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: Neponset
Reviews.Content: We booked a long Easter weekend stay with our elderly parents from Florida. The staff was gracious and accomodating. The location was ideal for our purposes. The corner rooms were clean, spacious and comfortable. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Decadent vacation in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Adamscott
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. From the moment we checked in, we felt like Royalty. We checked in early, and as expected our room wasn't ready. Rather than tell us to just check our bags, we were given access to the elegant lounge on the 26th floor to have a refreshment and a snack. It was amazing. We set out for the day after checking our bags only to return to the most incredible room I have ever seen-and I've seen a lot of rooms. We were upgraded to an Astor Suite! Basically a beautiful room with a sitting area. Not enough room to say all the good things about this facility, but if you ever have the chance-stay here. I can promise you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “When an opportunity hits, take it.”
Reviews.Author: fastball16
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf recent for work and it was the best opportunity I had to stay at such an esteemed landmark. Granted the glitz and glamour of the Waldorf is past it's prime (i.e. such as the W across the street and Time Square hotels now competing), the nostalgia and history of the Waldorf can not be missed. On the week day it's mostly like us business travelers, so the overall traveling experience is decent since I'm not fighting elevator space (which is small) with shop-o-holics. I had a superior room and both the super-large king and the pull-out couch were surprisingly comfortable. The bathroom was quite guilded, but not super tacky. The TV was at least 46 inches, which I think is larger than the average hotel size (42in.). I had an incident where I didn't have hot water for almost 10 minutes after running the water. I called housekeeping and someone came up within 5 minutes. I say this in precise time because, for some reason as the maintenance guy told me, it took me about 15 minutes of running the water to get hot water. (Which is odd since I'm was on the 6th floor, so I couldn't imagine how long it would take if I was on the 27th.) Which also seemed like a very non-green thing for the hotel. Overall, for the business rate I received, the location to my work office, and quality of service from the people at check-in to check-out enabled me to give this place 5 points/stars. This place exceeded my expectations and would definitely come again for pleasure. Additionally, I would recommend researching/comparing other hotels, because like me, you might find the Waldorf a considerably less expensive from Marriott chains and local inns around Midtown / Lower Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful - shame theres no dress code !”
Reviews.Author: SkyblueConnecticut
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel - everything we imagined, the room/suite was fabulous even though we had only booked a regular room, 2 bathrooms, dressing room, fabulous bedroom. My mother flew in from England to celebrate my birthday and her room was equally as plush. My disappointment with the Waldorf is with their lack of dress code. We alongwith many other guests had cocktails in the lobby bar area and most of us were dressed elegantly as one would expect when staying at such a nostalgic landmark. Imagine our thoughts when through the lobby wandered an assortment of guests in baseball caps, the shortest of shorts, ripped jeans, hoodies and an assortment of sports footwear. This was not one party but a number of different groups - my mother wanted to sit in the lobby near to the Cole Porter piano and whilst I appreciate the seating area is open to all guests it was most disturbing to view loutish scruffy unkempt guests sprawled across the beautiful couches. I have stayed in a number of Ritz-Carlton hotels and most of them have a strict policy for sportswear i.e. if you wish to wear shorts and training shoes then you have to clear it with the concierge and they will escort you to your destination. What a shame, we toured the hotel - looked at all the stylish sophisticated previous guests who are all glamourised in wonderful black and white photographs in the hallways and wished the Waldorf could have retained its elegance.

Reviews.Title: “big name - lousy comfort”
Reviews.Author: tomundtom
Reviews.Content: waldorf astoria, what a posh name from past times. be prepared that there is the waldorf astoria where they shelter cargo loads of charter tourists and there are the waldorf towers. however it makes not much of a difference which one you choose to stay. i have seen both and it is a living nightmare. the last time this hotel has seen a major refurbishment must have been when Super Constellation from lookheed martin where circling the sky. the bathroom had the particular charme of former gdr hotels or heap highway motels, you do not want to use them. of course if you want to impress friends at home stay there and nick a bathrope with a waldorf sticker on it. However the brunch on sunday in the mainhall is worth mentioning, as is the price.

Reviews.Title: “You can do so much better elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Travelcity_10
Reviews.Content: Long Neglected. The bathroom light fixture was unhinged, the bedside chair was so old the arm rests and seat had no padding left under the ancient upholstery. I was expecting Ms. Havisham. House keeping came in at 9:30p.m. as my son was sleeping. They had been in already that day, so what the purpose of the second visit was I am unsure. New York is full of great hotels, this is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in decline”
Reviews.Author: Familyof5201034
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with two young kids this past weekend---Paid A LOT and was told over the phone we could check in early (130 or so)---Rooms weren't available until after 3 ( past check in time)--Room reeked of body odor and cleaning solvent---Lamps---and furniture in especially bathroom fixtures were full of dust---really disgusting; service was so so and front desk not particularly helpful or friendly---- Number of people in lobby on Saturday nite with open beer bottles---Yikes---Maybe that's OK at a suburban Holiday Inn bachelor party, but the Waldorf?--Food was great but overall not worth the money....Really had the feel of a place living off its reputation....

Reviews.Title: “Grand”
Reviews.Author: Gim29
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights and must say that this hotel is absolutely beautiful and has a great history. Walking around this hotel you can feel how grand it once was. On the plus side: friendly staff, nice spacious rooms, hotel history, great beds, child friendly, Minus: expensive (get a good deal), $20 for 24hr. internet (I think I should be free these days), small bathrooms. Other than that the hotel is pretty nice, only if you get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Just Grand”
Reviews.Author: DeagleSunshineCoast
Reviews.Content: What a Grand Hotel experience. As a first time visitor to NYC and one who appreciates the fine buildings, the Waldorf exceeded expectations. We had a big room with a King size bed. A beautiful genuine 30's cabinet that served as Flat screen TV stand, dresser and fridge. Park Ave Foyer is a treat to spend time in. Comfortable and luxurious furniture and free WiFi a nice place to chill out and people watch, while sipping a coffee from the Starbucks near the entrance. Staff from check in to housekeeping were friendly (yes this is NYC) and efficient. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm”
Reviews.Author: YorkJean
Reviews.Content: Just spent six nights there and had an excellent stay.Very welcoming receptionist took a little time to find us a good quiet room away from ice-machines and elevators.Marvellous bed !

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, famous hotel- worth it only if you get a bargain price.”
Reviews.Author: ewe35
Reviews.Content: I loved the history and beauty of the hotel.Also, the service I got when I checked in was amazing. Really helpful and intelligent check in person. The negatives- the room was a smoking room-that's all they had left and the room truly reeked of smoke-the pillow, the bedding-pretty gross. also, the room they gave me was across from the ice machine and it kept me up all night. Admittedly, I was too lazy to move and I was only there 2 nights, but I should have moved. The room was nice- nothing extraordinary- typical 4 star - flat screen, good shower etc. The TV had many dead channels. The gym should be free-it's nothinhg special. The restaurant is sickly expensive, but charming . I blew $160 on lunch. But I knew it going in..I can die saying I nstayed at the Waldorf. If you get a great rate-less than $300 a night-it's worth it- otherwise, visit for nostalgia only.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, unimpressive tiny rooms with long waits and missing items”
Reviews.Author: Xtine98
Reviews.Content: We waited in line for about 15 minutes to check into our overpriced, tiny room with peeling paint and dripping faucets, and my husband accidentally left his wedding band on the table and returned to the room 20 minutes later and it was already missing but the staff told us that no one had entered our room in the brief time we were gone. We stayed in 2 other hotels in Times Square during our trip and the rooms were twice the size, recently renovated, and half the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay but not great”
Reviews.Author: icma45
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in NYC and decided on the Waldorf Astoria based on its storied history. Well, we think the best years of the W-A are in its past. We had a standard room which was of adequate size. But, it is outdated. The bathroom could use some updating as well as the AC. Temp set at 65 but felt like 85. No free internet in room (lobby is free). No coffee in the room either. Staff is friendly. Bed very comfortable. Quiet floor. Very good location. It was nice but perhaps at a bit lower rate it would be better.

Reviews.Title: “The worst ever experience of my life!”
Reviews.Author: petal92
Reviews.Content: This was not the Waldorf Astoria of old, that was gracious and comfortable and more importantly clean. The Waldorf of today is grubby, wallpaper peeling and the rooms so small I thought I was in a broom cupboard! My stay in New York was totally compromised by the state of the hotel we had to stay in, and I will never ever visit the Waldorf Astoria again, either dead and certainly not alive. Even the staff seemed to have lost the caring attitude they used to have. Waldorf Astoria being grace and elegant - dont make me laugh!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Waldorf Astorisa being gra

Reviews.Title: “Great service in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: dre_techie
Reviews.Content: Hotel was quite busy a week before July 4th, however check-in was done in less than 10 minutes since we arrived. All the services were excellent although the hotel was apparently quite full. Got a nice corner-room upgrade on a reward stay although I don't have status with Hilton HHonors anymore. Still one of the best hotels in Midtown Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Better than I expected.”
Reviews.Author: GlobalMogul
Reviews.Content: My wife accompanied me to NY on a business trip so we decided to stay at The Waldorf as a bit of a retreat. We were blown away by the level of service right from the moment that we walked in the door. As a Hilton Honor diamond member an upgrade was already being upgraded before we asked. Our upgrade was from a superior room to a one bedroom suite on the 21st floor. Amazing! We ordered the hotel signature breakfast in bed and we were not disappointed. We ended our stay with a late checkout and a time of shopping around town. I would definitely recommend the Waldorf for anyone wanting more than just a hotel room in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: odeeEdmonton
Reviews.Content: Read several reviews that made the place sound like some kind of has been, faded glory of a relic that needs refurbishing. Wrong. We had a quiet spacious room with flat screen tv, empty fridge, Speakman shower head / tub . In 102 F we appreciated the air conditioning at 65 F. We checked out the lobbies of several hotels including the Palace, St. Regis, Algonquin, the Plaza but all pale in comparison to the Waldorf Astoria. The location on Park Avenue and Lexington was ideal - close to Grand Central Station, 51st Metro station (across street), Top of the Rock, etc. Lots of small quaint restaurants on 2nd avenue including Gulluglu which has the best baklava from Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Time of our Lives”
Reviews.Author: CanadiansinNYC
Reviews.Content: Our expectations were far exceeded. A trip that was 1 year in the making became a reality. The grandeur of the hotel is amazing! The service was top notch. The beds were extrememly comfortable and the rooms extremely clean. A shout out to Pedro and Steve who made our stay at the Waldorf a GREAT one!!!

Reviews.Title: “You Get Exactly What you Ask For!”
Reviews.Author: familytravels2009
Reviews.Content: I love New York City and have been fortunate to have travelled there at least 2 times/year for the past few years. Having stayed at other hotels in NYC I would only stay at the Waldorf!!! My past 4 visits-2 this year have been OUTSTANDING!!! My husband and I have stayed in hotels outside of NYC..and we have yet to find one that offers the level of SERVICE that we have received at the Waldorf. We have paid much higher rates and have received far less. From experience: we always book directly with the Waldorf and select the e-standby upgrade. Additionally we have only stayed in the TOWERS-truly at amazing rates. If you are disappointed with ANYTHING let the staff know-they will go out of their way to satisfy. In terms of rates-EXCEPTIONAL VALUE compared to other locations we have stayed at! Just tell the staff what your expectations are and they will supersede them!

Reviews.Title: “bull&bear restaurant-Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: artful-7
Reviews.Content: the Waldorf could use some updating and the Bull & Bear Restaurant is so ridiculously bad. the wait staff is totally disorganized-i had to get up and find the maitre d to tell him I had a show to see and needed to leave in 1 1/2 hrs. My oysters were bad and the rest of the meal was ok but took so long to arrive! Several times I had to flag down a waiter and sw another table doing the same thing. I barely made it out on time!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: guyledouche
Reviews.Content: I expected an expensive, luxurious, great hotel and got the total opposite: it's cheap, basic and really not that great. At first got a moldy, smoky room. We got changed to one that didn't stink. The rest of the stay was OK although not at all what I expected. A real shame to lose such a prestigious brand...

Reviews.Title: “Choose for history and location”
Reviews.Author: soonermom
Reviews.Content: My daighter and I stayed here for a total of six nights to see shows at Radio City and on Broadway. I had never stayed in Midtown before and I liked the location. We walked all the time to Grand Central and Rockefeller Center and to Broadway. I also wanted to stay there because of the history ot the place. It was fun to look at some of the souvenirs in the lobby, including the beautiful clock. I found a good package on Expedia which is one reason I chose it, but my last night was an add-on, not part of the package, and honestly this hotel was more reasonably priced than most Manhattan properties. The room was large enough for the two of us. The first night, a Friday, we were bothered by music and noise from a street party down below. When I contacted the front desk they seemed to know nothing about it and weren't too concerned. Most of the other employees we encountered were extremely helpful and kind. I didn't feel like they always had their hands out for a tip, as another reviewer stated, but seemed appreciative when they received one. We also had a lot of trouble with our tv remote, but we weren't really there to watch tv. Our last night we stayed on the Lexington side of the property for the first time and I preferred it because there were many more shops, restaurants, and subway connections as soon as you walked out the door. Wish I'd known about them earlier in our stay. I would stay at the Waldorf again if the price was right, even though my personal favorite hotel is the Lucerne on the Upper West Side. On a side note, I recommend Ellen's Stardust Diner near Times Square. It serves great diner food and the singing wait staff is fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Old overpriced hotel in need of MAJOR renovations!”
Reviews.Author: FlyJayClass
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my third and what I imagine will be my FINAL stay at The Waldorf Astoria in New York City. To make a long story short, myself and two friends splurged on what we thought would be a luxury hotel stay two years ago and we were greatly disappointed in our stay, specifically the dated and tired room we were assigned that had fallen into great disrepair. We all complained in writing and were each given a complimentary stay in a "Luxury Suite". I stayed again once last year using my complimentary stay and then last month I returned with my same two friends for two nights using their complimentary stays. For this, I am very greatful. I honestly do appreciate the fact that I have just stayed in a suite at no cost to myself or my travelling companions however the fact remains, this hotel is old, overpriced and requires MAJOR renovations. I have stayed in 4 different rooms in this hotel, from basic to what they deem "luxury" and the need for significant upgrades has existed in each of them. The bathrooms are like stepping back into the 60's or 70's with any upgrades that have been done being done cheaply and quite some time ago. The carpeting in the rooms is worn and dirty. The air conditioning systems are ancient, the paint is peeling off the walls, furnishings outdated, you name it, it needs to be updated. In addition to the fact that the place needs a major overhaul, The Waldorf Astoria gouges its customers on the extras. In room internet access is an exorbitant $20 per day and I would never recommend ording room service as the food is disappointing and ridiculously overpriced. Try spending $30 on a club sandwich and a beverage! On this most recent trip to the Waldorf I drove to New York City instead of flying. Parking at the hotel is astronomical at $60 a day. I was LESS than impressed when my vehicle was returned to me after having been parked in what must have been a construction zone. It was absolutely covered in a powdery white dust (which I can only assumed was from concrete being chiselled and broken apart near to where my vehicle must have been parked). The stuff was hardened to the paint and somehow managed to make its way to the INTERIOR as well...all over the dash board, seats etc. I take very good care of my car and expect when paying $60 a day for parking that so does the Waldorf. There was no time to complain about this at the time as when your car is returned to you, there is little time to leave it sitting idle without blocking others from getting out of the garage. All in all, I would not recommend anybody stay here. Your hard earned money can be much better spend elsewhere and there are many more affordable NICER options in the New York City Area. I appreciate the fact that hotel tried to change my views of their property my offering us complimentary stays in its "Luxury Suites" however this place is far from Luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Gigantic Old Beauty Offers the best personalized service”
Reviews.Author: Masterdon
Reviews.Content: On my business and personal travels I almost always stay at Hilson properties and faithfully earm Diamond points for free stays with my spouse. Being interested in history and beauty, service, and location the Waldof Astoria in New York City is the perfect place for us . If you have Hilton points or you would like an outstanding hotel experience, I highly recommend this hotel. Jackie at the Diamond reservation desk, exemplifies the superb professional and excellent hotel service. Although the rooms and suites vary in space and location, they are all clean and sparking.We stay there at least once a year, and are returning next week for seven days to this historical and beautiful sight. I really appreciate the personalized and efficient service that employees, such as Jackie, enable us to enjoy..

Reviews.Title: “close it for major refurb”
Reviews.Author: dubainick
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in June and was given what I assume was a pretty basic room. Pro points: room size is OK; location is good; lobby art decor features are great for fans of the style which my wife is. Negatives : 1) decor is dated - the chintzy taste is never going to be mine, but all the supporting features of the room are really past it. Electric points look like third world; bathroom fittings are awful - 1970s crap and I am afraid US fittings in general are awful in appearance compared to comparable European fittings which should be in such a name hotel. 2) view poor - but problem I know for many New York buildings 3) carpets greasy - probably from over used cleaning fluids 4) smelly corridors, smelly room. 5) breakfasts overpriced. 6) being such a big convention hotel it felt like a zoo - as one other recent reviewer said, security should be a bit more alert - do you really want somebody sitting down on the floor next to the lift in a 5 star hotel 7) service for taking luggage from cab - non -existent. 8) air con - rumbling away as it is past its sell by date Overall given price we paid was $299 + taxes, I guess not too bad, but if paying over $350 just forget it there are far better hotels to go to - we shifted to Bryant Park and it was much better. For true upmarket we checked out The Mark and The Surrey - far far better. Maybe the good reviews are coming from people that got better more recently upgraded rooms but I think the number of bad reviews now coming out from here makes me think that the remaining good reviews like the style of furnishings sufficiently to counter the past sell by date aspects of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Was nice but...”
Reviews.Author: dtgmpls
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I stayed at the Waldorf Astoria. The overall feel of the hotel was very elegant and sophisticated. You could almost feel the history jump out and touch you. I would very much compare it to the Drake in Chicago. I stayed at the hotel for a total of 6 nights. My first room was kind of small and a terrible view (for the rate I was paying) but after the first day I asked for an upgrade and was moved to a larger room with a bit better view. Both rooms were very clean and orderly. The one problem I did have was the cordless phone did not work in the second room. I called down right away and it was not until 3 days later and several visits to the front desk that they actually fixed the phone. I was surprised by the lack of service in regards to this particular issue. I didn’t feel I needed to approach them so many times.

Reviews.Title: “Grand, historic hotel but rooms in need of update”
Reviews.Author: SCSLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf Astoria as a treat for our honeymoon. The lobby and public areas are very grand and beautiful however our room was a bit disappointing. It was large well laid out but the carpets and rest of the decor were very old fashioned. On the plus side it was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel is very well situated for sightseeing, shopping and the theatre. Also Grand Central Station is closeby. We had a buffet breakfast in Oscars on the first morning which was very good but overpriced and we also had drinks in the bar area one evening. We were quite disappointed with it as usually the bars in upmarket hotels are a real treat however this one had a poor selection of drinks and lacked atmosphere, rather like sitting in a corridor. The service was a bit slow but polite. Overall we were a bit disappointed with our stay in the Waldorf Astoria as it didn't live up to our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Astoria”
Reviews.Author: SharonOC
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in a perfect position to see everything in New York. Serves the best breakfasts ever.

Reviews.Title: “pleased as punch”
Reviews.Author: hunter033
Reviews.Content: i was looking at the reviews about your hotel. thinking about coming back next feb, with my daughters and grandsons hoping it would be as nice as last time we too were promised anupgrade because of refurbishing bathroom next door but this was only valid for 12 months . when we were last there we couldnt fault it

Reviews.Title: “Adequete but bring your wallet, wouldn't go out of my way to stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: jbiker
Reviews.Content: So, the lobby is historic and nice, and the location is great. But - I think we paid somewhere around $350 for the night - never again. Room was clean and nice but nothing fancy. This is an old hotel with lots of coats of paint. Not a "wow" experience and of course everyone has their hand out... tips expected everywhere you turn.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous-ity”
Reviews.Author: masulliv
Reviews.Content: After reading all the negative reviews on the Waldorf, I was really expecting a bad experience. Much to my pleasant surpise, it was fabulous. The location cannot be beaten, our room was very well proportioned, bathroom was upgraded, check-in was quick and easy. Fresh flowers abound. When one walks through the tiled lobby the scent of lilacs permeates the air. I must say that every single person we dealt with, from check-in to concierge to customer service reps, (who are roaming the floor offering help and guidance) was 5 star. I would add that I got a special price after perusing the internet which made all the difference. For the price, fabulous! Did I mention it was fabulous?

Reviews.Title: “Amazing suite”
Reviews.Author: bus_visitor
Reviews.Content: I I stayed using some Hilton Coupons good for a free night at any Hilton facility. I agreed to pay for an upgrade to a king bedroom suite @ $99/night. What a tremendous deal. Best hotel room I ever had. A huge room by any standards let along for New York City. The living room had a full size couch, love seat, soft chairs, desk, TV, etc. It was a corner room on the 24th floor with lovely views. The staff was great, the bed was great. Made for a stunning stay for our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “huge dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: joeyjump
Reviews.Content: i was really looking forward to this hotel and what a huge dissapointment! the room was very very dated however the bed was very big and comfy... i could hear the subway every 2 mins 24 7 out the window the bathroom looked like it hadent been refurbished since the 50's infact the whole hotel looks like it hasnt been refurbished for a good 30 years! breakfast was amazing but at a large price, the bulidng look tired and dirty and the lifts were a nightmare not stopping on the right floors and jolting up so fast making your stomach go funny... and the porters were so rude demading tips! i would not stay here again and definatly wouldnt reccomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Nice experience.”
Reviews.Author: Lis80
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights over Memorial Day weekend. The hotel rooms are a bit aged - but I stayed here really for the landmark status. The room I stayed in had two double beds. The room size was just right - not spacious, but just fine for two travelers. Service was friendly and attentive. It's in a very convenient location - just a couple blocks away from Rockefellar Plaza and shopping on 5th Avenue. It was about a $25 cab ride from La Guardia. Here's a warning - buy your own water bottles!! My sister and I bought 4 half-liter bottles of water from room service and it cost $36! UGH! No vending onsite. I still enjoyed my Waldorf Astoria experience!

Reviews.Title: “THAT was the Waldorf Astoria?!”
Reviews.Author: Burlingtonienne
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with our stay at the Waldorf Astoria. I used my HHonors points to book a night there thinking we were in for a treat. My mistake. The doormen did not deign to glance at us as we approached, overburdened with luggage. We let ourselves in and then stood in line in the cavernous, unpleasantly dark lobby for an eternity to check in. Our room was average - a decent size for NYC but the decor was stuffy and dated - and the plumbing was horrible. It took easily a half hour to fill a normal-sized bathtub, and a degree in mechanical engineering to figure out how to get hot water out of the tap. The hallway on our floor smelled strongly of sewage. There was no turn down service, which was surprising, and the amenities guaranteed by my HHonors status were not provided. When we complained about this, and the lackadaisical service in general, we were offered 1,000 free points and our complaints were not resolved. When we complained again at check-out, we were offered a complimentary upgrade to a suite on our next stay. As if there would be a next stay! There are so many great hotels in NY. Don't waste your money here.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Hilton hotel in New York City...”
Reviews.Author: jbgtravel
Reviews.Content: This is a Hilton hotel in New York City and I expect a level of service that never came. First, they did not have Internet access the entire time I was there-no wired or Wi-Fi in my room or the public areas. When I called for help they told me they were sending a tech that never showed up. The rooms have walls like paper and the noise fro the rooms above carry down, even with 10 foot ceilings. The room service sandwich, a Turkey Club that should be hard to screw up, was not toasted, completely dry and looked thrown together. For the money, you are better off staying at the W across the street.

Reviews.Title: “The suite life!”
Reviews.Author: HazemHussein
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the legendery Waldorf Astoria two times in May 2010, and have the following tips to the HHonors Diamond tier members. The hotel will upgrade you to suite subject to availability. However they will not mention that you are entitled to another benefit as per rules. I would recommend that you explicitly ask for the USD20 voucher for beverages. Also try asking for suite 25R which is very spacious and relaxing. The Sunday brunch at the hotel's Oscar's American Brasserie is not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Experience”
Reviews.Author: GranAZ
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a rare leisure trip (I travel usually for business)- to NYC with daughter for her 25th birthday. We got a great deal on the Waldorf-Astoria, and spent 3 nights immersed in elegance and luxury. Even though we had the lowest ranking room, it was wonderful. From the thick bathrobes, to the impeccible cleaning, we did not want for anything in the room that was not immediately delivered. The staff was the most helpful I've experienced, going out of their way to make our stay the best it could be.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - but guest rooms are average at best”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglandTraveler11
Reviews.Content: My wife wanted to stay here since she was a child because of its sheer elegance and history. Everything but the room itself more than met and exceeded our expectations. The lobby and all areas of the hotel are absolutely spectacular and picture worthy, however the guest rooms were unimpressive. I'm sure the pricier rooms are far better, but I advise if you want to have a better experience, spend the better $. The guest room we stayed in was very plain; the bed was very hard and the overall appearance was old (yet classy). The TV was a good sized flat screen, but the controller was prehistoric and probably purchased at CVS and had to be pressed multiple times to work. The upside is that the room was very quiet and the bathroom was small, but better than average. If you are a traveler on a budget and want a good breakfast , don't waste your time with a $14 grapefruit at the hotel - go a block away to the New York City Luncheonette and have a great breakfast at a good price! Also, be prepared for $50 extra a night to have your car parked overnight in the hotel garage. The service was friendly, hospitable and inviting and everyone on staff was very polite and helpful. Overall, I would definitely come again, but would pay for a more upscale tier room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but that’s all!!!!**READ IT**”
Reviews.Author: ili_Boston_MA
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel the door men were “too busy” doing nothing to open the cab door or helping us with our luggage and as I saw the next few days of my stay they only helped people that arrived with limos!! The room was nothing special and the bathroom faculties were bad. The second day of our stay we realized that some things were missing from our room, not valuable stuff but useful for our stay (a deodorant and a hear band). We thought that the maid had put them somewhere in the room so we started looking around. We didn’t find our things but we did find a used plate with knife and forks in the draw of the TV table from the privies guests!!!UNACCEPTABLE! (I have uploaded the picture of this plate!) I immediately called the reception to complain about it and they told me that the manager would come to our room instead they send two maids to pick up the plate and security for us to fill out a form for the missing items. The maids were supposed to show up and clean the room twice a day (morning and late afternoon). During the third day of our stay the maid came to our room during the afternoon and we told them to come by in ten because we were getting ready to go out. But they never came back. When we checked out I decided to go to the reception and complain about all these things. I asked to see the manager or someone to say all these things that happened during out stay but the reception guy told me to tell him about it. He told me that they wanted me to come back and offer me a complementary stay. Since the room information was in my friend’s name they asked me mine. In less than 24 hours they had email my friend telling her that they lost my information and if she could provide them my information again. In my opinion it is unacceptable loosing guest information in such a sort term. A month has passed and I haven’t heard from them. Anyway I don’t think I will be going back, not even for a complementary stay! I don’t think that this is what you expect from a four star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but room disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Falajoy
Reviews.Content: Have heard about the Waldorf ever since I was a child (considerable time ago) and decided this was going to be the hotel for us when visiting New York. It is impressive and the staff were terrific, nothing too much trouble. However, our room definitaly could have used a facelift. The carpet was circa 1970s and the windows were so dirty was very difficult to see out. I also didn't like the fact that the duvet had no cover just a sheet under and one above. I would have liked to know that a duvet cover had been changed between the last occupant and us as don't think the actual duvet had been laundered. The minibar was empty except for a plastic food container with some stale tuna left by previous occupant. It was also not cold. I mentioned this to the receptionist who was appologetic but said the minibars were not working because of a computer glitch. After a couple of complaints from me because I wanted to have cold water to drink in my room, eventually a fridge was sent up. Think housekeeping needs to be sorted out as when in the bath you can see years worth of dust and scum under the sink on top of the pipes. Also found the room quite dark even when all lights were switched on. Unfortunately, I had forgotten to pack my small make up mirror and the mirror in the room was smoked glass so had to use bathroom mirror for makeup and there was no pull out kind just the mirror above the sink so just had to cross fingers and hope my foundation was not on too thick (you ladies out there will know where I'm coming from).

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Astoria - a touch of luxury in a bustling city!”
Reviews.Author: SUZIELOU
Reviews.Content: We went to NY for my 40th birthday and as a treat we stayed at the Waldorf. First impressions are of a very grand building that has a lot of history. We went to our room and we were slightly disappointed as it was so small and we were there for 12 nights. When we spoke to the receptionist she said we could have an upgrade due to our Hilton Honors status but we would have to wait till the following day as they were full due to it being Mothers Day. Our new room on the same floor (26th) was huge. We had a separate living area, 2 bathrooms, a large bedroom with a separate wardrobe area and 2 tvs! The mini bar was due to be replaced so it didnt work but they sent us a fridge up to our room to use for our drinks! We got the use of the free breakfast buffet in the morning until 10.30 am but this was usually busy and tables were limited. We could also use the lounge to get coffee, tea and water from 12 til 4pm. All the staff were very helpful especially the concierge who booked restaurants for us. The rooms were very clean and we even got a turndown service in the evening. Some of the decor was slightly jaded but this is a classic hotel with a lot of character and history about it so a few scuff marks here and there is nothing. It was noisy at night even on the 26 floor but that was police and fire sirens. My only problem was and this is common in most US hotels is there is no tea/coffee making facilities (except for the free lounge for our floor) The lifts were usually empty and very quick. We had great views from our room too. As it was my birthday by hubbie arranged for a cake which was sent up to our room on my birthday and was delicious. They also sent up a complimentary bottle of champagne and some little chocolates which was a nice touch. My husband also booked some flowers throught the hotel which were beautiful. It was also our anniversary on our trip and we got a complimentary bottle of red wine too. The hotel is in a great location- just far enough from Times Square for it not to be too noisy. Althought there are thousands of cabs in the city it can be difficult to get a cab at night. The doorman will flag one down but give plenty of time for dinner reservations especially if the weather is bad as a lot of cabs dont stop. There are a few unsolicited 'luxury' cabs which stop outside the hotel but I wouldnt recommend these to be safe. There is wifi in the rooms but you have to pay so use the reception area which is free. There is a limo service at the hotel which we booked before hand that picked us up from the airport (even though we were delayed by 2 hours) and took us back to the airport. There are 4 resturants and a bar in the hotel so you are spoilt for choice (especially the Bull and Bear which serves excellent food. There is a business centre which you have to pay for but there is 1 computer set up to allow you to check in to flights on line for free and print out your boarding passes. There is a Guerlain spa in the hotel for a bit of pampering and a fitness centre to work off all those calories. All in all I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this majestic palace and if I could go back to NY I would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A truely exceptional week spent in The Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: JohnelnWeldon
Reviews.Content: We managed to get a great deal for our week stay in the Waldorf. I have to say I was bit worried before I arrived as the deal seemed to good to be true - I though they might of put us in a room in the basement!. When we arrived at the hotel all my fears were put to rest immediately. The lobby is real gem - luxurious and relaxed. The bedroom (on 12th floor) was decorated to a very high standard and the bed was very very comfortable. The hotel is really beautiful and kept to a very high standard. It is in a very good location too - 5 mins walk from the Rockefeller Centre. The only problem with this hotel is that when we go back to New York - we will HAVE to stay here - nowhere else will do now! A truly exceptional experience.

Reviews.Title: “I expected a WHOLE lot better”
Reviews.Author: KAS1981
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell? I was just simply NOT impressed. If you read my other reviews on Trip Advisor, you'll notice that I've been to lots of other smaller named hotels, for a whole lot cheaper where giving an honest and great review is most certainly not an issue. This hotel on the other hand received 3 stars, and that's only because of how beautiful the lobby was, how clean the rooms were, and the incredibly friendly bellman who greeted us. Other than that, it's definitely not worth the $300something per night that we paid. The rooms were very tiny and nothing about it stands out. I'm still trying to get over the fact that I paid over $300 a night to sleep in a little box, where even the bathroom door showed its old age. Instead of replacing a very old door, what they did was constantly paint it over year after year after year. Now what you have left is an incredibly old bathroom door with thick layers of cream colored paint. The headboards on the bed were old and cheap looking, and the carpet in the room needs an upgrade. It was nice saying that I stayed at the Waldorf in New York City, but I honestly don't think I'll be paying this hotel a visit anytime soon, nor do I recommend it, especially if you plan on staying in one of their standard size rooms. For that price, I'd honestly prefer to stay at a nicer hotel somewhere in Queens, commute into the city and treat myself to a wonderful dinner and/or spa with the rest of the money.

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping in an old castle museum”
Reviews.Author: grooveTlv
Reviews.Content: The service is great, the best. The standard room was small and felt like sleeping in old castle. The superior room was much nicer, though the bathroom is rather small. No WIFI in the room But still, a classic hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great experience in this historic grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ccheezee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf for a few nights. Overall the experience was great. It didn't come cheap but Waldorf and cheap don't go together. The Good The interior of the hotel matched it's look of a historic hotel. Knowing this going into a reservation may allow you to appreciate the grand architecture of a time past. If you are expecting a new modern look, you will be disapointed in the Waldorf. The grand entryway is beautiful and leads to the main hallway which holds the historic clock. Staff was very helpful. We didn't get the room size and bed request we had on the reservation, but staff worked hard to find a replacement which was a downgrade from our original selection. However we received a discounted price for the downgrade. Our "downgraded" room was nicely decorated with the Wifi setup and alarm clock and TV as the only new style decorum in the room. The furniture and fixtures in the bathroom look like they have been there for years however the fixtures and furniture were still good. A floor manager knocked on our door to check on us which is a rare standard of service to receive. Try to get a corner room (like ours) because it allows for additional windows and views of the New York Skyline. We walked from Times Square, however a short cab ride will only cost a few dollars (preferable if you can't walk more than a few blocks). There is a subway stop next to the building and a short distance from Grand Central Station. We walked with our luggage from Grand Central Station however this is not recommended. Good proximity and location in Manhattan. The hotel has a lot of history and a list of President(s) and famous people who stayed there. The Not So Good Pricey, Pricey, Pricey! We found ourselves going elsewhere for food and a nearby drugstore for other items. The price of the room will turn a lot of people away. This is a Old School hotel and some may be turned off by that look. Although I appreciated the architecture style of a bygone era, others may feel the need for an upgrade. Even 15 floors up you can hear the traffic below at times, however what do you expect smack dab in the middle of Manhattan. Overall a great experience and I would stay there again. Very pricey but a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “keeping up appearances”
Reviews.Author: Katjang
Reviews.Content: We got/get the strong impression that initially the hotel is trying to accommodate you in rooms of lesser quality. You only get a better room after having made a protest at the reception. Very annoying. I've seen more reviews stating the same problem. Never again. There are far more customer friendly and better hotels in New York, where you get value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “WOW...WOW...WOW”
Reviews.Author: annieGravesendKent
Reviews.Content: what a truly wonderful hotel sure has the wow factor as soon as you walk in its stunning atr deco staff great very helpful and friendly but not "in your face" bedroom wonderful food out of this world and it didnt cost an arm and a leg if you go yo NY stay there

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Corry2006
Reviews.Content: we had a wonderful stay at the waldorf for a week at the beginning of May. stayed in the King mini suite (room 20m-corner room) for $370+tax a night. we were a little hesitant about staying here because of the bad reviews. we were pleasantly surprised at how beautiful our room was. the mini-suites have a large living room (seperate from the bedroom) with a couch, chair, office desk & chair and big screen plasma TV & mini fridge. the bedroom was a good size with another big screen plasma TV and large marble bathroom. the bed(queen) was very comfortable. there were 2 closets-one in the entry way & one in the bedroom. the room was very clean & quiet. no problems with the A/C either. in room safe provided as well. the hotel & room are very elegant and historical. the lobby & ballrooms are breath taking. we found the service excellant & quick from the moment we checked in to the moment we left. good location too. Times Sq., theatre district, Roc Centre & designer stores are a couple of blocks away. room service was fast but pricey...a pizza & burger cost about $120 usd. drinks at Sir Harry's bar were about $20 each. the only compaints we have are that there is no counter space in the bathroom. there was no place to put your toilettries, hair dryer, make-up, ect. which made getting ready in the morning quite challenging. the room could also use a new fresh coat of paint. the paint & wallpaper were peeling everywhere. I know it's suppose to look old & historical but it would look so much better if the walls were freshly painted. It's true what other reviewers have commented on regarding prostitutes/escorts in the hotel bars. If you are paying attention you will be able to pick them out. we sat right next to a table one night when this was going on. the staff didn't seem to care. It's too bad because there were families in the bar also. the bar is open to the public so I don't know how they could prevent that. if you buy your theatre/musical tickets at the hotel expect to pay a large premium. extra fees are added on & we paid almost double the ticket price. the seats were excellant however. they must set aside good seats for the hotel guests. If you appreciate elegance & history, it's worth staying here at least once.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Fault - It's Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: LilLou25
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a hassle free stay with some luxurys then this is the place for you. We had absolutely no problems whatsoever with this hotel. Right from the moment you arrive, your taken back by the grandness of this hotel and just how beautiful it is, but it's not just that. The staff are amazing, they will literally do anything they can for you, receptionists, conceirge, room service, absolutely everyone. Hotel itself is stunning. Rooms are adequate, we got a great rate on a two double bed room for two people and there was more than enough room for us - and we're both girls who like to shop! The shower - I have to say the best shower I've ever had! It's well placed too, you can easily get to whichever attraction you want to visit from here, and being Park Avenue is never short of a taxi if you need one either! All in all would definately stay here again, and would reccommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Living off past glories”
Reviews.Author: Regularstayer
Reviews.Content: I found the Waldorf comfortable but very impersonal and although the rooms and location were good for the price I would be inclined to stay somewhere smaller next time i visit NY.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, very beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cosmicgirl_77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three wonderful nights in this amazing art deco hotel. We found the staff to be very professional and helpful and the hotel was well maintained. The room had everything we need and the location felt very safe, only a short stroll to the Rockerfeller Centre for a spot of ice skating and the underground was straight out of the rear door next to a nice Strabucks which we frequented for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip for Citigroup”
Reviews.Author: DickB2
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. I had always heard wonderful things about the Waldorf and they were all true. It is truly a magnificent place to stay. Everything is upscale and the service was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Trading on it's name... the wow factor being the lobby.”
Reviews.Author: henandshell
Reviews.Content: A group of us booked the Waldorf as for many it was their first time in New York so where better to stay than this iconic hotel? On reaching check-in, we were immediately offered an alternate option, that being all of our hotel costs would be covered if we moved over the block to Days Inn, a 2 star hotel (a sister hotel to the Waldorf). This was because a conference had over-run. Now we did not book the Waldorf to stay in a 2 star sister hotel across the road, so not clear why we were asked. I am also a Hilton Gold Card holder, so they would have known my preferences. However for refusing to move to Days Inn we were allocated a very small dingy room at the back of the hotel, with a tiny bathroom, which was many years old. Single glazed windows, so cold air blowing in. Not what we expected at all. The following morning my wife complained and we were offered a bigger room, on the corner of the hotel. Again the bathroom was very dated, the windows did not fit, and I know for the money we were paying we could have got much much better deal in New York (I had been to NYC a few times before).
