The hotel itself is prohibitively expensive to eat or drink in, you can cross the road and get the same cup of coffee at at one tenth of the price. Sadly its a hotel that has a great lobby that really takes ones breath away when you enter, once you are past that, it is very much all down hill - which is such a shame. The hotel has seen better days and is need of a refurbishment and to make the rooms and the bathrooms much more up to date. Even though the rooms are small, I get that, it's an old hotel, so you can't magic up space, but care and attention to modernising the rooms would go a long long way. It can surely only trade off the tourist buck, or its history for so long? Over all I wish I had booked somewhere else for my wife and our friends first time in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: myTuscanyAdventures
Reviews.Content: As part of the last leg of our USA honeymoon, we stayed in the Waldorf=Astoria for 4 nights. My wife was a little skeptical as she had read a few bad reviews, but we still went ahead with the booking, thinking how bad could it really be... It was excellent! we had a King Suite room, which was more than enough for us. Sitting room had TV, small dining area and sofa and a sofa chair with a separate air conditioned zone. The king bedroom had safe, small walk in wardrobe, en-suite bathroom, comfortable bed, air condition and another TV. We were in the 15th floor so the road noise was minimal except for the odd firetruck/ambulance. The public areas was very impressive and we were impressed with the taxi/limo separate entrance with its own staff for luggage and taxi's. All staff were very friendly, very professional and accommodating to make our stay as hassle free as possible. We had breakfast, lunch and dinners around normally just a few blocks from were the hotel is located, there are so much choice around it would put many European cities to shame. All in all a fantastic hotel in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “In a word.....Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: notuslimited
Reviews.Content: Had a great 3 night stay at the Waldorf Astoria with my wife. Couldn't get over the friendliness of the staff, the elegance of the hotel, a fabulous room and the quality of the food. The staff noticed it was my wife's birthday and on the second day of our stay we returned to our room to find a nice bottle of Cava (complimentary) to celebrate. Couldn't fault the hotel....one of the best hotels in the World.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous lobby but small, tired rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jules034
Reviews.Content: While the public areas of this hotel are beautiful, the hotel room seemed tired, faded, and past its prime. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, service left something to be desired”
Reviews.Author: s0h
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a room with two double beds with a friend. When given a choice at check-in, we opted for a corner room that was more spacious, rather than a room with a view. We enjoyed the extra space. The room decor was a little shabby, but acceptable. The heating/cooling units did not work well, and when we called to have them fixed, it looked as though the only thing that had been done was replacement of some newer cheap looking knobs. The concierge seemed a little dis-interested in recommending a restaurant for lunch, but in the end he did direct us to a very good Italian restaurant. Room service, internet, etc. comes at a great upcharge. You are supposed to be able to print boarding passes for free in the business center; however, the computer was broken. We informed the front desk and the concierge of this, and it was still not fixed later in the day. Ultimately, we were able to get the concierge to print out our boarding passes. The location of the hotel is great, and it was nice to stay in a historic place; however, the staff is not overly friendly or helpful and you pay a price for everything you get. There was no coffee maker in the room, and the Starbucks in the hotel is overpriced (as is room service); however, there are two Starbucks within a half a block to walk to.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful- changed my room 5 times”
Reviews.Author: RSC
Reviews.Content: I am a HH Gold member and had to queue to check along time to check in. Staff were not very friendly in the lobby. Despite this the hotel was busy with several conferences and parties. My 'superior deluxe' room which was an upgrade was tiny and the next door building on the Lexington side has a noisy generator on full blast. I rang to move rooms and a Manager had to come and see what I was talking about. They told me it would stop but I said I wanted to move rooms. Anyhow next room had air conditioning that would not switch off- cue engineer- not happy about that when you want to sleep. Upgraded again but then in the Astor suite the heater did not work and the air conditioning was dodgy.. In addtion to this housekeeping called to ask when they could do the room even though the sign was up to not disturb thus waking me up. Not worth staying- not luxury at all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect old style glamour”
Reviews.Author: brooksie1973
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel the week before Christmas. Was so excited as always wanted to stay here. Needless to say it didn't disappoint. Please ignore all the negative comments. The rooms were like mini suites with bathroom, bedroom with en-suite, lounge area and walk in closet, all of which were beautifully decorated with a charm of a bygone era. The communal areas, especially the lobby were stunning, particularly with the Christmas decorations being up. There was also the convenience of a Starbucks coffee shop within the hotel, but please don't expect to pay the same price as elsewhere. It is expensive. We had room service breakfast on our last morning. The service was wonderful, as was the food but it was pricey. Worth it as a treat and a great way to end our stay. Would definitely go again, unless we stay in the Plaza!!

Reviews.Title: “Great but ...”
Reviews.Author: teofilotrueba
Reviews.Content: The room was very large (almost double). Superb bathroom. Queen bed a little undersized. All beautiful but with a backtaste of old. If you can reserve in advance and have a good deal it is ok otherwise it is too expensive for what you get. Curious: large wardrobe but without safe! You have to deliver your money and passaport to a dedicated office. Strange, isn't it?

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Landmark Hotel but slightly lacking in that personal touch.”
Reviews.Author: JoozUK
Reviews.Content: I had always wanted to stay at this famous hotel and was very very excited about it - despite some of the negative reviews I had read on here. We went for a long weekend over Easter, so I guess it would have been an extremely busy time of the hotel calendar ,however we found the service to be very, very impersonal. The doormen 'underground' when we arrived in our limo were not too welcoming - pretty abrupt to be honest. We had to find our own way up to reception and when we got there, we had to queue for ages to check in - v frustrating with 2 young kids after a transatlantic journey. We were assigned our rooms and given our keys and left to get on with it - nothing was explained to us about where to go for breakfast and at what time etc - we had to come back and queue up again later to ask that. We also were not advised that they had removed all the mini-bars from the rooms for updating - we found that out ourselves when we got there. Trying to speak to the concierge also involved a lengthy wait and even then we didn't find her particularly forthcoming. Our room (an Astor Suite on the 19th floor ) was gorgeous though - yes, old fashioned , but absolutely in keeping with the hotel and I didn't feel it was at all 'tired'. It was v spacious and the views out of our 5 ( yes 5!) windows were amazing. However, we could have done with the mini bar, Wi-Fi ( I think all decent hotels should offer this now ) and a children's channel on the TV ( couldn't believe that with all the channels in the US, they couldn't even give us one free kid's network - you had to pay for anything remotely cartoonish). Despite being so high up, the noise at night from outside was unbearable - constant car horns and sirens. I'm assuming it's like that wherever you stay in New York? I didn't sleep a wink the 1st night - takes getting used to I guess! The hotel inself internally though was very quiet - ie no disturbance from other guests/doors slamming/toilets flushing etc. We had breakfast in Oscar's each day and I have to say that was fantastic. The food was fabulous and the staff in there were absolutely brilliant - they even waived charging the children to eat which was unexpected and highly appreciated. In a nutshell - the hotel itself is absolutely as gorgeous as I had imagined and I loved just wandering around, taking it all in. Location and price are outstanding but I'm not sure if I would go back there though - I have seen it /done it if you know what I mean, so if I ever returned to NYC I think I would prefer to pay a little more and stay somewhere that we were made to feel like actual appreciated guests rather than a number in a line. That being said, I did enjoy my stay there and I'm glad I finally realised a long standing wish.. Perhaps I've just been spoiled in the past by amazing service ( I'm talking Four Seasons!), or perhaps I just need to realise that New York is too busy for all that!

Reviews.Title: “WOW WOW WOW ! EXCELLENT SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: Almondbutter
Reviews.Content: We have been staying in NY for over 1 week and have changed hotels 3 times. 1st at the Manhattan hotel at times square ( worst hotel ever!) then the Hilton that we really enjoyed. As our flight was cancelled we had to get another hotel and what a surprise! This hotel is spectacular! Staff are the best in NY! Very friendly, helpful! the hotel is very pretty and our room with 2 beds spacious enough for both of us as I am travelling with my daughter. I regret not to have booked that hotel to start with as it is cheaper than the others too! I will come back here for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm & Excellent Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: StarsEnd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf on our first trip to New York. Despite reviews I had seen here that were negative, we found our visit very pleasant and the concierge was amazing! The rooms were very clean and exhibited a lovely old-world charm. True, ammenities like in-room coffee makers were not included, but I believe that the presence of some of the more modern ammenities would have detracted from the charm. When I needed to find a dentist after 7PM on a Sunday night for an emergency root canal, the lady at concierge took incredible care of me. Within 45 minutes I was at the dentist, having the dental work completed. As a result of this excellent customer service, from both the concierge at the Waldorf and dentist Dr. Chan, I was able to continue enjoying my visit to New York the very next day. If you are looking for a luxurious and charming hotel, I reccommend the Waldorf. The proved their motto, "The difficult we do immediately. The impossible takes a little longer."

Reviews.Title: “Well taken care of...”
Reviews.Author: BillySpears
Reviews.Content: Spent a lot of time prior to making reservations researching NY hotels. Read many of the reviews here, both good and bad, and decided to take a chance on the WA. I worked with a hotel rep, via phone, in an effort to get a good price. I was given a very good price and was able to get a few charges waived before arriving. Upon arrival, we were checked in quickly and headed up to our room, or more precisley, rooms! We had been upgraded to a two-room suite on the 27th floor. It was perfect, a room for my wife and I and a room for our son, everybody had space. On our first full day out, we came back to our room and found a bottle of wine chilling in a bucket of ice. We are not world travelers, we had never stayed at the WA, we don't belong to any rewards programs but the service and the hospitality given to us blew us away! The rooms were spacious, as well as both bathrooms. The view wasn't much, but we didn't spend a lot of time looking out the windows. Our bed was very comfortable and we had no trouble sleeping. Two issues that did bother us, no ice makers above the 6th floor. You have to call room service for a bucket of ice? And the mini bars have been removed from the rooms. In light of all the tremendous service and customer service these issues were very minor and easily forgotten. It was hard checking out as we had been become spoiled during our stay. If we are fortunate enough to return to NY, we will not hesitate to stay at the WA again!

Reviews.Title: “Old queen, but queen”
Reviews.Author: Stylianos
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Fantastic lobby. The rooms need some refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dodge1001
Reviews.Content: Just back from a fantastic stay. The hotel inside is just pure class. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Well worth the money and would go back there again in the morning. The Bull and Bear restaurant have great steaks and good wine list to suit all pockets.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and a pretty amazing place!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fizzy9
Reviews.Content: We loved the stay there more then what we could of asked for.Best place in New York and also the best place we had ever stayed in! Hopefully come again. Keep doing what you are doing because it is great!!!!!! Beautiful,glamorous and amazing place!

Reviews.Title: “Was expecting more”
Reviews.Author: Wurmer
Reviews.Content: First, We arrived at the Hotel at around 11:00 am and couldn't get our room before 15:00. It's a bit annoying even if you can let your luggages at the lobby. I don't know about you folks but when I get off the plane, I appreciate an opportunity to freshen up and change. The first thing that strikes you when you enter this institution is the lobby, it's gorgeous and luxurious but it seems that this impression stops right there. The room is OK seize wise but looks pretty faded. The AC was working but not extremely well and I wouldn't want to be in this room during a hot blazing summer day. Truth be told, IMHO, this hotel could use major overhaul in order to regain it glorious past and bring it in the 21st century. In the bathroom the celling was bulging downward in a fashion that was suggesting something had gone wrong at one time or another. As for the staff, not much to say since we had very little contact with them.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly, lost it's magic”
Reviews.Author: HobbitLondon
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we've stayed here in the last six years and it has gone downhill. The service is excellent and nothing is too much trouble for the staff. The rooms however are getting very tired looking and the little extras like a well stocked mini bar for a night cap has gone. The fridge remains but is empty (although still advertised on their website) on making enquiries I was told that as a security measure due to parties in the rooms this service was no longer on offer but a 24 hour room service was available. This we used the once for food and bottled water only but with service charge and delivery charge it works out very expensive. Spirits can only be purchased by the bottle so unless you are a beer drinker or want to drink half a bottle of wine room service is not really an option. The room service they did give was indeed first class. No tea or coffee making facilities in the room so if you wanted a hot drink between 6 am and 6 pm a trip to Starbucks in the lobby was a bit of a chore and a bit costly. Doesn't match other Hilton Group Hotels that we have stayed at recently. We doubt if we would stay here again on any future trips to New York as sadly it has lost it's magic which was the reason we returned here this time. Great shame.

Reviews.Title: “A truly wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: joanne91
Reviews.Content: A truly wonderful experience is exactly what it means! After seein the sights,shopping etc..i could'nt wait to get back to the hotel! All of the hotel was so relaxin,the lobby,the reception area,i highly recommend the Bull n Bear restaurant located in the hotel,excellent !! I would definaltely go again!!

Reviews.Title: “tourist magnet”
Reviews.Author: yatsey
Reviews.Content: the hotel has the perfect loation, neither too uptown nor too downtown. first impression was a lazy doorman and annoying revolving doors when trying to carry luggage. then a long wait to check in as the hotel was so busy (conceierge was even busier). its a big hotel and clearly attracts tourists from all over the world judging by the languages I heard. room was a good size for new york but it feels a little dated (ex-plasma tv). if i was trying to impress a partner id stay here but NY has lots of other options to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately, its only the name that is glamourous now”
Reviews.Author: ilovedubaibut
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night break to NYC, stayed at the Waldorf based on its name, history and reputation. The loby is glamourous,but that is where it ends. Upon entering my room it was like time had stood still, and so had the cleaners!, the room was dated, dusty and the bathroom was as basic as they come with a strangely yellow bath. My husband had paid alot of money for this trip and i felt dissapointed for him. The hotel needs to close and refurbish and bring itself upto standard and upto date. Its almost like its seeing how many years can they carry on without a refurb! The walls are so thin too, i will not even go into what we heard from next door! i would not reccomend this hotel unless you are into museams and do not have high standards of cleanliness. Sorry Walforf, but i expected more, alot more.

Reviews.Title: “The Toyota of hotels....”
Reviews.Author: andsank
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the W=A many times going back nearly 20 years. It still has a grand lobby and a a famous brand name. But it is living on past reputation for quality that no longer exists. Tthe rooms are dusty, the furniture is old and in need of replacement, and the infrastructure could use a complete overhaul. I had to switch rooms because there was no hot water in the first room. Hotel staff blamed a faulty pipe. The elevators were out of order for a while. The second guest room had a desk chair that was broken - I sank down almost half a foot when I sat down. Unless someone else is paying, I can't see going back to the W=A.

Reviews.Title: “Steeped in tradition and 'all American' history. A proud hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MB201065
Reviews.Content: Well located for the traveller, easy to get cabs from the hotel. You step back in time in this setting within the hotel. It could be day or night, what does it matter? The hotel takes care of you. The reception desk staff are well briefed. Having mentioned that the television in my room wasn't working, the duty manager looked at me as if something serious had happened. But within the hour it had been sorted with no fuss. Beware of the downstairs lounge/bar area, could have made an expensive mistake if I hadn't checked the prices first.

Reviews.Title: “Faded Beauty Queen”
Reviews.Author: mark_mclaughlin
Reviews.Content: Honestly, there's nothing really wrong as such with the hotel, except that what once passed as glamour is rapidly starting to look very tired as the years go by. Some people will love the chintz, the gold fittings, white-gloved attendants and the liberal use of barely readable fancy script on each and every sig - but it really wasn't for me. As others have noted, the reception and lobby are often overwhelmingly busy. On my check-in in the late afternoon there were twelve desks and probably only four being manned, with a resulting queue sprawling across the lobby itself. Fortunately there were staff on hand to direct and keep things moving, but simply adding more staff on the desks would have helped better. The rooms have been updated with a little bit of technology to drag them into the 21st century - an alarm clock with an iPod dock, a decent size flat screen and an individual room based WiFi router. However, my experience of the internet connection was that it was exceptionally poor, especially for the $15.95 USD daily fee. Other oddities were a lack of a safe and an rather fancy, yet entirely empty, mini-bar. Finally, I only ate here once for breakfast, in what seemed to be pitched as the more low-key buffet restaurant "Oscar's" that's tucked away downstairs. I think everyone knows that your average hotel breakfast price is way overpriced, but seriously for 40 dollars (no, really) I'd expect something more than the tired looking array of hot and cold food on offer here, with coffee and juice served up by aging robot-like staff who seem to have lost the will to smile many years previously.

Reviews.Title: “Landmark hotel has amazing service but could use an update!”
Reviews.Author: legaresimpson
Reviews.Content: I traveled to the big apple with my best friend and her 16 year old daughter - it was their first trip so I wanted to stay at a landmark hotel. The Waldorf is top of the list and the pricing was really great. The hotel itself is still beautiful. the lobby is rich and warm and the service was top notch. The room did need a little updating. There was a flat screen tv and new bed linens, but the drapery had a tear in it, most of the outlets did not work and the mini-bar was empty (as in, it was still there, just nothing in it). There was no safe in the room which I found a little odd. the beds were comfortable and housekeeping did an amazing job. the concierge was very helpful and the hotel bar (sir winstons) was warm and cozy. Over all, if you are looking for a landmark place to stay, I say go for it - they are running some really great specials right now, probably because the competition is steep and the hotel does need a little make over.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: dkpr71
Reviews.Content: Beautiful art deco hotel, Lobby amazing.Cleanest rooms i've seen Yes the restaurants are pricey but good,try Oscars for breakfast.Excellent location. Ignore the negative reviews just book it you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ClaireGBritain
Reviews.Content: We had arranged a special birthday trip to NYC for myself and 3 friends. WE wanted to stop in one of New Yorks well know and prestigious hotels. Therefore we picked the Waldorf. It lived up to all expectations. The staff were really helpful and friendly we didn’t have any problems. Location was excellent only a couple of blocks from everywhere we wanted to walk to. The rooms were big enough and the bathrooms full modern. WE only ate in the hotel once which was in the Bull and Bear which was very nice however with most places in NYC the menus was rather limited but the food was excellent. I would certainly go back and stay there again and would recommend it to anyone wanting a little bit of glamour for their trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulaJ2
Reviews.Content: History, service, location all rolled into one lodging experience!

Reviews.Title: “Staff very helpful and service great.”
Reviews.Author: dayzey
Reviews.Content: Rooms are standard for Hilton Group. Art deco themed hotel seems a bit fading. Staff and service good. Bar very expensive. Lower floor rooms very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a mixed bag...”
Reviews.Author: newyorker016
Reviews.Content: We put up my 85 year old mom for night in honor of her birthday and had my teenage daughter stay with her. The room was upgraded to one in the Towers and was very nice. The staff was helpful at check-in and in guiding us through the building; my mom and I both have mobility issues. We dropped my mom and daughter back at the hotel at about 10:30 pm only to get a call from my daughter shortly thereafter telling me that there was a pile of excrement on the carpet next to the garbage can! I called Guest Services and the person was appropriately apologetic and said she would look into it; I gave her my number and 2 hours later, still no call. I called again, and spoke to the same person. She said housekeeping had cleaned up, and they were "looking into what happened." I pointed out that she had not called me back as promised and also that I had wasted about 30 plus minutes on hold and on hang-ups trying to find out what was going on. They offered my mom a free breakfast, which she turned down. Finally, they said they would offer me a voucher for a future night's stay. When I said we weren't excited about staying there given what had happened and asked for a credit for the night's stay, they refused, with some incomprehensible claim about not being able to do so because of the credit card companies. This morning, there was no bill left in the room and more confusion around check-out. I called again and was told that the hotel would email the statement to me. Surprise--no email arrived. So I had to call again this evening, wait on hold, and tell two different people the story in order to get the statement successfully emailed. For an over $300 per night room, this was way more trouble than it was worth. And it remains to be seen whether we actually receive a voucher for a room...or any explanation for why there was crap on the rug!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but wouldnt stay again.”
Reviews.Author: traceygoulding77
Reviews.Content: Took our 18 year old for her Birthday and had high expectations of the Waldorf despite a few bad reviews . We were extremely disappointed as we had booked a Double Deluxe- wether this was 'standard' in the scheme of things I dont know but what we arrived to was a let down. We expected 2 standard sized double beds , but got what appeared to be 2 large singles. there was No Way my husband and I were going to experience a comfortable 3 nights !! I phoned reception straight away who were obviously niggled by my complaint but nevertheless did what they could to find us a better room, which they did. it was indeed a far superior room, but still 'frayed round the edges' ie-the air conditioning/ heating system didnt work properly, and the view was pretty awful. Ive actually been in low budget hotels that have been in better 'fresher' condition . The hotels location for us could have been better, as it was a bit far from most attractions [ a 15/20 min walk] but with the weather being pretty bad I suppose that made our walk feel worse. We didnt choose to have Breakfast as we discovered it was outrageously overpriced , but being English I was desperate to have my first morning cuppa.I looked at the Room service menu that priced ONE cup of tea at $8 !! Well, I still had one [which seemed to take ages to come] but went on to find when we checked out that, it did , in fact come to $18!!! I phoned immediately in disgust , and the patronising response was that it was 'service charge and VAT ON TOP !!!! Again most of my Hotel stays have had Tea and Coffee making Facilities already in the room, why not this one???? Not having breakfast did though have its downfall, we couldnt find anywhere in the immediate vacinity that did breakfasts!! we actually had to walk about 20 minutes before finding a reasonable restaurant that wasnt a Starbucks or Costa Coffee. Its been mentioned a few times about this Hotel but I will reiterate that The Waldorf really shouldnt use its Historical past as an excuse to continue charging ridiculous prices. If the management took note of these reviews its position in the ratings would be a lot higher. Overall,I would not stay again, I would stay more central and get my moneys worth.

Reviews.Title: “Some positive --- Some Negative”
Reviews.Author: Happytravelinfamily
Reviews.Content: We checked in early and were pleasantly suprised by having our room available early. The room was large and clean - the front desk and bell staff were wonderful. I would not say the hotel was not "kid friendly" as the front desk and bell staff were so nice but .... there is not a single children's chanel on the television (in all of our travels this was a first). We were not there to watch TV but when I inquired I was told we do not have any children's chanels you will need to rent those from pay per view. There was also no breakfast selections for children - the price for a 4 year old was the same as an adult (room service, $24 pancakes - ouch!!). I would have expected a little more and that is why I gave the hotel 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Very beautiful, but very old, ensure you get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: happytravelsss
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 nights! Booked a suite for 4 adults, which was supposed to include a bar/kitchenette. We got neither. After three nights we bought it up with staff who stated that because the hotel is so old no two rooms are alike, which is fair enough, but don't advertise on your website in the room description that all suites include a bar/kitchenette - or don't give us a room that is not a suite when we are paying for one and staying 9 NIGHTS! Also newspaper was supposed to be included, but had to request it when checking in, website said room included a marble bath, it wasn't marble... Eventually after an hour discussion we were upgraded to a deluxe suite which was so much bigger and better for 4 adults, so don't know what happened to the normal suite we were supposed to get. Then they forgot to bring our luggage to the new room even though the manager and guy were there to bring us to the new room, drama drama drama. Buffet breakfast at hotel is quite expensive and not much variety. Staff were friendly. Had to pay for gym. Overall a nice hotel and beautiful and old and famous, but wouldn't stay there again. A bit far from everything eg. 20 minute + walk to times square, central park, although close to Grand Central. No real touristy things around it. Im glad ive stayed there to say I have been to the famous Waldorf, but next time will probably stay somewhere else. And ps. so many stuck up people in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, not great at all!”
Reviews.Author: AaronandAshleyR
Reviews.Content: Maybe this was amazing in 1919 but sheesh...RENOVATE!!! After all...you ARE the WALDORF ASTORIA! I don't think it's changed since staring in Coming to America!

Reviews.Title: “Meh...”
Reviews.Author: RosslynAnderson
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this hotel was absolutley gorgeous and the prices were high...I must say that I was expecting a lot more. Even though it a "chic" hotel, you should really get what you pay for. Every time I walked into the room after a long day at the Javits center, the room smelt. From cleaners or something else I have no idea, but it smelt like toilet water. I had expected a much more luxurious room for may $500/night. I must confess my dissapointment, and the breakfast was not very good even though it was outrageously over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel, shame about the prices!”
Reviews.Author: WynyardTravellers
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night break at The Waldorf Astoria and have to say that the hotel is stunning and ideally placed for the majority of the attractions. The rooms are well furnished with all you will need. Our room was on the 15th floor and if the windows were clean we would have had a great view! The main hotel area, lobby etc is stunning, there are more staff than you can imagine who were always friendly, helpful and polite. The main criticism we have is that the cost of food and drink within the hotel is ridiculous, we would have loved to have eaten at the hotel and had a nightcap every night but the pricing is crazy. You can walk out of the hote and in 5 minutes have a drink at a third of the price, their loss! All in all we had a wonderful stay and would definately reccomend this hotel to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “love the waldorf astoria”
Reviews.Author: love2travel1000
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and very helpfull. The hotel is beautifull, has a classic look and we would book a room there next time. The room was clean and we had a nice view. The location is great, close to 5th ave and central park. If you book a standard room it will be fine but we stayed in the towers and it was worth it. The rooms were spacious, luxurious and the service is great.

Reviews.Title: “What a great stay we had”
Reviews.Author: theo1146
Reviews.Content: We went to the waldorf astoria in new york for three nights.Stayed in delux king room on 12th floor.It was a beautiful room with a very large bed,the bathroom was to die for.Everything you need.for your stay[shampo.conditioner,body lotion two different soaps.One for the shower one for the wash basin.Pure luxury.Staff were the friendlest I have came across,couldnt do enough for us.Would recommend this hotel.It might be a bit more expensive but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Glamour - fab”
Reviews.Author: JulieB15
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf was fab, great service, lovely room and the location is excellent. Felt like a film star walking about the lobby!!

Reviews.Title: “Experience varies greatly by room”
Reviews.Author: thfc1afc0
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt that the hotel is stunning in the lobby and other comunnal areas, although I have to say that depending on the room that you get I suspect your experience will varey greatly. We arrived at around 2am and had to wait to be checked in even though there were 2 people working it was reasonably busy with other guests checking in. While checking in we found out to our disappoinment that the room we booked was not available in fact they had no rooms of the level we booked and so ended up in standard room. I have to stay if we had to spend our stay in this room, we would have been very disappointed. It looked very tired and in need of a fresh coat of paint. We took this room for the night along with the assurance that we would get a much better room for the remainder of the stay. This is exactly what we got we were upgraded to a large suite on the 26th Floor with a view over Park Ave, the decor style was similar but was in hugely better condition than the room we were in previously. It was a stunning location, from our experience of seeing both ends of the scale I would definately say that the hotel may fall below your expectations if you have one of thier standard rooms if our first room was a fair reflection of that. However if you are staying in one of the suites it is greatly improved. This is by no means a modern hotel and I suspect the room styles have been the same for a great many years but this is part of the charm of the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Couples”
Reviews.Author: Linkaye58
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about The Waldorf except the standard rooms. They are too small for a family of four. Two people could not walk around the foot of the bed at the same time. Service was fantastic and the decor was breath taking.

Reviews.Title: “You do it for the experience”
Reviews.Author: 19flights
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at the Waldorf because I had heard so much about the hotel over the years and it was reported to be one of the best hotels in the world. I could not describe it as the best hotel I have stayed in, I would instead describe it as staying in one of NYC's tourist attractions. The hotel was luxurious and the location is unbeatable but what hotel in 2010 thinks that it is appropriate to charge $18.95 per hour for internet, and it was not wireless internet. I expect hotels to provide free internet services as they are essential for almost any day to day business, in order to use the internet in the Waldorf we had to go to the lobby. Also not all guests have access to the fitness centre so you should find out before you get your room if you can use the centre. Overall the experience of Waldorf, was an experience both good and bad. The service was not up to the standard that I would expect, we had to empty the trash cans and none of the toiletries were replaced. In contrast the front desk staff, the concierge and the door staff were all friendly and helpful. If you stay at the Waldorf do it for the experience but do not expect it to be an amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing lobby, but slightly worn out rooms... To try for the experience.”
Reviews.Author: Maast
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few times there. Each time scored a room upgrade thanks to HHonors status (good) but room was slightly worn out and the air conditioning was never very efficient (particularly in winter) Location is pretty nice yet not very close to the most lively and touristic areas. However the experience is worth it at least to enjoy the amazing lobby of the hotel and to experience the once legendary Waldorf-Astoria... Value for money is so-so except if you find a good package deal, but to try at least once.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Art Deco! Doesn't Disappoint.”
Reviews.Author: poohjee
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the entrance, the doormen was very nice to help us with our luggage and bags (we had just checked out of the The Plaza, whose house car was kind enough to drop us off). Check-in had a bit of a line, although the manager was quick to come and apologize (as apparently a convention was in town). Still not too bad of a wait (about 5 minutes). Was quickly given our room keys and up we went. I've stayed at the Waldorf-Astoria back in Jan. 2006, and this time instead of staying in a mini-suite, we booked the one-bedroom suite. The room was still had its classic red and gold charm. I will say that it was good to see that the TV's were now flat screens (back when I had been there they were still old TVs from the 90s), and that things had been renovated a bit. The bathroom is small and only one person will probably fit in there at a time (the only issue I've ever had with the Waldorf). It was supposed to snow that evening, and it was great finding out that we had a huge terrace all to ourselves that was already full of snow. There was an entrance to the terrace from both the living room and bedroom, which was very nice. Turn down service was nice, nothing I can really complain about... Went up to security at about midnight asking him where a good place to eat was...he did not disappoint and gave us places to eat that the locals went to as opposed to the usual tourist traps. Also, the best hot dog vendor in all of New York (that I know of) has his stand on the corner across the street from the hotel (in front of the church). He's there until 5am...so you should be able to get as many hot dogs as you want. The only thing I really had an issue with was when we checked out and went to get a cab. The doormen on the Waldorf Towers side got us a cab and helped us with our luggage, but wouldn't close my boyfriends door and just stood there. It took us a second to realize that he was standing there waiting for a tip! No hotel staff member has ever done that before. We didn't mean to try and go without tipping him (but we were rushing to the airport and had other things on our mind), but found it a bit rude that he would just stand there waiting. In any case, please dont let that minor thing deter you from staying here! Overall a great experience...the place has so much history, and I always like entering the lobby and thinking about all those who have been there before me.

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying here just to sit in the foyer!”
Reviews.Author: thebooklady
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights, parents and two young children. when we visited New York just before Christmas. If you want to experience the first class service, glamour, decor, spacious and lavish surroundings outside of the rooms, then I can recommend this hotel but if you are more interested in a large, comfortable room then stay somewhere else! The service is fantastic, and despite the constant bustle and activity in the foyers and reception areas, there is always someone around to help and offer advice on everything from booking a babysitter, to places to visit. The prices in the bars and restaurants were quite expensive, as expected, but the service and atmosphere were excellent. We booked an evening babysitting service prior to our trip, using an agency which the hotel concierge recommended to us. This allowed us to go to one of the hotel's restaurants whilst the children were cared for in the room for a few hours. Don't be afraid to complain however, if you consider that you have been fobbed off with a poor room. We thought we had booked the room rated above standard (possibly deluxe), but we were shown to a broom cupboard, with mould on one of the walls and thick dust on the skirting boards. We rang reception, who immediately "upgraded" us without any fuss, to a larger and much more pleasant room. The room was still pretty average and badly in need of a facelift but much improved on the first. This didn't bother us too much as we didn't choose this particular hotel for the rooms, and no doubt the suites and penthouses are impressive! On the whole, would recommend spending a little extra to stay here if visiting New York for the first time, but suggest you contact them to check the standard and location of your room before you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par with the name but it is still the waldorf”
Reviews.Author: Bittco
Reviews.Content: This is a difficult hotel to rate. It is historically significant and has an amazing lobby and really nice if cramped guest rooms. Everyone should stay here at least once just to see what it is like but expect that everything will have to be paid for. The one disappointing thing about this hotel was the service. The front desk was very slow and rude when I was checking in.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: karmajnke
Reviews.Content: I wanted the ultimate New York vacation, so I thought staying at the Waldorf was a super idea. We stayed in the towers, which had a fun exclusive feel. Other than that I am not very impressed at all. I think maybe they gave us a not so good room. Maybe because we were normal people? It was run down looking and the menu was limited. For the money I paid for a five day stay, I expected so much more than what I got. Next time I go to New York I am choosing a different hotel. Save your money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Lobby shame about the room”
Reviews.Author: Baskingseal
Reviews.Content: Although a great experience and a great old leviathan of an hotel, the rooms are the epitomy of 'faded glory'. We were upgraded after being put in a deluxe room but the upgrade was small and although the bathroom area was stylish, it could have done with a major re-grout. Exploring the 'Overlook' style deserted dimly lit ballrooms late at night listening for Jack Nicholson's footsteps was the highlight!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: meegiec
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we got a cheap deal. It was my first time to New York and I thought the location was perfect for what we wanted to do - close to 5th Avenue, Central Park, time Square are all walking distance The room itself is dated - the bathrooms are marble - very impressive. The check in peerson was quite conceited, but I guess that is to be expected. Rooms were clean, the tele was a gianormous plasma, but the food was over priced in the restaurants etc. Starbucks on site!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: jjblock
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with an old friend for a girls weekend. I love modern hotels like the Standard, W, etc. but, we got a good deal here and thought the location would be good & willing to try something different. The room was SO hot when we got there & we couldn't figure out how to turn it down. Waited and waited for someone to help but, got impatient and went out to shop & eat. We came back hours later to find all they did to fix it was crack the window open. The room was ok size. The bathroom was ok. No hairdryer. We weren't in the room that much anyway. Decor was stuffy & old fashioned but, we expected that. Totally unimpressed with the dated lobby. We asked the concierge for lunch suggestions and they sent us to a closed restaurant. The next day we asked for a reasonably priced brunch recommendation. They suggested Oscars (the hotel restaurant). We had the buffet - it was gross. Watery eggs, burnt coffee, a bagel & potatoes - $100 for 2 w/ tip. INSANE!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “best time ever”
Reviews.Author: enncle
Reviews.Content: my partner and i went to ny for thanks given and styed at the waldorf. it was amazing. staff very friendly and helpful, they gave us our room, a king suite but it was located right next to lifts and the noise was like being in an underground tunnel. we ask to move and they let us straight away. drinks and food expensive but you expect it. hotel lovely lots to see. rooms large and clean. hotel situated where you want to be. thanksgiven parade was great . statue of liberty lovely . loved little italy. bbubba gumps in time square good value for money. empire state a little too high for me. best bar in new york was p j clarkes and jimmys corner bar. loved central park .never queued long for any sightseeing but up very early. new yorkk was everything i wanted it to be and the dates we went were fab as it was christmassy but not full of shoppers yet . we went nov 25 till dec 5. will be back. but gonna try the plaza next time. mind you i did think the other guests would be weel dressed but as far as i could see there were plenty of jeans trainers and they didnt seemed to make and effort on the evening either which i thought was a shame. but loved it any way.

Reviews.Title: “Grand elegance!”
Reviews.Author: eaglestailg8ter
Reviews.Content: Stayed late October, 2009! Lower level suite in the older portion of the hotel. Large marble bath was spotless! Bedding very comfortable and separate sitting area provided a place to relax in front of the TV. Dinner and cocktails at the Bull & Bear restaurant - lower level was excellent! Met a number of interesting people during happy hour! Great midtown location!

Reviews.Title: “so disappointing”
Reviews.Author: fpk1005
Reviews.Content: Checked into room at 3:30 PM on a Friday..started out wonderful; was able to upgrade to king bed from queen bed; front desk reception person advised that if we "needed anything" that we should call her personally. Got up to room: heat was soooo high that we couldn't breathe - and the temperature was 42 degrees outside. We couldn't figure out how to turn it down. ...and the television did not go on. So, we called the front desk. We were told someone would be up within a few minutes. We called after 20 minutes of waiting because no one came to our room. We were told again that someone would come right up. After waiting another 20 minutes my husband looked behind the TV and noticed that , not only was it quite dusty back there, but that the TV was unplugged. He tried to get it to work himself after plugging it in, to no avail. We are now in the room 1 hour and no one showed up. We decided to get dressed to go out for the remainder of the evening. We stopped at the front desk to lodge our complaint and was told that, once again, someone would be up to fix our problem. We came back that evening and the TV was fixed but the heat was up to almost 80 degrees! There is no makeup mirror in the bathroom either. We were quite dissappointed that a hotel of this caliber would not have these details worked out within a few minutes of our checkin, if not before. There are too many other hotels in NY of this caliber for us to waste our time like this.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Jud1th
Reviews.Content: I was nervous of being given a tatty room having read reviews from here, but check-in was quick, with a single queue overseen by a cheerful member of staff and Laura, who checked us in, gave us an upgrade because our room wasn't quite ready. We were put on floor 35 of the Waldorf Towers, and the room for three of us did not disappoint. The short corridor on the other side of our door led round to a stylish bathroom with bath and roomy shower, a walk in wardrobe with ironing board, safe, lots of hangers and suitcase stands, then finally came the opulently decorated room with fantastic view over the city towards the river and antique furniture adding an atmosphere of grand country hotel. I love staying in good hotels and this will be put on my list of favourites, together with the De Tuilerieen in Bruges, Ritz Carlton in Berlin and the Inn at Whitewell in the Trough of Bowland. Breakfast was on floor 26 and continental, with smoked salmon and lots of fresh fruit and pastries, though the Sunday brunch looked wonderful, if expensive. My teenaged daughter was impressed by the idea of a chocolate fountain and the cakes looked wonderful; works of art fit for MOMA. Staff were friendly throughout our stay and the housekeeper even showed us a palatial room she was just finishing cleaning before new guests arrived, which looked fabulous. We had a late flight out of Newark back to the UK and the hotel looked after our luggage, leaving us to relax and notifying us when the suitcases were next to the cab they'd ordered at our request. The location is great, on a direct subway north/south and near a bus heading east/west. There are various entrances you can use to bring you closer to where you want to be.

Reviews.Title: “Many Celebrations”
Reviews.Author: TerryK4
Reviews.Content: The first time we visited was to celebrate my daughter's birthday. The second time was to take my husband and daughter to see the Broadway play "The Color Purple". We also enjoyed the Hotel's famous Sunday Brunch.

Reviews.Title: “April 2002 Trip with group of parents and aspiring models”
Reviews.Author: grandmamuppet
Reviews.Content: Loved the Waldorf Astoria. Such a part of American history, gorgeous architecture, some parts being remodeled so some noise and dust, but couldn't detract from the beauty. I think I stayed in an older room, it was small, wallpaper was striped, reminded me of Circus Circus a little. We didn't spend much time there as my daughter was in modeling competitions all day and into the evenings. I slipped away across the street to Cinquanta, a nice little restaurant, for a glass of wine and some dinner. AND, back at the hotel, I met and rode the elevator with Bill Murray! A very memorable experience. I would do it all again. I LOVE New York!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler465
Reviews.Content: At first they messed up our room, but they quickly dealt with it ....... our room was fantastic, and it had a great view of NYC... the food and service was great as well

Reviews.Title: “Great except heat problem”
Reviews.Author: RRMbo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice. Service was fine. We got a great rate and awesome room (suite) by booking in off-season (mid-Jan.). The only real problem was the heating. The heating system is old and despite new room-controlled thermostats, they basically didn't work. Got engineer in there at 10:30pm only to be told that the system is shot and since it was too hot, our best bet was to open the window. Thankfully that worked (and we were up high enough that noise wasn't a problem. If it had been summer and a/c didn't work... that would be a problem - not sure if that would be true. And oh yeah, our room was right next to the Tower elevators - the noise was bad in the spare room but ok in the bedroom. So other than that problem, the room was awesome and we had no problems with anything else. Note: there is a fee for use of Fitness Center unless you are Hilton Gold level.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot to stay”
Reviews.Author: VinnieSydneyAust
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. The location is great in easy walking distance to Times square (10mins at most) and Rockafeller square (5mins). The hop on hop off bus drops and picks up right outside the hotel. Grand Central station 5 min walk . Central park about 10 min walk. Hotel was nice and clean with the staff very helpful. There is free wifi hot spot in the foyer. What a great city.

Reviews.Title: “You could land a jet in this hotel room”
Reviews.Author: sierra_auska
Reviews.Content: We had the incredible opportunity to stay here due to a work trip my partner had been sent on, This hotel is every bit as impressive as you'd imagine. If you asked a passing staff member for a quick direction instead of pointing "That way.." they'd actually walk you half way there, nothing was too much trouble. We did see quite a few of the rooms due to my partners work trip and the decor and furnishings do vary substantially throughout the Waldorf and also the Towers. Our room was beautiful, just a studio but huge for NYC standards, plasma tv and an incredibly comfortable bed with deluxe pillows. Don't think i'd have the opportunity to stay there again but it was definately one i'll remeber for a long time

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: riseborough
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I had stayed in the Waldorf and the first time for my husband and we were not disappointed. Our room was in the Tower and it was perfect. The service was excellent, nothing was too much trouble and we were made to feel very welcome and special. The location is fine for getting around. We ate in the restaurants and one night in our room before an early onward flight the next morningand the food was very very good, not cheap but worth it. We will defiitely be returning as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had stayed somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: NJFunTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my burthday using Hilton Hhonors points last year and, as one other reviewer aptly put it, it was a disappointment. The entrance is grand but the carpet not only looks like it is from the 70s but has all the stains to prove it, which I found kind of disgusting and not something I think should be tolerated at a luxury hotel. At the front desk I asked if it was possible to have an upgrade but no, according to the manager the hotel was completely booked. When I arrived at my room, it was very small and looked just like any other hotel room, I am extremely sad to say. A view of another building, and right next to the elevator. I assumed they saved the 'bad' rooms for Hilton Hhonors guests. The carpet had a horrendous moldy odor, and the light switch and doorbell were literally haning off the wall, which is at the least unsightly and at the most a fire hazard. When I called to complain they couldn't offer any solutions. The next morning I asked the concierge where I could get breakfast in the hotel and he informed me that the restaurant had closed. There was a huge breakfast buffet being set up in the lobby behind us. When I queried about that he looked at me dubiously and said, 'Yes but that breakfast is [XX amount] dollars". How insulting! I can't believe someone would actually say that in real life! I have stayed many many places around the world, and at hotels I felt were much more luxurious - and much more well-kept - than the Waldorf. I do not plan on staying here again. Wish I had spent my points elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “This Grande Dame Retains her Splendor”
Reviews.Author: HMF58
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I stayed at the Waldorf for 3 nights midweek in January., having booked 2 rooms on the concierge floor. Price per rooms was AAA rate of $269 +tax. Upon check-in, we were upgraded to rooms in the Waldorf Towers--2 corner bedrooms with baths separated by a (private) hall with a living room. The bedrooms were enormous, especially by NYC standards. Baths had separate walk-in showers with good water pressure (even for the 32nd floor), deep tubs with gold fixtures, and a wide assortment of bath products (even dental floss!). The living room was huge, with a fireplace, large flat-screen TV, lots of magazines, sofa, easy chairs etc. Without exception, every staff member with whom we had contact, was gracious and accommodating. When we requested ice we were asked "Crushed or cubes or both?" There was nightly turn-down service. I can't understand past complaints on this site about the Astoria lounge continental breakfast (which is complimentary for concierge floor rooms), as we found it to be generous and delicious, from the fresh fruit with high-quality yogurt and granola, excellent pastries, hearty sliced ham, lox, cheeses, hard boiled eggs and bagels to the very good coffee. We did not eat other meals here, as there are so many other reasonably-priced excellent restaurants within walking distance. Note: the Starbucks down the street is less expensive than the one in the hotel.I take one star away for sleep quality as we could hear very clearly voices in the suite next to us--this is, after all, an older hotel. Traffic noise, however, was not an issue, perhaps because we were on a high floor. Views were spectacular, and of course, the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “An unforgettable experience”
Reviews.Author: MarylandNurseExec
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Waldorf. As I am beginning my 50th year I wanted to celebrate in style. The staff was kind enough to upgrade me from the concierge level to a suite in the Towers. Our initial check in was smooth, however we had to change rooms as the room assigned strongly smelled of smoke which I could not tolerate. As a result of this we were again upgraded to a premiere suite which was amazing. The views were incredible from our floor. I did not find anyone who was discourteous. We were made to feel welcome from the outset. Every member of the staff we encountered were consumate professionals. Guests at the Towers seemed content with numerous "good mornings and good afternoons". The location was great and I loved telling the taxi drivers "Waldorf Towers" please! The seperate entrance for the Towers was very inviting, however we used the Astoria entrance most often. I believe the Waldorf Astoria is a must for travelers if possible. Based on my experience you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “i absolutely loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: salo0061
Reviews.Content: being my first time going to new york and not knowing when i'll ever get a chance to go back i had to stay at the waldorf astoria. ever since i was little ive wanted to stay there. when i arrived at 5 am eastern time the people at the front desk were very helpful and checked our bags in for us they also gave us great advice which turned out to be very helpful. they also called us when our room was ready which was 3 hrs before check in time. our bags were brought to us very quickly. when i got to my room i was not disappointed. the room was very beautiful and a nice size and the bathroom was awesome (i hate staying in hotels that have the shower and tub connected so i was very pleased) during our trip it had started raining and when we got to the hotel the staff were passing out towels to all the guests that wanted them which i was very thankful for since i was soaking wet. i also LOVED the location of the hotel its right by grand central station which was very covenient, we only had to take a taxi to and from the airport which saved us a lot of money. if i ever get the chance to go to new york again i will definately stay at the waldorf astoria again

Reviews.Title: “Not for those of you who like the W”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler2007
Reviews.Content: Look, I understand that the rooms are not pristine and new. But the bed's not in the middle of the room and the toilet right there with it like over at the W. I happen to like the older furniture and the carpet. I don't really want to stay in a room that looks like it was pulled right out of an Ikea box. I like the fact that every room is just a bit different in design etc. And if you use their website you can get nice rooms at extremely reasonable prices very frequently. It's conveniently located. The service is excellent. I will agree that the prices in the restaurants are obscene. I mean, $30 for oatmeal? Get real. The Bull and the Bear has all of the charm of a classic steakhouse without the steak to go with it. Never, ever, get their tuna tartare as an appetizer. If I wanted unadorned raw tuna, I could bloody well find a fishmonger and take a chunk out of a tuna steak.

Reviews.Title: “I expected more - but maybe I shouldn't have.”
Reviews.Author: strengthcoach
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend near Christmas, 2009, with my family – wife, 2 small children. We go into NYC every year for my son’s birthday. In the past, we have stayed at some pretty high end hotels – our favorite is still the Four Seasons. This year, we needed to scale back the spending (no longer covered by an expense account) and got a weekend “deal” at the Waldorf=Astoria. We stayed 2 nights, and paid less than $400 total, not counting the $60 a day (yikes!) for parking. I had never been in the Waldorf before, I didn’t realize how massive it was. The lobby was like a three ring circus, but the guest room was fine, clean, and so were the toiletries and bathroom. The location is good, easy to go up to the park or down to Rockefeller Center, so sight seeing is easy from the Waldorf. My biggest complaint was the lack of free wireless in the bedroom. Sure, they had it free in the lobby, but I believe it should be free, or at least less than $15/day + tax. Would we stay there again? Probably not, but it is a solid “second tier” hotel in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Classic old school hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: holiday10
Reviews.Content: We stayed just before Christmas and were very pleasantly surprised with the rooms. We got a great deal on hotels.com and somehow got an upgrade to the tower suites. Room was very big by NY standards, free breakfast which was crowded at times but hey, it's free! A classic old hotel with plenty of glamour, good service and a great place to be located for shopping and restaurants. We usually stay around this area and i would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: RobbieSun
Reviews.Content: I kinda always wanted to stay at the Waldorf but usually avoid downtown hotels unless its for business. After arriving there, you already know it is a magical entrance, the decor is all it says it is with classic victorian settings and the clock tower in the reception. I must admit it is nice. Besides that, the service was not great and the room was ... well not much. Don't get me wrong, it is a 5 star property but the value for room is not there. Very disappointing for Waldorf and I guess that's where Hilton comes in. This is not a Hilton! This is the Waldorf. Better off at the Four Seasons or the Park next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice position and tradition... BUT NEEDS SOME RENOVATION....”
Reviews.Author: Canneto79
Reviews.Content: Good position and great tradition, nice lobby BUT..... NEEDS MAJOR RENOVATION OF SOME ROOMS AND BETTER MAINTENANCE SERVICE (air-conditioning not working in some rooms and maintenance service not able to take care properly, old interiors, old bathrooms, personnel very low skilled, no safe or low batteries in the safe,... just to name some inconvinience). Stay away from bars and breakfast downstairs , they cost a fortune!! way out of reasonable!!. Definetely there are better hotel in new york and for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: 132012k
Reviews.Content: Returning from a visit to Boston we stayed for one night at the Waldorf Astoria before flying home. What a disappointment. When I booked the room by phone about 10 days prior the pleasant young lady said we would have a queen sized room overlooking the church. What we got was a room overlooking the massive office tower on the other side of the street. Drinks in the bar cost an arm and a leg, and dinner in the Bull and Bush was very expensive. The only solace I have is that we can say we stayed at The Waldorf Astoria. What I can do however is advise others that they are really wasting their money doing what we did. There is a lot better accommodation in NYC costing a lot less.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service, But Old Room”
Reviews.Author: LetUsTravel2geder
Reviews.Content: This place has great customer service. Everyone that works there is so attentive to the customer's needs. The lobby looks great and truly magnificent. The rooms were just ok though. The bed was old and hard. The pillows and sheets were not comfortable. The room was clean, but again I expected more. Waldorf is just a brand now living on its past. But then again we just stayed on a regular room on the 11th floor. There are better rooms from 12 & up.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel downstairs rooms not as good as travelodge upstairs go to Roosevelt instead”
Reviews.Author: lubylooBristol
Reviews.Content: Waldorf Astoria public areas are fantastic exactly what you would expect from hotel with its history. Staff were very efficient but not overly friendly. We arrived in a yellow cab from JFK and were driven into the Waldorf garage our luggage was taken by the porter and checked in but when we opened the bedroom door we were shocked and disappointed even the porter seemed to understand why we didnt like it . We booked a deluxe two double bed room. The room we were given was smaller than what you would have been given in a travelodge. Very dark narrow, very plain no tripple sheeting and not even a safe had to use safety deposit box downstairs. Huge flat screen TV far too big for room, old worn out carpet beds clean but only plain white duvets no decoration plain beige wallpaper, dirty torn net curtains. Was not the room we booked with expedia but even though we told them this and showed them our booking description they politely refused to move us. Don't book this hotel go to Roosevelt round the corner and save a lot of money get a nicer room and breakfast. Starbucks inside the hotel massive queue nowhere to sit and the most expensive in New York !

Reviews.Title: “NYE in NYC”
Reviews.Author: TheJandtheV
Reviews.Content: We checked in to the Waldorf Astoria and were upgraded to an Historic suite, thanks AMEX. The room was magic being there for my Girlfriends 21st birthday it was so special. The room with quarters for help was Amazing, a Dining room a massive lounge room with piano and 3 separate seating areas (Great for the party we had). The bedroom was great and a bathroom that looked like it was out of Scarface. Great hotel super location catered to every need. The shopping in NYC was amazing, the sales were on saved a fortune compared to AUS.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: pinklane
Reviews.Content: As soon as i walked into this hotel, i was impress, the lobby and recepition was amazing, the staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was big with 2 big beds which were so comfortable, and the view from the room was excellent. I would recommend this hotel 2 anyone, i am planning another trip in 2010 and no doubt about it i will be staying in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Just the perfect place to be”
Reviews.Author: su123till
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Waldorf for 10 days and treated ourselves to a King Size suite. It was fabulous and you could imagine Frank Sinatra or many others staying here with happy memories. We certainly did. The staff polite, the hotel very clean and warm, service excellent and location just perfect. We didn't eat in the hotel as we wanted to experience New York's restaurant s and cafe's. A must. If your planning to stay in the Waldorf, it's like going back in time to the 50/60's. Treat yourself to a suite. We booked direct with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New Year at the Waldorf Astoria”
Reviews.Author: flipmodefly
Reviews.Content: This historic hotel was amazing. The bed was devine and our suite was fantastic - but I would expect it to be so at $600 a night. The service was the very best and I would definately go there again. . .

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful....”
Reviews.Author: LittleMissSmiles
Reviews.Content: Agree comlpetely with Swiss traveller about this hotel. We were apprehensive also after what we had read. Thankfully on our arrival all of those negative comments were dismissed. Our room was massive and having stayed in NYC before we knew what small meant! A beautiful old world hotel. We got an excellent rate by calling reservations directly after comparing on their website. Definitely a place to experience at least once in your life time. Brillaint for access to the underground and of course for all that retail therapy.We also found a brill deli 2 streets down from the hotel as you go out the Pk ave. entrance , turn right, cross road and two streets down its on left. Fab breakfasts! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money in Manhattan during New Year celebrations”
Reviews.Author: ArmTravel
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the background: I booked this hotel for our New Year's holiday in July 2009 purely due to very attractive deal on the website (USD 300 for double room, BB). It was before I looked for references on TripAdvisor and discovered all the horrible feedback about run-down rooms, rude staff and poor breakfasts. Ever since and until our trip I was looking for alternatives all the time, but failed to find better hotel offering: either prices were substantially more expensive (even for 3* hotels in Manhattan, or the location was much worse. So, we decided to take a risk, even though we knew that on top of everything else by default we will not be offered the best rooms in the range due to our "deal" booking. Let me also tell you that I had a chance to stay in many hotels around the world, including many Hilton hotels, so I pretty much know what the 4* or 5* standard should be. We were pleasantly surprised, after all. We were given Deluxe Double King Room on the 8th floor (one of the lower floors in the hotel). The room is very spacious (we did not need so much room in the closets either), the bathroom is OK, the heating system is loud, but it did not disturb as at least for us walking in the city for the entire day allowed very heavy sleep at night. We had a big flat TV and iPod dock - so, no problems with modern touch either (if only we had time to use them on our vacation to NYC). Yes, the overall condition is certainly not first year freshness, but at lesat there is a lot of character as opposed to the majority of other Hilton family hotels. The breakfast was served in Oscar's brasserie, the variety was very good, food delicious and there were no lines ever (as opposed to the top rated London Hilton Tower Bridge, where we stayed on the way to NYC) - so my fears of having to eat my "Hilton breakfast" in Starbuck's were unnecessary. Check-in was fast (but we arrived at 1 AM) and I indeed so crowds of people during regular check-in hours: the hotel was 100% booked. Public areas are truly magnificient, especially with Christmas decorations and the staff seemed to be nice (not much interaction as no problems encountered). Location was great - in the very centre, but just a couple of streets away from the crazy Times Square (last time we stayed in Casablanca hotel and experienced Time Square living in full - good and bad:) Yes, avoid Starbucks in the hotel - prices are 30% higher than elsewhere and there is another Starbucks nearby. In summary, for the price we paid this was a very good value, much better than tsimilarly priced 3*-4* TOP rated hotels in Manhattan. I am just For complaining business travellers expecting 5* luxury and absence of tourists in jeans - I would suppose Waldorf Towers can easily offer you this, along with associated price increase. For all other travellers screaming for rapid repairs necessary: yes, the repairs would make the hotel even more beautiful, but then I suppose this hotel would be a direct rival to Plaza, Pierre, etc in terms of everything, prices included. And tell me how many of us now staying in Waldorf would be able to afford Plaza?

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in New York”
Reviews.Author: DavidSuffolk_UK
Reviews.Content: A comfortable quality hotel centrally located with easy walking access to attractions, shops and metro. If you are looking for a bright, modern hotel this is not recommended, but if you want old style comfort and service the Waldorf is worth considering. Eating in the hotel is expensive, but there are a wide selection of cafes and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Was a pleasure to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Mroberts1954
Reviews.Content: The history and legend of the Waldorf helped to elevate my excitement about staying here for the first time. We were not disappointed. From the friendly service at the front desk upon check-in to the beauty and opulence of the public areas, we were pleased from the start. Our room was larger than most NYC rooms and quite comfortable. As far as the decor, it was...shall we say...understated (plain!). But that was OK, beds were great, linens were plush. We have a lovely experience and would stay there again. Read up on the history and don't miss the mini-museum just off the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Niki013
Reviews.Content: It was a special birthday trip for our daughter, the hotel offered her a excellent birthday chocolate cake, she loved it ! Many thanks. We all enjoyed the hotel, very quiet, clean, nice staff. The rooms are a little "old style" but it is part of the history.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, AWESOME bathrooms!”
Reviews.Author: braziliantraveler
Reviews.Content: I had a double bed room that was nice in size, but what took me to the moon was the big, bright bathroom, so great, what a treat in NYC. The bed spreads and carpet are a bit outdated but the bed is really comfortable. The room had a smoke smell, I called housekeeping and they sent someone pretty fast, and it made the problem better. If you can get a good deal, stay here, it's worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation staying at the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: Switz_traveler
Reviews.Content: I spent the end of year holidays with my partner at the Waldorf Astoria. I must say that our expectations were not very high after reading some reviews that noted how old and dilapidated certain rooms were. However, from the moment we got into the lobby to the time we check-out, the entire stay was wonderful! Check-in was quick and our luggage was brought to our room only a few minutes after check-in. We even got a call from the guest service welcoming us to the hotel and asking us if we were happy with our room minutes after arriving. Throughout our stay (one week) the staff was very nice and efficient and the concierge service was very helpful for booking restaurants or providing information regarding shops and museums. We had booked a superior king room. The room was very large, and so was the bathroom. We had been expecting a very old room (due to certain reviews we had read), but it was not run down at all, it even had a modern flat screen TV. The heating worked very well and the bed was huge and SO comfortable!! The room was definitely a 5 star hotel room. The location of the hotel is really perfect, there are many attractions close by and there is a subway line a few minutes away. The only negative remarks would be the very high price for internet access in the business center (however if you have a laptop, there is free wifi access in the lobby) and room service (over 50 USD for continental breakfast). However, these are only minor remarks compared to all the good aspects of this wonderful hotel! I would definitely stay again in this hotel and I would certainly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Comfortable and Full of Character”
Reviews.Author: TalismanUk
Reviews.Content: Have always wanted to go to New York and decided to spend a little more to go to the famous Waldorf. Having read several disconcerting reviews were slightly apprehensive but decided to give it a try. We were not dissapointed it lived up to our expectations, full of grandeur, elegance and It is very close to all places of interest. We were on the 22nd floor and had a large room, we couldnt fault the service and would deffinately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Lobby-Great Staff-Adaquate rooms”
Reviews.Author: lea29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf for 4 nights. I booked it a few months in advance on the Hilton website at a rate of $259 a night. We checked in around 2pm and our room was ready. We had a King Room. The room was very clean. I will say it was a little worn in areas. The bed was SUPER comfortable. Heater worked well. The only complaint I think I would have is the walls seem very thin. You could hear a lot of hall noise and the next door neighbors. Room service was delish. Starbucks in the lobby. They also let us have a late check out which was nice. Business center where you can print out your boarding pass. Hotel was also very secure. I would stay there again. We stayed at the Waldorf for it's character and history.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive hotel desperately in need of some TLC”
Reviews.Author: GRAW1702
Reviews.Content: First the good: The location is pretty good - near The Rockefeller, 5th Ave shops, Grand Central, Chrysler building etc and on a good subway line (1 block from the rear entrance of the hotel on Lexington Ave). The communal areas (eg lobby, toilets, corridors, shops etc) are elegant. The room service food is good (did not venture to the restaurants) and is prompt. The bed / bedding, as well as bathroom soft furnishings are good, as is the iron. Now the not so good: It is pricey, very pricey: from the initial room fee, to the room service, phone calls, internet etc there was nothing that wasn't chargeable.....and by that I mean at an exoribtant cost. There never seemed to be enough staff: there was always a long queue at reception, and we were always put on hold when calling housekeeping or the concierge (but not on the room service, which is not surprising given the room service costs!!!). The room was delapidated to say the least (have the rooms actually been re-decorated since they moved into the building in 1910?) with a TV which didn't really work very well - also the plug sockets were hanging dangerously out of the wall. There was not enough storage space for two people. The room was either warm but incredibly stuffy, or cold - impossible to get a balance between the two, hence difficult to get a good night's sleep. Neither of the plugs in the bathroom wok sufficiently - impossible to have a proper shave or relaxing bath without having the water on permanently (i thought the hotel was on an energy efficiently drive?!) and the shower was lacking in power. The taps in the basin were a bit suspect too - scaldingly hot to freezing. The lighting was very poor in the room - just a series of lamps dotted around - which meant entrance/departure required a tour of the room switching on/off each light - again not very energy efficient as i'm sure most people could not be bothered to do this. The noise from the street (even 14 floors up) was incredible, which also prevented getting a good night's sleep - and if you think there nothing that can be done about it, check out the numerous airport hotels which have complete sound proofing eg Hilton at Heathrow T4). There was no tea / coffee facilities nor a kettle in the room. No complimentary water to drink in the room - the tap water didn't taste great. Overall: if you're old & well past your best, and want a hotel that is too, then this is perfect for you.
