If you want to get a hotel which is comensurate with the price you pay, go somewhere else, where the rooms will have modern amenities, and have had a coat of paint in the last 100 years. With thousands of hotels in New York, this is not the worst hotel by far, however it's well over-priced, overdue a makeover, and you could stay at a 3 star hotel offering better rooms.

Reviews.Title: “High Expectations but Very Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: americanholiday
Reviews.Content: Front of house public areas (lobby, bars, shops etc) just divine. But I agree, go for coffee and just have a look. Don't bother with the rooms. Trading on their history and reputation of days gone by but the rooms are very overpriced and do not deliver. Guest rooms are very small, no free WIFI in rooms but availabel in lobby (!!!), or hi-speed internnet at $17.00 per day in rooms, ice machines on the floors don't work, bathplugs dont seal to have a bath, basin leaks water onto the floor (wetting towels and clothes), vanheating pumps out freezing cold air (snowing outside so you need warmth), tired original decor and grubby curtains. No tea or coffee, fridge so tiny hard to fit a coke in. After complaining, got upgraded and it wasn't much better at all. Basin still leaks on the floor, can't empty the bath water, even the TV pages are not in the hotel guide. You had to pay to visit the gym. This tired old lady desperately needs a massive injection of money to repair it. Most staff were very accomodating and did all they could to assist us and knew full well the limitations of thier hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic New Year Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ClaireSBristol
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Waldorf for 5 nights over the New Year period. There is absolutely nothing for us to fault! The service, from check-in to check-out, was superb. Our bedroom was spacious and clean. It didn't have the best view - but we were only there in the evening when the curtains/blinds are closed anyway! Our room was tidied and made-up daily. The hotel is in an excellent location. We were able to explore uptown and downtown with ease and the concierge were more than happy to suggest how to get about and could also recommend sights/restaurants for us to visit. I admit that the bars and restaurants in the hotel are expensive, but there are many other places within walking distance to eat and drink in instead. Am looking into going there again this year too. We had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: gillej
Reviews.Content: Read many reviews prior to arriving for our New Years Eve holiday and shopping fest. I was a little concerned, but from Day 1 until Day 6 we really enjoyed are stay. There were 4 of us staying in a twin double bed room which was ample enough. Everything was clean and worked fine. Except the aircon was a little too warm for us and couldn't turn it any lower. We used the bars, free wifi in reception, safe deposit boxes without issues. The place has seen better days; but it's nearly 100yrs old and is ageing well. The entrance is magnificent and the staff are quick to help. Our check in took 5 min and I used auto check out which worked fine. Location is great, walked to Times Sq, Rockafeller, and central park. Subway is 1 block around teh back of the hotel that gets you downtown quick enough. I would stay here again for sure. Makes you feel special staying in a place with a rich history!

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf is Historic and Classic but did not live up to our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Idaho_travel_lovers
Reviews.Content: I have to say I expected the Waldorf to be more luxurious with better service. We booked a non-smoking room 6 months in advance with a comfirmation of such and when we arrived we were told that they were out of non-smoking rooms and we would have to take a room on a smoking floor. For non-smokers, being on a smoking floor is horrible/gross. Since the Waldorf is part of Hilton and we are part of the Hilton Honors it really bothered me that they could not do something about this. The room itself was small, which we do expect for NYC, however, the furnishings were worn and bed was not that comfortable. The anemeties in the room reminded me of being in a Holiday Inn. The bath had been remodeled and was nice enough, but nothing luxurious about it, pillows, bath products and towels. I just expected the Waldorf to be a little better than it was.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Mommy17
Reviews.Content: We traveled to NYC Mid December for an extended weekend to take the kids to see the Christmas Show at Radio City and just do the city thing. Ever since I can remember, I've always wanted to stay there. We were not disappointed! We ended up getting upgraded to a one bdrm suite on the 23rd floor. Although the decor was a little outdated we were very happy! The Hotel is gorgeous and is very museum-like. We ended up staying an extra night b/c of the blizzard of '09 but had no complaints. The area is wonderful ( just a few short blocks to 5th ave). Their world class Sunday Brunch is a site to see and experience. We all enjoyed the different foods and were very satisfied. Although a little pricey, definitely worth it! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “been there done that couldnt afford the t shirt”
Reviews.Author: mugginsathudds
Reviews.Content: stayed at the waldorf for 3 nights it was great. old and tired in places but steeped in history. the lobby was everything it as been written about and more, staff very attentive but so they should be bedroom was ok nothing special bit surprised that they didnt charge us for the mini bar. food and drink very expensive $60 for 3 beers and a cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “A Big dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: DarcyKent
Reviews.Content: Having booked this hotel due to the history and good reputation to get engaged to my girlfriend I found myself very disappointed considering the amount of money I spent on the room. The rooms were tired, the blinds dirty, there were no tea and coffee facilities, a very small wardrobe for clothes which was packed full of of blankets/ironing boards, ended up living out of our suitcase. I really expected a lot better than this due to the hotels long standing reputation. The lobby was very impressive but that was about it. I would not stay here again. Back in England I stayed in a four star hotel in Kent which was no where near as expensive and found the rooms to be of a better standard!!

Reviews.Title: “checking in was a night mare”
Reviews.Author: willowwood
Reviews.Content: This was as you can imagine a trip of a lifetime. Our 3 day break was brilliant except for the check in. We had arranged an upgrade before we left the UK and fortunately took all our paperwork with us, as it was, the Waldorf did not show the upgrade on the computer although we had the confirmation in writing with us the lady on recpeption could not deal with a minor error on their part. Even with the confirmation she constanly wanted to put us in a double room, it took over 3 hours to get sorted, at one time they sent us to a room which was not only double but small and poky and not what we had booked, I was very disappointed that they could even try to fob us off with something and nothing, after we asked to speak to a manager we finally got the room type we had paid for and an upgrade which was the view and breakfast, they gave us $100 to spend on a meal whilst we waited for the room to be prepared, this was great but the bill for the meal came to more than that. We didn't find the service too good either in the Peacock Bar and this was the only time we felt let down by any service in New York, one family on the table next to us left without ordering as they had waited so long. We waited over 40 minutes for our meal, when we commented we were in a hurry for the theatre the waiter bought the bill with the meal and made a comment about being in a hurry! Having said that the other areas of the hotel and staff were great, would I stay there again - no, although it was an experience and one I would not have wanted to miss.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: AdelaidianTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite in the Waldorf Tower , with the Executive Floor privileges. Everything about the hotel was great! We had a beautifully decorated and spacious suite, which overlooked the Chrysler Building. The location of the Hotel is great for seeing all of the highlights of New York. The Executive Lounge is a great place to have breakfast- a high quality continental style breakfast is served daily. The service was warm and welcoming. We had Sunday Brunch in the Peacock Alley Restaurant- this was an incredible cornucopia of fine gourmet food! It is well worth taking the Hotel Tour- the guide (Karen) was very knowledgable, and she gave you a fantastic insight into the hotel. At least once in a lifetime, you should spoil yourself and stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, If you can afford it”
Reviews.Author: JayHTexas
Reviews.Content: The service in this hotel is definitely top notch. We stayed in a mini suite, and it was very roomy. Had some friends in a regular room, and it was kind of cozy. I guess since it is New York, space is kind of limited. Ate a few times in the lobby restaurant, food was reasonably good, but quite expensve(even by NY standards). $25 for a tiny Waldorf salad!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, elegant hotel but perhaps over-priced”
Reviews.Author: CreepingBeauty
Reviews.Content: We went to New York for my mother's 60th birthday and chose the Waldorf Astoria for its location and great reputation, and also as a treat for my Mum as she had always wanted to stay there. Our stay was very nice, staff were friendly but check-in was rather slow moving. The hotel is impressively elegant, if you stay here don't be afraid to explore, it is well worth taking the time to look around the building. We had a standard room which was average in size and decor. Given that the hotel charges substantially more than others in the area, I am not sure that it is worth it. Yes, the hotel itself is stunning and was a pleasure to be in but the room itself was nothing more than average. I would assume the more executive rooms offer more opulence but for the money I think a little more elegance was needed even in the cheaper rooms. I can not fault its location on Park Avenue, we were able to walk to Times Square in a matter of minutes and walked almost everywhere. I would recommend getting a 3 day tour bus pass from one of the bus stops outside the hotel. It proved to be a great way to see the city, covering all the major sites, even going out to Harlem and Brooklyn, as well as a night tour, which is well worth doing, the city really is quite a sight when lit up at night. I left with mixed feelings about the hotel. It was lovely to be in such elegant surroundings every day and nice to stay in such a renowned hotel but if I return to New York I think I may stay elsewhere, purely because of cost.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful (but aging) Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rhglott
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf is a fantastic hotel. But this last time I visited I noticed that the rooms were wanting some much need renovations. I know the hotel is old and that is part of its charm, but they need to address the pealing paint in the rooms and "antique" air conditioners. If you can over look these cosmetic issues, the hotel is lovely and they treat you like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and flawless”
Reviews.Author: badbacktraveler
Reviews.Content: Not only was it our anniversary, it was our 50th, and we'd been married at the Waldorf. So, usually more frugal travelers, we opted for one night at the site of it the Beginning. The threat of snow turned it into two nights. Reservations couldn't have been kinder - reducing the cost of the second night by half, and giving us a free upgrade as well, which provided a gorgeous room on the 40th floor with double exposure, the resulting magnificent view, and a lovely buffet breakfast each morning included. The mattress was the best, the six (!) down and feather pillows luxurious, the amenities matchless - almond soaps, lemon verbena shampoos, terry robes, large safe, umbrella, an alcove with sink and frig. In most hotels, you throw your used towels on the floor. At the Waldorf - an elegant hamper receives them. The grand total for us: $279+taxes/night. I say wait for a 'special' - they do have some - and grab it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but it is not 5 stars,”
Reviews.Author: PabloSanJuan
Reviews.Content: Service is good but not great. The room was very good, but I got an upgrade because I am a Hilton Honors member. The best part of the hotel is its location, but it is an expensive hotel. If you are looking for the best I will try St. Regis or the Four Seasons

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: hattmann
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Waldorf on short notice after the boutique hotel we origanlly had reserved proved unacceptable. Got a very competitive rate on the concierge floor. The continental breakfast was great and a real value. Concierge got us a reservation same night at a restaurant after we were told by the restaurant that reservations needed to be made 2 weeks in advance. Only minor negative is the cost of room service ($18 for a pot of coffee), but hey its New York.

Reviews.Title: “what it claims to be, plus great location”
Reviews.Author: starlight1010
Reviews.Content: I've always wanted to stay here. My husband's business had some events here, which allowed for the perfect oppertunity to visit. We had a beautiful room!! From the other reviews, this must have been one of the redone rooms, because it was wonderful: historical flare with modern conveneices. Although, we were on the 6th floor, and our view was directly onto the roof with the heating units. We overlooked this fact and figured the time in our room we weren't looking outside anyway. For the price though, you'd hope for a better view. The banquet rooms, especailly the Starlight Roof, were gorgeous! There was good service, and I liked that there was a person outside helping to flag down taxis. It was quite cold, and waiting outside was not something we wanted to do that night. It also had a great location for us. It was two blocks from St. Patricks Cathedral, two blocks from Radio City Music Hall, and a short walk to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, especially for honeymooners!”
Reviews.Author: rachgn
Reviews.Content: I cannot describe how fantastic this hotel is. We stayed for 3 nights en route to the Caribbean whilst on our honeymoon and it was truly amazing. Our room was upgrade and we stayed in a Superior Room which had a lovely dressing room and beautiful marble bathroom. The room (especially by NY standards) was a great size and the bed was enormous. The twice daily turndown of the room was a nice touch and the staff could not have been more helpful. The conciege were fantastic and helped us with some super restaurant choices. We stayed on the Park Avenue side and had the most wonderful view straight down Park Ave from our bedroom window. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough, especially if you are on your honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS HOTEL, THE BEST!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wolfgangice
Reviews.Content: the best hotel, the best service. perfect! Strongly recommend it, its got lots of history and Oscars is one of the best restaurants ive gone to.

Reviews.Title: “People, in this case Diamond Desk Jackie make the difference”
Reviews.Author: holzman
Reviews.Content: I am a very heavy traveler; up to several hundred nights a year. For those who have to do this for a living, YOU KNOW how little time you have and how someone who understands your needs, and makes your life a little easier can help. I wantred to stay here. Had little notice. Hotel was full. Jackie found me a good room (knowing preferences from past stay). When I went to check out, she prepared bill, confirmed valet charges were on it and printed it, all while helping a much older customer figure out how to use wireless on his PC (clearly not her job, BUT she knew he was an an important customer and that this was important to him. I think I am renaming her "5 STAR-Diamond Jackie". Friends have tried to put me in other hotels of equal rating w/i 1 block of there, for 1/2 what I am paying 20-24 Dec, but no way. I am going back. This is an employee that males a difference to the bottom line. Hotel was as always, exceptional. Room was beautiful. Service was fine. Gym is now 24 hrs (big improvement). Only area of concern is the garage. 48 minutes to bring the car from valet parking is NUTS. This is a consistent issue, so know this in case you are in a rush. Thanks Jackie.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel, but avoid the parking”
Reviews.Author: GWSD
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night for a splurge trip to Manhattan. We booked a mini-suite so that we could have room for ourselves and our three children. The room was beautifully appointed, with great little touches throughout, and it was very spacious, especially for a hotel in NYC. We had Hilton Honors, so we got upgraded to the Tower, and had a very nice continental breakfast included in our stay. The only negative to keep in mind is that this is a huge hotel, which means that check-in and check out can be hectic, and the parking is a nightmare - expect to wait for quite a while for your car to be retrieved. Overall, though, this was a really nice place to spend a night during the holidays, and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms could do with an update”
Reviews.Author: LausanneFrederick
Reviews.Content: We booked a four night stay in this hotel, primarily due to its superb location and on this point we were not disappointed - it could not be better. However, although we had a suite its configuration was a little odd - which meant that we did not really get the beneifit of full use of the space available. We did have the beneifit of two bathrooms but both were in need of updating - the shower facilities in both were poor. We also found that the restaruants were not available all day and seemed to operate on alternate days during our stay so, on two ocassions (quite high for a short visit) we found we had to think quickly and find somewhere else to eat. Also, on three mornings when we chose to take breakfast in the Peacock area, we had long waits and the service was very slow - on one morning there was no chef in attendance at the hot food area which caused enough annoyance that the hotel did not charge for one of the meals. Despite these niggles the hotel public area is lovely, the staff are friendly and generally helpful and it's great location means you are right in the heart of things - getting a cab is never a problem. We have used other hotels on previous visits to New York and if we were to visit again we would certainly consider staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room, thank goodness!”
Reviews.Author: homefree
Reviews.Content: Our room wasn't available when we checked in at 5pm. Obviously we were not happy as we had an event to get ready for in an hour! They let us use a room (queen bed) to get ready in as we couldn't wait. It was TINY! And rumbled every few minutes as trains came in and out of Grand Central. Thank goodness this wasn't our room! I can't imagine having to deal with that train noise all day and night. When we came back later that night, our room was available. It was a very nice large room with a king bed. Very clean and in good condition. They did offer drink coupons for our inconvenience (didn't take them though.) All in all, if you get a nice room, count yourself lucky! The lobbies are exquisite, especially with all the Christmas decorations!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonSusanna
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in June for November and had not read any TripAdvisor reviews. After reading some particularyly disturbing stories of shabby bedrooms and poor service and even ladies of the night going about their business in the hotel I would have been tempted to book elsewhere but my friend had paid in full when she booked so this was not an option. I received an e mail from hilton concierge services prior to our departure and replied by telling them that I was concerned about the standard of the rooms after reading some bad reviews and requested a refurbished room. I recieved a reply stating that my request had been noted and if a refurbished room was available at the time of check in they would comply with my request. On arrival we checked in two hours early to be told that our room was ready and we went straight up to the 12th floor. Our room was absolutely fine and clean overlooking a very quiet courtyard so I was extremely relieved! We explored the public areas of the hotel which are absolutely beautiful . This is a really impressive hotel with a fascinating history. Everyone in the hotel was more than helpful , the service from all the staff was first class and we could not have asked for more. The barman mixed me a cocktail which was delicious nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff anywhere in the hotel. As this trip was a 50th birthday present from my friend to me the hotel put a bottle of sparking wine and a lovely welcome letter in our room which was a very considerate touch. In conclusion I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone. We had a lovely time here and would return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't put my dog here”
Reviews.Author: thenewporter
Reviews.Content: Was offered a "luxury suite" to compensate for previously very substandard accommodations e.g. peeling paint (probably lead), unclean room, furniture missing parts, etc. Some of the pictures already on the site pretty much tell the story. The "luxury" suite was nothing like their brochures would have you believe. Old 60's era furniture, utterly unclean. The kitchenette still had spilled coffee from the previous occupant and the stove? Didn't look like it had been cleaned in years. Grunge and leftover food. It was downright gross. Ruined my anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice, saving already to go back!”
Reviews.Author: OAP20
Reviews.Content: Lived up to our expectations!Staff were very friendly and most helpful.We had a room on 14th floor with 2 double beds overlooking Park Ave.It wasnt ready when we arrived so we were given a Voucher for 2 drinks!Only thing missing, as in most NY Hotels, was the kettle and tea/coffee.They need to take a leaf out of our N. Ireland Hotels&Guesthouses.You MUST try Waldorf Sunday Brunch, expensive but worth it! It is a perfect base for sightseeing and shopping.We walked to Battery Park so wear comfy shoes.Took Staten Island Ferry (free) at sunset and views were spectacular!Breakfast at the Rock Center Cafe was exceptional-we had a table right beside the Ice Rink.So was our meal in Benihana.Smith and Wollensky was also worth the money.They are all just a few minutes walk away. Go to Top of Rock early in the day to avoid queues-views breathtaking.Buy a map for 2$ so you know what you are looking at and go RIGHT TO THE TOP.Bryant Park worth a visit - Christmas Market and Ice Skating in a lovely setting.Times Square on a Sunday afternoon has to be seen to be believed!Cant wait to return.Didnt have time to revisit Central Park but enjoyed walk by East River in the sun.

Reviews.Title: “distinguished manhattan hotel - needs some updating”
Reviews.Author: leetlesasa
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one bedroom suite, which was pretty big (not just by NYC standards either) first, the bad: Bathroom had very little counter space, just the sides od the sink and the bathroom itself was small considering the size of the room. Definitely too small for two people to be in at once. The shower curtain doesnt stay totally shut and water was all over the floor everytime I showered. The paint in the room (esp. near the windows) was warped, chipped and the wood exposed. I dont think the a/c in either room worked properly. it was set to 65, i left the room for a few hours, and when i returned it was still balmy. It was on, i could hear it, but cold air (even cool air) wasnt coming from either unit. Had cocktails at peacock alley and while they were friendly, the service was SO slow. it wasnt even very busy (it was much later than chocktail hour & dinner) and even having our waters refilled or getting a second glass of wine took so long, we just decided to leave early. The good: even though the hotel was busy (they said it was booked at full capacity) check-in was quick and efficient and the clerk was very friendly. the location of the hotel was perfect for me - i had a meetings at a building mere steps away and there's great shopping just a few blocks away. the room was huge, both the bedroom and the living area. the flat panel tv's are big too. i dont think there was much "hallway traffic" but i never heard anyone walking by or any of my neighbours through the walls. had dinner at bull & bear with a girlfriend and everything was fantastic - the service, atmosphere (very busy for a weeknight at 10) drinks & wine and the meal itself! there were a lot of, er, questionable looking ladies there and it was certainly entertaining to see them in action lol overall this is a nice hotel - a manhattan classic - but it does need some updating. i will absolutely stay here again because of its location

Reviews.Title: “Not up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: maida22
Reviews.Content: First thing to note is that this doesn't act like a Hilton Hotel, so your diamond loyalty cards etc count for very little. We did manange to persuade them to give us breakfast in the Towers lounge but the regular off er was a voucher for Starbucks Rooms are tired but large with the most revolting toiletries! Marzipan soap and clove shower gel! There is a large discrepency btw the room choices so do ask to be moved if you are not happy. We found service to be very patchy but if you were pesistent and got the right person, they were willing to help. The location is outstanding and worth a lot. The public areas of the hotel are beautiful and interesting - you are staying at an historic place. There is a poor level of communication regarding hotel facilities. We were told Oscar's brasserie was open when it obviously wasn't etc. Do check if you are planning to eat at a particular restaurant. To sum up; not bad but could be so much better.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: noellex
Reviews.Content: we are just home from our stay in waldorf astoria, had been reading the mixed reviews prior to our trip so decided to post my own review, check in was slow enough we arrived at 2pm and despite an early check in request we had to wait until 3pm,i know it is only one hour but i did request it at booking as ia m 7 months pregnant and knew i'd be tired and also other people were checking in around the same time. As everyone else has been saying the main areas of the hotel are very grand and expensive, but the rooms do not reflect this at all, they are in serious need of refurbisment, although clean the bathroom was dissapointing. tiles coming away from the wall and grout all discoloured, curtains in bedroom were a little grubby. I wouldn,t normally be so picky but when paying these prices i expected a little more for my money even with new york standards. Would not stay here again there are better hotels to stay in for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: YYZ_TOGO
Reviews.Content: First the positive notes: Can't beat the location. If you like a historical hotel, this one has a romantic history. Other than that... On their website, they offer an uprade (certainly not for free) if you request one. We requested a one bedroom suite on the Concierge floor. We were told that the website was wrong and that was not an upgrade. We were disappointed, but accepted a one bedroom suite in the main hotel Do not depend on the concierge service. I e-mailed them prior to our arrival to book a reservation at a nearby restaurant. I didn't hear back from them. When checking in, the gentleman at the reception desk said he would get back to me, which he did, saying there was no record of my e-mail and they'd be happy to make a reservation if I called them back. I called the concierge desk, who knew nothing about this, and the woman said she would get back to me. She didn't. Later that evening I spoke in person to one of the concierges who finally booked our reservation. When asking for directions to The Boathouse in Central Park, I was told it was "very touristy" and handed directions - which were wrong. Had we depended on our own map, we could easily have saved an hour's walk. We found the Boathouse, and thought it to be delightful and high end. Breakfast. We were only there for 2 days, so I cannot recommend an alternate, but you are virtually held prisoner if you wish to eat at your own hotel. The first morning, we had to line up for almost 45 minutes before we were seated. Continental Buffet: $32 Full Breakfast Buffet: $38 Excuse me, but if I'm paying $38 for breakfast, why am I making my own toast?? The cheapest item on the menu was an $8 bagel. It is overpriced and the buffet is sub-par with very runny scrambled eggs and rubber potatoes. The next morning, we lined up once again, and were asked if we had a reservation! For breakfast in OUR OWN HOTEL? Outrageous. If you have an endless budget, and can stay in the Boutique part of this hotel, then by all means, stay here. Otherwise, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A Step back in time without loss of service”
Reviews.Author: Aaronwood
Reviews.Content: A fabulous hotel, beautifully presented, a step back in time to an era of luxury and style. Helpful, pleasant staff, delicious food, central to everything and a lovely retreat from the bustling, lively city f New York,

Reviews.Title: “Unmissable experience”
Reviews.Author: Dizzyexile
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Waldorf Astoria with mother and sister form the time we arrived and were escorted from car to lobby we were treated with courtesy and politeness. It did not matter if you were in jeans or furs guests are guests. We did have a room upgrade so it as large enough for all 3 of us-although the access to the closet was restricted by 1 of the beds, Beds,pillows and duvet soft and comfortable,daily change of linen and towels too. The room was very warm and the windows did not open and the heating/cooling system a bit outdated and inefficient. Eating and drinking at the hotel v.expensive even the "Inhouse" Starbucks was 50% more expensive than outside-there is one around the corner on 50th and Lexington. But it is in a great locationand to sit in the front lobby and watch the coming and goings of all sorts of guests is not to be missed. It is a bit faded but the old glory still evident.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel that lives upto its reputation”
Reviews.Author: WorcesterEee
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a wonderful time in this classic hotel, staff were exceptional with any requests dealt with immediately and nothing seemed to be too much trouble. restaurants were expensive but the food was of the highest order and worth the cost. Try the steaks in the Bull and Bear, they are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience - will be back”
Reviews.Author: CBHDublin
Reviews.Content: This is a stunning art deco hotel in a great location – within walking distance of 5th Avenue, Grand Central, Central Park and Macys. The bedrooms are not up to the same decorative standard as the public spaces (that would be hard) but we had a spacious comfortable room for three. The staff were fantastic – friendly and courteous. Cleaning staff are constantly on duty throughout the hotel and pay great attention to detail. The restaurants in the hotel are a little pricey - we weren’t keen on Peacock Alley but Oscars was a real treat for breakfast and the steaks in the Bull & Bear were delicious! It was a real pleasure staying in a hotel so full of history – we’ll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Still has its charme!”
Reviews.Author: RobbertS
Reviews.Content: Last March after a not-so-good stay at the Westin New York @ Times Square, decided to stay our last nights at the Waldorf Astoria in New York. At check-in were upgraded to one of their One Bedroom Suites who really have the nice, classic, luxurious fibe the hotel is known for. The breakfast vouchers for Starbucks in the hotel were not so special, but for the rest the hotel is really undescribly beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Classic New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Snaddy
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel, loved the lobby, ballroom, atmosphere and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty old bedrooms in need of a refurb.”
Reviews.Author: IAN321
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel as a family break. The foyer of the hotel is grand, the checkin is slow and poor. When we were given the keys to our two rooms and went up in the lift as we got to our floor WHAT a come down. It was like a 1930s bed and breakfast. The paint was dull the paper was hanging off the wall the bed was dirty and the bathroom was old and dirty. I complained to reception but the staff did not want to know. After a lot of shouting we did get moved, but these were in a no better state. I would not recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decrepit suite”
Reviews.Author: sheri2420
Reviews.Content: I could not believe our suite. I made reservations 2 months in advance and requested a large suite. Our suite was large, but that was it. It had 2 1980 TV's, no flat screen, When I complained, they put in flat screens, but they did not work. The electrical work in the room needs upgrading. The bathroom tiles were coming apart, the shower looked like a motel 6. We are still in New York, but have since moved to the Pierre. The management here really does not know how to run a hotel. I was disgusted.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: hellobabes
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria lives up to it's reputation as a world renowned hotel. From the moment you enter the hotel you are aware of the service that you will receive. The rooms are lovely with city views and offer everything that you could possibly require. The decor had a traditional English vibe which I loved. The main pro of this hotel is it's location which is in easy walking distance of Grand Central Station, Central Park, Fifth Avenue and Times Square. The Waldorf Astoria is well worth paying for. Pure luxury! The starbucks in the lobby entrance was another bonus for me and went in there every morning. I did not have the chance to try it but so many other guests recommended the Sunday Brunch so I would definitely sample that if I went back. Service was fantastic from the check in desk to the doormen. Ignore all negative reviews and stay at the Waldorf!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: LWoody46
Reviews.Content: We booked the Waldorf Astoria in New York for 4 nights on the last leg of a family holiday to America after researching the hotel website and in particular the guest rooms which looked lovely in the photos and were described as "luxurious guest rooms". They were also described as "cheerful bedrooms with oversized marble bathrooms which give our rooms a delightful ambience". We arrived late on the Sunday evening, checked in and then went down to one of the restaurants in the hotel for a meal which was extremely pricey (as we expected) but some of the restaurant staff were almost to the point of being rude - not the "unparelled hospitality and service" promised on the hotels website. On returning back to our room we did notice that it looked a little bit tired but as we wanted to make the most of New York's sights we only really used our room for sleeping and bathing until our last day when we spent some time in the room packing and that was when we started noticing things. For example, the net curtain at the window was flithy, the valances on the bed had holes in and were stained, paint was peeling off in the bathroom, the sealant was hanging off over the bath/shower, the toilet seat was loose (you had to be careful how you positioned yourself when you sat on it!) and the vent in the bathroom was full of dirt which must have taken months to accumulate. There were 10 of us in our party which meant we had booked 5 rooms for 4 nights each which we had booked and paid for 5 months in advance. At the time of booking we had also upgraded the rooms. I'm sure there are some nice rooms in the hotel - apparently the President stays at the Waldorf in the Presidential Suite when he goes to New York so I'm assuming that's quite a nice room! - but unfortunately it would seem that none of our party had a nice room as on our return and discussing the hotel it appeared that there were similar problems in all the rooms. My sister in law wouldn't even put her bare feet on the carpet in her room as it seemed so dirty and these were the upgraded rooms - what would we have got if we hadn't upgraded??? When you arrive at the hotel and go into the main reception you are struck by the elegance and opulence as with most of the main areas of the hotel but unfortunately this didn't continue through to the guest rooms we were allocated. This was the third hotel we stayed in on our trip to America and we didn't have any issues with the other two hotels we stayed in (the first in San Francisco and the second in Las Vegas) neither of which have the reputation that the Waldorf Astoria has. Unfortunately that seems to be what the hotel is trading in on - its past reputation as it definitely didn't live up to our expectations and we certainly wouldn't return.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Stay Ever And I Have Traveled The World”
Reviews.Author: Cheryldel
Reviews.Content: NO room ready after travel from Europe and made a special request for an early check in months in advance. Told to change in the public bathroom off the lobby to reach walking clothes and shoes. An abrupt angry black man at the concierge desk told us to change now or he was taking our luggage..NOW! So we flung it open in the lobby and changed shoes and what have you there!! How crude and how rude..and this was supposed to be a luxury hotel..Our room ..at the farthest end of the hallways with a city view was a wall. When our luggage was brought up to our room the sandwiches we had purchased prior to check in were gone. So we hope whoever ate them enjoyed our lunches. The tub was almost completely plugged and the permanent ring on the tub belied that it always ran that slow. We took showers standing in each others shower water. Managment said we should have called them and they would have sent up a plumber to fix it. IF THE PHONE WAS WORKING...we may have called..but also We came back to our room at midnight and had an early check out to fly out of NY. Was a plumber going to be working into the morning hours while we sat on our beds in this tiny cramped room and waited to shower??? we had to wait for a room..now this too?? My friends from Europe said it best at the impression left by this American luxury hotel staff...I always thought Americans were very proper and professional. I see now they are not." I cannot tell you how embarrassing that was and remains.. That first impression can never be removed...and to think it happened at the Waldorf Astoria in NYC on Park Avenue....for shame.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room”
Reviews.Author: Yellow Bee
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 7th floor, Park Ave side and found the room to be spotless. Could be the room has been redone lately as it had a flat screen TV and was in excellent condition. Have stayed here in the past and have always had a great room. It was a business trip but the location has always been perfect for walking to the theater, Rock-center, shopping etc. Lobby was always busy and check in took longer then we liked but it is a large hotel.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: AmyBayley
Reviews.Content: I met my best friend and her parents in NY in the middle of my tour across Canada and stayed in this amazing hotel! First time in new york, amazing location with a starbucks restaurant and bar in the hotel and a few minutes walk from times square this is definitely a great choice. very spacious bedrooms with ensuite, lcd tv, radio/alarm :) I would definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “Stay from Hell”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteNorthWales
Reviews.Content: My Auntie and I stayed for 3 nights at the Waldorf and it was terrible. The room was very grand, beds were lovely, service was good but we could not sleep due to the people in the next room. After talking to one of the sales assistants at Saks - I realised what was going on next door!!!!! The Waldorf allows Call Girls in to guest's rooms - each night we were awoken to the couple's screams, the headboard banging against our bedroom wall and then the hotel slamming as the Call Girl finished her business. It was a nightmare. We did complain after we had checked out - the manager did not want to know. Would never ever stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel, clean & gorgeous rooms, top notch service!”
Reviews.Author: adam1111543
Reviews.Content: stayed for one night - had an amazing time. it was an anniversary. rooms were clean and beautiful, and the staff was absolutely helpful . would definitly recommend you stay here if coming to NY!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and service but in need of updating”
Reviews.Author: JaneEMorgan
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite for a two night stay and was pleasantly surprised by an upgrade to a one bedroom with a foyer, huge living room, and bathroom. The room had very good bones (super high ceilings, nice mouldings), but it really needs new decor. The bathroom was very old and small. The toilet paper dispenser was rusty, the paint was chipping off the door moulding, etc. The good news is that at $465/night, it was a relatively good deal in NYC, but we would not have been happy if we had not received the upgrade to the huge 1 BR. Room service was alarmingly expensive ($25 for a steak sandwich) but the service overall was excellent and attentive. The dark lobby where checkin takes place is outdated an in dire need of a renovation. I will say, however, that if the place were renovated, the prices would skyrocket to St. Regis heights. Overall, I thought it was a good value for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Saddened at the performance of an iconic, historical hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sgfltraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have stayed before & I loved every moment we shared at the hotel including the restaurants. This time, the rooms were dirty, the service was slow, the food was marginal and the drinks were poor. We were very disappointed. We will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “stay here if you can afford it”
Reviews.Author: cbz_9
Reviews.Content: We nearly didn't stay at the Waldorf because of some of the reviews on trip advisor and what a mistake that would have been. Ditto for Raffles in Singapore. Forgive my rave, but either some people like to whinge or they only look at the negatives. So what if something tiny sometimes goes wrong. Get over it and enjoy everything else. These are grand old hotels and an experience that you should have if you can afford it. Anyone can stay at run-of-the-mill five-star hotel, but these places are truly different. I've been meaning to write something here for a long time because staying at the Waldorf was so much fun and there are so many poor reviews below. Ignore them and give it a go.

Reviews.Title: “Find someplace else to stay”
Reviews.Author: DrGfromFlorida
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Waldorf for over 30 years and this stay was heartbreaking! They have cut their staff and quality to what you would expect from a Motel 8. Our room was dirty and dusty, the glass had enough dust to write your name on it. The once superb linen has been replaced with cheap linen and the pillows are nothing but air! The Bull and Bear was way-over-priced for the portion and quality of the food. When I spoke to the limo drivers, most said they have heard the same complaints from other people who stayed there recently. It's too bad to see such a wonderful place go from the top to the bottom in such a short amount of time! I strongly suggest you try the old Meat Packing District or any one of the other hotels in NYC

Reviews.Title: “Old time elegance with modern day appeal”
Reviews.Author: GroovyGalTraveller
Reviews.Content: My first trip to New York ended off with a stay at the Waldorf Astoria just after getting engaged and our stay at this famous landmark hotel was the perfect way to end off a perfect trip. Our room was lovely and the view of Park Avenue with it's beautifully decorated trees all the way down the avenue was amazing. I highly suggest the sunday brunch at the Peacock Lounge, it is the best brunch I have ever had anywhere and have never experienced anything like it since. Check-in was quick and efficient, even though there were long queues due to it being a very busy time of year. On the day of check out, they kindly held on to our bags in order for us to take in some last minute sight-seeing. We returned to The Waldorf for a second stay in February of 2007 and we weren't dissapointed, everything was just as great as the first time around. Just a tip, request your transfer driver/taxi driver, to drop you off at the "check-in" entrance, and not at the front of the hotel in Park Avenue, as you have to drag your bag up the stairs and through the foyer to get to the check-in counter. If you arrive at the hotel guest check-in entrance, the concierge marks your bag and stores it, and by the time you have checked-in and get to your room, your bags are already waiting for you. The doormen also went the extra mile, hailing cabs for guests, and even asked us where we were going and told the cab driver where to take us. The doorman even called Madison Square Garden for us to check what time the game started! Compared to other five-star hotels in the city, I feel The Waldorf offers way more value for money...they just don't make them like this anymore!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Romantic”
Reviews.Author: jenjenjen123
Reviews.Content: A truly wonderful experience. Lots of shopping, great food and wine..right around every corner. Beautiful rooms comfy beds~

Reviews.Title: “Nice but over rated”
Reviews.Author: naplesphoto
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby but very crowded and noisy. Took over 30 mins to get our luggage to our room. The rooms were small and the curtains( sheers) in our room were dirty, black at the bottom. We had a view of the a/c unit. At the price we paid we should have had at least a view of the street. The bartenders at Peacock Alley were great and very attentive. I would not stay here again. The attached steak house was way overpriced and the food was marginal. My chair was broken and when I asked for a new one the waiter took the broken one put it at another table and gave me a new one..I would hope that some one else did not have the misfortune of sitting in the same broken chair.

Reviews.Title: “The Waldorf Astoria is a fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LAIslandgirl
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped out of the cab the service was first class. Gus, the doorman, was so friendly and funny. All the people there were warm and helpful. The room we got was bigger than I expected and the beds were comfortable. The hotel lives up to its name... Grand, elegant, first class service. My friends and I never ate there because the restaurants are overpriced(especially room service). However, this was not a problem because there are so many places to eat there. Go to the Starbucks on the right side of the hotel. You'll pay half the price compared to the one in the hotel. I would definitely stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 16th Birthday Celebration at the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: TexasShoppingGirl
Reviews.Content: I recently treated my daughter to a fabulous stay at the Waldorf Astoria for her 16th Birthday! It was a magical place for her to turn 16, the hotel staff treated us like royalty! The hotel room was beautiful and we had an excellent view of New York City. The location of the hotel made it easy for us to get around the whole city. I would strongly recommend staying there to anyone, especially if you are traveling in this city without a man. We felt very safe in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Elegance”
Reviews.Author: huntchef
Reviews.Content: My daughter really wanted me to stay here and against my wishes, I did. It was a truly wonderful experience - sort of a throw back to the old days of luxury and service. My room happened onto a rooftop area overlooking Park Avenue and I enjoyed watching Park Avenue come alive in the morning. Everyone, from the doormen to the housekeeping staff was wonderfully friendly, albeit a little formal, and I truly enjoyed my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Its worth it for the History”
Reviews.Author: Wood7
Reviews.Content: We visted New York in June of this year for my wife's 40th birthday, and as a surprise I booked the Waldorf Astoria. On arrival she was delighted with the choice, and proceeded to look at the historic pictures etc, the reception was excellent and so efficient. We were allocated a corner room overlooking Park Avenue and the church etc, it was huge, with the comfiest bed ever. It is an experience to stay at the Waldorf, and we had a good time just wandering around the place looking at the pictures etc. Its not cheap, but you wouldn't expect that we had a few drinks in the hotel and ordered breakfast in the room on my wife's birthday (£110) but if you can stay there once, it is worth it just for the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dankersoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 2 days during our honeymoon. The staff at reception gave us a free upgrade to the tower as we were honeymooners :-) Great start! The free morning buffet in the tower is okay, but nothing extreordinary - but hey it's free. Great location but maybe not the best value for money. I think you pay lots of money for the brand of the Waldorf Astoria.

Reviews.Title: “Great Dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: Elena_n_Isabel
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my sister to NY and we spend two days in the worldwide-famous Hotel Astoria, as was my sister "Dream of her life". The experience was disappointing from begonning to the end: long waiting upon check in, the rooms (we booked superiour!) were in quite bad conditions (bathroom forniture with cello-tape!) and not really clean (specially the bathroom), the lady who made the turndown service came in and out without doing anything at all, during breakfast we had to leave our table to go back to reception to ask for some "breakfast vouchers" we never been told about. Upon departure we had to go to pick our luggage ourselfs... We wrote a letter to the management leaving our contact details and they never got back to us...

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: kerolkitty
Reviews.Content: best hotel ever, just like a dream... what a room!

Reviews.Title: “Old Class Style”
Reviews.Author: Circletheworldby2020
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three nights during a conference. While i much prefer the style of a new property, it was a nice treat to experience a taste of the old luxury. While the hotel was clean, it still felt very old... (old furnishings, smell, etc). I think if they maybe updated the hotel, and furnishings, i'd be more likely to return. Overall, service was very good, location was great and the food was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Truly horrible....will never return”
Reviews.Author: Mac7471
Reviews.Content: I stayed here many years ago (2000) as a treat for my mother's birthday and it was absolutely wonderful. I've been back once since then in 2003 and it was clear things were heading downhill. However, this year my mother and I were returning to New York and she asked if we could stay at the hotel once more. Since I'd read that Hilton were introducing the Waldorf-Astoria Collection I (wrongly) assumed they would have invested in their flagship hotel. Not the case, check in was dreadful and we were given a single room. I complained by calling down from the room and was told by the reception manager that she was too busy to deal with me or my complaint. I went down to reception and threatened to make a fuss in the lobby if something wan't sorted and they found us a larger room, but still not the one I'd booked. We were there during labour day weekend for the US Open tennis and the hotel was packed. Clearly customer service had gone out the window. The new room was much larger but horribly old, tired and dirty. It even verged on the dangerous as the carpet was so threadbare that both my mother and I slipped over on it several times. Nothing has been updated or changed since our original stay in 2000. All the flower arrangements have been removed and even the carpets in the public spaces are dirty. Such a shame for a once fabulous grande dame. The only saving grace is that the beds are still comfortable. However, I doubt Hilton have any plans to change those either so presumably the only positive factor will be gone in a couple of years time. The service is laughable....after the mix up with the rooms, we were promised an additional foldaway bed which never arrived and then a complimentary bottle of cheap champagne was delivered to our room in apology....except that it wasn't for us. My mother and I were addressed as Mr and Mrs...when we queried this the poor confused chap simply picked up the tray and walked back out of the room with it. So dreadful it was actually funny... I filled in a feedback form but am not suprised that I've heard nothing from Hilton. Stay away....I hear the Kitano is a much better option, especially if cleanliness is high on your list of priorities.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience at the Waldorf Towers”
Reviews.Author: joan3boys
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly you get what you pay for. Our last visit we got a good price on a room in the regular part of the hotel. It was a great room, but right in line with what we paid. This visit we decided to splurge and get a suite room in the Towers. The Towers is a hotel within the hotel and has a separate private lobby with check in and elevator. The room was about 3 times more than the rate we paid for the regular hotel, but it was worth it for us. For the reviewers complaining about dealing with lines and "regular people"at the hotel pay the extra money and stay on the Towers side. You can't choose their cheapest room and expect it to be on the same lines of those much more expensive. Our suite was extremely roomy and beautiful. The bathroom was gorgeous. The Tower's rooms include a continental breakfast that is excellent and well done. The staff was extremely helpful and there is never a wait for anything in the Towers lobby. The next time we go back to New York we will be staying at the Waldorf Towers, there is no other place like it. The only time we were not pleased was when we received very spotty and rude service Friday and Saturday evenings in the lobby bar the Peacock Alley. We were having pre out to dinner cocktails and we were ignored both evenings by both waiters. Our drinks were empty for over 10 minutes before they came back to offer another. Terrible for any place especially this one.

Reviews.Title: “Old school style”
Reviews.Author: loveluxury1
Reviews.Content: We are both 25 and thought the WA might be a bit old school for us, which it actually is, but in a good way. Its old school luxury and has a great classic feel to it. I would recommend it to anyone who wants great service and a great location. We had a suite which had a huge living room, walk in wardrobe and massive bedroom. bathroom was a bit small compared to the rest of the suite but overall very clean and well presented.

Reviews.Title: “The Old Lady Still Has Her Mojo”
Reviews.Author: Hayes22
Reviews.Content: Are there likely better, nicer, more upscale hotels in 2009 in NYC? Sure. But few, if any, have the name Waldorf-Astoria. You can feel the history the moment you walk in the lobby and you realize that you are someplace special. The famed hotel still has its charm. The standard room was pleasant, decent size, and functional even if lacking the "oh, wow" atmosphere of the lobby. So close to so many sights and sounds of the Big Apple...St. Bart's Church, St. Patrick's Cathedral, shopping, and Times Square all within easy and safe walking distance. The service is first class. Recommend a nightcap in Harry's Bar off the lobby before you retire for the evening. With Frank Sinatra tunes playing softly in the background, you'd half excpect 'Ol Blue Eyes himself to come walking through the door. Room prices are very reasonable in this down economy and competitive lodging environment.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable NYC experience”
Reviews.Author: platanita4
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to New York at the last minute and wanted to experience the city and its many treasures all in one weekend. The Waldorf was the perfect way to do it. We got a great deal through Travelocity. Our room was a little noisy because it was close to the elevators, but it was still luxurious and comfortable. Simply admiring the lobby and the reception, you feel like you have elegantly traveled back in time. My only regret would be ordering an $8 iced tea while having lunch at Oscar's; but I guess, that's just part of the NYC experience. Overall, I loved this hotel and its many amenities. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Class is timeless”
Reviews.Author: Omegasaints
Reviews.Content: Hi,we had a wonderful few days at the Waldorf ,service as one would expect was superb,Toni[silver haired master of knowledge]knew everything about anything we needed to know or do,our room a superior on the 16th floor was excellent ,with 2 large beds and a superb large screen tv.We will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Iconic hotel, paid for the name”
Reviews.Author: Jam6287
Reviews.Content: The original Waldorf Astoria was a glamorous place that was as gorgeous as one could expect. The Bull and Bear and Peacock Alley were ritzy and classy, but the rooms were not what one would expect for the price. My friends and I only stayed one night, so maybe we didn't have a chance to fully experience it, but we really didn't love the rooms. They were old and small. The AC didn't work, and someone had to come up to our rooms at 2AM to use a special wand to open the windows which only slightly helped. Of course, the rooms were very clean, but that was about it. I understand you are paying for the opportunity to say that you stayed at the Waldorf, and it was definitely worth it in that respect. We had lunch at the Peacock Alley, where our martinis cost more than our entrees. We had a couple of drinks at the Bull and Bear during happy hour and then came back with more friends at around midnight. They were great to us then, and we'd gladly go back for the Bull and Bear alone. Check in was a hassle, and our room wasn't ready until it was almost time for us to be at dinner, so that was inconvenient, and the line for checkout the next morning was long as well. Worst of all, the internet wasn't free! Overall, it was great to be able to stay in such an iconic location, but I probably wouldn't do it again. I'd rather spend the same amount for a larger room with a quieter atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “A tired and depressing hotel, worth avoiding”
Reviews.Author: BasilFawltyHK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf for over a week on business and it was a rather depressing experience. It feels like a ballroom and conference facility with a few rooms attached above as an after thought. The level of staff service is terrible, some of them are quite simply rude. The rooms are well below the standard they should be for a hotel of this price: a little dirty and worn, pathetic TV and internet, poor bathroom, stale smell. The breakfast is lousy and overpriced, and the bar is ridiculously expensive. The location is obviously great though, and it is nice to be able to say you have stayed at the Waldorf, you just won't enjoy the experience very much at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate to stay at the Waldorf.”
Reviews.Author: athensglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: It is the great old lady of New York and one should stay there at least once. The Hotel is really great, the lobby is a time warp to a wonderful art deco past, it is warm and pleasant. The rooms are big and at times the view is simply spectacular. I find them very clean (been at the Waldorf 7 or 8 times) ,big, very smart and the Waldorf people are always eager to please their guest.It position is a very big plus as one is within walking distance from all major attractions and best shopping in town. The Bull and Bear and the Inagiku restaurants are good altho' expensive but i feel they worth it.If asked whether you would like to take the upgrade option do not hesitate!!!It is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Chronically understaffed”
Reviews.Author: timbo2002
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights during the US Open 2009. Was expecting good things, but had forgotten that I had been spoilt by the great hotels in Asia. The hotel is ok - rooms are ok (I was in a standard room so nothing exciting). The hotel is old - and it shows. Air conditioning did not work that well, glasses in the room were dirty when I checked in, bathroom was average. The hotel is in a great location - right in the middle of things in NYC - not too far from anywhere. But WORST of everything was the level of service. There were queues EVERYWHERE. It takes 20 mins to chekc in and out, 15 mins to get to speak to the concierge, 20 mins until you order breakfast and then another 20 until the first drink arrives! FYI, the breakfast buffet was US$45 or so - before a tip!!! It is obvious that they have severely cut back on staff. While I can see that at one time it was a "grand old hotel" there has been underinvestment recently - and they clearly do not have enough staff for the number of guests at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely amazing!”
Reviews.Author: rockandrose21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the east side of New York on Lexington Avenue and Park Avenue which is the ideal spot. Its close to grand central station, just a few blocks from fifth avenue, walking distance to central park and times square. The service was excellent. The room was very spacious which was what we wanted. The beds were so comfortable too! and there was a huge tv with loads of channels. the bathroom was lovely too. We had an amazing view of the chrysler building from our room. the room had air conditioning which could be adjusted to a temerature you prefer. We never had a meal in the hotel but we did have drinks in the bar twice, the service in the bars was excellent both times. This was an amazing hotel and i would definitley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Old world glamour”
Reviews.Author: caroraj
Reviews.Content: A stay in New York is never complete without a visit to this hotel.Old world glamour,warmth and hospitality is what the Waldorf is about.Incredible lobby , comfortable rooms.There is a sense of history about this hotel.We got a chance to see the ballroom which was beautiful.The location is fantastic.Overall a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: Jusine710
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf Astoria for 2 nights in a Deluxe Room. The hotel grand lobby is so beautiful, first impressions are Wow. The room we had was grand, the size was roomy with a lovely large bathroom and a large flat screen tv. The Staff were friendly and we were given a free early check in and a late check out which was excellent. Another bonus is free wireless internet in the main lobby. Just a hint is that there is a Starbucks in the hotel, advice is to use the Starbucks, 3 min walk away it is 35% less in price. Als depending on how far ahead you book the better room rate, we found April and August the best rates. Otherwise a glorious old hotel with so much character.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: GrandDuchess14
Reviews.Content: We have officially fallen in love with NYC. The Waldorf=Astoria was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Not even close to a luxury hotel operation”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoRosie1
Reviews.Content: stay away, watch your credit card charges from the Peacock Alley Rest. save all receipts no exhaust fans in bathrooms. You cant survive on your past reputation in today's market. Small rooms

Reviews.Title: “Missed the top rating”
Reviews.Author: Bruce88
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel was exceptional. It is, afterall, historic in its reputation for catering to the rich and famous. We were give a room (mini-suite) on the 16th floor that had windows on two sides. It was interesting to see how at one time it had been two rooms but had been remodeled into a "mini-suite." We were very pleased with the size of the room, the view, and the bed - very comfortable. A couple of problems: 1. Bathroom could have been cleaner - hairs were noticed on the floor. 2. The balcony - which was expansive - was obviously the repository for those who smoked. See photos. This was inexcusable. A cursory glance around the balcony by staff would have taken care of this issue. --- Expensive, but it was our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience will definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: ehp_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Towers and the room was great! We had an amazing view as well! Will definitely stay again. We normally stay at the Sheraton New York and you cannot even begin to compare the two! The staff were really friendly unlike the Sheraton where they are rude and are not really interested! Some of the staff at the breakfast room could have been a little nicer! It was almost like they were doing us a favour!

Reviews.Title: “You have not experiences New York if you have not stayed at the Waldorf Astoria!”
Reviews.Author: UkAnnabelle
Reviews.Content: I Would most deffinately recommend this hotel to anyone who wants the ultimate New York experience. It's location is fantastic for first time visitors and experienced travellers. Nestled perfectly on Park Avenue you are a stones throw away from Grand Central Station which is not only a must see, but makes it easy for you to get around, and impossible to get lost. You are also within EASY walking distance from central park, rocker fella centre and many more attractions. Just tap the address into google maps and see for yourself!!! Within the hotel you are greeted by the most helpful staff who are a credit to the hotel. Everywhere is spotless. The rooms are huge and come with all the facilities from irons, hair dryers to satelite television offering a decent range of programmes. Although I found that the power output from electircal appliances such as hair dryers and straighteners was weaker than I am used to, so ladies you may have to get up a little earlier for perfect hair!!! The food is amazing with varieties to suit all tastes. Although not the cheapest, it is not necessarily expensive when you consider the expertise of the chef that is cooking for you!!! Not every day can you say an award winning chef has prepared your lunch...well you can when staying at the Waldorf. You do not get the impression that the Waldorf attracts a "type" of traveller, there is always a range of people wandering in awe around the lobby from business associates to families, to couples. The hotel caters for the needs of all it's guests on an individual basis, which makes you feel invited to part of the hotel family (not a fish out of water) My partner and I would never contemplate staying anywhere else and will be back as soon as possible!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value...for a trip to the zoo”
Reviews.Author: spencerusa
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf was once the grande dame of New York hotels. Now it is a joke. It swarms with ill-dressed tourists slouching around the once-famous clock in the central lobby. Anyone wearing a suit and tie feels desperately out of place. However, if you appear in the lobby in business attire, not having realised when you reserved your NY hotel that Hilton has dumbed down this property beyond redemption, things will look up. You will likely be singled out by a staff member who will extricate you from the maddening hordes, whisk you into a private room off the lobby and check you in super politely and super promptly. It is the Waldorf's way of apologizing to its former clientele and it is a very welcome touch. I find a junior suite at the Waldorf one of the best values in New York, about the same price as a regular room at the Regency across the street..You have to hold your nose in the elevator and you would never consider going into a hotel restaurant or lingering in the lobby. But, once behind the locked door of your bedroom, you can spread out in a large, comfortable space with all relevant amenities....though the bathrooms are still small and old-fashioned.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: BinkaLeics
Reviews.Content: I had booked a double double at the Waldorf through a booking agency after being assured it would be large enough for my family group. One adult, two teens of seperate gender. On arrival when I checked that a rollaway bed was in the room I was told that the size of the room would not accommodate a rollaway. One look at my tired face and the reception staff swung into action, in no time at all we were installed into a two roomed suite. One king size bed in a bedroom and one double bed setee and one rollaway bed in the other room. The rooms were beautiful, clean and fresh with no signs of wear and tear.The daily staff were accommodating and helpful at all times. The lobby of course is grand in every sense of the word. Located near Central Station we found this hotel to be ideally placed and in easy walking distance for shops, restaurants and Central Park. The only thing I missed was the ability to make a cup of tea when I woke at 5 in the morning, a small niggle only.

Reviews.Title: “bring your pants”
Reviews.Author: MichiganFloyd
Reviews.Content: We made a quick two night trip to NYC for my wife's birthday. We booked on-line and took them up on their offer of an upgrade if available at check in. I agreed to all three upgrade options and we wound up getting two bedroom suite. The rate was $329/night. Clearly part of why we stayed at the Waldorf was its storied past. Indeed, the lobby oozes of old time class. Although I'm not sure how strictly enforced, they ask all men to wear slacks and a collared shirt after 6 pm. The room was comfortable, but the bathroom kind of small. Also no wireless internet in the room. (The room is wired and the lobby has wireless.) The hotel is close to a subway stop and an easy walk to Radio City, etc., but there really weren't a whole lot of shopping places or restaurants right nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Luxury”
Reviews.Author: caseyclan3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is undeniably gorgeous and luxe! Probably the most elegant hotel I've stayed at. Although you must remember that it is old. During our stay the plumbing was a small problem, but the helpful staff fixed it right away. It boasts the best brunch in New York City and psssttt- you can see famous people here!! It is VERY VERY VERY expensive though, and is not a usual business class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: heidi123
Reviews.Content: We just returned from three nights at the Waldorf. We did not stay in the tower rooms, just the regular one. Due to the varried reviews here, there must be some older and some redecorated rooms. Ours looked to be recently redecorated. Nice bathroom with a real medicine cabinet with shelves. That was a plus for me. The beds were very comfortable and clean. It is an older hotel, but kept up nicely I thought. The staff was extremely helpful. Only problem I encountered was when I booked (through their web site). I realized I put down wrong info (which did NOT change price in any way). I called the customer service number to update the info and she rebooked me at $100 more! I called them back and after speaking to numerous people, the manager at Waldorf corrected their error. I also declined the minibar key at checkin (and made them note this on my account). I have heard of numerous problems with minibars and didn't want to argue about this.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Astoria - great location”
Reviews.Author: alanatabz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Astoria, found it a great hotel and excellent location. The Greyline bus tour stops at the door, so very handy on that front The hotel is one ofthe historic ones in NYC, and on 49th Street, quite close to Rockafeller centre and 5 mins from Broadway, Times square is about 10 mins walk. Room was clean, spacious and that's all we really needed, we ate out for all meals as we thought breakfast was expensive. If there's flags outside on the flagpoles, check out the country flags. that means a senior official from that country is staying, since the UN is close by. Hotel staff efficient, liked the business centre with 10 mins free for all airline online checkin sites, so a great help. Would def go back!

Reviews.Title: “What Happened Waldorf!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Roddy_Rod
Reviews.Content: You used to be the pinnacle of luxury and you were such a disappointment. I arrived and I waited in the longest check in line I have ever seen and I travel every week for work - but this was my first time at this hotel. The entrance was grand but the rooms were very drab, wallpaper was pealing off from the bathroom walls, the rooms were outdated and the carpet had a weird feel to it in my room. I was in RM 2528 which was a corner kink delux room. I was very disappointed and it is not worth the money at all.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and wonderful...old style NYC”
Reviews.Author: JulesHouston
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on Trip Advisor I changed my reservation from the regular Waldorf Astoria room to the Towers. I am soooo glad I did. The difference is amazing! It is almost a seperate hotel with it's own "Private" entrance off the street and a private entrance in the hotel lobby. There is a special private check in desk for the Towers. I got a really great deal on Expedia and was very excited upon check in to find out I had been upgraded to an Executive Suite on a Concierge level. The room was huge (for NYC standards) with a beautiful marble foyer and seperate living room and bedroom. I had a large walk in closet + a coat closet in the foyer and a butlers kitchen with a full size refrigerator, sink, etc. There was a nice size flat screen TV in the living room and one in the bedroom. The room was very elegant and had a feel of "old style" New York. I have stayed at more modern hotels in NYC with beautiful accomodations however this felt more like NYC and definitely very elegant. The concierge level offers a special room that serves a light breakfast including cereals, breads, fruit, and boiled eggs. There was coffee, juice, and water available. There is no afternoon service as with most concierge hospitality rooms I have experienced and the room was always very crowded. One of my travel companions was turned away one morning and offered a voucher for the lobby breakfast on the main level. Although it was very crowded the staff made every attempt to keep things stocked and were always very helpful and polite even when the guests were not. We were asked everyday if our expectations were met as we left. One staff said to me "we want you to leave happy". Considering the crowd and how rude some of the guests were to the staff, I was impressed with their attitude. The staff were wonderful and the service was exactly what you would expect from the Waldorf. My only issue was that the floors were really slick and I fell in the foyer one evening. We called for ice and it took over 30 minutes for them to bring it up. (no self serve ice machines on the concierge level) Other than that this was a truly wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Huge, impersonal hotel”
Reviews.Author: Avia2r
Reviews.Content: We visited the hotel twice, in October 2008 and Christmas 2008. Although our stay was nice both times, I won't stay again. The hotel is missing this something special that makes a stay unique. It is huge and impersonal. (Perhaps most hotels are in NY). Upon arrival in December, we were upgraded to a Towers suite. In check out, we realized that this was not a complimentary upgrade, although the front desk employee failed to notify us that we would be charged extra. (I am a Hilton Diamond member). After a lot of complaining the hotel finally accepted to charge the original rate, but the employee in the Towers reception was very hostile bordering to rude.

Reviews.Title: “Grande and luxiourious, historic feel”
Reviews.Author: esesi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Waldorf Astoria, NY, in February while visiting Westminster Dog Show, Madison Sq Garden. We had a fabulous time and we did not regret staying at such a famous and well renowed hotel. To a certain extent you could see that the hotels truly big days are gone, the rooms and the corridors were a little bit in need of a face lift. Could be the pompous style that contributes to that feeling and strangely enough I would not want to have it any other way since that very much is their signature. However, the bath rooms (we had 2 in our room/mini suit) were really fresh and up to date. The bed was extremely comfortable and we liked our little extra room in our mini suite where we could sit and take a drink before bed time. The restaurants, bars, lobby and service were fantastic. Location is perfect on Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Tip: Book Concierge Level Room”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixAZ
Reviews.Content: Reviews of the Waldorf are mixed. Reviews of the much more expensive Waldorf Towers, on the other hand, are uniformly positive. The trick to staying in the Waldorf Towers at a reduced rate is to book a "Concierge Level" room through the regular Waldorf. Those rooms are located in the Towers, and they are exceptional. Private elevators, 15-foot ceilings, twice daily maid service, and the standard rooms are easily suite-sized which is huge for NYC accommodations. We stayed in July on the 33rd floor in the N/E corner and the room rivaled any hotel in the city. Towers guests also get free access to the beautiful and never-crowded gym and steam room. If your priority is nice accommodations (the service is a little impersonal due to the size and never ending turnover of guests), and great location this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “W=A is wow=awesome.”
Reviews.Author: Tarasound
Reviews.Content: We travelled with a bus tour which we booked through Travac, an Ottawa travel agent located in the Westgate Shopping Plaza. Our tour included 4 days and 3 nights at the Waldorf=Astoria in the Theatre District of Central Manhatten, New York City. The price was exceptionally affordable and included 2 tour guides, a video of the Waldorf =Astoria, and a 4 hour tour of Manhatten. We opted to start with a deep tissue massage at the Guerlain Spa on the 19th floor. This included a wonderful foot massage while we completed our questionnaire.
