We found all the W=A staff to be professional, sincere, respectful and very friendly. Our room, although small, was opulant, with marbled bathroom and a walk in closet big enough to dress in. I would advise requesting a room located near the central air shaft to avoid the street noise from below. In the business centre behind reception, we discovered free internet access for 10 minutes. The gift shop where you can purchase newspapers is also behind reception. Starbucks is located beside the front door on Park Ave., perfect for a quick breakfast. We ended our stay with a tour of the hotel and viewed the beautiful ballroom and the 4 kitchens which span the length of an entire city block. This is a world reknown hotel which houses state visits from queens, kings and presidents. Well worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pixie58
Reviews.Content: Travelled to NY in July was worried about some of the negative reviews of the hotel and was beginning to regret booking it. Our experience could not have been better! Beautiful hotel, stunning lobby and walkways. Small queue to check in, but it was managed very quickly and efficently. Upgraded to an Astor suite although we had only booked a normal double room. Shortly after getting into our suite, reception rang to check we were happy with everything. Suite was amazing, so much room! Decent size bedroom and beautifully decorated lounge. Looked as though it had been recently decorated and was clean and nicely done. Bed was huge and very comfortable. View was nothing special as we were on the 9th floor, but who were we to complain when we got upgraded to such a lovely suite. Lobby is a great place to people watch and there are all sorts of people coming through ! Conciegre was helpful although there always seemed to be a queue. Didn't eat or drink there as it is expensive and there are lots of other places around. I thought the $50 charge for the tour of the hotel was a bit expensive, there should be a discount if you are staying there. Would be nice to have some sort of leaflet about the history of the hotel as it is a very interesting place. Booked a town car to take us to the airport through the hotel for a reasonable price with no charge to store the luggage.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: toymey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf for 7 days in 2005 after my daughter had an accident and had to have an operation in the States. We stayed there again in 2006. She was in a wheel chair and we got all the assistance from the staff that we needed. Our room was large and beautiful. The Waldorf has an ambience all of it's own and the history has to be preserved. Breakfast, dinner and everything else is great. The autobiography of the original Hilton, left in the room as a gift, changed my life forever. It showed me that you must never give up and always trust God. I have since started a B&B back home and have read the book twice. Thank you Waldorf Astoria for everything you have meant to me.

Reviews.Title: “DIsappointing and in a time-warp”
Reviews.Author: Roamingabout
Reviews.Content: This former Grand Dame of New York has sadly been overtaken by much better boutique hotels and seems content in being a tired rude reflection of it's location. The Waldorf now is regrettably nothing more than a conveyor belt of middle-class cheap one night / weekend brigade stays who seem obsessed with who can wear the tiniest ill-fitting dress ; who can stay up the latest with their lap top by the piano; and who can swan about talking loudly and looking decidedly unimportant. Sorry - I know that is rather damning but the truth often hurts. The hotel is run by numbers and there is no level of sophistication as is evidenced by the endless daily lobby check-in routines. Watch it and enjoy!! The service reflects this - perfunctory but no extra mile. The detail in the rooms are poor when looked at closely with items missing or fudge repaired. The room we stayed at for 4 nights was crying out for a makeover. The internal finishes, lobby, ballroom and state rooms are indeed art deco glorious but this is not enough to make you feel that the stay was 'special'. It's run of the mill stuff. It is extremely rare that I ever consider leaving a hotel early but this was one of those occasions. By all means stay there for a night just to say you've done it. Eat the salad at the Bull and Bear. Take your cocktail in Harry's Bar (or whatever it was called!) If you want something more sophisticated to unwind you from the daily rudeness and grind of New York then this hotel isn't it. There are far better out there at only a slightly higher price if you know where to look and the truth is this hotel knows it. Disappointing and in a time-warp.

Reviews.Title: “Met my High Expectations”
Reviews.Author: NeedSomeSunNow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf to celebrate our anniversary. I am Hilton gold and we were staying on points. My daughter contacted an individual in management to request we receive special consideration. From the moment we arrived at the check in the service was incredible. We were upgraded to a suite and we received a complimentary gift to mark our occasion. We also enjoyed a fantastic dinner at the Bull and Bear at the hotel. As to some specifics, we were driving; the hotel car entrance off 50th St is a narrow alley that goes under and through the building. Initially the entrance was closed for security, as an ambassador was due to arrive, however his arrival was delayed which then allowed me to get in. The elevators are plentiful and fast. The room was wonderful, the hotel had a recent 'facelift', though close examination of the room revealed some ‘character’, the room was very charming. The bed was very comfortable and the showers were tremendous. In the parlor of the suite we could here some elevator mechanical sounds, however the bedroom was very peaceful. We were granted an extra hour for late check out. The hotel was very busy at check in, with a high rate of occupancy. Anticipating we were going to a nice place, we tried to dress for it, it seemed others were trying to make a different statement. To summarize- it is a grand hotel, if you allow it, it will take you back to a higher level of personal service. If you are trying to spend the least amount of money and see NYC it is not for you. People that retrieve cars, carry bags, and provide concierge reservations deserve tips, just like a server in a restaurant. I have stayed at the New York Hilton on Ave of the Americas and the Hilton Times Square, each have their place, but the Waldorf is that special place for something just a cut above.

Reviews.Title: “A Palacial Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJose012
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Waldorf last year and it was truly a impeccable experience. Lobby was Grand and they have a old art piece of Clock right in the lobby. Room was spacious. Stairways, corridors, public areas were all Grand. They have a lot of boutique shops near the lobby. Infact in one of the boutiques, there was a set up made with fine pottery which was a mock up set up for a wedding set up done by the Waldorf... That was interesting. The lounge on the Ground Floor looked really grand with the Lavish use of Leather. Service was simply Great. If you walk around the hotel public areas, it is HUGE and sometimes you get lost if you are truly mesmerized with the Granduer. The history and grandeur of the Waldorf make it a wonderful and a memorable place to stay. It was indeed WORTH a STAY..

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: MARKBUICK76
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night in the Waldorf for our wedding anniversary using our hilton honors points. It was like staying in an historic museum. The lobby was grand. It has old photos and artifacts of the hotel in glass showcases. The room is small, but it is old school and that is what I expected. The room was clean and nicely decorated. As a hilton honors gold member they gave us a choice of 2 free drinks at the bar, 100 Hilton points or starbuck coffee and danishes. We took the drinks. So after dinner we went back to the hotel and used our vouchers at the peacock alley bar. The drinks were good, but when I ordered a second drink (gray goose and cranberry) I was charged $18, wow. So to sum it up I highly recommend the hotel but drink elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Trading on its name - avoid”
Reviews.Author: KeenIrishGolfer
Reviews.Content: Avoid the Waldorf Astoria. A stay there is like waking up beside a 1950's starlet...in 2009. Yes its name may conjour up glamour and elegance from years gone by but they don't seem to have spent a penny on this hotel since years gone by. The decor is shabby, the carpets are shabby, the room amenities are practically non existent and the service is decidely average. The doormen virtually ignore you as you enter the hotel or exit a cab...yet they'll still come running over at the last minute looking for their pound of flesh. Room service is particularly vile (and overpriced). I ordered something very light, it cost me $100 and I genuinely wouldn't give it to my dog. How can a hotel like this have ancient TV's and not flat screens?! This was my first (and last) stay at the Waldorf and I would advise anyone thinking of staying there to avoid it like the plague. There's little point in wasting your money, especially in these recessionary times. If you want to treat yourself in NYC, try the Plaza or even the Grand Hyatt which in my view is streets ahead of the Waldorf. Hilton need to give this place a massive facelift because at the moment it's living off its (diminishing) name.

Reviews.Title: “Not what is was nor what it could be”
Reviews.Author: mjf
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf has a great location, beautiful lobby and helpful staff. Unfortunately it is definitely showing it's age...not in a good way. Our room size was fine, but it looked a bit dingy- curtains have been hanging a long time and need cleaning, as did other things in the room. We had 3 people in our group and the room only had double beds which was difficult for us. We actually had a magnificent balcony, but it was unkept, with trash about, and not a stick of furniture on it! What a wasted amenity!!! On our departure I overheard someone saying he was moving to a different hotel since the Waldorf was, "ratty". I think he had a point.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Classic!”
Reviews.Author: FLYDL
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Waldorf with my wife for her birthday. A beautiful hotel in the heart of Manhattan. You can feel the history. I could imagine Marilyn Monroe walking down these hallways so many years ago. Hotel is perfectly located withing walking distance of 5th avenue shopping, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Times Square etc. Is it the newest around? No. But it's a landmark in which Presidents have stayed! We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “From Montreal to NY at the Waldof Istoria”
Reviews.Author: Big_D_MTL
Reviews.Content: Well what can i say,it GREAT....BRING YOU RE CASH!!! everything here was super,but we will not pay 32 $ for two eggs and if you think of taking a apple from brunch buffet..36$ for buffet. Everything else was super,concierge gave us great info. Oh yes we did get great price on the room 216$ for one night. Good trip all

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Service”
Reviews.Author: francetraveltrekker
Reviews.Content: The quality of the Waldorfs customer service was the worst of any hotel I have ever stayed in. The check in line was long and our room was not available upon arrival, plus we had to wait well beyond the normal check in. To make it worse the staff could have cared less about our trouble This was really unexpected for a hotel of this class. As a frequent traveler I could not have been more disappointed. The rooms were comfortable and clean, restaurant food was good if they work on the service they may in fact actually get repeat business.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel in Great Locatoin”
Reviews.Author: Justinh213
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights in the Waldorf Astoria in New York and were very happy with our stay. The entrance off Park Ave. and the lobby are very classy. The staff was friendly and our room was also very nice. We had a corner room that was clean and comfortable. A subway station is only a block away so you have easy access to the city through the subway or from the many cabs that line up in front of the hotel. The only complaint I have is the Bull and Bear Resturant located in the hotel. It is WAY to expensive for the quality of food and service provided. We only went to this resturant for it's convienience. I will write a separate review for the Bull and Bear. Overall, we were both very happy with our stay at the Waldorf and will consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: IMA81
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Waldorf Astoria on honeymoon from 4th-8th July 2009 and had a fantastic time. The hotel is located on Park Avenue and is the perfect location away from the pandemonium of Times Square but in walking distance to eveything....5th Avenue, Grand Central Station, Rockefeller centre all about 5 minute walk. Central park and the Empire State building are about 10 minute walk but there is a line of taxis at the front door of the hotel. The Waldorf itself is spectacular. Anyone who says this hotel is tired must be used to staying in some fantastic places as my wife and I thought it was great. The front entrance is breath taking and our room was just as opulant with a lovely big marbel finished bathroom. We found the staff to be very friendly and received a complementary bottle of champagne on the first night to celebrate our honeymoon. We didnt eat or drink in the hotel so cant comment on that but there are loads of bars and restaurants nearby. We had a fantastic time there and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Address, Historic Hotel but just OK”
Reviews.Author: ketel_always
Reviews.Content: Traveling 2 weeks in New England, We stayed in July for a couple of days with our teenage sons so they could experience a bit of NYC. I used Hilton points so I wasn't expecting the greatest rooms, no view, smaller etc. It was clean and visually nice, with the styling you'd expect but definately starting to show it's age. I'd guess that the last serious renovation of bathrooms was in the late 80s. The A/C wasn't great, it got cool enough but we could never seem to get the dampness totally out of the air. It's central air but I don't think the dials in the room actually control the temp other than the speed of the fan. This is our second stay here in 3 years and we were realistic about it so none of that really bothered us. We slept fine, although the bed was a little soft for my taste. My warning is that if you get the basic room here and are expecting a room with the grandeur of the Waldorf, you're going to be disapointed. Now the lobby, bars, resturants and the staff and all the rest is what you'd guess they would be.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your credit card bill”
Reviews.Author: ljmzta
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal through Continental, booking flight and hotel together for 2 adults and 2 teenagers. I compared pricing with the Plaza and found a suite at the Waldorf to be about half the price, having stayed here in June of 2008 and enjoying the experience, I decided to stay here again. We stayed on the Lexington side and noticed that it took a long amount of time to get elevators, unsure if several were out of order or what was wrong. Our room was nice, the decor was great but you could definitely see this is an old hotel but I guess that leads to some of it's charm, the art deco stylings. Each day of my stay I had to request additional towels, even though my reservation was for 4 people, I could only get 3 towels. I even told the clerk at check in "there are 4 people in this room." I checked out, was told they were not able to print me a bill. 3 weeks later, I found out why. I saw an odd charge on my credit card for $122.77. I called the hotel to ask what this charge was for, we had not taken any items from the room, ordered room service or billed anything to the room. The billing department advised me that Travelocity told them to bill me this fee for extra person charges. I called Travelocity (Apparently the company Continental Airlines uses) and they said they knew nothing of it, had no records of ever telling the hotel this. I was eventually told by travelocity that the receipt says my room was a double room rate, not a quad rate, even though it says the room is for 4 on my receipt. I ended up giving the issue to my credit card company saying I did not authorize the charges and eventually, I was refunded the money. I am not sure if Travelocity, Capital One, or the Waldorf are responisble for the refund because none of them bothered to call or email me with a resolution. Just like they didn't think it was worth it to tell me they were going to bill me extra....3 weeks after the stay. Apparently using 1 extra towel costs you an additional $122.77 at the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Madison06443
Reviews.Content: Over the last 20 years we've stayed at many hotels in NYC. Coming in from CT for Broadway weekends our thing is to stay at different hotels and try various restaurants in order to soak up the essence of NY. When we saw the special Waldorf rate it was time to experience the best. For $219 we upgraded to the deluxe king room. What a room!! High ceilings, fire place, 42" Flat Screen TV and a terrific view of the Chrysler Bldg. Our freinds weren't as lucky with the view but also had an awsome room. The Waldorf has one of the best lobbys you'll ever see. It's almost like going to a museum. At this rate one's lucky to get a basic room in a average hotel in NYC, take advantage while it lasts.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: PMaloney
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week while visiting New York. We parked in the hotel and upon arrival our bags were removed and car was parked within minutes. Reception: Excellent service, fast efficient and very helpful Room: We had a corner room which was quite big by NY standards. It included a large walk-in wardrobe that accommodated all of our luggage. The room itself was a little old but was spotless and comfortable. Given what we have paid in similar priced hotels in NY this was easily the biggest room we have stayed in. Location: Perfectly located for all shops in 5th Avenue and approx a 15 minute walk to Union Square. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel. It is a little old fashioned, but the service was perfect and coupled with a fantastic room and location, it was well worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice Before Staying Here”
Reviews.Author: Aviator_Boeing
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for a 4th of July 2009 visit to NY at the Waldorf. Have previously stayed at the Ritz, Palace, the Sherry Netherland and before renovation, the Plaza. Thought were getting a great deal for a single room - King for under $300 per night. Not so. We were on the Lexington side of the building (no view - but this was not my complaint). Here are the issues: stayed on 13th floor but visited other floors to confirm impression- once you've left the lobby and are on the Lexington tower you'll quickly notice some dramatic changes in quality and feel. Carpetting is very, very worn, does not look or smell clean or fresh. Gave me the same sense of cleanliness of the security checkpoint carpeting at the airport. Other than the ballroom floors, the hallways on the Lexington tower appeared to lack air conditioning and proper ventilation. I am 40 something guest....and never cared about ventilation before. Courtesy and personalized attention is non-existent (at least for patrons at this rate) - if you need anything more than to hand a tip or your credit card to anyone. The shower admittedly old, did not provide reasonable expectations of hot water or adequate pressure. The front desk attendees had a difficult time delivering a complete bill including mini bar charges. The mini bar had stale $6 potato chips. Room door is not well insulated. In the morning, we heard the whispers and non-whispers of a dutiful (and courteous) cleaning staff on the adjacent rooms. However, not a good sign if sleep is what you need. The TV appeared to be a $100 1990 Walmart purchase - my local Motel 6 has already updated to flat screens - not sure if too much to expect from the hotel touted as the only one where the President stays. Arrived very late at night with not another guest at the time. Nevetheless - it took over 35 minutes for the bags to make my room. It took me 3 minutes to get up to my room. We were pleased by the comfortable bedding. Not impressed by anything else. Hotel business center and computers are quite out of date. You share printers with others in a four computer small room. Difficult if you have sensitive business to work on. I thought this was unbelievable for a hotel of this magnitude. Person in charge of taking my bags for the afternoon after checkout would not stop asking what is my profession and whether business is good - not sure this is what I want to discuss with the hotel staff. Top notch, courteous, professional, personalized attention was non-existent. Does not favorably compare with any of the other five/four star staple hotels in NYC. I've never written a review before but thought this was an important one to write.

Reviews.Title: “Just good!”
Reviews.Author: bbellini
Reviews.Content: It was great, but also expensive...If money is not playing a big role for you, you should try it! Very beautiful grand hotel and one of the oldest!

Reviews.Title: “Worth it-once(or twice) in a life time!”
Reviews.Author: guffin
Reviews.Content: Outstanding from the great check in staff to the staff in the hallways. This hotel that was once owned by George Bolt of Bolt Castle fame on the St. Lawrence River(now mostly restored) lives up to it's previous reputation for greatness. The rooms bring you back to a time of pure elegance and fine service. From gold fixtures to wonderful bedding this is a must. The rates very widely so look deep into the travel websites for a bargain. You will need to save money somewhere to afford a cocktail at the Bull and Bear Bar-$17.50 per. we stayed here,but, now retired, ate off site. Cheap or frugal?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful honeymoon stay”
Reviews.Author: BeautifulTorquay
Reviews.Content: What an amazing honeymoon, being in New York was fantastic staying at the Waldorf Astoria, Park Avenue was everything we expected from a 1930's iconic building as beautiful inside as outside. From the moment we walked into the foyer through the grand marbled corridor to the reception area we felt back in the era of Ginger Rogers, Lana Turner and Walter Pigeon. The service was wonderful, complementary chocolate strawberries and champagne and letters, we felt decadent and like film stars. The room was lovely on a corner on the 24th floor. The views were spectacular. The room was comfortable and big and the bed and bedding was so comfortable. We spent very happy evenings in the cocktail bar. It was the best honeymoon in the world and we loved it so much we're going back in August!

Reviews.Title: “Great history; Fun to have done it once”
Reviews.Author: Viajera64
Reviews.Content: We were excited to stay at the historical Waldorf Astoria, to look at the pictures and marvel at the beautiful decor in the lobby - and it was very interesting to see and read about the history... but the charm ended there. Our room was small and in need of being renovated, the drinks/ food were very overpriced, as expected, and the service for what I would expect from a world-class hotel, was very mediocre. No one was rude, but I expected better service and more attention and have gotten better service from many other hotels. I'm happy we stayed there, but next time I think we'll shoot for staying somewhere in Times Square closer to the action for the same price. For first-time tourists, I recommend walking to Times Square - it's a straight shot down 49th and only about 10 blocks and you pass Rockefeller Plaza, Radio City Music Hall and 5th Avenue all on the way. Go there for dinner and drinks and save yourself some money!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunshinegirl0707
Reviews.Content: after searching for the "perfect" hotel getaway, I choosed the waldorf. I read all previous reviews and went with an open mind. I couldnt have selected a more beautiful, well appointed hotel, it still has all the glamour and history I was expecting. Our room was upgraded to a suite, the appointments were gorgeous, the bed fabulous, linens perfect, this room had it all. I was very pleased with the selection. The front checking was wonderful, easy, fast, the desk staff was friendly, smiling, happy to be working at such a classic hotel. When asking for anything every staff member was friendly and willing to go the extra, I had a wonderful stay at such a fabulous hotel, I would go again, without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not what I expected!”
Reviews.Author: moodyblue0611
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 6pm by limo. The hotel staff in the parking area were to say the least uninterested in our arrival and I had to find one of them to take care of our luggage. We were given what was described as an upgraded room, that was a little disappointing. It could do with some TLC and redecorating. The staff were great, all being helpful and couteous. A couple of weeks before this stay, we stayed at the Hilton New York and have to say our suite there was more comfortable and our welcome to the hotel more professional. We were really made to feel welcome there. Not as nice as we had expected!

Reviews.Title: “Having stayed in luxury hotels worldwide, the Waldorf falls way short of expectation.”
Reviews.Author: differentplaces
Reviews.Content: Initial impressions of the Waldorf were poor and nothing happened for us to change our minds. Queueing in a long line on arrival for reception was annoying and the receptionist just rattled off what was an obvious sales pitch when she asked us if we'd like to eat. We were in a "king superior" which was spacious and clean, but backed on to 49th Avenue where garbage vans work constantly from 5-10.30pm every weekday emptying out the rubbish from the office block opposite. Forget trying to sleep while this is going on, even if you have jetlag travelling from the UK. Breakfast in the Peacock restaurant was $33 for the worst buffet I've ever seen or eaten. Actually "buffet" is an exaggeration, there were just a few slices of processed cheese, 2 (!!) slices of inedible meat, some bread and fresh fruit (the melon was disgusting) to choose from. The waiter had the nerve to tell us we couldn't share like we were schoolchildren. Breakfast downstairs serves up a decent fruit bowl with a choice of bread - a mere $28. On the last day of our stay, we went down the road to the deli and had the same breakfast for $10 each. You have to queue for the concierge as well as reception, this time to be told they didn't have any brollies to lend us. Knowing traders were waiting outside and selling them for $5. This is a hotel still relying on past glories. The large reception hall is bling Art Deco, as are the ladies restrooms, but behind this grandeur, there's a tired feel to the place. The Waldorf is part of the Hilton group who continue to rely on its previous high reputation and status, charge ludicrous amounts of money for everything and expect people to put up with it. Well, wrong, we'll stay elsewhere next time we're in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Jackpot!”
Reviews.Author: fun2bhad_4
Reviews.Content: Although I was concerned after reading some reviews I kept our reservations at the WA in NY for the beginning of our vacation. I'm SO GLAD I did! I rec'd excellent service from the first reservation call, the 2 calls prior to arriving (I was nervous because some member pics of the beds made them look small), to the day we checked out. Nothing short of "bend over backwards for us!" We got what I think is the "expedia" room because the view I've seen in pics too. It is not the Park Ave view, but I can't expect that for the expedia price I paid, but it was a good view of the Chrysler Bldg. and the room was actually quite large with a walk in closet. Edgar the doorman was a hoot! He recommended Pizza at Angelo's and it was perfect. Not a far walk either. We also walked to Ess-a-bagel and didn't get yelled at--even though we hoped we would just to get that NY feel! haha! They were delicious. Everyone that we encountered at the hotel were great, except the waiters in the lobby bar where we stopped for a welcome cocktail with the free beverage coupon they gave us. But we had kids and they probably didn't want to be bothered with them. Our room was stale smelling upon arrival but what can you expect form an older hotel. I asked for freshener and Mason was there in less than 10 minutes to spray an orange scented freshener and it was fine. My rating from 1-10--WA gets a 9! We wanted "kid friendly" apps and drinks one night so we stopped by TGI Fridays. HORRIBLE mistake! Horrible horrible service, the food tasted like it had been sitting around for days. Save your money and take the ecommendations of hotel staff instead.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome building, service Sucks”
Reviews.Author: citytraveler_9
Reviews.Content: I went to stay at this hotel for 2 days to celebrate a mini-honeymoon. The check in process was nice, and the guy at the front desk told me that he was sending me a complimentary strawberry and champagne package. That's where the excellent service ended. Two days and three phone calls later, there were no strawberries and there was no champagne. I also made a reservation at the steakhouse, bulls and bears, through the hotel phone (from my room). When I reached the restaurant, the maitr'd told me that he had no record of my reservation. He did not apologize for it; instead he seemed to try to make me feel sorry for visiting the restaraunt without a reservation. Despite several empty seats, he sat my fiancee and I in a cramped space surrounded by other people. We left the place and went to a much friendlier and nicer steakhouse. The Waldorf Astoria hotel has excellent history, but needs to get its act together. I will never stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, but you have to go”
Reviews.Author: The_Lewis
Reviews.Content: Let's be upfront - I was thrilled to be booked into the Waldorf Astoria, even though anticipating that it would be a faded and worn shadow of its Thirties glory. And it was, but I would still go again with the family just to share with them a New York landmark. Stayed in three rooms over 4 nights. The first room was tiny with two double beds lacking any form of back support. Was moved to a quirky mini-suite overlooking the front entrance. This is the sort of room which makes staying in an old hotel so memorable. It had an entrance foyer, bedroom, a huge dressing room (large enough for a small couch, dressing table and two armoires) and an art deco bathroom on a raised platform. Incredible. The third room was a nicer version of the first. All the rooms were worn and in need of repainting, new furniture and carpets. But it was all well worth staying for the fireplaces in the halls, lobby area and the ability to say that you stayed at the Waldorf=Astoria.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: oldfogeys
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 6th - 8th June as part of a 5-night NY trip to celebrate a 50th birthday. From the moment we arrived till the moment we left we were treated so well, the staff were all pleasant, helpful, attentive, no pretentiousness, and a real credit to the hospitality industry! We were upgraded to a suite which was absolutely beautifully furnished and spotlessly clean. The bathroom had plentiful towels and toiletries, the shower had power, the bed was huge and the living area with its gorgeous chandelier was just magnificent! The staff sent up a bottle of bubbly to help us celebrate too! We had a couple of drinks in Sir Harry's bar where the high standard of service was replicated, nice dish of complimentary mixed nuts! - and the prices weren't too bad in comparsion to the big measures! Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel, you just cannot fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Glamour and glitz”
Reviews.Author: integrityandhonesty
Reviews.Content: Wonderful service and equally wonderful hotel. Not the cheapest but it was a treat for my wife. One of the "must do" hotels as you travel around the world.

Reviews.Title: “your not a guest... your a number”
Reviews.Author: goldcoastgal82
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Waldorf Astoria in honour of our wedding in New York City. The Waldorf to us seemed very New York, very classic - it would fit so perect into our New York Destination Wedding. I was VERY disapointed in the hotel and service however not to be confused with my STAY in New York , that was amazing. You often read reviews and think "Disgruntled traveller and blames everything ". I have taken the time to join up on Trip Advisor and write this review as I feel my stay needs to be shared. Check In - was quick and professional. however no "extra" service. Can conceirge help you with dinner reservations?, can I assit with any local information, is there anything I can do to assit with your stay ahead of time?. None of these were asked and it would have been a nice touch. It felt like you were at an airline counter, line up and be sent off in a hurry... Conceirge Rude , Rude , Rude and unhelpful. I was made to feel like an inconvenience at any time I had a request . Very disapointing. Extras It would have been nice to receive a welcome card or congratulations card or our wedding ; however their was no acknowledgement at all. Even though it was noted in our reservation and wearing a wedding dress is a clear indication. It wasnt a big deal however small touches do differ hotels from others. Room Service A bottle of champagne was delivered as a suprise to us from a friend ; we were then charged for this. Upon explaining this was a gift and it had clearly been pre paid ; we were given the third degree. After making us wait they found the records and then decided to remove it the bill. I was made to feel as if I was lying and trying to get a ree bottle ! We clearly made the mistake of putting our champagne in the minibar as then we were charged or $100.00 worth of items that were just moved to the side to make room. We were told that we were not allowed to make room for personal rereshments and that was considered taking the product. The drinks were just put on the side of the fridge as the minibar attendant would have clearly noted. Really.... a little pathetic. Afterall its still the champagne that was from their hotel. Valet Asking for my wedding dress to be pressed was such a challenge. I never thought a reequest of this nature would prove such a challenge and a 40 minute wait in the lobby. The bell captain was very unhelpful just telling me to call the Laundry on his desk phone and ask them my request ... very unprofessional ... can they not annouce calls and or handle requests themselves , making me wait? The service of the dress at the end was well done. All in all , I never mind paying top dollar for above adverage service to say the least this was just below par. The hotel would charge you to breathe! from $13.95 a minute local phone calls , excessive business centre charges, charged for extra glasses to be brought to your room, $5.00pp room service fee... I am sure the list goes on. The room was spacious , very clean, amenities very high standardm, and housekeeping very attentive. If you are after a Waldorf Astoria experience come for coffee and people watch in the foyer , dont bother staying ....go to the Plaza instead. I had high tea at the Plaza and just that 1 hour experience was wonderful ; the stay would have been too .... Unortunately, my Waldorf experience was far below adverage.

Reviews.Title: “The good and bad of an old school hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keithcu
Reviews.Content: New York city is unique to the world, and I like staying in uniquely New York hotels when I'm there. The Waldorf definitely qualifies. It has the great lobby, half a dozen food/drink options, and the feel of something old and wise. The lobby is always hopping, which I love. That said, the hotel doesn't do anything super - the rooms are small, some areas are a little worn, they don't always have enough people working the front desk, etc. But, for me, this is so much better than the cookie-cutter hotel experience that you will get at the big chains, even in NYC. When you wake up and stumble into the lobby, you won't forget what city you're in, and that's worth something. The Waldorf gets a thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “It Doesn't Get Any Better Than This”
Reviews.Author: scmcb
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf=Astoria not only lived up to it's legendary reputation, it exceeded it. I have stayed here several times and it has always been a phenomenal experience. On the most recent stay I brought my wife and two young children (6 and 9) up for the kids' first trip to New York.as part of a business trip I was on. The only downside to this decision is that the bar set by the Waldorf=Astoria can never be reached by anywhere else and my kids will now measure every other hotel by this stay. Every staff member is friendly, helpful, enthusiastic, professional and genuinely nice. We had the great fortune of staying in a room that almost defies description - it was beyond elegant. I have also had the pleasure to stay in other rooms which may not have been as large, but were still very luxurious and roomy. I recommend this hotel to anyone who would like to have a real New York, or for that matter, world class, experience. The room rate was an excellent value. The location is great as well - on Park Avenue, a short walk to Grand Central, Fifth Avenue and Times Square. I always look forward to staying at the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Classic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amsharpe
Reviews.Content: My family and I chose to stay at the Waldorf due to the history and location of the hotel. Having read the reviews on TripAdvisor I ws confident we would not be disappointed and we were not. Even with its age the hotel was in great shape and our room was very nice. We ended up in the tower on the 35 th floor with a great view of the city. The room had a large well appointed bathroom and VERY comfortable beds. The lobby was goergous and the staff very nice and helpful. Well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “SO ELEGANT!!!”
Reviews.Author: gumbie1118
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf in late January. The hotel is very close to Grand Central Station so it made transportation so easy. We were so impressed with the hotel. The staff was great and the room was awesome! We had issues with the heater at that time, and they graciously upgraded us to a suite since it was also my first time in the city. The concierge was very helpful and the entire NYC experience was made much more memorable because of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horrid”
Reviews.Author: TEXDC
Reviews.Content: Worst excuse for a "luxury" hotel I've ever seen, anywhere, including the Third or Fourth World. aStayed in "Upgraded" king room with Hilton Diamond (highest) status. Rooms are extremely dated and in poor condition. Bed and bed linens smelled as if they had not been changed from the last guest, the beds had to be changed twice on check in and the pillows had to be swapped out for new ones. Room was not ready, despite Diamond Status and notification to the hotel upon booking of time of arrival. Carpet was so worn as to be slippery, and indeed we did both slip several times. Very, very loud, even for location. I have lived in and visited Manhattan my whole life, and I assure you there are much better hotels at the price - try the Sherry Netherland or Lowe's Regency. When I was a child in Manhattan this was known as an hotel for business, parvenu tourists, and an "event" venue for second rate debutante balls - but I cannot think anyone in even any of these classes would put up with this hotel. If you really think there is something special about this hotel, visit the lobby and the bar - if you need to get your hair done, go the Kenneth's by all means - but for Heaven's sake, stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “One night stay - upgrade to a suite in the Towers”
Reviews.Author: pcs1
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Waldorf last week. I usually stay in another mid-town hotel but for logistical reasons chose to stay at The Waldorf this time. I had a very nice - but perhaps atypical - experience. I booked at superior room but at check in was upgraded to a one-bedroom suite in the Waldorf Towers. Decor a little dated -- but very large and very comfortable. I was on the 33rd floor so not bothered by street noise which can be intense in Manhattan. My room rate included breakfast at Oscar's - a choice between American or Continental breakfast -- breakfast was good and they brought me a nice big pot of tea. The hotel is enormous and obviously caters to a convention/group crowd. The public areas are very nice and they showcase the long history of the hotel. Definitely NOT a boutique hotel experience. Location is terrific - right down the street from Saks and St. Patrick's Cathedral. All hotels in Manhattan are expensive but with my upgrade this was great value -- and also would have been good value even without it.

Reviews.Title: “not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Alexandre92100
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 5 nights in may 09 with my mum in 2 different rooms. I've chosen the superior ones. When we arrived, only one was ready, the other wich was gaven later was on the same floor but not the same size, first question. Then I wanted to use the internet, the connexion is announced at "a nominal fee" for those room on the WA website....15$ a day, is it nominal?? they also say that the maid comes twice a day, they never showed up for the night tunr!! when I complained at the front desk, the answer I had was "oh, ok, sorry"...is it an answer you're supposed to get for such a hotel? Well, of course, the hotel's got a very nice lobby but I guess one should better just have a look there but stay in an other hotel....

Reviews.Title: “This is my type of hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Ellemay
Reviews.Content: Wow....the moment you walk into this hotel you know your walking into history. A beautiful gracious elegant masterpiece oozing with magnicent architectural features. This is my type of hotel. A hotel that stands proudly with memoirs of the famous and the ordinary; a stylish grandeur of stately opulence in days gone by. A hotel with a story. Check in – Busy hotel with queues but extremely friendly and professional. Room – Our suite 1148 was traditionally furnished with a spacious lounge room which consisted of a lounge suite, large working desk , mini bar, and beautiful antique furniture. The bedroom was enormous with a comfortable king size bed and a cabinet with TV. Off the bedroom was a walk-in dressing room with safe. Bathroom – spacious with great walk-in shower and large vanity unit. Location – Marvellous location just around the corner from Fifth Avenue. The hop on/ hop off bus has a stop outside the hotel. Staff - All happy to assist, we found all members to be totally professional and proficient. Dining – We had a very ordinary breakfast the first day in the café downstairs. However, we were blessed when our US clients escorted us to the Sunday brunch and Oh my goodness, what a delightful feast. We were very happy we didn’t have to pay ! as its very expensive but a must do if staying in the hotel on the weekend. Overall – We loved our stay at the Waldof Astonia. It’s a " real " hotel that is smothered with old fashioned grandness and luxury. Staying in New York at the Waldorf was a wonderful experience and a very special treat !

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Experience-very good”
Reviews.Author: PiFi
Reviews.Content: Impressive hotel especially the lobby areas. The rooms and corridors are more dated and a little worn but the comfort and service makes up for it. Our room had the disadvantage of having a generator running all nights on the roof outside our window but with ear plugs you wouldnt hear it. However at a hotel of this claibre i would have expected double or tribble glazing on the rooms facing this internal lightwell to help dampern the generator noise or sort out the noise form the equipment in the first plave. That aside we had a lovely stay and would defenatily stay again i would just ask for a room well away for that roof in future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, rooms vary”
Reviews.Author: MCHCA
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were visiting NY and booked the Waldorf 7 months in advance. We arrived at 1 am without luggage as the airline had lost our luggage. The lobby is gorgeous and well maintained. The man at the front desk, I believe his name was Amin checked and found our room had been given away and immediately upgraded us to a luxury suite. He also assured us he would send up toiletries. He was very professional and helpful and such a relief to find someone so helpful in NY! Sure enough he sent up a great pack of all the toiletries we would need. The suite was nice and consisted of a living room, bedroom, front hall, dressing room and bathroom. The furnishings and window shades appeared to be a bit worn but other than that it was very nice. The next night we switched to a normal room which was a corner room overlooking Park Avenue. This room seemed very updated, was very large, had high ceilings and very comfortable. Our parents were also on the trip and I found their room to be a bit dark and also a little outdated and smaller so I think the rooms really vary. I would recommend asking for a corner room. The bathrooms are nice, GREAT water pressure. The actual location of the hotel is great because you are within walking distance of Times Square and Broadway but enough removed to not be in the middle of the chaos. Also being 2 blocks from 5th avenue was nice since we didn't have any luggage! The Bull and Bear Bar hosts the Fox Business Network show "happy hour" every weekday so we went and had a drink at the bar and watched the taping which was a lot of fun. We only ate at the hotel for breakfast at Oscars which was very good. Overall I am confident I would stay here again but would request a corner room. Great staff at both the front desk and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “1st class service with excellent facilities.”
Reviews.Author: jackson_sprandy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Waldorf Astoria in NYC for a holiday with my now fiancee.I got a great deal for 2 nights through hiltons own website. I had put on my booking form that i would be arriving on my birthday.I thought nothing more of it. From arriving with very bad jet lag and no bags (Grrr British Airways), the staff at the hotel couldnt do enough to make us feel welcome. They pointed us in the direction of clothes stores to purchase replacement clothes which the airline lost and generally made us feel special. On returning to the hotel after a days sightseeing, we returned to our room to find a tray of chocolate covered strawberries and a bottle of champagne with a hand written card from the general manager wishing me a happy birthday and "if there was anything the hotel can do for you to enhance your stay, please do not hesitate to contact me". I was so impressed by this hotel and its staff i decided to propose to my girlfriend in the hotel as opposed to elsewhere in the city. It really was that good. I would recommend this hotel to anyone time and time again.

Reviews.Title: “An old hotel with lots of character”
Reviews.Author: leighan1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Waldorf for 5 nights this month and really enjoyed my stay. It is a heritage building and one of the oldest hotels in New York. I believe it is nick named The Old Dame. The decor is old fasioned and you feel as though you are being taken back to the Marilyn Monroe/Frank Sinatra era when you are there. The location is perfect, right in the heart of Manhatten. And the staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you expect for the price”
Reviews.Author: scotlandmark
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for seven nights. Before we went we had high expectations due to the Waldorf name. This hotel is very run down and needs a major renovation. The rooms are a decent size but everything seems old and needs replaced. We found the staff in the hotel not too friendly unless you had cash in your hands ready to tip. The man who works in the security deposit box area is extremely sad and angry looking. Overall I would not stay here again, it is not worth the money and living on an old reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms dated, service so so”
Reviews.Author: allovus
Reviews.Content: We took a family vacation at Thanksgiving to New York. The location is great, but our room was very dated.(over $400 a night). We got to the airport to fly home and realized we left our video camera in the room. We could not get a live person on the phone. It was 2 days later before someone from lost and found called us back. Of course they said they could not find our camera. I sure they didn't even look. I do not think I will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: RawFitness
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. When the staff found out we were celebrating a birthday, they sent a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries to our room. I love the old world charm of this hotel. The romm was beautiful. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: abigaleCoKildare
Reviews.Content: I travelled to NYC with my daughter last week. We had organised to stay at a private club for the 1st 4 nights. We were delighted with the accommodation there, it was 1st class, however they were full for our last night and I had to find somewhere equally as nice, and decided on the Waldorf. Well! What a lovely experience! We were SO sorry we had not spent the week there!!! The room was large and the beds so comfortable. The buzz of the reception, lobby & bar area was electric. I did find the bar and restaurant expensive: but there is a Starbucks on the premises and so many restaurants nearby....u are never stuck for somewhere to eat in NYC!! Our ONLY problem was, that the fire alarm went off at 2am !! It was a false alarm...so could have been worse. New York is such good value, I look forward to my next trip. I will be staying at the Waldorf for the full duration of my trip! Cant wait!

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: gea-bud
Reviews.Content: We chose Waldorf-Astoria because the incredible offer on their site (pay in advance, no change of dates, no refund, a room for around 230USD). As we could not find anything better at this rate we thought that trying such a world famous hotel would be fun. In fact the hotel is nothing special, I would say it is fairly average. The rooms are clean but a bit run down, you can see that they have not been redecorated or renovated in decades. The TV is at least 15 years old. We stayed on the 10th and had absolutely no view, only the offices in front of us... I would have been a bit dissapointed had I paid the normal rate...... When we arrived nobody offered any help with the luggage and I was a bit surprised to see the internet service for almost 5USD per minute (we came from Central America on our way back to Europe and had no laptop). I was a bit shocked that this was the world famous Waldorf, but with the price I paid it was worth it. I would definitely not pay the normal rate as it would be far too much for this service and quality. I personally prefer smaller, friendlier places and Waldorf-Astoria is definitely none of the above.

Reviews.Title: “A little underwhelming!”
Reviews.Author: HappyWanderer72
Reviews.Content: Treated my Mum to a two night stay at the Waldorf Astoria over Christmas 2008. I unfortunately expected a lot more from this hotel, and was a little disappointed with the stay. Check-in was incredibly slow and ended up leaving bags with the bell captain and walked around Manhattan to kill time until our room was ready. Ended up with room 1455 which had fairly average furnishings. The curtains needed a good clean, the surfaces were all a bit grotty and the telephone hadn't ever been cleaned! The bathroom was pretty average but they did provide nice toiletries. The room did have two very comfortable double beds with lovely soft pillows, sheets and gorgeous feather quilts. Had a wonderful porter who was extremely friendly and very knowledgeable. Most of the staff we came across were very helpful. No wireless internet access in rooms. To use the business centre downstairs it was a fee of $4.99 to log on, then 80c per minute thereafter. I did get random wi-fi behind the lobby by the public telephones but it dropped out frequently. My advice is to find an internet cafe! Don't drink at Starbucks inside the Waldorf at the 5th Avenue entrance. It's way more expensive than every other Starbucks. After eight previous stays in NYC, I'd prefer to be over on the 8th or 9th Avenue side of Times Square for proximity to cheap and cheery restaurants and bars. 5th Avenue was a little short of eateries at night, but did find a nice little Italian place called San Martin on 49th between Lex and Park. Great food and service was fabulous. I'm sure the East Side has great places to eat, but given the weather on Christmas Eve, we didn't venture too far away. Would I stay there again - No. I think it's overpriced and over-rated. For that kind of money, I'd try the W Hotel or spend the extra money on Broadway shows!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: kcplaza2001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf for two night on business. I was quite excited because of its history and name, but came away disappointed. I stayed on the 6th floor, the room was small, view of a brick wall, dated furniture and no wireless internet. I ordered room service for room service, 2 eggs/coffee and juice and it was $53. For the price, there are a ton better options and I'll never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional Glamour and Charm”
Reviews.Author: H0lidayhead
Reviews.Content: We were 'upgraded' to this hotel by our travel agents, so found ourselves based here for a two-night stay by happy accident. Our room was allocated to us on arrival at 10.30am and we were delighted to discover it was a very spacious twin room decorated traditionally (lots of florals going on!). The bathroom was somewhat dated but was perfectly adequate for a short stay with good supply of towels and toiletries. We found the bars and restaurants in the hotel to be almost prohibitively expensive, but this is probably due to the weak Sterling when we visited. That said, we had a couple of drinks in the bar near the lobby - everyone just seemed to be having the most lovely time in there and we didn't want to miss out! The hotel is well located for first time visitors to New York who want to do all the sights - we were able to walk to most landmarks, although there were always plenty of taxis to be had nearby if needed. It's always a comforting feeling in a big city to pop back to the hotel to drop off shopping/freshen up before heading back out - and the Waldorf was located centrally so as to allow us to do this. Overall, this hotel is the very meaning of 'faded glamour'. Whilst I'm glad we experienced the charm of the Waldorf I would probably pick a more contemporary hotel for future visits to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great First Time Stay at the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: NJparalegal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary at the Waldorf in April 2009. We stayed for an extended weekend and we had the time of our lives. Upon checking in, we asked for an upgrade and were given a minisuite on the 42nd (top) floor. We found out this suite also doubles as a second bedroom for the Royal Suite, which used to be the part-time home to the Duke and Duchess of Windsor. The room was absolutely beautiful and had windows that faced 50th Street and you could also see Park Avenue. There was a small foyer, that included a wetbar and refrigerator. Then the bedroom/living area, which had the most comfortable king bed I've ever slept in, along with a desk and chair, couch, armchair, coffee table, end tables and entertainment center with TV. To the right of the bedroom was a small changing area with a closet where the safe was kept along with luggage racks, iron and ironing board. Through the dressing area was the bathroom, which had a tub and separate shower area. We could not have asked for better service. The hotel was convenient to everything and there were a couple subway stations within a block or two. We would definitely love to return to the Waldorf someday, but there are so many other cities/countries we want to see first.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: fraggles
Reviews.Content: This is a large, impersonal, busy hotel. We had a one bedroomed suite which was spacious enough for a family of four. The bedroom and lounge were in good condition, comfortable and clean but felt cold and dark even on the sunniest of days. The bathroom was old and very dated. We heard no traffic noise. Drinks and food were expensive. I found the location of Sunday brunch in the main foyer next to the check in desks to be rather odd. I was surprised at the lack of security at this hotel, as anyone could just wander in. The hotel is ideally located and within easy walking distance of many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Honeslty?.....I stayed for the name!”
Reviews.Author: Riggers01
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf is extremely elegant, and as the famous hotel it is i certainly wasn't disappointed. The rooms were not huge but immaculate, and I loved the bathroom, really bright with loads of mirrors! The bed was fabulous (mind you, its so exhausting sighseeing you would sleep on a washing line!) However in New York you spend very little time in your room anyway! It has to be said the people watching in the Waldorf was fabulous full of tux's and ball gowns and me in my Ugg boots! I have to be fair I only stayed in the hotel because of it history but it really did make my trip to New York special!

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Hotel Experience!”
Reviews.Author: lisaland
Reviews.Content: I too read the not-so-flattering reportst about the Waldorf-Astoria before I left. I did not get the chance to choose a hotel because we were part of a group. I was pleasantly surprised by my WA experience! The service is second to none. They took care of anything we asked for. One night, I needed to ice my foot. Within minutes after asking, I had an ice bag at the door. The decor was upscale and very elegant. The hotel room was large and spacious. The only part of the hotel that showed any age was the bathroom plumbing. I was ok with that though. We had the opportunity to have dinner in the Bear and Bull. Quite expensive, but very nice. A drink in the lobby was about twice what it would have been anywhere else. The food at our two group breakfasts was super, and a perfect way to start the day. Would I stay here again...probably not since it's a "been there, done that" kind of thing. I do prefer the Crown Plaza on Time Square to this hotel. Would I recommend this hotel? Absolutely! It's a great place to experience atleast once. On a side note...we noticed what we thought were hookers in the lobby very late one evening. Not sure if this is something you see in other NY hotels but the were there to "see" someone. I'm not sure if they were allowed upstairs or not. (GROSS)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place....middle of road for NYC.”
Reviews.Author: cliff1788
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at the WA for a long weekend with friends. Location is central in Midtown which makes it easy to get around. The WA's famous name makes it sound more appealing than it really is. I am not going to rip on the hotel because it is nice but lets face it...It is an old place....and you can sort of tell it. I think the management has done a great job with what they have but the WA is aging and it is easy to tell in some spots. The hotel apparently does not have AC and heat...they only have one or the other. the temp was 80 degrees in NYC but the AC in the hotel had not been switched on. Our room was not uncomfortable but our friends did complain. they were told to open a window and they provided them with a small oscillating fan. It was funny to see this cheap little wal mart fan blowing around a room in the WA. Our room was small but it was well appointed. the bath towels were top notch and the bed was very nice. the 42 inch flat screen was cool too. check in service was polite and the concierge was very helpful. Bartenders were cool and recommended great restaurants. The WA is nice and everyone is as nice as they could be but honestly the place was a little disappointing. Overall, I think the problem that I, and all of our friends, had with WA is that the hotel itself does not live up to its big name. when you say WA you think of timeless elegance and oppulent accomodations. Not bashing the WA but we are just used to something a little nicer and i think most seasoned travelers would be on the same page.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, good service, challenged experience.”
Reviews.Author: eandjbeck
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf is a beautiful Hotel with comfortable beds and a helpful staff. Its location is perfect, near the liveliest spots but far enough to allow for a good nights rest. Now for the not so great, our non-smoking room was a smoking room with an air-ionizer placed in it. The hotel double charged our account for our stay, only after placing a hold for 100 dollars a day over the initial quote for the possibility of "incidentals" (ie. minibar, internet use etc). This brought the on hold amount from our bank account to 240% of the initial quote. In the staffs defense, after being told by the desk attendant I was wrong and the charges were correct, the manager called and corrected their mistake, 24hrs later it was corrected, both on paper and in my bank account. The television remote never worked, but we were so tired from running at city speed we didn't have time to notice. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff, attentive and courteous, with the exception of the desk clerk,were always professional. I had high expectations for this hotel, but found myself disappointed when I had to correct another billing issue at check out, this time an incorrect charge for the minibar, of course in the hotels favor. Everything here is specifically designed to seperate you from your hard-worked for dollars. Enjoy your stay here, but double check all billing, and be prepared to direct attention to poorly handled billing procedures. Don't be too nice to make a stand, you will be taken advantage of.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: GlobalMogul
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked at the Waldorf for a romantic getaway this month and were pleasantly surprised at the accommodations. We booked the romantic package(champagne & breakfast in bed). and were pleased to be upgraded to a tower one bedroom suite, above and beyond the package suite. The restaurants are a bit pricey, we at Qdoba across the street for dinner one night. Had lunch at the Peacock restaurant in the hotel and would say that it is fair, although the fact that it is off the lobby and the people watching was great. When booking in NYC I recommend considering the Waldorf simply based on value. I am looking at booking another trip to NYC and the Waldorf is only about $40 more than the Hampton Inn, so for the extra money I will stay at the Waldorf based on it's status and proximity to local attractions.

Reviews.Title: “After not expecting much, I was pleasantly suprised once there!”
Reviews.Author: RaysPizza
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this I traveled to New York not expecting much from the hotel. Well I must say I was wrong. The hotel is in a fantastic location and I would say that if you were to use all the facilities, which I did not, then it would be worth the money. The rooms were very clean and the staff more than happy to help. Despite the fact my first room was on the small side after requesting a larger room I was given a corner room which proved to be larger, although some bathroom space was compromised. Not to big a problem as that is an area I do not tend to spend much time in. The location was excellent. A 4,5,6 subway round the corner, a ten minute walk to Grand Central and about the same to Times Square. All in all I would recommended you stay here if you get a relatively good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: PhileasFoggScotland
Reviews.Content: We were really apprehensive with all the previous negative reports, but we have to say we had a great time. When we first arrived, the room we were given was not big enough for my wife and two sons. We enquired with John, the very helpful check in clerk, who moved us the next day to a large corner room. We were on floor 12, which is barely half way up the main hotel building on the front (Park Avenue) corner and we heard almost no noise from passing traffic. You hear the odd car horn but what else would you expect in one of the busiest Cities in the world. We did not eat in the Hotel as we found it very expensive and not suitable for children. The hotel lobby and reception are however stunning and the staff are all very helpful and accommodating. We will return to this hotel on our next trip to NY and our experience does not reflect some of the other entries on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cherrytreefold
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at the Waldorf Astoria to celebrate my 60th Birthday, we didn't eat in the Hotel as we were out from morning till night sight seeing. On the morning of my birthday I was going to have a lovely bubble bath and champagne, only to find there was no water, we couldn't even have a wash. Disappointing to say the least, we were told that no rooms had any water and that it did eventually come on , but unfortunately we had left to go shopping by then.

Reviews.Title: “OMG the perfect hotel, perfect room and perfect staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: tivvo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to New York for our wedding anniversary and chose the Waldorf because of it's name and also we were offered a pretty good rate. We stayed on the concierge floor (actually 2 flights up on 28) because continental breakfast was included, and we might get a better view up higher. It was the best decision ever! Our room was BEAUTIFUL, with a loungeroom, walk-in-robe, king size bed, fireplace, and although the view wasn't spectacular, it was decent. We just loved going down to the 26th floor for breakfast. Seeing the gorgeous fresh food laid out on proper silver ware and greeted with a smile and kind words each morning was fabulous. Breakfast included cereals, fresh fruit salad, yogurts, smoked salmon, bagels, a selection of breads, freshly brewed tea and coffees, all of which could be taken away and eaten in your room if you wanted. The hotel itself was amazing. Now, we would probably only stay in a hotel maybe two or three times a year, so are not experts or anything, but we know when we are enjoying something and we DEFINITELY enjoyed the Waldorf Astoria. We ate i the famous Bull and Bear restaurant (I enjoyed my surf and turf, the hubby HATED his oven roasted rib), drank in Sir Harry's bar ($9 beer, $12 vodka & coke, $22 cosmopolitan + tips), and walked EVERYWHERE (20mins in heels to times sq!). We even arrived to our room one night to find a bottle of champagne and choc dipped strawberries awaiting us. No, we definitely can't speak high enough of the Waldorf Astoria, LOVED IT!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected luxury”
Reviews.Author: slates7
Reviews.Content: The hotel overlooking needs refurbishing, the windows and corridors as well. The hotel located in an excellent place. It is very huge you can loose yourself easly. We didn't get the reserved room, but they offered free breakfast for us. A strange noise from the street had heard. The quality of the service was excellent and stay as well. We've been there only one night. I told the problem for the receptionist at check-out, she wrote it up, I hope they can do something.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful stay at a historic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: QM2passenger
Reviews.Content: We chose the Waldorf Astoria for a two-night stay before a Caribbean cruise on the Queen Mary 2. We wanted to combine this modern cruising icon with the historic landmark of NY that the Waldorf is. The hotel is impressive and has this kind of old elegance, charm and finesse that it is difficult to find in modern hotels. It is well maintained, even if some places look tired. We particularly liked the rich wood hues in various walls and the balanced combination of spaciousness and restricted classical atmosphere in many public spaces. Our room was tastefully decorated, giving you a sense of intimacy, warmth and harmony. Service was very good and the staff was helpful and friendly. Actually we experienced this as soon as we arrived, when a kind young employee at the front desk (we remember him with gratitude) upgraded us to a beautiful junior suite at the 17th floor. We had dinner at the historic Bull and Bear Restaurant of the hotel, whose decor and ambience we enjoyed. The restaurant promotes itself for its awarded beefsteaks, and we found our own to be true to the advertisement. The location of the hotel is magnificent, at the centre of action of New York City. Everything was near, and when we needed to do some shopping all we had to do was to walk a bit, simultaneously enjoying the atmosphere of the city. Right outside of the hotel we also found the two-decker buses that we extensively used to explore the city. Overall it was a most memorable stay. Decor, room, service, staff, location were great. We would return to the Waldorf Astoria in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but rooms disappointing”
Reviews.Author: helykj
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from this hotel and overall the hotel was stunning inside but our deluxe room was dreadfull, it was small and with no heating working outside i could of been staying anywhere in the world as all i could see was 3 brick wall and a generater !!! I imediately complained and was told that there were no other rooms available which was an absolute joke eventually after sleeping in our robes we were moved the next day to a slightly better room. The location is great and we have Brad and Angelina staying there but some how think there room would be a bit nicer than ours!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location - threadbare rooms - grand dame is ready for an overahaul”
Reviews.Author: DPJ79
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf is ideally located - easy access to everything. The staff is incredibly helpful (great concierge!) - but the room we had was pitiful, way overdue for an update. Paper thin walls - with a neighbor who slammed the door at least a dozen times a night between midnight and 2am - the lingering smell of smoke (nasty!) - no glazing on the windows so even on the 19th floor you felt like you were in the midst of mid-town traffic. All the more annoying since I had called the hotel and specifically requested a renovated room (to avoid all of the above). Management was not particularly helpful when I pointed out on my confirmation that I had made the request, their answer was to give my daughter a stuffed bear. A lovely gesture - but a quieter room without the acrid smell of smoke would have been better. My husband is a fan of the Peninsula - I fully understand why. If you want a reasonably priced room and are willing to take your chances with a room which may (or may not!!) be renovated then the Waldorf is just fine. But in a city with so many great hotels - I'd try elsewhere the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Peacock Alley Fiasco”
Reviews.Author: KerrySullivan
Reviews.Content: Our family were in New York for a birthday celebration, as a thank you I booked Sunday lunch in Peacock Alley for 12.30pm. Booking was made by telephone from Ireland, the receptionist gave his name (I will not embarrass him). When we arrived, despite the fact that there were innumerable empty tables we were told that there was no record of our reservation but a table would be found if we cared to wait. We waited and were ignored for 20 minutes, then gave out and went looking for an alternative, a wasted morning and a big disappointment as I had previously eaten there and was anxious to share the experience with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay at the Legendary Waldorf=Astoria”
Reviews.Author: NatBriKen
Reviews.Content: This was the second time my 9 year old daughter and I stayed at the Waldorf=Astoria. It is our yearly "Girls Weekend in NYC". The lobby is beautiful...Art Deco all around. Don't forget to look up at the ceiling and check out the golden clock by reception. If you go to the website you can also download an I-Pod walking tour of the hotel. Fabulous! We arrived early. Although our room was not yet ready, we were able to check in and have our luggage stored until we came back from a Times Square sight seeing walk and some lunch. After our return, we picked up our key and our luggage was taken to our room. We had a corner king (room 1113) on the eleventh floor. Note: After 6:00 pm you need to use your card in the elevator to go to your room. Our room was recently renovated. I had asked for a renovated room because the room we had last year, although very nice and large, was in need of sprucing up. This year, our room had tones of Gold with red, green and beige. The accents were dark wood and brass with beautiful fabric wall paper. There was plenty of closet space. The room included a long desk, comfy large upholstered chair, marble bath with tub/shower and plenty of towels, Lg. Phillips flat screen TV, I-Pod dock/radio/alarm clock with presets, 2 phones, and a comfy king bed with enough pillows for both of us ...I'm a pillow person. The bath had very nice amenities including cotton balls and tips, glycerine soap, lotion, shampoo, conditioner. There were heavy drapes at the window with both sheers and pull shades. The views from our two windows were fabulous. There was a great view through the far window of St. Bartholomews church and it's dome, as well as, down Park Avenue. The view from the front window was slightly obscured by the building but Park Avenue was still visible. The only thing I can say that isn't complementary is that our room had uneven floor boards under the carpet on one side of the bed. That's it. And truly, hardly worth mentioning. Nothing more than that. Everything else was great. In the morning, my daughter and I ordered up a small pot of coffee and small pot of hot chocolate. This is where you either like room service or not. I knew what the total cost would be before I ordered. But for those of you who may find this excessive I will explain. Each pot is $8.00...not too bad for a 3 cup pot in NYC. However, there is a $5.25 surcharge per person for your order. There were two of us, so, our coffee and chocolate came to $26.50 plus the $2 tip. If this is too much for you, there is a Starbucks downstairs at street level by the Park Avenue entrance (revolving doors) to your left, before you go up the stairs to the Terrace lobby. Or, you can take coffee downstairs in Peacock Alley or at the Terrace. Overall, everyone we interacted with at the Waldorf, from the doorman to the concierge to the reception desk to the waiter who brought up our beverages in the morning was very professional, courteous and helpful. They made my daughter feel as if she were a princess in a castle. The location can't be beat. This hotel is located on the East side of Midtown Manhattan. Close to Radio City, MOMA, Rockefeller Center, Top of the Rock, American Girl Place, Build a Bear and within a 10 minute walk of the Empire State Building and Times Square. A thirty minute walk will take you down to the Central Park Zoo. A little less time will take you to the park's playground, horse/carriage rides and FAO Schwartz (my daughter loved the floor piano -- think Tom Hanks in BIG). There are so many things to do at the park. On the East Side of the park, a little further down from the Zoo, is the petting zoo and the Metropolitan Museum of Art. On the West Side of the park (you will need to take a cab or walk for a bit) is the Museum of Natural History. Don't forget the Tavern on the Green, the castle and all the fabulous concerts and outdoor performances in the summer. We will definately stay here again next year, and hopfully for years to come, on our "girls weekend" in NYC. WE CAN'T WAIT!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 25th Wedding Anniversary Celebration”
Reviews.Author: JaneyJaneEngland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 25th Wedding Anniversary in Febuary at the Waldorf. After reading a few negative comments we were a bit apprehensive about what to expect. We shouldn't have worried. The staff were very friendly and couldn't have been more helpful. We had asked for an upgrade and received a room on the 27th floor with a corner view of Lexington and Park Avenues with an amazing view of the Chyrsler Building. We never ate in the hotel as it was too expensive, but found an excellent cafe around the corner for breakfast called Cafe Europe. All in all brilliant. One top tip, try and get tickets for the Rose Centre, sound and vision show in the Planetarium.

Reviews.Title: “A little dusty but great location for the price”
Reviews.Author: cgn318
Reviews.Content: We were very excited to stay at the famed Waldorf on our trip to NYC but were definitely a little disappointed by the experience. The hotel had a very "convention/tourist" feel rather than the old world elegance we were expecting and the hotel as a whole was pretty dusty and tired feeling. Our room was a decent size for an NYC hotel but our view of the flat rooftop left a lot to be desired. The room was pretty clean though and the location to the 5th Avenue shops and Broadway can't be beat. Room service costs (for breakfast) were absolutely outrageous, even by NYC standards which was annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Service much improved”
Reviews.Author: Intl_trvler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times over the years, and always thought their service was pretty dismal. It would appear that someone has decided to remedy this. Was also pleased with a relatively large room -- stayed in the front of the hotel this time rather than towards the back. Rooms are clean and beds are comfy. My room only had a shower -- no big deal for me but I think a larger person would have difficulty fitting in the rather small space. If you like more space in which to shower in, suggest that you ask specifically for a bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “Best avoided unless you are a VIP”
Reviews.Author: KWLV
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf obviously is a landmark hotel and its reputation is well deserved in most respects.
