Unfortunately, I find that the level of service and quality of room drops significantly if you lack celebrity status or your name is not prefaced by something like "Senator" or "Ambassador." On recent trip, I was made to wait 2 hours beyond regular check-in time for my room after having registered early (but they were more than happy to hold my bag ... thanks for that). Then, I was told that I was "upgraded" to a SUPERIOR Room. Wow (thanks again). What I found was that my SUPERIOR Room was so small that I had to turn sideways in order to squeeze past certain spots, and the bed needed to be moved in order to unfold an ironing board. Calls to Guest Services were met with ambivalence. Simply not acceptable for a hotel of such stature. There is a W Hotel and a Doubletree directly across the street, likely better values for a stay in Mid-town.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: DogWorld
Reviews.Content: We took our daughter to New York to celebrate her birthday. We reserved a junior suite, but the hotel upgraded us to a full suite when they learned the occasion of the visit. It was a beautiful suite - a mini-apartment - with a great view of the cathedral. The staff was highly solicitous and the concierge was extremely knowledgable and very smooth. It was a great stay, and one that will be memorable for our family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Monkeybum69
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great central location about 5-10 minutes walk to Times Square and 5th Avenue. Our room was on the 16th floor, the room was very spacious including a large dressing room and bathroom. Overall, we had a brilliant stay in New York City, the location of this hotel was brilliant for sight-seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...better than expected”
Reviews.Author: LittleJackieWayne
Reviews.Content: First class stay. All the staff was very helpful from resturant reservations to theater reservations. Oyr room was just perfect...no complaints at all. Can't wait for our next visit

Reviews.Title: “Art Deco opulence in an outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: LadyH72
Reviews.Content: A wonderfully plush and equisite hotel with outstanding customer service. We were upgraded from a king concierge room to a corner room on the 34th floor of the Waldorf Towers. The view was fantastic across Manhattens' skyline but the room was a little shabby (flaking paint and an avocado bathroom suite!), however the view and the comfiness of the bed overrode this point. Breakfast was gorgeous, with delicious pastries, cream cheese and salmon bagels, yogurts, fruit and cereal served everyday.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location,friendly staff,most comfortable bed in the world”
Reviews.Author: anychance67
Reviews.Content: Arrived in new york for the first time in august and checked into the waldorf for not a lot more than no name hotels charge in poor locations.The staff are very friendly and eager to please.Our room wasnt ready on arrival so they gave us a free upgrade with a view of lexington avenue and a voucher to get some free drinks at the bar.We had to wait about an hour so we had a look around the hotels ballrooms and shops.The room was very nice as we had expected and the beds were the most comfortable I have ever slept on.The maids came every day and did an excellent job.Unfortunately I didnt know til we got home that youre meant to leave a few dollars tip on pillow every day .Its a good idea to have a roll of dollar bills ready for tips to the staff who appreciate even for a buck.The location is perfect and I felt safe walking around surrounding area at midnight .I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone and hope to go back again one day.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tanjua
Reviews.Content: My wife always wanted to stay in Waldorf Astoria. It lived it's expectations!! marvelous place!! we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: hgtybn
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Waldorf several times over the past years and have always enjoyed our stay - this time we returned to the Waldorf after a couple years absence and were impressed by the increased level of service and efficiency - all given by genuinely friendly, competent personnel. All members of the staff: the doorman, valet, bellhop, check-in person, room service, maintenance, waiters at both Bull & Bear and Peacock Alley made us feel like we were the most important people staying at the hotel and I observed that this level of service seemed to be the norm. Although the Waldorf was fully booked, we never had to wait or ask for anything - check-in went very smoothly - we were escorted to our room and the luggage arrived immediately, as soon as we stepped outside we were asked if we needed a taxi and it was promptly hailed, as soon as we arrived to one of the hotel's restaurants we were immediately greeted and shown to our table, the server came to our table instantly and continued to provide excellent service, each call to guest services for a request had someone at our room within minutes - even getting our car at the end of our stay - Biden was arriving as we were leaving so the cars were being delayed but the staff was wonderful and very responsive to the guests - we relaxed in a lounge area of the hotel and when we returned to get our car, it was waiting with a couple people helping to load the luggage, open car doors, etc. - and, it was extremely busy at this time. Again, all the staff were genuinely warm, friendly and extremely efficient. Everything seemed to go perfectly, we did not have to "think" it was so seemless. The Waldorf is an older, historic property and there are some things about the Waldorf that probably would be helpful to know: - During all my stays, there has never been a coffee maker in the room, I have speculated on reasons - building construct and codes, etc., but have never found out for certain. However, we called room service and asked if they would deliver a hot pot and a variety of tea bags for our stay - we paid a very minimal charge and these items were delivered promptly. - Rooms appear to be continually renovated. Also, there is a great variety of room types and the floorplans on each floor vary. I always note that I would like a renovated room when making a reservation and repeat the request upon check-in. I have always received wonderful rooms. Each room appears uniquely decorated and this time we stayed in a beautiful one-bedroom suite that definitely had an elegant, warm, "home" feeling rather than a cookie-cutter hotel room feel. - As with any hotel, there may be maintenance issues, but the staff responds immediately and expertly if you mention it. We had one of the heaters in the living room giving off cold air, no heat. We called guest services, a maintenance person arrived within 5 mins, explained that a new part was needed but rather than have us wait, he called housekeeping for an electric heater. This arrived in 5 mins - a brand new, quiet, tower style heater. Then, when we returned from our activities there was a message from the manager to check that everything was ok and to please call if we need anything else. - Bathroom amenities, etc. - if you need anything else by way of bathroom amenities, a phone call to guest services has it delivered promptly. - Turn down service - the hotel services directory notes that you should call if you would like turn down service, we called the first day to request it and it was provided consistently throughout our stay. - It has been my experience that management at the Waldorf responds to comments or issues immediately and does their best to ensure that things are resolved during a stay. We had an excellent stay at the Waldorf and, if it were possible to transport the Waldorf staff to every hotel I stay at, I would.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great Park Avenue location.”
Reviews.Author: faarias
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times and every time I ahve had a very different room. My favorite is the Towers room as I was given this time. While not as spacious as other rooms I ahve stayed in, it did have sevral lttle upgrades tha made it feel nicer. Service is good, about what you would expect from any Hilton. It has a nicely recently re-done fitness room that I got to enjoy for free because of my VIP Hhonors status; it wold not have been worth it if I had had to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Atmosphere - But Average Guest Rooms”
Reviews.Author: AbbyAngelsCamp
Reviews.Content: We loved the Waldorf, mostly because of the high level of service and the wonderful public rooms. But our guestroom was a bit small and needed some TLC and the bed was only average. The prices for dining are very high. Overall a tremendous experience but not one that we would repeat over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star room in 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ferina
Reviews.Content: The lock on the bathroom door didn't work at all, the bathroom door handle flopped around. The door paint was well overdue for TLC. I would echo several other comments about hot water taking ages to arrive at the bath/shower. The next day we spoke to reception about the faulty lock and they moved us to a slightly larger room. Solution -- complain ASAP. The second room was 1302 and suffered from some street noise, but tolerable. Same problem as the 12th floor room with poor hot water supply. We loved the hotel's ambiance but at the end of the day your room is the major factor and the 1st room was 3 star and the 2nd room was 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable stay”
Reviews.Author: AceyFace
Reviews.Content: I visited New York at the end of February with a friend for a three night stay at the Waldorf Astoria. Upon arrival at check-in we were ignored by the majority of the desk clerks but a charming lady called Monika smiled at us and welcomed us to the hotel and indulging me by not laughing at my faltering few words of Polish (she could speak flawless English by the way). We stayed in a lovely double/double room with separate dressing room and bathroom on the 17th floor overlooking Park Avenue (and consequently further away from the traffic noise which was a definite bonus). I have visited New York twice in the past and stayed in rooms the size of a shoe box so it was a definite bonus to be so well accommodated. I wouldn't say the room was spotless or perfectly decorated but it had a certain elegance and charm which you rarely find. All in all worth every penny. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A legend shows its age”
Reviews.Author: misterjjones
Reviews.Content: I had heard miraculous stories about the Waldorf, so when my company agreed to put me up there I was thrilled. The thrill was short lived as I experienced a real disappointment. The Waldorf has well sized rooms that are tastefully decorated and of course has a good location in New York City, but I found it shabby and somewhat in disrepair. My room was also noisy and I had hairs on my pillows. Of course for a legend you pay high prices, which was not a problem on my company's dollar - but I would never go here on my own bank account.

Reviews.Title: “Consistency is a serious problem”
Reviews.Author: japdx
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay at the Waldorf go ahead, but do not expect it to be better than other places you could choose. I travel for business all the time and need a good fitness center and a nice salad from room service at night. Fitness Center: First night there was no attendant but water, fruit and towels were plentiful. Second night there was an attendant at the beginning and when she left she left water and fruit on the counter. Third night there was an attendant at the beginning but when she left she put away the water and left fruit. Fourth night the attendant put away the water and fruit. Now, isn't this the Waldorf Astoria? There are hardly any people using the fitness center at night. Is it too expensive to provide bottled water and fruit for people using the fitness center. Room service: I order a chicken ceasar salad, dressing on the side, whole grain rolls every night. I am going into the detail so you will understand that my order is so consistent when I travel that it never changes, the food I received was all over the board. First night I received the salad and no whole grain rolls/bread. Second night I received the salad and whole wheat toast. Third night I received the salad but without parmesan cheese slivers, and the whole wheat toast. Fourth night I received the same thing as the third night but was charged $8.00 for the whole grain toast. Overall: When you travel all the time consistency is key. Just didn't feel that here. If you want to stay here once, go ahead and roll the dice. If you want to be sure of service, you might need to look elsewhere. Plus side: The check-in staff was great. The staff in the lobby to answer questions was great. My room was not as clean as it should have been the first night (vacuuming was poor) but after that it was clean and the room was always well stocked with towels, shampoo, etc. Hall noise was minimal to nonexistent. Cons: Consistency. TV choices: No travel channel, food channel, etc. Just the basic networks plus middle eastern channels. No Fox News if you like that choice - MSNBC and CNN related choices only.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, issues with service”
Reviews.Author: KandDinDC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Waldorf-Astoria for two nights in late January 2009. We made our reservation through American Express for a room listed as “1 King Bed Concierge Level”. The Waldorf had always been a hotel I wished to stay in so I was excited about the visit. The hotel is truly magnificent. Staying there really takes one back to a time when a visit to a hotel was an EVENT, not something we do simply as a necessity. I was taken thinking of how my parents or grandparents would have felt as a guest there, and how much the hotel has changed in the past century, but how little (overall) the Waldorf had managed to retain the grand charm of days long past. If for no other reason than connecting with history, staying in the Waldorf is an experience one must do at some point in their life. The room we were given was in the Waldorf Towers and we were very pleased with the room overall. The size was exceptionally large for a New York hotel room. In addition to the main bedroom, there was an entry foyer, a kitchenette area, a dressing area, and a very large bathroom. The fixtures were a nice blend of old and modern, from the trio of closets to the multi-jetted shower. The condition of the room was excellent and all the linens and amenities were of superior levels. The view was a decent view down Park Avenue but nothing postcard worthy. The Concierge Level lounge provided a very nice continental breakfast each morning in a private room. The quality of the food and the selection were excellent, even if you had only a moment to grab a coffee to go. The staff in this area did a nice job of helping with most all requests. The area is small though, so don’t be shocked if you have to wait a few moments for a table. The main amenities of the hotel are all superior. The fitness facility is very modern and well thought out, even providing guests with fitness gear in case you have left yours at home. The concierge is most helpful, providing good information and reviews on local restaurants. The shops and business center are well done and very convenient. And the location of the hotel is hard to beat. My main complaint with the hotel is one of attitude towards guests who are younger than, say, 50 or 60 years. Although they were always polite, the staff seemed to be uncomfortable dealing with my wife and I (both in our 30’s but looking much more like two people in their 20’s). From the front desk to the bell attendants, there seemed to be this underlying sentiment of “are you sure you are old enough to be staying here?” whenever we dealt with staff members. Given that we are polite, courteous and professional people, it caught us very off guard. Overall, this is a fine hotel and well worth a visit. I would recommend it to anyone, especially those over the age of 40.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Experience”
Reviews.Author: tinydancer0
Reviews.Content: Came to NYC for the very first time with all of the women in my very southern family. We shopped, toured, ate amazing food, and stayed in this breath-taking establishment. The staff were beyond helpful, offering umbrellas and curbside cab-call. Everything was top of the line. We ate breakfast 2 mornings in the restaurant downstairs. The Starbucks Shop was nice enough to stay open an extra half-hour per our request because it was rainy and cold, we needed warm coffee!! Would most certainly recommend this to any and everyone wanting to visit the beautiful big apple. A+++

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service!”
Reviews.Author: cea0569
Reviews.Content: We went to the bar at the Waldorf for drinks after the Opera and no one even looked at us for 10 minutes! The bar had horrible service and was not even busy..... I will never go back!

Reviews.Title: “W-A better than many reviews”
Reviews.Author: SonoraDweller
Reviews.Content: I was rather nervous about staying at the famous Waldorf-Astoria after reading a number of negative reviews on various web sites. But, I had the Hilton Honors points, and there was a discount sale making it no more points than the Hilton Hotel several blocks away. So, I opted for the W-A. Frankly, this is an old, prestigious hotel, and I wanted to experience the art deco building and style. Check-In: More clerks than guests, so I walked right up at about 4pm. Pleasant clerk took my check-in, and said that I had been upgraded. Nice. Asked several times if there was anything he could do for me, anything I wanted to know. Nice attitude. Room: For NY, this was a LARGE room. Big King bed, huge desk, flat screen TV, mini-bar, two large windows (alas, overlooking a rooftop of another section of the hotel, but you can't have everything - if I looked sideways, I could see the street). Furniture was traditional style, and very fine. No wear and tear. Bathroom was good sized, black and white marble, exquisite fixtures in art deco style. Amenities: everything worked well, including the heat controls, and the maid did the room early each morning. Just fine. Newspaper every morning. General: Elevators are on key-card after 6pm for security, and they were FAST. Lobby is fantastic. The entire hotel is beautiful and kept up well. There were employees everywhere asking to help. The concierge was helpful, printed my boarding pass for the return flight without charge. Room service was expensive, so I left it out. No coffee maker, but I suppose that was an economy measure. Starbucks is in the hotel. Lower lobby. So, why bother? All-in-all, it was a very delightful stay. Room was great, checkout was swift. Internet in the lobby is free; in the room it is a charge. No problem sitting in the lobby accessing the net. Others did it too. Enjoyed seeing Cole Porter's piano in the Cocktail Lounge. And, I felt like a rich Master of the Universe, for only 120,000 points. The room is certainly worth the money - the location is great, the service is excellent, and the art deco furnishings and architecture are fabulous. A landmark it is. They had pictures of famous guests everywhere, but I was never able to figure out why Hermione Gingold was relegated to the Men's Room.

Reviews.Title: “As expected...”
Reviews.Author: ParagonIreland
Reviews.Content: Ok, just back 4 night stay. After reading the reviews on the site, I had lowered my expectations somewhat about what to expect and I was neither hugely dissapointed or 'wowed'. First off - I did want to stay here as I was going with my brothers and parents and it is somewhere we have always wanted to go. The lobby is magnificant really opulant and I love that, we had no problems checking in, we all arrived separately and they accomodated an early check in as my brother was arriving first. The rooms where v small, which I was prepared for, however three of us where staying in a room with 2 double beds and there where 4 small drawers in total + a wardrobe for hanging, so we ended up just living out of our suitcases. Bathroom was tiny, but functional, we only used our rooms for sleeping and cleaning, so size wasn't getting us down. We had breakfast in the hotel in the morning (Peacock Alley - Oscars was shut during our stay) - cost was outrageous, I don't care how affluent you are, this was too much. Also having to pay to use the gym on top is bizarre I think. In summary, I found that other reviews lowered my expectations in terms of the rooms, however it was definately a dissapointment on my original impressions of how it would be. Lobby aside, the whole place is just a little too tired for my taste. Did I enjoy it - yes, as a one off with my parents and brothers, but would I go back again with my wife and kids - no. It was ok, but not worth it. I think we could do better.

Reviews.Title: “loved this amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharonaNewcastle
Reviews.Content: we have just arrived back from our 5 day break at the waldorf astoria&after reading alot of the reviews on how unhappy peaple were with their rooms,i was a bit concerned!When we arrived,straight away our bags were taken care of by the doormen,while we checked ourselves in.The hotel is huge&very elegant.We arrived at 2pm and were given our room keys almost immediatley.We just booked the standard king room and we were pleasantly surprised by how beautiful it was.Very spacious,huge bed,desk,fab mirrored wardrobes,very beautiful marble bathroom with huge shower,bathrobes,hairdryer,minibar ipod station and immaculatley clean!we had a huge window with a view of park avenue.We were very pleased.It was my husbands 40th birthday and had a very exclusive box of waldorf chocolates& white rose left in our room which i thought was a lovely surprise.Hotel bars & restaurants are very expensive.Didnt eat at hotel so cannot comment on the food.There are alot of business and money peaple stay at this hotel but all the same we felt very comfortable around them,When we went to plaza hotel for a look around we felt very uncomfortable and out of our league.The waldorf is very central 2 everything,it is in a great midtown position.Would definately recommend this hotel to anyone considering it.I give this hotel 10/10

Reviews.Title: “A complete and utter disappointment”
Reviews.Author: 9o21o
Reviews.Content: In early August 2008, having arrived at La Guardia from LA X, the last thing you'd want to do is arrive in a stuffy indoor car park and wait there for about half an hour whilst a member of staff gives you the look of death for not tipping him! This kind of sums up the experience. The moment my family and I arrived we were very disappointed. Service was rubbish-we waited at the reception desk for about 45 minutes whilst people buzzed around EVERYWHERE. I was personally upset upon arrival to my room. It smelled of urine and smoke, the bathroom was appallingly tiny and the toilet failed to flush. It was a good summary of the Waldorf experience. Come dinner time on the first night, we were waiting for about an hour for some disappointing food which should have taken about half an hour maximum. The waiter had an attitude problem and felt the need to correct a jet-lagged and disorientated yours truly for pronouncing a dish wrong. Breakfast was fun, though (NOT). It was worse than waiting in a long queue at the supermarket. Whole groups of tourists gathered around our table to talk to friends sitting at other tables, taking photos and in general disturbing most people trying to eat their breakfast. Often, the queue for breakfast was so long that it extended up the stairs which lead to the room itself. To have an enjoyable breakfast you'd probably have to be down there by 6am. After two dreadful nights, we left the Waldorf Astoria and I honestly could not have been happier to find a haven in the form of "Le Parker Meridien". Not only was it less teeming with people, the staff were friendly, the rooms beautiful and modern and the service impeccable. This is a plea to anyone thinking of going to the Waldorf. Don't go! It thrives on reputation alone and is as tired and frankly dead as the film stars of the past who resided there from time to time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: maximus217
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from January 16 to January 18 using Hilton Honors Awards. Upon check-in, we were upgraded to a corner luxury suite. And my what a wonderful suite it was! The room was about 700 square feet with a foyer and a coat closet by the entrance door which leads to a luxurious living room. The room has an executive desk, and a view of Park Avenue. Bedroom is separated from the living room and has a walk-in closet. The bathroom is all marble with a deep bath tub. We didn't have any problem with the water or room temperature. They provided a turn down service at night time. We had an opportunity to eat at the Peacock Alley for brunch. If you have a chance, one should try it even once in a lifetime. The buffet was great with wide variety of food such as oysters, clams, lobsters, chocolate fundue, crabs, shrimps, brioche, pancakes, crepes, and so much more. The gym on the 5th floor is adequate and open for 24 hours. We were told the spa on the 19th floor also has a gym but smaller than the one on the 5th floor. This hotel is great. The staff are courteous and polite. The location is wonderful. We really enjoyed our stay and would not hesitate to return to Waldorf Astoria upon our return in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: nwwriter
Reviews.Content: It was a nice experience to stay at the Waldorf given the history of the hotel. While the hotel room was a bit small and dated, the hotel has wonderful ambiance. It was great to have tried the hotel, but it's very expensive for what you get. While there are many better choices in NYC, it's worth staying at the Fairmont at least once in your life. No regrets.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: canman75
Reviews.Content: Hotel did not have our room ready until 5:00pm and check in time was 3:00. There was no one at the diamond reservation desk. The room was above average but a little on the small side. Most of the staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: goodie411
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with Hilton HHonors points and was really looking forward to a great stay at a classic New York City establishment for part of my mom's birthday surprise. We drove down from Westchester without any traffic and after bringing our car to the valet (initially $65/day, but turned out to be $50), we found our way up to the front desk for check-in. I couldn't believe that the long line in front of us was for check-in, so I double-checked with the concierge. Yep, check-in... 50 very TEDIOUS minutes later, we were finally at the desk. While watching dozens of people (read: tourists) babble on with the front desk clerks and most likely ask questions about where to go and what to do while in NYC, I was beyond infuriated. The man who checked us in could not have been nicer. He was incredibly pleasant after what must have been a long, trying day for him. He offered us information about the hotel while our reservation was processing and also offered me 1,000 Hilton points to "reward" me for my long wait time. Very much appreciated. The room was exactly as I expected: old school, fancy hotel room with that New York charm I was hoping for. My mom, who loves fancy, classic things, was overjoyed. Overall, the stay was lovely in spite of the mobs of tourists. If you are a New Yorker and choose to stay here, bring your patience. You'll need it; think Times Square crammed into a hotel...

Reviews.Title: “How can they get away with this ?!”
Reviews.Author: CByrne
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf last year ago and found the experience quite disappointing then, however I decided to put my concerns aside as I returned with my friend and daughter who really wanted to stay there. We arrived after a long journey from the UK at around 4am UK time. There seemed to be various altercations going on at the check in desk with other guests, but we were basically told that the hotel was overbooked and that we were being sent to a Hilton 10 blocks away. We were handed $10 to pay for the cab ( which we were expected to sort out for ourselves ). When I eventually got to see the manager I was told that everyone checking in that night had to do the same and that she would send me a voucher for a return free 2 night stay. I had no choice but to accept this, my daughter was in tears as she had been so excited to stay at The Famous Waldorf, and basically it ruined our trip. To cap it all, 4 weeks have gone by and I have received no voucher or communication. I think this is pretty disgraceful and I would never stay here again. Go to The Sofitel...I stayed there last year and it was wonderful with service like it should be.

Reviews.Title: “A classic beauty”
Reviews.Author: Travelmaven1
Reviews.Content: The main entry reflects elegance of a time gone by. We are Hilton Diamond members and used a Hilton Award to celebrate a special anniversary. Our room was a newly renovated corner room on a lower floor. The heating system worked perfectly. The room had a large boudoir adjacent to the well sized bedroom. The bathroom was a marble studded gem. The location of the Waldorf is perfect for touring NYC. The theater district, MOMA and 5th Ave shopping are located close enough for a walk or a quick cab ride. Oscars, a wonderful breakfast place on the lower floor of the hotel, is no longer a perks for Diamond or Gold members. The Starbucks is the new breakfast benefit. Starbucks is located at the base of the hotel. It is very good, but you have to bring the food into the hotel if you want to sit down to have breakfast. Sir Harry's bar is a cozy place to go for drinks. You can order champagne by the glass. The Diamond desk has a staffing problem. This is the second time this year we have had excessive waits to get registered. If someone at the Diamond desk has a problem the staff does not alert the hotel management that additional help is needed to take care of Diamond members. Once we did get to our beautiful room we were pleased. The house keeping staff does a beautiful job of keeping it clean. They were exceptionally friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Better to visit than stay”
Reviews.Author: sinners
Reviews.Content: My husband booked a surprise three night stay in NYC at the Waldorf for the pair of us. The hotel is breathtaking upon entrance and definitely worth a look around as it is beautiful with regards to bars/restaurants/lobby etc etc. However the rooms were disappointing. Whilst I appreciate the hotel is old, the room we were given was very small and 'faded' even though we had paid to upgrade. In addition we were right next to the service area which was very noisy at 5.30am! We requested a move but having arrived Xmas night were told the hotel was full and would be offered a better room the next day at 3pm. We returned to move our things at this time and were disappointed to find our room not ready so had to hang around until it was, which was a bit annoying as we only returned to the hotel to move things and thought we could freshen up and have a rest but c ould not do this as we were 'in limbo' between rooms. We were then given a better room and yes it was in a nicer part of the building ie quieter and yes bigger in size but pretty much the same in the way of 'tiredness' of the room if that makes sense! Overall I loved New York and this did not spoil our stay but certainly wouldn't pay the money my husband did to stay there again when there are cheaper hotels with much better accommodation in New York from what I have seen/heard .(This was my fifth trip to NYC) Make the time to visit the Waldorf and even have a drink in Harry's bar (albeit very expensive I had the best Apple Martini I have ever had!!) its worth a trip but treat it more as a museum to visit rather than somewhere to choose to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A retrospective of 5 stays”
Reviews.Author: Rochfoucauld
Reviews.Content: In the last decade my wife and I have stayed at the Waldorf=Astoria 5 sepatate times, each during Christmas week. We have experienced accomodation categories from an executive room in the Towers to a king one-bedroom suite in the main hotel. Much to my surprise, we have never been recognized as repeat clients when checking in. In some other hotels we have frequented, the better rooms are routinely given to returning clients. This has not been our experience at the Waldorf. Overall, we have never had an unacceptable experience (by our standards). Our one stay in the Towers is remembered mostly for the rude and unhelpful Towers staff. Our room expereinces in the main hotel have been hit-and-miss with both postives and negatives. In terms of the rooms alone, our best experience was being assigned a corner suite on a high floor. This suite was very spacious and the basic decor was classic. Yet, some of the furniture was broken and (in the bedroom) the backs were literally falling off both nightstands. The wall paper in the parlor was waterstained and bubbled around a window. I mention this case specifically because this is very typical of our 5 Waldorf expereinces--a mix of postiives and negatives that some will find acceptable (or at least tolerable) and others will judge totally unacceptable. This past year (2008) we had a Lexington Ave side king- suite--significantly smaller than the corner mentioned above but overall better appointed and in better condition. A few oddities with the bathroom plumbing and a large entertainment console that did not fit well in the parlor. Quite noisy at times due to Lex Ave emergency vehicles and garbage trucks. That mix again. The queen Astor suites in the Lexington Ave side of the hotel were redecorated a few years ago and overall I would expect these suites to be in better condition than others. Early on we had a mini-suite with an excellent bed but otherwise in need of furniture replacement--topped off by 2 bathrooms and a great view of the St. Barts dome across 50th street. Always a mixed experience. Over the years we have found the reception and housekeeping staffs to be polite and willing to help when asked. As I am a native New Yorker, we have never used the concierge staff. At present, it appears that occupancy is down (hotel was significantly less busy that in previous years)and staff reductions have already occurred. A problem in the making--not sure. So why then have we returned on numerous occassions? The main reason is that we have had mostly good times at the Waldorf, in large part because we have been able to enjoy the positives and put the negatives aside. In many ways this is a great classic hotel. In terms of cost, the suites have been nicely priced in late Dec. (relative to many other hotels). As others have frequently mentioned, the public spaces are magnificent. I started this review with a bit of a negative tone because I think that one should be aware of the Waldorf experience. Given that, I have rated the hotel above average overall as this is how we judge our collective experience with this hotel. As this forum indicates, many others have a different view. I have no reason to think that the general situation sketched out above will change for the bettter or for the worse. If you like modern and impeccably appointed hotels look elsewhere. If you are comfortable with history, classic decor, and flexible on many little details you may well enjoy a stay at the Waldorf. I believe that no two rooms/suites are the same, so you are in part dependent on the luck of the draw as far as accomodations are concerned. Will we return?--haven't decided yet.h

Reviews.Title: “unforgettable holiday”
Reviews.Author: mum08
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Waldorf for Christmas, what a great expierence. I did have some concerns after reading some of the negative comments from other travelers, who had stayed at the Waldorf. All I can say is I don't see how any one can stay in this Historic Hotel with has such an elegant appeal to it, and not be happy. Our room was ready on arrival and it was spotless, it was much larger than I was expecting and the bed was very comfortable. The maids came in daily and did an excellent job. The concierge staff were so helpful and nothing was too much trouble. We had a room on the 17th floor as we had requested a smoking room, not much of a view but we weren't expecting one, its New York. The people of the city were very helpful, we even had our photo taken on a policemans Harley Davidson. We did not eat in the hotel as there are so many Delis that serve excellent food at a fraction of the cost, I can highly recomend Scottys Diner on Lexington Avenue, wonderful food with a great service. We decided to spend our money in Maceys. What a shop so easy to get lost. Iceskating at the Rockafella Center looked rather small so we went to Central Park, the rink was much bigger and less busy. A helpful tip, if you want to go to the Empire State building get there early, we went straight up at 9.a.m, by 10a.m. the queue was going round the block. I would recomend this beautiful hotel to all of my friends and I could not find fault with a single thing.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you would expect”
Reviews.Author: sltaylor
Reviews.Content: When you first walk in the lobby is fabulous. The room, however, was a disappointment. Understanding the age of the hotel I expected small rooms (ours was one of the few with a King bed) but the room had none of the amenities you would expect for $389 per night. No robes, a small tv, no thermostat to control temp (we had to open the window frequently to keep the temperature from being uncomfortably hot). Decor was also a dissapointment. the bar was nice, and Sonny was a great bartender. Sandy (waitress) on the other had consistently complained about her job in front of customers, and always had a scowl on her face. Getting change for cab fare was next to impossible as the line for guest services was frequently quite long (10 minutes). Concierge service was unimaginative to say the least. they couldn't recommend restaurants new the Waldorf open past 10pm on two requests. (City that never sleeps?) The Sunday brunch was ok (but at $95 per person you would expect more) and the Bull and Bear turned out an acceptable steak, but pale in comparison to Del Friscos just down the street. All in all, we won't stay at the Waldorf again.

Reviews.Title: “As sad state of affairs”
Reviews.Author: karav
Reviews.Content: Unbelievably awful and depressing. Used to be a grand dame of hotels in NY, now is like any crappy Hilton. We had to wait 40 minutes behind ropes to register, las vegas style because there was a mob scene and the hotel decided to have 4 desks open. The lobby had been converted to a crappy las vegas style buffet, so the mob had to stand beside the steam trays and wilting roast beefs. The hotel seems to service hoards of tourists and is about pushing people in and out. The room was not as pictured/described at all. The "one bedroom suite" was a cramped, shoddy, depressing room that looked out at a brick wall. The bathtub drain didn't work, the temp controller was broken so the room was insufferably hot. There is no free wireless, like there is in any mcdonalds or red roof inn. It is a crowded, touristy, depressing hellhole with outrageous prices. Sad, this used to be a gorgeous and lovely hotel. Whomever ruined this hotel should be ashamed of themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying at Grandma's - but she doesn't love you any more.”
Reviews.Author: jperatl
Reviews.Content: I travel to NY for business a good bit. I was spending a quick weekend for pre-xmas NY enjoyment and wanted to use some Hilton points. I saw I could book the fabled Waldorf Astoria - why not? I knew it was a bit of a gamble but figured the location was right, plus I didn't require much, and when else would I get to check it out? It went fine. It was what we needed. The location was indeed very good. The room was good enough. If I had paid $ I would have been very disappointed. It was like a best western I guess.. except I think those have had to keep up with the 1990s at a minimum. I can't think of much to compare it to. Old school vegas, maybe. Think freemont street. Frozen in time. Everything is a bit musty and dank. If they built it today and used that styling you might call it retro and give it a good laugh. When it is actual items from the 60s, however, they are a bit grimy and dirty. The rooms are full of carpet and oldness. There is a massive draft through the poorly sealed 1954 window. The temperature controls are pretty shoddy. Think motel 6. There are 600 uniformed employees to watch you as you walk around the hallways... there are large chandeliers... these things are all true - note them if they are what you are into. The mini bar doesn't autodetect what you take. If you are really lucky they will give you some COUPONS for free tiny bottles of water from the mini bar. They will instruct you to place these COUPONS in the minifridge in lieu of the water.. really... 1984-style. It is a riot. The showerhead literally has a font from a beatles album on it. Neat... but.. not very good for showering. The business center literally has FLOPPY DISKS for sale. I kid you not. I heard them tell someone they could lend him a charger for his laptop - $50/day. Funny stuff. Wifi? You gotta be kidding... nothing close. Lucky you have power. 2-prong power. No ground plug. I can't believe they had mag cards now that I think of it - I would have expected a bunch of skeleton keys handed out at the front desk. Kiosk checkin? HAHAHAHA. No way. Oh it gets better... We get a PERK.. free breakfast! After the checkin person mentioned 2 restaurants that would honor this, they backtracked in apparent embarrassment when the printed vouched stipulated the 'breakfast' was at.. STARBUCKS. Yup... one cookie and a coffee. Out of control with oldschool old-fashioned cheapness that seems ignorant of all the real hotels with customer service dotting the city. Oh yeah... went for a run. Wanted a hot tub. Called around and inquired about having one at the gym... no.. maybe the spa?... no... nowhere. No hot tub in the entire palace. Ok. In sum, this is without a doubt the worst hotel I've stayed at in years - and certainly in New York. It should definitely be demolished and replaced with something useful. It still exists for the same reasons as racism and The Varsity restaurant in Atlanta - sometimes people value 'tradition' over any actual quality/benefit. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in New York!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chez4226
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband were due to go to New York 4th Dec 2008 for 5 nights we had booked a hotel through expedia a bog standard 2 star property however upon arrival I found that my darling husband had secretly changed our hotel to the Waldorf to my absolute delight!!!! Bless him, it was a surprise xmas gift as he knows I have always wanted to stay there as I thinks its so new york!!! The hotel is amazing so luxurious and gorgeous and our room was lovely. The hotel is always busy and full with people and there is always something going on such as an awards ceremony or a wedding etc so very posh!!! The hotel is in such a great location and we found it easy enough to get everywhere from there. Very very very busy in New York in december never seen anything like it shopping was just a complete nightmare as you had to que to get in everywere so maybe I wouldnt reccommend dec as too busy but then on the other hand you wouldnt see all the fabulous xmas decorations and lights which we just unbelievable! all in all a brilliant hotel and we thought why the hell not as to us we probably wouldnt visit new york again so we wanted it to be special!

Reviews.Title: “Park Avenue's Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoveEnglandLots
Reviews.Content: I had not stayed at the Waldorf-Astoria since 2002 so I was interested to see if anything had changed at the hotel. The service at the hotel is excellent and the breakfasts' that I ate at the restaurant "Oscar's" were very good as well. Check-in was swift. The only complaint was that the first night I was supposed to have a suite and my room was located near an elevator shaft and I heard it making a noise all night. This room was on the 22nd floor. I was moved to another room after I let the staff know about the noise which was much quieter- however, it was not a suite. I would recommend using the Lexington Street exit to hail a cab from between 5 PM-6:30 PM as the cab lines on Park Avenue are way too long. I missed a dinner reservation because of it.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Andy_TLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at the Waldorf Astoria in November. Upgraded to a King suite at check in, which was great. No negatives to our stay. Room was cleaned to a high standard. Breakfast in the towers lounget was of the continental variety, would only pay for this if you really want the convenience. Spent most of the time out of the hotel although made use of Harry's Bar early evenings and for a quick drink before bed, great ambience, good service

Reviews.Title: “Relive a golden era”
Reviews.Author: DCFrequentFlier
Reviews.Content: Ya gotta love grand old New York! We arrived by cab on the Park Ave side. The hotel was quite busy so we toted our own luggage up a short flight of stairs into the enormous lobby. It was as if we entered a long lost era. The lobby features those high ceilings and big chandeliers you rarely find in contemporary buildings. Checkin was very quick.. the front desk team very friendly. Took our own bags to the room. Booked through corporate travel, it was your basic room. The decor is a bit dated but very plush. A king bed that slept well. A big flat screen tv. Furniture in good condition. Nice, very clean and well appointed marble bathroom with a shower, no bathtub. Again, I had booked a basic room.. so I give the Waldorf a big thumbs up that I wasn't in some dark dank closet but instead in a well appointed space. We had drinks in the lobby bar. Very pricey (16 each) but well made. Came with good bar snacks. The bar was not clubby as you'd might expect in an old grande dame hotel though. A bit disappointing. Checked out via the service on the television. The bellhop had us wait inside (in the warmth) until our car arrived. Overall a pleasant experience. Better than many of the newer boutigue hotels with tiny rooms and darkened hallways. I would go stay here again if my business or visit keeps me on the east side of NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: HopNstop
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend stayed here the week of 19th November. we arrived at the hotel at about 245pm, to have our bags helpfully taken from the taxi, in the underground entrance off lexington avenue. We went to the grand lobby and were checked straight in to our deluxe room. The staff during our whole hotewl stay were very good, from the doormen to the reception staff, concierge desk, travel desk and the cleaning people were all very nicve and helpful. Our bags were delivered to our deluxe room promptly. The room itself was fantastic, it definetley was a bit bigger than i was expecting. The bed was a huge and super comfortable kingsize bed, really good. The room was quite big that we had three large windows facing the bed, but the room was in no way cold, in fact we even turned the heating off at night. We also had two large separate built in wardrobes. The bathroom was all marble and the shower was good. The wireless signal in the room was not the strongest, but for all the length of time i was using it for, i just used the free service in the lobby. The hotel location itself is fantastic. The nearest subway entrance is only about 150yards away, fith avenue shopping only a five minute walk away and times square is about 15 minute walk or a quick ride on the subway. Is the hotel brand new and shiny...no. But it has a charm and charisma and everything was spotlessly cleana and in working order while i stayed there. I would definitely stay here again for a New York holiday.

Reviews.Title: “After the QM2 crossing”
Reviews.Author: mum53
Reviews.Content: We were booked here via Cunard after a transatlantic crossing on the QM2. Hotel was a disaster at the start. We arrived early (not sure who to blame) at 11.45 but our tickets said rooms ready for 3pm. Luggage taken off coach and put on pavement outside hotel. We were put in a very hot room and given coffee and advised that as we were a large party - 300 - our rooms may take a time to be allocated. Sensing a long wait my husband and I left the hotel and began our sightseeing trip. We arrived back at the hotel at 4pm to see little change. Loads of our party getting very agitated as few rooms had been allocated and that our luggage was still outside on the pavement! There was nothing to drink despite requests for water. A representative from the hotel said that rooms would be released as soon as possible. 5pm came and went with the production of 3 jugs of iced water and paper cups but no rooms being released. Despite being told to wait for our keys/rooms to be allocated I joined a short queue in the main reception of the hotel. I checked in as normal and was given my room key and advised my luggage was in my room!!! Quite obviously the hotel was not able to cope with the Cunard guests and showed it was utterly unprepared. Next morning we received a letter from management apologising for the delays and we were given a credit to our room account of 50 dollars. This did not even cover the cost of a buffet breakfast for two. Our room was draughty, the sash windows were not clean and the whole room had an air of faded charm. The reception/lobby of the hotel is magnificent and is a magnate for all tourists to New York and is not to be missed, but there is no way I would stay here again. Some of the blame for the problem can be laid at the feet of Cunard and this is also being addressed.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful welcome at the door but everything else fab”
Reviews.Author: SJ118
Reviews.Content: Dreadful welcome. Our taxi pulled up, no help from the taxi driver to get our luggage out. The doorman saw us and barked "It's too early to check in!" and promptly ignored us with no help for luggage / doors etc. It was 2 30 pm ! However everything else was fab. The diamond desk sorted out a double bedded room with a separate dressing area for 4 girls. Jackie and Mary were very welcoming and helpful, giving us info on shoppping and other trips. They assisted with obtaining a late checkout as well. Lovely ladies. The public areas were spotless and full of wonderful Art Deco touches.The wedding flowers in the foyer were fabulous ( though we overheard security say on the Saturday night that the wedding guests were fighting!) and we loved reading the history of the hotel from the displays. The staff were smiley, approachable and all took a pride in their job. The doormen at the luggage collection point were a complete contrast to their front door colleagues. They sorted our luggage, smiled and chatted and found an extra large taxi. Excellent. Our room was spotlessly clean and large enough for 4 adults. Plenty of hot water and the beds and bedding were super comfortable. The hotel was in an excellent spot for sightseeing and we would certainly stay there agin

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay but wouldn't come back...”
Reviews.Author: christie629
Reviews.Content: Booked the Waldorf Astoria for weekend of November 17th for a Ladies weekend in NY. Was hoping for these lovely large rooms I'd seen written about so many times on the reviews but alas...it was not to be. The room was one of the smallest I'd ever stayed in..tight for 3 women. The bathroom was just like any other hotel bathroom except also maybe smaller. Nothing about the inside of the room made you think you were in anything other than a large dime a dozen chain hotel. Of course the lobby and public spaces were very nice but is it worth the huge upcharge...no. There is no wireless internet except in the lobby and the wired internet is pricey. There was also a shooting in the hotel stores while we were there. A crazy man tried to rob the Cellini jewelry store and he shot the security guard, a retired NYPD officer... sad and crazy! All interactions with staff were pleasant but again, nothing to brag about. The Sunday brunch was quite a shock. It is set up in the lobby and looks very nice although not much more elegant or posh than a local resteraunt in my town. The cost was $95 per person... Ouch!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Full of Character”
Reviews.Author: Didosak
Reviews.Content: Myself and three girlfriends were all sharing one room but hey - we were staying at the Waldorf! The room was large with two generous sized and very comfortable beds. We had a separate dressing room with wall to wall mirrored wardrobes, with double doors leading to a large bathroom complete with huge mirror and marble washstand. After reading several reviews where people were disappointed with their rooms - we were thrilled with ours. The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful, the service couldn't be faulted. Rooms were clean and tidy, there's a turn down service so don't leave stuff on your beds when you go out in the evening. Towels were changed twice a day, even when we'd left them out to dry. One down side for us English ladies was that there are no tea-making facilities but we had brought our own travel kettle and tea-bags after being fore-warned by other reviews. Take the time to have a look at the exhibition of old photos and memorabilia in the lobby and visit the Ballroom and Starlight Bar - fabulous art decco decor. Apparently there's a guided tour of the hotel but only on Thursdays so we missed that. We had one rather decadent night drinking champagne in the piano bar where we were spoilt rotten by the most lovely waiter who brought us complimentory savoury nibbles, then dainty cakes, then chocolate desserts in champagne glasses - with the third bottle of champers also being "on the house" we had a lovely memorable evening - hic!

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful Elegant a fantastic stay.”
Reviews.Author: Gill66
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria hotel was beautiful and elegant Stayed in Manhattan for three days whilst visiting friends in New Jersey . Family of four (two girls 14 & 10). The lobby areas are a must see even if your not staying there. The staff where friendly and so helpful. We had a good look round the ballroom was unbelievable. Our room had two double beds although not large it was very comfortable. The location was great short walk to the Rockefeller top of the rock is a must. It was well worth paying the extra to experience staying at the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “Living on it's past”
Reviews.Author: StheBRIT
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed at the Waldorf, the first time we were upgraded to a fantastic suite, this time we were given the smallest hotel room I've ever seen, for three of us! We asked to move and the room we were given was certainly larger but with peeling wallpaper, ripped cushions on the furniture and a very unusual smell. We had originally booked for four nights but checked out the next day and went to the London Hotel on 54th and 7th which was a breath of fresh air. The Waldorf has great history and a rare presence, but if you need quality accommodation at a this price you can do a lot better. There is no wireless internet in the room and the wired service is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, old-world charm”
Reviews.Author: rpost06
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Waldorf during the NYC marathon since we found a great rate ($275/night) by booking nearly a year in advance on the hotel's website. We loved the attentive service, and especially appreciated the free upgrade to a larger King room. The quality of the service and the history put this hotel in the 5-star category. However, we've stayed in hotels with nicer rooms in 4-star hotels. We recommend the Bear & the Bull bar for a nightcap. The bartenders were hilarious & very attentive. Be prepared to spend $30-40 for two drinks (unless you are drinking the $6 pints of beer). We would definitely stay at the Waldorf if we found another great rate, but there's no way we would pay the going rate of $700/night.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and over-hyped”
Reviews.Author: CliffLeach
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were really good, the location is excellent BUT the hotel itself is faded glory, the rooms we were in (and we were poart of a large ocnference) were in serious need of redecoration and upgrade, if I had paid $100 per night it might just have been acceptable, for $600 it most certainly was not. I would go out of my way not to stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull old world nyc glamour”
Reviews.Author: nycgirlNorthEast
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Waldorf Astoria now on 3 occasions....i love the location of this hotel....Park Avenue. Great location for 5th Avenue shopping...although close to all other areas you will deff visit. Hotel rooms are of stardard size for NY....most rooms not very large if you book std rooms. Hotel has a very 'Old World Glamour ' feel with still with all original features from when hotel was first built. I have saw many celebs at this hotel,and watched first hand a hollywood movie being filmed in the lobby!!!

Reviews.Title: “Did exactly what it said on the tin”
Reviews.Author: lynne1307
Reviews.Content: Waldorf Astoria. A classic piece of NYC. Had to be done really, as (for now) it was my only visit to NYNY. I am so glad i stayed here. Yes, its not your trendy boutique hotel in the village, but it is a piece of history, and its like living, in a piece of history. Great service from all, had a refrigerator delivered to the room FOC - great for keeping beers in ! - wonderful service from front of house, great bar - who could resist having a manhattan in manhattan !! - just a great place to spend a long weekend. i would recommend it. room was fine, a litlle dated, but what do you expect. everything clean and working order. had great alarm clock with ipod docking station. stole all of the toiletries and stationery, well, you have to don't you !! go there once, for the experience, you won't be disappointed - we weren't !

Reviews.Title: “Time Warp in a positive way”
Reviews.Author: JuhaniJyrkka
Reviews.Content: After a couple of stays in this NYC classic I´m very pleased with service and also with rooms provided. We had our requests met with good attitude, although some mix-ups and misinformation occured, but nothing serious or nothing to effect our stay. As usually mentioned here this is a wonderful historic place with importance and iconic status to NYC. While we where there Alfred E. Smith Foundation had it´s annual dinner featuring Barack and John making some decent jokes. We didn´t get to the dinner, though... If you don´t mind some aging and spots here and there and wan´t to experince tradition with good sense of today, I´d say go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel but can find better for the price.”
Reviews.Author: CLA0406
Reviews.Content: This is a stunning hotel and a piece of NYC history. At $500 a night though i found the grand hyatt to have nicer, larger rooms and the service to be better. The Grand Hyatt usually falls between $350-450 a night.

Reviews.Title: “A trip back in time”
Reviews.Author: lookin4luxury
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 10th anniversary at the Waldorf recently booking through the Hilton Honors customer service due to a complex itinerary. First, the lobby, bar area and Bull and Bear restaurant were lovely and did not disappoint. We were upgraded to a suite (two rooms + wet bar room, bath and vanity area) due to my gold status. In this era, when it seems nothing is free, the Waldorf management really came through with a surprise gift of a full size champaign and chocolate dipped strawberries waiting in our room to acknowledge our anniversary. That really meant a lot. Make no mistake, however. The other reviews are on to something. The room just seems to lack pizzazz and/or doesn't seem to convey $500/nt value somehow. Some of that may be that a dollar doesn't go very far in NYC. I stopped to consider what I would ask them to do differently. Unfortunately, the reality may be that staying true to the hotel's history and art deco style may mean living with what feels to some extent like staying in your grandma's living room. If they updated decor to the luxury standards we've come to expect, would it be just another hotel vs. a trip back in time?

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf fine, but shabby in places”
Reviews.Author: MarleneK
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to my one night stay at the Waldorf this past weekend. I have to say there were highpoints and low points. The lobby is wonderful. Angel at reception was patient and kind when checking me in early. But my room - 1060 - was not the best. The bed was great and comfy, but the wallpaper was separating and had a few problems. The white curtains were dirty, and the cable tv seemed to be having problems, too, as most of the stations were a little snowy. The service was, however, impeccable from the room service to the maid who turned down my bed to the Bull & Bear and to the guest service managers who handled my complaints about the wall paper, etc. (I hope the room got looked at after I left). I was given free breakfast at Oscar's and $75 off my room price. Yes, things are pricier at the Waldorf ($95 for Sunday brunch) I treated myself to a Waldorf Salad (appetizer size) and a glass of the house champagne which came to $34.00. Room Service for onion soup and hot chocolate was about the same. I enjoyed people watching - no dowagers in tiaras -but several rather formal events were taking place that night at the hotel. Surprised by the lack of doormen at the front to assist with cabs, etc., but on the whole, a pleasant experience. Would I stay again? If I got a good rate again - and I would make sure that I didn't get room 1060.

Reviews.Title: “Does not live up to the reputation”
Reviews.Author: KGBSydney
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here for our honeymoon. We found the experience somewhat lacking. We went straight to check in after a 10 hour flight. The staff were apprehensive about assisting us until, after they served several people before us, they discovered we were staying in a suite and their entire attitude changed. I found that approach mercernary at best. Our room was extremely large, however the bathroom was very small and not terribly moden. The whole hotel gave us the impression that it must have been something in its time but some modernising is needed here. We were on the 27th floor and we still found street noise a problem, however we soon learnt that this is a new york thing and therefore hardly the fault of the hotel. The lifts were not working properly for 2 days while we were there and as we were so high up, taking the stairs was dreadful, especially after walking around the whole of manhattan during the day. Our new york experience was somewhat disappointing all round. We found it a soulless, money hungry city.

Reviews.Title: “Where's Waldorf?”
Reviews.Author: JJFB
Reviews.Content: I broke down and spent the extra $115 per night to take my wife to the Waldorf-Astoria, instead of a cheaper NYC hotel after reading a bad review about that other hotel on TripAdvisor concering bed bugs. The Main Lobby and floor of the Waldorf is opulent, but the room I was in was significantly less so. The room I stayed in was nothing too special, and lacked features you would expect in a high class hotel. There was no flat screen television, no t.v in the bathroom, the queen sized bed was too small, and the lighting was poor. Don't get me wrong, it was a nice hotel room. But, I expected great and was disappointed. There always seemed to be a bustle in the main lobby comprised of well dressed foreignors and corporate types. The best thing about this hotel is its lobby and location. The hotel is situated in easy walking distance to mid-town sites and is surrounded by impressive buildings. As NYC mid-town hotels are un-godly expensive, the Waldorf was actually a fairly good bargain. My room, unfortunately, was near the elevator shafts, so I keep hearing the swoosh of elevator cables all night while I was trying to sleep. That's my fault for trusting the reception staff to pick my room, because I went with the cheaper option of having my room selected for me upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dandb
Reviews.Content: We were recently very lucky to spend one night in the Waldorf, thanks to my sister & brother-in-law booking us in with their Hilton points. We had a great king size superior room on corner of hotel - more like a suite as it had separate dressing room. I liked the old decor and charm, the room was very comfortable and by far the most luxurious we've ever stayed in. It was also the largest. There were so many cupboards and wardrobes - our meagre overnight bag looked very lost! The housekeeper was very attentive with regards to making sure we were happy with everything in our room. We used the Starbucks for snack on arrival and the Bull & Bear for cocktails before going out in the evening. We had emailed the hotel a few days in advance re menus as my husband has special dietery requirements but unfortunately they didn't bother to reply - so we didn't eat there. We also found that the hot water supply in the room wasn't that great. Neverthless, we did enjoy our overnight stay there and thought it was very grand hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Historic and unique but aging”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelerAustin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf and found it charming and authentic, but it does show its age. The Waldorf service is top notch, with lots of extremely helpful staff at the ready at all times. Great food, location, and fitness center as well. Starbucks in the lobby - yay! The accommodations are not necessarily as deluxe as you might expect at this price point (more than $700/night) - the bathroom in my suite was tiny, with only a pedestal sink and a shower/tub combo. I could not open the shampoo bottle to save my life, and outlets were hard to find. On the upside, though, the towels, sheets and robes are fabulous, I loved the alarm clock with the iPod docking station, and the view of the Chrysler building out my window was priceless. On the whole it is a treat to stay there, but don't expect flat screen TVs, jetted tubs or updated fixtures. The place has character!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Katya
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf back in 2004 when we got married and it was truly wonderful. Very glamorous, admittedly a faded glamour but this only added to the charm. The hotel really enhanced our New York experience and the staff were very kind to us, upgrading us to a room with fantastic views of the Chrysler building and sending strawberries dipped in chocolate and a bottle of Champagne up to our room on our wedding night. It was the most, wonderful special time and we WILL be going back but probably not until a special wedding anniversary because it is expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gap1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a small double bed room on the 14th floor and even though we had a bad view from our window, our room was comfortable, clean and elegantly decorated. The only small problem was it seemed as though we would occassionally hear a banging and scraping noise coming from the rooms above. The staff was very helpful and eager to please. I would also suggest eating breakfast around the corner since it is Very expensive eating there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: CourtneyIN
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf was not cheap but it was worth it. The hotel is as grand as I had imagined it to be. We stayed in a basic room (no upgrade) but it was still fantastic. The room was a comfortable size, the black out drapes were great, the marble bathroom was lovely. All in all, it was the perfect luxury hotel experience. I have never enjoyed a hotel stay more, I didn't want to leave the room!

Reviews.Title: “Corner Suite”
Reviews.Author: Travels4workand4fun
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Waldorf=Astoria four or five times over the past two years. As a Hilton Diamond VIP, this is my preferred Hilton full-service property in NYC. The separate check-in lounge for Diamonds, just to the left of the looooooong registration desk, is a nice touch. The Waldorf is truly an historic gem, rich with period details. I booked a one bedroom suite for $529 and received an upgrade to corner suite 13-A (yes, they have a 13th floor). A nice room with non-working fireplace in the living room, crystal sconces, small but nice marble bath, and a very comfortable bedroom with walk-in closet, suite 13-A overlooks St. Bart's. Room service was prompt and very cordial. The housekeeping staff were pleasant and attentive. Bathroom amenities were on a par with the Four Seasons. Peacock Alley is a great spot for lunch or cocktails. Kenny's gives an upscale men's haircut in a private salon, for a price (about $125). Avoid the Bull & Bear - if you want a steak, go out on the town. If you love historic hotels, you won't be disappointed at the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “Just like the movies”
Reviews.Author: unclejunior
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria is everything you'd expect from a 5 star New York City Hotel. Absolute luxury and first class service. Personally speaking, the location is a little too tourist friendly but I can't fault the hotel. The service was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Wowie Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: Scorpio55
Reviews.Content: I used Trip Advisor to review a number of hotels prior to booking for my stay in NYC. As the Waldorf had very mixed reviews, I decided to take a chance anyway and book it - keep the fingers crossed and hope for the best. I need not have worried, our experience was utterly fantastic! Yeah, the doorman was a bit distracted when we stepped out of the taxi but I can carry my own case and yeah there was a wee queue for check in and breakfast but what's the rush - I'm on holiday!!! Nothing about our Waldorf experience dissapointed - the room was luxurious, particularly the mattresses and its a pleasure to be in a hotel with an environmental conscience. We ordered room service one evening and both the service and food were second to none. I work in a quality and customer focused environment and tend to suffer a bit of occupational hazard - with the Waldorf there was no need. I would return here again and again, it certainly contributed to a wonderful NYC experience for me! Thank You!

Reviews.Title: “Out of this World!!!”
Reviews.Author: dumdumdedum
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last year and I chose it because it was my first time in New York and after hearing about the Waldorf and seeing it in so many movies I just had to see it for myself! I was not disappointed!! My friends and I hired a Limo to take us to the hotel as we thought we may as well as it really didnt cost that much (about £30 each for a return trip for 3 of us) the limo pulled into the underground car park of the waldorf and we were greated by a staff member who immediately loaded our luggage on to a trolley and guided us to the reception desk to check in, this was very quick!! He then showed us to our hotel room (2 double bed deluxe room). The room was beautiful!!!! very spacious we had a corner room and had a view of park ave, you really feel in the heart of the city! The room looked so nice i was afraid to touch anything and was very warm and inviting compared to some hotel rooms now that feel quite impersonal and clinical! The bathroom was very clean, great shower (nothing worse that a shower that has no power in it) and overall a great standard!! I also found the staff to be fantastic! I went to the shop within the waldorf to buy a sewing kit as I found I had a hole in my jumper the hotel staff offered to have it fixed FOR FREE!! Overall the staff were so helpful!! Ive never been to a hotel where i've felt so well looked after! from beginning to end this hotel is truely an experience and yes it can be expensive but if you can afford it or can save really hard like I did haha its well worth it! We ordered room service on our last morning which was so much fun just to have done it i think it was $25 each and all silver service i would deffinately do it just to treat yourself! The staff were perfect! The room was perfect! The door man was so friendly i loved staying there just because it was so nice talking to him in the morning, the staff are a credit to this hotel. I really hope I can stay here again, i give this hotel 11 out of 10! I think if anyone has found fault with this hotel they are very very very hard to please!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: Joneses11
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying at the Waldorf Astoria and had a wonderful time. We were apprehensive after reading some of the recent reviews but every fear was unfounded. On arrival at the hotel, we had to enter via the car park which was disappointing, but the doormen don't like airport shuttle buses parked outside the front entrance. We found our way to the lobby with our cases and checked in within five minutes. The staff were friendly and asked if we needed help with our luggage but we declined, knowing that it might not arrive quickly. When we entered our room we were very impressed with the size and the decor was traditional and well maintained. We had e-mailed a few days previously to ask for the best room possible at our rate and also stated that it was our anniversary, so arrived to find a bottle of champagne and a plate of chocolate covered strawberries with a note wishing us a pleasant stay. The airconditioning was effective, the room was clean, and the maids provided a turndown service each night. We were on the 27th floor and had good views towards the East River and Park Avenue. We did not intend to eat at the hotel knowing that the prices were high, so have no complaints about the cost. We did drink in Harry's bar and ,although quite expensive, I am sure that we could have found other hotels nearby with the same prices. The hotel itself was beautiful, and if you take the time to walk around and explore, you can imagine what it must have been like in its heyday. The grand ballroom and silver corridor were especially magnificent. The location of the hotel is great as you are within easy walking distance of most of the main attractions but do not have to put up with the constant hustle and bustle of somewhere like Times Square We had no problems buying food nearby and ate in places varying from the cheap Viennese deli on Lexington towards the Chrysler building, to the Oyster bar in Grand Central Station, and the View restaurant 48 floor up in the Marriott Marquis hotel in Times Square. We also would recommend taking the Gray Line bus tours from the 49th street side of the hotel. We had 72 hour passes and these included all routes and tickets to the Empire State Building and the Statue of Liberty. There are street vendors everywhere but we bought ours at the hotel ticket desk. We experienced prompt attention and good service with no queues. We went to the Statue of Liberty via the bus and although it took some time to get there, the tour was very interesting. The queue to the boat was long but moved very quickly and we only waited half an hour. We did not get off the boat but you can disembark at Liberty Island and Ellis Island if you wish. We went to the Empire State building when it opened at 0830hrs as recommended by the hotel staff, and walked straight through with no waiting and no crowding on the viewing platform. Later in the day queues form outside and around the building. Returning to the hotel after a busy day was always a pleasure and the sheer opulence of walking through the lobby and not being in a brand new 'chain' hotel with no history was lovely. Staying at the Waldorf Astoria does not have to be that expensive and to be in such beautiful surroundings only enhanced our stay in New York. The staff were always friendly, helpful and easy to approach. We hope to return to New York and stay in the Waldorf Astoria again.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Dame”
Reviews.Author: 2toots
Reviews.Content: In today's world of Holiday Inn's, Courtyards, etc. it's always a pleasure and a treat to take a step back in time and bask in the glory of a time gone by. After reading some of the posts, it made me wonder if I was the only one to appreciate this landmark hotel. I took in all the glitz and glamor the hotel could offer. Our hallway was adorned with photos of those celebrities caught in the moment of being in the Ballroom, at dinner, and the likes. I wish I had more time to stroll the other hallways and gaze upon moments preserved forever. My daughter and I were in the city for one night, to attend a cooking demonstration at the Astor Center on E4th St. We were able to take the subway, just around the corner from the hotel, and be in the SOHO District in 10 minutes, and I think it only cost $4 for the round trip. We took the train into the city, so we didn't have to deal with driving/parking, because it is a nightmare! We were upgraded to a suite, offered a choice of continental breakfast or 2 cocktails at any of the 4 bars at the hotel and 2 bottles of water --being an Hilton Honors member does have it's priveldges :) Our 2 room suite was huge...a small entryway, large 'coat' closet, fireplace in the living room area, another huge (7x5ft) walk in closet in the sleeping area. I felt extremely spoiled having the room we had..we were on the 9th floor of a 26 floor hotel. They do have a club level. Water pressure and temperature were just fine. 2 tv's, mini-bar (always outrageous prices with mini-bars, but they are fun to see what's in them!) We were at the end of the hallway so I never heard any noise...but being in the city is loud..constant traffic, horns, sirens, but that is all part of what makes NYC the best city in the world! NYC is expensive, so be prepared... We had drinks at the Peacock bar and just watched the world go by. Our drinks were complimented by 2 little dishes of marinated olives and espresso dusted almonds...thank you Nick and Michael for your attentiveness, you're great mixologists! Even at 10pm there were people, lots of people checking in, checking out, the front desk was always busy when we walked by, and we were there on a Monday. I loved hearing the clock chime. There is so much history in the hotel--enjoy it while you can, and if you can, be grateful that you were able to....

Reviews.Title: “Don't Waste Your Money”
Reviews.Author: travel165
Reviews.Content: I have been to NYC on many occasions. I have stayed at some WONDERFUL places like the Carlyle, Ritz Carlton and Affinia Dumont.
