On this trip, we didn't want to spend that much money on accomodations as it was only for one night. However, I was traveling with someone who really wanted to stay at the Waldorf. We found some very reasonable rates online (around $350). We drive into the parking area for Valet. When you first drive in, it seems very nice. We waited about 15 minutes just to pull the car up and get the bags out. No one helped us with our bags. This is not a big deal, as we are certainly capable of carrying our own bags, but I certainly expected better service from The Waldorf. We finally get inside and found it a bit hard to find where to find the lobby. Not a big concern. We get to the lobby, which is indeed very nice, but certainly an older hotel. We then found a large row of registration desks. We found an even longer line to check in. Standing on line with our bags for about 10 minutes or so. Again, not what I would come to expect of a hotel. I have received better service at the Marriott. There are a large array of people staying at the hotel. We get to our room and it is a good size for a superior room. The hotel, it's obvious is older and the renovations don't appear to have helped. Upon going to the restroom, I walk out and notice that I am actually walking downhill from the bathroom to the main room. There is a slope in the floor in our room. The bathroom and the bedroom were spacious. The bathroom had been renovated, but it seemed more like a 'face-lift'. The sheets on the bed were ok and the towels in the bathroom were good as well. Getting a cab from the Park Street entrance was a nightmare. The front door men seemed really lazy and there was always a line of people waiting for a cab. Not to mention the bike riders constantly asking if you want a ride. It's NY, so it's ok. The staff would try and move them to the side, but they always seemed to be in the way of cabs and cars. It was easier to walk a block down and flag a cab myself. The restaurant took a very long time to get seated for breakfast, which was odd considering there were only 4 people eating at the time. The food was ok, the bloody mary was terrible and overall WAY too expensive. Would have been MUCH better to hit a deli. Location is ok, but there are many other great and reasonably priced hotels in the area that would be worth your time. Don't waste your time staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ViatorBoston
Reviews.Content: This is a grand old hotel, and the lobby and public spaces don't disappoint. Our room, however, did. Cramped, dark, with no place to sit comfortably and relax (except on the bed or at the desk), with a view of some sort of shaft. In order to tell if the sky was blue or gray, we had to crane our necks up from the corner of the window. The concierge staff was helpful if you could get to them; there were always a lot of people waiting in line at their desks and at the front desk. The cleaning staff was friendly and did a good job. If the hotel cost less, one would take these inconveniences in stride, but when paying so much, one expects more. For less money, I think I would in future book a nicer room at, for instance, the Helmsley on Central Park South. Better location and you wouldn't feel depressed every time you returned from touring. P.S. When, in answer to a question about my stay, I indicated my disappointment while checking out a friendly person at the desk gave me her name and said she would see I got a nice room next time I came. I probably won't take her up on it.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great. For that price there are so many other hotels to choose from.”
Reviews.Author: mil123
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to New York City. We have been there many times and have stayed in many different hotels that varied in price. The Waldorf is pricey and you would expect things to be different that what we experience. I found the room had an old musty smell. The lobby was grand and beautiful but there was always a line at the front desk. Even though there were probably 10 spots for staff to help customers there were never more that 3 or 4 people working at one time. The line was ridiculous. On our last night we woke in the morning with no running water. Supposedly there was a problem in the middle of the night and they had to shut off the water throughout the hotel. When they turned it back on at about 7:30 a.m., it came out of the facets in the sink, the shower and in the toilet, black. We could not shower, wash or even brush out teeth. When I got down to the desk to complain, I had to wait in line to speak with someone. I heard other people compaining about the water as well. I was compensated with a free night. That was the only prositive part of my stay. They also sent our bill up to our room on the day of checkout, riddled with mistakes. There were charges for mini bar purchases we did not make and charges to the fitness centre when my husband is a gold priority club member and fitness centre visits are free. For the amount of money we paid for this hotel room, there are so many other hotels I would prefer to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: danie67
Reviews.Content: For the hotel itself, the staff was great. We had a problem with our theatre tickets, and although they couldn't help, the concierge tried. They were always willing to hail us a cab. They held our bags for us both before we checked in and after we checked out. They were great. The room was really largel and had a fantastic view of NY The bathroom was a good size, although the shower was a stall and no bath. I don't take baths in hotel rooms, so no problem. The hotel offers a free continental breakfast, which I didn't take advantage of, and free coffee and tea , which is really nice for a NY hotel. And the rates were comperable or better than other places in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: DAHL79
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the Waldorf Astoria, and it lived up to our expectations. We knew that it was a very old hotel, but wanted to stay there for the history and to be able to say that we had been there. We arrived early in the evening, but the room they had reserved for us was not ready yet, so instead of transfering us to a less nicer room they gave us a free dinner at the Bull and Bear Restaurant, which is a very good steak restaurant at the hotel. When we were done eating the room was ready. We stayed in a superior room with a big flatscreen TV and nice furniture. The aircondition was old but it work just fine. The place is a little worn down, but we knew that, so there was no surprises. Our view from the room was not so great, as we were overlooking the construction between 2 buildings and part of Park Avenue. Overall it we had a great stay here and the service of the staff was excellent. I´m not sure that we will go back, because at that price you can find much better hotels in New York, but it´s fun to be able to say that we have been there and to have experienced the unique history of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay during a heat wave”
Reviews.Author: Me9247
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is clean. Our room seems to have been updated based on other review. The bath room and room are a bit on the small side but this is NYC. They are big for NYC. I have stayed at other hotels in the city with smaller rooms. The room was cleaned every day and even had a turn down service. My issue with the Waldorf was that nothing seemed to run smoothly. Maybe my expectations were too high. We checked in at 11 am and were told our room was not available. This was no big deal and expected. We were asked to give them a cell phone number and they would call. We were also told not to stand in line when we returned since all we needed to do is big up keys. I should also mention that we were using Hilton Points to stay at the hotel and were in the city for a wedding. We left the hotel and went to entertain ourselves in the city. At 4:30, we decided we should head back since we had to be at the wedding rehearsal at 7pm. It was over 100 degrees in the city that weekend and needed to shower before the event. When we arrived at the hotel we went were we told to go at 11 am. A woman working for the hotel came over and said we needed to stand in the check in line. After explaining our situation she said we still need to stand in the line; which had over 10 people in it. Oh, I have forgotten to mention I am Hilton Gold. After a 20 minute wait, we got to someone to help us. We were told that we had been upgraded to a nicer room but it still wasn’t available at 5:30pm. At which point, I told her I had to be somewhere at 7pm and needed to shower ASAP. She left to go speak to a peer. 15 minutes later we were given a room key. We were told it was just a normal room and to make it up to us they would give us drinks at one of the hotel bars. At this point, I was more worried about making the rehearsal. We were told our bags would be sent up. After 30 more minutes our bags finally arrived. The room was extremely hot. The bell boy told us they don’t keep the AC on in the rooms. He showed us how to work it and left. We were in the room for only 45 minutes before we left as well. The room was as hot as when we got into it. When we got home at 2am the room had not cooled down at all. However, since it was so late and we were exhausted we decided not to worry about it. The next day we went to the front desk and they said they didn’t have any other rooms at that time but could move us later in the day around 6pm. The wedding was at 5pm and that was not going to work. They said they would send maintenance up to the room and see what was wrong. That night it didn’t feel any cooler. The next day we noticed the entire hotel was warm. In the long run I do not think there was anything wrong with the AC. I believe the Waldorf is an old hotel with an old AC system that can not handle a 100 degree heat wave. On our last day we checked out and stored our bags at the hotel. When we came back to get them at 4pm, it took over 45 minutes to get them. The bell boy even expected us to tip him. FOR WHAT! Thankfully, our car service understood and we still made our flight with plenty of time. Some other issues were that neither our tub nor sink drained properly. Additionally, the mini bar smelled like something had died in it. The smell was terrible. Thankfully, we only opened it once to get our Hilton Gold Gift-bottle water. I did mention this to the maid in the halls. She said she would clean it. I do not know if it was done since I didn’t want to risk opening it again. PEWWW!!! We also had a few drinks with friends at Sir Harry’s in the Waldorf. The service was terrible. We hit it at a lull so I would expect some slowness but we both had to ask for our bill and then also walk it up to someone to get it run after waiting 20 minutes for her to pick it back up. Unfortunately, my experience didn’t get any better once I got home. My bill was $0 since I was using Hilton points for my stay. The Hilton website confirms. However, once I got my credit card statement I had 3 charges on my statement from the Waldorf. One for $16.10; one for $8.70 and one for $1578.00. I have been on the phone with the Waldorf and they plan to credit my card back for all the charges. It is just a hassle to deal with in the first place. I am glad that I got to experience the Waldorf. If I was paying for the hotel, I would go somewhere else. There are plenty of hotels in NYC that do a better job and have better service. The name isn’t worth what they are charging and for what you get. Once you get out of the lobby the rooms are the same as any other Hilton, DoubleTree, or Marriott. There is nothing special in the rooms themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: MrWonderfulToronto
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 6PM with a reservation for an executive king.When we attempted to check in, we were offered a room with a defective TV but they offered us free movie. We declined. This was a sign of things to come. After 20 minutes they assigned us another room. I clarified to make sure that it was an executive king. When we arrived we found it was an ordinary room. We called down and asked if the room we reserved was not available, why had we been downgraded instead of upgraded. We told them we were furious for being lied to at the reception, downgraded without a discount and unsatisfied, We were tired of arguing and accepted their offer after a half hour of haggling of $100 per night and a bottle of champagne. Our luggage took 45 minutes to arrive. Worse, the bubbly that was supposed to calm us down took almost 2 hours despite the promise of priority service for our unhappiness. In summation, the staff at the front desk are either incompetent or poorly trained or trained to lie. They are overworked and guests are inconvenienced. Hilton ruined the once great Fontainebleau in Miami and were thrown out. They have totally destroyed the Waldorf. I wouldn't go back if they paid me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PackRat08
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not modern, its a classic piece of New York's history. The lobby is beautiful, the staff are great and the rooms are nice. All the staff that we encountered in our 5 day trip were pleasant, seemed to enjoy their jobs and were very nice and patient. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat. Our room was very clean, very comfortable. The walls are a little thin so you can hear the odd tv or person but it is to be expected in such an old hotel. The cleaning staff were great, offering privacy when needed and the turn down service was very nice. We stayed there just to experience it and it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel infrastructure, old rooms”
Reviews.Author: antonypb
Reviews.Content: I spent a night at the hotel with my girldriend. When you see the historical building and even more when you enter in the hotel you are absolutely stunned! Fantastic lampadar and lobby with a historical watch in the middle of the lobby. When you pass the elevators you start getting aware of the age of the hotel. The elevators are old and slow, the corridors or nothing special and the rooms have nice beds and desk but not all rooms are newly refurnished. The air conditioning is still very old and smelly. The view from the 7th floor was nice with a view of the Rockefeller center. Nothing special compared to other hotels like Hilton Times Square. Worth a visit but happy to have spent there only one night just for the historical importance of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Does not deliver”
Reviews.Author: ChillyAlbertans
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay here to soak up the ambience and history. We have stayed in historical properties before so we knew the rooms would be small and possible a bit dated. What we did not expect was a smelly, poorly furnished, boiling hot room with dirt everywhere. We were totally shocked. The room had a beat up old air conditioner that did not not work the two of the three days we were there. It was filthy. The bathroom was horrid with some sort of drywall bits and other dirt in every nook and cranny. The bathroom ventalation system looked to be about 30 years old (and never cleaned). It made a tremendous noise but seemed to move no air. We called the front desk about the problems. They repeatedly apologized and then did nothing. We asked for a new room to no avail. This was the rare occassion when we dreaded our return from a day of shopping and sight seeing. Just to top it off, we had a view of the top of the roof between two wings which was a bloody mess! I took a picture (which is on another computer so I may get around to uploading it along with the shot the air conditioner I also took) it was so funny/sad. It looked like what you see driving down a back alley in a poorer neighborhood. The public areas are great. They were everything we expected. The food was, sadly, very poor. The drinks were great. The staff were very good too. Having just come from the Michelangelo (at $100 a night cheaper and a much, much better room), this was a real let down. Never again...all the nice places in the hotel are public and you can enjoy it without being subjected to the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Times”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrs149
Reviews.Content: Recently spend 3 nights at the Waldorf and we would compliment the hotel on a very good central location. Public areas were traditional and well maintained. Our guest room although quite big, was a little tired in style and presentation which was disappointing given the hotel's historical standing in the city. Same for corrdidors to guest rooms......... Was disappointed with lack of flexibility in room charging. We stayed for three nights including a weekend and were charged dearer weekday rates throughout our stay because we stayed from a Friday . If we had only stayed on a Saturday and Sunday, our nightly rates would have been a good bit less.???? Hotel expensive to dine it.Lots of good eateries nearby at a fraction of the cost.......also, down town open top tourist bus stops right outside the hotel.......worthwhile to get your bearings.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: DoncasterYorkie
Reviews.Content: I was realy looking forward to visiting the Waldorf Astoria, but was very disappointed. The rooms we were given were poky and in need of a change of decor, the bathroom was tiny and there was a very odd smell in the room. Our outlook was on to another wing of the hotel, so we often looked out to see other people staring at us from their rooms. Windows could not be opened, so the stale smell stayed the whole week. One night I threw the heavy top cover off as I was so hot and found what looked like blood on the inside, I told the chambermaid the next day, and even though there was a clean one put on the bed that night, there was no word of apology. As I went with my son, we requested rooms close together, he ended up down the corridor and round the corner, his room also had a funny smell and was just as poky as mine. I had expected more from this hotel, having read so much about it. I would definately NOT return as there are many more modern, and cleaner hotels to choose from in New York. The only good thing I can say about it was it was nicely situated, breakfast was chaotic, and staff very poor. Love New York, hate the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Waldorf Astoria”
Reviews.Author: IloveNEWyork001
Reviews.Content: Stayed here nov 07 was a bit unsure after reading the reviews on this site but have to say it was a wounderful stay. Had mini suit was newly refurbished view was out the back of the hotel but wasn't in the room often only to sleep so wasn't that bothered. It was thanksgiving weekend so was very very bussy, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf doesn't live up to reputation”
Reviews.Author: Ravenduffer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights for business as a part of a large group. Excellent midtown location with the subway immediately across the street to the left on the Lexington entrance. Very good Redstone Pizza, Duane Read Pharmacy, and a liquor store are three blocks to the right down Lexington. Morrell Wine Bar is a great place to people watch the Rockefeller crowds a few blocks away.The Waldorf lobby, common meeting areas, and restaurants still convey a grand old school appeal. The peeling paint in the bedroom bathroom and the non flat screen TV's should be improved. Service was hit or miss when the staff could or could not manage the crowds. The front desk manager was excellent at handling a stressful checkin, while an undertasked bartender at the Bull and Bear was lazy and unattentive. This is a BIG hotel, and there are so many good hotels in the area. I wouldn't stay here unless the price was right or my company was paying again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: Mr&MrsN
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Waldorf in July 2008 for one week with my mum and sister as a shopping trip and chance to meet with family who live in NYC. On arrival our luggage was taken care of quickly and we were taken to reception rahter than just being directed. Check in didnt go according to plan as when we booked we booked two interconnecting rooms (these were promised by travel agent) On check in there were no interconnecting rooms left although it worked out in the end as the single room was offered on the 17th floor (smoking rooms only) which one of our party wanted. Rooms were big - our room had two double beds, walk in wardrobe (great for the shopping bags) although it did have a small bathroom. We experienced problems with the shower.. you have to run it for over 15 mins before any hot water. My sister complained once and was given breakfast vouchers (which we didnt use) but the water was never fixed properly. Housekeeping okay - turndown service didnt happen every night and when you wanted towels changed they hung up your used ones again so we called down a few times for fresh towels. The room has a/c which you cant turn down lower than 63. Rooms look like they could do with a facelift but hey how long are you spending in your room. We used the Theatre and Tours desk within the hotel to book a show (Chorus Line) Richard on the desk was very helpful and got us great seats. The Concerige desk was again very helpful especially when it came to plotting all the shops we wanted to go on a map! No problems getting a taxi outside the hotel.. although for those who have not been to NYC before like me.. their taxi drivers always ask for a full address of where you are going!!! Theres a Starbucks in the ground floor of hotel which is pricey compared to the starbucks out and about but ideal very first thing in the morning. Hotel has all different types of guests... we saw wedding parties, business persons and tourists.. the hotel does say it has a dress code for lobby areas but we wore shorts etc and noone said anything. The best thing with this hotel is the location. A pleasant 15min walk to Times Square/Tiffanys/Bloomingdales/Grand Central Station its perfect. We wanted to have a late checkout as our flight wasnt till late at night.. when we called down to first ask we were told 75 dollars per hour so we werent going to bother. On the day we were going home we called again and were told first hour free then £35 dollars per hour so another warning... always check again! We also had mini bar charges on final account which we had not used so again check your bill before you leave. All in all a lovely hotel with its amazing lobby and history but personally I prefer a more modern hotel and if I was returning I would find one but ensure it be close to the waldorf as location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: suesp30
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous lobby then it goes downhill. For the price paid, there are much nicer hotels in the vicinity - the rooms are very old fashioned - and I dont mean quaint! We had trouble getting hot water via the shower - tip - let the tap run for at least 15 minutes then turn to shower mode. There is a on-site Starbucks but the prices are quite hefty - tip - loads of Starbucks outside and charges are much cheaper. The staff are very helpful but on checking out, noticed we had all been charged for using the mini bar (we couldnt even open ours!) - not a problem though, the charges were immediately taken off. Remember to check your bill before leaving. There is a dress code in certain parts of the hotel but we had no problems wearing shorts and tshirts as were many others, bearing in mind this hotel is also hugely used weddings, business conferences,etc. All in all a fantastic stay in New York but would definetely stay in a more contemporary hotel.

Reviews.Title: “rob and vivs 40th birthday in the waldorf”
Reviews.Author: poshandghandi
Reviews.Content: stayed in the waldorf astoria in march with my girlfriend for our 40th birthday what a hotel. the staff were so helpful what you would expect from a top class hotel .the room was really nice and the bed was so comftable with those triple folded down sheets never slept in a bed like it.if you go out the lexington entrance the are plenty of places for breckfast .a good tip if you suffer from astma you can e mail them and they will supply astma sheets . unless your going to drink out of the mini bar leave the stuff inside alone because as soon as you lift something out it registers on your bill . you can book in online from the buisness suite in the lobby for free for your return flight home the staff are more than helpful.if you want to see a broadway show go to the booking office of the theatre the day before or on the day you can get seats at half price we did at the winter garden went to watch mama mia the seats where 3 rows from the front and the show was fantastic.. if you go to macys shopping as for a discount card in the shop visitors get a 11% discount .have a go at the helicopter flight you will enjoy it we did and a good tip if your going to visit ground zero or liberty island its all in the same area so worth planning we did the helicopter flight then went to ground zero, . all of the starbucks have wi fi so just buy a drink and surf away on your laptop.just a last thing we felt safe all the time in new york night and day even on the subway and we are going back

Reviews.Title: “This place is a dump”
Reviews.Author: esheng
Reviews.Content: This place is totally resting on its laurels. Our room was large, which was about the only good point. The carpet was filthy. There were no slippers so I had to request them. They probably haven't done a thorough renovation of the room since 1970. There were layers and layers of paint on the bathroom door, closet doors, and on moulding, whch also had a nice big piece of blue painters tape stuck to it. The furnishings were tired - there was a hole in one of the lampshades. The bed itself was nice as were the sheets, but the decorative pillows and stuff were practically threadbare. The marble/granite was nice in the bathroom, but you could tell the tub had been refinished about a 50 times. There were a few layers peelng off around the drain. Can't complain about the price since we used Hilton points to stay here but if I were paying anything close to the rack rate, I'd be very annoyed. No way would I stay here again - there are so many nice hotels in NY why waste it on a has been?

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MummyDScotland
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews, I must admit I was a bit apprehensive about staying here with my family, particularly given the comments on the condition of some of the rooms from many previous visitors. However, from the second we arrived until the very second we left the Waldorf, the service was excellent. It was my son's 15th birthday whilst we were in NY and I wanted to make it a special occasion. I had e-mailed the Waldorf a few days in advance explaining this and requested a nice room with a view. We were not disappointed. We had a large room (there were 4 of us) with a separate dressing room and bathroom facilities all in very good condition with an excellent view over Park Ave. The Waldorf even sent my son a personal card, some fine bottled water and exclusive chocolates for his birthday. The hotel is something special and people who plan to stay here must remember it is not a modern hotel, This is quite simply its appeal. The reception areas are stunning and the scent from the wonderful flower arrangements is simply lovely. The staff were always extremely helpful and curteous and made you feel very welcome. This is a truly special hotel which offers character and a bit of history which undoubtedly is its charm. I would have no hesit ation in recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: dcsae
Reviews.Content: After reading all the negative reviews about the waldorf I was hesitant to stay. We used points for our first trip there in October 2007 and were delighted with our room, service, tour desk... everything. We returned in May and our room was outrageously large for NY - with huge closet, large bathroom with seperate shower and bath, and a seperate sitting area. I love the classic elegance of the hotel and I must say we loved the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “There are better options.....”
Reviews.Author: dusty1196
Reviews.Content: Converted Hilton points for my stay so did not pay. Room was very small. By the time we removed decorative pillows and bedspread walking aroudn the room was severely limited. Bathroom very nice. Air conditioner was marginal at best. If it had been warmer outside the A/C would not have been sufficient. Public spaces are gorgeous. For a nearly 80 yr old building it was very well conditioned. Service was fine. I have stayed at the Hilton NY (Ave of Americas) and for the same # of points could have stayed there and had a better room and a better location. It's a great tourist spot but there are better rooms and locations for the money in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but worth the money”
Reviews.Author: sendmehome
Reviews.Content: Well this place is a great location. Close enought to shopping and restaruants but not right next to you so you don't have that much foot traffic around. So given the other reviews, I must have really lucked out. My room was spacious, newer furnishings, beautiful bedding, bathroom with marble counter top and hugh medicine cabinet to store your stuff, two plush bathrobes in the closet and a nice chair and ottoman all provided a wonderful room experience. The staff was courteous but not over accomodating but it is New York. They were, however, able to get me into my room my 1PM so I was thankful for that. Again this is New York, but I still have diffuculity spending $16 for a glass of wine in the lobby bar that is, by the way, pretty noisy. The lack of a coffee maker in the room is amazing in this day and age and while there is a Starbucks in the lobby, I hate to have to get dressed and go down there each morning. The $14.95 daily charge for itnernet usage is part of the nickel and dime stuff that a hotel of this magnitude should not subscirbe. Also beware that when you are quoted the price for the room there are also about 15% additional for various taxes. So it was a nice hotel in a great location but but not worth the additional money.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Calcuttan
Reviews.Content: When my company booked me at the Waldorf Astoria for a business trip I was overjoyed. Even though it would be for only one night, it would provide me with an opportunity to stay at this legendary hotel. The lobby, the elevators and the general ambience lived up to the reputation; however the room was a big disappointment. The room was very small, with faded wallpaper and musty carpeting and the window opened out to service chutes with view of piping. The bathroom was tiny and dirty. I am not planning to stay in this hotel in the future

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: ELL1234
Reviews.Content: Stayed in The Waldorf Astoria at the end of May 2008 & was rather nervous given that it has more than its fair share of bad reviews, however the whole experience was excellent. Arrived well before the specified check in time but had no problems checking in - there was no queue & we were in our room within 10 minutes of arriving. Luggage turned up 5 minutes later. Reception staff & porters were all very friendly & not at all snooty. we paid for a standard room - Our room was on 27th floor & had a double aspect view up Park Ave towards the park & East towards the river. Room was very spacious, well decorated & furnished & clean. Aircon worked well & unobtrusively. My stay coincided with my birthday & I was sent a complimentary bottle of champagne & chocolate covered strawberries on the day - a nice touch. We also found the concierge service in the lobby very useful for advice on getting around & booking tours etc. My only gripes would be the high cost of room service (We didn't use it there are plenty of reasonable restaurants & delis within 2 minutes walk) & the high cost of the laundry service. overall, highly recommended & well worth the money to stay in a piece of NY history.

Reviews.Title: “Old World...New perspective”
Reviews.Author: AUBeachPotato
Reviews.Content: No problems at all here. The hotel is extravagant and quite beautiful. I would stay here again in a NY minute. I loved the historic touches and detail that the hotel provides. It's a side of the Big Apple that I have never seen before. Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorfn Astoria”
Reviews.Author: AGGSBAGGS40
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights in the Waldorf. Was a bit unsure due some bad reviews on this site. Check in was great and our room was excellent, vWe had a King Deluxe andnit nwas deluxe in everynway. The staff we met were very helpful right down to a man who helped me down a flight of stairs with my case when the elevator was being repaired. Would recommend it to anyone. Try the Hilton.com site for good deals.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Over-priced”
Reviews.Author: blacklucycat
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Waldorf with my boyfriend as a weekend getaway to NYC. We picked the Waldorf because of location and hotel history. Upon our arrival, there was a long check-in line and after waiting, we found out our room would not be ready for another 2 hours. When we finally were allowed to go to our room, it was very underwhelming. The room was tiny (queen size bed) and outdated. The bathroom was small and the tub/vanity/sink was circa 1970s. Around dinner time, housekeeping insisted on scrubbing the outside of our door for five minutes knowing we were in the room... very awkward. The "luxury" room did not have simple amenities such as coffee maker/ample electrical outlets/slippers. Overall, we were extremely disappointed. It was an experience I would have expected at a $125 per night hotel vs $500+ night experience.

Reviews.Title: “You can find better quality for your money”
Reviews.Author: Michael666
Reviews.Content: This was the third time I stayed in the hotel and on this occasion I was most disappointed. I booked to stay 6 nights but checked out after 3 nights. I found the room in dire need of refurbishment. I was placed on the executive floor and had access to the executive lounge but found a real change in attitude to my previous experiences some 5 years ago. At $600 a night I exspect good quality accomodation with a classy edge, I think this hotel is now lost within the New York market place of posh hotels these days. Previously I found every member of staff greating you with 'good day sir' and the lift had a bell boy and took you to your floor. These little extras made the hotel special. On this occassion I found the staff unfriendly and probally demotivated. I was concerned to the lack of security at the hotel, one would of thought these days that such a high profile hotel would have better security arrangements. So all in all I think prospective guests can find better quality hotels that offer the wow factor for the same if not less room rates. A real shame, I think this hotel is in dire need of a change of management.

Reviews.Title: “luxurious position”
Reviews.Author: catb
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in New York before going down to the Caribbean. Booking one year in a dvance the Waldorf came up cheaper than many below its standard..... You can't fault the location, you can't fault that lovely feeling of history and just 'staying at the Waldorf'.... but the room we had, whilst very large was drab and tired with paint peeling off the ceiling in the bathroom. . I think part if it is undergoing a revamp and it's due. Drinks and food are very pricey at the hotel but there are plenty of local breakfst options if you would prefer to eat elsewhere. If you get a good deal take it, if you don't ,stay at the Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Your money could be better spent elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: NZ_Scooter
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Waldorf and we were less than impressed. We paid an absolute fortune for this stay given it was high season. There were three of us staying, and our first room was basically an old shoe box. We were not happy to see the carpet coming up in places, marked and peeling wallpaper and a cracked sink. We asked to be moved after the first night. Our second room was better - much bigger and not as damaged. But still looking quite old. On the positive side, the lobby of the hotel is very grand and luxurious. Plus its a great location. But next time we'll stay elsewhere - the Waldorf needs extensive renovations before we'll stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carolina59
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for Friday and Saturday night for my husband's 50th law school reunion from Columbia U. We were in a short line but a hotel clerk could see my husband was having a problem standing so they ushered us into the Hilton diamond office with no wait at all. We were treated wonderfully and given a very nice room. Everyone at the hotel was so friendly and nice. Our room was great. Service was great. The hotel is elegant and beautiful. They sent us a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries to celebrate my husband's law school reunion. I can't say enough nice things about this hotel including location

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Classic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shazzyb123
Reviews.Content: Our family, which consists of myself, my husband and my two daughters aged 12 and 15 stayed at the Waldorf for 4 nights from 24 May. It was our first time to New York and we all really loved it. The Hotel is very classic so anyone wanting contemporary will not be happy. However I liked it and prefer the old style. The room was rather dusty around the fixtures and fittings but the bathroom was cleaned well every day and we always had the room done by the time we returned from our outings and fresh towels. The maid came in the evening to take off the bedspreads as it was warm at night. The size of the room was adequate as it was a standard room. We had 2 double beds but we had a seperate dressing room and the bathroom was next to that so we all had privacy when required. We had room service a couple of times and that was very prompt and the food was lovely. All the staff we encountered were very well mannered and helpful. We used the safety deposit box facility which is free and found it useful to safeguard money and passports etc. Taxis were outside the Hotel to take to you to wherever you wanted to go and they are very cheap. We had a great time and will return!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: newfrog
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Waldorf Astoria during our trip to New York because it was not that much more expensive than other hotels and the location was great. There were three of us in a room with two double beds. It wasn't giant, but it was large enough to be comfortable for three people. The best part of our stay were the beds, because they were some of the most comfortable beds we have ever slept on. The location was also great, with plenty of attractions within walking distance, and the subway close by. There were only two things to worry about. One was the constant static electricity we built up due to the plush carpets throughout the hotel. We kept getting shocked every time we touched metal. The second was the maids who were quite insistent upon coming in to turn down the sheets around 6pm, even when we asked them not to. They seemed to be blatently pressing for tips. Tipping was in general expected among the staff, so be prepared for it with some spare bills. We didn't use the restaurants in the hotel as they were more expensive than other places in the area. In general I would recommend this hotel to anyone, but note that it is not the cheapest in the world. But how many times can you stay in a place that is also a tourist attraction itself?

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: l1n
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf is a traditional style of hotel and probably some of the furnishings in the room are a bit tired looking but overlook that and it is a fantastic experience to stay there. The bed was really comfy and the room very quiet. There was always something happening in the hotel and I could have sat all day in the lobby, people watching. Sir Harry's bar does a mean G & T which was worth the $16. Great location. We bought an open top bus ticket for 3 days and used it like public transport from right outside the hotel. Ate in the Bull & Bear one night and wouldn't really recommend. Great local places for breakfast. Loved New York and thought the Waldorf made the trip really special.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: mand48
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 bedroom mini suite and were not disappointed. We spent one week here and it was wonderful. Large bedroom, separate living room with a TV in each. 2 bathrooms and large walk in closet. It was all clean and nicely decorated. Check in/ check out was very quick. We were on the 22nd floor but those lifts are so fast it wasnt a problem. The iron in the room was broken but when my daughter reported it a new one was brought within minutes We had buffet breakfast on morning which was lovely. We also ordered meals from room service twice. Both times it was delivered quickly and was very hot. More than enough food, with all the little touches included. We were treated well by all staff, and the location is perfect. walking distance to all the major attractions

Reviews.Title: “The worst nice hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: MTC-BAMA
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Diamond member so I try to stay at Hilton Hotels. For the last few years I've stayed at the Hilton on Avenue of the Stars and it was fine, but I thought I'd try Hilton's "premier" NYC property the famed Waldorf Astoria. This will be the one and only time I make that mistake. Straight up, this place is nowhere near as nice as the Hilton a few blocks over (which is no gem but merely serviceable) and WAY over-rated. I had a 6th floor room with a view of anything other than a rooftop. Fine, not a big deal but the floor was also being used to host a conference of some kind and there were tables set up in the hall all the time of my stay and a constant procession of wait staff setting up things for the conference. When I got to the room neither the TV nor the Air Conditioner worked. I called about both. They fixed the TV but didn't do anything about the A/C. (The TV here is a old tube not like the sexy flat screen a the "lesser" Hilton a few blocks away). I called again about the A/C the next morning and they said they'd fix it .. but nothing again. The morning of my last night there, I called again. When I got in from my meetings at the end of the day, they had installed a crappy window unit air conditioner in the room. It was extremely loud and was letting in heat in the side spaces where it didn't quite fit in the window. I called and complained and told them I wanted my rate reduced. They agreed to give me my last night free. Of course, when the bill came under the door it included my last night so I had to go wait in line and manually check out in order to get that night removed (And explain the whole experience again). I've actually never answered the question "how was your stay?" with the answer "not good" before until now .... at worst, I would say "fine" to the person checking me out but I just couldn't hold my tongue. Eventually they got the bill right. But at $525 per night, this was a joke. So many better places for this price. I KNEW I wasn't staying at the Four Seasons, but surely they can beat their very own Hilton a few blocks away!?! What a joke. I'll never go there again and am thinking of abandoning the chain entirely.

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: buddyandmisty
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a stay at the waldorf astoria and want to say what a wonderful time we have had. The check was easy, even though our room wasnt ready until 3pm, they had upgraded us and made mention of our anniversary and told us we were down as vip guests. (I had emailed the hotel prior to arrival to inform them of our special occasion) When we went back at 3pm our room still wasnt ready so because we were tired, we agreed to pay a nominal fee to upgrade to a suite. The room was beautiful, very elegant, it had a sitting room and a lovely bedroom. The furniture was in no way dated as suggested in previous reviews, it suited the grandeur of the place - maybe these other reviewers prefer the crisp pristine look of a boutique hotel and the classy look does not appeal? On the day of our anniversary the hotel sent us champagne and chocolate strawberries with a rose and card wishing us all the very best. What a lovely touch! We were extremely happy with everything. The breakfast was lovely, lots to choose from at the buffet and the waiting staff were efficient beyond words. No wonder Americans can seem quite impatient in a restaurant in the uk if this is the service they have come to expect! All in all it is a wonderful place, very very clean and elegant and we would not hesitate to stay there again. The staff in no way looked down on you, in fact we would say quite the opposite. If you get the chance to stay there do not worry - as long as you appreciate the history of the hotel and its intended style you will certainly not be disappointed. Cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't get any better ...”
Reviews.Author: frocha
Reviews.Content: There is an elegance to the grand old hotels like the Waldorf and the Plaza that is simply unmatched. So when you get the opportunity you simply can’t pass it up. We came across a great rate (< $350 a night) over this Memorial Day weekend. It was first class all the way. PROS: . Rooms are large . Linens and bedding were great . Lot of hot water and good water pressure . Small refrigerator in the room (great for water and sodas) . Complimentary continental breakfast (upgradeable to full breakfast for $6) . Elevators are fast and all elevators were operational all the time . Entire staff was friendly, courteous, and helpful CONS: . No shower caps for the wife . Wallpaper a bit worn but not a distraction

Reviews.Title: “Love the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: charmm
Reviews.Content: We loved the Astoria - all our experience with the staff was of the highest standard from check-in to check-out time. Concierge were great and always helpful. Would definitely stay here again - not only for the grandeur of the hotel but also the location.

Reviews.Title: “World Class... but worth the price?”
Reviews.Author: Cube44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Waldorf=Astoria in April. My parents stayed their about 25 years agoand I had always wanted to stay their. We're from Las Vegas and we've stayed in many luxury hotels all over the country. This Hotel was exceptional, especially when you consider the history of the building. We need to get one thing straight. The Waldorf=Astoria is OLD. If you're expecting everything to look shiny and new, you'll be disappointed. If, however, you are willing to accept the fact that you're in a well kept piece of American history, and not the Disney/Vegas-based hotel/resort, you'll be in good shape. The hotels does have its pros and cons. To be honest, I probably wouldn't stay at the Waldorf again on my own dime. The place is full of history and really lets you peek into what the "old guard" must have marveled at in it's day. The entire hotel drips with history and old world charm that makes it very obvious as to why its considered the "Gand-dame" of hotels. But for a regular guy like me who wants to squeeze as much luxury as i can get for my dollar, it may seem like a waste of money. Though my wife and I agree that the service and staff were all phenominal. We just couldn't bring ourselves to spend $8.50 for a glass of Sprite and $14 for an Amstel light at the bar. The $95 per person Sunday Brunch buffet had us very puzzled, as we've both been to some of the greatest buffets in the country and never paid more than $30 per. If you're a business traveler and have a decent expense account, the Waldorf may be for you as the hotel seems to be really concentrating on large meeting and conferences, which with corperate sponsorship, would make more sense for some of the prices. The area itself is just about perfect if you want to be close to the action, but not RIGHT IN THE MIDDLE of it. A ten minute walk will get you to Times Square, which in my opinion is just an unkempt Disney-type property. Every piece of wall is covered with some sort of advertisement designed to catch your eye, and there are thousands of ads trying to out-do eachother to get you attention, so all together you look at everything and focus on nothing. Though it is quite the spectacle, Times Square epitomizes that universal image of NYC; almost overwhelming. Before you get to Times Square from the hotel you'll run in to Rockefeller Center. Top of the Rock is a must do. Beware of the creepy security guard at the top who REALLY seems to like to take pictures of couples kissing with the view of the city in the background. My wife and I couldn't stop laughing because he kept moaning "yeah, yeah, kiss her again". Friendly guy though! Walk over a few blocks to the east of the hotel and there are several privately owned restaurants that won't hurt your wallet. We really liked Ristoranta Lazagna. Great specials and amazing Lazagna, especially for the price. We also enjoyed the Grayline Hop-on/off bus tours.If you walk into this the the mind set that you're going to get to see the city from a bit better view than what you would in a cab, you'll appreciate it a bit more. Don't expect much more aside from that. What more advice can I give you? Don't be afraid to eat off the street carts. Try the gyro guy a block west of Rockefeller Center. Try Ray's Pizza on 7th Ave btwn 53rd and 54th st. and have a slice. Try the original Grimaldi's Pizza in Brooklyn. Friendly staff and great pizza. Don't be afraid of the subway, It's very easy to learn the system, and most people will gladly help you find your way around. Try everything!!! It's New York City!! Last last bit of advice is to take comfortable shoes. In NYC you never realize how much you've walked until the end of the day. If you like to explore as we did, your feet will thank you if you leave the dress shoes in your suitcase and wear those walking shoes.

Reviews.Title: “This is how it is - Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: corhiain
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a girls trip in 2007 and loved it so much went back this year, little did we know the hotel could only be better than before! And no it didnt cost the earth at all, for 5 nights we paid less than £600 between us which for this hotel is amazing! On arrival we were dropped off at the underground section, somthing we hadn't had in 2007, we were met by a 'welcomer' to the hotel who greated us, had our bags taken to our room, walked us throught the hotel and checked us in while we sat and relaxed on the sofas. He came with us to the room, and after saying we would like a bigger one, just because our room in 2007 was slightly larger, he made a call and we were moved to a large suit and had strawberrys and bubbly arrive at our room as a welcome gift. Anything we wanted he looked after us. All other staff were amazing. My friend and i love the old world style of the hotel, the fact that all the furnature is not new and Ikea looking is what i want from the hotel, the grandure of it all makes you feel special,ALL the staff are amazing and the beds better than any i have ever slept in! We never dress up in the day and never feel out of place at all, never looked down on and only given respect by ALL the staff! On leaving the hotel in Jan we did have a slight issue, only minor with regards to our luggage as we left, i recieved an email from the hotel asking for my opinions on the hotel and detailed my minor issue. Within 3 days i had the director of the hotel on the phone to me in the UK to discuss the matter and express his regret...and this was only a tiny issue i raised!! He knew i was returning to the hotel in Feb and on my arrival, to my suprise, met me to further appologise, upgraded my room and when i checked out left a note to say on my next visit i would get another upgrade and a free night, so if you dont like something in the hotel tell them and they will do everything they can to make it better for you!! Oh and the welcomer from my visit in january spotted me in the hotel and welcomed me back, sent more bubbly to the room and gave us any info or help we needed....all the customers he would see but he remembered me and greated me by name! Thats the kind of personal touch i would never have expected in a hotel that size but it just shows the level of class with its employees. All staff from the door staff to housekeeping were fantastic and would do anything for you. I would not stay anywhere else in New York. Its location is amazing, the experiance is one of a kind and above all you feel safe within the hotel which is important in any city you stay in, more so when its two young women traveling alone. I am not a visitor to the hotel who as one reviewer wrote 'is on the billionaires list' but i am always given the attention from the staff that makes my stay more than i would expect. If you are going to New York please give this hotel a chance it will do nothing but make your trip more special.

Reviews.Title: “World Class”
Reviews.Author: cduda
Reviews.Content: I spent my entire life in the hotel industry, 22 years of that as a general manager for a large hotel chain. I have always wanted to stay at the Waldorf. I booked a girlfriends weekend there in March. I was not disappointed. The staff was first rate from beginning to end. The history of the hotel and it's "presence" were amazing. The room was enormous, especially for NYC. Maybe someday I will be able to return to this gem of a hotel... Don't hesitate to stay there and when you do, savor all of the history, people and amenities this hotel has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Landmark hotel, some issues”
Reviews.Author: achnyer01
Reviews.Content: I booked my reservation through the hotel- there was a special discount which applied if you used a Visa card. Upon arrival we were greeted to a very crowded lobby. But hey this is NYC and what can you expect. The line moved quickly and we were able to check in. However the price I was quoted on the phone when I made my reservation was not the same upon check in (it was corrected) The staff at the front desk was excellent-polite efficient and no attitudes. When I booked the room I specifically asked if there was a fold out bed. I was told all suites had fold out beds. No such luck. They did bring up two cots which were provided at no charge(usually a 50.00 charge each). We stayed in a corner suite and the room was excellent. Couple of small issues- the furniture was dirty and could stand to be cleaned and even on the 13th floor the room was noisy. The concierges were useless, usually concierges in a NYC hotel are helpful and knowledgeable. And I expected the same from a large hotel like the Waldorf. I called about a week or so ahead of time to see if they had any pull at a particular restaurant and the concierge could not have been less helpful. To quote, "Its not like they are holding any tables for us" well no [--]. During our stay I asked one of the concierges about the address for Brooks Brothers and what the cross street was- no clue what Brooks Brothers was!! She aked me to spell it for her and then she had to google it-I eventually just walked away. Overall the staff at the hotel was great the exception being the dopey concierge staff. Also Bull and Bear drinks are outrageously expensive. I've been to NY many times but even I was a little surprised at 18.00 for a gin and tonic and 20.00 for a maritni. But the atmosphere is very NY and the bartender was excellent. I like the Waldorf- its busy but it is a landmark and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a place to start your trip”
Reviews.Author: Christine52
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a holiday to New England and decided to start our trip with three nights in New York, so we thought where else than the Waldorf. We booked directly with the hotel, but then after visiting the Trip Advisor reviews we were more than a little worried by what we read. No need, we arrived at the Waldorf to be greeted by a delightful bell boy, who introduced himself and said if there was anything he could do, we only needed to ask. Check in was swift, and within 10 minutes we were in our room, which was delightful, lovely furnishings and bathroom everything we had hoped for. During our stay the concierge station was always helpful with theatre tickets and restaurants for dinner. They recommended a really nice Italian and the food was excellent. I can't praise this hotel enough, no wonder a lot of the staff are long standing. You can tell.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, tired and overrated.”
Reviews.Author: ILoveNYAustralia
Reviews.Content: I know I am late in writing this, but as I have not received any reply from the hotel in over a year after writing to them several times via email and completing their feedback form several times, I want to write about our experience. Hopefully they have renovated by now. This was supposed to have been a wonderful experience for our 30th wedding anniversary in the great Waldorf Astoria. We had saved up to go to New York for ages. We arrived jetlagged after more than 24 hours flying,late at night to a tiny room that greeted us with a massive stain on the carpet that had seen better days. The paint was peeling and the bathroom had make up all over the door and basin. I used the toilet and it got blocked, very blocked, so we called reception who said they would get a plumber. By this time, we were beside ourselves with tiredness. We asked if we could have another room to go to sleep and were told no as it should not be long. The room was like a sauna all night and we slept in by 30 minutes(having slept about 2 hours in all) so we missed the buffet breakfast that we had paid for months before. They said all they could offer us was coffee and sweet pastries. It was such a waste of money, hard earned money. I have stayed in better hotels here for 1/4 of the price. The most disappointing thing when I look back is that there were no apologies of any sort. Not even a simple reply to the numerous emails..... We love New York, but never again will we stay at the Waldorf Astoria.

Reviews.Title: “Thank God for Travel Points!”
Reviews.Author: PlainTraveler
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Waldorf Astoria (WA) in a suite on the 9th floor. We were using travel miles that had accumulated over 9 months time. This was my third trip to NYC, and we loved the WA's location. The lobby and its expanding hallways are magnificantly furnished. The entire place had that "old money" feel. Our checkin was quick, but we didn't have our confirmation page with us. We were told to provide it before we left or we would be charged $910 a day. We were not required to have bell service with our bags. We were given 4 free passes for a drink/Bull and Bear or for a breakfast/Oscar's. We took the drink tickets and headed down to the Bull and Bear. Our wine was $14 a glass. The three of us had dinner for a grand total of $333. Two of us had the filet for $50 each. It was terrific, but it could have been a smaller cut for less money. The lobster soup was first a dollop of lobster served in a bowl with garnish. The server then came back and poured the bisque into the bowl. Fabulous! We tried the waldorf salad, but it was basically a partial red and green apple slivered for $17? My friend had just had a birthday, so she picked up the tab as her celebration. One of us is a smoker so we were going down the elevator a lot at night to smoke at the ground level parking entrance. We wound up making friends with the valet staff. There is also a private entrance down there for upscale clientele. One night we saw Donatella Versace and her daughter, Allegra. Room Service: We didn't want to pay $8 for a small pot of coffee (3 cups) delivered to the room...plus a 15% gratuity and a $5.25 service charge. Instead we headed across the street/outside on 50th Street to Starbucks. $2.11 for a Grande/including tax. Later on we found out there was a Starbucks in WA, but their prices were higher. Suite: There were beautiful tapestry pillows and bed runners on the beds. The first time we returned to our room after being out all day, we found our beds turned down with the music playing at the IPOD station. We enjoyed the scented body lotion left for our use in the bathroom. The bathroom lacked a fan for ventilation. We kept joking about the price of what the WA charged for any kind of laundry service. $9 to wash a pair of panties? In the end, all we had to pay for was our internet service. It was well worth the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: karenb284
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay which was booked as a surprise for my birthday. I found about the trip 2 days before we went, came straight on here to check it out and was apprehensive to say the least, after some of the reviews! Get the not so good out of the way first - our taxi was directed round the side, and no-one gave us directions to reception so we stumbled around for a while. One evening in the bar the barman looked a bit sniffy at our 15% tip on 2 drinks. And my parents had a problem with their room. Good bits - Fabulous lobby - very grand and beautiful. Every member of staff we had contact with was extremely friendly, polite and professional. We got some great advice on where to eat, and excellent help with everything we asked - cancelling a restaurant booking we had made elsewhere, directions, booking return flight seats - nothing was too much trouble! Our room was spacious, and we had a corner room, so 1 window that overlooked other room windows, and the other with a view down Park Avenue. Big TV, great radio / clock, and a really comfortable bed. There was a room service note to say they would change the sheets every 3 days unless we asked them to change more often, but they changed the linens every day anyway. Our bathroom was small, but looked like an original bathroom, which we thought was nice - it was small, but fine for 2 people. Good turndown service - bedside lights are turned on, and the radio is left on low so its almost like youre returning home. Maybe if I were to be picky I could say that the decor was a bit faded, but if we wanted sparkle and modern we would have stayed at the W or the Hyatt. MY parents twin room was large with a gorgeous bathroom, but they did have a problem, and when they spoke to reception they were immediately moved to a suite which was beautiful. Their problem was handled swiftly and professionally - perfect! We didnt find the hotel, the other guests,or the staff stuffy or snobby in the least. There were functions going on every day, and we just marvelled at the management that this took. It was lovely to see people all dressed up in their finery, and yet we didnt feel out of place at all. Some of the reviews had said you would be out of place if you werent dressed up in designer clothes at all times, but I dont see that - I saw people in jeans and trainers, flip flops, and shorts and t shirts just back from running, and no-one batted an eye. Some of the retaurants have a dress code, but thats to be expected, isn't it?! There is a starbucks just to the left of the main doors that opens at 6.30. If you are from the UK, and youre awake before then and need your coffee fix faster, go right out the main doors, turn right at the end and there is another Starbucks 50 yards down which opens earlier! Take a trip up to see the ballroom and the Starlight room - both are amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “Starbucks paper cups and snobby staff”
Reviews.Author: ThenHePackedAndLeft
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful Art Deco lobby! ... it seems to be one of the NYC top sights. Get a coffee from Starbucks located next to the Park Avenue entrance and sit down comfortably in the lobby and enjoy. Afterwards leave the paper cup somewhere, on the stairs for example. The staff is so snobby they won't even notice You (unless You are mentioned on the world's billionaires list), so no problem! ...and You have been able to enjoy the best W=A has to offer - for a reasonable price! There is no reason why You should stay at this hotel: as already mentioned the staff is snobbish and uninterested in serving a guest (however not at the bar!) During my five days stay at the hotel I didn't receive a single smile from a staff member. The rooms are very outdated and depressing. The overall room standard was surprisingly low - even at the higher room category (superior). A very modest turn down service occured every second evening. Bathroom toiletteries (mixed!) where changed once during my stay. In the bar, Sir Henry's, You can expect to find all a tired traveling salesman needs after a long day (however even here the standard was surprisingly low!) ...and of course a good selection of liquors, as well. In brief: once You leave the lobby (although with those paper cups) there are no signs of a world known luxury hotel anywhere - at least not below the Waldorf Towers floors.

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel, but no 5-star”
Reviews.Author: lotsofhotelstays
Reviews.Content: I very much looked forward to staying at the W=A given that I had heard that they had refurbished the hotel. The common areas, including the ballrooms have been cleaned up to reflect the original style (classic modern architecture) and, while not my style, they did a nice job. The rooms, however seemed to have been overlooked. Wallpaper seams were exposed in the room and bathrooms. Basic fixtures did not get replaced (i.e., toilet paper holder or smoke alarms that have a kahaki color that comes from plastic getting old) so they looked like a bad Motel 6. And, much of the furniture had clearly not been addressed (e.g., dings and scratches in the wood, backings coming off of the armoires, etc.). The staff was friendly and the food was great, so it is a good place to visit....especially from a historical perspective. But if you are looking for a 5-star hotel, suggest staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anndavies64
Reviews.Content: 3rd May 2008 We have just returned from a week at the Waldrof Astoria, New York. What a fabulous place, without doubt it must be one of the best hotels of its kind in the world. Not a glass and modern minimalistic boring place, but one steeped in history and grandier that you don't find in many places today. When we arrived we were greeted with a very warm welcome from the receptionist, who didn't take long to go through all the details of the booking. Our room was a bit small for a weeks stay, but no problem ,we returned to reception to ask for a bigger room and although they couldn't do anything that day told us that after 3pm the following day they would have a superior room for us to view. After viewing the room we were very pleased indeed and took it straight away. We found all the hotel staff more than happy to answer any questions we asked, The room was cleaned every day and the bedding changed every other day, and turned back every evening. Yes you do find that the hotel is very busy with business people, but thats one of the things you have to put up with as these people and there companies are the ones that are probably keeping this hotel going. No, we didn't find them intimatating as we also saw how pleased some of the were to be in such a lovely hotel, and they to were taking photographs of the lobby and asking passing guests to take a photo of them in the hotel. Please except it as a pleasant experience as we did. How is wish we could go back Ann Davies Swansea

Reviews.Title: “Classic New York Experience”
Reviews.Author: shebuck
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had always wanted to stay in NYC around the holidays so we cashed in some Hilton Honors points and stayed at the Waldorf. The building and lobby are beautiful and dramatic. The location can't be beat for all the mid-town touristy sites. However, the room decor could use some updating but was very richly decorated. We also didn't care much for the clientele - the Waldorf is not necessarily for those who want the best, it's for those who want everyone to know they spent the most. Though we are fairly well off for our age, I felt out of place for not wearing a full-length mink coat or a 10 carat Harry Winston diamond. The staff was also snobbish towards us for not being a member of the New York elite. New York is full of hotels - I'm sure there's another one that also has history and a great location minus the snobbery.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Mannfred
Reviews.Content: Arrived after a long weary flight to find a long line waiting the check-in, which seemed to take an age. The receptionist insisted in going through an extensive briefing (selling) on what was available at extra cost. The room we were assigned, at $514 per night, was not reflective of cost. It's a fine old establishment, but the service level needs review as I found out one evening trying to get a drink at the lobby bar, Sir Henry's, when the bar man informed me that he was extremely busy and asked if I wanted him to "split himself in 3" to get served. I alerted management who did not appear surprised that this had happened. I would recommend a visit, but stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Aging rooms”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeJamey
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 905 for one night 4/26/08. We received a free upgrade to a king room for $299 a night, but our room was not available until after 4pm. Not a huge problem, b/c we left our suitcases with porters and went sightseeing---until the next morning when housekeeping banged on our room door at 8:30am--how is it that the room is not ready until 4pm, but housekeeping starts before 9am? Room service arrived promptly and the portions were adequate. The bed was super comfortable and was turned down. We had a king bed, chair with ottoman, flat screen TV, walk in closet, desk and chair. All in all, it was the largest hotel room we have ever had in NYC. The decor is aging, the carpet was worn around the edges and the draperies were 1960s granny style. All service personnel are polite, welcoming, helpful and sincere. There was a Denzel Washington movie filming at the hotel, which meant that the Park Ave entrance was closed periodically, which made it difficult to hail cabs. The Starbucks is convenient, but a venti nonfat latte cost over $6, almost double the normal fee. We would probably stay at the Waldorf again due to the size of the room and the location, and would expect superior service but a dated room.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: bikkie
Reviews.Content: I booked with a friend for a very special trip (significant birthday) and took one of their experience packages, which was the most truthful thing about the stay, it was an experience. Grubby suite, bed not made (just the sheets straightened, no comforter put on or pillows, but it did mean that they didn't need to do a turn down at night!). Draughty (the maintenance man came at 11pm and put gaffer tape around the windows to stop the draught). Two ancient TVs - why?? - tiny shower room in this suite for 4 (we were fortunately only two and no toiletries. Room not tidied or vaccuumed. The hotel was just faded. 2 concierge on duty for hundreds of people, long queues every day. Expensive, not worth it and I wouldn't bother, in fact I so wouldn't bother that they have given me one night in a 'luxury suite' and I am certainly 'not bothered' to return. Good if you want a Starbucks on site as they have one in the basement so you can sit on the stairs with your paper cup and eat a muffin out of a paper bag - nice.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: tessa1978uk
Reviews.Content: Okay, after reading a few reviews on here prior to going, I had mixed emotions about what we were going to expect at the Waldorf. I, myself, am a Travel Agent within the UK so I have been trained to always go somewhere with an open mind. The check-in was speedy and perfect however it did go a little down hill from there. The room we were given was 'dated' and not what I'd expect at such a famous and well recommended hotel. As we were there for 'tourist 5-days' we always felt out of place within the hotel as it was mainly full of buisness people carrying briefcases and chatting loudly on their mobile phones in posh Armarni suits. We were (more than once) looked at like we smelled of dirty poo, even though we were dressed quite smartly. The bad thing is, is that I've booked the Waldorf to stay in for my wedding in May and it was too late to cancel it and find somewhere different. Fair enough, the hotel was in a very good location and if it wasnt for the dated room with a crap view and the nasty stares from the other guests then the stay would of been great. The bonus you have within the hotel is it has a Starbucks inside which is a must for the 'City that never sleeps'. Anyone needed any further info or for recommendations on other hotels in NYC, please feel free to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “A good base in NYC”
Reviews.Author: chr_8
Reviews.Content: Considering what a huge hotel this is, service is remarkably efficient and personalized. Everything we needed or wanted was promptly provided. Our updated room had a nice view of St Barts. Other reviewers have talked about a lack of heat. This certainly was not our experience. Food and drink are not cheap, but considering this is a grand old hotel in New York what do you expect? All in all a good base from which to explore Manhattan

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 Star!!”
Reviews.Author: EST_8
Reviews.Content: Just Came back from a long weekend trip to USA. On the way back from a hotel conference in Las Vegas, we stopped in New York for 4 nights. In Vegas I stayed in The Venetian, stayed in a suite, and it was great as well as the rest of the hotel. When arriving to Waldorf Astoria, they did not have the room that i had requested. BUT they offered to upgrade me to a junior suite for only 100 USD extra per nnight, and i accepted this. When seeing the room i was very disappointed, not really any bigger than any normal hotel room, and in need of refurbishment. As it was late, and i had a dinner appointment that night, i did not have time to waiste complaining to reception. The following morning i was woken up very early by building work outside. This was confirmed by reception....who amazingly admitted they knew this when they upgraded me to this room. I was given another STANDARD room, now on the other side of the hotel. Very small....and I had to call reception again later that day as the water was stuck in my bath! On departure day we checked out before 10 am as we were told. We were offered to store our luggage till we had to leave for JFK. When arriving back in the afternoon to pick up my luggage, I was told to wait outside on Park Avenue where Taxis would be found, and they would bring out my luggage. Well!!!....after waiting 20 minutes, i asked the doorman if he could find out what happened with my luggage, so he went in to find "investigate". As he never came back, after waiting another 15 minutes, i went in to the bell desk AND soon found out that nobody knew where my receip for luggage had gone missing!!!! and nobody came out to tell me....but instead i had to follow somebody down to the garage and luggage room to identify my luggage!!! Just to add to the story, my friend who also had attended the hotel conference in Vegas, also had to request a room change when we arrived to Waldorf Astoria. They might live on their name/brand, but not worth it! Lots of other great hotels in the area!!! E.S

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place - Will be going again.”
Reviews.Author: WorldWondererUk
Reviews.Content: We went on a five night stay to New York (First Time) we had no idea on what to expect. When we arrived underneath the hotel we where helped with the bags from a friendly porter, and directed to the lobby. The lobby itself was very very impressive! Booking in was a breeze with the amount of desks open and with smiling people standing behind them ,was a nice change from England with scowling people :) We had a room on the 13th floor the lifts are alot faster than in the UK i'm pretty sure, we got into the room to find the maid turning down the bed for us(nice touch). The room itself was very clean and tidy the bed was very very comfortable, the bathroom was spotlessly clean! Everywhere in the hotel was just impeccable, no matter where you looked there was cleaners busy! All the staff are excellent and very friendly, the concierge was excellent made our stay effortless as we'd ask for a good resturant and 5 minutes later it would be booked at whatever time we asked for. Location was very central so i couldnt have asked for more from the hotel and when I do go back to New York I know what hotel i'll be booking. New York is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Astoria - OK if you're a "Pretty Woman"?”
Reviews.Author: jd1978
Reviews.Content: Myself and my friend stayed from 9th to 13th April 2008. This was a special trip for our 30th and 60th birthdays so I wanted somewhere we could both enjoy. First impression was it was a great location. Out taxi pulled up at the grand entrance and was then asked to move to a different entrance not once but twice. So at the third attempt we were directed through the scaffolding at the side of the building (now affectionately known as the tradesmans' entrance!) and up to reception where we were advised room was not ready but hey took our mobile and said they would call when it was...no call but we did not mind as we took a great carriage ride around Central Park instead ($34 for 2 of us plus tip) Check in was smooth and girl was very pleasant. Our room (1609) was better than expected having read some reviews prior to departure. It was spacious enough for the 2 of us, although bathroom was a tad small although perfectly serviceable! Plenty of towels and 2 robes provided. Only negative was the shower took ages to get the hot water to come through (they did do some repairs one day so may have been fixing it then?) Using the tradesmans' entrance was to become a regular thing...on 3 separate occasions we were advised that we could not use the front entrance as there were events taking place and they obviously did not want us common folk getting in the way! This got a bit annoying after a while!! One night when it was late and raining we returned...wet and minus our umbrella! We were ignored by the doorman so he could run down the road to the aid of what could only be described as a "pretty woman" character! (incidentally already carrying her own umbrella!!!) It was a quite a picture which will not be forgotten quickly...next time I go I must wear at least Prada/Cartier to get any kind of attention and carry my Amex card of course!! Overall we had a great stay tho' . ideal location, comfortable room and we got a good deal via Greenbee!
