Reviews.Title: “The Wonderful Waldorf....”
Reviews.Author: BrokerPaul
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel to enjoy the history of the Waldorf and it's old world charm. Found the room w/ a Queen bed to be on the small side with an outdated 26' TV set in a large armoire. The staff was very professional and helpful, especially the doormen hailing us a taxi and giving us city tips. Enjoyed dinner at the Bull and Bear restaurant, although overpriced and somewhat darkly lit. You must stay at the Waldorf at least once in this short life. Paul H. - Irvine, CA

Reviews.Title: “Old Titanic”
Reviews.Author: Artist68
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf in March for two nights. I had the opportunity to stay in several high end hotels and I can tell you that I was not impressed. I realized it's NYC and prices are higher but really folks, 20.00 for two eggs any style in the Peacock restaurant for breakfast? Twelve dollars for a bowl of oatmeal (not that we ordered that) Check out the menu on their website, your eyes will roll back in your head. Ok down to the nitty gritty, the room, 17th floor average size and just plain ugly old yellow and brown decor, with a huge armoure that takes up too much room and an old 27 inch regular TV. The beds were terribly uncomfortable, the bedding scratchy white hotel sheets with a 200 lb bed spread that looked like it belonged on one of the beds on the Titanic and flat pillows. The only modern device in the room was the alarm clock that allowed for an Ipod. I could not regulate the heat, it was very hot, the bathroom was really small and there was no exhaust fan. It took 2 minutes before the water came out of the faucet in the tub and then it took at least 8 minutes before any hot water came out. The curtains, again very Titanic and white sheers that looked so dingy I wondered if there had been a fire. The desk is way to small to do any work on. Don't ever book a room that is near the elevator because all you will hear all night is the sound of a 747 taking off down the runway. The website doesn't tell you that there is a Starbucks down stairs. And it does not tell you that it costs 50.00 a day to park your car and an additional 10.00 if you have an SUV. I paid 120.00 bucks for two days OUCH! The lobby is very "grand" and dark, again like an old ship. I will say that when I checked in I found the staff to be very friendly, including the bellmen, the doorman and any man or woman that worked there. Here's a cool fact that the man who checked me in told me when I had advised him that my father stayed there in 1950 for his honeymoon, he asked if he still had that bill? Then went on to tell me if he still had the bill and wanted to stay there, that the Waldorf would honor that price he paid in 1950. If you are going to have to stay in a hotel, don't you want to have the same amenities or even better amenties that you do at home? I suppose if you are a history buff, you might love it

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and Service with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyofFiveNJ
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to New York City to celebrate my 40th birthday. We spent two nights in the Waldorf-Astoria. This hotel embodies old word elegance and charm. I felt like I was in the middle of an old Hollywood movie from the moment I walked into the impressive lobby. This sprawling hotel is also quite luxurious with plush carpets and swag draperies. A bellman greeted our cab as we pulled up to the hotel and our luggage was whisked away by very efficient porters. At check in, we learned that our room probably wouldn't be ready until about 3:00 p.m. The front desk clerk took my husband's cell phone number and said that he would give us a personal call when our room was ready. After receiving the call that our room was ready, we took a ride in the elevator to the 15th floor where our room was located. I must admit, after reading some of the trip reviews posted here, I was a little nervous and scared that I would find mold in the bathroom, peeling wallpaper, or dirty furniture. Thank goodness I did not find any of these things. Instead, we walked down a private corridor to our room and were greeted with a very elegant and clean bedroom. The main room had a King sized bed, a plush chair, a desk and chair, nightstands and an armoire with a large flat screen T.V. on top. Off of the bedroom was a dressing room with another plush chair, a small table, two mirrored his and her wardrobe closets, and a vanity area with stool. The bathroom had French doors and was done in black and tan. There were lots of nice details such as silver waste baskets, a silver tissue holder, complimentary magazines relevant to the NYC area, and plush robes. The molding and light fixtures were very pretty and added character to the room. Shortly after settling into our room there was knock on the door. Because it was my birthday, the hotel sent up a birthday card and a silver tray complete with fresh fruit, a small loaf cake, and a large bottle of Spring water. It was services like this that made our stay so unforgettable. We ate in Peacock Alley and Oscar's while we were there. I ordered a steak in the Peacock Alley and was disappointed to find that it was full of fat and quite tough. The service in the restaurant was top notch and the waiter quickly noticed my distress. The manager came over and said that we would not be charged for my entree and would I like the chef to grill me another steak? They also provided my husband and I with complimentary flutes of champagne in honor of my birthday. My husband was very pleased with his meal and gave it a thumb's up. Since the service was so wonderful, the unfortunate steak incident was quickly forgotten. We had breakfast both mornings in Oscars. They offer a decent breakfast buffet which was complimentary to us since my husband in a Hilton Diamond member. The location of this hotel is very nice. Walk two blocks and you are right at Saks Fifth Avenue and across the street from Rockefeller Center. You are within walking distance of Central Park, great shopping on and off Fifth Avenue (including Bloomingdales), and Times Square. Cab service was very easy to catch from the front of the hotel. The hotel assists guests with finding a cab. The bellman always opened the door when the cab pulled back up to the hotel which gives you a nice "welcome home" feeling. One thing I did find strange was that the conditioner, soaps, and moisturizer were all from the same English brand but the shampoo was Neutrogena. They did not refill the soaps or shampoo between cleanings of the room. We did enjoy the turn down service each night because they also pulled down all the window shades and closed the curtains. We did not find the room to be too noisy considering that we were staying in such a central section of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Famous hotel, but a little dated”
Reviews.Author: trumptonfireman
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf does live up to its reputation, although in parts, it is becoming rather dated. The staff were the friendliest and most helpful I have met in a hotel to date. The lobby area is very exclusive, and shows why the Waldorf has the reputation it has. The room was very good, and the decor reflected the upmarket nature of the hotel, however, the bathroom was dated, and the carpet was showing signs of wear. The shower head also looked cheap and It would not stay up on its own. The elevators/lifts also took a long time to arrive at the floor (though they arrive quickly in the lobby). On one occasion, we waited 10 minutes, then decided to take the stairs instead from the 9th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: eastridingowl
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel for a seven-day New York experience and chose the Waldorf for its name,and despite seeing some indifferent reviews on this site. We need not have worried; the stay was great. The service from the hotel was absolutely first class, and the rooms (on the cheapest tariff) were spacious and well maintained. We even stayed for breakfast every day- something we had not planned to do- as we found the buffet so good. Another bonus was the ease with which we could access city attractions, as we were easily within walking distance of Times Square, Broadway, MOMA and Cental Park. A super holiday at a super hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: Blondieq
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights over the last weekend in March and had a fantastic time. The photographs do not do justice to the real thing. It is old fashioned but absolutley fabulous. The service is second to none and the best my sister has experienced and she has stayed in other hotels in New York over a dozen times over the years. We paid a bit extra for a superior room but got a good discount. The room was very large with 2 king size beds and a walk in wardrobe and beautiful marble bathroom. You will be bowled over by the architecture and stunning flower displays. The rooms do not have tea and coffe making facilites but there is a Starbucks in the main entrance that we used. A good tip if you havent been to NYC before is to take advice from the concierge with regard to restaurants as some look decidely ropey from the outside but fantastic when you get in. We had great meals in Little Italy and China Town. We also booked Empire State building on the internet and got a far better deal than if we paid on the day (plus you can jump the queue) We went to BB Kings for brunch on Sunday with the Harlem Gospel singers and had a great time. This was also booked online as all the shows at BB Kings were sold out for the 4 days we were there. The pace in New York is frantic and all the people we met were friendly and helpful without exception. The key is to plan what you want to do but be flexible according to the weather. Tickets you buy online are not date and time specified which allows you to make the most of good weather and shop when bad weather! Best times to visit attractions seem to be early before 9am or after 6pm. We visited Top of the Rock at 11pm and it was deserted - fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: DotandJim
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as I love the film Coming to America and it's where the king stayed!! I did not expect great things as the reviews weren' t great. I was pleasantly surprised as we were upgraded to a suite with a dressing room living room and kitchen. Room service was expensive but well presented. Try the sunday morning brunch it's to die for. Great Location good for a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: Gold007
Reviews.Content: I didn't think the rooms were anything special. Classic old money New York. There are a lot of more exciting places to stay. I ate dinner at the steakhouse and my steak was poorly cooked and lacking flavor With all of that said, the history of the hotel is amazing and everyone should stay at the Waldorf at least once in their lifetime

Reviews.Title: “At the Waldorf.... March 24-26”
Reviews.Author: Chocokide
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love the Waldorf. I had set my expectations accordingly i.e. low, changed in a few large bills for smaller bills to tip everyone we came across and I had even made sure not to wear blue jeans at the Waldorf=Astoria so I could take in the historic hotel and feel one with my environment. Unfortunately after the front desk, service pretty much went down hill. I remember Lauren checked us in and she was quite nice giving us the option of two rooms to choose from and even supplied us with a map of NYC, complimentary water and a verbal overview of the hotels restaurants. The room (1727) was nice enough, pretty clean and I could find almost no fault with the room, loads of hot water, working quiet heater, no inside or outside noise. The lotion that the staff leaves from FRESH is top-notch. Unfortunately at the Waldorf apparently the doormen are too busy doing other things (standing around looking Waldorf=Astoriaish) to hold open doors. At the Waldorf bell hops are too busy (talking about other guests broken luggage) to take your bags and just leave you standing around feeling foolish in front of the hellhop desk. At the Waldorf cleaning staff never fully make your bed, but instead leave the bedspread and shams folded in the room on the luggage rack for your entire two night stay. At the Waldorf's Bull and Bear Restaurant where one soda, one drink and dessert run $50 the staff is far too busy to provide your table with a table cloth or service of any kind. At the Waldorf you will be left to fight off black town cars sent over by the staff to take you to the airport. The WA even has a sign inside suggesting you only take yellow checker cabs, so why an employee would send a black town car over to it's guests is beyond me. If you want to stay here, you are going to do it no matter what you read. It's not horrible, but I just say make sure you know why you want to stay here and that it's not because you think you're going to have some super four star treatment by the staff of the Waldorf=Astoria.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in great city”
Reviews.Author: gypsyjetter
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel itself is old, the room we had was recently remodeled & better than expected. Flat screen tv, updated bathroom, and larger than most NY rooms. Friends stayed on another floor and their room decor was older, not recently updated, yet larger than our room, no flat screen tv, but a huge dressing room and large marble bathroom. The hotel staff was friendly, turndown service was great as was doormen & bell desk. The hotel sundry store is lacking, but there's other DR drugstores nearby or street corner vendors for a cheaper drink/snack. The lobby is beautifully decorated. Location is great for shopping in midtown, 5th Ave, walking to Time Square, theatre district, and MoMa. I will stay here again. Room Service & restaurants are expensive, but exptected in this area & this hotel. Quality is good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jessicarenwick
Reviews.Content: After being surprised for with a Christmas present of a fully booked trip to New York, I was straight onto tripadvisor to check out the Waldorf but slightly worried after reading the reviews. When I arrived at the hotel everything from the bell boy taking our luggage, to the amazing lobby, right up to our huge room, they all far exceeded my expectations. The Waldorf Astoria a hotel of movies. Old World New York has been sadly mistaken in previous reivews for shabby and it is far from this. IT IS OLD WORLD, the New York style that Sinatra and co would have known. They have kept the hotel true to its original style. The amazing main foyer is something to experience, treat yourself to cocktails accompaniend by free nibbles of olives or fancied up bread sticks and music by the house piano player. Admire the supersized flower display like none I have ever seen before and people watch, see the real new yorker have meetings here. Our room was amazing, we paid for the grade above standard and were amazed at the sheer size of the room. There was a massive super king bed, 2 walk in wardrobes. THe bed was incredably comfortable and there was a turndown service every evening. We got engaged while we were there and the hotel were aware of this, we arrived back that evening to find a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries with a card from the hotel. The hotel is in a great location, you are in walking distance of lots of major attractions and some bus tours stop right outside the hotel. Definately would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking Hotel. Good Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Striker54
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a quadruple room (two double beds) on the 9th floor of the Waldorf for 6 nights in March. Check in was fast and courteous. The Receptionist wasn't overly friendly or interested in us but that suited us quite well as we just wanted to get to our room. We'd had a long and bumpy flight and been terrorised by the rudest little man I've ever met at immigration in JFK. Anyway. The room was a good size, very clean and comfortable. I had been worried by previous reviews mentioning the shabby decor but although it did look a little tired and dated in places the wonderful comfortable beds, walk in closet and fluffy towels made up for that. The bathroom was also slightly dated but the shower was great and the toiletries were replenished daily. There was a good hairdryer in the room and an iron with ironing board. The only things missing were tea and coffee making facilities. I know Americans don't drink much tea but this was an international hotel and I go a bit mad without my tea. The staff were helpful and polite and I did feel a little bit special despite it being such a large hotel. This was very welcome because outside of the hotel almost all the New Yorkers I met were very rude - something I found gobsmacking in a city where the world and his wife wants a tip for their "good" service. I only had two real problems with the hotel. Firstly, the lighting in the bathroom was somehow rigged to make you look like you'd been dead 4 weeks - or feel like you wish you'd been dead 4 weeks. I've never felt so ugly! Secondly, the entire hotel gives out electric shocks constantly and is filled with the sight of people leaping back from light switches and elevator doors. It did make us laugh at first but when you've had your 9th shock of the day and start debating with your friends who is going to draw the short straw and have to touch a door nob then it gets a little bit irritating. However, these are minor points and if you can get a good price via the internet then I recommend the Waldorf because of it's location, cleanliness and peace (the lobby is often very busy but once upstairs in our room we never heard a sound from another room or from outside). I wouldn't pay the full prices asked for if you book directly. We didn't eat in any of the restaurants as we'd heard they were expensive but did enjoy some ultra strong but wonderful cocktails in the lobby one afternoon. You can sit and guzzle them while listening to piano music and watching the world walk by - very nice. I liked this hotel and loved the bed which I could have lived in quite happily!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: timian
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in a great corner room with twin beds (3 persons) No heating in bathroom, but otherwise very good. Very good service all over hotel, but also very expensive bars and restaurants. Eat outside for breakfast : "Burger Heaven" on 49th, and great thin Italian pizza at "Angelos" 2 av., or at "Dockers" in the neigbourhood. The atmosphere is worth everything at this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and in need of some TLC”
Reviews.Author: mandy-must-travel
Reviews.Content: We went on a short break with our baby and decided on booking a traditional NY hotel. The location is absolutely perfect for shopping and seeing the sights and you can get most places on foot. Taxi's were easy to get hold of and we felt comfortable and safe the whole time we were there. The hotel lobby is grand and very large and you have to get in a long line to queue up for reception. It moved fast but it felt odd and unpersonal. The room did not have a safe, there is however a safety deposit area behind the reception. Again with so many guests, at times you had to queue to get your belongings. Having a pushchair was awkward as there are 2 entrances to the hotel (it's big) and we kept going the wrong way, leading us to either bumping or carrying the buggy down stairs. The room we got was very small and tired and hardly any room for a cot. The heavy furnishings and drapes were not uplifting and as the weather was torrential rain it was not a great place to be. Everywhere in the hotel was packed and we had to venture out for food as the room was too cramped for room service. Breakfast was very nice and again always busy, however the staff were always friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Our room was close to the lift shaft, which was good in that we didn't have to walk miles to our room, but on the other hand the noise was eerie. We asked for a kettle to warm baby milk, but they didn't supply such things and as room service took too long we went out and bought our own kettle. I am sure there are much better hotels in NY with a good location and I would definitely look harder to find a better one the next time I go back to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wow wow wow - we wish we were still there!!”
Reviews.Author: LittleWitchlet
Reviews.Content: Well, we've been back for three days now, and I am still waking up hoping to be back in that beautiful, plush, clean and elegant room. We stayed at the Waldorf Astoria for 5 nights in all, and it was the best hotel stay I have ever had. Staying at the Waldorf isn't just somewhere you come back to in order to sleep - it is an experience you will never forget. We were filled with awe every day with the splendour and attention to detail. The staff were very friendly, helpful and eager to please. The whole place was spotless and, for us, everything in the room worked fine. The bed was HUGE!! With masses of pillows and beautiful sheets, it was a dream to sleep in, and put our bed at home to shame. We had a large TV with plenty of channels, a mini bar (which we didn't dare even open!!), a very comfy sofa and easy chair around an elegant glass coffee table, and an abundance of lamps all around the room. Next to the bed was a top of the range alarm clock/radio - with an iPod docking station built in, which was a nice touch, we thought. The bathroom was large, with fabulously opulent oversized taps and shower fittings. The bath was DEEP, so you could really soak away a day' worth of walking in it. The toiletries were quality and smelled wonderful - and were replenished when even a little bit had been used. The sink area was between the bathroom and the main suite, and had a large, well lit mirror over it. There were two closets - one in the sink area/room, and one in the entrance hall to the main suite. We also had a lovely little kitchen room, with a sink and an excellent (and very cold) fridge complete with a freezer section, which enabled us to bring food back to our room that we had bought in local minimarts. All in all, the hotel was a fabulous place to stay, and even for us with a 19 month old daughter (who was provided with an excellent cot with linen and accessories - all very clean) it was a pleasant and very enjoyable stay. We would recommend a stay there to anyone who would like to experience old New York. Full marks to the Waldorf Astoria!!

Reviews.Title: “Oh my God!!!”
Reviews.Author: ClaireinCork
Reviews.Content: Wow....just back after 4 nights in the W.A. I cannot but give this hotel 10 out of 10. It was truly exceptional in every way. We had a divine suite, which we never asked for, and each and every member of staff combined to make this one of the truly memorable trips of a lifetime. A special thanks to Sarah in safety deposit who was a daily treat to meet!!Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “One of the greats!”
Reviews.Author: PTD
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Great restaurant if you can get a table. Staff helpful and great location

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf - A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: vacationhat
Reviews.Content: Just returned yesterday from New York City. My husband, daughter and I stayed 5 nights at the Waldorf Astoria. The hotel is a great choice for a number of reasons. The service is excellent. The rooms are well appointed and very clean. The hotel location is ideal. And, the price was right. This is the second time that we have stayed here and it was great both times. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not At All What They Advertise Shabby Run Down”
Reviews.Author: difstages
Reviews.Content: reserved here with great expectations. Viewed wonderful photos on the website, called the hotel to confirm the rooms were renovated. We checked in and the room was small, very dumpy, very dingy. The bathroom was horrible and was last remodeled i the late 70's considering the tacky chrome and mirror theme. Very old in wall air conditioner in the bathroom. Staff was great but that's about it. Save your money, you can stay in the same kind of dump for alot less!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicola3
Reviews.Content: From the outside the hotel looks like a throw back from a 1940's film, it is beautiful. Inside they have managed to maintain the wonderful period features. When we arrived the taxi stopped outside one of the entrances that doesn't open until evening! therefore we had to walk around the side of the hotel to another door. This door had no doorman and there were no directions of where to go to reception, so we had to find our own way. Check-in took a little time, my partner had reserved a junior suite and it seemed to take a while to locate an available one, although the reception staff were very nice. No bell boy came to take our suitcases although the offer was there if we wished! The room itself was beautiful and spacious, however i would have expected a separate shower for a hotel and room of this calibre and we had a view of the rooms opposite. For such a large hotel the staff were friendly and professional but sometimes a little distant, which sadly is what you tend to received when staying in such a large international hotel. A thoroughly enjoyable stay in a wonderful hotel. Room service was very good, although the morning tea was vile. The hotel is a good central location for Central Station (10 mins walk) and Time Square (30 mins walk), the shopping centres are a maximum of 30 mins walk away.

Reviews.Title: “It's the Waldorf=Astoria, and it's splendid”
Reviews.Author: Thamyris
Reviews.Content: I stayed the last week in February in Room 922 for a conference. This is the legendary Waldorf=Astoria, after all, so before the trip, I checked the negative reviews here for things to be wary of. I need not have bothered, for I had that rarest of hotel experiences - feeling sorry to leave at the end. What about some of the most common previous criticisms? 1. Rooms too small: My room was fine, 20 sq. meters. 2. Musty, old smells: The room and corridors were not scented, but smelled fresh and crisply clean. 3. Decrepit heaters. My room heater was indeed an old design, but quiet and extremely efficient. The electronic temperature control worked perfectly (It was -4C outside).. 4. Not "value for money": Maybe not, if you consider only the high cost of a bed here. But I was aware of enjoying every moment in the hotel, not because of the room, but for the elegant hallways, the beautiful lobby, the historic ambiance, photographs, and mementos (including Cole Porter's piano in the Park Lane lobby), plus the bustle of people coming and going and meeting by the old clock in the main lobby. You do also pay for the Waldorf=Astoria New York experience - and it's worth it. 5. Offhand staff: Unobtrusive, maybe, but I liked that - and friendly, without the "have a nice day" American fakery. I got to test the reception staff when I found my check-out date was incorrect, a day too early. (Not the hotel's fault, my office screwed the booking). I expected reception to find me another hotel, or at best another room, but not at the lower conference rate I had checked in on - since the place was clearly booked solid. It may have taken 20 minutes juggling bookings on his computer, but the receptionist managed to keep me in my room for another day. It was at a higher price (which was OK), but then his supervisor stepped in from behind him and told him to keep me on the cheaper rate and she would actually enter on the computer that the hotel had misbooked my dates. I have never experienced individual service like that in any major hotel. My conclusion - this is a hotel to fall in love with. It was beautiful, elegant, friendly, a pleasure to walk around. My room was as comfortable and friendly as home, the superb breakfast and cheery staff at Oscar's restaurant made waking up early every morning a real pleasure. Complaints? 1. The room Internet rate of $15 a day is a ripoff. But the wi-fi in the lobby is free, and my room was covered by a couple of independent wi-fi transmissions of intermittent quality. 2. The usual mini-bar scam. Ignore it. I found several small shops nearby and loaded up with snacks and a bottle of Scotch for around the price of one mini from the bar. 3. Amazing, this - no coffee maker, water heater in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Matt-7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights with my girlfriend mainly for a shopping trip and enjoyed the stay. It is a large, grand hotel and we received a good rate booking direct with Hilton. On the plus side, the lobby is great looking and the rooms are very comfortable compared to most 4* hotels in new york. They are also a decent size. On the negative, the hotel is a business hotel and is very very large so there are lots of suited people all day long. (I was on holiday so wanted to stay away from work). There are 10 people serving at check-in who are busy all day. Lots of conferences are held at the hotel and you get the feeling that you are not one of their important guests and therefore deserve less attention - in room movies didn't work so we called down and were put on hold for 10mins before we gave up. Only a minor hiccup but noticeable because it is the Waldorf Astoria and I'm sure if we were a guest at the conference where the Duke of Westminster was speaking they would have treated us differently. All in all though a good hotel to stay in as it's only a short walk to most places like Bloomingdales etc. I would recommend it for the experience but in all honesty would not stay again as there are better hotels in New York which have better service and I personally prefer staying a bit closer to time square so that everything is on the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Oldie but a goodie”
Reviews.Author: yaltachick
Reviews.Content: Fabulous stay at the Waldorf. Try and get the Towers if you can - it's so worth the money. Will happily go back at any time. Try and note the photos on the walls - it's an indication of how much history is actually there. Catering and Events department is fabulous. Much to rave about. Will go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Huge disapointment”
Reviews.Author: cornish007
Reviews.Content: Remember 'Hotel'? The TV series. Was it James Brolin who played the manager? That's what i was expecting at the Waldorf. I thought it would be welcoming and have the ambience of a very large family run hotel. Not in the slightest. There didn't seem much customer service after check in. No welcoming faces, no friendly staff. I guess it's because its a tourist destination. There are an abundance of tourists with cameras snapping away, but they don't actually stay there. They just get in the way of those that do. Anyways, i had a suite. It was tired. It was sad. If it were a dog i would have shot it. In fact it smelt like a dog too. The wallpaper was peeling, the windows locked so you couldn't get fresh air. In truth the hotel was never going to be more than a crash pad. but even the piano bar lacked any real character. Souless, that's the word. I got drunk and fell asleep fully clothed. Wouldn't rush back. i imagine there is much better available at a cheaper price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: linguica
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Waldorf for 2 nights in NY while there to see a couple of Broadway shows. Have been reading all the reviews in the past months leading up to our trip and was a little worried about our stay here. It turned out to be perfect! We loved the hotel, its location, the service, the breakfast (only meals we ate here). The only problem we encountered was at the check-in (unfortunately). We had a gentleman who insisted on putting us in a small room w/2 double beds w/no extra sitting area, couch, etc. My husband is a Hilton Gold Card Member and whenever we travel to Hilton hotels they are very accommodating. We were w/our 15 yr. old who has allergies and this was documented at the time we made our reservation. I believe it was because we were using our Hilton points to reserve the room. I had called numerous times and was told that in the middle of February it is their slow season and there shouldn't be any problem w/an upgrade. He began to chastise me about the allergy problem, saying I should have made note of this prior to check in, which I had, more than once. Since my husband is 6'3" and a very early riser I asked for a cot for my daughter if we couldn't have a bigger room. Even being a Hilton Honors Member he wanted to charge us $35/ a night. I finally agreed to the regular room w/no cot and when we were brought up to the room it was very small compared to other Hiltons we have stayed in. The problem was that the beds were pushed up against the wall with a desk in between them so there was no logical way to get out the bed. If I had been travelling w/just my daughter or one other person we would have been able to make do but because there were 3 of us in this room for 3 days I knew it would be a problem. My husband ended up asking to speak to one the managers and she corrected the problem immmediately. They put us on a lower floor but in a 2 room suite - 1 queen bed and bath and a living room area w/ a fold out couch. This was perfect for us and not sure why the person at check-in would not have given this to us as it was requested on all our check-in information The manager who moved us also sent up a box of chocolates which was a very nice gesture. The rest of our stay was wonderful and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to NYC because of its location and such a beautiful hotel. Our room (both rooms) were extremely clean, maid service was 2x a day. The hallways always smelled vey clean with a nice fragrance (not sure what they used but would love to find out). We had great service at breakfast and enjoyed the buffet. Not sure what the other reviews are talking about in the cleanliness or condition of property because that was not our experience. I would recommend changing rooms if that was the case for anyone. Other than our inital experience checking in it was great and we plan on staying there again on any future visits to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome beyond words!”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunkies8078
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? My husband took my daughter and I here for a valentines surprise, and wow we were surprised! I have been to New York before but have never stayed in such a wonderful historic hotel! We had a room on the Astoria level, and it was breathtaking! Stunning furniture, and the view was awe inspiring! The concierge were all incredibly nice, and were very sweet to our daughter. I found the beds to be very sleep inducing, which is rare for me, because I'm a picky sleeper. The bathrooms were amazing and very nice decor. The building itself was incredible, and if you are like me, and have only seen this hotel in movies, well let me tell you..YES its that stunning in real life. Don't hesitate to stay here, not one bit. The location is perfect for all your needs, and honestly one of the best hotel experiences we have ever had!

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend the Waldorf=Astoria”
Reviews.Author: TheHitman69
Reviews.Content: I have never been so well look after in a hotel before, I highly recomend this hotel. This is one of the most famous hotels in the world, yes you can find cheaper hotels in New York but it is well placed for many attractions as well as the subway and sometimes it really is worth spoiling yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf, good, but should be great”
Reviews.Author: LeedsGlobalman
Reviews.Content: A beautiful Art Deco hotel in a great location. To me this hotel should be classy,luxurious, and provide great service. It doesn't quite live up to its billing. The communal parts of this hotel are stunning, BUT, the hotel is let down by Big ques at check in Very busy lobby and main foyer Indifferent service Some of the finishing , i.e. paintwork,wallpaper and furnishings in my room and corridors were a bit shabby and cheap compared to the elegant bars,and reception areas. It looks like Hilton Hotels the owners have decided to pitch this hotel at the well off tourist, it is not luxurious and elegant as say the Ritz, Paris or The Dorchester, London. It does have a good selection of bars and dining options, expensive but not extortionate,14 -24 USD for cocktails. Had a great meal in the Bull and Bears restaurant in the basement (£60 per head inc bottle of wine), but the service was indifferent. My junior suite cost me £280 per night (pic attached). I enjoyed my stay, but I think better rooms/service is available elsewhere in NY for this price. But, it is the Waldorf, and I enjoyed being there.

Reviews.Title: “40th Birthday Treat”
Reviews.Author: AnEnglishPerson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Waldorf Astoria in Jan 2008 for a long weekend. For style and grandeur, it is a fabulous hotel and was ideally located for everything that we wanted to do. The hotel offers everything in terms of service that you could need and the staff are extremely efficient at everything. eg. arranging theatre tickets at an hour's notice. If we stayed in New York again, we would probably stay somewhere a little more relaxed as the hotel was really only used as a base. We did not eat in the hotel at all. Downsides: (1) the general standards of cleanliness in the room left a lot to be desired and it looked like it needed a good spring clean. (2) The staff were a bit poncey. This hotel is not suitable for children (they might be frowned upon!) so thank goodness we left ours at home with their grandparents. The Phillips'/Hampshire/England

Reviews.Title: “A classic”
Reviews.Author: Bibssy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf for our honeymoon. We chose it because of it's status and history. The hotel lobby was lovely but the room was a disappointment. The room was on a low floor with absolutely no view, as it faced onto a stone wall. We specifically asked for a high floor and a view. Understandable if these were not available however. Maybe my expectations were too high but I thought we would be treated especially well as it was our honeymoon, we didn't even receive a 'congratulation's'. Food was not good value for money. We still had a wonderful honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “A grand old lady”
Reviews.Author: steviemacHarrogate
Reviews.Content: I treated my wife to her 50th birthday in New York and we stayed in the Waldorf. I had read some of the reviews and cannot understand how anyone can crticise this beautiful, historic and elegant hotel. The staff were so friendly and helpful. The restaurants and bars in the hotel are top class. You can feel the history as you sit in the foyer or Sir Harry's bar and watch the world go by. Our room overlooked Park Avenue on the 13th floor. It was spacious, clean and had a huge plasma tv. The bed was turned down each evening and to say that the bed was comfortable is an understatement. After walking round New York all day it was just what we needed. The Waldorf is only 2 blocks away from the Rockerfella centre and Grand Central Station. We did the Gray Line bus tours (a must) and each tour operator commented on the Waldorf as the best hotel in New York. There is a hop on/off stop outside the Waldorf's front door. The food is good if a little expensive, but the location makes up for that. 2 blocks away the restaurants are half the price. However, you just have to sample the ambiance of the Bull and Bear, Oscars and Sir Harrys Bar. Try Bobby Vanns Steakhouse, within 5 minutes of the Waldorf. You must sit and watch the ice skaters at the Rockerfella centre and enjoy a slice of Pizza at "TWO BOOTS" pizza parlour inside the food concourse. $3.75 for a huge slice! The Waldorf is within walking distance of Central Park, 5th Avenue, Bloomingdales etc and The Empire State Building. All in all a fantastic hotel in a fantastic City !!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel, poor service - not a 5-star luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveller123London
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Waldorf Astoria is an experience that shouldn't be missed. The interior of the hotel is spectacular, including not only the ground floor lobby area but also the ballroom, etc. I can't imagine that there are many hotels in the world that match the Waldorf Astoria in terms of elegance and history. I was expecting the hotel to have more of a "faded grandeur" feel but it didn't. The room we stayed in was also very nice - large for NY standards and well decorated. Where the hotel really disappoints is in the service. The poor service is evident in virtually every aspect of the hotel - upon checking in we couldn't help notice how inexperienced the reception staff were, then in the room the key to the minibar didn't work, the lamp wasn't near an outlet so couldn't be plugged in, there was no needle and thread or shoe shine kit in the room, there were no glasses in the room, the bellman staff were rude and aggressive re: tips and the luggage delivery/collection procedure is set up so you have to tip several times, the list goes on. Overall, this is not a 5-star hotel in terms of service but well worth staying at particularly if you can get a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: wilvey
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny and dingy - almost creepy. The heat didn't work and the shower was lukewarm. Don't bother staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: RCRGator
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf is a beautiful building and has a certain elegance about it. The staff is extremely attentive and nice. There are some downsides though...the heat in my room didn't work....in January. I was at a business dinner and didn't get back until late and got in bed and did not confirm the heat wasn't working until about 2:30 in the morning- at this time I didn't want to change rooms so I didn't call the desk. In the Waldorf's defense, I never made a complaint so they could not respond. I, however, was freezing! Overlooking the lack of heat in my room, it was a nice stay. The rooms are not overly luxurious but nice and quant. I'm not sure if I would stay here again but I would definitely visit the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “old, dusty and small”
Reviews.Author: Foodmaster68
Reviews.Content: Old, dusty, and small - that was my room! Carpet peeling off the floor, mediocre furnishings, and no space in the dimly lit, old room. Even the lobby was covered in dust and I started sneezing horribly. We arrived and not a single bellman or doorman was there, so we had to search for one. The check in line was way too long, and our desk clerk couldn't answer a simple question about the area. This place is NOT worth it, and if you like updated, clean luxury hotels avoid this place. The bathroom was so tiny I could barely use it! There is no in room safe, no umbrella; the touches of luxury just didnt exist. I was hugely disappointed with both the service and the room, and would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: sissynut
Reviews.Content: Here is the e.mail my husband sent to the General Manager of the Waldorf Astoria at the end of our stay: Dear Sir, As one who spends average 3 nights per week in hotels all over the world, I was excited by the prospect of taking my wife on a birthday trip to your 5 star establishment. It is with huge disappointment therefore that I write to say the hotel fell well short of my expectations, and fails to stand comparison with most less prestigous hotels. Firstly, the room 1064 is so noisy we were obliged to use ear plugs at night! There is a constant roar, akin to a wind tunnel, which is supplimented with real wind noise, traffic, emergency vehicles and garbage trucks! Why in the days of double or even triple glazing such noise should disturb ones sleep, is beyond me! Particularly when you provide such comfortable mattresses. In checking to see if the windows were not closed completely I touched glass and frame and my hands turned black! The net draped are also not very clean! When the maid raises the roller blinds, the cords are too short to be regained without standing on the desk! The general state of the decor is tired, the handbasin cracked, the bathroom door seen better days, the cornice around the room poorly patched! And yet, the room has no disposable slippers, no safe, no sewing kit, no tea or coffee making equipment. The decor around the elevators on floor 10 is badly held together with duct-tape! When we left the room one day at 08.30 and toured the city, upon returning at 16.30 the room had not been serviced, and we were obliged to go out again while it was serviced! The toiletries which exist on entry to room, mouthwash, cotton buds etc are not replenished once used! So had to go out and buy our own! On Saturday evening when I called down to order a Sunday paper, I was told "we don't do papers at weekends!" when I said it was part of the room service breakfast menu, the guy checked and then came back to the phone and said "what paper you want!". All the bars and restaurants (except Oscars breakfast service) are over manned with numerous lazy, disinterested and slow staff. And finally, when I checked in, you offer HH card holders 2 free bottles of water! Whoa! 2 people staying 4 nights, and you're so generous! Better you don't bother! Needless to say, I won't be coming back! Yours faithfully,

Reviews.Title: “Rooms in need of a good cleaning”
Reviews.Author: travelmum415
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf=Astoria guest rooms are in dire need of updating and a good cleaning. The wallpaper is peeling and has been "repaired" with masking tape. A strange brown spotting is along the bathroom wall --- mold, perhaps? I can tell a picture was once hanging across from the bed, but now all that remains are two large holes and pencil marks. The carpet is frayed and the dust in the corners and on the baseboards is truly gross. I know this is a historic property, but it is too bad that the graciousness is saved for the lobby and common areas and the rooms themselves have been left to deteroriate. If you like cleanliness and modern amenities, stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Kings,Presidents and you”
Reviews.Author: LADWhitePlains
Reviews.Content: Once a year, my wife and I spend a Friday night at the Waldorf to attend a social function held there. We have found the rooms comfortable and clean, but certainly not the most up-to-date. You will find heavy bathrobes for your use, and no shortage of pillows, towels and blankets, unlike less expensive hotels. Although the hotel has valet parking we use a website to locate more moderate priced parking and found it a block and a half way on 50th street, just east of the hotel. Since we had tickets to a Broadway show on Saturday, we checked out at noon and left our bags (free of charge!) with the hotel luggage area located in the basement near the automobile entrance. What a pleasure. We walked (15 to 20 minutes) to the theater, then picked up our bags on the way back to the car. The magical part is however unmistakable. Kings and Queens and the world's leaders have stayed here. This is, after all, the Waldorf Astoria in New York City. What more can you say?

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull hotel that shines in the shadows of a city of hotels!!”
Reviews.Author: lip89
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife back in 2004 and forgot to write a review but have to say it was one of my better stays in a hotel. this place shines like a jewel in the city full of hotels and trendy spots and it caters to the real upper crust traveler with equisite taste. The whole night from check in to check out was spectacular. The looby is something out of fantasy and just looks the part, really decadent and top notch. the staff is friendly for a 5 star place and helpful. this being part of the Hilton family of hotels, it is apparent they want you to return. The rooms are sort of run of the mill, small in size and all the top shelf ammenities. Hallways are dimly lit and historic looking. It is the only way to stay if you are visiting the city. I was there for one night but wish I had more time. Make sure to book well in advance because it sells out and make sure to take a loan out before you go, this place is not cheap and there are reasons it has been there for a while!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here once for the experiance”
Reviews.Author: hdblue
Reviews.Content: I have been a hilton honors member for a long time but have never stayed at the Waldorf Astoria before, Hilton's "Flagship" hotel. I was a bit nervous to book at this hotel based on the reviews but I figured I should at least stay at this hotel once for the experience. Check in was very nice. Like the other reviews say, the lobby is beautiful and the staff was very helpful. I am a diamond member at hilton at they have a separate diamond reception desk to check you in which is very nice, I wish other Hilton hotels had this. The diamond desk rep was very nice and gave me a large room overlooking park ave with a bathroom that was actually bigger then the bedroom. While we are talking about the bathroom, let me say it was the best part of the room. The bathroom in this room was huge and had a very nice tub/shower and lots of room with a huge changing area. The room came with two robes and slippers which was nice and if you are an HH member you get free water from the mini-bar. Unfortunately that is where the amazement ends. The bedroom, while not bad, was not what I would expect from a flagship hotel. The TV was about as old as the hotel was and the furnature and fixtures are showing their age. The architecture in the room is very impressive with vaulted ceilings, arched walkways and a huge arch above the tub. The ceiling fixtures are classic, but the old wallpaper and peeling paint really take away from it. The carpet is quite old and faded and the bed is actually not as nice as most hilton bed I stay in. I realize that this is a classic hotel and very old but really, does it take that much effort to keep it up, they manage it at the plaza just fine, and its a shame because honestly, even though its a classic hotel and the service was wonderful I would most likely not return. Another detractor from the hotel is the price gouging that continually gets you. Room service for a burger, coke and desert was $70, parking was $55, internet was $23 a day, you will not eat in the hotel for under $70 a person no matter what restaurant you choose. I might not have minded the prices so much if they were re-investing that money into making the hotel as classy as they would like to think it was. I would recommend staying at the hotel once for the experiance of staying at a classic hotel, then find a better one in NY, there are many.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrsc0
Reviews.Content: had lovely spacious room,staff very helpfull,fantastic floral display in lobby,would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, but was great for us”
Reviews.Author: grisventre
Reviews.Content: We had a great 2 night stay at the WA in a 2 bedroomed suite. We came to the WA to get married and used the lounge (parlor) as the venue for our small wedding, which really suited our purposes and was both a great venue and a good value option. The hotel staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming. It may be that they were particularly lovely and attentive as we were there for such a special occasion, but it certainly helped make our stay even more special. I called down for room service one morning and was greeted with a cheery "congratulations!" and wishes of good luck, which was very sweet - even housekeeping knew we were getting married. When breakfast arrived, i was congratulated again and told that my food complimentary since it was my wedding day. For such a big hotel, such personal attention is to be applauded. The public areas are amazing and grand - they underwent a facelift in recent years and the money was well spent. You certainly feel like you're in a grand old establishment. Unfortunately i would have to agree with previous reviewers that the bedrooms really need to be upgraded/given some TLC too. Our suite was sizeable but in need of cosmetic work/upkeep. The paint was peeling from the walls in areas, there were evident damp patches, peeling wall paper etc. Fortunately, at first glance this isn't too obvious, but is really disappointing for such a high-priced establishment. Our suite on the 20th floor had a large terrace/balcony which was great for viewing the skyline from (and as a location for our wedding photos) - unfortunately it's not decorated/kept in any way and is therefore rather ugly and littered with hundreds of cigarette and cigar butts. Quite foul. It can't take much effort to pop a couple of plant pots up there and sweep up the litter! We didn't have any problems entering the hotel, as previous reviewers did. In fact the door staff were very friendly and really helpful with directions/taxis. On the whole, we really enjoyed our stay (we had a fantastic wedding!) but would agree that the WA is trading off it's reputation a little too recklessly. Considering the room rates and other charges in the hotel, they should really give some attention to the upkeep of the rooms... Plenty of NYC hotels offer a lot more for a lot less, but none can match the grandiose old-fashioned sophistication of the WA.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but dated and expensive”
Reviews.Author: G M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is impressive from the outside, has laods of history and character attached to it and well worth a stay but...it's decor is dated, it's a little impersonal and food and drinks really over priced. The rooms are ok in terms of size but depending on your room location can be very noisy due to proximity to the lifts. I'm pleased we've been but dont think I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed, Better Places to Stay in NYC for the $$”
Reviews.Author: JPinJupiter
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in the Waldorf for a business trip lay over in NYC. When I arrived at the hotel in the evening, I expected to enter into the Waldorf's legendary lobby, but was met at the door by the member of a security detail with an earpiece who pointed me off to the side. No greeting, no explanation of why I couldn't walk through the lobby and no verbal direction of where I needed to go to check in. I understand that there was an event going on that evening, but at a hotel of the Waldorf's purpoted caliber, there should have been someone greeting arrivals, not a security guard pointing to a hallway. When I finally got to the check in desk, the clerk was friendly and courteous. My room was clean and decent-sized for a NYC luxury hotel. I ordered a BLT through room service. Delivery was prompt and the sandwich was substantial, although it was slightly less expensive than a steak at other hotels. Overall, I was underwhelmed. It's a great historic landmark to visit, but they don't have guest service to the degree of a Four Seasons or a Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: JRH6
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria survives on a reputation. I was unimpressed with the room and the hotel facilities are unappealing to a normal tourist. It really is nothing special and it is easy to find a cheaper, better hotel in an even better location.

Reviews.Title: “Grand and breathtaking, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Ross1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. Wanted a traditional grand New York hotel with lots of history....this was the obvious choice. Although the grandeur/luxury interior of the hotel was breathtaking the hotel lacked a decent service. 3 things spring to mind:- we waited over an hour for the bell boy to bring up our luggage, we waited 4 hours for a cot to be brought up (which we were promised would be there upon arrival) and we waited 2 hours for a cup of tea to be brought up (eventually cancelled). I think when built and for some time after this was a hotel with a very high level of service but now it is merely a tourist attraction with too many guests to offer a decent service. Happy we stayed here as it is what we wanted as part of our New York experience, but would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: john/moira
Reviews.Content: We stayed over christmas 07 in the waldorf and found the hotel to be excellant value for money Was locateded centrally to all the main attractions Stayed in standard room and found this to be quiet large and very comfortable Staff were very plesant and always helpfull When i return to new york i will definetely stay in this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “A LifetimeMemory”
Reviews.Author: debramoore120
Reviews.Content: I hestitated prior to leaving Australia about spending our 11 nights in New York for Christmas and New Year after reading the many negative reviews. As it was the Waldorf I decided to bit the bullet and kept my booking. Where do you start, this place is amazing from the grand foyer and people sitting around being a life long tradition. Upon checkin the staff were excellent, friendly and very knowledgeable. Our room was a good size with Plasma television, fireplace, and the most amazing bed. The room was aged but what would you expect from place this old, you felt you were really part of a tradition. Room cleaniness was excellent and kept that way through our whole stay. The bathroom although small was very clean and the so call miss mash of products is such a trivial thing to complain about at I found it great to have the different products. We dined in the Bull and Bear for Christmas and the meal was subperb, breakfast in Oscars, afternoon tea on the terrace, Cocktails in Harry's Bar, all offered excellent service. We felt the age of the place made it special but was very pleased to see that in renovating areas of the hotel they were carefully making sure that new carpet was matching exactly what was previously there, so I imagine when finished the hotel will retain it's wonderful art decor style, and continue to be a proud hotel in New York. Our greatest regret was having to leave and I hope people will take this Hotel for the grandeur it is and see beyond small tiny faults of age

Reviews.Title: “Oozes Character - Enjoyable Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Richard_evs
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews about the Waldorf Astoria prior to our trip, we were delighted with our stay and found many comments to be unfounded. Staying for two nights (over New Years Eve), we found that the hotel offered bags of character and we thoroughly enjoyed most aspects of our stay. There are nicer and more upmarket hotels to stay in NY, but we found that staying at the Waldorf was more of an experience. Staying in a King mini-suite, our room felt fresh and clean, with all the charm that you would expect from the Waldorf. The view wasn't amazing, which was a shame, but we spent more time out exploring than gazing out of the window anyway!! There were negative aspects - it took us 20 minutes to check in for no apparent reason and I would advise most to stay away from Oscar's (restaurant/bar near Eastern entrance). Although the food was good, we waited almost 90 minutes for our main course and the waiters seemed, well, incompetent. Everyone seemed to be complaining and sending food back to the kitchen for various reasons - apparently they were short of kitchen staff. However, I have heard better reviews from others, so maybe it was a one off. Regarding other staff - most were friendly and helpful but there were the occasional employees who didn't really seem to care what impression they were giving (again, mainly in Oscars). Generally I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to NY if they are looking for something a bit different. If you're highly strung or short on patience then aspects of the Waldorf might not be for you, but for the easy-going, laid-back amongst you, then I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: TMichael2
Reviews.Content: We just got back from NYC and the Waldorf Astoria. I cannot express how disappointed we were with our stay. The service was poor and our room was not clean. We have stayed in this hotel on other visits to the city and we were shocked by our bad experience. I won't stay there again. The only positive about the hotel was the Bull and Bear Restaurant, which was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Living on its name”
Reviews.Author: Kwah
Reviews.Content: Just the name Waldorf Astoria conjures up images of grandeur and extravagance. To some extent the hotel lobby lives up to this expectation, with its high ceilings and big art deco statements, but it only lasts till the moment you turn to the 20-plus position reception desk and the mass of departing and arriving guests swarming around it. Even then the disappointment was starting to set in. With only 24 hours in New York (with my wife and daughter) I decided to book us on a couple of short tours to make the most of our visit to the city. The tour desk in the lobby were extremely helpful and within minutes had us booked on a harbour tour with Circle Line that evening and an open-top bus tour of Manhattan the following morning. Already my wallet was nearly $200 lighter – the fees for the tours plus the Waldorf Astoria tour desk's commission on top. As I turned from the desk, my wife said, ‘I think he was expecting a tip. He put his hand out as you turned away.' I chose to ignore it and we went off to find our room. The whole tip thing became something of an irritation for the rest of our stay. I have to admit all the staff are impeccably turned out, but the thing you see them doing most is putting their hands out for tips. At 6am the next morning – when the Starbucks in the hotel itself was still closed (no facilities in the room either) – I went in search of a coffee. A bellhop in reception directed me to a Starbucks outside the hotel and promptly stuck his hand out for a tip. He didn't get one. The room itself was nothing special and didn't even come with coffee/tea making facilities. For $428 (before taxes) for one night, I expect more. We didn't dine in the hotel restaurant, but we did take breakfast the morning of our departure. That cost $60 for the three of us, and we didn't even go the whole hog – my wife only had a poached egg! Something tells me the Waldorf is just using its historic past to fleece its 21st century guests. As for New York – go there, it's amazing. Just don't stay at the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, dated yet luxurious.”
Reviews.Author: labradorheat
Reviews.Content: We saw a deal on the internet and called the hotel. We ended up with a fantastic deal for the WA, even better than originally offered. Check-in was great. Staff were even greater. All the bad things you hear about NYC people are not evident here. Furnishings and decor were a bit dated but the luxury was there. The bathroom was huge, almost as big as the room itself. View was not the best of Park AVe. but with so many skyscrapers around, what was there to see? The rate included buffet breakfast. Very good food. The hotel was close to many things. We walked to ESB, Times Sq., Bloomingdales, Central Park, and Rockefeller Plaza. If I go back to NYC and can get a good rate, the WA is where we are staying. Thank you for helping make our first NYC experience Xtra special.

Reviews.Title: “Great City”
Reviews.Author: Gondolier
Reviews.Content: We took our daughter to New York for her 18th Birthday and wanted to stay somewhere special, we were not dissapointed. The Waldorf is top quality. Prior to arriving, I e-mailed the hotel asking them if we could have a room with a good view and they gave us just what we wanted, with a view over Park avenue. Staff were very helpfull and accomadating. Had a great week, did the lot, ESB, Liberty, Maceys, Blummers, 5th Ave, ground zero, china town, ice skating and loads of shopping. Snowed on our last day, wind chill of -25, then got snowed in at JFK, can't have it all good I suppose.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if using Hilton Honors Points”
Reviews.Author: Changes-In-Longitude
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at the Waldorf the last few years around Christmas, always with Hilton Honors points. While it has been a favorite of ours it seems to be losing its luster for us. The thin walls between rooms are not a problem if quiet guests are staying next door or the adjacent room is unoccupied. However, on a recent trip the baby in the room next door was crying so loudly I was tempted to get up and warm up a bottle myself. On this most recent trip we were serenaded by a teenage girl and her younger brothers' constant squabbles. It was so loud that we could have joined in on the conversation about who used whose toothbrush. Other little nits included the bathroom light that would not turn off (there was a problem with the switch) and another light in the room where the pull chain was broken off. In order to turn it on and off we had to tighten or loosen the bulb. For our 3 member family we had a room with two double beds. For a room at this price level there should be more than one night stand with a single lamp between the two beds. It ended up not lighting anyone's reading area. The beds are comfortable as you would expect but stay away from the $29 Continental breakfast for 1. (Plus $5.50 service charge and 15% gratuity.) The location is excellent and the gorgeous lobby is still a reason to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Frayed around the edges...”
Reviews.Author: EatLikeABird
Reviews.Content: A disappointment. This place is relying on past laurels. The guest rooms definitely need renovation: faded carpeting; threadbare furniture; tattered, old-fashioned, roll-up window shades, cracked sink in the bathroom. Service was spotty: couldn't get the attention of a bellman so had to carry our luggage up stairs to the lobby; waited for ages after being seated in the "brasserie" for the breakfast buffet for a waiter to acknowledge us and bring coffee and juice. Once housekeeping entered our room without knocking or any announcement. Definitely not service and accommodations worthy of a five star hotel. I won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: ra7519
Reviews.Content: decided to stay here as never been to NY before. Room was old and tatty. Definitely not worth what was paid for. Bathroom wall cracking.. I think they dont think its worth updating the hotel as people would pay to stay in a landmark. Hilton have definitely lowered their standards here. Hotel was central.

Reviews.Title: “A classic, aging”
Reviews.Author: KMGBirmingham
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location. We wanted to stay here our 2nd night in NYC over Christmas just to experience it. It has a grand lobby, though not as grand as the Hilton Chicago we visited earlier this year. The room was a good size, especially for NYC. However, the bathroom was in disrepair. The paint on the ceiling was peeling off. The carpet nail going into the bathroom kept catching my foot - ouch! Also, the toiletries, which can be a treat at nicer hotels, were a mismatched hodge podge of what felt like leftovers. All different brands, none particularly luxurious. Once you are out of the lobby, it is sadly just another hotel. There are surely much nicer rooms than what we experienced, however, we booked directly with the property and did not book a "discount" room. I visited the gym on Monday Morning, Dec 17 and we were charged $15 dollars for the thirty minute visit. I knew this going in and while a little high, I was willing to pay $5 for each mile I ran!

Reviews.Title: “Very Art Deco”
Reviews.Author: sraj
Reviews.Content: Stayed during February and the weather was the coldest I have ever experienced. We had a 2 room suite with bathroom which was great with large mirrors. Windows 2 sides made the room light but was cosy. Nice view also. Didnt eat in the hotel so can't comment on food but service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, excellent location, probably time to do some renovating!”
Reviews.Author: grho4171
Reviews.Content: Upmarket hotel with excellent service. Great location. I largely agree with other reviews in that the public areas of the hotel (lobby, bars, etc) are fantastic however the rooms are dated and in need of renovation. We had to change rooms on arrival as the first room had two random live wires protruding from the wall.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: DaveysGal
Reviews.Content: It was my first time staying at The Waldorf and it was even better than i thought it would be. The lobby is absolutely fabulous and the staff at the front desk just lovely. Our room didn't have a great view but everything else about it made up for it. The bathroom was really old world but still brand new, and the room was very spacious, with a sitting area a massive bed. For New York standards, great size. We ate in Peacock Alley restaurant in the hotel the first night because our flight was a bit late and it was magnificent, can't wait to go back. The tasting menu available was out of this world, with lots of little dishes to choose from, and because they are small, you can have 4 or 5 so you get to taste a lot of different things, just brilliant!! And what can i say about the location... Park avenue is so grand and yet so cool, i could walk up and down taking it all in for hours. The Waldorf is our New York hotel since, i won't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jowarren
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights on are way back to England, after being in florida doing the theme parks. As you walk into the main recepetion its breath taking. The young lady on reception was having a bad day, she did have a bit of an attitude. We asked her some questions about being able to get a larger room. But she managed to upset my husband. But she had the last laugh because she put us in the smallest room in the hotel. 1369. when we got to the room we could only just mange to get all our luggage in. We had been in florida 2 weeks with two children so we had quite a bit of luggage. We rang recepetion to ask to get another room. it would have been fine for a couple but not 4 people. Even the cleaning lady comented on the size of the room she said it was a very small room. They did get us moved to a more suitable room. No problems at all. Moral is not upset the recepetion staff. We found it easy to get around being based at this hotel. In the middle of all the things that we had come to see. I thought that the hotel would be very stuffy. But it was fine. My children really liked the lifts ,they went so fast. They thought they were back in florida again. The room was lovely we had a corner room. Very clean. All the staff seemed helpful especially the door men. We had a great time in NY. We all loved it so much. Felt totally safe walking around with my children even at night. Felt safer than my home town at night and that has apopulation of about 30,000 max. NY has so much to do and see its a magical city. We cant wait to return. Will stay longer. We went on the bus tours loved it a great way to see the city. it's agreat city for all ages and especially children. We loved it here and the people. We had a marvelous time. So sorry to leave. Everydody should visit if they get the chance. When we left for the airport it was just getting dark. Looking over my shoulder and seeing the sun setting. I Know that we will be back again. Had a few tears on plane home when I looked out the window and seen the city all lite up so beautiful it was breath taking. Ive heard many people say about it. It reminded me of lava and sparkling amber jewels flowing from the centre brightly then just gently fading away. Loved the whole thing.

Reviews.Title: “A Welcome Return”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugLA
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about returning to the Waldorf after our last visit -- when the atmosphere was akin to a chaotic frat house - but our recent stay made the previous one a dim memory. The hotel lobby was bustling with visitors, but there was a sense of calm and control, and numerous staff members were cheerfully assisting wayward guests with directions to their rooms and/or the numerous special events being hosted by the hotel. We had a very nice suite for the first two nights of our stay, and the hotel staff was polite and helpful when we were forced to change rooms due to a circulation problem - and even upgraded our suite to a beautiful set of rooms on a higher floor. The staff seemed genuinely concerned with our needs and took care of us promptly and courteously. The Bull and Bear Restaurant has undergone a nice renovation, and the Waldorf's overall atmosphere of classic and restrained elegance was once again on display, We look forward to staying at there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely lobby but don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Peagreen98
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night and I won't be staying there again. The lobby is stunning , so very beautiful and the bar is very nice too. The check in staff were perfectly pleasant on check in and check out in a prerequisite form filing way. The room and hallway to the room were a different matter. I'm all for artistic shabby chic or for historic hotels - but this was neither. The wallpaper outside my room in the hallway was peeling away in huge sheets, the carpet was badly worn and faded both in the hall and in my room. Then of course the dark "old" furniture was in dire need of some beeswax. The bathroom looked like it hadn't been updated since the 1930's but not in a cute retro way, cracked paint, the air vent had 20 years worth of dust attached to it and the toileteries were all mismatched different brands and half used! It's in a useful location and I can understand the desire not to stay in a "chain" hotel with bland decor but there are nicer rooms to be had in New York - go to the Waldorf for drinks and have a look at the lovely lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay but noisey”
Reviews.Author: Chrella
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Waldorf Astoria, the last time we had a room facing the back & it was quieter, this time we were on the Park Avenue side & it was a continual noise of police sirens 24 hours a day even although we were on a high floor. Check in was very efficient & the receptionist on duty was extremely nice. The rooms are very well decorated but for the price in my opinion too small & as I already said they need to do something to soundproof them. The concierge was very helpful & booked us some very good restaurants near the hotel. Our only meal there was the Sunday Brunch which was wonderful & we will definitely repeat the experience on our next visit to New York. We had drinks in the Bull & Bear & Sir Harry's & as expected were expensive but in both bars there was a very good atmosphere. We had a chat to a gentleman in Sir Harry's who said he was a security officer in plain clothes who's job it was to suss out any high end prostitutes, he said that this was a big problem in all the luxury hotel bars in New York & that the girls were getting more devious so his job was getting more difficult. We would only stay here again if they soundproof the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Threat”
Reviews.Author: ChristianMoscow
Reviews.Content: Might have been nice in the 50ies of last century. Windows pretty dirty, couldn't see if it is raining outside or not. But at least I could have heard the noise of the rain after swithing off the AC, which must have been one of the first ever produced. Besides the noise of the rain I also heard in the 12th floor every noise from the street. Mold in the bathroom added to my comfort as well as a slippery ramp betwenn bathroom and bedroom And it was also a unique experience to meet the most incompetent and most arrogant concierge of my life. Maybe this is special NY flair.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: LennieCork
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Waldorf for 5 nights. We got a great deal on the internet and decided to go for the experience - the price was equivalent to a 3 star hotel in NY. We didn't eat in the hotel so unfortunately I cannot comment on he food. However, the reception areas were superb! The most amazing arrangement of Lillies greeted us. The reception areas were spectacular. The staff that checked us in were very friendly and welcoming. The double room was of a very good size, old style, but thats what I would have expected from this hotel. On the morning after our second night we were woken by drilling across the corridor at 8:30. We complained to reception about this and we were immediately upgraded for the remainder of our stay. Very good service. The suite was a fabulous room - Bedroom, kitchen area, sitting room and bathroom. I am not sure I would pay full price for a stay at the Waldorf, but if I got another good deal on the internet I would definately be back. The location is fantastic for exploring NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Posh? Not really”
Reviews.Author: cecilim
Reviews.Content: Not giving this one a full rate because it was a little less than I expected it to be. I've heard that the Waldorf is a really posh posh hotel, but to be honest I wasn't that suprised. Of course the reception was awesome, and the bed in the room was really good, but I don't think the bed would have been that good if it wasn't for staying in a bunk bed hostel the pervious 4 nights. But I must say the sleep I had was priceless!! It was a really good bed! I just don't think that the room was worth all those money, for that amount of money I would expect a little bit more. Like maybe a better room, a better breakfast and a jacuzzi. But been there, done that!

Reviews.Title: “living on its name”
Reviews.Author: bilsim
Reviews.Content: i visited the waldorf with my girlfriend and her family (mother, father, sister) for the fact there was 5 of us, we decided to book one room, with a promise from the hotel they would be able to give us a fold out or camper bed. When we arrived we were informed the hotel did not do these things! After my girlfriends brother decided he'd sleep on the floor, we got up to the room. the view from the window was marvellous, but the room itself was disappointing. for a start, I'd been in touch with the hotel more than three times in order to have chocolates and champagne prepared for my girlfriend as it was her birthday, there was nothing at all. The room was too small for three people, yet it was meant to be a family suite! The staff diden't seem too bothered to help us with anything because we tried to be economical with the trip. Overall it's a nice place, but it's not great.

Reviews.Title: “stop complaining this is a first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: sirlawrence
Reviews.Content: a lot of rooms and a lot of guests go thru everyday so there is bound to be some complaining...the hotel is in a perfect location, most rooms are great ( all hotels have some rooms that are not perfect..ask to be moved instead of cying..the hotel is beautiful, common areas comfortable, rooms exceptional and a crack staff all around..what is not to like ?...also kudos to mallorie at the front desk who really helped me get a nice sunny room...people, stop getting off on complaining..there are dozens of great hotels in nyc and this happend to be one of the finest

Reviews.Title: “Extremely overated”
