Reviews.Author: SydneyW0rldtraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel recently for 3 nights whilst on a work trip. Coming from Australia, I couldn't believe this hotel was so famous....it definitely can't be famous for the standard of the rooms/facilities/food. My room overlooked the street and had a faint humming noise (air con?) the whole time. The room was extremely tired looking and the shower didn't function properly with either a blast of water or a dribble coming out. The bedspread looked like it hadn't been cleaned since 1968 and similarly the decor probably hadn't been updated in most of the parts of the hotel since that date. There was very little lighting in the room so I spent most nights stumbling to and from the door and to the bedside lamp. There's also a distinct lack of power points in the room - I had to unplug the desk lamp in order to charge my mobile phone. Be warned if you receive a fax at the hotel, you will be charged US$15 per fax. The charge for the gym is now US$25. There were no porters to assist with luggage both on my arrival and departure so expect to carry your own bags. We ate at the restaurant one night and it was a very ordinary meal for approximately $100/head (two courses and including some very mediocre wine).

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY WORTH EVERY PENNY!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: juju36
Reviews.Content: Not sure why anyone wouldn't like The Waldorf. Something has to be seriously wrong with you if you have something negative to say about this hotel. This hotel was amazing! After reading all of the negative reviews on this website, I was really hesitant about staying at the Waldorf. Thank goodness I didn't listen to them. There was not one thing wrong with this hotel. It was gorgeous. The rooms were huge and beautiful. The beds were so comfortable!!! The staff were so friendly, along with the bellman. He actually arranged for a limo to pick us up to take us to the airport. We are going back to New York in April, and I don't have to think about where I am going to stay, because it will definitely be The Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “Sad demise of a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: amdgMd
Reviews.Content: On arrival was told I would receive upgrade to suite due to Hilton diamond status. Heard voices in suite as I tried to unlock door. Suite was occupied. Back down to lobby, shlepping luggage. Was then assigned room in Waldorf Towers. Must have been smallest Towers room. Tastefully decorated but no more so than other NYC hotels such as Benjamin and Elysee (both with superior service). Was perfunctorily denied access to club lounge on floor where room was located (apparently one must pay $700 or more per night rate to qualify for standard cheese and crackers hors d'oeuvre). During two night stay no bellman was available to assist with luggage, no doorman available to help with taxi service. E-mail to the hotel afterward received zero response. Quite a change downhill from my stay years before when the service was excellent and the Waldorf could still legitimately claim to be a luxury hotel. Or maybe you just don't rate if you're not Brangelina. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Tired Old Gal”
Reviews.Author: margie55
Reviews.Content: In fulfilling a childhood dream to stay at the Waldorf, my daughter and I booked a suite for 6 nights. The photos on the website showed fantastic rooms filled with plants and flowers, gorgeous wallpapers, etc. What a letdown! The paint was peeling off the walls, carpet was stained, light fixtures were broken in the bathroom. All this for close to $700 per night. Shame on you, Hilton, for letting this beautiful hotel go to pot!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: treeman
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for the first time. We were expecting luxurious accommodations. Although the lobby was tastefully elegant and the staff gracious, the hallways and rooms were only average for a hotel of this stature. The appointments in the room were nice, but the space was small and there was need for upgrade in places. For example, there was significant peeling paint on the ceiling of our bathroom - something I was shocked to find at "The Waldorf." Also, the thermostat in the room did not control the temperature, and my wife was cold all the time. We have stayed in 5 star establishments before, and I would rate the Waldorf a 3 1/2 star hotel. It definitely was not worth the $500 price per night. Next time, we will choose to stay in a smaller boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not What You Would Expect.”
Reviews.Author: MikeZzz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf on a Saturday night and had a Mini-Suite. I felt like I had to write this review, so that people will know what to expect. We are well traveled and I almost never complain. But....The room was dated. Peeling paint in the bathroom. Wallpaper that was coming loose. Scratches on the wall. Old bath tubs. Just not what one would expect . The location is very good though. Close to many attractions. The staff was friendly, everyone from the check in lady to the valet parking attendant. The worst part of our stay was our neighbor across the hall. They smoked cigarettes all night and we could smell it in our room. The hallway was almost unbearable. The entire floor was Non-Smoking so I called the front desk. They sent security who told the "guests" not to smoke anymore and open the windows. The smell continued and at 4am I again had to call the front desk because people were coming and going all night long. I looked out several times. They were obviuosly intoxicated So much for a restful sleep. I was very dissapointed that there were guests like this, staying at this hotel. Again, not what one would expect. Now, I know it's not the hotel's fault that these people disregarded the rules. But the hotel is responsible for stopping this. They fell short. We will never stay here again. Too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cindy65
Reviews.Content: I went to New York with 3 friends for a weekend. We booked two rooms and stayed 2 nights. We chose this hotel because of the location and also because of it's history. The hotel rooms do show some wear in the carpets and appointments but the beds are very comfortable, clean, and of decent size. The hotel was very quiet and air conditioning not loud. We had a snag when we tried to enter our room and found it already occupied. We found the bell service to make sure our bags did not get delivered and then went back to the lobby to fix the problem - seemed that the guest was not in their computer. We were given another room and the desk called after we were in to apologize again and send complimentary wine/cheese to the room. The concierge was very helpful with directions and recommendations. Bell captains and all service personnel were very attentive. We walked to shopping on Park Ave and Madison Ave., Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Times Square. The subway to Little Italy was only a block away. Cabs were easy to get when needed, as they are waiting on line at the entrance. The Starbucks in the lower level was convenient in the morning, and the cafe across the street was great for a quick breakfast before heading out. Several higher priced restaurant options are in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied my Curiosity but Would not Return”
Reviews.Author: isabelle304
Reviews.Content: I and my friend while on holiday in New York took advantage of the lower weekend rates (we paid around $550 per night for a room with two queen beds) to stay at the Waldorf Astoria from Friday to Monday. The lobby areas were certainly impressive and conveyed very well some of the history of the hotel. They were also extremely busy. This is a huge hotel with a corresponding amount of guests and staff and this can be a bit disorienting. As stated by many reviews here, the decor is quite faded. The room was spacious but unremarkable, with an old-style TV and old fashioned carpet with swirly green and brown patterns. The bathroom had lovely art deco details (bathroom suite, lights, cabinet) but was fairly small and the paint was peeling off the ceiling. The room windows were extremely dusty and some kind of plastic sheeting hanged over half of the outside of the windows. There was no safe in the room so we had to use the safe deposit boxes area on the ground floor - this was manned 24 hours but inconvenient for storing items which we needed access to every day (eg my laptop, or some items of jewellery). Internet access in the business centre was quite expensive (I paid around $20 for about 10 mins) so avoid it if you can. I was happy to stay there for the 3 days we booked as I always wanted to stay in a grand hotel with history - I would however not stay there again - it's too big, too impersonal, and the decor was just too old for me (and I am 43!).

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf - the Hotel or the salad?”
Reviews.Author: ehjott
Reviews.Content: It´s all about the name. We were really looking forward to our stay - though we weren´t impressed that much while staying there. Maybe were not the kind of people that can truly honour this special kind of old fashioned decor. I have to say, that the Lobby and all public areas of the hotel are very grand and you certainly can get a feeling of nostalgia in the place. On the other hand, the hotel has seen better days. It´s a little bit tired. Our check-in was very swift and the staff was very helpful and polite all the time. We would choose (and already have) other hotels in the B.A.. I don't think the Waldorf-Astoria quite lives up to its reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: ckayjr
Reviews.Content: We were definitely not impressed with the Waldorf. We stayed on the Tower side and thought it would be a relaxing weekend with our 2 children. There were no upgrades available and the front desk service was lousy. The room was nice but a bit dated. The large bath area was fun for our children. The club area for snacks and breakfast was not impressive at all. Way too crowded and not enough seating for guests. The staff was not attentive nor was the facility worth the price. I would suggest looking elsewhere for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Old but not passed it Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: Caz1006
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf with 3 work colleagues, I shared with 2 students in one of the suites on the 27th floor and my manager stayed next door, this was a business trip for 6 days. First impressions count for me and the ambience and politeness of the staff in the Waldorf was amazing, the décor was old but not off putting. We got to our suite and the view was amazing and I had a bedroom/bathroom to myself and the 2 students shared the other bedroom/bathroom. Yes the room is old but it didn’t put me off in anyway, the bed was divine. If there was one problem it would have been the toiletries in the bathroom were half empty also it did not have bubble bath which I love a soak when I’m away. We had room service one night and had pizza’s, pasta and apple pie, we sat in our delightful robes watching a DVD and eating how great was that. I had a few drinks at Oscars with my manager and we had breakfast everyday which was the normal buffet style, very nice and the service was superb. All the sights and sounds of New York were relatively close and we did manage to do some sight seeing. Would I stay at the Waldorf again…………..um I’m not sure as they’re so many hotels in New York I would be tempted to try another, it was a small fortune (thank goodness I wasn’t paying!)

Reviews.Title: “Everything we hoped it would be and more”
Reviews.Author: Nikki_4_7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a 3 night stay in New York for my 40th birthday and we wanted it to be especially memorable. We were not disappointed in any way with the Waldorf Astoria. As our cab drew up at the front of the hotel, the car door was flung open and we were immediately greeted and our luggage taken from us. The lobby was breathtaking and everything we hoped it would be. Checkin was extremely quick with no waiting at all. It was lovely to look at the hotel's memorabilia and at the photographs of famous guests who had stayed there in the past. Our hotel room was just as expected and the bed was devine. We only used room service once but this was very good too. We had a drink in both the cocktail bar and Sir Harrys and found them both pleasant, although prices a little high. We ate in Oscars on our first night and had a very nice meal and prices in there were very reasonable. All in all we had a fantastic stay in New York, it was everything we had hoped it would be and more. We very much look forward to visiting again

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Old Lady of Manhattan...”
Reviews.Author: BrunoChapman
Reviews.Content: We had read many conflicting reviews and opinions of the Waldorf on different review sites before our trip, which made us feel slightly nervous as there are less expensive places to stay in Manhattan. We arrived at the hotel by cab from JFK ($45 fixed price) and were first struck by how many people there were, Both staff and Guests. The Lobby and all public areas of the hotel are very grand and you certainly get a feeling of nostalgia in the place. Our check-in was swift and the young man on reception was very helpful and polite. We had booked a Mini Suite, which wasn't huge, but was well appointed with all of the things that you would expect from a luxury hotel. My only minor criticism was that the room, although immaculately clean, appeared slightly dated. I wouldn't want to put anyone off from visiting the Waldorf as it is a good hotel and a piece of American History. My only comment is that for the money, you could probably find comparable (if not better) accommadation in one of the many very good boutique hotels that are strewn accross the island. In any case, remember where you are and ask yourself how much time you intend to spend (awake) in your hotel room when you are in the city that never sleeps...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrisp1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 6 nights and found from arriving to checking out the service we received was fantastic. The hotel was just as we had expected - very grand. The rooms were big and easily accomodated two people +many shopping purchases. The 2 bar areas were nice to relax in both before and after a meal. We didn't eat in the hotel as there were more than plenty of restaurants to sample in New York however our only complaint would be that 2 of the restaurants weren't open the full duration of our stay - had we have wanted to use them. Would recommend a visit to The London - Gordon Ramsay restaurant which was fantastic and only a short cab ride away. For our first visit to New York the Waldorf made us feel very welcome and we thoroughly enjoyed celebrating our first wedding anniversary in such style.

Reviews.Title: “snobbish place does not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: blackszabbi
Reviews.Content: the standard room price was USD 500 per night w/o breakfast, reservation was made via a bank who arranged a large conference. The list price is USD 650. I was on the 41st floor, the view was nice. The room was tired, old deco, a refurbishment is pretty needed. Big screen TV but old equipment. Terrible service. I called min 4 times in the evening the front desk/concierge/room service/operator etc to have a wake-up call. Not succeeded. I also wanted to find out some basic info about the gym. No success again. The gym was average. Breakfast: no variety of food, very crowded the Oscar, very unpolite staff Limo service was reasonably priced and efficient arranged by the hotel to the JFK To sum up: this might be a very stylish hotel 20 years ago. Since then just prices went up....

Reviews.Title: “Experience the grandeur”
Reviews.Author: Pascal1
Reviews.Content: We booked a 5 nights stay at the end of August at the famous Waldorf Astoria. The Waldorf is a nice hotel, but it is faded glory. Although the reception area is beautiful, the standard hotel rooms are old and you see the wear and tear of the past decades. The location of the hotel is superb. The continental breakfast in the hotel (@ $20) is below every level. Nevertheless we had a pleasent stay at the Waldorf and went for the experience in stead of a real 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Wows US”
Reviews.Author: MariaOttawa
Reviews.Content: It has been more than 10 years since I have been to NYC. This time my husband and I were taking our 15 year old son. We use to visit New York when we were young and broke and always wanted to stay at the Waldorf. It was all that I had hoped it would be. I booked on line and thought the price was rather resonable for NYC. The receptionist, ( and we were fortunate to have dealt with him both on check -in and check-out was charming, polite and totally effecient. We arrived very early and new our room would not be ready for hours. They took care of our bags and we enjoyed the city. We were exhausted close to check in time and because it was the labour day weekend the hotel was very busy. Rather than letting us wait they bumped us up to an executive room - no charge and it was beautiful. The bed was comfortable, the sheets prestine and the duvet lovely. No 'ick' factor at the Waldorf. We had the best steak ever at their restaurant. So much so we had it twice in four days. Check out was a breeze. We loved it all. New York has come a long way in 10 years . We'll be back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “A Stay in Art Deco Style”
Reviews.Author: Sampo_S
Reviews.Content: If Art Deco is your thing, The Waldorf Astoria is the place to stay. Entering the hotel is an experience as you will feel like going back in time to the times of black and white television. You can almost see the filmstars from the 30's walking around. The service is superb and almost everything is within walkin distance. And if you need a taxi you can simply walk out the door and there are taxis waiting for you. Also, The rooms are spacious with comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “We felt special in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Munsterite66
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria was "all that" and "more". Even though we arrived late (12:15 AM) on one of the buisiest weekends in N.Y., Labor Day, and did not call ahead to explain our late arrival; we were treated with a smile EVEN when I requested a room with a view. After all, my daughter and I had come to N.Y.C. to celebrate her 40th birthday. Our view, from the 9th floor, was of Park Avenue and it was very very quiet. Not only was the view pleasant, but the room extremely enviting with beautiful furnishings and enterior decor. The beds were the most comfortable ever. We had a dressing room where we could set up our suitcases and ironing board. The bathroom was sparkling. On the ceiling, in the water closet, was a crystal chandalier. It was a hoot! Everyone mentions the lobby, and it is grand as well it should be. It reflects the hotel's aristocratic, yet welcoming, personality. The art work, marble, chandalier, and overwhelminly large fresh flower bouquet are sites to behold. To appreciate this hotel, one must appreciate art deco. I do! Apparently lots of people, famous and otherwise, do as well. The hotel and towers were filled to capacity. New York City shines with art deco buildings including the world famous Chrysler Building and Grand Central Station, all amazing feats of architecture. Bring your walking shoes. You are within walking distance to 5th Avenue shopping, Rockafeller Center, Time Square etc. If you don't wish to walk, the "Hop-on/Hop-off" bus stops at the Waldorf. You can get a 48 hr. pass for a very economical price. Every weekend, there is a street festival somewhere in Manhattan. Ask the consierge. Over Labor Day, it was on 6th Avenue; again, within walking distance of the hotel. The one thing missing from our room was a coffee pot. Even with a Starbucks on the premises, I did miss that convenience. Except for this one small improvement, it was a most memorable stay. I would be privileged to stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hilton hotels out there!”
Reviews.Author: Andriyko
Reviews.Content: We really loved this hotel - from check-in to check-out. Hotel's location is just perfect. The rooms are large (especially compared to European standards) and well appointed. Our room was always clean - we never had to ask for or complain about anything. The building itself is so magnificant and historic. It's just so grande. Breakfast was not included in the rate so we had to pay which was probably the most expensive breakfast we have ever had anywhere. That was the only drawback. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and would gladly comeback myself.

Reviews.Title: “A Hilton at Heart”
Reviews.Author: sse1078
Reviews.Content: The grand hotel has a beautiful art-deco lobby but the rooms are tiny and nothing special. This is a clean hotel in an excellent location, but I don't think it deserves the reputation it has. There are many more excellent hotels in NYC. I feel like the concierge was a little snooty towards me and I've stayed here several times.

Reviews.Title: “no big deal”
Reviews.Author: jinnty
Reviews.Content: I don't know what all the fuss is about, okay it has a fantastic lobby, and you can watch all the people in their fur coats go by. but it's very impersonal the staff barely tolerate you, you are not given the VIP treatment, don't even get tea coffee in the rooms anymore. The rooms remind me of 'The Shining' and can be described as 'brown'. Oscars still do a good breakfast, but sooo many suits, felt out of it not going to a business meeting or arranging one on my mobile phone.

Reviews.Title: “underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: BritBurque
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very convenient location, but it does not live up to its grandeous reputation. We were very underwhelmed by the room and breakfast was mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Astoria--Better as a Salad”
Reviews.Author: kdz1
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby; very small rooms. No view except a dirty roof. Shower was awful. The concierge are the opposite of helpful; they tell you all of the reasons they can't help you in fact. One told me that "Les Mis" was not open Thursday nights (it was) and that no tickets were available (I got them easily). Concierge won't call a cab for you, gives out poor info--not sure why they have them. The Waldorf is in a nice central location, but you are paying for the name and what it used to be.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: jbmWyoming
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned after reading some of the reviews, but I thought it was a terrific hotel. We stayed there for four nights and I wanted to stay longer. It is historic which means it is not going to look brand new, but our room (King Executive) must have been recently renovated. The room and bathroom were not huge but very luxurious and very comfortable. Bedding had nice duvet and very comfortable mattress bedding and I think six down pillows! We had a closet down a separate little hallway off the entrance, which was great to store our luggage and clothes and not take up room in the "bedroom". There was a little noise, our room looked over Park Ave, but it was not bad at night. Short walk to the subway we took everywhere. Very safe area and very easy to walk to all the top spots in NY or take the subway. Room service was quick and tasty; yes expensive. Concierge got us two tickets to a Yankees game for less than we would have paid an online ticket broker. Concierge was also very helpful with theater suggestions, even though we bought tickets on our own. Check-in was friendly, really everyone was friendly at the hotel and in NYC. Absolutely loved our trip, loved NYC and loved the Waldorf. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel great for celeb spotting”
Reviews.Author: clairebutterfield
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel from the 15th to 19th of August. The hotel has lots of history and the lobby area is great. It feels like a grand hotel but the rooms are in need of an update. They are quite spacious but the bathrooms and corridors in the hotel need updating. Still they are better than most New York hotels. We saw David Beckham in the lobby during our trip and were told many famous people stay there in the waldorf towers!! The bar area was nice but £4 for a bottle of beer. Some areas of the hotel are being updated The location of the hotel is perfect and close to all attractions . A taxi to Soho of south manhatten is only £5 and is the best way to travel. Would stay again but will try other hotels until its been updated

Reviews.Title: “A dream realised and a tired old lady”
Reviews.Author: SandDragon
Reviews.Content: When I was a child growing up in Australia, I was a big fan of the Guiness Book of World Records which listed the Presidential Suite at the Waldorf Astoria as the most expensive hotel room in the world. I wanted to stay there. We disembarked a Caribbean cruise in Brooklyn and I booked us two rooms at the Waldorf Astoria to live out my dream (although not in the Presidential Suite) before we flew home to Dubai. We arrived early and no rooms were ready yet and so we got to spend some time in the ample lobby. In fact ample time in the ample lobby. It speaks of a grand past while delivering a slightly dated present. When we finally got into our room it basically reflected the lobby. You know when you see some elderly people and you can see from the glint in their eye or their structural features that in their day they real stunners - such is the Waldorf. She must have been a beauty one day. But not today. The rooms were small and tired and dark. Curiously, the halls are huge and bright. But the beauty has faded. She's tired. She needs a nap. The staff are all very attentive and the Conceirge provided some good suggestions for dinner. While waiting for a cab out the front of the temporary entrance due to construction work/refurbishment we got to watch the unseemly battle between the doorman and the bicycle cabs. I am still glad we stayed there. But only once for me thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Waldorf Astoria!!”
Reviews.Author: sarated13
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Waldorf Astoria!! Great location -you can walk to alot of different sites ! Comfortable bed and very friendly staff! Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: jahanchey
Reviews.Content: We had a great time from the moment we walked in... we could not have asked for a better hotel! There was a little construction on the Lexington Avenue entrance which made the restaurante, Bull and Bear, closed. There is a Starbucks in the lobby, for all you coffee fans. (Not to mention, on every corner in NYC.) The rooms were well appointed. The views were nothing to write home about so we recommend the Towers if you have the extra money. Best of all, was the turn down service each night with jazz music playing on your alarm clock. Overall, we were delighted with the hotel, service and location. You can walk to Central Park, Times Square and Rockefeller Center. And if you decide to take a tour bus, all of them have stops at the Waldorf. We would highly recommend the Waldorf Astoria when staying in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: HolidayGirl02
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf Astoria with 12 other members of our family and friends for our wedding. It was in a convenient location for our wedding in Central Park and we were upgraded on arrival to a King Suite. Although the check in process took a while, but there were 14 of us checking in and the staff were very accommodating situating everyone in close rooms. Friendly and attentive staff on our wedding day and our wedding meal which we organised through the hotel at Oscars restaurant, again couldn't be more accommodating to everyone! Really made it a perfect trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest let down ever”
Reviews.Author: BananaTMF
Reviews.Content: Waldorf Astoria - great location for business and pleasure; beautiful common areas. Staff was very friendly and helpful. However, when I checked in they said that there was some remodeling going on and I may hear some odd noises here and there, but that it would not go past 5 pm. The noise was so loud you could not even make a phone call. And it went past 5 pm, at least until almost 6 pm. Started up promptly at 9 am again. I went to relax on the star light roof top with a business partner, which the whole floor was a construction area. No notice that it was closed or to not go there. Then that night I received a voice mail after returning late to the hotel that there would be no water available from midnight until the next morning. "Sorry for the inconvenience." On top of it all, I ordered breakfast for the next morning. Somehow a $27 combo of 2 eggs, toast and coffee added up to $49 (I knew the delivery charges, gratuity, taxes, etc would definitely add up though). But the eggs were stone cold, and the toast was burnt. Just overall experience that I would expect at a 2 star or less hotel, not the Waldorf. The Waldorf has its location and its romantic brand image going for it; but from what I saw, that's it. Huge let down.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: hernher
Reviews.Content: Although I could never afford the $599.00 a night to stay at the Waldorf, when we booked a package (airline and hotel) then it came into our price range. What a wonderful opportunity to stay at a hotel that we would never normally be able to afford. It was classy; the service superb and it made our recent trip to NYC a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable, if not opulent, return”
Reviews.Author: lovemypup
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate enought to be staying at the Waldorf-Astoria for one night on my Hilton Honors points. It has been many years since I have stayed here, and it was nice to return. Rebecca at the front desk reception was absolutely lovely, and although my room was not ready when I arrived at noon, she guaranteed me that a room would be available when I returned from an appointment around 5pm. I asked her that she please make sure I was not in a "closet," which happened once when I stayed here. She assigned me to room 2727. A HUGE (and I mean HUGE) room, with no view to speak of, but it was a quiet corner room, and which was absolutely wonderful for spreading out. If you don't care that you will be looking at other buildings, this room is truly large enough to host a cocktail party! Other parts of the hotel are starting to wear down a little, and the plumbing/ac is getting a bit old and doesn't work as efficiently as it could/should. However, the lobby is still breathtaking, and the huge flower arrangement by the elevators as you walk in the Lexington Street side is gorgeous (not to mention fragrant). Location is fantastic, and it was certainly a pleasant return to an old favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not worth the $$$”
Reviews.Author: andie325
Reviews.Content: Some girlfriends and I stayed at the Waldorf Astoria for a girls weekend of shopping and fun. Upon arrival, we were admitted to our room, which was small but comfortable. We noticed it was sort of warm in the room, but we were running late for a show, so we turned the ac knob all the way up and hoped it would be warmed up by the time we got back. Upon getting back to the room at around midnight, we noticed the a/c was not working. The hotel staff moved us into the Waldorf Towers where we had a larger than average room which was nice. The beds were pretty comfortable, but there was still a lot of street noise. We had a view of the top of the hotel, nothing special. We also had breakfast at the buffet, that was nice. THey did offer a nice spread. Overall, our stay was nice and the lobby of the hotel is beautiful. However, I do think that the hotel is overrated. It's an older hotel with older furnishings and it really shows that it's from an older generation. The staff did not go above and beyond and it certainly wasn't the most lavish hotel I've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful waldorf.”
Reviews.Author: brian&patricia
Reviews.Content: look i would just like to start by saying "ellegance " why some choose to wait until after their stay to say something i will never know . But patricia and i have found ourselves staying at the waldorf 3 times and once strayed to what others said was a better place to stay, well on behalf of patricia and i wrongggggggggggggg! just people watching at the waldorf is worth it .We would love to return soon (we stayed 8th july -11th july) .Just soak up the atmosphere ,use your imagination and look around this wonderful piece of history , cause your part of it as you stay at the waldorf.like we say ellegance.

Reviews.Title: “Living on its reputation”
Reviews.Author: between_u_and_I
Reviews.Content: Given its price and reputation, I was really dissapointed by the Waldorf. The lobby area is still a beatiful sight, and the service was good, but the rooms are now sub-standard. My room was oddly shaped. The decor was dated. The TV reception was poor. Most things in the room looked worn.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star hotel any longer”
Reviews.Author: Critical2
Reviews.Content: This is a tired hotel and all its past glory has gone. Oscars brasserie for a buffet breakfast is to be avoided.Poor selections,dirty crockery,cold plates,warm coffee. Rooms are not well furnished and although the bathroom is clean its only the parts you can see.Cob webs on the ceiling,peeling paint work. No sense of service or client care

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sunflower12
Reviews.Content: Room we stayed in was quite old and dilapidated and not very clean. The beds/linen were the only clean part of the room. The AC vent near the window was covered in a visible layer of brown dirt that had obviously accumlated over time. The sink and bathtub were both cracked and chipped and had peeling paint. Really not what you would expect for the star level of this place. The downstairs lobby is quite beautiful and old and grand. But the rooms have not been upkept. The only positive side to the stay are the staff who are all very customer service oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel-Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ellen32
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Waldorf with my 3 teenagers. Great location, easy check in - checkout, parked my car there about $45/24 hrs. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms very clean. With taxes etc it was $400 per night. I would try and stay somewhere else that was less money since we were never in the room but I liked the location. The flowers in the lobby are beautiful and they do change them on Mondays. The people that worked there were very nice. Easy walking distance to Times Sq, central park, UN Bldg, Rockefellar center.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Every Minute of It!”
Reviews.Author: flourgal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2006 and couldn't have had a better experience! The hotel itself is beautiful and, even if you're not staying here, it deserves a visit. We were immediately greeted upon arrival and promply, and graciously, checked in. The gentleman behind the desk gave us a voucher for free drinks at their bar, an unexpected bonus, which we used later that evening. The room was spotless, as was the bathroom. We didn't have a spectacular view, but we didn't spend enough time in the room to need one. The bed was comfortable, better than the one I have at home the linens were clean and soft. My favorite feature of our room.......it had its own doorbell! What can I say, the little things make me happy! We did have to wait in a long line to catch a cab outside......I probably could've gotten one faster myself.........and we were late for our show. The following morning, we left our bags with the bellhop desk while we spent the day in the city, and when we picked them up later that afternoon, they had a cab waiting to take us to the train station! Overall, a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible all around”
Reviews.Author: brian714
Reviews.Content: This was a real let down, I expected more from this hotel. I would have to say to anyone thinking about staying here to not ruin their hotel experience in NYC by staying here, there are other hotels that understand how to deliver an outstanding experience. construction is under way on each floor - 3 rooms at a time. for remodel. This is going to take years. LONG LINES at check in -- slow staff, had a quaranteed reservation for a king room and what do you know, no king beds just doubles and queens..after 2 hours waiting for a call from the front desk and getting a manager involved I got a king room. Most staff is unfriendly and can care less about the guests. Room service charged me two times for breakfast that came with my HHGOLD room. Then they hassled me to get the charge removed. Shower has no water pressure. The water is a drip. Bathrooms are old and borderline filthy, mirror was falling off the wall. Hotel rooms AC system does not work very well so prepare for a warm nights sleep. Bell staff is never available and you may have to lug your bags on your own. I'm young and able to carry my own bags but I had to offer to carry an older couples bags one evening because I saw them struggling up the stairs in the entry. No staff to be found, oh wait, yes the hotel GM was BS'ing with some other hotel manager from Wynn LV at the table next to me at the lobby lounge when I sat down for a drink. I overheard the GM saying the in house clientele was not the preffered at this time of year because it is off peak and that attracts a "less desirable" crowd. Perhaps that was the reason the service was so crappy, they turn off the service and the water pressure during the summer??? haha FIRE ALARM problems??? Alarm went off two times during my 4 day stay and hotel kept testing intercom which blasts you out of bed. not worth it folks, stay elsewhere when in NYC. Try the W or the Mandarian or Carlysle.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected!”
Reviews.Author: kmcpirate
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Waldorf on business for an entire week, hoping to be pampered and relaxed during my busy visit to NYC. I got quite the opposite. Every time I tried to get a doorman to catch a cab for me, they would start to and then bam - they're chasing after a limo that just arrived to open the door for a "high society" guest. Also, the people who work there are completely unprofessional. If you call, they're rude on the phone every time! They're the same once you arrive.... The worst part is the front desk and billing dept completely messed up the payments for several people at my company. All charges were supposed to go on our corporate card, I filled out the EXACT paperwork they gave me. When it came time to check out, they had charged each person at my company individually on their credit card. One guys account was overdrawn $2000!!!! It has taken a month of phone calls and faxes to finally get it fixed. The only saving grace is the beauty of the lobby, and the friendly housekeeping staff. It is a BEAUTIFUL hotel on the surface, but be VERY prepared for the horrible people who work there. My suggestion is go to NYC, stay in another CHEAPER hotel, and visit the Waldorf to see how beautiful it is. But DO NOT stay there.

Reviews.Title: “So great!”
Reviews.Author: winechick1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf for 3 nights with my best friend on a 'girls trip' to the city. It couldnt have been a better location, close to shopping, and restaurants. Yes, the hotel is old, but that is definitely part of the charm....sort of 'old school' new york. Our a/c worked fine, and it was quiet. We loved our room(2 double beds), and it was surprising large compared to other rooms I've had in the city. The bathroom was very spacious, and clean. Our turndown service was excellent, and we ordered late night room service, and it was always quick and tasty(though, as expected, VERY expensive-1 sandwich and 1 salad for $125). The front desk was really friendly, the bar and all the doormen were very nice. We felt very safe there, which is worth the extra $$. Will DEFINITELY stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent -- stately and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Upp
Reviews.Content: Waldorf was everything we expected: stately and comfortable. The character of the hotel shows in every detail: right from the sturdy desk to the exceedingly comfortable linen. The location also cannot be beat: it is just a few blocks off Grand Central and an easy walk to Midtown. Hotels in NYC usually fall below expectations (we have stayed at several of them over the years), due to the volume of the number of visitors to this great city. Considering that, Waldorf seems to have maintained its quality after all these years!.

Reviews.Title: “Well Kept Hotel....but Older Feel”
Reviews.Author: PeaceInTraveling
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are both former NYC residents and we were there for a wedding. We used Hilton points to stay at the Waldorf and were not upgraded upon check-in despite the fact that we are both Gold members. We were offered tickets for free drinks and were given enough of them to compensate. We were offered an upgraded room the second night but decided not to move our things. Here goes, the Waldorf is nice and clean but very dated. The room was a decent size but felt "old". We are both 30 years old and would have liked a more trendy hotel, but for free this was not bad. The location is great and is near Central Park and the subways. I am happy to say that I stayed at the Waldorf but would not pay full price for it. The Affinia 50 and Affinia Dumont are both very nice hotels and are the size of an apartment for a great price. I have stayed at both of these hotels with friends and we were very pleased.....for a family or a group of friends these two hotels are a great find! If I had to pay to stay in a hotel again in NYC, I would definitely stay at the Affinia 50 or Affinia Dumont!

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: Abbie101
Reviews.Content: When we went to the Waldorf Astoria the first thing that went wrong was when we got out of the taxi the bellboy got our bags out of the car and forgot 1 bag and we didn't know. So we went on to the hotel. Then that night they were building at 3.00 am! And it was right outside our room. The next day we realised that 1 bag was gone! And it had some valueable stuff in it! So we went down to the front desk very tiered and asked about the bag.They said you probabley left it in the taxi! But we told them that the bellboy got the bags out! So they called the taxi company and told them the number plate in case we saw it. We had to make 9 phone calls to the taxi company! Once we got home we had to make more and more letters and phone calls to the hotel. Until a month later we got the bag back delivered in the post. And it was safe.

Reviews.Title: “FIND SOMEPLACE ELSE!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: HowFtLaud
Reviews.Content: I am a business traveler who stays at hotels 50+ nights a year. This place is the worst. OLD and in bad need of upgrading to the elevators, plumbing and cooling systems. My room was so stuffy and musty that the assistant manager called it "suffocating" when he came up to see why I was complaining. They moved me to a new room and the cooling systems was sub-par and the plumber had to address shower issues twice. I rarely complain but these problems were unacceptable. Never did a manager call and say sorry for all the problems. Never did they offer a complimentary breakfast. Truth is they don't care, they are busy with wedding and convention business and could care less. They don't care about repeat business. Also, the elevators are so slow that you must allow extra time if you need to be somewhere on time. If you need to be in this area, stay at the W across the street or the Marriott Eastside.

Reviews.Title: “VERY Disappointed with the Afternoon Tea”
Reviews.Author: misterdarcy
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay at the Waldorf, but my sister and I did go the Cocktail Terrace for afternoon tea service. We were disappointed for the following reasons (I'm excerpting this from a letter that I'm sending the Waldorf): 1) Service - It seemed as though there was no structure to the service. There was no one there to greet people who had reservations for tea--no host or hostess. Everyone just sort of walked in and sat wherever. Our waiter was good, though. 2) Food - The finger sandwiches were medicore. The scones were good, but when we were brought our tray, it didn't have scones. The waiter said that there was some sort of delay and that he would bring the scones as soon as they were delivered. It turns out that we waited a good 30 minutes for them. 3) Tea - The tea was a bit weak, even after I let it steep for 10 minutes. Apparently, they put in too little tea and a lot of water into each customer's pot. 4) Level of formality - For a place like the Waldorf, you would think that there would be some standards of formality. However, there was absolutely no dress code for the tea. Also, the sugars were served in packets rather than lumps as I've seen in many afternoon tea services. One particular incident surprised me: A couple came in for tea, and a woman (who seemed as if she might be some sort of restaurant manager) with a flour-stained black skirt, abruptly informed them that she had no more tea strainers. I couldn't believe it. I mean, only about four tables in the whole place were occupied. Where the heck were the rest of the tea strainers? All in all, I expected more from afternoon tea at the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in the Waldorf Astoria”
Reviews.Author: Barefooter555
Reviews.Content: I wanted to have what I considered the NY experience and thought it should include a stay at the Waldorf hotel. The room I booked was a KING BED EXECUTIVE ROOM. The room was not ready when I arrived so they took my cell phone number to call me when the room was ready, I got no call. The view from my 6th floor room was of the other side of the hotel and of an air conditioning unit, no view of any of the NY city skyline. There was a wedding reception in the lobby and the elevators were locked out to anyone trying to go down to the lobby. We waited more than 10 minutes for an elevator before using the stairs, only to find out about the elevators being locked out by a doorman. They were apparently taking reception guests to the observatory on the 18th floor. The bathroom had paint peeling off the ceiling. I had to wait in the lobby to check out since no one had put the bill under the door. The staff thanked me for letting them know this did not happen. I have stayed at hotels all over the world, and have had better accomodations for less than half the price in other large cities. But this is NY, so maybe this is what you get and should be happy with it. I will not ever stay there again and will tell others that this hotel is fine, but you do not get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: DavidBelgium
Reviews.Content: I already had dinner twice in the Bull and Bear restaurant in the past, but now I decided to stay in the hotel. Checking in was smooth and the staff extremely friendly. Bags arrived 5 min. after entering the room. The room (standard queen) was spacious and very well appointed. Warm colours, nice furniture, a very comfortable bed. The bathroom wasn't very big but nice with a lot of amenities. Everything was spotless clean. I had a wonderful stay, and I'm looking forward to my next visit. If you like old world charm then you have to try this hotel. Walking through the lobby, passing the boutiques in the hotel, having a drink at the bar in the Bull and Bear, tasting their excellent steaks, ... This hotel takes you back to the past in a very positive way. The Waldorf Astoria, to my opinion pure elegance and class.

Reviews.Title: “nice visit”
Reviews.Author: chicagoboy23
Reviews.Content: Huge room. Great service. Very expensive price. Worth the price. Nice location. Restaurant probably not worth price but rooms and service are good. Staff is superbly trained and responsive.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly a positive experience”
Reviews.Author: PatonAyrshire
Reviews.Content: Our 5 night stay at the waldorf was mainly a very positive experience with a big comfy bed and a spacious bathroom. Some errors in our bill - which were rectified immediately -so check as you go using your in room tv. 2 members of staff were, to say the least ,arrogant and snooty, one in peacock alley, the other at the theatre ticket desk, but the rest were wonderful. They made our stay memorable and lived up to the hotel's reputation. We had a very comfy room and houskeeping service was second to none. These are the folks we should be tipping! Food was very good, though not cheap. On the whole we would highly recommend the waldorf as a great place to stay in N.Y. The only downside - constantly busy lobby during the day with 'suits' attending conferences in the hotel. They swanned about wearing badges while the rest of us who pay for the privelage go about our day anonymously. Would be great if they could use a 'back door' and leave the lobby area free for paying guests. Would recommend this hotel for anyone who enjoys the history of hospitality

Reviews.Title: “Cheaper than others in its class, but needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: lycheefruit
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Waldorf Astoria several times in the past year, and I am generally pleased with the hotel. I have never stayed in anything less than a suite, so I cannot comment on regular rooms. The best thing about this hotel is that it is half the price of other big name hotels (like the St. Regis, the Four Seasons, or Trump Towers). The suites are really quite large. The rooms I have stayed in have had large sitting rooms, often with two couches plus other seating, in addition to a desk and chair. The bedroom is often smaller, but comfortable, and the bathrooms can really vary in size depending on where you are located. The rooms can be inconsistent from room to room depending on what layout you get. Some rooms have a TV on a cart, while others have a full armoire. Some bathrooms have a large tub and a separate, small shower, while others are combos; still others have pedestal sinks and others have large dressing areas with vanities. Some rooms have butler pantries, which don't really add much functionality. Generally, no matter the layout, all the rooms are decorated with antiques or mock-antiques. I happen to like how the rooms are decorated with an older-world charm, reminiscent of the hotel's history. However, the rooms are definitely shabby. Cracking paint, scuffed furniture, old and poor-quality TVs, and shabby couches are often seen, but at least it is a NICE shabby couch. In other words, everything is high quality, but there is wear and tear. The air conditioning doesn't seem to be working wonderfully, though, as the rooms often got quite stuffy at night. Room service is really good, and they make a point of getting it to you fast and hot. Plus, the quality is above average. The concierge level has a nice breakfast in the morning and cocktails and appetizers in the evening, as well. Several of the restaurants in the hotel are quite good as well, including Bull and Bear and the Japanese restaurant. Service is impeccable, but not to over the top, as in, it's not St. Regis butler service. But the concierge was able to get us into Per Se on one day's notice after I tried unsuccessfully on my own, which is plain unheard of (typically takes a reservation over a month in advance to get in). The lobby is really nice, with beautiful fresh flower arrangements dutifully groomed daily, and the eclectic group of people, from businessmen to tourists to dignitaries, is fun to people-watch. Also, the location is really great, with proximity to all of midtown Manhattan and pretty easy access to subways. Overall, the hotel is a nice hotel at a nice price. It isn't as nice as the nicest hotels in New York, but a great compromise, especially if looking for a suite (these are large for New York) or an extended stay. If the hotel underwent a face lift, it would be great.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place”
Reviews.Author: windycityart
Reviews.Content: Marvelous old landmark hotel. Everything is just the way you want it. Our room was fantastic, probably the nicest we've ever had (and we've stayed in some world class hotels). Staff was great. Good location, Starbucks on the premises. Very high speed internet access. Only gripe was the price for internet access - $12.95 a day. For $409 a night it should be included. This is a great old hotel. HIghly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: FredCelling
Reviews.Content: Considering this places reputation I was far from impressed with the service levels. Check in was a disgrace and not organised. Maids left our room door open when they'd finished cleaning and overall, we felt it was poor value for money. Won't stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “elegant historic hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: ch40001
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night to catch dinner and a play and were upgraded to a corner room...rather small but nicely appointed. Staff were efficient and nice. Comfortable bed, pillows, and fine linens. Rapid elevator service. Sense of elegance throughout,despite rather busy lobby with a hodgepodge of people.

Reviews.Title: “Faded Glory”
Reviews.Author: Profire
Reviews.Content: Took friends (7 of us) and all stayed at the Waldorf. Due to the number of us going, we had a limo pick us up at the airport and take us to the hotel, and we had to go to the back entrace to get into the hotel. Not impressive when arriving in a limo and staying at the Waldorf. I had one of the largest suits on the property with a very large bathroom, decent size bedroom and a large living room, plus an entrance way and a "kitchen". The "kitchen" didn't have any service amenities (plates, glasses, flatware, etc) and we never ventured in there after the initial inspection. The bathroom was horrible. The tile on the shower was cracked and the shower door wasn't flush with the bottom of the tile and I ended up flooding the bathroom. The shower had extra (read as "old and unsued") knobs to turn on the water. The "door" to the toilet was a white cloth curtain. The TV in the bedroom sat on a Wal-Mart-esque brass table, which I thought was inappropriate for this level of room. All in all, I was VERY disappointed with this hotel. I am a big fan of Hilton and their brands (Hilton, Conrad, Biltmore, etc.) but wouldn't recommend staying here to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: lisakev
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 nights stay at the Waldorf, with my wife and two teenage children The hotel is magnificent and we have never experienced such incredible service before. The hotel decor in some places is a little tired. But the atmosphere and decor out way any minor issues. If you plan to visit Manhattan treat yourself to a stay in the Waldorf. We paid £2,500 for fligts and hotel accomodation. May not be the cheapest but well worth every peny . What an experience !!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: pakalana
Reviews.Content: Superb Service. From the moment of arrival, there were valets and porters to help with the car and bags. We were whisked to registration. Incredible decor & ambience. The main lobby had many comfortable seating areas, beautiful orchids everywhere, and a magnificent floral display in the central walk through. You can just sit in the various seating areas and listen to music, piano & vocals from the lobby (Cole Porter's piano) and from Peacock Alley. Art Deco details, e.g., on elevator doors, the ceilings and exquisitely furnished and well appointed rooms. Comfort. Despite what I believed was a very reasonable rate (for NY), was given (upgraded to) a room on the 41st floor in the Waldorf Towers; ample linens, Penhaligon toiletries, the most comfortable bedding, china service for tea, coffee, glass coasters, daily papers, good water pressure (shower & bath) and a view of St. Bartholemews, made for a very comfortable stay. Parking. No self park, $45.00/day valet parking. Remember to call ahead for your car so you won't have to wait long. Food & Beverage. Had drinks at the Bull & Bear and a meal at Oscars (tried the Waldorf salad --- which was nice but have had better versions elsewhere) and service was fine at both places. Location. Excellent. Just a short walk from everything, Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Center, The Chrysler Building, Theater District, MOMA; also walked back from the Met (it only took 25 minutes at a leisurely pace). Although have made many trips to New York and have stayed at a variety of places, including the Plaza, by far, this will be where we'll (hope to) stay on all future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Great Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alvin&Tracy
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to New York City, the first being at the New York Hilton & Towers. The Waldorf is a great Classy old hotel. The entrance and lobby is stunning. Upon arrival, the check in was very quick and we were taken to our room. Unfortunately, this room needed some serious updating (paint peeling from the ceiling etc) so we phoned reception and we were moved to another room. This room was fine if a little dated. Unfortunately, this room flooded ( a broken toilet pipe) while we were out , we returned to find all our cases etc on the bed, we were moved to a suite. This was our last night in New York though and it was all a bit of a pain to be honest! In all though we still had a great time, our tastes have moved on though and we prefer to stay in more modern hotels know such as the W & Hudson which we are staying in later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Wow wow wow ”
Reviews.Author: linzi_l0u
Reviews.Content: this place is amazing-the grand entrance is breath taking. there is a flower display in the lobby which is HUGE, it is changed daily=gorgeous We went for our 1st wedding anniversary and stayed in a king suite. The room was just as expected FABULOUS the concierge & ladies on reception were friendly and stopped at nothing to make our stay special- although i have to say we didnt get any special treats for it being our wedding anniversary - which i was suprised at!! the concierge on one day went out of his way to sort a helicopter flight, even going through another company that they dont normally use just to help us out. REMEMBER all the americans do the tipping thing, so make sure you got money in your hand when they bring your bags up etc Also REMEMBER for the young ens amongst you - take ID out with you to the bars. We are both 29 and look it, but still got asked for ID- its a must to have passports at the ready. Breakfast through room service is the nuts!!!! hot food delivered with a table top _ delicious!!! GO there- experience it Hope ill go back one day

Reviews.Title: “They Don't make 'em like this Anymore”
Reviews.Author: Worldtravel41
Reviews.Content: Just returned from business in New York and a stay at the Waldort Astoria. If you are looking for old world style in a convenient Midtown location, this is the place to stay. Are there swankier hotels in New York? Yes, I've stayed at several. Are there hotels with better rooms and/or facilities? Yes, I know from personal experience. Are there hotels with as much tradition and personality. Perhaps only a handful and that is debatable. From the minute you enter off of Lexington or Park Avenue, you know you've stepped into a special hotel. The lobby is a gargantuan, stately cavern with attentive staff and an excellent bar/lounge. The main entry hall is very impressive, leading up to the flower table they change every Monday morning. Venture up a few flights of stairs to the ballroom and see if you're not impressed. The point I'm making goes as follows: how many hotels do you visit where you spend part of your stay walking around to 'tour the grounds.' I can think of only a few. I have seen critcisms from other members as to the rooms. Since I base all of my reviews on my own personal experience, I can only comment that my room was excellent. I had a fantastic view of the city, a large King bed, a spacious room, and an updated-remodeled bathroom. Perhaps I missed the remodelling other members experienced... Service was prompt and curteous. I had to place two calls, one for drycleaning and one for room service, both of which were taken care of immediately. Location of the property is amazing. You're ten blocks away from Central Park and only a few from Midtown's shopping areas on 5th and Madison. You can walk to Broadway. You can walk to Grand Central. You can walk to the Rock. I can understand the criticism of expense by some members, but you have to bear in mind that 1) this is New York (where all accomodations are overpriced) and 2) this the WA, one of the original luxury hotels in the City. If you want to save money, you should stay in one of the chain hotels. I highly recommend this property and will consider it the next time I'm in the City for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: snowyshome
Reviews.Content: After reading the various reviews on TripAdvisor I was almost dreading what we might find at the Waldorf! We were at a conference there and had booked to stay for 5 nights. We got a good rate of 299 dollars per night, direct with the hotel. On arrival you cannot check in until 3pm but they will happily store bags until that time. We found the reception busy, but never had to wait more than a couple of minutes to be served. The lobby, reception etc are very impressive. We found all staff to be extremely helpful and courteous. The room, although dark, was very nice and there was none of the peeling paint that has been mentioned by other reviewers. We had a 'quiet' room but even that had traffic noise constantly despite being on the 14th floor. However it didn't stop us sleeping - after all it is the heart of New York, so don't expect it to be quiet! In terms of noise from other rooms, corridor etc we didn't hear a sound, I think it is very well soundproofed and the hotel is so vast that the rooms seem pretty well spread-out. The bed was to die for. It was an emperor size with gorgeous percale linen of really high quality. The only criticism of the room is that the curtains were for decoration only and didn't draw across, but there were black-out blinds - the curtains would have just looked nicer! The bathroom had bathtub with shower over, plenty of hot water and crabtree and evelyn toiletries. Maid service was also very good. No free drinking water in the rooms, but there is a Starbucks on the ground floor of the hotel which was a good place to stock up on drinks. The hotel cannot be beaten in terms of location. Overall we had a great stay and it far exceeded our expectations. I would recommend the Waldorf, but beware of the rate you pay - it would not have been worth much more than the rate we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sooze
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the Waldorf we were amazed at the floral display leading to the lobby, it was huge and of course we had to touch it just to make sure it was real!! It must've been atleast 3-4ft wide. We had a twin room which consisted of 2 king size beds with bolster cushions and decorative pillows which matched the bedcover. We didn't make use of the "Pillow Porter" who would've supplied us with any particular pillow we required. There was a turn-down service and all the decorative cushions and pillows were removed for us and the bed has to be one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The bathroom was full of original features from when it was first built which was great to see. There is an elevator which can take you to the penthouses and private suites. The lift itself is silver and ornately etched you can't help but admire it's opulence. We attended the bar quite a few times and maybe it was a little expensive but nice for a nightcap. The in-room guides are very helpful and no matter what you want to do in New York whether it's shopping, sightseeing or clubbing the guides tell you where it's all at. It's quite expensive to stay here but if you want to treat yourself and see and experience a wonderful hotel (not to mention the bed!) then don't hesitate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: SheilaAndMatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf for 6 nights and had a really pleasant stay overall. Pros- The hotel is on Park Avenue and a short walk to 5th Avenue and Central Park. The reception area is very impressive, check in was good and our room was also good. Friendly staff Cons- We felt that the rooms could have done with a bit of refurbishing and needed a good dusting. I have allergies and felt the dust quite badly. The hotel charges for local calls are really expensive Don't book theatre tickets at the hotel- we saved about $90 per person booking Lion King tickets at the theatre for amazing seats compared to what the hotel was quoting ($190 per ticket).

Reviews.Title: “Great Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelersAnon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated 25 years together with a stay at the Waldorf. We were really hesitant after reading the reviews but decided that it was worth a chance. Thank goodness we took the chance because it was EXCELLENT. From the time we arrived, the staff was attentive, friendly, and went out of their way to guide us. We were told to feel free to explore and given pointers on sites within the hotel to see. After our exploration, while relaxing at the Bull and Bear Bar within the hotel (try the onion rings), we were called on the cell phone to say that our room was ready (ON TIME!). We booked a king bed executive room (the least expensive since we didn't know what to expect) and were given a corner room that overlooked 50th st. (which runs by St. Patricks Cathedral and Radio City) and the other side looking out over Park Avenue on the 25th floor. Spectacular!!!!!!! The room was beautifully decorated, large by New York standards and had a separate dressing area with vanity, seating and more windows. Connected to that were double doors leading to the luxurious bathroom. Before our luggage could arrive (within 10 minutes), the management delivered a bottle of champagne on ice, chocolate covered strawberries and a note congratulating us on our anniversary. What a great surprise! The rest of our stay was just as wonderful and we have nothing but positive things to say about the Waldorf. As for the condition of the hotel, there may be newer, more modern places to stay, but for us nothing could replace the feel of the history of that great landmark. Here's hoping your trip will be as special as ours.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the experience”
Reviews.Author: looby2
Reviews.Content: Went for a 3 night break Two ladies on a shopping trip. Had a wonderful time, Hotel is enormous!! We stayed in a room with two double beds, It was very clean and spacious. I found the bed very comfortable. The Air conditioning didn't seem to be very effective! I must say it lacked a kettle there was a Coffee maker but that didn't help my tea drinking friend. We ate the basic breakfast and found it amplle with plenty of choice and as much orange juice as they could force down you. The staff were all very helpful and very knowledgable when it came to restaurants, places to go etc. It is still a very opulant hotel even if a few things need bringing up to date. Go and enjoy the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: mitch39
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from celebrating our 25th Anniversary at the Waldorf. We had a lovely stay at the Waldorf. We arrived early in the morning before our room was ready and the staff held our bags so we could go out for the day. The front desk called my cell phone at 12:30 PM to tell me they had a room ready for us. Check in time is 3PM. We did not get back to the hotel until much later and everything was perfect. No trouble checking back in and getting our room key. We had a lovely room. Very clean, well appointed. The bed was fabulous. The Waldorf bedding is superb. In fact, we loved it so much we purchased 4 pillows, the mattress pad and sheets. We had dinner at the Bull and Bear on Saturday before the theatre and the food was fabulous. I had the filet and my husband had the surf and turf. Yes, dinner was expensive but for something special this was the right place. I especially liked the area that the hotel was in. It was walking distance to time square etc, but it was out of all the madness. We found a great deli on 7th Ave and 50th street for breakfast. My husband and I will definitely stay at the Waldorf again. Also, the hotel's website is very helpful. We read almost the entire site and reviewed the menus before we went so there was no surprises as to cost. If fact we booked our dinner reservation before we left for the Bull and the Bear restaurant. In reading this site, we learned about their dress code before we arrived. I would advise reading about the hotel before you go.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel, Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: Troon17
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Waldorf for 5 nights over Easter Weekend and for our first trip to New York this was a wonderfull induction. From the minute we stepped out of the cab the bellman took our bags and directed us to the check-in desk. Every member of staff we came across was not only polite but friendly and always ready with suggestions for things to see and do in the City. The hotel itself is very beautiful in a very traditional sort of way which we loved, good sized, clean rooms with good views of the city (we stayed on the 40th Floor of the Waldorf Towers). During our stay we had drinks in the bar and a meal in Oscars - both very enjoyable. Perfect location for sightseeing and shopping. Although we walked nearly everywhere as we didn't want to miss anything by taking the tube, we did take the Gray Line Open Top Bus Tours which you can hop on/hop off at any sights you want to see more of. Recommend going to the 'Top of the Rock' for brilliant views of the city and much shorter queues then the Empire State Building. We will definitely be back to stay at the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel from 'Scent of a woman'”
Reviews.Author: celine41
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel. Just as luxurious as I had imagined. Went for 6 days before christmas and had a wonderful time. Had the most beautiful christmas decorations. Was glittery and magical. Pure elegance, the best design, the best furnishings- no expence spared for this hotel with tonnes of old school glamour. Not that much more expensive than other hotels but well worth the price. Treat yourself and stay there!! You will feel like a millionaire. Beds turned down twice daily. Spotlessly clean. Immaculate decoration. Very helpful, intelligent and polite concierge. Beautiful architecture and interior design. Very good central area. Great views.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but......”
Reviews.Author: CALIKris
Reviews.Content: My husband used all our Hilton reward points to book this hotel. We arrived at JFK, caught the New York Airport Bus to Gand Central and then a shuttle bus to the hotel (we could have walked, but had 2 large suitcases). The lobby is beautiful and check in line went quickly. When we got to our room and opened the door, a very strong odor hit us hard. Our porter agreed that we would have to make a room change, made a phone call, and returned with a hotel key to a standard rooom. The hotel night manager apologized for not having a comparable business class room, and offered us a much smaller deluxe room. We had no choice (we decided the smell was mold). We were told not to unpack, so that they could move our bags for us when a upgraded room became available the following day. Good thing we didn't unpack because the closet smelled awful, almost like moth balls, musty and moldy. We were gone for most of the next day and as instructed, went to the diamond reception office to pick up our keys to the new room. However, this arrangement was not complete and waited 20 minutes. When given permission to up, housekeeping was still cleaning the room. After waiting another 30 minutes for our luggage(and delaying our dinner plans) we had to call and wait an additional 10 minutes before it arrived. This room was quite nice. Beautifully decorated, no odor, great view of St Barts's church, spacious, a comfortable bed, and lovely art deco bathroom (the shower did not drain adequately). The complimentary continental breakfast was nice and you could choose from a variety of hot items for an additional $6.00 .The hotel is in a great location. Rockefeller Center, Grand Central, the UN building, Times Square, Theatre District and subway are within walking distance. Would I stay again? Probably not. Was it worth all our hotel reward points? No. This is a beautiful old building that needs some well deserved attention. For the prices they charge for accomodations, you would expect this hotel to be a well preserved landmark. The night manager was very nice, apologetic and went out of her way to find a shoe I left behind in the first room. I did not find the rest of the staff (other than our first porter) to be overly accomodating and thought they were only marginally polite. This historical hotel deserves better care and better reviews from it's guest.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Bruno52
Reviews.Content: We arrived home today after 4 nights in a mini suite. Overall, we loved it but perhaps partly because we got a great rate. The room was fantastic although street noise could be a bit of a problem for a light sleeper. I didn't like Harry's bar and we had a poor meal in Oscar's but the location of the hotel is superb. I would happily recommend it to people who are prepared to overlook imperfections and want that touch of class.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Waldorf!”
Reviews.Author: winston11
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day stay in the wonderful Waldorf Astoria. Since booking last October I have read with some delight and often disappointment the varied reviews posted by fellow travellers on this site. I am extremely delighted to say however that our stay was great. We arrived mid afternoon, in the parking garage. Thanks to the fellow tripadvisor reviewer we knew we had to go a couple of flights up to check in the lobby. The lobby was beautiful, old fashioned elegance and despite being really busy felt relaxed. Very attentive check in staff (even though our room was not quite ready) and helpful bell-captain made our first hour a welcome experience. Once up in our beautiful room (can only assume it must have been a refurbished one) we unpacked and relaxed for the start of our holiday. The room was clean, with lovely decoration, bed linen etc. No signs of the peeling wallpaper or mould others have mentioned. The bathroom was clean, marble and fresh paintwork stocked with toiletries etc. The heating seemed fine too, on/off and quite controllable, and anyone who saw the weather over the Easter break will know we needed warming up! Although we didn't eat in the hotel restaurants, we were made to feel free to wander, which we did up to the Ballroom, the Starlight Roof etc. The old world elegance was overwhelming in real life, the pictures really don't do it justice. Yes, I agree the mini-bar was expensive, but for soft drinks (and coffees) we just used Starbucks in the downstairs lobby and the hotel seemed happy to allow patrons to sit in its lobby and lounge areas drinking from a paper cup. Everyone did it - so did we! If the wallet allows we will definitely visit again. Thanks W-A you made us feel very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel, consider an upgraded room first”
Reviews.Author: pauloregon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Waldorf=Astoria for our 23rd anniversary March 2-5, 2007. After reading reviews on this website, I was quite worried that our stay would be terrible. I upgraded to a mini-suite before arriving and hoped for the best. It is true that this hotel has a grand, classic lobby. The Peacock Alley restaurant is quite good and great for a drink after being out all day. Check-in was quick and efficient. The 2-room suite was large and comfortable, pretty much what I expected. he only negatives were paint peeling off the ceiling in the bathroom and the noisy family (kids) in the mini-suite next door. It was nowhere near as bad as I expected after reading this website, most likely because we upgraded to a nicer room. If you stay here, make sure to bring some nicer clothes since it is not a hotel in which men wear shorts and flip flops! Would we stay here again? Yes, I would, but I would try the Waldorf Towers which I hear are even nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: SCTravelerCharleston
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 days at the Waldorf Astoria. I was nervous that the room would be tiny since I have 2 teenagers and I knew my son would have to sleep on the floor. (no rollaways) (We couldn't afford 2 rooms.) Luckily the room was a good size plus there was a very large dressing room so we took the bedspreads and made a pallet for him in there. He was thrilled because he had his "own room". When my daughter wasn't feeling well, the maid was very concerned. The hotel is within walking distance of the theatre district, Grand Central and lots of restaurants. We saw 3 plays and were not nervous about walking back at 11:00 pm at night. The one bad thing was that the sodas in the mini bar are $6.00 a piece. So we stopped at little stores everyday to bring back drinks to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Faded glamour”
Reviews.Author: HP_London1
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf has undoubtedly seen better days. But it is still a great hotel. What it lacks in recently refurbished rooms, it makes up for in charm and service. So the bathroom was a little tired and the room not exactly large but the it was clean, the beds comfortable and the linen new and excellent quality. The army of housekeeping staff were rarely seen but the room was even serviced when we popped down for a very late brunch on our first day. The aircon was controllable from the room and there were plenty of towels. Also, the proper coffee maker was much appreciated. On top of this, the hotel's location is fantastic. 10 min walk to great shopping and the wonderful doormen could easily get cabs to head downtown. It's not a modern hotel, it's a piece of old school glamour that is very much New York. I loved it, in part because it is a little faded, and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OVERATED & OVERPRICED”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugVancouver
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so disapointing. The rooms where very very small, however the linens where new, which is important. It has a central heating system so you cant turn down the heat.... Room was soooo hot. Needless to say that when we eventually got the window open (very hard to open) it was soooo loud. I wouldn't recommend this hotel, It is really overpriced & overrated! - However in NY, it is tough to get a decent hotel without spending a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “The Waldorf Baby!!!”
Reviews.Author: Littlel82
