Reviews.Content: Me & my best friend travelled to New York in January this year & after reading a few bad reviews about the Waldorf we were more than a little apprehensive to say the least.... Well all i can say is the people that write those bad reviews should be banished from all review websites...After six amazing days the only thing bad i can say about this hotel is it was a 5 minutes walk from the shops as opposed to the 2 minute walk we were hoping for..... The lobby is beautiful, the staff at the hotel were great & went out of there way to bring us a very special heater for the room and our room was amazing with a great view of the chrysler building....The beds are like sleeping on clouds and after six days both me & my friend were reluctant to return to our own & the breakfast is pricey but def worth it for one day of your stay..... We were so impressed with the hotel we've already booked to return next year.......So anyone havin doubts, don't listen to the bad reviews just look forward to the best hotel in New York....

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world”
Reviews.Author: MACK21
Reviews.Content: Where do I start with this hotel. Well simply Fantastic is all I can say. From the moment you are dropped off in the covered entrance the staff are waiting on you hand and foot. The staff escort you to the reception where we had a speedy check in and the bell boy took our luggage up to our room and what a room it was. We booked a Superior double room and everything about it was great. We were given a room on the 14 th floor at first but when we went into the bathroom and turned the light on the bulb blew, so we rang reception to get the bulb changed but they didnt change it, they changed our room instead and they couldnt apologise enough. We were not expecting to be moved just for the sake of the light bulb blowing. We were then given a newly refurbished room on the 12th floor. Room consisted of two double beds, a huge television and a seperate seating area. All of the public areas in this hotel are of a high standard and you are truly experiencing a hotel filled full of history. Location is fantastic and all of the main sights of New york are within walking distance. For your first visit to New York I would recommend this grand hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Only a nice lobby”
Reviews.Author: labergo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a conference. The Astoria has an impressive name and lobby but that is it. Our first room's bathroom was so moldy I could not use it other than to wet a tooth brush before brushing. I had to use the lobby restrooms for anything else. They were able to move us to another room. Both rooms however had decades old carpeting, thread bare comforters and wall paper peeling from the wall. Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly exquisite”
Reviews.Author: natalie83-7
Reviews.Content: What can i say? Beautiful, hotel, fabulous people, and extremly helpful staff. Dream holiday!! Cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf tops in my book!!”
Reviews.Author: pughpughbarneymcgrew
Reviews.Content: Fantastic travelled with my 14 year old son...great rooms..great staff...great service...fantastic bathrooms..an art deco lovers dream!! I WILL BE BACK I loved it

Reviews.Title: “Experience Historical Architechture and Presence”
Reviews.Author: kereng
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in NYC. We were only at the Waldorf two nights, but I was very pleased with the accommodations, service and staff. It was interesting to note the type of visitors that stay at the hotel. Many types of people can be seen in the lobby - families, average tourist types and business men & women. I was interested in visiting the Waldorf to experience the history of the building. I did not find the guest rooms to be very noisy at all. I could hear the person above me for maybe 5 minutes the first night and that was it... Although I don't think anyone was staying across from us in the same corridor. Guest rooms were cozy and quaint, not very big, but provided all the essentials... I could not find any issues with the cleanliness or physical condition of the building. Overall I was very pleased but would probably try another hotel in the city next time... just to try something new. I'm glad I made the Waldorf my first NYC hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel didn't live up to expectation”
Reviews.Author: rsn1977
Reviews.Content: Having booked the Waldorf Astoria on the basis I had heard from many sources it is one of the best hotels in New York I was looking forward to my visit. It was also my first visit to New York. Having encountered an un-pleasant visit through JFK airport (to be fair building work is going on) and a very unhelpful miserable taxi driver we parked up outside the hotel (legally) only to be told by a very rude member of staff to get out at the garage. Nothing of a welcome, hello, afternoon. The driver took us into the deserted dark garage round the back of the hotel where we unloaded our bags and tried to find reception which wasn't sign posted (luckily I sort of knew where to go as I read another report about this before we departed). We were taken into a private room to check in and went up to our room which was of the size I was expecting for $380/night not inc breakfast but it was in desperate need of a revamp for following reasons:- A lot of large brown stains all over the walls in the lounge room. Some panelling coming away from the wall. The air conditioning did not work except for blowing out hot air even at the lowest setting of 18 degrees. The shower head had come away from the wall. No hot water from the hot water tap in the washing basin. Considering the price I was surprised to find no complimentary drinks (not sure if this is isolated just to the Waldorf or for all hotels in New York). These problems didn't really bother us as we were only there for 2 nights and more interested in seeing what New York had to offer. Our main problem was a knocking noise coming from pipes inside the wall. It was a similar noise to trapped air in a home central heating system. It was quiet at first so didn't bother us but when we returned later that night it was louder. As we were shattered from a very long day we went to bed regardless. I woke up at 4.30am as the sound became unbearable. I called reception who confirmed it was a known problem with the hotels steam system during cold weather and there was nothing they could do about it. I couldn't quite believe they knew about the problem but still put us in the room regardless. No apology was provided but we were offered an alternative room but could only move into it after 3pm. As we couldn't put up with the noise we decided to get ready and start our sight seeing at 6am. On the 2nd night the noise wasn't too bad but it was warmer outside than the previous day. We were disturbed twice by staff who entered our room whilst occupied without ringing the bell (unless the bell didn't work). Bar staff and concierge were very friendly but the Bar Manager did drop a note to the pianist (via one of his staff) on the Saturday night to finish early which was disappointing as the pianist playing was superb. In fact many people stayed longer at the bar because of the pianist. I have stayed in far better 5 star hotels and would even go as saying I have stayed in better 3 star hotels. The prices were the only aspect I found of this hotel meeting a 5 star requirement and would advise booking in other 5 star hotels unless you are offered an extremely good deal. I won’t be booking in the Waldorf Astoria again but will definitely be going back to New York.

Reviews.Title: “I miss the Waldorf!”
Reviews.Author: clouisep
Reviews.Content: I miss the Waldorf! After 2 years of staying at the Waldorf on business, I have now switched companies and no longer am allowed to stay at this beautiful hotel. If you like charm and class, you will love this hotel. I miss it so.... No two rooms are alike, one of my favorites (I wish I remember!) was a room with 2 double beds - a VERY large dressing room with a vanity and floor length mirrors, stepping up into the marble bathroom. Lovely! I primarily stayed at this hotel for business. Oscar's was nice for a single person dining alone. The immense fresh flower arrangement in the main lobby will take your breath away. It is like no-where else. Treat yourself and stay at the Waldorf!!

Reviews.Title: “The Waldorf Experience”
Reviews.Author: bathtubjake
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly suprised to find a remarkable deal on a two night stay at the Waldorf on an early March weekend. We arrived by airport shuttle at the "motor entrance" to the Waldorf. The motor entrance was disappointing as we were let off in covered alley that was dirty, noisy, and confusing. In the modern era, no one is arriving by horse and carriage, and I doubt few are dragging their luggage down Park Avenue, so I am mystified why the motor entrance seemed to be an afterthought and an embarrasing one at that. The bellman was perfectly pleasant but pointed us in the direction of the hotel and we set off up a series of steps. The direction was not well marked and we did not see an elevator there. Once at the top of the second flight of stairs, we could see the lobby. The lobby was richly decorated in dark woods and colors that said "old money". There was a lovely flower arrangement in the hall that stood about five feet tall above the table. The staff at the reception desk was very pleasant and even apologized that our rooms were not ready at 11 am. We checked in, and left our cell phone number because the staff offered to call if our rooms were ready before 3pm (they did not call, and we received our room keys when we returned about 9pm). We asked the concierge where we could have a light lunch nearby. First, he called an Italian restaurant that did said they didn't open for a half hour. Next, he called another cafe just a block away, and told us they were open but did not accept reservations. Although, we asked specifically for salads and sandwiches, we arrived to find only a breakfast buffett and a staff that wouldn't even give us the lunch menu until after 12 noon. I was suprised that the Waldorf concierge had been unable to fulfill our simple request for a light lunch. We returned to the hotel about 9pm and presented our photo id in order to receive our rooms. We did have our 3 rooms in a row as requested. The rooms were small by modern standards, and one person's suitcase had to be kept in the closet. However, they were nicely appointed with a tv armoir, bench at the end of one bed, a desk with fax machine, and a walk-in closet. There was a little street noise on the 9th floor, but not enough to be distracting. The beds were made with feather pillows and a down duvet. When I called to ask that the bed be remade without feathers (serious allergies), the housekeeping office did not question and promised to send someone right away. The housekeeper arrived quickly and did the job, but seemed to be having a bad night as she spent much of her time in the room yelling into the walkie-talkie that she only had two hands and would get to the next room soon. Fortunately, that was the only time when the staff was less than pleasant. When we were checking out, we could not seem to find our way back to the motor entrance because the way out was not marked well, just as we were confused when we arrived. We ended up coming out of the lower hall at the Park Avenue entrance. The door man was very helpful and he had us wait there while he called the motor entrance and had our car brought around to us. I have to believe that this happens often. Overall, the Waldorf was pleasant, friendly atmosphere. The room was small but comfortable and the location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “It's a no-no. Pompous 3 stars.”
Reviews.Author: Divebabe
Reviews.Content: We recently got married in NY and stayed at the WA for about a week before heading to our honeymoon. How sad to realize that this 'Old-NY institution' has become just an impersonal, kitschy, stuffy, boring and pretentious conference centre. Actually the first problems arose already at the moment of booking: the lady at the Hilton-reservation centre provided us quite a good rate for an 'executive-room' , expressly guaranteeing that this rate was inclusive of breakfast and that the room was on the 'executive floor', with access to the executive lounge. Once at the reception we were faced with the first very very disappointing surprise: the lady at the reservation centre had allegedly made a mistake (I wonder how it is possible??), we were told that at the Waldorf no executive floor exists(!!) but only a so called 'concierge floor', unfortunately our booking did not allow us to stay at this floor. Furthermore the lady at the reception informed us that the breakfast was not included in the rate, neither was any of the facilities mentioned at the moment of the reservation. No one seemed able or willing to explain the reason for this irritating situation, the receptionist even seemed to imply that we were lying. Absolutely disgraceful! No apology was rendered. No solution was offered. Even worse: although we were willing to pay for an upgrade to stay at the concierge room this proved impossible, because the floor was fully booked! No alternative accommodation was offered. At that point we were, of course, already quite disappointed but the worst was still to come. The room was decent, not too small for NY-standards but definitely and absolutely in need of some improvements..stuffy, signs of age were visible which can barely be tolerated in a 3 star hotel but are unthinkable in a 4 or 5 stars. The service was simply not what you expect from an hotel like Waldorf Astoria. To say the least. On the wedding day my fiance ordered champagne and strawberries to be delivered at midnight, great thought...too bad that the champagne was actually delivered at 2 p.m., just when I was about to leave for the ceremony and therefore remained on the small table, in the room, getting warm until the moment when we finally got back to the room..at about midnight. Of course the mini-bar was too 'mini' for the bottle to fit. Luckily there was an ice-machine in the corridor. Still a better faith than the small treat sent by one of our witnesses which she expressly asked to have delivered to our room on the same day, together with a card, both the treat and the card never arrived at destination. Again no apologies, just a mumbled 'there must have been a mistake'...yeah, there must have been. Last but not least: when checking out I forgot a pair of nice lammy-gloves (a present to which I was very attached to) in our room. When the day after somebody of our wedding-party went to collect them...nobody knew anything about them and nobody had seen them. Yes, plenty of mistakes, a bit too many. But the firs and biggest mistake was choosing Waldorf Astoria for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: hapitraveller
Reviews.Content: I got married recently in New York and my fiancé and I each had a room at the Waldorf to get ready in, and we also spent the first night of our honeymoon there (before heading to Paris). I am so glad we decided to splurge on the Waldorf; our stay was completely magnificent and totally went beyond our expectations! The reception staff were so helpful and even arranged for our rooms to be next to each other. Upon checking in we both had complementary champagne and strawberries dipped in chocolate, as well as lovely cards congratulating us on our wedding and wishing us the best for our honeymoon. The rooms were immaculate with lovely, very plush furnishings and large windows on basically every wall. The beds were huge and comfy, the shower was warm, with good water pressure and a bathroom heater. Room service was very responsive and the staff went out of their way to ensure everything in the room was in good order. If you are prepared to forget about what you are paying, or you have a special event that warrants a splurge you’ll have a great time indulging yourself at the Waldorf. We treated ourselves to room service breakfast and a private car to the airport and these services combined cost more than what most of us would pay for an average night in most New York hotels – but it was totally worth it and heaps of fun!

Reviews.Title: “Quite Acceptable..but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: q9rve
Reviews.Content: I recall that I became acquainted with the name "The Waldorf" a few years ago when I heard it from somewhere, either the TV or on the net that it played host to numerous high profile events and that it is one of the well known historic hotels in NYC. With that, I decided to stay at The Waldorf on my next vacation to NYC, with the hope of experiencing "an old world charm" right on Park Avenue. After logging on to the hotel's website, everything looked great. Duh! They probably photoshopped it . With the hope of finding a good deal, I logged on to Expedia and got myself quite a good deal for a standard room at The Waldorf Astoria. I requested an early checkin as my flight from Bangkok arrives JFK at 7:00 in the morning. Arriving at the hotel, my first impression was that it looked quite old from the outside. But of course you can't judge a book by the cover! Cars are not allowed to park in front (on Park Avenue) to unload your baggages, instead you are directed to this damp crappy basement area, and have to find your way up to the lobby with no one to welcome you. (Remember, this is a 5 star!) Arriving at the lobby, I thought that this was Times Square, because it was soooo crowded. I can tell that only 20% of the people there were hotel guests. People taking pictures, posing with that "famous clock", walking around, kids shouting. The scene was quite chaotic, and I am not exaggerating. Nevertheless, we checked in and was told that the room is not yet ready since it's only 9 am in the morning. Since I am Hilton HHonors Gold, they were nice enough to upgrade me to the "Waldorf Towers" floor, and provided me with complimentary breakfast everyday. Shortly, I was taken to my room on the 42nd floor. The room was ok... but a very small size, not like the pics on the website at all! It's old...yes, but at least there were no cockroaches or spider webs. Like I said, the room was ok. It's just that I find it a bit too small. The bathroom was acceptable, and was of moderate size. Service is quite good though. I think that all the maids were trained to greet and sorta bow down on you everytime you walk pass them. The beds however, were extremely comfortable...I should've checked for the brand of the mattress. All in all, I am satisfied with my stay at The Waldorf, but was not impressed. Maybe all the fuzzes that I heard about it were overly exaggerated. If you expect this hotel to be like The St. Regis or The Four Seasons, then do not ocme here, because it is NOT. ** RESTAURANT REVIEWS** The Waldorf actually has a collection of many good restaurants, and I had a chance to dine in 2 of them. Bull and Bear Steakhouse (Formal) This is a really nice restaurant with a warm and romantic atmosphere. The restaurant itself is quite elegant, mainly from the decorations and the people that dines there. Great steaks! Very well prepared and the service was really nice. The restaurant is divided into two sections, the bar and the restaurant. I recommend the New York Strip! Oscar's American Brasserie (Casual) This is where I had my breakfast in the morning. Although it is always very busy, and you have to wait at an average of 15 minutes to get a seat, the staff are excellent in making sure that your water/orange juice gets refilled instantly. Great buffet, very wide variety and the ingredients are fresh. The food is quite good that you wouldn't really mind the busy, loud noises.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: lncd515
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to stay at this famous hotel, and am extremely glad that I did. The ambiance is incredible, and the service is certainly 5 star. If you are looking for a classic New York experience, the Waldorf is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Please do not go!”
Reviews.Author: punjabi1
Reviews.Content: Waited until my 50th birthday to go to this hotel, and I should have waited another 50 years. So average at best, and even below average for most of the time. Prices are so so high for such terrible service. Will never go back, arranged transport for a 6 minute drive and back ,in a lincon town car at the transportation desk and was charged $400! The next night we did the same journey in another, even better lincon for $20. They used to where masks in years gone by when the held you up, now they where black suits and work at the Waldorf! Really you should not consider this place at all, there are better places everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, very busy.”
Reviews.Author: barnkent
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at the Waldorf, the whole experience was on the whole a good one, the bed was extremely comfortable and housekeeping was spot on. The room was looking a bit tired and would benifet from a lick of paint, but it was clean and comfortable. Because of it's size the hotel feels very busy and there are no quiet areas. The service in reception is swift and pleasent. Be warned some of the rooms suffer noise from air conditioning units sited on the outside of the hotel, as did the first room i was given, but to the credit of the hotel i was moved to another room within minutes and without any drama. Altogether a good hotel, but not a peaceul one.

Reviews.Title: “Old New York!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoWanderlust
Reviews.Content: Just returned last night from NYC and stayed at the Waldorf Astoria with my teenage daughter. We had an executive king suite. The room looked like it had been renovated and the linens were great. It's a great location as far as shopping and walking to one of the Broadway theaters. We were two blocks from the subway which was convenient. We originally booked a room at the New York Hilton, but after reading the reviews, it sounded too much like a convention hotel. We went on ---.com on Thursday and got a room rate of $259/night for Friday and Saturday and $239 for Sunday which was cheaper than the Hilton and we thought it would feel more like "Old New York." We are so glad we did. The conceirge could have been a little more helpful, but otherwise we were quite pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the experience”
Reviews.Author: evansbrown
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf for 4 nights in January 2007 accompanied by my 15 year old nephew. It's worth staying at such a famous hotel - the pleasure of enjoying a drink in the lobby bar taking in all the period detail and passing parade of faces. Our room was quite small with some lift noise - the bathroom was also a bit dated but still worked well with good quality toiletries and nice towels - everything was very clean. The coffee is good quality however, I was disappointed no decent milk was provided. Enjoyed the food at the Hotel including room service. The staff were in the main quite friendly apart from one lady on the concierage desk who was persistently abrupt (almost rude) and unhelpful. Location is first class - walking distance to all the sites - Grand Central Station, Time Square, Radio City Music Hall and the Chrysler Building. Take the plunge and enjoy the nostalgia!

Reviews.Title: “Night on an Underground Platform”
Reviews.Author: millgent
Reviews.Content: Started well with a Waldorf salad for lunch and a smart haircut in the barber shop. However, the room was right next to the lift shaft and it was really like being next to an underground train going past at high speed every few seconds or minutes, even with ear plugs in. Complained to management, no other rooms, but cut the bill down. Crazy really, because we had paid more for a decent room but got a load of rubbish. The Waldorf buffet for lunch the next day was really splendid. Pity about the room. I suppose with an old building like this it makes business sense to hack off that certain percentage of the guests with noisy rooms like that, rather than simply close a whole column of rooms or relocate the lifts. Since there is no guarantee it can't happen again, we can't go back which is very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “A FANTASTIC WEEK IN THE BIG APPLE”
Reviews.Author: francisBelgium
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in the waldorf-astoria the first week of feb and had a great stay;everything was very luxurious and the staff was very friendly. the room (a suite on the ninth floor)was huge and very clean as was the bathroom,the beds were very comfortable .the only minor drawback was the street noise which I think goes with new york. checking in and out was fluid . we would absolutely go there again .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: nightaway
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in January for 5 nights and all I can say is WOW! I was nervous booking here as I thought it would be very formal and stuffy, but it's not. Too be honest yes you get people walking around in their fur coats, but you also get the holidaymakers in their casual clothes. It is a massive hotel and all the staff was very friendly. Check in was quite quick and we got a lovely room on the 39th floor of the Waldorf Towers. Our room was huge and had fantastic views, which I had requested at time of booking and also reminded the check in clerk and he obliged. The hotel is very central to everything, a few blocks from the Rockefeller Centre, Grand Central Station, 5th Avenue; we even walked home from Time Square. We didn't eat in any of the restaurants, had planned to but ended up having an expensive meal in a fab steak house one night that we decided that was our treat meal but I believe the restaurants are lovely. Wasn't overly impressed with the service in Harry's bar, on two nights we must have asked twice or three times for service. A tip would be to sit at the bar and not at the tables. It was bad enough trying to get a drink let alone get the bill. Overall I would have to say this is a great place to stay if you can afford that little bit extra, it's extremely central and you do feel like you are in a movie while staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: deepdvr_ca
Reviews.Content: Stayed there after Christmas. Smallish room and bath in the old part of the hotel. Service was excellent. Even though I am a Hilton Honors member, I am not the top level I once was and could not use that elite desk. Kind of silly. Check in proceeded quickly however. At this level of hotel, expect to pay for the little items and tip heavily. It is workth it.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up its reputation!”
Reviews.Author: virginiakoalas
Reviews.Content: A weekend commemorating a milestone event in NYC was fully complete with a stay at the Waldorf. Late night piano music/jazz at Peacock Alley was wonderful! The room was comfortable and clean (though the bathroom ceiling appeared to have some mold on it). Great bed and pillows. Loved the alarm clock system!

Reviews.Title: “A True Classic”
Reviews.Author: Pauly-london
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Waldorf, Feb 1st to Feb 4th 2007. Took a friend for their birthday, had booked two rooms over the phone direct with the hotel at a rate of $279.00 per night per room plus taxes. For this we got deluxe kings located on the 22nd and 23rd floors, one was smoking the other non smoking, and as a non smoker I would have been happy to have stayed in either room. Both were classically decorated with great comfortable beds, reasonably sized bathrooms, and comfortable furnishings - sofas etc. Views weren't great but you have to expect this as NY is such a crowded and condensed city, although there was a reasonable view of the Chrysler building frolm my room 2225. Rooms were clean and very comfortable. Little tip - if you plan to go and see a Broadway show, you may find it better to avoid the ticket desk in the hotel and book direct with the theatre. Upon our arrival I asked about tickets for that night for Avenue Q - Hotel quoted $170 per ticket, direct from the theatre agents they were $106.00 per ticket. The saving made paid for a very nice dinner. Of course there may be times when the hotel desk can obtain tickets that are simply not available, but it is certainly worth checking our first. Oscars breakfast was average so we chose to eat out on most occaisions, including lunch at Gordan Ramsay which was excellent and despite not having any stars was every bit as good as his London restaurant in Royal Hospital Road, and it was great to see that some of the staff were direct from his UK operation. Overall the Waldorf lived up to our expectations in every sense, and the only downside had to be how cold it was waiting in line for a taxi - little tip try getting your taxi from the the garage level rather than the Park Avenue entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Astoria A Great Getway Locale for Exploring NYC”
Reviews.Author: mindybaby
Reviews.Content: On a vacation with my two sons, I booked a weekend at the Waldorf Astoria Hotel and we had a fabulous time. Within walking distance of Central Park, Fifth Avenue shops and close to the Lex Ave subway, we galivanated around NYC from the Museum of Natural History (for that, we took a horse and buggy ride); hopped the Lex Ave subway for lunch in Chinatown, and ate hot dogs from the ever-present carts. Our room was spacious with a huge bathroom I could read in in a comfy chair (I dragged it in) as the boys slept.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: KTee:P
Reviews.Content: I was excited at the prospect of staying at what can only be considered to be one of New York's great landmarks - but my excitement soon turned to disappointment on arriving at what can only be considered a 'has been'. This started as soon as the lobby - where there were so few staff on check-in that the queue was ten deep. After travelling for the better part of 24 hours - this was the last thing I needed. Then the room - it was more like the spare room at a great uncle's place who hasn't touched it since the 50s or the 60s. There were absolutely no modern conveniences. The furniture was old (worn not antique). The heating didn't work properly. The room was small. Everything was overpriced. I disliked it so much that I checked out early and moved across the road. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Would return tomorrow”
Reviews.Author: D4SUL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Waldorf Astoria from 14th to 19th December 2006 and I have to admit to being a little apprehensive after reading some of the reviews. On arrival the lobby of the Hotel certainly has the "wow" factor and is always busy with people either checking in, checking out, sightseeing or on conferences (as was the case when we were there). If you want a nice little quiet Hotel then don't go to New York and stay at one of the tourist attrations! We did have to queue to check-in for approx 10-15 minutes but the staff were helpful and friendly at all times. One bonus was the free safety deposit box facility that the hotel offers - take advantage and keep your Passport and valuables safe ! We were allocated a room on the 11th floor (we had booked a king size deluxe) and had a side view of Park Avenue. The room was spacious, well appointed had a good size bathroom and one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. There was no sign of wear and tear, peeling wallpaper etc that has been mentioned in some of the other reviews. The room was also very quiet, we could hear no road noise or blasting of horns and had 5 nights blissful sleep. We were on a room only basis and actually never got around to either having a meal or a drink at the Hotel so can't comment on food quality/service - it was my first trip to New York and we were so busy that we basically just went back to the hotel to sleep. Our stay at the Waldorf was fantastic (it's location on Park Avenue is perfect) and we would go back tomorrow if we could !

Reviews.Title: “What a Grand Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MissBette
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf Astoria Jan 2007, with Hilton Honors points. There was a short wait to check in but staff and customers, alike, were very courteous. I think it's fair to say that my husband and I were thrilled with this hotel. Our room was very spacious and nicely appointed. We stayed in the "Astor Suite" It boasts a living room, bedroom, 2 bathrooms & 2 TV's. It was quiet, clean and very comfortable (also had plenty of closet space and nice robes). The staff was friendly, attentive and very helpful. We also enjoyed room service, having lobster & steak, both were prepared perfectly, and arrived to the room on a quaint little table with white linens and serving domes. What a treat! It was a pleasure to experience such a NYC landmark. We'll definitely stay at the Waldorf next time we are in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: manicsfan
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at The Waldorf for 5 nights from December 30th to January 4th. I'd always wanted to stay there and my expectations were high. We were told check-in time was 3pm but we had arrived early (just after 2pm) and thought we'd see if we could check-in early. We were expecting a wait to be honest but there was no problem and the extremely friendly and helpful Timothy checked us in. The room was a decent size (1 bed king room) and was extremely clean and comfortable. The bathroom was perfectly adequate with space for toiletries and was spotlessly clean. We had pre-arranged champagne afternoon tea and it was fabulous. The service was excellent and the staff were friendly without being over the top. We had room service a couple of times and the service, again, was excellent. It was also the nicest burger and fries we had during the whole trip! The hotel certainly has the wow factor especially in the lobbies and we can't wait to go back. The only negative I could find was when we sat in Sir Harry's bar one evening. The service was slow and the waitress got me the wrong drink - twice! However, I wouldn't let this put me off - we went in the bar on our last day and the service was faultless. A fantastic, traditional hotel that we loved.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Staff”
Reviews.Author: Leisure
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Jan. 1st thru Jan. 4th, 2007. While plenty of people were checking in, the wait was less than 15 minutes. The staff is what makes this hotel. They were extremely friendly and helpful. We were given complimentary vouchers for breakfast at Oscars when checking in. The breakfast was a buffet and was excellent. The waiters were attentive to our needs. The room is on the small side but not unusual for NY. We have experienced this at several other hotels in the area. We had no control over the thermostat even though it was a comfortable temperature. The bathroom was small and there isn't a place to leave your toiletry items. Plaster peeling on the ceiling but that is because there isn't a vent to pull out the steam. They delivered the newspaper to our room every morning. The hotel fire alarm went off twice, once in the evening and once about 8:30 am. On the evening alarm, they stated wait for further instructions but never came back with any instructions so we finallly went down 16 floors to the lobby along with other guests. We assumed it was a false alarm even though they didn't say that. The next morning, we ignored the alarm. The location is excellent and that is why we chose to stay at the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “a must stay in this famous hotel.”
Reviews.Author: stu&jess
Reviews.Content: myself and my girlfriend stayed at this hotel from 8th-10th dec 2006 at one of the suites. checking in was a bit of a problem as it was rather overcrowded we had about a 15 min wait which wasnt a problem as it was a very busy time of the year, the staff were very pleasant and looked after ourselves. there seemed to be a function on all day every day in every room so we were dodging lots of people dressed in tux`s and ball gowns. waiting for lifts was a nightmare as they slow and always crowded, so getting two bags in with everyone else didnt seem to go down too well, there was a lot of people who obviously thought alot of themselves staying there.(thats not the hotels fault) the room was fabulous very clean and tidy and so much space, it was very quiet at night so had a nice relaxing stay. location wise its good not far from tube and a short distance walk from shops which is worth doing. would definately stay here again, its my second stay here but the crowds didnt put me off.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, Location, History”
Reviews.Author: happysheila
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights, including Christmas. It was busy but, after all, this was the holiday period AND New York so what else do you expect? We found an amazing deal - $279 per night through AAA - so I assume we were in one of the least prestigous rooms in the hotel (the front desk guy told me there are over 1400 rooms). Despite being the 'poor cousins', I am left with the overwhelming impression of comfort and history. The room was pretty average sized, but the sheets were soft and the doona/comforter/duvet and pillows were oh-so-luxurious. The spacious bathroom was clean, the towels and huge floor mat were super plush, the toilet tissue was thick and soft (I'm sure you wanted to know that). There was plenty of storage space in the room so that we weren't stepping over ourselves to move around the room and all the fittings were in top condition and worked (which isn't aways the case in other hotels). The room didn't smell of anything; not smoke, not dampness, not horrible airfreshners; we couldn't hear noises from the neighbouring rooms and we had control of the air conditioning. On a more superficial note; the decor was homey and tasteful without being 'musak for the eyes'. The TV included internet access, however I didn't try it out. Instead, I used the business center downstairs (which was expensive but efficient). The 'fridge had a well stocked mini bar and the coffee supplied for the coffee maker was a really nice medium blend. Unfortunately we were only supplied with coffee whitener instead milk or cream, but there is a little deli across the road (Dominicas) where we could buy fresh milk and as we left each day, which picked up a treat-coffee from the Starbucks shop inside the front entrance of the building. The staff were all great: helpful, attentive, polite and sometimes charming, only one of them was snooty-polite; the rest were quite down to earth. Each day our room was cleaned nicely. We don't come from a tipping culture so I wasn't sure how much tip we should leave in the room each day (so we left about $3), but it didn't seem to affect the quality of the room cleaning (which is not always the case). The history of the place made it an extra special place to stay and you can feel it the minute you walk into the building. There have been movies set in the Waldorf, (eg 1945 'Week-End at the Waldorf ' or 2004 'Alfie') so it might enhance the experience to watch these movies before you stay at the hotel. Once you get there, check out the mosaic floors in the entrance and the art deco decor throughout the building. I regret that we didn't find some reason to spend some time sitting in the waiting chairs of the lobby and reception to enjoy the view and soak up the ambiance. Another great feature of the hotel is it's centrall location. It is one of the route stops of the grey line hop-on-hop-off bus tour. Its also a pleasant walk to central park. If you're comfortable walking a mile or so, you can easily get to HEAPs of NY attractions, including Empire State Building, Rockerfella centre, St Pat's Cathedral, Times Square, The United Nations and a large chunk of the Broadway theatres. Having said all that about the Waldorf Astoria, I'd be happy to pay $100 less per nite and catch the subway into the city each day from Brooklyn or New Jersey. But, as a once-in-a-lifetime treat, it was definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: ChristineZac
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a five night stay at the Waldorf (28th December - 2nd January) I have to say how disappointed I was with the hotel. Travelled with family (2 adults + 2 teenagers) for the New Year Period. On arrival the hotel lobby was absolutely jam-packed full of people waiting to check in. We had to wait a couple of hours for the room to be ready. We paid top rate even though we booked directly with the hotel and felt that it was not worth the money. Yes, the first impression was "wow" on entering the building but after seeing the room this was not the case. The room was a "deluxe" double-bedded room which for four people was certainly not adequate. The bathroom was tiny (and dusty round the edges) and the bedroom definately needed up-dating. I appreciate that it is art deco style but it didn't quite work. I didn't feel that there was any personal attention, I think we were just numbers and nobody actually asked if we had enjoyed our stay as they will fill the hotel regardless. I would look at other "boutique" type hotels for our next visit. We went to Gordon Ramsey's new restaurant at the London NYC and that was really smart. If you have the money stay there as the hotel and location is fantastic. Also the Palace hotel looked very nice, but again probably more expendsive than the Waldorf. Having said all the above - New York is a fantastic place to visit. We booked tickets for the Empire State Building on line but still had to queue up for about 30 minutes to actually get in the building but you then bypass the ticket office. Also I would suggest booking tickets for the Statue of Liberty as to go in the Statue they only allocate so many tickets per day, although you can still visit the island. Also went to the top of the Rockefeller Centre which was fantastic and I thought better than the Empire State. Central Park was lovely but the carriage ride was a rip-off as you only do a 20 minute circuit for 40$. Grand Central was well worth a visit as was SoHo for shopping as well as Macy's and Bloomingdales. My husband and son went to the Natural History Museum which they really enjoyed, they were there for quite a few hours! We travelled on the subway quite comfortably and didn't feel anxious as I would have expected. Finally on arrival we caught the train from Newark to Penn Street Station and then took a taxi to the Waldorf. Coming back we hopped on a coach (Newark Express) at 42nd street which runs every 15 minutes for $14 per person, as taxis are very expensive. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay at the waldorf”
Reviews.Author: baxterMississippi
Reviews.Content: *** GREAT EXPERIENCE*** we went for christmas dec. 22-27. i was a little concerned because of reviews i had read here.However, we loved it lovely hotel and great room(23rd. corner rm. overlooking park ave.) staff was first rate and a great location.Also,while your there see Jersey Boys best theatre exp.in many years.Happy new year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Busy- Quality vs quantity”
Reviews.Author: Hornet22
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel presently Suite 700F. Very busy Christmas period from 22dec - 27th dec. After travelling all night to get to the US we were told at reception at 10am that the room was not available till 3 that afternoon (check out time is 12 for suites then they have to clean the room). Lobby had a queue to wait for reception which took 15 minutes. Lots of tourists wandering through- felt like a lab rat-maybe I should have more bling on!! No transit room that we could wait in and the kids were very disappointed that they had to wait 5 hours till they could relax. Room is pleasant - homely. No view and the garbage trucks come past at 3am everymorning which is very noisy. The heater in the room looks like it was installed in the 60's and does not really heat the room. All in all I enjoyed my stay here - it was pleasant - but have to admit for this hotel is not coping with the amount of people. Service is hit and miss as they are overworked. Never rang concierge without being put on hold for 5 minutes - same with going down there to ask questions. Today is the 26th dec and it has taken 4 days to recieve the newspaper on the door. Yesterday breakfast turned up without preserves, coffee and milk. Was informed that we were booked into the Peacock Alley for lunch and after waiting in the queue for 30minutes was advised the booking was at the Bull and Bear - not happy, Jan. The meal at the B & B was superb and made up for the wait. Starbucks for breakfast is the tip. Stay again?? No. I have ticked the box. I feel that I am in an art deco building (which is nice) but the hotel is overcomitted (could be for the holiday season). Service is hit and miss and not personalised - I felt more like a room number rather than a paying customer.

Reviews.Title: “Suite Deal”
Reviews.Author: ssful
Reviews.Content: We got an excellant rate, for a suite and breakfast...150 dollars and the hotel was outstanding good service the breakfast was a buffet (Oscars and was very good) location was outstanding smack in the middle of Midtown Manhattan well connected to the subway and made most of the sites we were visting walkable...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience but Not As Expected”
Reviews.Author: Swecker
Reviews.Content: This hotel public areas are beautiful. The staff is somewhat stuffy. The rooms are well appointed on the surface and the beds are extremely comfortable. This hotel's room conditions just do not merit a 5 star rating from Tripadvisor or any reviewing publication.But for the same amount of money as the Ritz Carlton (Central Park or Battery Park), you are a fool to choose this hotel. Location is Great and Restaurants are Great. Please contact me if you have any questions. collier@alumnipropertiesllc.com Collier

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best!”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveller101
Reviews.Content: 5* + Tripple A, outstanding....I could go on and on. We took a suite here for five nights and Boy! I did not want to leave. It was pure heaven, beautifully decorated, wonderful amenities and super sized rooms. The staff were excellent, the food exquisite, the location the best. I cannot say anything bad about this hotel – if you get the chance stay here! I will be back – even if it is just for the delightful pancakes at breakfast – scrumptiously yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel..”
Reviews.Author: kruegerray
Reviews.Content: IF i don't see another Taxi or crowd, it would not bother me.. Never seen so many people. The hotel was excellent all around.. I love our room on the 16th floor... most of places were located in the surrounding area... Very hard to get a taxi though.. Never been scared untill i got in the taxi... I recommend the hotel for anyone going to New York.. A++++ All Around

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marriska
Reviews.Content: After reading the reports on Trip Advisor we were very apprehensive about the hotel. On arrival the check in was efficient, helpful and polite. The room and facilities were excellent. All the staff we met were friendly. Our regret was we didn`t get to eat at this beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Big but satisfying”
Reviews.Author: MangoChetney
Reviews.Content: Spent a hectic Friday and Saturday here during the week the Christmas decorations went up in Midtown. The hotel was crazy with a Nascar awards event featuring former presidents Clinton and Bush so first-timers to this hotel like us were both amazed by everything but saw the hotel service levels stretched to the max. We had a one room suite. Yes, there was some aging but not a problem given older grand hotels bear the same effects in our experience. GREAT location -walked to Rockefeller plaza and up 5th Ave. to Central Park. Had a terrific Waldorf salad at Oscars but wouldn't dine there again due to service. Our daughter and son-in-law joined us from Boston and we ordered room service breakfast that was wonderful. YES, the hotel food is expensive. Bathroom, decor, bed, quietness on 27th floor were all just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice suite”
Reviews.Author: shadwell_lad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip at $450/night as all other corporate rates were gone. For this I got a suite with a bedroom, lounge and bathroom with a view onto the Chrysler Tower. The suite was large and clean although not modern at all - I suppose this is the hallmark of Waldorf. The rest of the hotel was beautiful and I did visit a couple of bars including the Bull and Bear where the service was great and the barmen very tollerant of our antics in the bar! This is a great location for Manhattan and if you want some old style oppulence and good service then this is the place for you. If you want something more modern, then try The Palace that is similarly priced and one block away.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Wladorf”
Reviews.Author: mte22
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf is such a nice and historic property in a great location. The lobby is grand. The staff is helpful. The room was a reasonable $289/night. The linens were very comfortable and the room immaculate. However the room itself was somewhat dated w/regards to the faded carpeting and bedspreads. I also found the common areas of the hotel quite crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Classy is as Classy Does”
Reviews.Author: Msk6261
Reviews.Content: A business conference brought us to the Grand Dame of NY. It's not particularly our style of hotel and probably would not have chosen it but you can't deny it's a luxurious address. We are Hilton Gold members and requested an upgrade but the place was jam packed and none was available. They apparently still get a big convention/event crowd. He did however, place us on the most newly refurbished floor. No view but the room was nicely appointed and apparently well maintained. It was quiet with no street or other room noise. I was expecting a hotel that had passed it's prime but was pleasantly surprised. Everything was beautifull. The reason I am more impressed (in addition to the newly remodeled room and great mid town location) is that there was a major problem with the elevators during our stay. It was a major inconvenience for the guests. But...... I am a firm believer that it's not the mistakes you make but how you recover from them. From the moment we arrived, the staff was incredibly attentive. There were managers everywhere to help make things run more smoothly. They offered free breakfast for the entire hotel and had coolers of drinks in the elevator area to try to compensate for the trouble. It eventually got fixed but I was impressed with how they handled the problem. I wouldn't turn down another night at the Waldorf if offered.

Reviews.Title: “Lost In Comfort”
Reviews.Author: SIOBAHAN
Reviews.Content: My new wife and i stayed at the Waldorf Astoria for our honeymoon in mid sept 2006. As we entered the hotel we were greeted with up to five bellhops all falling over each other to help with our bags and give directions to the main reception area. At the impressive reception desk we spoke to yet again a more than helpful member of staff who sent us to our room which of course exceeded all our expectations. Space, comfort and not forgetting luxury were all awaiting us at our eleventh floor room. With a view over Park Ave i knew we made the right choice of hotel. New York boasts world class hotels and the Waldorf is most certainly one of them. We stayed away from eating or drinking in the hotel due to the expensive menus (26$ for two drinks) but found more than enough pubs and eateries in the surrounding streets .Although it must be said the hotel did supply a bottle of bubbly and chocolate covered strawberries for four nights in a row,a nice touch .I can do nothing but speak highly of the Waldorf and its staff ,yes it is expensive but you pay for what you get in New York. Try not to listen to much to the bad reviews on this hotel i guess some peoples expectations will never be catered for.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: BSW1958
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for two nights in mid-October. We had stayed here before and although we were not overly impressed on that occasion we decided to give it a second try. The central location and prximity to Grand Central makes it an ideal location for touring around the city, plus there are a number of nice diners / restaurants within walking distance. The main lobby / reception is still very impressive and spacious, and the staff were considerably more helpful and coureous than on our last visit, as was the room. Our room was spacious, nicely furnished, well provisioned and reasonably clean - although it did shows signs of it's age / usage. I would have to agree to a certain extent with other postings that this hotel survives mainly on it's reputation - they are far nicer hotels, and cheaper, in the area and I would certainly consider them before returning here. If your desire is to experience one of the grand old establishments of Manhattan then give it a try, but don't build your hopes up!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: JKY
Reviews.Content: Like other travelers, I was very nervous about staying at the Waldorf, specifically because of the amount of negative reviews of the hotel on this website. However, I was particpating in my one of my best friend's wedding, which was at the Waldorf (and all of his wedding-related activities were held at or near the Waldorf) Thus, I opted to stay there for the primary reason of convenience. I stayed at the Waldorf for five nights in mid-October. For two of the nights I paid the rate quoted on the hilton homepage. The remaining three nights I used hilton points. I arrived at the hotel and the taxi driver dropped me off at the wrong entrance. It was a side entrance and there was no staff to help me with my luggage. I entered the hotel and upon entering, a staff member asked if I was staying at the Waldorf. When I replied, "yes," he welcomed me and took my luggage for me. I checked-in very quickly at the reception desk. The person who checked me in was very friendly and upgraded me for the first two nights to a luxury suite. The suite was beautiful and very spacious! It was like a large three room apartment, probably about 1500 square feet total. There were three separate rooms in the suite and a large foyer area. One room was a sitting area with a large couch, two chairs, a fireplace, a TV, desk, fax, etc. The second room was the bedroom with a king size bed, large TV, two chairs, nightstands, etc. Also, there was a walk-in closet with a secure safe in the bedroom. Very spacious for NY. The last room was the vanity and changing area and bathroom. This area included a sitting area for the ladies to "freshen up," two good size closets, large floor to wall mirrors on both closet doors, a changing area, and the bathroom. The bathroom had a separate shower, a bathtub, and was alot of space for all of your toiletries, etc. There were a fair number of windows in the suite and they did provide a nice "city" view of the street, buildings, etc. Best of all, the suite was very clean and the carpet felt like it was just shampooed. I was very pleased with the suite and after two days had to check-out. I had a separate reservation for the remaining three nights b/c I had used my hilton points. When I checked out, I went to the Diamond reception desk for Hilton Diamond members. I had to check out by 12 and could not check back in to my new room until 3 pm and I didn't want to lug my luggage out of my old room for just three hours. So, the Waldorf staff had me leave my bags in the suite and they aranged for my bags to be moved into my new room. My new room was a double executive room. When I entered my room, my luggage was waiting for me. The room, of course, was alot smaller than the suite. I had a friend stay with me in the double and it did become a little "crowded" in the bathroom. The bathroom was small, not very much space for makeup, toiletries, etc. However, I did think that the size of the double room was sufficient/pretty good considering that it was in NYC. The room, again, was very clean. I also received two free coupons for the breakfast buffet at the restaurant Oscar's. You can upgrade the breakfast for a small charge and they serve freshly squeezed orange juice with FREE REFILLS! The food was pretty good and they have a pretty decent selection at the buffet. It gets crowded very quickly though, but the wait is typically no longer than 5 minutes. For those room service fanatics like me, the room service was good, but nothing special. I ordered room service on three occassions. The food was good, but nothing extraordinary. The service was prompt and friendly. The prices are a little higher than usual, but this is the Waldorf and NYC... I expected that much. One more thing. the LOCATION IS GREAT!!!! It is near the shopping areas, alot of great restaurants, day spas, etc. There are only a couple things that I would say were "negatives" about the Waldorf. 1. Because it is the Waldorf, it is ALWAYS crowded and somewhat noisy, at least in the reception/main foyer area. There are ALWAYS people taking pictures, or just hanging around in the reception area. Also, I didn't have to use the conceirge service at all, but I noticed that there was almost always a line when I passed by. Thus, the hotel isn't really "low-key." If you like the "bustling" atmosphere, then this wouldn't bother you. 2. The hotel can get noisy. When I was in the double room, I could hear alot of the traffic and honking from outside. But again, it's NYC and the hotel is located right off Park Ave. 3. The room temperature controls were not that great. They have some old heating/cooling system in place. I typically like the room a little toasty, but the heat did not work very well. It blew out, at best, lukewarm air. All in all, I was pleased with the Waldorf. It's a beautiful hotel. The hotel is probably best known b/c of its reputation/history and architecture, and that's probably one of the primary things that sets the Waldorf apart from other hotels. In all honesty, I don't think the Waldof is that much different from any of the other top hotels that I've been to. But the location is GREAT and I had a great experience overall, so I'd give the Waldorf another stay if I was in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: lambert47
Reviews.Content: had a free nights stay after complaining about our noisy, dirty,small room during our stay in jan 06. not much better considering our complaint from before, apart from a bigger room with a not so nice view! very dissapointing as this was our 4 stay.

Reviews.Title: “They took great care of us”
Reviews.Author: TampaJack
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Diamond member and used HHonors points for a two night stay (Fri and Sat). My son and I were upgraded to a beautiful room on the 24th floor. The room was immaculate and clean. In fact, we had to wait to check in because it had not yet been inspected by a manager, which they insisted on doing before we were allowed in. (We arrived at 2:00pm, earlier than we had originally planned.) The front desk clerk was extremely friendly and courteous, and we were given two drink vouchers to compensate for our wait. Very nice. All in all, it was one of the nicer rooms I've stayed in (I travel a lot for business and pleasure). All the staff seemed friendly. We enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: pvj
Reviews.Content: The room was small and smelled. The view was nonexistent. The shower dribbled COLD water. The minibar was exorbitant. The staff couldn't have cared less. Easily the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Exuberance, Elegance, Electric-Shocks!”
Reviews.Author: dustroom
Reviews.Content: An amazing hotel - glorious rooms, exquisite restaurants and marvellous service. The one little niggle is the constant electric shocks from the metal work. Maybe it was my shoes (though rubber soled), but everytime entering a lift or opening a door handle I was treated to a jumping blue electrical current. But even that didn't spoil the stay. Make sure you buy some robes :-) Top tip: on flying into La Guardia Airport make sure you either arrange a car, or better yet book a limo! The taxi rank just shove you all into one little cab and trust me, it doesn't hold four comfortably!

Reviews.Title: “Not able for disabled people with wheelchair”
Reviews.Author: Natsvilas
Reviews.Content: Even if some works have been done to adapt the hotel to people with wheelchairs, rooms and access to the hotel are not convenient. I booked the hotel for 10 days to discover New York with my brother who is in a wheelchair and cannot stand up. When I booked the hotel by phone I insisted on the fact that I needed a completely adapted room and a roll in shower. When we arrived, monday the 7th at midnight we discovered that my brother could not access the main entrance as there are a lot of stairs and no lift. To go to the lobby we had to take two different lifts as one of them was not working. When finally we arrived to the room we discovered that the bathroom was not adapted, a tube instead of a shower and the bars in the walls where not fixed at the well distance. The room was too tiny, my brother could not circulate in the room. I phoned the reception to explain my disagreement but nothing could be done as there were no adapted rooms available and we had to wait until next morning. Next morning, we went to Hilton New york hotel to see if they had rooms available and fortunaly we found a perfect room completely adapted for my brother. We came back to the Waldorf and explained to the receptionist that we were checking out. The manager came and excuse himself of the situation and offer us to take the suite but at this point we wanted to change the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: Nordish_by_Nature
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Waldorf Astoria during my holiday trip in 2002. I was expecting a great hotel with superior service etc. The hall and reception was grand and beautiful old fashioned. The rest was terrible! The service was bad - I asked for the executive floor and I was denied to access the floor. I was Diamond HH-Member at that time! Also the day to day service was not good - bearish and slow! The room was not nice. The furniture was scratched and partly broken - at the desk my girl friend wrote "dirty"into the dust. We asked them to clean the room nothing happenedAfter six nights we still could read "dirty". All in all the Waldorf was one of the worst hotels I stayed!

Reviews.Title: “The most expensive worst nights sleep I ever had!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 20january
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to end our recent holiday to NYC and Cruise to Bermuda. Before the cruise we stayed in a small hotel called the Blakely on West 55th and it comparison to the Waldorf it was fantastic!!! The Waldorf was supposed to be the perfect end to a perfect holiday - it couldn't have been further!!! We booked the room 6 months ago and when we got there we asked for an upgrade if they had any available, which they did. When we arrived in our room we were a little concerned as to what our non-upgraded room may have looked like. This was one of the smallest rooms I have ever stayed in and our view was of the aircon units servicing the building. As they had no other rooms to offer we decided to make the most of it and went out for dinner. When we went to bed I woke an hour later to the aircon generators stopping and starting on rotation like they were in he room which us. Then on top of that our room was close to elevators which ping twice when someone gets of on your floor - I swear every person in NYC was staying on our floor - that lift pinged twice on and off consistently between 1.30 and 3.30. When we finally went back to sleep we were woken at 6am by a constant creaking sould, when we went to investigate we saw that our room was directly opposite the service lifts which are shielded by a swinging door that has never in it's life been introduced to WD40!!!! This then continued for the rest of the morning until we gave up trying to sleep and got up. We complained, but as we had booked thru an agent they could refund the room rate, which I will now never do again as you have no come back. So we are trying to get a free stay in another Hilton Group hotel closer to home. But as the previous poster said, it would surprise me if we ever heard back. If you are looking for somewhere special to stay DO NOT STAY in the Waldorf Astoria - it is completely rubbish and the most expensive worst nights sleep I have ever had!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Iconic hotel in need of a good wash and paint”
Reviews.Author: Mattperks
Reviews.Content: I read a mixed bag of reviews on the Waldorf but as it is an iconic hotel and somewhere i have always wanted to stay i thought i would give it a go. We stayed for four nights and booked two rooms directly with the hotel as that was the cheapest option. On the day of travel one of my companions was unable to travel due to illness, which was ok as we were able to get our money back from the insurance companey, However we had a non refundable booking as such i asked the hotel if we could have an upgrade as we only needed the one room. i was told the Hotel was already "over comitted" and it was impossible...later to find out in the bar from a couple who had complained that there room had been changed 3 times before they had one they were satisfied with on that day. There were several things that ruined the break, the room not being made up twice! having been out for a full 10 hours sight seeing, trying to charge us $40 for some tea bags that should have been in the mini bar and the lack of newspaper on two mornings...minor things that i wouldn't worry about normally but together it was very annoying as was the apathy displayed by the hotel. On departure i highlighted all of these things to the management and was offered 2 nights free accomadation if i go back, which is ok but it means them getting more of my money. At the rates charged you can get better value the rooms are dated and i didn't feel the hotel was that clean, there was a table outside the restraunt covered in dust! On the plus side the breakfast was excellent...extremly good and the Porterhouse steak in the restraunt/pub type bar was also to die for. Food 10/10 the rest 2/10

Reviews.Title: “I'd Stay Again If the Price Were Right”
Reviews.Author: larover
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business and there is alot wrong with this hotel.....the first room I had had a bathtub with the enamel peeling in the bathtub. I was politely moved to another room where the phone was staticy, the tv remote had to be replaced and the internet on the television was not working. There were also some hairs on the bathroom door which were way too long to be mine. On the other hand the room was a fair size for NYC and very nicely furbished. It was very nice to have a biz meeting at the bar overlooking the lobby with a piano player, the lobby is quite nice, the gym was reasonable for a hotel and there are many dining options in the hotel. The hotel provided either a coffee maker or free coffee or tea delivered to your door anytime. The wide hallways are unusual except for the older hotels of which there are not many left in NYC and it does have great history and a touch of old world charm. I think it a bit unfair when folks say the hotel needs a billion dollar renovation. This hotel is no longer a five star hotel but it is also not charging five star prices. Rooms at The Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton and St Regis normally start at almost twice the rate or more than The Waldorf. You do get what you pay for. If you are looking for old world charm at a reasonable price for NYC this is a good hotel. If you want all the bells and whistles while also getting old world charm be prepared to pay alot more. In sum this hotel has some problems however as long as they continue to price their rooms on par with or alittle above other 4 star hotels I think it is worth it. On the whole I prefer it to any other 4 star hotel I have stayed at in NYC and I have stayed at about 4 other 4 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a let down”
Reviews.Author: Lucy123456
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf Astoria for one night and have to say that the experience was a bit dissapointing. The first room they gave us was pretty big for NY and pretty, but there was a low, thudding noise coming from the hotels huge airconditioning unit or something which was outside just on the same level as the room. I knew I would not be able to sleep in that noise so we asked for another room. I could not help thinking that this was the room they automatically offer to first-timers who don’t know about the noise problem in that room. The next room was in the Astoria Tower and it smelled like tobacco smoke. As we had been confirmed a non-smoking room we asked for a 3rd room.. The 3rd one did not smell of tobacco and was otherwise ok too. It just took a lot of time and energy to get a proper room. And I have never had to ask for another room before, despite loads of travelling around the world. As I have seen in another hotel with a prestigeous past the staff can be a bit snooty. And they seem to pop into your room rather often. We had put some bread and cheese in the minibar and were "scolded" by someone whose job seemed to be just popping in to your room to have a look at the minibar, in the evening of your 1-day stay.. Why not at the end of your stay? Another snooty example from the breakfast restaurant where we were rushed to the table and hastily asked "have you been here before?" in the meaning that do you know how this works. So they have many options for breakfast which come with their do's and don'ts, so the first thing in the morning (before your morning coffee ;-) ! ) you have to be sharp, focused and fast and absorb the rules. Why don't they just simplify things?! One breakfast type in one buffet table etc. It seems to be that "this is the way we have always done things" and you just need to read through the hotel manual so that you know what to do and where. I would not recommend this hotel to friends or family. It would be nice to tour it for the history, but staying there is not so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Just as well I am so in love with hubby”
Reviews.Author: Lunaghsa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the NY leg of our honeymoon. Upgraded by reception as it was our Honeymoon. Room TERRIBLE! We were moved to a slightly better room. Service is slow and slightly rude. Hotel trading on reputation only. I wish i had saved my money and stayed in the nearby holiday inn. If you are considering this hotel, DON'T! I am currently trying to get a response from the Waldorf in relation to my complaints and will keep you updated in relation to the level of customer care received but based on our stay I don't expect to hear from them soon, if at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the effort or expense!”
Reviews.Author: casalinda
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf Astoria for one night in September. It was definitely not what I expected from a world-famous hotel. I had always heard about how fabulous this hotel was but I was truly disappointed. From the time I arrived at the Park Avenue entrance there were problems. Bad entrance. Check-in was a nightmare with a long line of people waiting to check-in. Even though at least 5 people were working the check-in desk, the wait was terribly long. I was given a room on the 13th floor. The hotel was so confusing that I simply could not find the room ( ever). I finally found a phone on the wall and called the front desk and they sent someone upstairs to find me. The halls, while spacious, are very shabby and confusing. There are also two banks of elevators which the front desk does not tell guests about. The two banks of elevators service different floors and arrive in different parts of the lobby. My room was ok but small for a 5 star hotel. It looked like a room from the early 1900s. The furniture was old and shabby in a chic way but there was too much furniture for such a small room. There was a cabinet with a large tv in it. However, when the doors of the cabinet were open so that the tv could be seen, I was not able to get from the window side of the room to the bathroom/closet side of the room. I had to close the cabinet, move around the room and then open the cabinet again and then repeat the process every time I wanted to move to the other side of the room. There was a luggage rack in the room ( stored inside the closet) However, when taken out of the closet and set up to hold a suitcase, there was no place in the room ( except in front of the closet) to put the luggage rack. So everytime I wanted to get something out of the closet or put something into the closet, I had to move my suitcase. The bathroom was adequate but small. There was no inroom safe. The front desk has safes, but who wants to battle that line again? About room service--THE MOST EXPENSIVE I HAVE EVER SEEN. I ordered room service twice. Once I had a piece of cake and a scoop of ice cream and it was $40. The next morning I had breakfast-toast, orange juice and bacon and it was over $50. Too expensive-- the toast was cold and burned--I sent it back twice before I finally gave up. For the price of the rooms at this hotel, I would stay someplace else. This hotel is trading on its past glory and reputation. I would not stay there again and I would not recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Just the Best!!”
Reviews.Author: lauderdalebob
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Waldorf=Astoria the night of August 28, 2006 for one night in a one-bedroom suite at a rate of $399 which we booked over the hotel website about 6 weeks in advance. Boy! Our stay was so completely opposite of the bad reviews I've read here recently. Before booking our stay there I was very hesitant about the Waldorf since so many people had bad things to say. Our experience was nothing but the best! We arrived into LaGuardia around 12:30 p.m. and rented a car and drove in. Used the valet parking at the hotel which was pricey at $45 as I recall but quite simple to do. There was NO line at the reception desk and we walked right up to the counter. The woman behind the desk couldn't have been any nicer or accommodating and had the bellman take our bags and let us check right in even though we were a couple of hours early for the normal check-in time of 3:00 p.m. We were in Suite 10A the 10th floor corner (a corner in from the corner directly on Park Avenue) and both the bedroom and living room overlooked the dome of St. Batholomew's and down on the Cafe St. Barths where we planned on having a family reunion that evening. I guess we lucked out because the suite was beautiful. There was no chipped paint, no threadbare furniture in the room, the marble bath was new and beautiful, no smells in the corridors, etc. Both rooms were quite large with a VERY large walk-in closet and the bathroom had lovely Evelyn and Crabtree toiletries. The only negative comment I could make (and did make to the hotel after our stay when they requested any comments) was that in the bathroom the air circulation vent (which was located under the full size bathroom window) needed cleaning. We took a tissue and did clean out of vent the best we could, but this was no big deal. We like it cool and set the ac in all the rooms to the lowest setting and it was quite adequate. The following morning we had friends over and entertained them in the living room and ordered up from room service coffe and tea service for six people (which came to over $50), but was so convenient having them roll in a beautiful tray with coffee, tea, cups and silver spoons. Went down early in the a.m. and got from Starbucks (which is tucked away down a little flight of stairs on the left hand side when entering the hotel from the Park Avenue entrance) some pastries to go with the coffee & tea from service. Having lived in Manhattan for 20 years from 1970-1990 I was quite familiar with the beautiful grand lobby of the Waldorf and the only miniscule negative comment I might make is that one of the arms of the lobby chairs I sat in across from Harry's Bar was threadbare . . . and that would be about my only other negative comment. Oh! Almost forgot, there was one other thing that puzzled me. We did have turn down service at night (which I made sure we had because I called downstairs to request it) and it was done, however, there was no chocolate left on the pillow. Not a huge deal, of course, but most better hotels, cruise ships, etc., do make it a practice of doing that. Well, there you have it. Whether we lucked out or not, I don't know, but I can say our one-bedroom suite was really lovely and beautiful, IF you like the heavy gold drape, damask furniture look, which we do. I hope you take a chance and book the Waldorf and enjoy your stay as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “In Need if a Billion $ Renovation”
Reviews.Author: JMS
Reviews.Content: I had intended to stay at the Hilton Times Square, but when I saw that the rate at the Waldorf was less I thought I had scored a deal. I was wrong. Stayed at the Waldorf August 2-August 6 2006 during the heat wave. The public areas are old and beautiful, but the rooms are just old. The hotel felt like it was being cooled with a swamp cooler. The room was cool, but not cold, and it was dank. There was a major heat wave and I guess the ancient cooling systems in the hotel could not keep up. The bathroom was borderline gross with flaking paint on the ceiling and chips in the tub. One morning we were awakened by the sound of a plumber's snake being run down a pipe in the wall. After a very sweaty sticky day of sightseeing we arrived back at the hotel to discover there was no water. The front desk explained there was a "water emergency" in the hotel and that as consolation we could consume the two miniature bottles of Evian in the minibar free of charge. They need to close this hotel for a couple of years, gut all the guest room floors, and build a new hotel worthy of the Waldorf name inside the historic walls. I would not rate this hotel as terrible, it is in a great location, and the lobby is beautiful, but overall I would say skip it.

Reviews.Title: “An overpriced LaQuitna!!!”
Reviews.Author: monimo1974
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that, I have never been so highly disappointed in a hotel stay in my life. I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Waldorf (Sept 7-10). While the staff were very polite, that did not make up for the terrible accomodations of the rooms at the hotel. Upon entering, the lobby is nice - nothing out of this world, but that is about as good as it gets. We stayed on the 12th floor. When we got off of the elevator to the 12th floor, there was a stinch that reminded you of an elderly nursing home. It appeared that it was being covered up by a whole can of Lysol. The wallpaper was peeling, and the lighting was quite dim. Finally, we entered the room. If you love old elegance, this might be the place for you, but it is done on a budget. Our room had a huge square cut out in the ceiling. It looks as though it had been sheet rocked and painted. The comforters had blood stains on the backs of them.
