It was very stuffy in the room, and even with the air on it was still quite humid. Don't even try to wash your hair in the shower, as the water pressure is tooooo low. The rooms were very dusty. Dust was flying everywhere. I went to the Front Desk Manager to ask for a refund, and to see about moving to another hotel. I told him that in my opinion the hotel appeared to be an overpriced LaQuinta. Even on a good day, a brand new LaQuinta would give the Waldorf a run for its money. Needless to say, he would not give give us a refund for the 3rd night stay. The first 2 nights were on Hilton Honors points. BEWARE-even if you do have points, do not waste them here. Use them at another Hilton hotel in NY. I have stayed at various hotels in NYC. This is by far to be a 5 star hotel, definitely becoming a falling star.

Reviews.Title: “Old Style Elegance and Service”
Reviews.Author: Ken_R21
Reviews.Content: Having just crossed the Atlantic on Queen Mary 2 we were a little apprehensive about our stay in New York having read a couple of negative reviews about the Waldorf. Needn't have worried though, although we cannot vouch for all the rooms obviously, the standard double we had was very good, clean & comfortable. The only problem we did have was that the room was too cold on arrival and turning off the air con did not make much difference. Staff quickly brought up a heater for us and explained that the hot water heating was not on as it was not usually needed in early Sept. Room service/mini bar very expensive: e.g. gin $9 + tonic $6.75 = $15.75 (approx £8.70), small chocolate bar $3.75. Oscar's restaurant (attached) do a good full buffet breakfast at $24; dinner for two with pre-dinner drinks & wine (3 courses) was $130 inc tax & tip (about £70) Overall a very enjoyable experience which made one feel rather special.

Reviews.Title: “This grand old hotel is nothing more than your average business hotel!”
Reviews.Author: alexandermals
Reviews.Content: I am very late with this review (we stayed in June, '06) but I was so very disappointed that I was just shocked. I accompanied my husband on a business trip. We were lodged at the Waldorf for 7 nights. While I have to admit the lobby was grand and beautiful, the ambiance doesn't go past the ground floor. The nicest thing I can say about the rest is that it's tired, none too clean, badly maintained, and the furniture is scratched and threadbare. I see alot of luxury hotel rooms and this is no better than your run of the mill business hotel, and frankly, worse than some. The Waldorf is cashing in on the name and history. The room staff was very nice, but the lobby staff is snooty and condescending, IF they acknowledge you at all. This place is also convention central so do not expect any peace and quiet. The walls are thin and you can hear everything from surrounding rooms and the hallway like it's been amplified. Let me just say, I love and have stayed in many historic hotels and would gladly return to them, but this one isn't worth the bother. And forget about amenties...what ameneties? You will pay out the nose for things like internet, room service, bar service....just about anything except for the room itself. It is ridiculous when you consider that people pay up to $600 for just your basic room!

Reviews.Title: “Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Simonkf
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at the Waldorf for 3 days at the end of May. While it is undeniably a very fine hotel, I am sad to say that it simply does not live up to its reputation. I am surprised frankly that it is a five star hotel! It would not be a five start hotel in London, or Europe, no, I am shocked about that - there are lots of real 5 star hotels in New York. By 5 stars I son't simply mean the dated decor and furniture of the rooms, or the peeling and frayed plaster of the corridors, i also refer to service - which was polite, but only polite. I asked the concierge about a rental car, he gave me the telephone number of Hertz! I was locked out of my room - because the key they gave me stopped working - the staff demanded I return to reception - which is quite a long way - they only came to the room to let me in on my insistence. There were too many instances of this type of service over just 3 days. Finally to top it off, they over charged me on the room rate!! Different to the reservation - they did refund this - but not immediately - I had to wait a month and provide them with a copy of my reservation - they obviously didn't have a copy themselves. So they were a few problems with my stay, a few problems with the service and with standard and maintenance of the decor! And don't forget the famous NYC water pressure in the shower - issues that the Waldorf shares. I would also like to point out to a previous reviewer on this hotel, that it IS INDEED possible to have old antique furniture and fixtures and fittings and for them to be in good good condiditon. The fact of the age of the hotel etc does not excuse the frankly shabby furnishings and decoration not just in the rooms but also the corridors etc. So although i loved my stay!! I really did, the atmosphere and the location, i have to say that it is no where near a real 5 star hotel. It is a 4 star hotel. You cannot compare this hotel to the Landmark and Ritz in London, the Ritz or George V in Paris, the Baglioni in Bologna and Venice, the Metropole and National Hotel in Moscow, the Penisula in Hong Kong or indeed a few other real five star hotels I have stayed at in NYC. Yes I have stayed in the places in this list, I know what a 5 star hotel is.

Reviews.Title: “The best!”
Reviews.Author: JM_Maa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Waldorf for 5 nights with my wife. We both loved it. At the check-in I asked to have a room as high up as possible and they upgraded our room for free. From the 25th floor we had a splendid view of the Chrysler building. I paid 300 dollars per night. In my opinion it was definitelly worth it. Everything was first class. The bed was comfortable, the room was large and in good shape (considering the age of the hotel), the furniture was elegant. The hotel has some rules for the customer's clothing. For example T-shirts are not allowed in the lobby. I saw some people wearing just T-shirts and nobody seemed to mind, but my recommendation is: take your better shirts with you, because you'll feel better, when you are dressed appropriately. It is a walking distance from Waldorf to the theaters at Times Square or the shop at 5th Avenue or to the Central Park. Alamo car rental is only one block from the hotel. We ate room service breakfast one morning. It was mouthwatering, but the total cost for 2 persons was over 60 dollars. So if your budget is not limitless, you might consider eating out. On the other hand if money is no problem for you, then you'll be delighted with the restaurants at Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: maritza1101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf Astoria for Christmas vacation the week of December 26 2005 thru January 2 2006. This is a lovely and Grand Hotel, and still has that elegance and glamour that is well-known for, plus it offers a great location. The lobby is a great place to sit and people watch, but who would want to do that in New York City. Service at check-in was polite, helpful and super fast, our rooms were clean with a large bathroom and the beds were very comfortable. This was our first trip to New York City, and we had a great time, can't wait to go back for Christmas vacation again and of course we will stay at The Waldorf Astoria one more time.

Reviews.Title: “Grand But Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pitts
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in Aug. in a suite, $400 per night w tax. As most of the postings stated. This is a very old hotel. Some things are updated but most of the rooms are not. Thats part of the charm. If you want a new hotel all clean and shiney, go to the Trump. Positives: Beautiful lobby of grand style. Rooms are of fair size and clean with comfortable beds. Centrally located to shopping, theater, Time Square, Radio City etc.. STAFF: Among the friendliest, most efficient I have found in NY bar none! Everyone including housekeeping wants to know if you are enjoying your stay or if there is something else they can do. Negitives: Rooms are very dated with paint peeling from the bathroom ceiling. Shear curtains dirty and worn this was a turn off. Bathrooms very small but that's the way they were back in 1931. Furniture was in good shape as was carpeting. TV's in suite small and old. No plasmas here! Also, room service is extremly expensive even for Park Ave., High prices with $4.50 per person charge plus 15% Martini in bar is $16.00 per, food in resturant is somewhat expensive. Business Center: We printed out tickets and it was $6.50 for internet and .80 per minute YIKES!!! OVERALL: Based on staff and other considerations, Above Avg. on the high side but not Excellent. Again, it's old so some of these things you see in my posting and by others in unavoidable due to age. Some others such as extensive charges to guests and dirty curtains can be corrected if management wanted to. After all, Mgt does go through these rooms from time to time. All things said, based on the staff and charm we will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: evjolin
Reviews.Content: Perfect stay in the city. We arrived early, and our room was not ready, but they could place us in a lower-class room immediately. We chose that, and were thrilled with the room, a standard deluxe king (no pull-out couch). The room was much larger than expected, though by the chart on the back of the door, it was definately one of the largest on our floor. Bathroom was spaceous as well, and of course the service was impeccable. If you stay, make sure to wander through the event rooms--lovely art deco decor worth exploring! they also managed to squeeze in a last-minute half hour massage, also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: CaptainPlanIt
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Waldorf was simply out of this world. I am a Hilton Hhonors Diamond level frequent sleeper and made our reservation 11 months in advance redeeming points for a free nights stay. Then a week before we arrived I wrote the general manager a snail mail letter advising him we would be staying there on our wedding night. The results were astonishing. I received a call two days before our arrival from someone at the Waldorf telling me that we had been upgraded to a luxury suite and inquiring our estimated arrival time. When we did arrive we were driven by a car service and were directed from the front of the building on Park Ave. to the Towers entrance on 50th St. There a bellman took our luggage and gave me a chit as we then went to the top of Rockefeller Center for sunset. When we arrived back at the hotel to check in there must have been 14 available desk clerks able to assist us. The one we approached noted on his computer that it was our wedding night and asked if we liked champagne. The form for redeeming the room with points was in my luggage, and the clerk told us not to worry. I exchanged the luggage chit for the room key and off we went. Our room, 14H, was a corner suite. There was a marble foyer with a wet bar; a sitting room with sofa, chairs, fireplace and built in bookcases (with books); a bedroom with a four poster king size bed and a walk in closet with two robes; a dressing room with a make up table, fainting sofa and a five foot by seven foot floor standing mirror; and a marble tiled bathroom with his and her sinks, a shower in a tub AND a shower stall (with five nozzles) and the toilet ~in~ a closet. The windows inthe various rooms looked out on Park Ave except for one in the living room which overlooked 49th St. and down Park Ave. to the Met Life building. Just a few minutes after we arrived there was a buzz at the doorbell (!) and a bellman arrived with our luggage. He carried all the bags into the dressing room where he unfolded the luggage stands and set our suitcases on top of them. When I couldn't find my jacket with my wallet to tip him he waved "no thanks" and let himself out of the door. On a table in the living room was a tray with an ice bucket and a bottle of Waldorf-Astoria Champagne, a plate of chocolate dipped strawberries, two flutes and a note from the general manager thanking us (!) for choosing to spend our wedding night with them. We sat on the sofa and sipped our champagne, ate the berries and relaxed our first night as husband and wife. Just as we were finishing the doorbell rang again and another (!) bottle of champagne and plate of strawberries were delievered. The note on this tray was from the clerk who checked us in. I ordered a room service breakfast, hung the card on the door, and we put the second bottle and berries in the fridge in the wet bar for the morning. The bed was wonderfully comfortable. In the morning our breakfast was delivered at the exact time we had checked on the form, and though I laughed a lot at the $73 charge for six muffins, two glasses of juice and a pot of coffee, it was worth every penny. The cart was wheeled in with a linen tablecloth and napkins. Two folding leaves easily opened up to make it a nice size table. The butter was in an urn sitting atop a pile of ice to keep it chilled. The muffins melted in my mouth and the croissants so buttery they didn't need any more. There was real cream for the coffee, which was rich and dark. The silverwear was heavy and the plates monogramed with the distinctive Waldorf-Astoria logo. We enjoyed a leisurley breakfast, and then opened the other bottle of champagne and ate the strawberries in a hobbittlike second breakfast. I called and inquired about a late check out, but was told none was available. We didn't vacate the room until about 12:30, which was still fine with us and no on had any issue with that at all. As we were leaving the room I opened the card that came with the second bottle of champagne. In it was a coupon for breakfast for two at Oscar's, one of the restaurants on site. When we were checking out in the lobby I mentioned to the clerk that we hadn't used it because we'd ordered room service and he converted it to lunch for two. We gave our bags to a bellman and walked around the city a bit before heading to lunch. There was no problem using the coupon, which included both an appetizer and an entree. We, of course, had to try a Waldorf salad. We went to retrieve our bags in the bowels of the building and thought we would have to then roll them out front to Park Ave where the car to take us to the airport was supposed to meet us. The bellman asked us our name and who the car service was, told us to have a seat and he called the service, the car materialized in the undergound passageway, the bags were loaded in the trunk and the rear door was held open for my wife. What incomparable service! I know our experience is not the norm, but we didn't want the norm when we planned to spend our wedding night at the Waldorf-Astoria. Every person we encountered there, from bellmen to desk clerks to the bartender in the restaurant was polite to a fault, gracious and warm. I had high hopes for a memorable stay when I booked the Waldorf, and they were exceeded beyond my wildest dreams.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: woodysloan
Reviews.Content: When my cousin's decided that we would stay at the Waldorf for our 1 night in the city, I was a little concerned after reading some of the reviews (especially since this was the final leg of a long trip from San Diego). However, the Waldorf exceeded every expectation. The lobby is beautiful, staff attentive and kind and our room had high ceilings, fireplace, view of the city, granite bathroom and every amenity. Our room was in the Waldorf Tower - so if you go, you may want to request that section. It was my cousin's anniversary - and they comped us all breakfast at Oscars in the hotel - which was great. The hotel is centrally located - within walking distance to everywhere. And yet quiet - which is a definite plus in the city that never sleeps! All in all - a grand hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Met All Expectations”
Reviews.Author: CITYBREAKERSCAMBS
Reviews.Content: Simply fantastic hotel. Arrived after very good flight to see live filming outside the hotel of Law & Order! Hotel interior still retains the elegance of a long gone age - we had booked a suite and were on the 27th floor with a view of the Chrysler Building. Roome excellent , 2 bathrooms and sitting room as well as 2 very large beds. Room service excellent and all staff extremely helpful at all times during our stay. Excellent location evey main attraction was easily reached on foot. If go to New York again this would definitely be our No1 choice.

Reviews.Title: “Always the very best!”
Reviews.Author: ModernTraveler
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Waldorf Towers. Again, only the very best. From the staff to our 900 sq foot suite that was upgraded for us. Thanks to the Waldorf and the Hilton Company.

Reviews.Title: “OVERRATED”
Reviews.Author: sumnereli
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at the Waldorf Astoria, I paid $290 a night (corporate rate), this seemed reasonable enough in comparison to other hotels in this area. The good, very convenient to where I was working (Park Avenue). Walking distance to a wide array of "New York" sites. The hotel was not horrible overall, the room was a little dated but comforable. The bed was very comfortable, I slept great all evenings. The turn down service was nice and the staff was OK. The Management is even sending my cell phone charger which was left in the room, major points for this kind gesture. The bad. As mentioned, the room was very dated, paint was peeling in the bathroom, carpet was coming up. Windows were old and dirty. room was small (i realize this is common for midtown hotels). charged me $1.50 to use my phone card in the room (was not clearly disclosed. Bottom line, a colleague of mine was staying at another hotel for roughly the same price. the room was more updated, larger and about a block away, I would probably never say at the Waldorf again unless it is updated. The word that came to mind upon first enerting the room was "OVERRATED". this is a Hilton property and apparently the name recognition is all people are looking at when booking this hotel. Beware of the overrated Waldorf, there are plenty of comparable rooms in the area that are as good or better for the price

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 2nd stay !!!”
Reviews.Author: Zunipink
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time to stay at the Waldorf in the past year. My first stay was brilliant but this one was even better. When it was discovered that we were there to celebrate my son's 21st birthday, everyone was so nice and we were even given an upgrade to a mini suite !! ( 23rd floor ) At one stage my son went to the desk to ask a question and was congratulated on his birthday just by the lady looking up some detail or other and we were given a complimentary breakfast the next morning !! I have read the negative comments here regarding this hotel and I understand that things can go wrong, but honestly the "quality of the shampoo & shower gel" to me is going a little too far ! I am sure I am not the only traveller who brings their own bathroom supplies !!! The staff could have not been more helpful from the time we arrived until we left. We had dinner room service only once and yes it was expensive but we worked it out that it was a Friday evening and even if we had gone out for a nice meal it would have cost a lot more. We were just exhausted on that night and needed a relax !! Will definately return !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Holleeds
Reviews.Content: We have just had 5 nights at the Waldorf and really enjoyed it. Maybe we were lucky, but our room was newly decorated and refurbished. It was in the 16th floor and overlooked the church of St Batholomew next door, which is a good place to eat as they cleverly utilse a paved area as a restuarant. The room itself was tastefully renovated and had the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. If I was going to make any complaint it would be that the windows were very dirty but I don't suppose it is easy to clean them very often in high rise buildings. Overall, we thought it was a lovely and grand hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: rhirsch1
Reviews.Content: We travel to NYC about 2-3 times per year for pleasure. This was our first stay at the Waldorf (past hotels NY Hilton and Towers, Algonquin, Roosevelt, Ritz on Central Park, Essex House, etc) and this was by far the best experience. Service was polite, helpful, and fast! Rooms were extremely clean with a very comfortable bed. Great location. We actually could not find any fault with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “In serious need of updating”
Reviews.Author: KIKIBO
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in the Waldorf in April. It was two nights too many! While I'm sure the hotel was once the most stylish and fashionable place in New York city, it has now really passed it's prime. The rooms and furnishings are old, grubby and smelly. The bathrooms have clearly not been renovated in decades - old stained baths, mildewed shower curtains, discoloured tiles and mirrors. The entire corridor on our floor of the hotel had a disgusting smell for the duration of our trip. We compalined about our room and were shown to another equally dated and grubby bedroom. Needless to say we declined and were instead given tokens for a complimentary buffet breakfast. The breakfast is extremely poor. Very small selection, an over-crowded room and bad service. The hotel lobby is absolutely stunning, and the location is perfect for Fifth Avenus shopping. But these are the only good points unfortunately. We will NOT be returning.

Reviews.Title: “no Hot water at the 5 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a Guest of Waldorf Astoria in New York I was desapoited. 3 nights and one of them from 5 pm to next day morning I tryed me ,my wife and my 2 kids at room 1036 were with no hot water!!! For more than U$400.00 a night!!! nobody from the hotel sttaf solved this problem on june 24th 2006. I was about to have a very good night at New York wearing new clothes that I have bougth in an afternoon summer day shopping.When I realize in my bathroom there was no hot water to have a shower!!!I Imagine go to a special dinner, a broadway theatre without a shower! Come back to the hotel after a nigth like this waiting for a good shower to have a very comfortable sleeping and NO HOT WATER FOR ALM OST 24HOURS !!! Who can help me??? It`s an absurd a legendary hotel with no hot water and no notice about this problem for the guests! They said just sorry about that!! Ricardo Vieira Maria Faria and Kids. teclecomigo@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: Targa25
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New York and we'd always fancied a stay at this famous establishment. Well it took three attempts at getting an acceptable room!! First one still had previous guest's make-up and tissues in the drawers and large stains on upholstery. Second one was clean but very ordinary, third one clean and spacious. Restaurant downstairs kept us waiting for nearly half an hour after our booked time before we were able to sit down. A supposedly medium steak was in fact very rare, which meant another long wait for that person whilst we others proceeded with our meal. Quality of the steaks were otherwise super. It is an interesting place to just sit in the lobby and people watch but it appears to be rather tired.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf with my family in April. Although I am not sure of the name of the type of room it was, the room did had a large bathroom, a well-sized changing / sitting / getting ready room with a full vanity, a couch and two large closets. The beds were comfortable and the staff was pleasant. Some of the paint on the trimming was chipping but that did not bother me. Because it is New York City and there is a million things to do at all hours, we truly only used out rooms from sleeping, showering, and getting ready for the day and night, however, I am sure if we used all of the ammenities the Waldorf supplies, we would'nt have to much to complain about. All in all, it was a very nice hotel and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: J & L Stirling
Reviews.Content: We booked the Waldorf as part of a luxurious holiday. The reception areas are splendid but flatter to deceive - the staff are unsmiling at best and arrogant or sullen at worst and we encountered all three. The Waldorf is undoubtedly surviving on its past reputation and we got the clear impression that we were priviledged to be there and the staff had to do nothing to please. Far from being made to feel important as a customer the atmosphere created is one of indifference. The room was comfortable but could best be described as faded elegance and really needed a fair bit of smartening-up it had no view other than the air-conditioning system and brickwork. On a trip with five star accommodation this rated the bottom - we will not stay there again - it was the low point of a second visit to the great city of New York.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise in NYC”
Reviews.Author: TheVastMachine
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf on a corporate rate (ROH room) for about a week last October. Having read the reviews here, and having stayed at many different hotels in NYC over the years, I was a bit apprehensive. However, my fears proved to be unfounded. Check in was quick and friendly. My first room was right behind the elevator on the 13F (and unlisted on those little signs that point the way to your room!), but the hotel only took 15 minutes to find me another room away from the elevator, stair wells, maid's room... While I was waiting for the hotel to call me back, the staff who checks the minibar came in and after hearing that I was waiting to switch rooms, gave me a bottle of water to drink while I was waiting! I was asked to wait in front of the new room for security to let me in, but after 20 minutes I just went down to reception to pick up the key myself. (Security showed up about 45 minutes later...) My new room (1303) was terrific - big room, quiet, huge bathroom, amazing water pressure - perfect. It was a bit noisy the first night with street noise but fine for the rest of the week. The internet was not too pricey as I remember but it did cut out quite a bit. Basically usable but not perfect. The beds were a little on the soft side, though, which might be a concern for some people. Service was fine - for some reason I chucked out all of my breakfast vouchers but the hotel replaced them instantly with no questions. The breakfast buffet itself is basic but the waiters and waitresses were fun. A great room, no service issues - a very pleasant surprise in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CathyOhio
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Waldorf from June 14 - 19, 2006. I was a little worried from reading some of the reviews of the rooms but we had no problem. We had booked a deluxe double bed room and ended up being in that type of room but in a handicapped accessible room. The room was about 340 square feet and we paid 269/259 per night. We got the internet price through the Hilton site where you have to pay the full fee up front. I had asked for extra pillows and towels when I reserved the room and they were in our room when we got there. Staff was friendly and maid service was adequate. I felt like for what we paid and what we got was very fair.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My second time at the Waldorf=Astoria was repeat of the first. Hotel lobby and other areas are astounding and very nice, but I tend to think the hotel is resting on past reputation. The room was run down with paint peeling in the bathroom, paint drops throughout and tub cracked and chipped. Despite several requests for help, we never got help with heat/air problems and television remote problems. Valet parking required us to call 30 min in advance, but always when went to retrieve the car, another 30 min wait as car was not retreived previously! The beds were new and very comfortable though. As a Diamond level Hilton member I found the room and service lacking and will definitely stay elsewhere next time such as NY Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: tchotspur
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first trip to New York, WOW! We decided on the Waldorf even though there were a number of previous reviews suggesting this grand old hotel was past it's best. Well, if like us you are reading reviews and you are thinking about the Waldorf, BOOK IT. This hotel is stunning, pure class. The Art Deco style is still wonderful make sure you take time to look around all the hotel, the grand ballroom, starlight roof etc. These is so much to see. We stayed 4 nights in a Deluxe room on the 24th floor. Very spacious, very clean, comfortable bed. The position on park ave is perfect, easy to get around the city. Close to Grand Central, St Patricks Catherdral, Rockafeller Centre, Times Square, Broadway and Fifth ave. The staff are so helpful, all of them, and can't do enough for you. This trip was to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary, when the guy who checked us in found out he arranged for champange & strawberries to be sent to the room, nice touch. As you would expect your $$$ won't go too far if you eat in the hotel. It has it's own Starbucks, great for breakfast. There are plenty of other places around the hotel to eat within a reasonable budget. If you are going to a show there is a lot of restaurants around Broadway & Times Square to choose from, with pre theatre dinner menu's. Try Langan's 150 West 47th street (just off Times Square). Great four course dinner for just under $30. Fantastic city, Fantastic trip, absolutely Fantastic Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The reviews were right on the mark. The lobby is wonderful and what you would expect from the famous hotel. The room was small and somewhat dated but not bad. I believe all the beds are new and it was great. The curtains were old and the bathroom sink and tub were cracked but otherwise clean. I see that rooms are going for around $400 a night and would not recommned paying that. I stayed for a discounted corporate rate and paid only $200. For that price it was worth it. I had minimal interaction with the staff but they seemed to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were a little apprehensive about going to the Waldorf after reading some of the bad reviews on trip advisor. However we were very glad we decided to give it a go. Even though we had to cut our visit short due to family illness back in the UK, the time we spent at the Waldorf exceeded all expectations! The interior of the hotel is stunning, and it's location is hard to beat. Our room on the 13th floor overlooked Park Avenue and was beautifully furnished and very spacious. The staff went out of their way to provide exemplary service and made our 1st trip to New York a really special event. We are only sad that our trip was curtailed, and greatly look forward to a return visit as soon as we are able. We would not stay anywhere else !

Reviews.Title: “Old-School Elegance”
Reviews.Author: dergenie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Waldorf this past weekend and loved it. This is actually the second time we have stayed here and both times we were very pleased with our choice of hotel. We origninally had reservations for the Grand Hyatt by Grand Central Station, just to try something new, but we cancelled them and chose the Waldorf instead. We are so glad we did, as we walked to the Grand Hyatt while staying at the Astoria, just to see what we missed. The Grand Hyatt is contemporary in style and the lobby was chaotic and frenetic- not at all our taste. We were glad to get back to the Waldorf. The ambiance at the Waldorf is so tasteful, refined and definitely old-school elegance. We realize that this is not everyone's choice, but I mention it to help others decide where they "fit in." We arrived early for check-in- about 1 PM, and were able to get a room immediately, this on a Sunday. Our room, as seen by the photos, is what the Astoria considers a Queen Deluxe. It was quite satisfactory for us- comfortable bed, and the bathroom, while not large, was quite adequate. One thing people should know is that this hotel is on an older heating/AC system. If the hotel chooses to have it on AC that day, then you will not be able to get heat. Guest services, however, will be happy to send up a space heater for you. (I believe that is proper term.) Since this was a cooler spring day than normal, we thought we might need one, but the bedding was quite adequate as far as warmth goes, and we did not need it. While here, we attended an Andre Rieu concert at Radio City Music Hall (stupendous!) and we were happy to be within walking distance of RCMH. As you walk along 50th street to RCMH, you pass Rockefeller Center, so you can stop off there (which we did). You also pass St. Patrick's Cathedral while walking to RCMH and it was open for visitors on that side, as we passed. We also walked to Grand Central Station, and that is certainly do-able, but I recommend doing it along Lexington Avenue, versus Park Avenue. The Empire State Building is close to there as well. The service at the Waldorf was impeccable. All of the staff we encountered were courteous, warm and gracious. We ate at both the Bull and Bear, which we highly recommend. If you love steaks, then this is a good choice of restaurant. We also ate at Oscar's for both breakfast and lunch and found the food here to be quite tasty. We found that using Zip Check out, by phone, was the easiest. We first contacted the bellman's desk. They came for our luggage, stored it and then we could enjoy the city before we took our train later that afternoon. When it came time to leave, we simply went to the garage area where the bellman obtained our luggage and hailed us a taxi, which took us to Penn Station where we got our train. So, in short, we had a hassle free check-in and check-out. I realize this hotel tends to be more expensive than many in the midtown area of NYC, but I have Hilton Honors (Astoria is a Hilton run hotel) and I frequently get brochures advertising specials, one of which I used this time. Spring is a good time to go, it seems, as well as summer, and both seem to have more specials then. Online, just visit (---) . If you do stay at another hotel, at least go see the renowned Waldorf Astoria lobby with its weekly fresh HUGE bouquet of flowers and its signature chandelier.- truly beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and i have wanted to visit New York for years and finally we did it!! Have just spent the most amazing 5 days. Stayed in the 'Waldorf Astoria' which was first class, the room was really good (and yes they do have coffee machines in them now) the staff were fantastic, could not have been more friendly. They advised us of the best ways to visit the sites, (Grey Tour Bus Co) and booked us tickets for the open top bus which was $77.00 which gave us 48 hours of unlimited travel on an open topped bus with a tour guide, you can get on and off at any stop as often as you like they run from 8.00am to 9.30pm and are a great way to travel especially if its your first visit to New York and you want information about where you are in the city and some history of the place.The hotel staff also booked us tickets for the 'Phantom of the Opera' (Majestic Theatre) a wonderful night for £130.00, but when the theatres come out it is impossible to get a cab, we got a 'bike' (2 seater carriage type) felt sorry for the poor guy peddling , he must of been fit !! cost $20. where a taxi would of cost $8.00 but it was better than hanging around in the rain. On our last day we took a carriage ride in Central Park which was the only dissapointment of our whole trip it cost $40. and he only took us out for 10 mins and showed us only a very very small part of the park!! we saw more when we walked through afterwards. New York is a fantastic place, the people are friendly, helpful and fun and we cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Second time to stay; Can't wait for the third!”
Reviews.Author: SRMW1972
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Waldorf in December 2005 with my husband and we loved it. I planned a girls trip with my sister-n-law for last month and we stayed at the Waldorf again. I can't tell you how much we both loved it. The staff was so accommodating. They helped us with anything we needed. I never met a rude or disgruntled staff member during either stay. I think the rooms are amazing. I love the decor. Yes, they may seem old, but I love that. The bedding is so incredibly comfortable. My room both times was very clean and spacious. I just can't tell you enough about how much I love this hotel. I'm planning a trip for the fall and can't wait to stay there for the third time. As much as I love NY, if I couldn't stay at the Waldorf, I wouldn't even want to go to NY . Oh, and the location is awesome! Feel free to email me with any questions. Stacy W.

Reviews.Title: “Superb in every way!”
Reviews.Author: CityGirlNewYork
Reviews.Content: I booked the last two nights of an eight night stay in New York at the Waldorf in a one bedroom suite as a birthday surprise for my Mum (we stayed at the Salisbury Hotel for the other six nights - please see separate review). I last stayed at the Waldorf in 2004 and had a good experience, but nothing like this time. I checked in by telephone on the first day of our stay and was advised that the keys to our suite would be ready for collection in the Diamond VIP area at the rear of the main lobby (I hasten to add that I am not a VIP, but they use this for express check in). The person (Paolo) I spoke to on the phone could not have been more accommodating or helpful. I mentioned that it was my Mum's birthday and asked if I could arrange for a birthday card or something to be put in the room - Paolo said he would take care of it. We arrived at the Waldorf at midday after checking out of the Salisbury. The room wasn't available, but our luggage was stored until we returned later. We spent the afternoon having lunch at Fraunces Tavern and visiting the museum there, returning to the hotel at about 5.45pm. Paolo got our keys ready and we went up to our suite on the 27th floor. The suite itself was amazing - marble-floored hallway, art deco bar area, sitting room with 2 sofas and several chairs and two bedrooms, both huge and with two double beds in each. Each bedroom was en-suite and had a small dressing area. We also had superb views over Park Avenue, Rockefeller Centre and St Patrick's Cathedral. I was disappointed that there was no birthday card as I had arranged, but this was explained when a trolley arrived at 8.30pm that evening with a complimentary bottle of champagne on ice, chocolate dipped strawberries, mineral water and a huge tray of fresh fruit. I was absolutely delighted that the birthday treat for my Mum had worked out so well. We were treated like royalty throughout our stay and particularly enjoyed a meal on the second night in Oscar's Restaurant (just off the Lexington Avenue entrance). We were waited on by Taner, who made it a wonderful experience. I could not have hoped for a better way for my Mum to celebrate her birthday and will have no hesitation in returning to the Waldorf again. We couldn't have wished for anything more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Check-in was quick and smooth and the receptionist wished me a happy birthday for the following day and offered us a complimentary breakfast. This was an appreciated gesture and the breakfast was fantastic (continental buffet) After reading several mixed reviews on the rooms in this hotel we were very apprehensive when we opened the door but I must say we were pleasantly surprised. The room was clean, light and the furnishings of a high standard. The bathroom was small but again very clean with plently of complimentary toiletries. The location of this hotel is fantasic - a stones throw away from Grand Central station and a few blocks from the Rockerfeller Centre. My one negative point is that the drinks and room service in this hotel are very expensive. £5 for a beer and £7 for a baileys! Also you only get complimentary coffee in your room not tea! Would probably stay here again if we could get the same deal for 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: geegee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Waldorf for 3 days before boarding QM2. Have stayed there several times before, last time around 10 years ago. I don't think they've cleaned th place since. The net curtains in our room were dark yellow!! The whole place - other than the reception area, which is still quite impressive - could do with a good makeover. Luckily breakfast was included in our booking as we would have gone elsewhere if we had to pay the hotel price , which I think is $25 for the not particularly good buffet. It is still a convenient place to stay and it's a great pity it's been let down. We also had to haul our bags into the reception area ourselves as the coach (organised by Cunard) had to drop us off behind the hotel, not really how one wants to arrive after a longish flight. Won't stay there next time around.

Reviews.Title: “The Correct Choice, After All”
Reviews.Author: scbelle
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a four day weekend in a King Room on the concierge or Astoria level. We had read all the reviews, and were see sawing between the Sofitel or the W=A. After I found a great rate for the concierge level, we opted to have the grand old NY experience at the Waldorf. Our stay was wonderful. It was not a Ritz Carlton or a 5 star property, but neither did it cost that much. The concierge staff for the Towers, which is available to Astoria level guests, were fantastic. We had the concierge staff arrange our reservations prior to the trip as I ended up running out of time. We were pleased with ALL of the dinners we had. The staff also accomodated us on a number of small requests. They also arranged for late check out and allowed us to continue using the Astoria lounge after checkout because we had a late flight. (This is non-chronological, but check in was a breeze via the telephone express registration and then the diamond reception desk). The private entrance/elevators were an absolute necessity. I do not think we would have enjoyed our stay had we not been on the concierge floor. The lobby/main entrance is often crowded, and the poor people catching taxis at the front door had a hard time of it, especially in the rain. We never had to wait longer than a minute for our doormean to hail us a taxi, and they also provided umbrellas in the rain. The lounge was very comfortable. Non alcoholic beverages were comped. We were there for the breakfast and "tea" food presentations. Breakfast was typical continental fare--bagels, pastries, fresh fruit, cereals, fresh squeezed juice. There was no espresso, but the starbucks downstairs was quick. The tea/dinner/hors d'ouevres service was different both nights. They had a number of salads (including the "Waldorf Salad" one night), cheese trays, olives, some cured meats, some light appetizers. It would provide an ample meal if for some reason you couldn't make it to a restaurant. Or would tide you over pre-theater. For us, it was great as a cocktail snack when we had later dinner reservations. The alcoholic beverages were typically priced, but they did give a fair pour, which sadly in these days, few places do. The room itself was quite nice as well. Our curiousity actually got the better of us and we took a tour of the Sofitel--our room was significantly bigger. Certainly not huge, but large by NYC standards is the fair assessment. The bathroom was not particularly luxe--perhaps it had been, many years ago, but today we are spoiled by huge expanses. My mother and I debated the tub issue and decided that in truth it would be a sin to redo those bathrooms. Perhaps the enamel has cracked in the tubs, but they just don't make them like that anymore (and I am in the plumbing business!). A cast iron tub that heavy is a luxury in itself, despite a few beauty marks. Incidentally, they had updated the shower heads, and nothing beats a Speakman shower. We must have been in a renovated room--we didn't see any damage to the carpet, plaster, or wall paper, The draperies and bedding and upholstery were all in excelllent condition. The air conditioning was not the greatest, but sufficed. The street noise was not bad on the 26th floor. The bed itself was exceedingly comfortable. Great mattress, nice pillows, very sof triple sheeting, and the perfect weight down duvet. Oh--there was an eveing turn down if thats important... OUr final decision on the hotel was this:if you want to stay in a four star property in Midtown, a room in the Towers/on the concierge floor is your best bet. If you can't get a room in the towers/concierge, stay at the Sofitel. And if you want FIVE star service, then stay at the Ritz and be willing to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Easter, absolutely no problem checking in, we arrived early and they still accommodated us straight away with no fuss and no waiting. Lobby is fab and very busy, and harrys bar is a great place for a few drinks after a long day. Stayed on 17th Floor (Lexington Avenue side, plus less occupied lift!), room excellent, enough room to skip a little!, a bit dark, a great service, while your out the maids come and turn your bed down later in the day, dim a light and turn the radio on low, nice touch! Food is expensive, we found a lot of choice for breakfast at Grand Central Station about 5 mins walk away, the food court below has loads of choice. Checkout was beyond simple, a simple call and you’re out. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte2010NC
Reviews.Content: It was a big deal for me to say I was staying at the Waldorf, but beside the grand lobby, I was not impressed. I stayed for five nights on a business trip, and won't do it again. I'm going back to NYC in two weeks, and I'm going to try somewhere else. The Waldorf is just old. The rooms are old. It was burning up hot in my room and no way to cool it down. Someone had to come open a window for me, and the there was a constant whooshing sound of air being sucked out of the window. I was on the 8th floor and had absolutely no view of anything. I get to say I stayed there, and I never will again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the glamour or richness you would expect!”
Reviews.Author: Boomer2
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas at the Waldorf Astoria and given the richness of its history, and the glamour that surrounds this hotel, it really didn't live up to our expectations. For seasoned travellers, the Waldorf is nothing more than a nice hotel in New York City, certainly not worth a (5) star rating, due to the fact that the hotel is still clinging to the glamor of the 50's. We had some major issues with check in, incorrect rooming and misleading staff, however after directing my complaint further, we were moved, although the heating did not work, even after numerous maintenence calls to repair. The room itself was very unimpressive, small, and we had paid for one level under top room rate. Although this sounds odd...the carpeted floor was VERY slippery to the point that you could slip over if step in the wrong direction. We expected to see elegance and grandeur, however this did not exist past the lobby, and even this felt a little dated. The location is great if you want to be close to Times Square without being in Times Square and Broadway, and we walked this many times. The Peacock Alley restaurant is nice, although you really are stuck right in the middle of the lobby, and do not feel romantic or special, rather alike being at a bistro on the main street. The food was absolutely brilliant without a doubt, however you will pay for it, as with most restaurants in New York City. The restaurant manager is SUPERB, the most decent, genuine, professional man, in that after some issues, we were content with the level of service we had received and continue to praise him. If you love traditional Japanese, head to Honmura Ann in Soho, amazing food and relatively priced, although beware the green tea is scorching hot, and chopstick usage is a must. If you love Pizza, you simply can NOT go past Lombardis in Soho area also, you will wait for 45-60mins although take a seat at the bar, the drinks are good and finally when your pizza arrives, you will not be sorry. We took some back to California with us, and would love to have it flown out if possible. Pizza just doesn't taste the same anymore, anywhere else. Shopping: Everyone raves about Soho for faux designer label sunglasses, bags etc, however we found this to be one big tourist trap with the same crap at every crammed side by side vendor store. Hundreds of people cramming to look at the same items, same prices, and people constantly hassling you, which we didn't enjoy. You will find that if you walk around the Times Square area, not the back, back streets, but just off the main drag that you will find the same items, with only a handful of tourists around and they are more incliined to meet your price as they know you can always head straight to Soho. This is where I bought a few bags and some sunglasses. In conclusion: If you want elegance, luxury, this really isn't worth the money, pay a little more, may not even have to and stay closer to Times Square or Central Park. It not that the hotel is BAD, just not probably what most would expect, when they say 'I'm staying at the Waldorf Astoria". Once perhaps!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: karen 17
Reviews.Content: For my husbands birthday I had booked 3 nights at the Waldorf over the Easter break. Like a lot of other reviewers I was very nervous after reading some of the other comments, however all of my fears were groudless.The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful we were able to check in immediately (no queues) our room on the 30th floor was excellent, very clean and well decorated the general ambience of the Hotel was better than I had hoped for, and it is in a great central position for sight seeing and eating out. As previous reviewers have suggested if you can afford to upgrade it is well worth it ,as although we did not have a suite we had a large room with a great view . I cant wait until we can go back to both New York and the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Reviews on this hotel certainly vary! We loved it; weren't expecting a huge room, as we had taken the standard double, but the standard of furnishings was very high, with a really lovely bathroom. Plus it wasn't any dearer than less famous hotels of this grade and a whole lot cheaper than hotels in London, none of which would match the opulance of the W-A (The Hilton at Edinburgh Airport which is very ordinary, cost us more than the W-A). We loved being able to wander in the lobby and know we were staying there, rather than tourists in for a gawp!

Reviews.Title: “Off the planet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The best hotel in the world. My family 2 adults and 2 children aged 14 and 16 have just arrived back from the most luxurious hotel stay ever. We stayed for 4 nights in a mini suite on the 27th floor and it was superb. We had 2 marble bathrooms, a living area with everything needed, and a bedroom with 2 of the most comfortable beds. Room service was polite and courteous. After a hard day shopping we had our evening meal in our room. The food was superb and arrived in double quick time. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and definitely cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to New York as a surprise for his 40th birthday. When we arrived at the Waldorf Astoria we were told we had been given an upgrade to the Waldorf Towers - this was a gorgeous suite with kitchenette, dressing room and massive bedroom, plus the comfiest bed I have ever slept in. Every morning and evening we admired the views over New York from the 33rd floor! The staff were all extremely polite and helpful and couldn't do enough for us. When there was some unexpected work carried out on one of the lifts we received a personal letter of apology along with a fresh fruit platter! After reading some of the negative reviews I was a little apprehensive, however we were more than astisfied with our stay and it was altogether a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: naturalogg
Reviews.Content: The lobby and common areas are quite nice (though could use some updating), but the rooms were just awful. I only stayed one night and thank heavens for that - there are dozens of better, cheaper hotels in the same area of New York. This hotel will need a full renovation very very soon in order to keep pace with its world-renowned reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Great !”
Reviews.Author: PatEric
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in the Waldorf. We were in the Towers at the 31st floor. It was wonderful ... First of all, the lobby is really impressive. We were 2 adults & 2 childs (8&3) and the room was really large enough. The bathroom was exceptionnally well furnished, with all you can wait in such an hotel. The service was as you can expect : really perfect, as well at the reception, concierge or room service ! We didn't have to wait for check-in & check out : perfect ! We were a little afraid after having read some reviews, but we will definitely go back to this exceptional and mythic hotel !!! (and our children say the same thing!) "Thank you" to the Waldorf !

Reviews.Title: “Room was rubbish!!!”
Reviews.Author: jojo.b
Reviews.Content: We stayed in mid February for 1 night having spend a week at the Radio City Apartments (excellent for families/intrepid tourists) and a week down in Florida. I agree the lobby and public areas are impressive but our room on the 7th floor was the size of a shoe box! It was too small for 2 adults and 1 child, the decor was pretty poor and the bathroom in desperate need of renovation. Not worth the rates charged unless you are seeking the kudos of staying at the Waldorf, and definitely not suitable for young couples or families. NB If I recall correctly, the charge for half a grapefruit on the room service menu was @$10 - HAAAA!! - may I recommend the Starbucks up the street for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Nice historic hotel, quiet”
Reviews.Author: azogal
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf is a nice hotel with lots of history and it was fun to stay there once. The rooms were clean and quiet, but a little worn around the edges (e.g., cracked sink in the bathroom). The location was convenient to many mid-town attractions. My main complaint is that there wasn't much of a selection of eating places near the hotel for a quick breakfast. The area also has a very "business-like" feel because of big insurance and financial offices nearby so the restaurants seem to cater to the office crowd who grabs breakfast or lunch on the way to work or to eat at a desk.

Reviews.Title: “The Waldorf - A special lady”
Reviews.Author: PINKGILLY
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Waldorf with some apprehension after having read the reviews on Trip advisor. Our 4 night stop was to celebrate my mums 70th birthday as she had particularly requested to stay at this hotel to relive the old movie days. I am happy to report that our visit was a great success. Upon arrival in the main lobby it is like stepping back in time - the lobby of the Waldorf is beautiful and the hub of the hotel, it is a great people watching place. Our check-in was very smooth ,however one of our rooms was not ready and we were advised that it would be ready in 10 mins. It turned out to be another 40 mins before we got our room key but the Waldorf delivered a complimentary bottle of champagne for the inconvenience caused.This was a pleasant surprise and totally unexpected. I have to agree that the bedrooms are a little bit on the small size we were on the 8th floor but you do have everything that you need. The decor is matching with the hotels history so if you are looking for art noveau or minimilistic this hotel is not for you. There is a complimentary service of fresh coffee and tea which is delivered to your room every morning- you just order it the night before.I found all the staff to be very friendly and willing to do all that they can for you. For a city centre hotel it makes you feel very safe and secure. 5th Avenue and shopping heaven is just a block down. The location of this hotel has to be one of its main selling features - if you need to hail a cab the doorman will do that for you very easily. If you want to arrive at the Waldorf in style then I suggest you book a stretch limo - after having travelled on a long flight which had an extenisve delay it was great to have the car waiting for us . Within 5 mins we were on our way having avoided the long queues for taxis - you start your holiday off in style. I have been to New York many times and I have to say on this visit it was a delight to see how friendly people were ,New York had a good feel to it- I can not wait to go back. If you are thinking of staying at this hotel then go with an open mind, be part of and enjoy this special lady's history you should not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “First Time in NYC - Waldorf was grrrreat!”
Reviews.Author: HilGray
Reviews.Content: Having seen some of the Trip Advisor reviews we didn't know quite what to expect of the Waldorf. On arrival we were dealt with at Reception by a very friendly and efficient chap who gave us a choice of rooms with different bed options. The bell hop delivered our case within minutes of us getting to our room. The Lobby and Reception are wonderful - it may not be the most modern style of hotel, but you don't go to the Waldorf for minimalism and chrome. The furnishings and fresh flower displays were wonderful. There was often a pianist playing in the lobby which added to the atmosphere. There were lots of beautifully dressed ladies and gents wandering around for a function which created a lovely, stylish and buzzy atmosphere in the lobby areas. The room was fine (on 17th Floor) but probably is due for a refurb. The room itself was a good size, the bathroom although a little small and dated was perfectly adequate (the old fashioned fittings somehow added to the olde world charm actually). A nice touch was the "turn down" service; you arrive back after an evening out to find your bed turned down, a lamp on and the radio playing relaxing soft jazz - it says you have to ask for this service but we didn't have to - like I say, a nice touch. On the downside the drinks are expensive but we expected this to be the case. Sir Harry's has a great atmosphere and the staff are very friendly, as are the Americans who are more than happy to talk and suggest places to go. Peacock Alley is perfect for a nightcap. The Bull and Bear bar is quite English in style. Oscars is quite informal but still relaxed and friendly. We had a wonderful three days in NYC (our first ever visit) and found the Waldorf to be the perfect base (great location) and would be happy to go back there. We do plan another visit to NYC, we would be more than happy to stay at the Waldorf again as we were very happy with it, but it is nice to try different places so will probably see what else is on offer. Our tips for first time visitors - Helicopter Flight is great, dinner cruise on World Yacht is a wonderful way of seeing the famous skyline at night. Breakfast in the food hall of Grand Central is good value and very tasty. Pre-theatre dinner at 21 Club is good value and has a great atmosphere - check out the toys! Be warned - don't take your expensive Dunhill (or similar) lighter with you to the US - they confiscate all lighters at security at JFK when you leave so you would lose your nice lighter for good! Also on arrival we queued for an hour and a half to get through immigration at JFK - be warned that if you had booked a car to pick you up they may not wait this long (ours was still there though). I hope that you find this review helpful - as the song goes New York New York, it's a wonderful town!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Exceptional staff.”
Reviews.Author: AGSAugusta_GA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Waldorf-Astoria for a long weekend in NYC. We found the location to be particularly convenient to everything. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful. We thought the room was nice with a very comfy bed. Our bathroom was recently updated and nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Not As Grand”
Reviews.Author: GoddessAva
Reviews.Content: Had a 'Girls' Night Out' in NYC. We stayed at The Waldorf-Astoria hotel. We wanted to do NY in style! I was waiting to encounter rude and arrogant staff members (as I've heard NYers are), but was pleasantly surprised. The staff was VERY courteous, polite and FRIENDLY! Whenever we made our way thru the lobby to leave, the bellmen and MANAGERS remembered us and ALWAYS stopped to chat! They made our hotel stay GREAT!!! (Did I mention how cute we are?!? LOL) As far as the hotel room itself, it wasn't as great as the staff. It was OK. We reserved a suite...an old looking suite. The colors were pretty though. The heat took forever to heat up the room. We'd turn the heat on in the evening and it was still cold at 4am in the morning. Not very good. But the bathroom was spacious. The next time I visit NYC, it will not be here!

Reviews.Title: “The Real Truth”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights (15th march - 18th march)and here is my honest opinion. - First impression: not as grand as photos I have seen would suggest. Reality did not meet my expectation - Check in: very rigid about 3.00pm check in and in fact the female staff I spoke to was not as courteous as I feel she could have been. I think they think if you are dressed casually you are less important and this became more apparent during my visit - My preassigned room was changed to a less favourable location (doesn't really bother me but it might bother you) - Room was deluxe king but for price and hotel reputation very dated. Room could do with complete makeover (beds, carpets, bathrooms etc) - No room safe although available at no charge in reception which is inconvenient - Mini bar already open when arrived and they attempted to charge $40 (approx)for items I didn't use although when I raised this issue they quickly removed it from the bill ! - Breakfast at Oscars (full buffett) was grand but had you been paying hotel prices not worth it. Ask for free buffett breakfast and upgrade at check in as they gave out alot of buffett breakfast vouchers as I was checking in and when I asked they also gave me vouchers for my stay which included taxes and tips!!. As I say worth it if free if not dont eat in otherwise. - Didn't eat in any main restaurants as prices I felt totally OTT.Have a look yourself when you get there. - Location of hotel - Excellent for 5th Ave, Maddison Ave etc and only about 15 min walk to broadway - At checkout we left our bags with concierge but had to go downstairs and collect our own bags and take them to the taxi when we went to collect them. Again I felt that casual dressed they felt that we didn't merit same level of service. - One good tip for you is that if you book in advance keep an eye out on the Hilton website for promotions and reduced rates right up to day before you go as prices often fall day before arrival so ring up and get the reduced price. Overall - Having travelled alot I feel the hotel is not good value for money, mixture of staff from excellent to less than polite. In regards to decor and as a place to relax not great at all. Living on past reputation in my opinion and badly in need of radical updating to the 21st century. Even simple things like tv remote in room not working and not a very clean smell in the room. At prices you pay you simply expect better. 3 star quality in a 4-5 star location is how I would sum it up. Good luck in your travels

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel quality at expensive hotel prices!”
Reviews.Author: Jeffscuba
Reviews.Content: Unimpressive to say the least. I was looking forward to trying the Waldorf Astoria due to its reputations as a top quality hotel. Unfortunately, the reality is always a let down from the illusion. I've stayed at Super 8 Motels that were better in quality. First, the building smells. I suspect that they don't know what "non-smoking" means, because the whole place smells like someone smoking. Second, they gave me a room with an "accessible" shower. It turns out "accessible" means that unless you are an ambidextrous mutant born with 4 arms, you aren't taking a shower, because the flexible shower head didn't have a mounting bracket. Third, when I'm paying $550 a night, I tend to assume certain amenities, like a comb and toothpaste in the room. It turns out that they just gave me the basics, soap and shampoo. Overall, I'd prefer to stay at a nicer hotel than this. I'm sure I won't be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf is a beautiful space and a grand old hotel. I've stayed there twice with mixed results. The first time we were treated very well and had a lovely room, the second time I was brusquely processed and given a dreadful, dingy, tiny room. We are Hilton Gold members, and the Waldorf is part of the Hilton chain, but they told me on check in, that they were too busy and full to honor any Hilton Gold priviledges. After seeing the room, I called to complain, and was given a more spacious room. A major point in their favor is that the beds are very comfortable and the linens quite nice. The food in the hotel is expensive, and breakfast for two may run $50.00. The location is excellent for walking around town. The hotel is so large that the lobby can be rather a "scene" with all kinds of people, but that can be fun. Overall, I'm fond of the hotel, but aware that one's experience may vary with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Experience”
Reviews.Author: Sassypants01
Reviews.Content: We stayed several nights with a group of 7 other couples. We all had a wonderful experience. The Spa was a huge highlight. The location is PERFECT. It's just a lovely old hotel. The staff was great & we had no problems, other than a late check at breakfast in Peacock Alley. It'd be hard to go back & not stay there after our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: HartleyManchesterUk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel in Jan with my sister in law. I can not fault the hotel or its staff. Our room was fantastic (junior suite) so there was plenty of room for 2 girls to get ready. Everything about the hotel was fabulous and the word of the weekend was 'opulent' The staff were always very helpful from check in staff to doormen, only down side was lots of tipping. Can highly recommend the Champagne Afternoon Tea in the Cocktail Terrace Bar to really soak up the New York atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf is tops!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and met all expectations. We booked a one bedroom suite on the concierge (Astoria) level and were upgraded for free to a two bedroom suite without even asking. They saw we had two children and offered it to us. The room was very spacious and the lounge was great to relax in. The continental breakfast was mostly just cereal and croissants. The evening hors d'oerves were better. The staff is very helpful. The best thing about the WA is its location. You can walk just about anywhere. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Hyatt instead of the terrible Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: MatBarrow
Reviews.Content: We had problem after problem with our stay here. Unfortunately, it seems that as the hotel is already world famous, the staff do not consider it important to take care of guests to ensure repeat business. Many reviewers have given the hotel a 3 or 4 rating, but in reality, this is always a generous rating based on the aesthetics of the public areas, and some level of acceptance of the problems. At $600 per night, I am not willing to accept compromises. Our room was cancelled prior to our arrival from the UK, and we received a two category downgrade, for which they then attempted to charge twice as much as the original booking. The lady on the excursion counter was extremely rude, preferring to continue a personal call rather than advise us on how to get to the airport during the city-wide transit strike. Our room was in a very poor state of disrepair, with faulty electronics and leaky fittings. The TV signal was poor, and the heating options were effectively 'furnace' or 'off'. We went for a look in the Hyatt and the Benjamin, and both seemed much, much better. People accustomed to American levels of service will be disappointed, but for those of you used to Bavarian or Asian hospitality, you will be nothing short of horrified! Thanks to the Waldorf for ruining our trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, perfect location, irritating staff”
Reviews.Author: superiorlines
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay here, which was in the dead of winter last year. The room was on the smallish side, but cozy and comfortable. The bathroom was quite nicely sized, with a real, human-sized tub and room to swing a hairbrush. The lobby and entrances are lovely (as is the public restroom in the lobby, which has a fireplace, lush) and hanging out down here near the front desk, and the entrance to the way-more-expensive Towers section means you can gawk at the beautiful people coming and going, especially in the evening. The location is fantastic, an easy walk from all the Midtown tourist attractions, as well as Central Park. The only negative was the silly bitchiness of a few employees at the concierge desk. It might be standard behavior at some exclusive establishment but the Waldorf, despite the name and the high-end lobby stores, is basically a tourist attraction - there are people trouping through the public areas all day, snapping photos, and the guests are (like me) hardly wealthy or famous.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Snowroad
Reviews.Content: Simply put, the hotel is fabulous. Historical enthusiasts would love it. Beautiful lobby (ie: entire main floor). The bear and bull is great for dinner and drinks. Very pricey but giant portions. Liquid and solid ounces... The bar staff at Peacock alley were tremendously friendly and the concierges will steer you in the right direction for what you seek. (see Vinmore or Roel.... they know what you want !) The suite was spacious but a little run down, bathroom needing a little more charm. Kudos to the doormen who spend their days hailing cabs for mostly unappreciative guests... tip 'em well!!! I'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dantastic16
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel. I stayed at the Waldorf with my girlfriend from Thurs to Sunday. After reading some of the negative reviews, I was a bit nervous. However, the hotel far exceeded my expectations. We stayed in a standard queen room. The room was in perfect condition with a brand new marble bathroom. It was spacious for a New York City hotel (mind you - if you haven't stayed in a NYC hotel before, keep in mind that space is expensive - every hotel is smaller than what you may be used to). The floor we stayed on was extremely quiet - we felt like we were staying in a private apartment as opposed to staying in a hotel. Checkin was a breeze. Our bags were brought up to the room and the bed was turned down. The lobby is beautiful. There was quite a bit of tourist traffic on the weekends...fairly common among one of the most famous hotels in NYC. Overall it was a fantastic experience. I would certainly recommend it to a friend and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nurse87
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel for $150.00 on Priceline. I was so pleased with the deal that I got! It is so elegant and lovely. We first got a smaller room and I had difficulty sleeping the first nite. I asked for a larger bed the next day. I did have to wait awhile for the upgrade but I was so pleasantly surprised! I received a very beautiful private room at the end of the hall. It had a foyer. The room was beautifully furnished and very large. The bathroom was huge with marble flooring. When my husband and I came back from the theater that evening, we found a complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. We were very pleased with the service. It is top of the line. The guest service is outstanding. I was especially pleased with the help that Christian and Denny provided. They went above and beyond to assist me and providing us with the lovely room and experience. The hotel lobby is gorgeous. The location is excellent. We ordered room service. It was fantastic but of course expensive. But, what a treat! I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a week at the WA. Charming, having extremely high expectations of the hotel (working in the industry), it was so wonderful to stay in a hotel with real character. The danger of a mass refurb will be to make this a blank characterless hotel. The WA has history and that's what we went for. The staff, without exception, were helpful, polite and efficient. If you get a chance, go and look at some of the function rooms - complete gems and so atmospheric. Great location and can't wait to return. If you are staying in NY, please go and see the Top of the Rock, Rockefeller Center, which must be destined to become one of the top attractions in the city since recently re-opening. Dream week.

Reviews.Title: “good value five star, slightly faded”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf in February 06 for seven nights; we have stayed on a previous occasion for three nights. The hotel has a grand reputation which is mostly justified, this is a five start hotel perhaps not as modern or luxurious as some in New York but nonetheless very comfortable. The major advantage the hotel has is the large room size; being an older building you get a lot more space. Our deal included breakfast which was a good buffet arrangement with a reasonable choice of quality items. Some of the housekeeping is a little slipshod but overall the hotel is an experience especially the grand lobby. Prices are also more reasonable than many other five star hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday of a lifetime!”
Reviews.Author: charlotte61
Reviews.Content: Our party of five flew out to NYC on Saturday 11th February. Upon entering the hotel we were all utterly amazed (even the six month old baby that was with us was stunned!) From the moment you step out of the cab and enter the hotel you are treated like royalty. The lobby is amazing, and the playing of the grand piano gave the hotel a magical atmosphere. The receptionists that dealt with us were extremely helpful, they did everything to accomodate our needs and even upgraded our rooms. Both couples in our party stayed in King rooms, these are under the banner of the deluxe guestrooms. The room was clean, spacious, luxurious, comfortable and catered for our every need. The bed in particular was enormous and is the comfiest bed i have ever slept in, i looked forward to sleeping in it! To summarise, for me this was the trip of a lifetime. We all thoroughly enjoyed our time in NYC and the WA was a pleasure and a privelage to return to after a busy day around the city. The coursiege inparticular went out of thier way to help us with our enquiries (however bizzare they were!) We will definatley be returning to this hotel, it's amazing and well worth the money! Thank you to you all at the Waldorf

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful Waldorf!”
Reviews.Author: Benski
Reviews.Content: My lovely lady and I stayed here for 2 nights over Valentines and what a magical stay it was! Greeted in our room by a complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolate coated strawberries we were immediately whisked into a fairytale... We dined at Oscar's where the menu undersells the quality of food, and we got more complimentary champagne and dessert - Yeah ok, it was probably the fact that it was Valentine's night that they put on the goodies, but oh boy what a wonderful evening! The service & staff were great, the ice machine on the 15th floor was broken, but i just ordered some ice and glasses and that came up in a jiffy... Our only complaint, they didnt have VH1, so we missed an episode of Flavor of Love - but hey, sacrifices sometimes must be made... Magical hotel, fantastic stay!

Reviews.Title: “classy”
Reviews.Author: katie1811
Reviews.Content: Certainly lived upto it reputation, this hotel is full of history and very grand. Pleasure to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel, but quite overrated”
Reviews.Author: RichardChicago
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Waldorf a couple of times while on business. The first time I got a standard room towards the back of the hotel, and the second time, I was upgraded to a suite in the towers since I waited for hours and no other rooms were available. Obviously, the WA is one of the best known hotels in NYC, if not the entire world. My mother mentioned to me that she knew of it as a child, and she grew up far from the USA! The location is spectacular, and the lobby area is extremely impressive and stately. Having said that, once you get into your actual room, its really nothing special at all. The average room is 2 double beds, and a nice marble bathroom. I found the furnishings and decor to be somewhat aged. Though everything was clean and tidy, the room seemed like a good refurbish would be in order. When I stayed in the suite (which was massive, bigger than my apartment in Chicago!), the decor was like an old English countryside. Clean room, but very dated. Also, getting to/from some of the rooms is a major pain with the locations of the elevators. Overall, the WA is a pretty nice hotel in a fabulous part of NYC, but given the rates that they charge to stay there, and the fact that the rooms really are quite average, I dont feel like its anything special.

Reviews.Title: “My mother always taught me that if you cant say anything nice..............”
Reviews.Author: roscoe39
