Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a rather extensive trip through the States I was fortunate enough to start off at the Waldorf In New York and was able to compare it to a number of other 5 star hotels through that great country...with the exception of the Beverly Hills hotel in LA I would rate this one as the best that I had the pleasure of staying in. I booked a 1 bedroom suite about 6months previously from the Hilton Website and got the accomadations at $325 plus taxes a night. Having stayed in New York in the past I was aware that hotels were very expensive and having stayed at the London Wardorf the previous year was prepared to be very disappointed....especially at that rate, however, this was not the case. The hotel was everything that I could have expected and more., yes it is an old hotel, yes the decorations are dated by todays standard but that is charms and one of the reasons you would stay at an old icon like this. The rooms were beautifully presented., the bathrooms clean and luxurious and the room service staff attentive and prompt...and not at all sarcastic as a previous reviewer mentioned. I would not hesitate to stay here again....though....it would have to be a similar rate! One hint I discovered on checking in., if you have a platimum credit card they will give you a complimetary upgrade to the next standard of room from what you booked and discount various services from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Living On Past Glory”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in quite a few 4/5 * hotels on our travels around the states and the Waldorf is very low on the list. The lobby of the hotel is amazing but unfortunately that's where it ends. The reception could not have been any ruder or unhelpful. We were given a dark dingy room to the back of the hotel that was in great need of restoration. We should have had an upgrade as part of HHonors Programme but had to complain about the room to recieve this. The second room we were given had something spilt down the wall, along the bedside table and on the headboard. There was also a huge chunk of wood missing from the tv cabinet. We called for a manager and asked if this was the standard of room expected at The Waldorf and he agreed this was not and promptly moved us. All rooms are in need of redecoration/moderisation as are the halls on the 7th & 8th floors. Oscars restaurant called us at 7:35 to ask if we could come for dinner earlier than 8:00 which we had booked as they were going to close the restaurant for cleaning? When we said no, they asked if we could then be finished for 9:00. All in all, the hotel has poor and rude staff, terrible rooms and I would rather stay in a bed & breakfast given the choice!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: Surf-Chick
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf as a special treat for me and my boyfriend and we were very impressed. Check-in staff were very efficient and friendly. The atmosphere in the Waldorf cannot be beaten, you feel transported back in time to the golden era. Whatever previous reviewer have said, I found our room nicely appointed and spotless - I dropped something under the bed and I didn't see a single bit of dust when I retrieved it (try that at some other hotels!!). Yes, things are relatively old but I wasn't expecting anything modern. If I come back to NY I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful grand old place”
Reviews.Author: WNelson
Reviews.Content: I had previously stayed here in Nov 04 with a girlfriend and loved the place, so recommended that me and my hubby, and a couple of friends who were celebrating their wedding anniversary stay here and we were not disappointed. Check in was very quick although when we initially checked in at 1pm we were told our rooms were virtually next to each other, but at 4pm when we actually collected our keys they were on different floors - not a major problem but slightly annoying at the time. We had 2 double beds in our room (previously asked for) and it was on a corner so slight larger. It was beautifully decorated, very clean and the beds very comfy. There was no tea/coffee making facilites so when we questioned this with reception they said we could order this via room service free of charge. This was not ideal but better than nothing. Several times it was added to the bill but was always taken off when we questioned it. We stayed on the 9th and 7th floor and both of our rooms were fine - no signs of anything needing renovation. Location is great and for that alone we would stay there again. It is a very old and grand place so please don't stay here expecting anything but this. The Bull & Bear pub in the hotel is fabulous - especially if you are served by Oscar who is very generous with his measures!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous just fabulous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but praise for this fantastic hotel, it took are breath away. The hotel is magnificent and we have never experienced such incredible service before. I was a bit concerned as I had read some of the hotel reviews before we went and I cant acutely believe people have the cheek to bad-mouth this hotel what's wrong with them!!! The decor is amazing, the hotel is so grand the staff are so polite and very helpful. The only trouble we did have was getting are luggage to are room. When you arrive you are given a ticket and advised by the door man your luggage will be brought up to you, we waited 2 hours and still no luggage my sister called down to reception and they said they would look into it and call us back ( they never did). In the end me and my sister went down to the luggage drop off point and there were the cases still sat there. I would advise you to take your cases up with you if you are in a hurry to get out and explore NY and not wait for them to be sent to your room otherwise you could be waiting a VERY long time. Are room was amazing so clean the beds were amazing to sleep in they were that good my mum nearly bought one ( yes you can buy the beds). You must go and visit the Starbucks in the lobby there are two guys that work there during the day, we forgot to get their names but they were so lovely and bent over backwards for us and if we needed any advise or directions on where to go they told us to come and see them. They would always ask how are day went and have a chat with us when we were in there they were probably the nicest people we met in new York. Word of warning watch out for the NY taxi drivers never in my life have I met the rudest people (not all of them )But if you don't know exactly were you are going you have had it, they cuss at you cause you may not know were you are going and then at the end of your journey throw the receipt at you to pay them ( they never got a tip) Don't get me wrong not all of them are like that, we did have one or two really nice drivers but most of them are not very nice. All I can say is you must stay in this hotel don't let any of the bad reviews put you off, I was panicking before I got there as people were really putting this hotel down and I think they need a reality check ( how can you moan about a place like the Waldorf), but like I said they don't know what they are talking about and even if there did happen to be a problem with your room ect all you would have to do is let the reception know and they would sort it out straight away. I will defo be returning and encourage anyone coming to New York to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Waste Your Money”
Reviews.Author: MsPeggy
Reviews.Content: I'm NOT one of those people who are hard to please. I always say "no matter what you do, some people will never be happy". I'm NOT one of those people. HOWEVER, when i stay at the WALDORF ASTORIA i expect a little something more. I must report that i've stayed at many many better hotels. The hotel is old and it shows. Too many renovations in the rooms especially the bathrooms. Seems rather then redoing things in the bathrooms they chose to build boxes around them and put mirror and formica on it to boot. how's about a little marble??? i mean this is the Waldorf! i expected marble counter tops. the bathroom radiators were changed to electric heaters. they built a box around the radiators and mounted the heater to the front. You have to see it to know what i mean. seems they painted over and over the original doors and the doors are peeling. The bathroom in my room was Super 8 quality. i mean it. Except the bathtub was really deep and i took a nice bath. i've stayed in some older hotels and they don't seem rundown. the hotel is very crowded in the main lobby etc, alot of through traffic. that's probably why the rugs seem worn out. the wallpaper and fabric all over the hotel make you feel caged in, everything is very heavy. There are no windows and everything's dark and closed in. I didn't like it. I couldn't stay in the room long because it felt so closed in. The attitude of the staff is not good; Room service hung up on us and said if we were going to be sarcastic that we'd have to call back. The ice maker on our floor was about a mile from our room and then it didn't work. there are no coffee pots in the rooms. The beds were extremely soft, there was good heat, almost too much, and the closet, room, and bathroom were all large. The free toiletries were very small, it was a good thing we brought our own. the tv and alarm clock were new. there was one of those deordorizers that sprays airfreshner every so often (the kind you find in a gym locker room) HELLO! this is the waldorf astoria! i don't know where it was but i heard it go off and i smelled it. it was pleasant smelling tho i thought. Overall the room was clean and comfortable but the staff wasn't overly friendly and for being the Waldorf...it might as well have been a Holiday Inn. At least they have coffee pots and working icemakers at the Holiday Inn. Someone told me this is where the president stays...well i say "let him stay there, he probably gets the really expensive room and gets treated like royalty" BUT don't forget it is the average guest who fills your hotel on a daily basis. From the looks of the reviews on this website, the Waldorf is leaving a lot to be desired for many people who stay there. They cannot continue to survive on their name alone.(or can they?)...they really should try to please everyone....a smile goes a longggggggggg way. i wouldn't stay there again, nor would i recommend them when there are so many good hotels in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm....mixed view”
Reviews.Author: ls100
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to New York with my boyfriend....our first trip. We stayed at the WA for 5 nights over New Year. My first impression was WOW! what a beautiful reception area, full of history and very art deco. We decided to pull out the stops for our 1st trip and we booked a suite. When we were shown to our room I was quite disappointed. The bedding was lovely and the bed very comfortable, but the lounge has this horrible sofa in, you would have expected to find it in some dingy bedsit. 2 days later it had been changed whilst we were out (they must have read our minds). The shower spurted water on the ceiling and the paint was faded. I realise that this is a hotel that is regarded as one of the best, but I think it's well overdue for a facelift. It is a fantastic location and certainly gives the right impression, but I have definitely stayed in better hotels and for the money, I did expect better. My biggest gripe was the net curtains, they were filthy, this is clearly a housekeeping issue and a small difference they could make. Although I have high standards, I made big allowances for the WA but even I couldn't pretend that it was 5*. I would still recommend a visit to the WA, but if I return to NY you'll find me at the Four Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel, Perfect Location, Thoroughly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Lol64_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Waldorf in January 06. To be honest I was originally overjoyed at being able to book the hotel for a reasonable price, but then after reading reviews on this site was quite worried about what we would find. We checked in effortlessly, our bags were taken from us as soon we arrived, check in was flawless with no queue and extremely helpful staff. We could not access our room straight away but this was not a problem because we had no bags to carry and had been able to check our valuables into a safety deposit box so we went and grabbed some lunch and got our bearings before getting the room key. Our room was on the 11th floor and as soon as I opened the door my heart sank - it was for want of a better description a dump - dirty net curtains, peeling wallpaper - no tea or coffee facilities - old formica furniture. As we were at the hotel with friends I went straight up to the 16th floor to check out their room which was lovely. I went back to our room, stopped my husband from unpacking and off we trotted to reception - prepared to do battle. The guy behind the desk couldn't have been nicer. I didn't have to go into any detail, as soon as I said I wasn't happy he said he would move us, he offered us a choice of rooms and recommended that we take the one on the 13th floor which we did. The room was lovely and we settled in to enjoy a wonderful 4 days in New York. Apparently the hotel is being renovated and they have not reached the 11th floor yet so when they give you your keys, check if the room has been renovated, and if it hasn't don't even get in the lift. Apart from the hiccup with the room (which was easily sorted), we found everything else about the hotel perfect. The staff were really helpful and friendly and the hotel was really clean. Yes the hotel is old and no it's not modern so if you like shiny chrome and minimalism don't book the Waldorf, but if you want to be taken back to a golden age of class and gandeur then book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Let's go with...Historic.”
Reviews.Author: LOfallenVE
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Waldorf for 2 nights during our first trip to NYC. I was expecting it to be magical, much like many of the other reviewers here. However, if you take away the "Waldorf Astoria" sign out front, you're left with an old 3-star hotel with the corresponding 3-star customer service. My husband and I have stayed at many wonderful 4 and 5 star hotels- the only evidence of the Waldorf Astoria being in this class is it's reputation. We had the same complaints as previous reviewers. Our stay was complimentary, as we were using our Hilton Honors points. We are Gold members, which typically guarantees an upgraded room. I cannot imagine that the first room we received was upgraded, as it was extremely small with small window overlooking some mid-level Waldorf roof. The view was so appalling to me (garbage, heating units, other windows of the hotel), I called to request another room. I was polite, as was the receptionist, and we were moved to a large corner room with two large windows with great street views. However, the room still showed MANY signs of age: the carpet was dirty, the lighting was poor, the molding must have had 15 coats of paint on it and was peeling, the ceilings were sloped, the shower/tub was small and old, the sink area left no room for toiletries...I could go on and on. Our first room had showed the same signs of wear. I would not use the word "luxurious" to describe any aspect of this hotel. The lobby was nice, but not shockingly nice. The bar was extremely small. We ordered a bottle of champagne from room service and it took about 2 hours and 3 phone calls to make it to our room. Other reviewers may try to blame these inadequacies on the eye of the beholder, but if more than one reviewer complains of the same problem, you may want to give it a second thought. I believe that those who do not recognize the problems are still under the spell of the Waldorf mystique. Save yourself some heartache and stay at a real 5-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting / Dirty / Lousy Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When most people hear the name Waldorf Astoria they think luxury, outstanding service and a grand hotel, I was recently a guest of this New York City landmark and honestly it was anything BUT what it should have been. From the moment I arrived I was shocked and extremely disappointed. It took 46 minutes to check in, they had guests standing in one very long line that was snaking around a very crowded lobby, I can say that my bank at home does a better job of stream lining their customers then this hotel. It was only after standing in line that you read on a 8 1/2 x 11 laminated notice on a lobby table about 'express' check in...even the airlines and US Post Office have someone asking questions of people in long lines-so no one stands unnecessarily in a long line waiting for the simplest of requests. Now I finally make it up to my room where I am overwhelmed to see such a small room. Which was quite dirty and dingy, the beds were uncomfortable, linens felt worn and old, towels in the bathroom smelled funny and there was paint and plaster peeling from the back of the bathroom door. The tubs water spout was on but crooked so when an attempt was made to fix it you could actually turn it 360 degrees.Wow I could have my own waterfall ! Now if that wasn't bad enough we had requested a cot to arrive so upon returning to our room later in the evening it was there but no one had set it up it was standing straight up tied with what looked like a seat belt. Since the hour was now late. I headed down to guest services and voiced my concerns and was assured that my room would be changed but not until tomorrow and not until after 3 PM ..and so yes another 20 minute or so stand in a line so that I could receive my new room key .. now to add insult to injury before ever getting to our new room the toilet started to back up and become non functional in our old room I again headed down to guest services to voice my concerns where I was assured that the above matters would be addressed. So finally back to a new room which was really in all actuality was really no better as far as cleanliness to see the inch of thick dust in the air vents was GROSS and that was in the 'new' room! I even had to pick up a crumpled up piece of paper at the leg of the desk from the previous guest, and threw it in the trash can. Then there was the issue of the heating and how overwhelming hot and uncomfortable it was in the rooms, that to was brought to there attention but as you can imagine nothing again was done to correct this concern. We finally make it to the end of this stay and upon checking out, the car service we had used had some difficulty in locating the motor pick up area at the Waldorf Astoria so they requested that the pick up was at the main entrance at the hotel, when trying to retrieve our bags and get them to the location where we would be picked up the bell hop outside had that audacity to look us in the eye and yell and scream that we were using the wrong car service and we should of used his and that he wasn't going to get our bags so for 1 hour it was back and forth from concierge to concierge, to bell captain, to front desk he was yelling at not only myself but my other guests in my party, his behavior was embarrassing and humiliating and extremely condescending especially when he proceeded to act this way in front of a long line of other guests waiting in a long line for a taxi. I was embarrassed and humiliated as he was belittling me. Enclosing this trip was to be a celebration of a Birthday and of the Holiday season but due to our stay at the Waldorf Astoria I went home upset, angry and humiliated. I know that any of my future stays in New York will only be at Ritz Carlton as they are a 5 star hotel something the Waldorf Astoria will never be until they restructure there policy and procedures and retrain there staff on what Customer service is really about.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Similar to many others, after booking a stay at the Waldorf I then panicked slightly after reading some of the negative reports and considered changing my reservation to another Hilton in the city - I am an HHonours member so I always stay at Hilton. I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised and so glad that I did not cancel. We were greeted by the very friendly John (from County Mayo) when we arrived. John advised us to check our luggage in as the room wouldn't be ready for a while (it was 2.00pm). I declined saying that I had heard that it took an age for the luggage to appear in the room to which he was surprised. We joked about whether I would be able to check in when I went upstairs to reception. Happened to bump into him again in the lobby (with my room keys) as we were checked in by 2.15pm. I have to say that the receptionist was extremely friendly and welcoming. She also noted that it was my birthday and said that she would try and give us a bigger room which she did. No view unfortunately but as other reviewers have said - you are probably not in New York to sit in your room. The room was large with a large clean bathroom. There was sufficient space for clothes etc and there were facilities to make coffee although they were tucked away underneath the TV. Pamela did an excellent job of cleaning the room daily and as other reviewers have said the beds are soooo comfy with lovely bedding. We ate in Oscars every morning and thoroughly enjoyed the food. It was always extremely busy but there didn't seem to be too long a wait and overall it was a very pleasant experience. Although we never ate in the Bull and Bear the menu looked nice and not overly expensive considering the hotel we stayed in. Any contact I had with the staff was always pleasant, courteous and friendly - even when we departed, the doorman thanked us for staying at the Waldorf which I thought was a nice touch. All in all we had a lovely stay and glad I didn't change to another hotel. Access to the Executive Lounge and a room with a view on a much higher floor would have made it a perfect stay - but then I didn't pay the prices for that kind of accommdation! I would say give it a chance and at the end of the day if you check in and don't like your room you can always ask to be moved.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect new york experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week for the New Year's holiday for 2006 and it was great! I could not ask for a better New York experience. The staff service from the door men to house keeping was excellent they treat you as if you are royalty. The rooms are great (I stayed on the 12th floor)with a view of the small cathedral on Park Ave. There is one thing I must mention, that is the room service is quite expensive but the food is tasty I recommend the banana and pecan waffles! Also There is a great place in the Waldorf that is affordable and delicious called Oscar's and I would recommend eating there or visiting the hotdog vendor just to the right of the Park Ave. entrance. All and all this is a great hotel that knows how to treat you and that is extremly elegant.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - despite the reviews!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mops88
Reviews.Content: As with all the other recent trip advisor users, I too was worried having read the negative reviews of this hotel to the point of almost cancelling, I'm so glad I didn't! We stayed here for 6 nights over the New Year period in an executive King Size room and we couldn't fault it. The decor and furnishings were superb, the room was a great size with the most comfortable bed ever and the bathroom was clean and modern too. The room was cleaned daily with fresh towels and a nightly turn down service. All of the public areas were well decorated, clean with excellent service and the location of the hotel is fantastic with a constant queue of yellow cabs outside. This is a wonderfully historic hotel with many photos around to prove it. The only thing to be aware of, which another reviewer has mentioned, was the charge made on your credit card at check-in. They did not tell us that $600 would be cleared from our card (to cover the mini bar for the duration, whether used or not) and refunded 3 days after our departure, which gave us a shock when we obtained a balance. PLEASE be aware of this and do not use the new AMEX travellers cheque card for this. All in all though a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service”
Reviews.Author: brakston
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this wonderful hotel over the new year period. I travelled with my son and neither of us were disappointed with any aspect of our accomodation. The hotel not only lived up to our expectations but excelled them. Unfortunately I was taken ill in the early hours of Friday morning and required an ambulance. I was unconcious and my son had to deal with the situation but he was not on his own as the staff, in particular the Assistant Director of Security, were there to help and reassure him. I was speedily and efficiently taken to hospital where I made a full recovery and returned to the hotel with no ill effects. I cannot praise the staff at this hotel enough as without their actions and considerations I might not be here to write this review. Everything about The Waldorf was extremely good, the food, the rooms and of course the service and I can quite honestly say that I have never been treated better in any other hotel that I have stayed in either in New York or any other country, I shall, of course only ever stay at this hotel an any other trips to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the character and history”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having decided to get married in New York (in Central Park), we thought carefully about the choice of hotel to stay at. We had never been to NY before so relied on the internet for reviews. I had however, always had the name of the Waldorf=Astoria in the back of my mind. So we booked our stay of 5 nights at the W=A, even after reading the mixed reviews on this sight. Since returning I have continued to read the reviews, some of which leave me confused. I have read comments such as: "needs some updating"; "tired decor"; "discourteous staff"; "no internet connections"; "small bathroom and bedroom". To all the people who wrote such comments "GET A LIFE". Let me try to set the record straight. 1. Room size - we found the standard room we had more than adequate for us. My husband is 6'4" and not once did he band his head on the ceiling. If we stood in the middle of the room with our arms stretched out they did not touch the walls of the room. YOU ONLY NEED TO SLEEP IN THE ROOM IS SIZE THAT IMPORTANT?????? 2.Decor and furnishings - The hotel may indeed require renovation in certain areas or floors. Don't think of it in the negative; imagine the history that the objects could be holding. If you want to stay somewhere new/modern or recently renovated, do your research and stay in a place that has no character or history. 3.Internet connection - if there is not one in your room so what. Is that a reason to dislike a hotel? I DON'T THINK SO. Again if you are a business man then do your homework before you book and stay where your MODERN/CHARACTERLESS hotel needs can be met. 4.Staff courtesy - my favourite saying applies here, "You get what you give". Perhaps the staff that appear discourteous have just been treated like 'servants' which they are not. They have hundreds of people a day making demands on them - how would you feel? Ask nicely, be patient etc. If travelling with young children that may need special equipment (I have in the past, so i do know) take it with you/enquire first/make prior arrangements. Its not the fault of the hotel or staff if you have not made every prior attempt before your visit. Our room service was always prompt and what we asked for. We had our 'wedding breakfast' meal in the 'Captains Corner' of the Bull&Bear within the W=A.The staff members were attentive to us and all our guests. The food was delicious and the prices were of a standard price for the type of hotel we were in. The service in all the restaurants and bars we tried (Peacock Alley, Sir Harrys, Oscars, Cocktail Terrace and the Bull and Bear) was adequate enough. On the whole our stay was wonderful and there a few small things I would have preferred done slightly differently, nothing that tainted our stay. The staff on the whole were polite and responsive, the room was fine and the decor and cleanliness was fine too. Remember you are there in a piece of history to enjoy a fabulous city - SO ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Christmas Stay”
Reviews.Author: DCG
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at the Waldorf Astoria over the Christmas holidays and, after reading some of the very negative comments on these pages, I was somewhat anxious. I had stayed at the Waldorf several times before over Christmas and was worried, as many others had reported, that the standards had slipped. I can honestly say that I found everything totally to my satisfaction. A clean and well appointed room and first class, courteous service from every single member of staff I came across during my stay. The hotel was very busy but I was amazed at the level of service from the very patient and friendly staff who muct have been under enormous pressure with so many guests. I have stayed at some of the best hotels in the world - The Burj al Arab in Dubai, The George V in Paris and Sandy Lane in Barbados to name a few, but I can honestly say that my experience at the Waldorf most certainly represented outstanding value for money by comparison. The negative comments from other postings do not reflect the experience which I had at this excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - COCKROACH ALERT!”
Reviews.Author: WOLF_CUB
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf is most definitely a hotel living off of its reputation...I was very disappointed with my stay there - and especially disappointed in the level of customer service. We were travelling as a large group and some members of the party needed two adjoining rooms due to having young children - after phoning ahead and being promised that they would be allocated adjoining rooms, when we arrived the rooms hadn’t been allocated for us. We arrived at approx 11am and were told we wouldn’t be able to check into our rooms until 3pm so therefore had to trudge around with our hand luggage without being able to get changed or freshen up after a 7hour flight. When we finally got to our room we had been given a double instead of the twin that we had requested - we therefore had to take our luggage back downstairs and wait for a twin room to become available. After reading some reviews on Tripadvisor I was prepared for a 'less then modern' hotel - but the Waldorf is in DESPERATE need of a refurb - which they are now in the process of - however if you happen to get stuck on a floor where some refurb is taking place you may have trouble opening the door to your room as there is such a wind force blowing where some rooms have been gutted to the extent of having no windows. On the third night of our stay we arrived back to our room to be greeted by an 'unwanted' guest...A COCKROACH running under our door into our room!!!!! When we went back down to reception to report the 'visitor' it seemed that they were rather 'unwilling' to believe us! Which I found totally unacceptable and disrespectful. However eventually they sent someone up who luckily saw the thing in our bathroom and he eventually caught and removed it. It was now 3am and the manager informed us that he wished to fumigate the room so we would have to pack and move rooms - we were moved to the Waldorf Towers - much more impressive than the Hotel itself - however after unpacking and finally getting to sleep at 4am we were woken at 6am by the toilet flooding the bathroom! The morning we checked out we went off to do some last minute shopping before our flight home - my friends card was declined in a number of shops - when we returned to England she discovered that this was because the Waldorf had put a $400 block on her card to cover any costs that may have occurred to the room - they then informed her that they block would be lifted in 5 working days - this was very helpful as it was 3 days before Xmas and her card limit had been unnecessarily maxed out - when we handed over our card as a guarantee we were not informed of this! We stayed at the Waldorf for 4 nights and moved rooms 3 times - I WOULD NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Waldorf Astoria”
Reviews.Author: kidsnyc
Reviews.Content: It was everything we hoped it was going to be and more. It was grand and plush, it was exactly as we thought it was going to be. It was not at all stuffy or snooty. The staff were all very polite and friendly. The rooms were great. It was the most comfortable bed that I've ever slept on. For NYC room's, they were much larger than average. There was loads of room even though we had a roll-away bed in there. The carpet was deep and plush. The only downside was the bathroom was not as opulent as the rooms but it was clean and everything worked. It was everything you would expect from the grade of hotel that it is. The staff at Oscar's were great. We celebrated New Years Eve there. Being a large party of 9 with children we had been very worried that it would not be family friendly but how wrong we were. All the staff in all the bars and restaurants were so lovely. The location was great. We will be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Stunning...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Waldorf=Astoria many times, and mark my words.... YOU WILL NOT BE DISSAPOINTED! It is a Grand Hotel, with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Christmas Break at the Waldorf=Astoria”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a wonderful Christmas weekend spent at the Waldorf=Astoria. We were prepared to be disappointed after reading some of the terrible comments left here, but we found absolutely NONE of what other cranky travellers have reported. We paid a bit extra for an Executive room (approx. $250 a night) and were extremely pleased. It was clean, well appointed and had the most comfortable bed I think I've ever slept in. It was also HUGE by NYC standards. My sole complaint would be the number of tourists in the ground floor common areas (perhaps elevated by the holiday season). The staff could NOT have been more genuinely friendly, and I'm a hardened New Englander who's learned not to expect that sort of thing. For the price, the Waldorf=Astoria was really wonderful. The complaints I've read here would be valid if you were staying in a $500-700+ a night hotel elsewhere in the city (the standard if you're expecting that level of service). At this price, don't expect the world to stop for you. Enjoy yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Calling out for a desperate makeover!”
Reviews.Author: YoConn004
Reviews.Content: I don't know who would rate this hotel as a good place to stay in NYC, unless they're used to staying in gloomy, outdated, poorly managed hotels. While the Waldorf is indeed a good location for the holiday sights and Fifth Avenue shopping, it is far from the beautiful, elegant hotel it once was. Our suite had peeling wallpaper, cracking paint, a bathroom from the 70's and furnishings that weren't fit for a barnfire. And, all this for almost $1000 a night! Words to the wise...stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Falling apart”
Reviews.Author: phiphimomo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the same property several years ago and thought it might have some renovations. Unfortunately the room we were assigned needed definitely some touch-ups, especially bathroom and closet areas. Furthermore the room service was to our great disappointment. We asked for an electric water kettle as we traveled with our daughter and needed hot boiling water to sterilize her bottle. We were first disappointed by the answer that there wasn't any and but then delighted by the answer that they would bring us some hot water whenever we asked for. We asked 3 times. The first time it took about 25minutes to get some hot drinking water and the staff who brought up the water wasn't happy at all. The second time it took about15 minutes, which was acceptable. The third time we waited more than 40 minutes. I think if I asked for hot water from this so-called 5star property within 20 minutes, it isn't too much expected. It is sad that you booked a such well-known hotel and got to learn that their services still needs a lot of improvment.

Reviews.Title: “Fully Recommended”
Reviews.Author: RSJB
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a weeks break in New York and stayed at the Waldorf Astoria. The hotel is full of charm, character and history. It is not a modern looking hotel by any means which usually is the type of hotel I would go for. Having an 18 month old baby with us wasn't the easiest hotel to access with a buggy but the bellboys were always on hand to assist with carrying up the stairs. The hotel reception is so grand and fantastic from the flowers to the beautifull art deco. The staff were always helpful and very friendly (unlike some reports I read before going) and always had time to chat with you and made you feel very welcome. We asked for a King Size bedroom when we arrived and the room was very spacious even with a baby cot in the room and the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on in a hotel. The view from the room was non-existant but that seems to be the norm in New York. We didn't experience a really good value for money resturant anywhere but I think it was partly due to us picking poorly. The Bull & Bear restaurant in the hotel is very expensive but it's the best steak I have had for a long while anywhere. We had four main course meals, 1 sweet, 1 childrens main, 1 x bottle of champagne & 1 x bottle of wine which came to £600.00 including gratutity which was about $200.00!! The location of the hotel is spot on, you can walk pretty much everywhere you need to go for siteseeing and shopping. We went to Pax's Deli or Bon Pain on Madison Ave for breakfast every morning which is great value and only five minutes walk. The staff at Pax's were really friendly and loved children. New York is a great city to visit, the people are one of the friendliest (apart from the taxi drivers!!)I have ever experienced on my travels around the world. Have a great time!! I can't wait to return again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: julaphina
Reviews.Content: Everything was fabulous. We stayed from 11/17-22nd. The check-in from the airport went smoothly. The common areas and our room was immaculate. The friendly staff answered all of our questions with courtesy. We had previously stayed at the Marriott Marquis and the Shoreham. We will ALWAYS com back to the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “OKish for one night, what a shame !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in September and were very disappointed. The room was an adequate size but the bathroom cramped and with a chipped bath and basin. I was surprised not to find tea making facilities and internet connectivity which seem basic amenities to me, especially for $420 per night. When I rang to ask about the tea making (thinking it was an omission) the staff were terse and unhelpful. I would strongly recommend just 1 night to experience the art deco glamour of the public rooms and then move to a more comfortable and friendly hotel. Alternatively just go for tea and save a lot of money !! P.S. I gave reception my feedback form - no response, so I used their website to complain again - no response. Get the feeling they don't care..

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I immediately noticed a potential problem when we arrived at the hotel's garage. We left our car and were about to leave our luggage to be delivered when we noticed almost a hundred bags waiting to be sent to other guests' rooms. People were waiting everywhere to be serviced. When we told the bellman we would carry our own bags, he responded very abruptly and left without another word. At the front desk, there was a long wait to approach a desk for check-in. One couple next to us was complaining about not receiving their luggage for several hours. The representative mentioned that they had to be in the room to receive the luggage. The couple was apparently in the room, but never received their luggage. Another woman complained that the representative took her ticket and was told that she should look more carefully in her bag. Two representatives continued to help her for several minutes, while we waited at the desk. Neither one of the representatives even said anything to greet us. We ended up finding another desk. Even though we arrived over an hour after check-in AND called to confirm that our room would be ready, we learned at check-in that our room was still not ready. The representative left us waiting at the desk for at least 45 minutes to change our room. When she returned, she agreed to send us a complimentary amenities package for the delay. Once in the room, we ordered room service for dinner and received a wonderful meal in very little time. Later in the evening, we noticed that the package had not arrived yet. My husband called several times to see about the package, but still no package arrived. One woman actually hung up when she realized we had called back again. We finally reached a manager named Vidal, who promptly sent a bottle of champagne, cheese and fruit with complimentary breakfasts for tomorrow. That said, the suite was beautifully decorated, except for no coffee maker and a very small tub and bathroom space. In the morning, we forgot to bolt the door and were surprised by cleaning crew who just opened the door without knocking... even though we had asked for extended check-out and put a "Do-Not-Disturb" sign. After bolting the door, we still received knocks, even though the door says bolting the door notifies the cleaning service that the room is not to be disturbed. Someone did call later in the morning to apologize and see if there was anything else that could be done. Breakfast at Oscars was delicious. The manager even changed the date on one of our complimentary breakfasts, since we already had one. All in all, we'd definitely recommend going elsewhere. Four Seasons has similar decor and amazing service, not to mention Locctaine toiletries and free access quiet gym facilities.

Reviews.Title: “great value in Waldorf suite”
Reviews.Author: Cambridgtravler
Reviews.Content: We were in NYC for college visit, needed sleeping arrangement for three in three separate beds. For about $500 got a 1BR suite with two doubles in the BR and a pullout sofa in the LR. Beautiful furnishings, fireplace, comfy seating in living area, nice bathroom if smallish for a suite. Sofa bed was ridiculously uncomfortable, we folded it back up and made up the sofa into a bed, which was fine for my teen son. Love the public areas and bar, loved the room. Do wish they would give you a break on a slightly early checkin, we arrived about an hour early absolutely drained from a long drive in really bad weather, they would not budge on the time. All in all a good experience and the suite was cheaper than two standard rooms in another hotel,which would have been our other option.

Reviews.Title: “GRAND OLD HOTEL, but left me a little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Alan Doheny
Reviews.Content: Ok, we stayed here for 9 nights in Jan 2005. With all the history surrounding the hotel it was a little bit of a disappointment. The best part of the hotel is the different lobbies & as one previous reviewer wrote, "you can simply walk in off the street to view these". Our room was spacious with a superb view of the Crysler building, it wasn't very modern but you'd expect that for such an old hotel. The price for room service was unreal, we paid $70 for 2 sandwiches & $8 for a coke from the mini-bar!! As we were not business travellers,we weren't wearing suits, I found the staff treated us differently. For example, I was waiting to speak to one staff member to book a helicopter ride over New York. He was so ignorant & made me wait over 15 minutes, in the end I just left without booking the trip. On a positive note, we did leave some photographs behind, when we contacted the hotel upon our return to Ireland they posted the photos back to us, for which we were very greatful. Also the location for the hotel is good, in a nice & safe area. In summary the hotel is a GRAND OLD HOTEL, however, we simply did not find it worth the money. It seems to be survivng off it's name more than anything else. On our next trip to NYC we will not be staying at Waldorf Astoria.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with the Waldorf. Big Room for the price.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria was lovely and a good value. We spent 3 nights in an Executive Room with a King bed. After some searching in NYC at the last minute most rooms at 4 and 5 star hotels were over $400 a night (even on discount sites.) The room we had was under and huge by NY standards. Stayed in a suite at the Omni last year that was smaller and the service was poor. Our room was not renovated but was in very good shape. Staff was very friendly and very accomodating. Great bed and linens (300+ count), down pillows and comforter. Also exceptional location.

Reviews.Title: “Not Manhatten Spendour”
Reviews.Author: LisaSNewmarket_ON
Reviews.Content: "Wow, you're staying at the Waldorf?" was the response I got from friends and family. How disappointing it is to come home and say that the Waldorf is a flop! First day -- checked in and they said our room wasn't ready but come back in 30minutes and it will be. We went out and wandered around 5th avenue for 2 hours. Came back and it still wasn't ready. We had to wait for another 30 minutes, and all they had to do was check the room to make sure it was clean. We were in our room for 30 minutes, and maintenance came to fix our toilet (we didn't know it was broken because we didn't use it at this point). Sure enough, if we had have used it, it would have overflowed. That same night I wanted a cup of tea before getting ready for dinner. We called room service and asked for tea with milk. 45 minutes later, no tea. Called down and cancelled the order, but 5 minutes later up came the tea -- without milk. Called down and asked them to come and pick it up because it was wrong. Sunday when we left, the tea was on our bill ($14.95). Second night, I was blow drying my hair and the power went out in the bathroom. All that was on was the dryer and the light. The Waldorf is a Manhatten landmark hotel, but in need of repairs. Rooms are dated and small. Only half (if that) of the 6 elevators were working, so it took forever to make it to the lobby. Positives? The lobby is beautiful and the high tea was scrumptious. My advise is to stay at another hotel, and visit the Waldorf for tea!!

Reviews.Title: “Deserving of its lowly rating in NY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I find it outrageous to see a hotel with such history and reputation lying so low in the Tripadvisor ratings. How the hotel management havent reacted to this feedback is astonishing. I stayed here a wee while back and for such an iconic hotel, I found it a disappointment. Basically, the rooms are tired and in need of updating. I stayed in 2 rooms after requesting a move from the first (due to it being next to a noisy service elevator shaft). Both rooms had floral decor and bedding which isnt really my cup of tea. The wallpaper was shabby and I found it massively unimpressive. However, the building itself is in a great central location and you cant help but be impressed with the lobby. Also in the illustrious surroundings of the bar, you'll feel like a film star when ordering a gin and tonic. But this is all well and good, because you can enjoy this WITHOUT checking in. Just wander in off the street to sample the public areas. It's the rooms that we pay for. These simply arent good enough for 21st century travellers. You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “living on its laurels”
Reviews.Author: hemingwayaway
Reviews.Content: From when I was a kid the byword for luxury and extravagence was the Waldorf Astoria. Now being fortunate enough to afford to stay their I realise that it was one of those establishments that seek to rest on its past glory, much as many of new yorks jazz clubs. I booked a suite through Expedia and stayed on the 25th floor with no view, but 2bathrooms, a good sized bedroom and good sized living room. Nice furniture, excellent bed, average toileteries. Do not underestimate the drone of NY traffic even at this level - it is constant. The hotel is grand, but needs attention - quite how long it can hang on to its appeal I am unsure. Service is good-excellent. Rooms are not available until 3pm. Eating/drinking in the hotel is ridiculously expensive - but this is Manhattan. Plenty of cafes/diners on Lexington Avenue for breakfast/brunch and Grand Central Station Oyster Bar is only 5minutes walk away. The hotel is clearly a business hotel, rather than a leisure/tourist hotel. It is by far the busiest that I have ever stayed at and has an unstoppable schedule of dinners/conferences/etc that keep the bar stocked with revellers at all times of the day. This is probably not what a tourist wants to experience. To some extent unless you stay in the Waldorf Towers 'a hotel within a hotel' you might feel a bit cheated-a bit second rate, which is unfortunate. Overall, glad I went. Would not stay again, unless on business. If you are a tourist, you can stroll through the extensive lobby and visit the bar, savouring the grandeur, without the expense of staying here.

Reviews.Title: “OLD, broken hotel with INDIFFERENT staff (read more)”
Reviews.Author: garyfong1
Reviews.Content: Believe it or not this is all true. I'm here on business and have a sore throat and probably caught a cold. It's freezing in this room and I'm still here as I write this. I'm writing because nobody here will fix the problems. First two nights, the room was freezing, in the 60's. I called down and engineering told me that the hotel is on air conditioning only - so turning the heat on will only blow cold air - until October 25! I asked for a heater and he said we can only send up blankets. So that was day one - walking around with a blanket over my head and wrapped around me. Day two: 7am I call because I'm freezing. They said they have a massive group checking out and more heaters became available, and they'd send one "right up". They credited me one night stay. 455pm: Still no heater. I called down and with profuse apologies housekeeping sent one up - credited me a 2nd night stay. The heater worked for all of 2 hours and broke. Telephone was broken (handset) so I had to use the portable phone to call and ask for the phone to be replaced. "Right away, sir". It's 820 next morning - still no phone. Oh also I was told the manager was very concerned and would call within three minutes - still have not heard. Last night my girlfriend tried to take a bath - and the hot water wasn't working. Completely exhausted, we curled up in the freezing room. Two nights no heat in a freezing room. No hot water in the tub. Phone is broken. Requests that go unanswered. Welcome to the Waldorf Astoria!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms not what you expect”
Reviews.Author: Solic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf during Thanksgiving week last November. The location is excellent as is the hotel lobby but the rooms are very disappointing. The first room we were given was very shabby especially the bathroom so we asked to be moved. We were given a larger corner room with views down Park Avenue at extra cost. The room was still very dated and not particularly well maintained. The main complaint was that the room was cold. When we advised housekeeping we were told the heating was not yet switched on in November. They gave us an electric heater which worked fine except that it kept shorting because it seems everyone else had electric heaters in their rooms! Why didn't they just turn the heating on we asked but they could not give us an answer. We also had a bad expreiance in the Bull and Bear restaurant where the food was bad (inedible steak) and the service very poor (surly waiter). When we complained we received an apology and an offer of a free drink but nothing else - and it was not cheap. Overall we really enjoyed our stay in NY and the Waldorf and would probably stay there again. Just do not expect too much of the rooms and be ready to raise an issue if not satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Classy!!”
Reviews.Author: Allyone
Reviews.Content: My Wife and treated ourselves to a night in the Waldorf as part of our Vacation to Florida, having flown up for two days. The Entrance and Lobby is truly impressive, we booked through Expedia, and got a wonderful deal, $180.00 for a night, the room while not having a terrific view, was very large, with a walk in Cupboard, the bed was massive, and the all marble bathroom was very large. We did not eat here, friends have and thought the restaurants marvellous but had a couple of drinks in the bar, very snazzy!!, we only had a couple of days and the one night, so we spent all the available time out in NYC, but if I could get a similar deal, I would not go anywhere else, if you have a special day, anniversary, etc this is the place to go, we'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Glamorous But Dated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom suite, which had plenty of room and two bathrooms but was dated in decor and slightly shabby. Service in the bars and restaurants was excellent. Location is good for most areas of New York.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Waldorf for a special birthday and having come from the Bellagio in Vegas, expected it to be equally wow (but in a different way!) - was sadly disappointed. While the reception area of the hotel is magnificent in all it's art deco style - the rooms (especially for the price you pay)were sadly lacking - small, dingy and in dire need of updating - it's long gone past decaying grandeur. Within 24 hours of being their we had the need of 2 engineers (air conditioner, and electrics) and when we arrived at midnight they conveniently forgot to tell us there would be no water until 5.00 am (no shower, no hand basin, no toilet!). I've stayed in 2 star accommodation in Manhattan that was better. However you couldn't fault the staff who were very helpful and friendly. I stayed in the Le Parker Meridian last time I was in NY (March 2005) and although it is a completely different style of hotel - is far better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “How the other half live”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were given a 3 night stay in New York as a wedding present, and staying at the waldorf was one of the things that made it a truly amazing weekend. To us it really was an experience in how the other half live. From being helped from a taxi by a glove handed doorman, to being upgraded to a junior suite complete with chocolate dipped strawberries and champagne, to having a maid turn the bed down each evening, the other bejewelled fur coated guests (including a certain film star!) ... I could go on. Of course the most important things were that our suite was large, comfortable and absolutely spotless, as was the marble bathroom. The bathroom was big and beautiful as was the wet room style shower. The bed was large and comfortable. (You see a theme emerging here). Only minus points; food in the hotel was grossly overpriced especially mini bar & room service - price of a 3 course meal for a couple of snacks, didn't matter to us as New York is the place to eat out. We didn't have a view which again didn't matter as the room was so nice. Service was good but had not particularly personal or friendly. Apart from that - we were really really impressed. Not sure if we'll go back, it is so expensive and although the location is convenient for site seeing, we'll probably head for somewhere a bit more lively like tribeca next time. Great once off experience.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest Security Personnel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the hotel. It was my first time staying there and given my previous image of the hotel, I had high expectations. Late in the evening, one of the very large outside doors to the hotel slammed shut unusually hard on my arm and ripped my suit jacket. I reported this and they sent security to my room. They took my jacket and told me to go buy a new one - "no problem, we'll take care of it". Since I only had that one jacket with me, I bought a new one the next day and then checked out soon thereafter. Well, that was the last I heard from my sports jacket, the hotel staff, or the security people there. After much effort to get the hotel to resolve this, I called the police to ask what to do. The NYPD classified this as a grand larceny. I was told that this is apparently a common problem with "hotel security" in NYC. But I never expected this from the Waldorf Astoria Hotel! I was told I needed to pursue a civil action to get any recourse which should be either reimbursement for the cost of my jacket or simply my jacket returned to me. The Head of Security there had the nerve to tell the NYPD that they would pay me something but then later he never answered my calls. So thanks Waldorf Astoria for the wonderful stay in your hotel, and for the professional way you have handled this customer's problem. I hope someone there has repaired and is now enjoying my Italian sports jacket. To any and all visitors visiting this hotel: please be careful when you walk in the door. You can literally lose your shirt there.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Astoria -- Shame on you !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Writing this review while staying at the Waldorf -- Junior Suite, wanting to be pampered while traveling on business. Was brought to a beautiful suite -- but the smell was positively awful. The bathroom reeked of mildew emanating from the shower curtain. Waited 1/2 hour after I called the front desk requesting a resolution (asked for a new room) -- they said they'd call me back (ha!). I couldn't stand the smell in the room any longer, so I lugged my suitcases down to the lobby. Got a smaller room but at least no smell. (And, no apologies either!!) In the new room, found a tv remote control that didn't work (batteries had run out), and wanted extra pillows, so I called housekeeping. BY now, all I wanted was to crawl into bed, watch some TV and relax. -- 2 hours and several calls later, the remote and pillows finally arrived. I'm not typically a complainer, but for well over $500 / night, I expect excellent service, immaculate appointments, and most assuredly better service than I've received here. My advice: don't waste your good money -- You'll be terribly disappointed! Waldorf Astoria -- Shame on you!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Service - not good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, great looking hotel/reception. Service was really bad and not up to the standard I would expect from the Waldorf Astoria. We had been told that we could have a smoking room but were then told that there weren't any available (fine but why offer one to us in the first place?). We paid with our hotel voucher and they took a swipe of my credit card (fine and to be expected just incase we raid the mini - bar). However, on my arrival home I find that even though the hotel was already paid for, hence the hotel voucher, they have tried to bill me not once but twice for the cost of the accommodation to the tune of £2,000. No wonder my credit card company had put a stop on my credit card, I found this out when I went to buy something in Macy's and my card wouldn't go through. The rooms were very nice, we had upgraded to a one bedroom suite. We did find that not all of the lights worked and the coffee making facilities were located on a table by an electric socket that didn't work! If we wanted coffee we had to put the kettle on the floor by the only spare working plug. New York was fantastic and we will definitely be going again. It's nice to say that you've stayed at the Waldorf, however we won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “From days gone by”
Reviews.Author: SusieNotts
Reviews.Content: I have always dreamed of going to New York and staying at the Waldorf Astoria, to me it represented the true glamour and romance of the city. Upon arriving we were tired and just wanted to have a shower and then head off to take in a few of the closer sights. The queue to check in was HUGE, and when we finally got to the front we weren't even greeted with a hello or smile, just got asked for our names, not a good first impression. However, we were upgraded to the Waldorf Towers, apparently the more luxurious part of the hotel. When we finally found the lifts to go the Towers (we were finally told that you don't use the main lifts) and found our room, the first thing that hit us was the strong smell of cigar smoke (we had asked for a non-smoking room, but upon questioning this we were told that there were no non-smoking rooms in the Towers part of the hotel). However, the room was lovely, with fantastic views of Park Avenue from the bedroom window. Slight down side was the “elegant” marble bathroom wasn’t quite so elegant, as the basin had a large crack in it, and the wallpaper was peeling off. Why doesn’t Mr Hilton spend some of his large amount of cash doing minor repairs such as this, so that the hotel can maintain its image? In its favour, the bed had to be one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. Apparently you can even buy the mattresses! Of course, if you are staying in the Waldorf you feel like you are entitled to at least one lot of room service so we ordered breakfast. It was certainly impressive, the waiter who bought it up was so enthusiastic about it, and couldn’t do enough for us. Normally by the time room service gets to you it’s cold, not at the Waldorf, it comes in a heated trolley. There was a fresh rose on the table, and each glass of juice had its own mini ice bucket. The food was wonderfully prepared and plentiful. The main reception at the Waldorf is well worth visiting even if you aren’t actually staying at the hotel. It is steeped in history, with Noel Cowards piano in the Cocktail Terrace situated in the main entrance, and a large ornamental clock, designed for the World trade Fair, in reception. The enormous bouquets of fresh flowers are beautiful. If like me you fell in love with New York from watching old black and white films, then this is the hotel to stay in. Just be aware that now that the Hilton group has taken over, things aren’t quite as grand as they could or should be. I’m not sure I would stay at the Waldorf again, as I like to try different places, but I am glad that I have had the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best...if you can afford it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying at 'the waldof' 4 times now. Each visit is an experience. As a manhatten hotel the room are compact but never cramped.. Pluses:- The waldorf is all about the quality touches. The egyptian cotton sheets on superbly comfortable and generously sized beds, The afternoon turndown service, the marble en-suite bathrooms. The multitude of fresh towels twice a day, mouth wash as well as all the usuals in the bathroom including heavy cotton robes and slippers for every guest (if they're not there be sure to call housekeeping and ask for them as they are included). Fresh coffee makers in every room. High quality furniture. Friendly helpfull and ever present bell men. Cheerful and helpful reception staff. Relaxed upscale atmosphere. Giant fresh flower arrangements that are changed every few days. To be honest i always feel underdressed but never out of place, even just sitting on the comfortable sofas in the lobby listening to music being played on Cole Porters piano. Minuses:- As the title says, if you can afford it. The Waldorf is the best but you have to pay for the best. Room rates are high if you pay full price, i never do. Mini bar items are extremely expensive, say $4.50 for a 2 finger kitkat. The resturants cost a fortune, even breakfast is 36.50 each. But you do get that level of service. We had an early evening meal last year and counted 5 different waiters serving us. But it did got over $150 for 2 courses. Tips for visitors. Ask if you can have a corner room, these are larger and have several windows For breakfast go out of the Lexington ave entrance, turn left and go 2 blocks to a diner or 3 blocks to Au Bon Pain bakery. Let the bell man handle your luggage, thats his job and they are very good at it. When your leaving get them to put your bags in the store so you can have some time in the city before you leave rather than sitting waiting. If there are more than 3 of you take a cab to the airport, its a fixed fair and will work out cheaper than a shuttle. 51st subway station is closer and easier to use than grand central, even thou the maps may suggest otherwise. Buy stamps for postcards from the business center, they are normal price and they will post the cards for you. If your on 5th and get lost the hotel is on the same cross streets as Saks so its always easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “Cold shower”
Reviews.Author: ndwoods
Reviews.Content: Fantastic lobby, great NYC feeling. But no hot water on a Wed. morning at 7:30am -- essential for a business traveler. And who needs to wait in a line to check in? I'll go back to the lest interesting but more reliable Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location...”
Reviews.Author: MartinAB
Reviews.Content: My family, which includes 2 boys aged 12 and 10, spent 5 days touring New York City. Having lived in NYC for many years, and taking my family for their first visit to the city, I selected to stay here because of the location. This is a beautiful hotel in an ideal location. So many of the major tourist spots - 5th Ave, Rockefeller Ctr, United Nations, Central Park, Times Square, Broadway etc. are a reasonable walk from the hotel. The Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, 9/11 site, China town, Yankee Stadium are a short train ride on the # 4,5,6 line which stops right out side the hotel. The hotel lobby is still elegant after all these years and the rooms while a bit dated were very comfortable and clean. The on-site restaurant is a bit expensive for breakfast for 4. An excellent alternative is the out-door cafe (I think it is part of the Double Tree Hotel) located on 50th street between Lexington and 3rd Ave (a half block away when you go out the Lexington Ave exit). While there are more luxurious hotels in NYC than the Waldorf there is still something magical about this place. If you are coming to NYC as a tourist I recommend staying at the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed emotions but give it a try”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was surprised not to be able to completely love the Waldorf. My company gets a great rate and a courtesy upgrade landed me a junior suite, so I had an incredible amount of space for a NY hotel--in fact, the room was so large that the furniture felt sparse! The bathroom was huge and luxurious with lovely bath products, everything was clean and well lit, the bed linens and the view were great, and the bed was super-comfy. That said, the Waldorf clearly has seen better days. The hall I was on had a musty odor and badly spackled and patched walls, and worn carpet. All of the hotel seemed to need refreshing, being a bit faded and down at the heels. I wouldn't pay a lot of money for it because it's no Four Seasons, but if you can get a good rate, stay here for a glimpse of the past and for solid comfort and the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Experience”
Reviews.Author: Atlanticca
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf was all I expected in one way, and yet not all I expected in another way. It was classically decorated, not too overly done. I did find the check in was a lengthy wait / process. The room we had was nice, but it had absolutely no view. The bed linens were fabulous and the washroom was nicely equipped. Our room was quite spacious, which was nice. I do not think the rate for our room was worth it. Maybe a more elaborately decorated room with more offered would be worth the price we paid, but nevertheless it was a fun time in New York, and spending our last night in the city at the Waldorf was a nice end to our trip.

Reviews.Title: “magical time”
Reviews.Author: ruskie
Reviews.Content: Myself, hubby and daughter (14) stayed at the Waldorf in February this year - We had a room on the 17th Floor with two large double beds and a fairly large bathroom, no view but very quiet - We found the beds very comfortable and the room was fine..if like us, it is your first trip you will only use the room for collapsing in after a long day sight seeing. We were very worried with some of the reviews after booking but were very pleasantly suprised when we arrived - staff were effecient and pleasant, we were met after being dropped of at the back entrance and our bags taken away immediately - they arrived two minutes after we did and the gentleman bellman made sure we were quite happy. Although the hotel is sligtly faded, we all loved it, I think this is part of it's charm, there are plenty of modern hotels in New York but this place just felt...nice - even our daughter posed happily for photos at the large floral arrangements. We did not eat in the hotel but found two great deli's just across the road going towards Times Square - 1 Burger Heaven & 2. Au Bon Pain - The best almond croissants and fresh juice. We went on the 48 hour Gray Bus Tour and although it was Freezing and we had to wear two hats and two pairs of gloves - it was truly fantastic - especially seeing Brooklyn Bridge & Manhattan from Brooklyn. Central Park was great, the gates were being exhibited in February and the atmosphere was fantastic- and ice skating at the Rockerfeller - it was truly one of our best holidays ever - You will love it...enjoy...it was so good we went back in August.

Reviews.Title: “A must in NYC”
Reviews.Author: SA29
Reviews.Content: I must admit, I was expecting decadent opulance when I booked a room at the Waldorf Astoria, but it wasn't like that at all, I was still pleasantly surprised to see a hotel filled with so much character and old world charm. We asked for an upgraded room at checkin but were told we were the tenth guest to ask that question that afternoon, but our room was still large and comfortable, the furnishings are antique style and the light fittings gave the room a very warm feel, the view was of a side building, could have been better. The bathroom was very clean and tidy, with lovely toiletries provided. The location is quite central, even though its an expensive hotel I would recommend even a one nights stay, so you can experience a true New York legacy.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but could have been better - rather faded.”
Reviews.Author: mfm82
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I stayed here for 4 nights in February 2005, over Valentine's Day. We were surprised that on arrival we had to go up from the luggage bay, rather than being dropped of (by one of the hotel limos) at the main Park Avenue entrance. The lobby is undeniably spectacular, but the wait for check-in was excessive. Our room wasn't ready, despite our travel agent requesting early check-in for us. Eventually, we were given the key to a room, and directed towards the elevators. As someone else commented, we also got static electricity shock all the time - from elevator buttons, door handles, anything going! When we got to the room, I was surprised at the size of it - it seemed small, especially given the grand and luxurious 'facade' of the hotel. Still, the bedroom was nicely decorated, and the bed was comfortable. The view left a lot to be desired - looking out towards tower blocks (I suppose kind of unavoidable in NYC) with a roof with A/c units on it about 4 storeys below. This didn't cause us any problems with noise since it was so cold outside we didn't open the windows. The bathroom was badly in need of renovation - and was exceptionally small, even for a city hotel. The sink area and mirror in particular needed replaced. The mini bar was very expensive, and the internet facility, at $10 a day through the television was not worth the money - you couldn't get to certain sites because of the difficulty of using a cursor. We dined in The Bull & Bear on our first night, and were extremely disappointed. Drinks ordered after our starters never arrived, and my fiancé’s main course was brought to the table incorrectly cooked (a steak, very well done) was brought cooked medium-rare, despite my fiancé saying when he ordered that it had to be absolutely cooked through. The steak was brought back again, still undercooked, and again finally cooked well enough. By this time, however, I had finished my main course as much as I could - although it was bland and tasteless chicken, grilled and chewy. Therefore, we hadn't eaten together on our first night in NYC. The maitre d' also seemed to be unable to ask the chef to cook a portion of plain mashed potatoes, saying the chef only had garlic mash available. If a hotel of the reputation and standard of the Waldorf=Astoria cannot produce a portion on plain, non-garlic mashed potatoes then the kitchen is severely lacking. The side of vegetables my fiancé ordered also came 5 minutes after the steak was finally delivered thoroughly enough cooked. By this point, we were so tired, frustrated and disappointed in the restaurant which is so highly praised, thus why we decided to dine there, that we left, my fiancé having not eaten his main course, and me not having much of the main course. We informed the maitre d', who had been off-hand and unhelpful, that we were leaving and did not expect to see the attempt at a meal on our bill, he suddenly became very apologetic, especially, we suspect, as we had told him so in front of a group of 6 other customers. He pleaded with us to come back the next night, although we already had plans, and we unable to. He said a breakdown in communication was to blame, and that plain mash could certainly be made, despite his earlier claim that because it was a Saturday night, the kitchen was busy and couldn't. Instead we were offered a complimentary room service breakfast, which we took full advantage of on February 14th. We didn't dine in the hotel on any other occasion as a result of this bad experience - a good suggestion for breakfast is a little deli with a maroon awning opposite St Patrick's cathedral, which is about 2 blocks up from the Waldorf. The concierge was helpful, and found us a reservation at a very nice Italian restaurant off Broadway for dinner before we went to see the Producers. However, when we asked how long we should allow for dinner to get to the theatre in time to collect our tickets, the concierge got the time of the show wrong by 1/2 hour, and we had to run to get to the show. This hotel is very impressive in the public areas, but considering the room rates, I would say it is need of renovation in a number of areas (the rooms, and bathrooms in particular). Check-out took quite some time as there were long queues in the lobby. It then took us almost an hour to get a car or cab to the airport, despite the bellboy telling us we'd be able to get a cab within 5 minutes. We eventually had to commandeer one of the hotel's cars to take us, for twice the cost of a cab - if we'd waited much longer we'd have missed our flight. As I said, a nice hotel, faded grandeur, with some rooms badly positioned and laid out. The staff were also questionable at times - some were very pleasant, yet others seemed to look down at guests. It was nice to stay here for the experience, but there are so many other hotels in NYC that I think I'd try more of them before rushing back to the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Waldorf!”
Reviews.Author: FionaBell
Reviews.Content: I read the mixed reviews and started to get nervous about our stay. My worries were unfounded. This was a wonderful hotel with an excellent midtown location. The lobby was gorgeous, marble floors, crystal chandeliers and enormous bouquets of fresh flowers. The room wasn't huge, but very nice. The bed with the soft sheets and comforter was the best. As soon as I came in from a long day of sightseeing I loved melting into it. Our window even offered a view of the Chrysler Building which was a nice touch. The staff was also lovely. They were friendly and attentive. It's obvious the clientele has changed a lot over the years (we're now all wearing tank tops and flip flops), but the staff was as cordial and helpful as could be. The restaurant prices did seem a little stiff, so we left the hotel for meals. We had a nice stay which was probably made even more enjoyable by the excellent room rate we received.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf is not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: smlbusowner
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite at the Waldorf for a vacation arriving on a Friday and leaving on a Monday. As people have said in the past, the check in line was forever. Once we got to our suite, it was big, but everything in it was worn. Both air units seemed to try to keep up with the hot weather, but it was having a hard time. Our second night there, we returned to our room at 11:00 at night to find out that one of them was leaking. The floor around the unit was soaked with water. After several attempts to get someone to fix it, they put towels down on the ground and said they would come back with a wet vac the next day. They took that night off the bill, due to the fact they had no where to move us. We thought the problem was fixed. The next night, it started leaking again on us. The floor was soaked. After five visits to the front desk the day before, all of which had long lines, they still didn't correct the problem. The Waldorf lives off of its name alone. The customer service doesn't want to help nor really cares about problems during your stay. At the end, they just told us to fill out a comment card! After talking to some other guests, we discovered we were not the only one's with room problems. Also, as another reviewer said, tank tops and cut off jeans everywhere. Even though it states on their web site and in the book in the rooms, that they have a dress code. NYC has so many great hotels to stay at, and this is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: mackem15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the waldorf for seven nights and had a great time. However there were a couple of drawbacks in that the bathroom could have done with updating and the fact that you only got complimentary coffee in the room.
