We ate breakfast at Oscars one morning which was fine - the bill came to around $60 for two buffet breakfasts which at first seemed expensive but when compared to a UK hotel we stayed at the month before it was around the same price. However if you leave the hotel out of the Lexington Avenue exit and walk towards Central Park you will find several diners only a couple of blocks away who charged us around $25 for two huge buffet breakfasts! Much cheaper!!!! We also ate at the Bull and Bear and enjoyed some fab cocktails there - the meal was fantastic as were the cocktails and not too pricey! Overall we had a fabulous stay at the Waldorf - the room was beautiful as was the entire hotel, the staff were polite and the food ace (if a little pricey) I would reccommend anyone to stay there at least once.

Reviews.Title: “You don't get your money's worth!”
Reviews.Author: hirondelle11
Reviews.Content: Having read so much about this famous hotel we were quite disappointed about the room. Admittedly, the public areas and the lobby are beautiful, but the room we had on 10th floor was just mediocre. The beds (2 twin beds) were very comfortable, the room was quite small and the bathroom even smaller. The chair had stains on the upholstery and the one blind at the window was out of order. We had one soggy bar of soap for 3 days until we got a new one and our toothbrush glasses never got cleaned. The noise level was very high: we could hear the people next door using the bathroom and the hairdryer. Our room was facing unto a roof with some kind of a compressor which was making a lot of noise. I really don't think that we got our money's worth. Next time we will be looking for something cheaper since we only planned to sleep in the hotel anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Astoria - Manhattan NY”
Reviews.Author: pchnmain
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf Astoria from Jan 21-28, 2005. A couple of observations: (1) the facility is older; but it is very well maintained. But I admit that I wanted to stay here just to experience this hotel; for example, the lobby area is of a style that just isn’t replicated anymore. (2) Evidently, the site hosts a lot of meetings and other functions. So after coming back to the hotel after work, the lobby was very crowded. (Suggestion: if you can, enter through the Lexington Ave entry. It is usually the Park Ave side of the building that is crowded.) Fortunately, security staff manning their post is very obvious. (3) The service extended to me was very good. Example: I arrived at the hotel at 5:30am after a “red-eye” flight. Unfortunately, all the rooms were full, and no one had check out yet. The clerk made a specific attempt to get me a larger, corner room (he noted that I would be staying for a week), and asked house keeping to expedite the cleaning of that room when it became available. For my part, I went to the office, and my room was ready for me by lunch time. I did have the option to stay at another (newer) hotel, but all in all, I would say that it was worth staying at least once, for the experience of it all. pchnmain

Reviews.Title: “Very grand but doesn't deserve the reputation”
Reviews.Author: walkerSuffolk
Reviews.Content: We (two adults, two children) stayed for six nights at the Waldorf. The public spaces downstairs are impressive but the room was ordinary and although there were four of us in the room we were given two glasses, two coffee cups etc. Decided to have afternoon tea and when we arrived at the time booked we were told that we would have to come back in 20 minutes because they had only one table for four and they were expecting a VIP. Returned after twenty minutes to be told we would need to wait another twenty minutes. Told them politely to stuff it and left with the VIP still not having appeared. Hotel is brilliantly positioned and for what we paid great value, we had a good deal through Expedia, though I wouldn't pay the normal rates which are based purely on the name.

Reviews.Title: “Daughter Thought It Would Be Cool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We (wife, 2 teenagers, and I) stayed here over President's Day weekend, mainly because as we were searching online for places to stay, my daughter spied the name and convinced us that, Waldorf-Astoria equals NYC. (I think she's seen too many Fred Astaire movies.) That turned out to be part of the experience; watching the "swells" and wannabes promenade through the lobby. Room (2 beds) was $239/night, which seemed comparatively cheap for the dates and location. Add on $25/night for a rollaway bed. That was a problem because the room was tiny. People could not pass each other between the foot of the bed and the dressers. We wound up pushing the beds further apart to fit the rollaway in between. But the beds were comfortable once we settled in. We were on the "newly-remodeled"(?) 10th floor. Our view was of the "W" hotel across the street. It was a decent, basic, nothing-special room. As we were there with teenagers, the TV reception was important. It was OK, but the stations higher on the dial (including the premium channels) were fuzzy. There was a good range of PPV movies. A note about parking: we drove down and left the car with the valet service, which charged $45/day. That seemed awfully steep and I was planning on leaving it there just the first night, but during our walks around the area (very convenient location, BTW) it became clear that, unless I wanted to stray more than a few blocks from the hotel, parking garages were charging $30/night and more anyways, so I left it there. I'm sure with more research you could find cheaper parking somewhere nearby, if it's important. Overall, we had a fun weekend. It was a 10-15 minute walk to Times Square, 5th Ave, Rockefeller Center. We took in a play, ate well, visited museums, saw the "Gates" in Central Park (Sorry, didn't get it). The hotel (at least the lobby and the location) did become part of the NYC experience, as my daughter had predicted.

Reviews.Title: “Betraying a storied hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We sometimes use Priceline and are generally pleased with the result (we only do 4 star and up). Thus, we were very happy to see that we had been assigned to the Waldorf Astoria for three nights starting on Valentine's Day. We also called ahead to the Waldorf itself to request a non-smoking king room. For one of the world's most storied hotels, the Waldorf's rooms were in poor repair (I actually cut my foot on a carpet nail). Priceline customers get the less desirable rooms: my pregnant wife (who got to the hotel first) was given a smoky room, then we were given twin beds (Happy Valentine's Day!). That was the carpet nail room -- and the carpet itself was dirty. At first she was told that there were no other rooms available -- OK, perhaps that's the breaks. Then a more honest staff person admitted to her that Priceline customers didn't have access to the better (read:acceptable) rooms. Only when I went down to complain at midnight about the inadequate room, dirty carpet and roaring exhaust fan outside the window were we given a non-smoking king for the next 2 nights. The new room was better, although it had a terribly cracked sink and the heat didn't work. (Two calls resulted in a sympathetic response, but no heat.) We are real hotel buffs, and understand the challenges of an older property. The public areas of the hotel are terrific. But overall, the Waldorf needs serious work in the rooms. And a 4 star hotel should be 4 star for ALL it's guests, and not treat Priceline customers as 2nd class citizens.

Reviews.Title: “Is this Grand Central station?”
Reviews.Author: serendipit4
Reviews.Content: Incredibly large and spacious hotel. Over 1000 rooms! So busy,that the history and 'eminent elegance' is hard to take in at first as one's senses are diverted to negotiating the crowds! Our friendly and very patient receptionist spent at least 15 minutes getting us the best possible deal. We rang up on the day, following tremendous disappointment with the Hotel Giraffe(see review..if it's published!) and were offered a room @ $309. As we made our way to this thronging hotel, we decided to negotiate what deal we could arrange on a suite. We were not disappointed. For $500, we were offered a 14th floor luxury suite with breakfast. Our receptionist spent a good 15 minutes obtaining the best deal, even dissuading us from the Waldorf Towers as some of the suites there were apparently in need of decoration (not quite her words but we knew what she meant!) My wife thinks I have been very mean only giving the hotel 3 stars(she would have gone for 4 and awarded the Ritz Carlton an off the richter scale 5) but despite the wonderful space and the chance to finish the 600 plus pages of Dan Brown's 'The Da Vinci Code' in a priceless setting, I feel the Waldorf has seen better days, belongs to a different era and is just too darned busy to be a first class hotel. On top of the problem of the overwhelming crowds, breakfast in Oscar's brasserie was greasy, hectic and the tables were too small and close. We love to linger over a good holiday breakfast but here we more eager to return to our room. The bathroom too, despite the majestic space, lacked the special touches of a Ritz Carlton. Put crudely, it was not the kind of hotel where you couldn't wait to take a goody bag home of all the fancy extras. Stupid details like no toilet door in the bathroom also grated. A luxury suite these days should offer 2 enclosed toilets! An interfering bellboy who was keen to clean our kitchen,despite the fact that we were still packing (it was only 10.15) had to be practically ushered out the room. He wiped the spilt coffee with one of the bathroom towels and left it there, stained in a heap.Just can't imagine that sort of sloppiness and rudeness at a, dare I say it again..Ritz Carlton. Anyway, it WAS a fabulous space as I hope the pictures bear out(Sorry, after 5 or 6 attempts, site won't let me upload photos) Well, we appreciated the whole occasion of having stayed in the Waldorf but wouldn't recommend it, despite our fabulous suite.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Sander23
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in November. After the booking I read the terrible reviews on this website. But I wanted to experience this Legend myself. At check in (17.30 pm) we were immediately being helped. I asked for a remodeled room with a nice view. And that we got. She told us that the 10th floor was recently remodeled and she gave us a room with two double beds with a nice view above Park Avenue. The room itself was magnificent. It had high ceilings, two really comfortable beds with lovely sheetings, the view was really nice and the bathroom was quite big. Overall our room was above anything I've expected! We also had a couple of drinks at the cocktail terrace and Sir Harry's Bar, more expensive than here in the Netherlands but the ambiance made it up. There was one small incident, on our first night the wake up service rang at 1.00 am! We were just to sleep. That morning we went to the reception. They were very sorry but she would double check that it wont happen again. Our room was cleaned two times aday! In the afternoon the room was cleaned and the beds were made up. And when we got back in the evening the beds were ready to sleep and the pillows were placed on the bed. Also the menu for roomservice lay on my bed, although we didn't use this service. To my experience the staff was very friendly and there were no problems. On the last day we left our luggage in the "cellar" and when we were ready to go to JFK a staffmember would arrange a yellow cab for us. For me the Waldorf=Astoria is truly a magnificent place to stay. Located in midtown close to al the fantastic expensive shops and central park, and only a 20 minutes walk from the busy Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “you dont get the room you paid for unless you complain!!!”
Reviews.Author: UkFordy
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a 3 night stay with my daughter as my 43rd birthday treat. We booked and paid for an executive king which we were told wasnt a problem. On arriving at the hotel we were told that we were being checked into a very nice room, which i thought was what i had paid for. On getting to our room i discovered it wasnt the like the picture on the internet, so i rang the front desk and asked what sort of room i had been given. I was told a standard double. I explained what i had paid for and was told no problem and to bring all our luggage back down to check in where we would be given the right room. On returning to check in i was then told there was no executive king rooms available as they were all booked and would have to go back to the room we had just been told to come from. I had had enough, it was 4am my time i was tired and fed up. but i had been promised that a executive king had been blocked for the next day., so we lugged our suitcases back to the 18th floor to get some sleep. The next morning i checked our room was going to be available, and was told no problem i would be in by 3pm and they would even move our luggage across, so when we came back later that day all we would have to do is pick up our new key card. If only that had happened, but o no, when we got back we were told that the room had now been blocked for the following day. Which was our last night. They had now gone too far so i demanded to see the manager on duty. He didnt come out to see me, but when she came back, about 5 minutes later she told me that she hadnt realised that i had been given a one bedroom suite. Anyway it ended well, the room was amazing and we got free breakfasts for 2 mornings. It really is a shame that a hotel with such a high rating can think they can get away with this. Because i know if i hadnt complained we would of spent the 3 nights in a lesser room then we had paid for. I wont be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Bag stolen”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although the lobby was beautiful, the rooms were just average. My room had no way to control the temperature, with it on room was 85 degrees, with it off it was 60 degrees. Check-in was about thirty minutes to get through the line in the lobby. Then we were told they didn't have any king beds available, which we had reserved. At check-out there was only one man in the loading area, and we thought he worked for the hotel. After helping us load some of our bags, he grabbed our laptop computer bag and ran away with it. No bellmen or security people were present to help. We called security and they said this happens all the time that bags get stolen during check-in or check-out by New York City street criminals. They need a better and safer system for check in an check out, and for help with luggage, forget it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: janemc315
Reviews.Content: The architecture and decor in the main lobby is a must. This did make the stay there worth while. However, the staff were extrenely arrogant and patronising and it made us feel slightly inferior - not something we wanted to feel when we were paying $1000 for 4 night's stay. The room itself was small, dark and with a terrible view. The sink in the bathroom needed a complete overhaul and this, along with other nuances, marred our stay at this majestic landmark.

Reviews.Title: “loved every minute!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and 2 children (11 & 13) stayed at this awesome hotel for 5 nites in one of the suites. We had plenty of help with check-in and our baggage delivery to our room. The lobby is so impressive with these enormous fresh flower arrangements, I could sit in the lobby for hours just watching all the people from all over the world mingling (but I really didn't have time). Too much shopping, plays and sites to see. Every time we came thru the front doors, I felt right at home. The bed was the most comfortable one I'd ever slept in (by the way, when I got home I ordered all the stuff to make our bed just as comfy, and it is!) The last nite there, they were making a movie using the revolving front doors which we found very exciting.We enjoyed this hotel so much we will definitely go back there as soon as we can!

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf=Astoria at Christmas & New Year”
Reviews.Author: luckystrike
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Waldorf=Astoria for 15 nights over Christmas and the New Year, and it was fantastic in every way. The staff were very professional, from our arrival to our departure. The hotel was beautifully decorated for the festive season, and we felt right at home, despite our concern that we may be a little lonely on Christmas Day in particular. We were also encouraged to explore the hotel, and this gave us a real insight into how truly wonderful it is. The Park Avenue location was excellent, with all of the key sights of Manhatten within walking distance. To get downtown, there way a metro station right at the back door, on Lexington Avenue. We were also pleased to find lots of well priced bars and restaurants on 2nd Avenue, between 45th and 55th streets. Because we were staying over Christmas, our room was upgraded for us, to one with a dressing room, and a great view up Park Avenue. The restaurants were great, both Oscars and The Bull and Bear, and room service was superb. Despite what other Trip Advisors have said about the price of the burgers, I would say that they were worth every penny! When we return to New York City, we will certainly be staying at the Waldorf=Astoria!

Reviews.Title: “Aging Lady”
Reviews.Author: Wolverine
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf is an historic old hotel. Some of the rooms are fantastic (for example, a suite we used for meetings was spectacular). However, my personal room, rated as "Deluxe", was run down. This room would barely qualify as a "2-star". Although supposedly recently rennovated, the enamel in the bathtub was extensively chipped and worn. The carpets were dirty. The blinds were soiled and hardly worked. Basically, not the place you'd voluntarily choose to stay. So, I get the sense that staying at the Waldorf can be hit and miss. I'd recommend you specifically ask for a newly rennovated room (in the past 24 months) in the Park Avenue tower. Alternatively, there are many other great hotels in the area (for example, the W hotel, right across the street).

Reviews.Title: “Not A Five Star Hotel nor close.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was a mess. No one greeted us upon arrival (so that means no doorman or bell service.) The place is a maze from the start. No signs to where exactly is the front desk. Beautiful inside, high ceilings, big sparkling Christmas tree, marble tables with nice flower arrangements, etc. Used the self check in machine because there was an extremely long check-in line (3pm). To find out that our room was not ready and that we had to wait in the long line. 30 minutes later, got keys to our Park View room and their was no bell person available to bring our luggage to the room. So we brought it up ourselves. The place is the most confusing place ever (it was built in the shape of like 4 H's put together and they had lots of rooms). Also no upgrade was available even though we were Hilton silver members. After 30 minutes of being lost on the 12th floor we finally find our room. Oh and the views of the park were excellent (NOT!). We were on the 12th floor and could not even see the park. Also it was not views of central park it was views of their own little park that they developed themselves. So basically the only thing that we had good views of was the room on the other side of the H. The bathroom was made out of marble (old) but nice, no jets in tub and small tub. No special soap or shampoo... these were ones that you may find at let's say comfort inn. Beds were great and very comfortable. No plasma TV = junky comfort inn style television. the internet costs like $20 a hour. You have to request turn down service. On the plus side Hilton… being a silver member sent us a bottle of wine and chocolates which was designed like art (almost too good to eat.) The room was nice but needed a paint job and for those that work their it was room 1278(also the ceiling looked like it was going to fall). My advice if this place is $300 a night it's worth the additional $200 to stay at trump (that’s how bad it was). Read my trump review. Self check out was easy…that was great because I just wanted to check out and get back to trump. Again no service with luggage, etc. Oh I just noticed they charged me an additional $2... It was like my room charge and then $2 more! What?

Reviews.Title: “Best NYC has to offer”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: To stay at the Waldorf Astoria is to appreciate a time and place where things were done differently. If you are counting the pennies, don't even consider this hotel. Although to be honest, it is reasonably priced, but, you need to expect the extras! We stayed there in September 2004, we escaped Hurricane Ivan in Florida, only to find it caught up with us in NYC....can't help the weather. At 8:00am we awoke to the sound of a thunderstorm and a leaky window. While most would complain, we knew what a hurricane could do, and this was nothing to worry about! The staff were always courteous. They were a little slow in the Bull & Bear, but, the quality made up for the speed. We traveled by limo, best bet for NYC, and the hotel staff took good care of us at all times. They fixed us up with rides which were better and less expensive than we could have achieved on our own as out-of-towner's. The suite was comfortable, it wasn't modern, we didn't expect or want it to be modern! Apart from a window that leaked during a hurricane it was faultless. Their checking in process could be better. But, I suspect it is if you stay there regularly, which we don't. All in all, they run a good business for the occasional visitor. They probably go the extra mile for the regs.....nothing wrong with that! At the end of the day we have to compare apples with apples. For the occasional traveler to NYC then the Waldorf Astoria has to be the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - staff overworked!”
Reviews.Author: Wesleyb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister over Christmas 2004. I had read the reviews and was expecting a nice hotel, with some temperamental staff. How wrong - it was a fantastic hotel, and the staff always did their best to please, even if they were totally overworked! Two concierges for a 27 storey hotel! The breakfast was great - but the queues stretched out of the door and up the stairs - perhaps there could be an overflow to the Bull and Bear? Reception staff were fantastic and helpful, as were all other staff. The room was great - with a view, not too small and the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in! one small complaint though - be careful in winter time as the heating is erratic, and didn't work in our bathroom. Security is good - despite the crowds in the lobby, you need a key to go upstairs after 11. All in all I'd thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting an authentic New York Experience. Other 'minimalist' hotels just don't compare.

Reviews.Title: “Bring plenty of spending money!”
Reviews.Author: briant2001
Reviews.Content: Waldorf Astoria Hotel - very nice. Surprising $100per night deposit required "just in case" you wish to use their extra services is absolutely rediculous! Especially since I'd just given them the $1,600 we were paying for the room (which we'd saved up for ages) at the start of the holiday! Before I knew it the receptionist had swiped my card and charged the $100/night fee without my authorisation - leaving my bank account back home almost empty and eating into our spending money big time! We were promised a full refund when we checked out provided we didn't use the services! After a 7 hour flight from Ireland I was not amused - not a great way to start my holiday. I wouldn't normally mind except there was no mention of this fee at any stage of my booking - I've been to hotels where they've taken a swipe of my card - but a $100/night DEPOSIT is excessive!!! Sorry, back to the hotel - really nice pleasent stay, but I'd agree with earlier reviews, the rooms lack that something special which the rest of the hotel undoubtably has! I'd only recommend it if you can afford the additional deposit!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: IranianInUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during April 2004, and all I can say is what a fabulous hotel. When arrived at the Waldorf Astoria, you feel like an 50's movie star, there is something very glitzy and glamorous about the hotel. The lobby is spectacular and an attraction in itself and its grandeur and splendour are unrivalled. The bedrooms are classic, quaint and tastefully decorated. The location is possibly better than any other hotel in New York, where most of the main attractions in Manhattan are within very short walking distance due to its location on Park Avenue (especially if you're into shopping!). The restaurants are superb. Oscars had superb breakfast buffet which I would never miss, and stake at the Bull and Bear was divine which is why it is literally one of the most famous restaurants in the world. There is a restaurant very nearby that I simply cannot ignore mentioning. It is an upscale Chinese restaurant almost next to the hotels back entrance called Mr. K's (570 Lexington Avenue). This is simply my favourite restaurant in the world. Immaculately clean, plush surroundings and design, and simply the best Chinese food i have ever had, they treat you like royalty here and be sure to pay it a visit. Back to the hotel, it really is a fabulous hotel and it surely lives up to its name, very glamourous, very glitzy, very luxurious, and most of all very New York!

Reviews.Title: “Stepping Back in Time”
Reviews.Author: lolo51
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Waldorf in June celebrating our anniversary. What a place! Walking into the lobby, you feel as if you are stepping back in time...in a good way! The decor is fabulous and the staff could not have been friendlier. As luck would have it, we arrived on the night of some high school prom! Young people in gowns and tuxes. It was magical, although a bit crowded in the lobby. But who cares...it's the Waldorf. Checking in, we were not able to be upgraded that night as they were sold out, but we were assured that an upgrade would be available the next day. My husband's a Hilton Diamond VIP member, so we usually get treated well! Exhausted from travel, we didn't mind and got a lovely room, although small, it was more than adequate - all marble in the bath, beautiful dark wood furniture. We went down to breakfast in the a.m. and out to the streets and upon our return, our luggage was transferred to the promised upgraded room. It was beautiful and roomy with a wonderful view of the Chrysler Building. We couldn't have been happier. We dined at Oscar's and although quite expensive, the food was fantastic, as were the martini's! If I have a complaint at all it was on the prices for room service. We decided to bite the bullet and order a hamburger and two beers and the bill came to forty some-odd dollars!! Outrageous, even for the Waldorf. Not to mention, two martini's in the bar came to $24/plus gratuity. But I guess that's just New York at it's finest! You gotta love the place. I'd go back in a heartbeat, and we plan to this year. If you like glitz and sparkles, don't stay here. If you like ambiance and history and to use your imagination as to all the fabulous people in history who have stayed here, then the Waldorf's your place!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Dame”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a wonderful stay in New York. We were there from Dec. 15-20 and stayed at the Waldorf. It is a magical place. Our room wasn't new, it didn't look new but I wouldn't have wanted it any other way. We had a mini king suite on the 23rd floor with views of Park Avenue. We could see down to Radio City Music Hall. The bed was very comfortable with a down duvet. Our room had lovely 10' ceilings and I even had a dressing room! I think when people complain about the age of the hotel, they just don't appreciate the history that the building contains. When I stay somewhere with history I don't expect it to look like it was brand new. The only damper on our stay was room service in the morning. They forgot our order 2 mornings we were there. It wasn't the order for room service you place the night before but ordered in the morning via phone. I understand they were very busy but to forget our order twice was a little upsetting. Other than that I was a great stay. The room was comfortable and clean, the food was great, good location with walking access to most places of interest and great ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Willie3
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay in when visiting New York. It's just a very nice feeling to arrive at the Waldorf when checking in and for the money, it can be a very good value and here's why: This hotel does run specials quite often and you can actually get rooms here for around $200, a special which can occur more often than you think, especially if you book early. A very good bargain, considering a plain Manhattan Holiday Inn can be over $200. I payed $159 for the Sunday night I stayed on the 19th of December and I booked directly through the hotel's website. I was very happy about this bargain. I checked in at around 1:40 PM and it was easy and not a problem. The hotel staff is very good and friendly. Nice vibe I got from them. My room was very nice, actually spacious(seemed a little bigger than the standard rooms at the Plaza hotel) and comfortable. While the bathroom is small, it is very nice with marble. You'll get bigger bathrooms at the Ritz Carlton hotel but you'll also be paying over $400 a night there too. The bed in my room was wondeful, great down pillows and it was so comfortable to sleep on. You might wanna be careful about room service. It's insanely expensive. I ordered an apple pie and it was around $17! Even though room service is generally expensive at hotels, I only order it at special hotels that I like because it does feel good to get the service there. I wouldn't order room service at a typical Hilton hotel so the high price at the Waldorf was worth it. It's like, hey I'm getting room service at the freaking Waldorf baby! So that's how I rationalize it and I'll pay the higher price because it's like once in a life time that I'll probably do this, Ya know. So why not live the life for a few extra dollars more! Anway, the Waldorf has a pricy steakhouse called the Bull and Bear and I have to say that the steaks are outstanding! It was the best steak that I've ever had. I can honestly say this because I've eaten at many steak houses. I'm not saying that it's the best steak in New York but the standards are high at this joint. Side dishes were very good too. Very nice bartenders there too. Be sure to tip them well if they give you good service. I'll definetly be back for dinner on my next trip to New York City. In the lobby, there is a piano and it's actually a historic relic. It's the piano that was owned by Cole Porter who lived in the Waldorf. He's a famous jazz song writer and on the weekends, there is someone playing it for the crowd in the lobby and you can even order drinks there too. Very nice, especially hearing a piano that is a part of music history. Porter wrote many songs on that piano too. Just a little bit of trivial info about the Waldorf lobby. Checking out was very easy and lastly, one odd thing that I want to mention. I know it's a bit strange but when I come to New York, I like to bring my bike. I prefer this mode of transportation instead of cabs and public transportation. Anyway, the hotel let me store my bike for free in their parking garage! They actually have a bike rack where you can chain your bike. It was a nice feeling to know that my bike was safe in the hotel's garage. Usually I chain it to a pole on the street. All in all, I'm glad I stayed to stay at the Waldorf. It has comfortable and homey!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but get a newer room”
Reviews.Author: Dragonness
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf for two nights on Dec 13th and 14th. I had booked my mini king suite three weeks in advance on the hotel's website at the unbelievable rate of $239/night (unrestricted, too!) and was thrilled at the bargain as much as at the prospect of lodging at such a legendary hotel. The room was huge by any standard: 315 sq feet, with a king bed, a seating area, a kitchenette, marble bathroom with a separate sink/vanity area, two large closets, a desk with a fax/copier and internet connection, and views of the city from the fifteenth floor. I knew I should ask for a newly redecorated room, but it didn't seem like there was a choice: I got a room which had been renovated in 2000, which by hotel standards means it's up for renovation any time now. (My sister who's in hotel interiors tells me lesser hotels renovate every six years, good hotels renovate every four years - although in tough times they may try to get by with less frequent redecorating.) Well, knowing I had got a bargain I wasn't going to be difficult, and the room was just fine really. It was frayed at the edges, and could use an updated decor but even so, it wasn't tacky. I wouldn't want to spend my honeymoon in that particular room perhaps, but for a business traveler it is more than sufficient. For those expecting a deluxe hotel, note that this is not to be confused with the Waldorf Towers. The Astoria has Neutrogena toiletries, while the Towers offers Penhaligon's. I should warn you that room service is pricey! I ordered one cheese burger with no drink and the tab came to $40 with tip (hotels always charge you for the service yet they always leave a line for the tip anyway, which is a pet peeve of mine). However, I should also note that it was the most wonderful cheeseburger I'd had in a very long time, if ever! The fries were the best I'd tasted in the US. Clearly this was above standard hotel fare. (It was plentiful too, I wouldn't have had room for dessert.) Even though it's a 1000+ room hotel, I was taken care of and felt comfortable and welcome at the Waldorf and consider it New York's best bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but a 4 star in the UK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for our Honeymoon in 2002. The public areas of the hotel were beautiful and fantastic. We couldn't check in until 4 hours AFTER we were meant to be able to though and had to dump our luggage with them and wander New York. No appology was given. We had a suite which had 2 very spacious rooms with some of the best soft furnishings I've sat/slept on. What let it down though was a general lack of attention to detail and upkeep. The decor was very tired and most of the room could really have done with a paint or holes to be filled, especially radiators and windows. The bathroom was ridiculously small and just not that nice, and very run down looking. Similar in size and finish to a 3 star hotel in the UK - very poor. I have stayed in a club room at the Plaza Athenee in Bangkok and if the NY Athenee has bathrooms even half as nice they put the Waldorf to shame (and every other hotel I've ever stayed in to be fair!). I really enjoyed my stay and for most of the time the staff were great but I really think it would only be a four star hotel in the UK

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Salad anyone?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf=Astoria on Thanksgiving until Sunday, December 28, 2004. The hotel was classic and beautiful. Checking in was enjoyable, they had a greeter who talked with you while you waited. There were gorgeous stores inside the hotel, unique and befitting of the Waldorf. The Christmas decorations were up and sparkling! The rooms were nice. The windows actually opened and we could get fresh air! That was wonderful! The bathrooms were marble and clean, in the closet was a Waldorf ROBE for your use...lovely! There were heavy drapes on the windows so you could sleep in. The area is quiet (New York standards, but remember I live in a big City...Chicago, so I am used to the urban lull). If you are from a small town and not used to urban noises, New York itself will shock you, but seriously the rooms were CLEAN, NY QUIET and service was OUTSTANDING. The absolute BEST surprise was returning to the room after a looooooong day of shopping and walking to find that they TURNED DOWN the bed! Wow! Not to mention that the bed was the most comfortable down covered bedding and I slept comfortably for the nights we stayed there. We got a pretty good internet deal (about $275 a night) which is excellent for NYC on a holiday weekend. So the Waldorf salad...this is the ONE bad thing I have to say about our stay (but technically it wasn't the Waldorf's fault here). Room service has the Waldorf salad for $15. I called the front desk and they have a restaurant in the hotel named Oscars (or something like that) and they have it on the menu for $9. Well, I decided that a trip down to the casual restaurant would be just the ticket. So we went down and ordered. I ordered the tier platter (3 items) for about $15. What I got were the SMALLEST and I cannot stress the word 'smallest' enough, crabcakes I have ever seen, the SMALLEST Waldorf salad in the world! The crabcake was literally a little bigger than a quarter! The salad was about 3 bites of apples and walnuts. Excellent food, but I honestly can say this was the FIRST time I ever had to order out Chinese food AFTER I returned from a restaurant. My sweetie ordered the steak...The "steak" was a similar story here, at first glanced...looked like a steak, but was acutally 3 tiny strips of meat and a bunch of fillers (veggies, parsley) tucked under it that made it an "illusion of meat"! Overall the BEDS are comfortable. The marble bathrooms are CLEAN. They give you a ROBE to use! Classy! They turn down the beds....'nuff said! The SERVICE is outstanding. The neighbors at the Waldorf get in REALLY late and are a bid noisy. The food at OSCARS is good but SMALL. They have a desk, television, bed. Basic ammenities. The high-speed internet is nice to have in the room. The hotel is not a modern marvel, but a true NY classic. Would recommend to anyone... The Waldorf is Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Royal Elegance and Charm”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was so lovley. The reception desk checked me in over 4 hours early and they were as nice as can be. The room (to my suprise) was very large and a fabulous veiw of Park Avenue was just out the window. Also was a suprise was "turn down service". Awsome. There is a jewlery store, rare book store, and a high-end handbag store. Three amazing restaurants on site as well. They give you plenty of towels and goodies in the room daily. I would recommend this hotel to anybody. Unfortunately jeans are frounded on when worn in the hotel, but it was a wonderful experience overall! Awsome.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading a few reviews i was very unsure about the hotels in new york and as a result changed my reservation with the time hotel to The Waldorf Astoria and upgraded the room.After just returning i have nothing but praise for what can only be described as one of the best hotels i have ever stayed in. The service was faultess the rooms were spotless and the staff nothing but a pleasure. I would strongly reccommend any one to visit the waldorf and garantee they wont be dissappointed. The beds were turned down in the evening, the maids were amazing and nothing was to much trouble. If you are going to new york dont stay any where else. Thanks waldorf for really making it a break of a life time!

Reviews.Title: “Magical 25th Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Asatoria created the most romantic atmosphere for our 25th. We booked a mini suite that was beautifully furnished, warm and inviting. The Staff welcomed us with kindness and compassion. Which was comforting due to our nine (9) hour airline delay from Buffalo (our first stop was Niagara Falls). To our surprize we entered the room to find complimentary champagne and chocolate strawberries. If you need tickets for shows, tours etc. They have it covered. Greyline tours stop out the door. Weddings in the lobby, Great coffee. We will return

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Waldorf - unsure if it would be nice and ended up loving it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Based on some previous reviews, I was leary about staying here. But, we got a good rate (my husband's corporate discount) and asked for a newly renovated room. We ended up getting a newly renovated room with a dressing room and a huge bathroom. It was beautiful. I usually prefer more contempory hotels versus historical ones, but this room was great. Spotless and clean and comfortable. Room service was VERY expensive though. I think it cost $80 for breakfast for 2. That's just crazy. But, if you can get a good rate and a newly renovated room - you will not regret it. Also, the staff was excellent - no complaints there - everyone was very polite. Our rate was $210 per night. I am extremely picky and just loved it!

Reviews.Title: “quite nice”
Reviews.Author: bdsimpson
Reviews.Content: A lovely old hotel in a good location. Room service limited and off the charts expensive (as expected). Nice turn down service. Smallish rooms (typical NY) but well appointed. Lovely lobbies, well cared for spaces. All in all a decent NY value at under $400 for a legend.

Reviews.Title: “Old School New York Class”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf is a throwback to the early days of New York Class. We had a great time and loved the hotel. Our room was very nice, though certainly not "modern chic". The service was excellent and the facility overall was great. The Spa and gym were very good and the business center was very helpful. The lobbies were splendid. The hotel is in a great location- an easy walk, or horse and carriage ride, from Times Square and Broadway. The drinks in the bar were pricey, even by New York standards, but the service and atmosphere were good. Overall, an excellent place to stay if you appreciate history. If you are looking for W or the Millenium, stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Oozing with charm”
Reviews.Author: seamermate
Reviews.Content: Just celebrated my wifes 40th Birthday at the Waldorf Astoria...somewhere she's always wanted to stay. OK the Hotel may be living on past reputation but it's still an amazing place oozing with character and charm and ideally located. The rooms where spacious and clean with the most comfortable beds you could imagine. I requested a room change after the 1st night due to the noise from the extraction units outside...no problem...we were moved instantly (a high floor room is recommended) The service from staff was 1st class 5 star...not rude at all...very helpful and courteous Yes a one off experience & no doubt the budget seekers could get more for their money....

Reviews.Title: “All I dreamed of!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Waldorf Astoria for our 10 year wedding anniversary and we were thoroughly pampered. I had dreamed of staying there since I was a young girl and after reading some of these reviews I was sure I'd be dissapointed, not so. We had a mini-suite which was large, lavish and tastefully decorated. We were brought a gift of chocolate dipped strawberries and champagne on the night we checked in. Every need we had was immediately satisfied. The housekeeping was very diligent. The bellman very couteous and gave a history of the hotel. This hotel is a wonderful place, I could not fault it. Normal people will find it above expectations, those looking for something to complain about will find problems anywhere they go (ex. some of these reviews) A++++ to the Waldorf, we will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Better than some reviewers suggest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Waldorf-Astoria and Waldorf Towers in the past, most recently in June of this year. Some of the other reviews of this hotel do not do it justice. The public spaces of this hotel are beyond comparison in the United States, meticulously done from the Park Avenue Lobby to the Grand Ballroom. One user complained that they were expecting a 5 star hotel, but the Waldorf-Astoria makes no claim of being one. That would be it's sister hotel, The Waldorf Towers, run by Conrad Hotels, Hilton's luxury portfolio. To be short, you get what you pay for, and I find it hard to believe that someone would expect 5 star service in this city for that price. I'd suggest booking a deluxe room or a suite on their own website, as the rates are as good or better, especially if you enter your AAA number. Having only stayed in suites at the Waldorf, which were all of decent size, I cannot comment on the regular guest rooms. The Waldorf-Astoria should not be confused with the Ritz Carlton on Central Park, The Sherry-Netherland, or the Waldorf Towers. The Waldorf-Astoria is a large hotel, not an intimate boutique experience, and costs far less.

Reviews.Title: “Good time at the Astoria”
Reviews.Author: Pengers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Astoria for a long weekend 6 months ago. We booked it as a cheap internet deal, and I would never have believed I could have stayed at this hotel for the price we paid. I read all the reviews about the Waldorf - which were a very mixed bag of good and bad comments. But overall I thought it was fantastic - in terms of location, atmosphere, service, style, glamour and prestige. The sheer size and scale of the thing is amasing. Our standard hotel room, was not the best I've stayed in - but it certainly wasn't lacking in comfort or style. The room was in keeping with the hotel - oh...and the drinks in the hotel bar were expensive - but good lord...you're in the Waldorf!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Enough”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read these reviews before going to Priceline and can understand why some of these people complained as far as some of the complaints are concerned. The people there were very helpful; we had a very nice room in the Towers; the location is perfect; and of course it is getting a bit old and dated in there...that's the point. It's the Waldorf, not the W. If you are looking for tres sheik, then don't stay here. If you want to experience NYC from a great location with a piece of the history of the Waldorf, then this is great! Especially if you use Priceline and get it cheaper than you can any three star hotel in the Bronx. We arrived very, very early, and they worked extra hard to get us into a room to rest. They had one cleaned, but not restocked yet. Every question we had was answered, everyone had a smile on their face, and we really enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Big Name; Poor Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Waldorf as a name is very overrated. Got a decent Internet price for a midtown ‘big name’ hotel but a very poor value. Arrived at 3:40 p.m. but Front Desk check-in wouldn’t talk to us until after exactly 4:00 p.m. Main breakfast buffet ran out of most items by 8:00 am!! Bell service at front door was very poor. Have stayed at many midtown hotels but will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “this place is a DUMP!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a dump!!! I understand it used to be a famous hotel in olden days and came under the false impression that this is a five star hotel. It absolutely is not! The place is run down, you can tell the decor is outdated, wallpaper is peeling off..the rooms feel old and stuffy, I was even reluctant to go under the covers or use the towels. The bathrooms are very ordinary and If I had just seen the bathroom, wouldnt be able to tell if it was the doubletree or hampton inn bathroom! Overall, the hotel is not in a good condition, there are signs of age and bad design everywhere, would not recommend this hotel if you are looking for a clean, modern and sophisticated experience in New York. Would recommend some of the newer hotels in the city. The management of the Waldorf really need to spice up their act, and hire better designers and housekeeping services. The staff is also rude and abrupt, they need to do a major overhaul to this place, to make this a truly competitive hotel, get rid of the old stuffy look. If they really want to go for the classic look, they should take a lesson from the ritz carltons in the city, that are painstaking in detail and incredibly clean and luxurious, while at the same time being modern. This hotel does not even come close !!!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Sept 19th - 26th, the only problem was that the President Bush was there to. Not that the President is a problem but the security is a pain. The staff was 2nd to none! The room was very nice, and yes we gat a deal on Price Line. The only way you would not like this hotel is if you are a pretentious snob. Remember it is very upscale during the week, but on the weekend it is very laid back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent everything bar rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel last Dec for 2 nights it took my breath away but the rooms are nothing special lovely big and all mod cons but just not what I was expecting!!! Rest of hotel was a dream!!!

Reviews.Title: “I loved NYC and the Waldorf!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a lovely stay I had at the Waldorf! I had booked through Hilton Honors and was given an upgrade to a double room with a boudoir, which had a lovely makeup area and two of the largest closets that I have ever seen in a hotel! The art deco room was delightful. It was up on the 13th floor and the view of the city was interesting! I loved the central location and enjoyed walking to Grand Central Station and Fifth Avenue shopping! All in all, it was a delightful trip to NYC. The UN assembly was coming into town when I was departing, so it was interesting to watch the small representative of the "world" that stayed here! If love love people watching, this is the place to be! Old, grand, very European in feel, and definitely a NYC landmark! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Stinky in the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf in July and were very disappointed in the hotel. It has a great name for itself, but does not live up to the name. The first room we were in was small with two "twin" beds. They said they were double, but it didn't look like it. We were upgraded after complaining to a nicer room on a higher floor. The room was nice and had a better view, but it stunk...literaly. The entire time we were there the room had a foul odor. I think the hotel has so much potential, but needs a major facelift!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby, nice staff, room nothing special”
Reviews.Author: fins823
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf Astoria from August 23-25. The entrance and lobby was beautiful and elegant and the staff were very helpful and friendly. When we left, they made sure they asked if we enjoyed our stay, which we did. Unfortunately, you don't stay in the lobby and we weren't terribly impressed with the room. It was a fairly standard hotel room, but you could tell it needed some updating. The bathroom door wouldn't close entirely and we initially had to call maintenance to fix our fan/air conditioner, which was making a lot of noise. They did, with no problems. But the room was clean and there were no major issues and that was fine with us. That's all we ask for. Besides, we got our room for $200 a night, so you can't expect a luxurious room anyway. Overall, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “The Waldorf- The ultimate New York experience”
Reviews.Author: noplacelikehome17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are extremely particular about where we stay. When in New York, we love staying in the Waldorf or the towers due to the gracious, and elegant feel, as well as the location and service. We just spent two nights at the Waldorf and took our 2 year old son for the first time. We booked a two room Queen suite directly through the hotel, which upon request at check- in was upgraded to an enormous king suite with a kitchen, living room and dining area. For the same rate of $299.00 per night. ( The upgrades are not always available especially when the hotel is booked - I believe we just got lucky this time.) While I have seen better rates online through the discount websites, I have always booked directly through the hotel, so I know exactly what kind of room I am getting, and I feel more confident that the hotel will accomodate room changes or upgrades if we are not satisfied. In our experience, the rooms are always very clean and the staff is very personable. Our suite, while exceptional in size and luxury, had an outdated cooling system. It clanked a bit, and did not keep the room cool enough at night. This was unfortunate as we were not able to snuggle under the soft and sumptuous down comforters that are provided, and had to sleep without covers. If a comfortable, climate controlled enviornment is high on your list of expectations, make sure you ask when you book to reserve one of the renovated room with an up to date heating and cooling system. Room service, (which became necessary with our exuberant toddler experiencing sensory overload and boycotting naps) is very, very expensive. ie. last night my husband and I ordered 2 sirloin burgers, no extras, no beverages and with the service charge, tax and gratuity, paid almost $70.00. A simple, bare bones breakfast for 3 exceeds $100.00 While such expenses are expected in a high end Manhattan hotel, you may want to skip the Waldorf if you have a food budget and rely on room service occassionaly in order to enjoy a civilized meal if the children become cranky. The only other issue with the Waldorf (not at the towers) that we never noticed before because we never took our child, was that it is impossible to navigate the entrances and lobby with a stroller. They do not have ramps or elevators at the main entrance, and we had to drag our stroller up flights of stairs to get to the lobby. Very inconvenient. They told us there was a ramp around the back of the hotel, but after two days we never found it. All and all, high marks on luxury, people watching and service if you are looking for a historic New York "experience", not just a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Given horrible treatment because I booked through Priceline”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a reservation for a King room for 5 nights which I booked through Priceline. The room was for 2 adults and a child. The first room we were given had one double bed. When I called the front desk and was told that it was a mistake. The next room we moved to had a king bed but no room for the rollabed that we had request. When I called to complain I was told that because I booked through Priceline I would get the smallest (worst) room available. I complained to the manager who stated that all guests regardless of how they booked were treated equally. However, this was not my experience. Reference to my Priceline booking was made at least 3 times. The manager ended up moving us yet again to a room that would accomodate the rollabed. The Waldorf is not bad but be careful if you book through a discount internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel 2 weeks ago for 5 days - the room was average in size and decoration (definitely not worth the $400 per night that I paid!!) and the staff were selective with the information they gave me. I was initally told I would receive complimentary tickets for a Broadway show for any night of my stay, but when I went down the second day to pick the dates, the staff then said free tickets were only good for the first night of my stay and refused to give me the compimentary tickets. However, the worst problem of all was the numerous hidden charges- I was charged to use the TV, the Internet and even for storing my luggage for a few hours on the last day and for dialing toll-free telephone numbers! The most shocking charge was when I phoned down to reception to ask for a SPOON for my tea and was told I would be charged for it! Outrageous! Well, I used the spoon and returned it but they failed to refund me the $1.50 charge. I definitely would not stay here again! Why pay for something that other hotels provide for free? Go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf only so-so”
Reviews.Author: gjspring
Reviews.Content: The hotel is luxurious, but has its down points. I won a bid on Priceline to stay there for $120 per night. Positives: - Friendly, helpful staff - Beautiful lobby, luxuriously appointed - Coffee maker and supplies in room - Minibar in room - Internet connection - Very comfortable bed with soft "pillow top" mattress padding. - Room is attractive - Beautiful large marble bathroom. - Ironing board and Iron provide - Good TV and channels - Temperature control works great/custom setting Negatives: (Room #947) - Standard room is very small. - "King-sized" bed really a Queen size. - Room had unpleasant odor (mildew?) - Stain on carpet by bed stand - Hot water in shower slow to heat up. - Only "basic" supplies provided in bathroom, not what you'd expect from a luxury hotel. - Exterior of hotel is VERY dirty, could use a good sand-blasting to keep up their luxury image. - Beware of any rooms near elevator, you will hear the "gong" and can be annoying if you are sensitive to sound. - I would not have paid $250 or more (standard price) for this room

Reviews.Title: “Best bargain in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: EdBear55
Reviews.Content: Got it on Priceline for $ 115 a night; the best hotel bargain in nyc or perhaps the us. Wonderful, stay, wonderful people, wonderful service. We got a "renovated" room, but it could have used some polishing-up; thus, the four star rating rather than five.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in New York and we went at Thanksgiving. It was a great hotel, the lobby and restaurants are beautiful. The room was a good size and the bed was really comfortable. The only thing that didn't work was the Internet on the TV but that was a very minor thing. I fully recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms & Service”
Reviews.Author: JPCS
Reviews.Content: Just spend 5 memorable days in New York, wouldn't have been the same if we stayed anywhere else, room and bathroom was great, much bigger than expected. We had a lovely view down Park Avenue. Everything is close by. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tyra
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf Astoria Towers, which is a more private concierge level area of the hotel, Aug. 6-9. I checked in easily due to the fact that the Towers has it's own private check in area with no standing in line. The regular check in for the waldorf had about 30 people in line. The Towers is not that much more expensive. I chose the ambassador suite on the 30th floor. It is very large. It has a marble foyer area, a separate very large bedroom and a separate huge living room and a small kitchenette. The bathroom is very nice too. All marble with a large separate make-up sitting area. Roel, in the concierge was amazing. He knew EVERYTHING. Also I have to give a huge thumbs up to JOY in the travel area who helped with a town car for an afternoon of shopping. I also used the spa (plus 1) on the 19th floor. I had a manicure and a massage. The manicure was adequate but the massage was above average. They have a nice fitness center up there with all the up to date equipment. Nice helpful staff. Prices are really quite expensive though. If you like the grand old hotels with alot of history, then this is the hotel for you. If I had to say there is a downside to this hotel. It is the fact that they host a ton of weddings and company functions every weekend so the lobby is always packed with people. It doesn't feel very private or intimate. It's quite chaotic. That is why I chose the Towers because they have a very private check-in area. There own set of private elevators and their own private entrance. Also the St. Regis Hotel is very very nice too. I probably would not even put the Plaza in this catagory anymore it has definitely gone downhill since Ivana Trump stopped managing it. If you like more of a hip contemporary hotel I would go to W hotel. They have a terrific bar there.

Reviews.Title: “Great evening”
Reviews.Author: usa352
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a Friday night at the Waldorf. Wonderful location. You are close to everything. Room was nice, but a bit small. Lobby is large and elegant. Staff is friendly. Worth the money for a romantic night in the city with my fiancée. Only 2 drawbacks: $45 for parking, misguided at check-in on location of the room. Went up wrong elevator and ended up in a service area?

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf hype?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The front desk was hospitable. However I was disappointed when my card key malfunctioned. Apparently , the lock needed a battery change. So, we were reassigned to another room. It was a better room. The decor is elegant in black and gold. The lobby was stunning. Nice restaurants. When I got in the room , I was a bit unimpressed when I saw the cracked sink and faucet handle. The bathroom needed a renovation. The carpet in the room probably could use a shampoo wash. I think the more luxurious Waldorf Towers (adjacent to the rest of Waldorf) probably woud have met my expectations . Overall, the best part of the stay was the lobby/entry way. The doormen were great! However , I had problems with the general cleanliness of the rooms and bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Towers Luxury”
Reviews.Author: MikuDumfries
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a seven night break at the Waldorf Towers (a boutique hotel within the main hotel building from the 26th to 42nd floors). Our security within the hotel was fantastic...only Towers guests could access the 26-42nd floors and the Astoria Lounge, which provided continential breakfast and evening snacks, together with non-alcoholic beverages and soft drinks, "free" of charge. The Towers operated their own separate concierge and reception staff, who were very helpful and did more than their best to please. We were lucky enough to be upgraded as our original room had plumbing problems, which were quickly resolved much to our satisfaction as we received an Ambassador suite for the rest of our stay at no extra charge! The Waldorf Astoria oozes elegance and decadence from the moment you step inside and the Bull and Bear Restaurant is a must. My husband was particularly pleased with the outstanding views from the Towers level...definitely ask for a higher level room. Our room was located to the north west corner and I was able to gaze at the Chrysler building lit up at night - amazing. Although the drinks in the hotel are expensive, they are no more expensive than you would expect in any other city hotel. Another thing - our room had maid service twice daily and they would change your towels on both occasions if needs be. We would absolutely recommend the Waldorf to anyone - there's no other place we would dream of staying if we visit New York again. x

Reviews.Title: “the queen makes it great”
Reviews.Author: FloridaLaura
Reviews.Content: the waldorf is not all cracked up to be. the rooms are small unless you you pay more the Bill Gates makes in a year. and service is poor however just to be in the presence of presidents and the queen makes it worth 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel centrally located. The hotel was clean with good sized rooms by new york standards. The staff were friendlly and helpful. Check in was stress free. We got a good price on 3 nights stay and enjoyed all the luxury and scenery the Waldorf has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the WA”
Reviews.Author: socratesa
Reviews.Content: Great Historical Hotel! Part of Hilton Chain. We happened to get a great room: a corner unit with a decent room separate sitting area leading to a very nice bathroom w/ large tub and bathrobes to boot. Bed was very comfy, only negative was the bed was close to the door and if the people on the other corner unit slam their door Sunday at 7:00 AM several times like ours did it can be a bad wake up call. Great Lobby connecting Park Ave. and Lexington Ave. sitting area on one end which was always full, for people watching and several restaurants from fairly priced to expensive menus on the other side. Complimentary luggage storage was a plus ( because The Hilton Towers a few blocks away charges $3 a bag)

Reviews.Title: “must go back!”
Reviews.Author: reymax
Reviews.Content: visited in 2002 and were treated fabulously. Upgraded to a suite on concierge level and there was wine/strawberries in the room. It perhaps is an "old world" type of hotel but it sure is classy and we would return any time.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 2 nights, great people watching”
Reviews.Author: SandyCA
Reviews.Content: I just returned from NYC stayed at Waldorf for 2 nights. checked in is at 3pm room not ready until 3:30 this seemed to be a problem for many. However the lobby is beautiful and comfortable couched with great people watching. Room is small, clean, beds comfortable. Staff very friendly if you are friendly to them, otherwise they appear stuffy. Bar very expensive 1 glass house wine $12, ouch., once you are there you can upgrade to Astoria Level for $40 a night,this would have been great since I had 2 teenaers includes breakfast, snacks, soda's, they didn't mention this at check in, I read it in the room too late. Eat at Oxnard Cafe(deli) 52nd and Lexington. great pizza, for $2.50 a slice. Breakfast Sandwich $2.25. Bellman suggested it. I would stay again if under $200 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Take alot of money with you!”
Reviews.Author: surfingbudha
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf last summer for a week during a dance convention. When we checked in, the desk clerk said my debit card was denied, I said "excuse me?", he slid the card to me and snidely said, your card was declined. Knowing my room was going to cost $1400 for the week, and knowing I had $5000 in my account, I asked him exactly how much he was trying to charge to my card because the room rate was $175 a night. He told me he was charging me for the ammenities, the shops, the restaraunts,etc. (Being a dance mom, I sure looked like I wore $10,000 gowns). Since there was a line behind me, I asked him to charge what the card would take, and that I was getting paid on Thursday which would be directly dep. to my account. He did, leaving me $100 for the week. I then spoke with a rep from the dance competition who gave me a number of a lady who told me to call cust. service. Cust. service had no clue to why they would do this and told me to go see the hotel manager and have him notify them. The manager wouldnt come out to speak with me, but the girl at the desk spoke with my bank and arranged to fix the problem. I then wrote cust serv who gave me a email of the manager, got no response, emailed cust service again, they appologized and offered me a free night or a nights refund. Which I never recieved, and then never got a response back when I tried to notify them again about not recieving the refund. I got locked in the bathroom in the lobby for 20 min until a police officer walking through heard me yelling, and they tried to charge me for the mini bar we never used. Whats funny is, they were trying to pre charge me for the shops, but when I saw an investigative news story on antiques shops in the hotels, the hotel said they were not associated with the shops!

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Waldorf for the weeked May 14th-May17th. The room was large clean the registration clerk was friendly and helpful. I found the other guest in the hotel friendly and willing to share tips on where to shop and how to get around. The only problem during our stay was water draining slowly from the tub after showering. Otherwise it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “elegant but could use some work”
Reviews.Author: austinite
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Waldorf-Astoria. I remember things being in much better repair the last time I visited in 2000. We a room with a view of St. Bart's, which was nice, but one of the air conditioners was broken. It wasn't hot, so we survived with one unit. And though the hotel's past luxury is apparent, it really could use some new carpet and such. We had a parking special, and the valet tried to charge us for parking. I'm also pretty sure I'm going to be charged for my stay twice since I paid when I booked it but was told my bill would be charged to my card. I'll have to deal with that when the bill comes since I didn't bring my credit card receipt with me. The staff was wonderful. The housekeeping staff never disturbed us, even though we often left around 9:30 a.m. My daughter and I went to tea and got mediocre service, but it appeared only one person was serving the entire terrace. I'd stay again if I got a deal, but if I were charged regular rates, I'd try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad blind date: heartbreak ensues, aka "You Get What You Pay For"”
Reviews.Author: tanabutler
Reviews.Content: "Congratulations! Your bid for a 4-Star hotel at $100 has been accepted! WALDORF-ASTORIA!" -- sayeth Priceline. I squealed. Heaven! The Waldorf! Movie stars! Glamour! Gorgeousness! Well, the Waldorf is all that but, alas, 'twas a bad blind date for me. I was in New York for less than 24 hours, and was so looking forward to staying in this queenly hotel. Nightmare. I had to change rooms three times (four rooms in all) in one evening. The first room was lovely: 16th floor looking down Park Avenue. But it had no DSL--a necessity for me in my work--and that was a surprise. It took the staff about a half an hour to move me (presumably they were turning down the bed in the awaiting room). As I settled down in Room #2 to answer e-mails, I became aware of the loud, creaking elevators, which were on the other side of the marble wall in the bathroom (can you spell "echo chamber"?). I told the desk, "Please don't think I'm a pest, but if this is the only night I get to stay in the Waldorf, I really don't want to carry away the memory of a loud elevator. May I please change rooms again?" Another half hour went by, and into Room #3 I go. By then, it was getting late, so I went out to dinner. It was after 11 PM when I learned that the DSL was broken in Room #3, so here we go, another half hour, to transfer to Room #4. Farewell, deep, long bathtub! Hello, view of parking lot! Waaaah! But it was after midnight when I was ensconced in my fourth and final room, and I wearily went to sleep. The maid came in at about 8 AM, waking me up: my fault for not putting DND on the door. Ack! Next up: the double-billing on my DSL access. (Yes, they removed it, but still.) Next up: the first broken iron. Then the replacement iron that disgorged the steaming contents of its water receptacle all over my best pair of pants, blistering and ruining them. Oh, fie, Waldorf-Astoria, on your cheesy and cheap appliances! Finally: me writing the management to tell them of my disappointment, then the cavernous silence of them NEVER ANSWERING ME. Not a word. Not an apology. Not one word. I've got absolutely no complaints about the staff: everyone was helpful as could be. Woefully I must report that the Waldorf-Astoria, for me, was a bad dream and a bad night's sleep. Though I paid only $100, it wasn't worth it, sad to say. I guess you get what you pay for: they knew when I signed in that I'd won the hotel on Priceline, so I guess my comfort wasn't worth their time to notice or remedy. Too bad: I'm a food/travel writer and photographer, and I blab about the good AND the bad.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Maddie2006
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at The Wardorf on the 4th & 5th April, 2004 this was the first stop of our 19 night tour of the U.S.A. my son celebrating his 18th and I celebrating my 50th. The Waldorf and New York was all I'd expected and although we never spent that much time in the hotel our trip was really wonderful, all the staff being very friendly and helpful. On checking in I mentioned to the receptionist that we wanted two beds as I was traveling with my son, the room we had been allocated was a double but the receptionist went to great trouble to sort this problem out even though the hotel was very busy due to the begining of their spring break.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Penel0pe_Pittst0p
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in the Waldorf Astoria from 12th - 15th April 2004.We were expecting a large, luxuries hotel with friendly, welcoming staff and a large room on the concierge level with access to the Astoria Lounge.The hotel was large and luxurious, with many shops in the lobby, however the staff we encountered were not very welcoming or friendly. We had problems with our reservation. Because of a lack of available rooms on the concierge level, our room was on a lower floor, but we had been upgraded to a mini-suite. The receptionist at the time of check in hadn't told us this, and when we went to the Astoria lounge for breakfast the following morning, they wouldn't let us in because we were on the wrong floor!!!! We had to then go to reception and prove to them with a copy of our online reservation that we had a rate that allowed us access!!!! Eventually we did get it sorted out but we weren't happy with the treatment we had received.Our room was large, clean, and tidy but the air conditioning was not very efficient.In addition, although the hotel is in a good location for 5th Ave, Park Ave and Madison Ave, it is not close to a subway station.Another word of warning.... we are 27 years old and we got the distinct impression that the Waldorf Astoria is not for a young clientelle and we found some hostility and snobbishness from other, more mature guests.We won't be going back to the Waldorf Astoria in a hurry!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Hambagahle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Waldorf three times. Each time we have loved it! The last time, February 04, we had a one bedroom suite for the cost of a normal room. It was really comfortable, except for the foam pillows. However I asked a maid to bring us feather ones and within five minutes she brought 4 for us to choose from! The hotel was full, but very quiet and the A/C worked well so we didn't hear any traffic noise. The food at the Bull and Bear was lovely and Oscars, which has been re-done since we were last there, was really tasty and good value. We certainly plan to stay there again when we return to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - shame about the bugs !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf for 3 nights at the end of March for our 1st wedding anniversary and found it a great place to stay. Every member of staff we encountered was courteous and helpful.The check in was busy when we arrived so we were directed to the direct reception area - where we were told we could move to a superior room to what we had booked. The room was average size but was newly refurbished and contained every amenity that most travellers would ask for. It also had the most comfortable bed I've ever laid on !The mini bar was kinda pricey - $8 for a coke but if you don't want to pay that then there's a grocery store nearby.The only downside came in the bar one evening when we spotted some large "water bugs" crawling on the wall. While I thought this slightly disconcerting the barman - an Alec Baldwin lookalike soon disposed of them, and we got an apology and free drinks courtesy of the manager !All in all NYC is a great place to stay and the Waldorf, while maybe not as grand as it used to be is still a first class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would Have preferred a Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This trip to New York was a present for my 18th Birthday back in Jan. We showed up at the Hotel Thrusday afternoon and proceeded to chek in, which is where our trip went a little sour. We were told that the Debit card we were using was not being accepted. We had to hand over all the cash we had on us to pay for the room to be able to put our stuff in our there before calling our bank. We had just switched banks and had not yet recieved my debit card for that account so I made a deposit in to my old account the day before leaving. Apparently, the Waldorf, according to my bank, had attempted to charge the card 12 time the night before and early morning of the day we arrived. Since the bank had yet to open and show the deposit it did not go through and red flagged my account. After discovering this we tried callign the front desk to speak to the woman who checked us in, no one ever called us back. I ended up getting my father to call and try to sort the mess out since my sister and I were left in New York with no cash and a debit card that we couldn't charge or withdraw anything with. After about 4 hours of getting no where with the hotel I thankfully discovered a card I didn't know I had in my wallet and held the room with that until the next morning when the debit card went through. During all this I found the staff to be quite rude and not at all helpful. It completley ruined the first day of our trip. On top of that our second day there we came back to the hotel around 9pm and room service still hadn't been there, and you can't get a decent temperature in the shower to save your life. The only friendly people I encountered there were the doormen and maids.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and not what we booked”
Reviews.Author: BrynMawrBK
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two-day stay and would not return to the Waldorf-Astoria. We looked into staying at the Waldorf due to its proximity to the American Girl Place store and its advertised "American Girl Place special" since we were taking our two young daughters to New York to visit that store. When making our reservation, I specified that we needed connecting rooms or a suite that had a room with two double beds, as our kids can't sleep together in one bed and get any rest. I was told I had reserved a two-bedroom luxury suite featuring one king bed room and a room with two double beds.
