When we got to the hotel at 5:15 p.m., we were told the suite was not yet ready, although check-in is 3 p.m.; half an hour later when we were sent to the room, housekeeping was still there and the rooms had not yet been made up -- AND the second bedroom had only one large bed. After numerous phone calls, a manager told us the Waldorf has no suites with the bed configuration I was told we had booked (which was pretty much the whole reason we booked there at all), and simply offered to provide a rollaway bed. Their initial attitude was that it was our problem and they weren't going to do anything besides send up the rollaway. After we pushed the issue, we were offered a complimentary buffet breakfast, and later the hotel reduced the price of the suite.(Though we requested that the rollaway be sent right away at 6 p.m. since our kids were so tired, it didn't show up until 9 p.m.) While the rooms themselves were decent, there were many surprising defects for a hotel of its reputation -- only one bathrobe, no makeup or shaving mirror, a cigarette burn through one of the curtains, and torn carpeting in the lobby held together with electrical tape. Next time we'll stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fairytale Wedding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have visited New York a number of times and from our first stay at the Waldorf in 2001 we have continued to go back. In November 2003 we were married in the hotel with 34 of our friends and family travelling with us from Scotland. The whole experience was magical from start to finish. The treatment our party received was exceptional. The setting was truly magnificent and the memories of our wedding will last forever.

Reviews.Title: “Very Romantic”
Reviews.Author: BCLVfan
Reviews.Content: This place is fabulous! Check in is a little hectic if you come in via car or taxi, but they more than made up for it. Service was outstanding, and the room was amazing. When the front desk found out we were getting engaged, they made sure our room was extra special. Everything down to the linens were first rate. Room service is pricey, but comes very quickly. You get treated like Kings and Queens here, and the location is great. This place is what NYC is all about. Take advantage of one of the great deals online and experience New York's finest!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Not-so-great Bellmen”
Reviews.Author: killian02
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent NYC visitor, but enjoyed my first stay at the Waldorf Astoria in March 2004. Hotel & rooms are very nice and clean. We had a suite - lots of room. Our friends had a regular room - it was just big enough to move around in. Our suite rate was $320/night - our friend's regular room was $225/night. Great location. Walking distance to everything. Never had a problem getting a cab. One bad incident - when we arrived, a hotel bellman litterally chewed out our cab driver. The ugliest I've ever seen any human be to another. The cab driver dropped us off on the Park Ave side - apparently he was not supposed to do that. But what a rude greeting by hotel staff! As we stepped out of our cab, we were told by another bellman that we would not be able to check into our room and he would "have to take our bags." I politely said thanks, but we'll check inside at the front desk first. He responded with "suit yourself." By the way, it was 12 noon and our room was ready for us to check in immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Stay for the quality, charm, location and history”
Reviews.Author: narf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from 4 nights at the Waldorf Astoria, and we are really glad that we booked BEFORE we read the many awful reviews at this site. We reserved through Priceline so had an amazing deal including rt airfare from SFO ($459 each including all taxes). So the room cost us about $100 a night. We had an Astoria Level room on the 25th floor with a city view and a peek at the river. The room was immaculate and comfortable. We were never made to feel inferior for being discount guests; to the contrary, the entire staff made us feel as if we were paying full price. When we inquired about leaving our luggage after the usual 12 checkout, for a short while, the receptionist cheerfully told us that she could extend our checkout until 1. We weren't even asking for this. And as for those reviewers who say the WA is past its prime, I say, go stay at an anonymous corporate inspired chain and leave this magnificent National Landmark registered queen to those who appreciate history.

Reviews.Title: “The glory of the world renowned Waldorf=Astoria needs a polish”
Reviews.Author: jokemuc
Reviews.Content: Do not expect the Flagship of Hilton Hotels! We spend four nights at WA. The rate was a $200 per night (winter special). A long line at the check in. The person at the front desk was the only friendly employee I talked to during our stay. To avoid long waiting at the check in you can call ahead from the airport and they will put you on the Â fast laneÂ . We had a room with one king bed (as reserved). Size was ok, decoration of the room was nice and in a good shape. Heating/AC form the 80Â´s. The bathroom needs an urgent renovation! Overall itÂ s an average 4 Star Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf over Valentine's weekend. It was disappointing from the moment we tried to check in at the posted check-in time. We were told our room would be ready in 1/2 an hour and to come back. So we put our tour of the city on hold and waited. We went back again, and were told the room was not ready yet. Talked to the manager and was told the rooms were still being cleaned. Tried again an hour later, and the room still was not ready. This time the manager switched our room to one that was ready, but they must have put us in one the worst rooms they had as punishment for complaining! There was a big wet stain on the carpet, the paint was peeling off the ceiling and walls, and we had a lovely view on all three sides of brick walls. There are so many other lovely hotels to choose from in NYC, don't waste your time or money here. Take a stroll through instead.

Reviews.Title: “honeymooners who cannot sleep”
Reviews.Author: paulclark
Reviews.Content: Jenny and myself had a wonderful time at the Waldorf Astoria some time back. The reception was excellent and I could park my hire car until Jenny was comfortable within our room. The public rooms are, well! what can you say about them; they are stupendous. Our bedroom was spacious and very comfortable and with a marble bathroom, and our 'rates' were very acceptable. Can't understand the honeymooners complaining about not getting to sleep. Regards, Paul Clark.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Waldorf Towers about six months ago and had a fantastic time! Nicely appointed room and the continental breakfast room was fantasic. We lingered there reading the Sunday Times and felt like we were in heaven. We're going back in two weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf-Astoria was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waldorf Nov.29-Dec.2,2003. We were treated great from the time we checked in until we left. Everyone was so helpful & nice- I can't wait to return in September!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Living on its name!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the waldorf for our honeymoon and we were very disappointed. The room was very shabby and was located right next to the a/c vents. The constant humming meant we could not sleep. Changed room and we could sleep but it was as shabby as the first room. This hotel clearly needs a renovation.......fast!!!! The hotel seemed more interested in business travellers and not tourists. I have stayed in better hotels for half the price and would not come back to the waldorf again.

Reviews.Title: “Dont do it !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We decided as we were on our honeymoon to stay in the Waldorf. I have never been so disapointed as I was when I arrived at the hotel. It is dark and gloomy, carpets are worn as is 90 % of the interior of the hotel. When we got to our room it was filthy, dusty curtains, peeling paint and wall paper,in the bathroom the fixtures were rusty and it was generally unclean, I have stayed in nicer budget hotels!!. We complained about the room and were informed that the hotel was fully booked, eventually we were moved and our next room was much the same. I think in its time the Waldorf probably was a fantastic luxury hotel, not any more its trading on its name and Im afraid it doesnt live up to it.
